Reviews.Title: “1a located, friendly staff, but definitely (no more) 4*”
Reviews.Author: ursurs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for visiting NYC. The pros are the excellent location in the heart of Midtown Manhatten, just 4 min walk on foot from Grand Central (and the airport transfer busses around- if you don't decide to take an expensive taxi to/from the airports JFK/ La Guardia/ or Newark. You can not only reach the Manhattan sights and shopping areas on foot, but are also well connected to other destinations by the mentioned Grand Central Station. The staff was very friendly and helpful on arrival and depart, the roommaids were excellent as well. Now for the cons: you don't have to be in a hurry when trying to leave the hotel with the elevator. The 6 of them seem always to be very busy, so we often decided to take the staircase (luckily we had a room on the 3rd floor). Don't buy your morning coffee in the bar at the lobby- too expensive though good (did that on the first day), but rather in the small cafè on the right hand side when leaving the hotel at the exit/entrance 46th street! Be aware that this (rear) entrance will let you out all times, but not in before 9 a.m. and somewhat in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Camposol
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so luxurious,clean polite staff. I can't believe people write these bad reviews about it. Space is in great demand in Manhatten, all the hotels have smallish rooms unless you want to pay a fortune. We was happy with our room. We had stayed in much smaller rooms in the past Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AndyC93
Reviews.Content: My self and ex-girlfriend stayed here in March- We found the hotel to be in a brilliant location, located just off 5ave (If your looking for shopping) and also a very short walk to times square and other Mid-town attractions (With links obviously to all the others) First impressions were great - Arrived via cab from JFK (only $51 + tips) Welcomed warmly by the door man, and our bags were taken by the bell hop (Tipped). The lobby of the hotel is pretty spectacular, very grand! Check-in took a matter of minutes, all staff friendly and happy to help. The room (on the 3rd floor) was dated and small (Manhattan rooms are typically small) however, the room as very clean! The view looked out onto the hotels roof/services area - a little unimpressed by this. The bed was very big, apparently we booked a 'Cosy queen' however the bed turned out to be a 'Superior king' - very comfortable, with plenty of pillows. The room was fitted out with A/C and or heater - very noisy to say the least, we only used this when we weren't in the room! All facilities in the bathroom worked a treat, all very clean also. The room also came with iron, ironing board, suitcase props and also plenty of space and hangers to hang shirts dresses etc... The room was kept clean everyday by the brilliant maids, all towels were changed everyday without fail, and the bed was always made as if fresh. - Always very friendly when passing in the halls (Goodmorning, Goodevening etc...) The concierge at the hotel seemed to be very helpful, pointed us in the right direction a few times, and gave us information about airport delays and transfer times at different points of the day. The hotel bar was quite expensive, however served a wide selection of beverages including morning Starbucks coffee! (not that we needed them too with the 100's of other Starbucks on every corner!) The hotel Gym - we didn't use however we did have a look and the facilities did look impressive (Small gym with the usual equipment) Food/room services- we didn't bother with either, however prices weren't to bad, food always looked goof also. Checking out- We checked out just before 12pm, again staff very happy to help and wished us a safe flight back to the UK. Gave our bags to the bell hop for safe keeping until our departure time - Bell hop was very snotty at our $10 tip for 2 bags! Door man flagged us a cab back to JFK ($51 + Tips) and we were on our way home. - Overall this was a very nice hotel to stay in. Previously in October I had stayed in the Hilton Garden Inn just off Times Square (Much more modern). Services was always good, except for the last encounter with the bell hop! Room was brilliant, clean and big enough for what we needed it for. Location was excellent also, as are most Mid town hotels boasting the Times Square location. Would defiantly stay here again! (Bare in mind that if your visiting NY for sight seeing, 85% of the time your not going to be in your room! - If you are your not doing it right! ;) ) Andy.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in a new york icon”
Reviews.Author: Dale B
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this NYC icon. Although the price was quite high the location and comfort of this hotel more than made up for it. The rooms were really clean and tidy and the service was outstanding. We would return here next time in NYC just for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient enought to overlook the flaws.”
Reviews.Author: louis024
Reviews.Content: The location of The Roosevelt couldn't be better for the price. It is just steps away from Grand Central, Fifth Avenue and other midtown attractions. The first time I stayed there, in October, I had a renovated room which was really nice with two comfortable beds. This time (March 29-April 1) the room had not been renovated, and while clean enough, had a very musty, indoor swimming pool smell. However, while in New York I am on the go and love the convenience of having a place where I can take a break from the city. The lobby is gorgeous and very large. One problem is that there always seem to be large groups of tourists standing around and blocking access to the doors. I had drinks in the bar one night while they were filming an episode of Gossip Girls and the people watching was fun. Bar drinks are reasonably priced for Manhattan. It is very easy to catch a taxi in front of the hotel and they also have black cars available for all airports at the same rate as a yellow cab. Will continue to stay here, the convenience can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beth M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights during our 10-year old twins' spring break and we loved this hotel! This was the kids' first visit to NYC, and when Alfredo, who checked us in at the front desk, heard this he immediately gathered up pens, post cards and stationery for them to keep as souvenirs. He was so friendly and sweet to our kids and it was such a nice welcome to NYC! We checked in early afternoon and had no problem gettting our room a little earlier than usual check-in time. We drove here in a mini-van, which is a little large for some NYC parking garages, but we were able to get valet parking with no problem. The parking cost $55 a day, but at least they didn't charge more for a larger vehicle and we didn't have to hassle with finding parking on our own. The lobby is beautiful, elegant and inviting. We enjoyed hanging out ther on the comfortable sofas as were coming and going every morning and evening. We reserved a deluxe double double room, which was the largest double room offered, and we were pleasantly surprised with the amount of space we had - plenty of room for two adults and two children. It was very clean and had nice furnishings and bed covers - everything looked new and updated. The bathroom was maybe a little small by today's standards but it worked out fine. The shower was great - good pressure and all four of us were able to shower without running out of hot water. It was unusually warm in NYC for March so we actually used the air conditioning and it worked fine. The beds were comfortable too. The room had a small desk and chair as well as a padded chair and there was plenty of space to walk around the room without bumping into each other. We found the entire staff, from the front desk to the maids, to be very pleasant and accommodating. The location is great, The entrance to Grand Central Station is directly across the street so you can be on the subway in a matter of minutes. We did a lot of walking as well and were amazed by how easy it was to get to Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Plaza and Central Park on foot. We will definitely stay here again and are looking forward to visiting the rooftop lounge next time. It wasn't open yet but we were told it will be in mid-April. Also, when we checked out, Alfredo was very helpful in directing us on the best way to drive to the American Museum of Natural History from the hotel. He really took care of us and left us with a great impression of NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient But Not 4 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: texasladybug77
Reviews.Content: My friend, her mother in law and I traveled to NYC this past weekend to see her daughter sing at Carnegie Hall with her high school choir. When we arrived at the hotel, I went to borrow the luggage cart to use myself but the doorman would not let me take it which was annoying to say the least! I did not want to tip anyone, I just wanted to use the cart and get my luggage to my room on my own. He would not allow it. So we lugged our bags inside to the lobby. The lobby is gorgeous! Once you get to the room, it is nothing special. The rooms are very small especially if you have three or more people. There are no coffee pots, fridge or microwaves. The bathroom door almost hits the toilet when open. The bathroom is not updated and dull. My room did not get cleaned until around 3pm one day. I just didn't see where hotwire gives this hotel 5 stars. I would have had more amenities at a 3 star! As far as convenience, you couldn't beat it being right across the street from Grand Central Station. And the beds are very comfy. If you decide to stay here, be sure to print all tickets and boarding passes before you leave so you do not have to use their computer. They will charge you an arm and a leg to use them! My stay wasn't horrible but I wouldn't stay at this hotel again due to the size of the rooms and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: carolyn56
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous lobby but it about stops there. The room was extremely small with no bureaus so we kept our clothes in our suitcase. There was an very very small closet near the door and they had a curtain hanging off a rod to act as a door. The bed was uncomfortable, the pillows horrendous. Nothing on the walls and the bath was in need of dyer repair. The shower head was very old, cheap and broken. The tile and grout was cracked and missing pieces and they tried to cover it up with big thick lines of grout. There was just a sink with no vanity so there was no room to put anything. This is the 2nd hotel in NYC that we stayed at that offers no refrigerator or coffee pot. I thought this was going to be such a nice place and I was so disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price - location is only good thing about hotel”
Reviews.Author: audreymc13
Reviews.Content: We had soooo many issues at this hotel. First, they wouldn't let us check in one minute early. Next, heater in room was broken on a very cold night. And had trouble with TV. They did move us into another room. However, we initially were supposed to have 3 people in our room but ended up with just 2. When they gave us a heated room, they moved us from 2 beds to 1. Lucky for us we were minus one person. On the first night, our sheets smelled as though they hadn't been changed. We tried to contribute to water saving effort by re-using towels and hanging them up. Cleaning staff continued to replace them anyway. $15 per hour for wi-fi; no coffee maker in room. We tried to order coffee to go at restaurant and they would not do it. We then asked for coffee (without to-go cups) and told them we were guests and would like to take coffee to our room. They refused saying we would have to order it through room service - which would include a $4,50 fee plus gratuity...in addition to the cost of a cup of coffee. It was riduculous. They definitely were not about to go out of their way for their guests. We will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JollyHols38
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel has got to be it's selling point! One block from Grand Central, 5 mins from Times Square. There are loads of eateries within close proximity, including delis, diners and restaurants. The lobby is very grand, the desk staff very pleasant (unusual in NYC!!) and the concierge extremely helpful. The hotel has just undergone a renovation, and the outside is yet to be completed, but don't let this put you off. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Sizes vary depending on what room you book/get (have stayed twice and had a much bigger room last time). Shower over the bath was really powerful, and the bathroom overall was fine, just little things like rust on the shower rail. But everything was clean and functioned properly. To be honest, if you're a tourist, you will only use your room to sleep and freshen up in and for that the Roosevelt can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt, a sober apprasel.”
Reviews.Author: James73c
Reviews.Content: Like most on here I too was apprehensive about my stay at the Roosevelt. I'm pleased to say, that in part, my apprehensions did not fully come to fruition. As ever I'll start with the positives. The lobby, bar area and all other communal areas of the hotel were immaculate and the 1930s decor was stunning in my opinion, here the hotel is befitting of it's mantra "the grand old dame". Clearly the makers of Gossip Girl agreed, they were filming at the hotel during my stay. The food was good too, my steak earned it's $25 price tag I'd say. The maid service was excellent, each day I returned to my room to find my bed made with fresh towels in the bathroom, the cleaning it's self was to high standard with all the debrief from my previous day's exploits in and around Manhattan readily taken care of. The location of the hotel is another positive, if you want to walk or take the Subway most of the key attractions of this great city are within easy reach of the Roosevelt. Now about the room, 852, it was clean, a good size and contained two comfortable double beds. However, it is true to say that there were some noticeable minor aesthetic defects though certainly not enough to warrant any great concern, the bathroom however, whilst being clean and fully functional was in need of refurbishment. Small pockets of mold had developed around the bath with the some of the enamel worn away on the bath it's self. In all the bathroom had a rather dated feel to it though I should stress that this again is no great cause for concern. We are talking minor defects here, similar to those I've encountered in 4 and 5 star hotels. My experience of the hotel bar was over all a little less then satisfactory, service was slow, here I do not blame the bar staff, the fact is on the nights in question there simply wasn't enough staff on to cope with demand. In all certainly not the horror hotel some would have you believe, I enjoyed my stay and would happily return. A solid 3 star hotel that has the potential to strive for better things. If you're thinking of staying at the Roosevelt I have some advice for you. 1) Don't pay $14 per day for Internet access. Every Starbucks and McDonald's in Manhattan provides free wireless Internet access, simply accept the terms and conditions and you're online. There is at least three Starbucks and one McDonald's with two minutes walk of the hotel. 2) If you're a Steak fan you must visit Morton's Steak House, a minutes walk away on the same street (45th Street) Morton's provides probably the best Steak in the world, I cannot describe how good this restaurant is. If you have the cash to spare, it is pricey, you must go. 3) Visit the Highline. The Highline is an old elevated rail road that snakes it's way throughout the lower middle half of Manhattan and beyond. Long since disused it has been converted into public gardens with much of the old rail infrastructure left in place, it truly is a unique, beautiful public space that provides great views of the city and a great place to unwind. Entrance can be found on 23rd Street, and the best part, it's completely free. 4) For breakfast lunch or dinner try the New York Luncheonette, situated on 50th Street close to the junction with 3rd Avenue it's about a five minute walk from the hotel. The locals love it and so will you.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel NYC”
Reviews.Author: Paula B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel (29Mar 3nights) with my husband and 8 year old son. The location is great, very convenient and a great spot. The main hotel areas seem well maintained but this is where it ends. There are 12 floors and mostly only 4 elevators work so a 15 minute wait for one is the norm. There is no atmosphere to this hotel whatsoever so if you are looking for a great American experience don't stay here. It is completely soulless with money 'tip grabbing' staff particularly the bell men. I overheard one of them say we store luggage for free but it is expected that you pay me to take your bags to the store room! Very handy when I also saw guests carry their own bags to the store room and then watched the bell man count out his stash of money in front of me!!!! The rooms are so small I couldn't believe it with two very small doubles and no room to move - the only way it worked in our room was when two people remained in bed whilst the third moved and squeezed their way around the room. I'm disgusted that British Airways are recommending this hotel and I would never ever stay here again or recommend it to anyone - do not stay here, it is the most horrendous hotel I've stayed in during the last ten years. I would rather pay double the price to at least get friendly and sincere staff and a room that you can fit more than one person in. Seriously there are better places to stay and whilst I get the 'you are only there to sleep' concept it was a major issue during this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: mannie448
Reviews.Content: After nearly 9 hours of travelling the comfy beds and bath was a welcome relief - was upgraded on cin also - lovely hotel and 10 mins walk to times sq, rockafella and shops. stayed four nights cud have happliy stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring this exciting city”
Reviews.Author: Blondilocks
Reviews.Content: The lobby was very grand and the reception staff were friendly on check-in. We arrived slightly earlier than the 3pm check in but the room was ready straight away. The safe in the room did not work but after reporting this to reception this was quickly resolved without too much hassle. The room was fairly small in comparison to other rooms I've stayed in in the USA, but an adequate size for a base to explore New York. The room looked like it had been recently decorated and was clean. The bed was pretty big and was really comfortable and there was a good sized TV. The temperature in the room was OK and it was easy to control the A/C unit which was a little noisy. The bathroom looked a little old fashioned perhaps but everything functioned OK and was clean. The hairdryer was also a lot better than it looked too. Talking about noise, we were on the 5th floor and you could hear quite a lot of street noise, like beeping etc. The first night I was woken up by really noisy roadworks at 1am (my other half was oblivious to this!) It was really loud, like we were out on the street as well. I had noise reducing headphones with me so just popped them in and was able to get back to sleep fine. There was no reoccurance any other night and we weren't woken up by any other noise. I would perhaps suggest taking earplugs just in case (I had meant to take some for the flight anyway but had forgotten) The housekeeping staff do come round quite early so it is worth remembering to put the do-not-ddisturb sign outside. Breakfast was quite expensive ($28 each) so we didn't go for this option. There are plenty of cafe's within a few blocks - cafe 49 (green sign) was great, plus you can find lots of Starbucks and McDonalds. We ate in Times Square most evenings. The location of the Roosevelt was excellent (this was the main reason for us choosing it)- close to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Empire State Building. We walked pretty almost everywhere with the exception of Wall Street although we did walk back. Taxis were everywhere and the concierge would call you one if you needed (we did this for our return fo the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: Dr_guyc
Reviews.Content: VERY tiny itsy small room. Bathroom as well. Eventually left the hotel after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: prpro70
Reviews.Content: A work event required staying here march 26-27. Although front desk said room had been renovated recently I think her definition of recent was 1990. The entire room and furniture was dusty, had heavily stained walls with what appeared to be food. Same splatter was on bedskirt. Bathroom had not been modernized at all (anew shower curtain doesn't count!) and had mold on ceiling and where floor met walls. Eyes were itching so bad from room dust, air system wheezed, window curtains were so dirty. I called housekeeping three times each day literally begging for a real cleaning which never happened. On last morning my toilet overflowed, thankfully it was clean water. I called housekeeping and it took 40 minutes for a response. By then it was hard to care as I was checking out. PLEASE do yourself a favor, do not stay here. I don't care if your room was free or if they pay you to stay here. It is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for price point and location”
Reviews.Author: Ways2go
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel as part of a conference. I read the reviews and I had very low expectations. Fortunately, my low expectations were exceeded. We initially were booked in a standard queen room. I called to see if we could get an upgrade; they said they were completely booked and an upgrade would not be possible. Upon arrival, we asked for an upgrade again and we got a standard king room on the 12th floor with no view (but no traffic noise). Check-in was fast and the staff was courteous. Our room was smallish but renovated: new carpet, drapes, furniture, paint, bedding and new lampshades. The chair was either new or re-upholstered. The bed was comfortable and the linens were quite lovely. Plenty of pillows. Room temperature was fine. The old heater rattled at low speed but did fine at high speed. The drapes were made out of lightweight material and ballooned out when the heater was on. I found that somewhat disconcerting. The Roosevelt would have done better by installing shades or using a heavier fabric. Safe was easy to program. The clock worked. Flat-screen TV worked fine although the screen had a scratch/missing pixels on it. Room had an iron and ironing board. Desk chair was comfortable. Three lamps gave adequate light. One of the lamps had a light bulb socket hanging out at a cockeyed angle but I was able to fit it back into the holder. The lampshades were not large enough for two of the lamps (the light bulbs were below the shade). The glare of the light bulbs was unpleasant and cast a harsh light in the room—the last thing an older hotel needs. Someone messed up here because I saw the same problem in two other rooms I peeked into. This is a simple fix for the Roosevelt and they need to hop to it. Lighting can make all the difference in a room. The bathroom was very small but adequate. I felt like the cleaning staff did a very good job of cleaning each day. I found the towels to be good quality; we were supplied with fresh, clean towels every day. There was a small ledge above the commode for toiletries. This was an accident waiting to happen and I was glad that I had brought my hanging toiletry kit. Lighting in the bathroom was older but adequate. There was a nice, large mirror and decent hairdryer. Water was not always hot but it stayed warm, and, yes, it was clear water. Commode was set in the floor a little crooked and was not quite securely fastened. This could have been done so much better. There was no active mold but there was some old mold/mildew stains evident around the bathtub. Not such great caulking here. I had room service for breakfast one day and I was extremely pleased. I had two perfectly scrambled eggs, crisp bacon, roasted potatoes with onions and peppers (not greasy!), water, tea (hot!) and orange juice. Service was fast and the food was really delicious. I did not eat in the hotel other than this meal but if this was representative, the Roosevelt can certainly claim to set the standard for room service breakfast—and that’s coming from someone who is very picky about breakfast. I enjoyed the lobby area. Yes, it was busy but it was still pleasant. The doormen and the bellmen all gave very good service. There was a place to print one’s boarding passes and there was even a place to weigh one’s suitcases. I don’t see that very often in hotels. We had a late flight out so the Roosevelt held our suitcases all day while we toured—I truly appreciated that service. Checkout was fast and accurate. All in all, I would go back to this hotel if I garnered a good price. The Roosevelt Hotel could have done some things better in their renovation. I get the feeling that someone inexperienced/not detail-oriented headed up the renovation. That’s unfortunate but it is not a deal-breaker here. I consider the Roosevelt hotel to be a solid choice for its price point and location.

Reviews.Title: “caveat emptor”
Reviews.Author: Innseeker56
Reviews.Content: We checked in for one night. We had to drive north so we had to park our car. We arrived at 10:00, checked in at 8 pm and checked out at 11:30. The parking fee was $110.00, there was no complementary coffee or coffee pot in the room. The rooms were okay although the distinct odor of chlorine cleaner permeated the air. If you need an inexpensive room midtown, this may be the answer BUT let the buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “don't be put off”
Reviews.Author: reymax
Reviews.Content: We booked this for it's location but were put off by the adverts in travel magazines that it was a typical businessman's hotel. We found it friendly and helpful. Yes it is in a good location and we would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Worn-down interior, great location”
Reviews.Author: Danielle C
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice in the last few years - most recently in Feb 2012. Both times we were attracted to the hotel because of its great price. It has a very grand entry/lobby/bar, but the rooms are a little worn down. Supposedly they have recently renovated the rooms, but that seems to mean a paint job and new fabrics. The rooms still look old and the bathrooms are very dated. The rooms are also small -- but I expect that from a place in the city. Overall, though, it is in a fantastic location. Steps from Grand Central Station and within walking distance of museums, Central Park, 30 Rock, and Times Square. I would recommend this place to others, with some reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth O
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt's lobby is it's best asset. Beyond this it is a very dated hotel. We booked a double double, thankfully, as the rooms are small. The bathroom was basic, but did have a good supply of towels and the beds are comfortable. Everything could do with a make-over. Some of the staff were quite rude and left a lot to be desired. On the positive side it is in a fantastic location for everthing and Eamonn's Pub, just two minutes away, is well worth a visit for great Bar Food.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Boltontraveller_12
Reviews.Content: was really excited t the prospect of staying here..looked fab on the website... what a disappointment the room was tiny (even for new york), tatty , extremely noisy...the whole hotel was dark and dingy and felt in need of an update.. and as for some of the staff-it is supposed to be a service industry-so rude. Would not recommend this hotel..have stayed in much better in NYC at a much lower cost.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this horrible place!”
Reviews.Author: cestlaviebaby
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for business purposes in nyc, their service is completly horrible, i checked in at 23:00pm, and was gonna leave in the morning, asked for the attendant to upgrade my room ( im a elite member of starwood, hilton and icg hotels), she was very unpolite and said that even that they had available rooms she eouldnt give upgrade because i paid for a regular room..Soooo rude! Getting to my room I thought how would it be if i were in prision, the room is so small, someone cant hardly move inside! Dont waist your money in this hotel, you better either pay a little more or even less money for decent hotels close by!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: tstyles
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to stay here after reading some of the reviews, but was actually pretty impressed. I guess what really determines your experience may be your expectations. The Roosevelt is a historical building with a true "classic" New York feel. I received excellent service from both the front desk and the bell hops. Had no issues there. The rooms are standard - they are not luxurious by any means, but they are clean, comfortable and nicely decorated (in that "classic" stye). The location is fantastic - you are right in midtown within walking distance to Times Square, 5th Avenue, and even Central Park if you are wiling to walk a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...Don't be put off by bad reviews...”
Reviews.Author: Dougall2010
Reviews.Content: Like others I was very anxious about staying here after reading negative comments however I can honestly say that my stay here between 16-21 March was excellent-check in was a breeze-very friendly staff-bedroom and bathroom was very clean & comfortable-clean sheets & towels daily, the bed was so comfortable-best nights sleep ever! The bar staff were very friendly and no probs with the lifts or bad smells at all-we stayed on the 9th floor. I can't understand all the negative reviews, our stay was faultless & would stay here again, I would recommend this hotel over & over again! Ok so the air con was a bit noisy-I slept well, the view wasn't great-I didn't go there for the view! 10/10-a big thumbs up and a big thank you to the staff at The Roosesvelt for making our stay a very enjoyable & comfortable time in NY. See you next time!

Reviews.Title: “A Complete Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: BAS06
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this...do not stay here if at all possible. I am a frequent NYC traveler and thought I'd give the Roosevelt a try given the outstanding location and value as we were traveling with children. The pictures on-line are not accurate. The rooms are small (even though we had booked the "superior/deluxe" room, we were placed in the cozy/cozy room). After they claimed they had no other roons available and agreed to credit our rate by $75, I escalated the issue and another room suddenly became available. The woman who initially checked us in was rude, abrupt and never made eye contact. We found the rest of the staff to be much the same. The bathrooms in these hotel rooms are exactly like a bathroom you would find in a small shared hospital room. Old, dirty, flourescent lights, dingy shower curtain....an absolutely horrible experience. We had a tub issue (draining) on one evening and when I called down to "guest services" - no one answered the phone! I then called housekeeping...still no answer. The safe in the room did not work, the staff was generally rude and disinterested, there was no temprature control in the room, no in room movies, some lamps were broken and did not work. Every day, I calmly approached the front desk asking to speak to a manager regarding our concerns and each day, he was not available. The elevators do not work correctly, sometimes skipping entire floors and the vending rooms on each floor smelled like urine (we were on 15). Although the hotel would have masses of people checking in and out, there were only a handful of people at the front desk to manage the flow. The rooms smelled and looked old and dirty, the window units were loud, and the space in a superior room was tiny. Avoid this hotel at all costs if you are traveling with children as there are no support services and no in room movies. It is truly a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “One great location”
Reviews.Author: LateTravelers
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive after reading some reviews but couldn't agree with some of the bad comments regarding service. The front desk were very good as were the bell hops. Early in the week we had no problems with the elevators but I have to say that closer to the St. Pats weekend, they were slower. We were on the 5th floor so easily walk able. The room we had was large especially for New York. Two double beds in a corner unit. Beds comfortable and clean. They have made some renovations to the room but the bathroom definitely could use some work as the grout in the tub was covering over moldy previous grouting in a roughshod manner. To be honest all the bathrooms probably need upgrading which would cost thousands and put the room cost up accordingly. We were able to overlook this. The noise at night from road works going on at different hours of the night was pretty loud. My daughter wore earplugs and was unaffected. I would wake up but was so exhausted from our days adventures I went right back to sleep again. Based on this experience I would stay here again - probably not for the more affluent traveler but as long as the bed is clean and the daily room service is fine, I'm happy. Our focus was New York and being so close to Grand Central station was a bonus. Everything was walking distance including the better restaurants - you just had to walk a little further.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory”
Reviews.Author: DixonsInLondon
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel -- I loved the Deco architecture, the high ceilings, the potential. The room was really a let down, looking as though it had not been refurbished since perhaps the 1970s. I was struck by the old tub with worn ceramic, the glaring fluorescent bulb in the bathroom, outdated furniture, and the single-paned windows that allowed me to hear the 5am trash trucks every morning. Seriously, this hotel room had features that usually can only be found at a $49-per-night motel. I have always found it difficult to find a hotel room that I like in New York, and this trip was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “It's just average!”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel for a conference in the week leading up to St Patricks Day and it is quite possibly the busiest hotel I have ever stayed in. I tend to agree with a number of other comments about the hotel needing some work; in my room the bathroom was very old and there was a lot of wear and tear in other areas. The air conditioning unit was also very noisy so I couldn't sleep with it on and couldn't sleep with it off as it got to hot - lose lose situation! The staff were generally ok and attentive but especially when checking in the queues were enormous. Queuing for the elevators was also a very time consuming affair. There are six elevators but the waiting time is excessive and so much so that I eventually just started taking the stairs. Final warning, the wifi is expensive and had very poor reception in my room resulting in the connection failing every 5 minutes. Also the wifi you pay for in the room is not available throughout the hotel which was infuriating since for the conference we were spending time in different parts of the hotel. Overall, it's just average and for around the same price I think you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “It's not right, but it's OK...”
Reviews.Author: BryanR-W
Reviews.Content: It's OK enough for us to revisit for a second time! It's well placed on the island (the main reason for us to revisit) and on the surface, it's a 'classy' Art Deco hotel. The rooms are pretty good, 'brown' furniture which befits the style of the hotel, flatscreen TV (usual 'crap' channels though), big walk-in closets, ironing board with iron etc. Despite a 'major overhaul' in the recent past, it's bathrooms are looking a bit shabby (bath needed re-enamalling and the toilet seat was broken etc.) but for the price (via Expedia) you can't complain. Staff are nice, but avoid the guys who stop at nothing to get your dollars by helping you with your bags etc. But you expect that in the larger, 'classier' hotels (or the ones that think they're classy!). Top tips: If you're on a budget or don't like to pay over the odds, DON'T order food or alcohol from the (admittedly pleasant) bar; we're talking $16 dollars for two pints of lager here! Instead, visit a local nearby bar; it's gonna be cheaper! Or, do as we did, head 'round the corner to 'Smileys' store on Fifth Avenue, just across the street from 45th street (opposite Barnes and Noble). They do a vast array of 'six packs' and wines and also have a wonderful 'salad bar' that is a actually a huge choice of hot and cold food; all with an asian twist, that you box up yourself and then take to get weighed ($7.99 per lb). You can eat in (upstairs) or take back to your room! Easy, and much cheaper than the hotel prices. Breakfast: BIGGEST tip here is to go straight to 'Red Flame Diner Coffee Shop' on 67 W 44th St (between 5th Ave & Avenue Of The Americas) - look it up on Yelp.com. We were actually recommended to go there by the (cute!) Roosevelt doorman; he uses it, it's a New Yorkers' place to eat! The food is AMAZING, the service wonderful and with NONE of the attitude at Carnegie Deli (seriously, why do tourists STILL go there?!). It's been 'done up' in recent years and is so clean and bright, you might want to eat there for evening meal as well! You can get a hearty breakfast for two with unlimited coffee etc. for under twenty bucks; yep you read right, twenty! If you don't follow this top tip, shame on you!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right: perfect for some and not for others”
Reviews.Author: fromourhouse
Reviews.Content: Our comments are fairly consistent with the majority of previous reviews, in my estimation. This is a large hotel (1000 rooms) that hosts a lot of conferences. People wanting luxury accommodation or a large bathroom, for example, will be disappointed but for our purposes, we found the room to be perfectly acceptable. In our case, our family of four was on a mission to take in all the touristy sights, so we needed nothing more than a clean, decent place to sleep for 4 nights. Additionally, we booked the room through an online travel website for a “song” so cannot complain about value for money. Other reviews have commented on interactions with hotel staff, which appear to be hit and miss. Our experience with the hotel staff, especially the room maids, couldn’t have been more friendly and pleasant. We had two small issues (burnt out bathroom light and inoperable room safe) that were resolved with lightening speed by maintenance and security staff. We weren’t thrilled having to pay $15/day for WiFi to appease our teenage daughters, but we were braced for it thanks to other tripadvisor reviewers. (Long live tripadvisor!!) We’d stay again if only because of the location. It was a manageable walk to Times Square, or to the UN if that’s your cup of tea. Otherwise we took the subway daily to visit other attractions since The Roosevelt is very near Grand Central Station where the subway is easily accessible. We loved the proximity to a little café right across the street called Cosi (a chain) where we had our coffee and a quick, inexpensive breakfast every morning of our stay (delicious breakfast sandwiches and wraps, yogurt parfaits and steel-cut oats). Anyone wanting a big, leisurely breakfast of eggs, pancakes, sausage, homefries etc. would want to go elsewhere. Yes, we would book there again due to the price point and plough the savings into sight-seeing and fabulous dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid avoid avoid, unless you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: SaintmarkLondon
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this hotel should get a 1 star at best. I've given it a 2 as if you are on a budget, business or personal, and you will be out of the room a lot then maybe this hotel is ok. However, be warned. I stayed here as the usual hotels I book were full and I wanted mid town. However I moved 1 day into a 4 day stay. Dreadful. The only good thing about this hotel is the location and the price. I am an honest reviewer, see my other reviews. Here goes: The lobby is ok, as the bar. The staff were generally rude - the receptionist was awful, the bell man too. The operator was also dreadful. Didn't care much and didn't do as they said. The lifts, lighting and hallways are 40 years old, with no decoration. They are way way out of date. The carpets stained. The rooms - I'm honestly not sure where to begin. It smelled old and musty; carpets stained: don't touch the window unless you want to lose a finger, I'm serious; the windows are tiny, no light; the next curtains, well, if they were washed before 1950 I would be shocked; the safe didn't work; the bath was blocked; the bathroom, well that is worse than a 2 star motel. I've stayed in plenty of 2 star motels and they beat this hotel by some way. The maintenance is just shocking, don't get ice - you will see a room that was last cleaned with Kennedy was president. To be fair there is wifi and a tv, with few channels. There is a gym, but not one most people are used to. I will not, ever, go back to this hotel. I would rather sleep in my car. Honestly. I'm no snob, I review on value for money. This hotel is not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt "grand renovation"”
Reviews.Author: martin t
Reviews.Content: Actually it's not as pretty as the professional pictures: 1. unfriendly service 2. very poor "grand renovation" 3. room poor condition 4. standard rooms are very small 5. same days don´t clen the room Only positive things that the hotel was located in a good location. I was in this hotel 6 nights in February. I will not go back anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned and worn out!”
Reviews.Author: dirk9980
Reviews.Content: Beside the beautiful lobby and a good location this place doesn't offer much. The rooms are clean and reasonable sized but pretty much worn out. The bathrooms need a refurbishment they have standard of the 70's.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MUFan-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for the Big East Tournement and stayed at the Roosevelt because it was the team hotel. Based on some of the reviews if figured it would be just average and a little run down. I was very pleasently surprised. Our room was in very good condition and the hall way walls and carpet were in excellent shape. Rooms in NYC are going to be small but this room had two double beds, room for a desk with a chair you could pull out and even room to set up a suit case holder. The beds are very comfortable. The elevators were fast, the staff was friendly. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Its got the wow factor”
Reviews.Author: r1chard311
Reviews.Content: 6 night stay beautiful lobby/reception, great first impression. The room was spacious and comfortable but no tea making facilities which appears to be the norm in NY. I would recommend this hotel as good value and a brilliant location for sightseeing just 2 negatives. 1. The hotel receptionists or agents as they call themselves are off hand and are not particularly welcoming. When we checked in the agent didnt bother to tell us that the room was not yet ready merely indicating we should leave our luggage with the porter - when the luggage was placed in a side room we were puzzled and had to queue again for reception to find out we would have to wait for our rooms to be made ready. 2. My phone rang interminably thru the night and despite repeated complaints it was not fixed. These were minor issues and overall i would stay at the Roosevelt Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much & you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: byulaxmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here while my husband attended a conference. PROS: 1) staff is very friendly although some of the advice/info the concierge offered was not always accurate; 2) the lobby is beautiful; 3) great location in midtown, right around the corner from Grand Central Station; 4) bed was comfortable; 5) they will hold your luggage after check out for free CONS: 1) king sized room was small; 2) A/C did not work; 3) no refrigerator, microwave, or coffeemaker; 4) if you want WiFi it will cost you $15+/day; 5) concierge refused to print off free tickets to 911 Memorial--instead he directed us to the public computer which we had to pay for :-( ; 6) friends who were with us woke up the first morning to water pouring through their bathroom ceiling & had to change rooms; 7) room never got made up before 3 PM; 8) no mirror outside of bathroom where I could sit to blow dry hair/put on makeup while my husband was in the bathroom. For the price, I would probably not stay here again. I guess my expectations for the money it cost were way too high.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Quick Stay”
Reviews.Author: wildorchid416
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt during a quick trip to NYC, and I would stay here again. We found a great rate on line, and since we were staying on a busy Saturday night, it was a relief to be on the East Side, as the West Side of the city was MADNESS. The hotel itself was very very busy. Many large groups were staying, and I think that would've been frustrating if we had been staying more than one night, as there was a line to check in that was constantly being cut by people whose keys didn't work, TV needed fixing, etc. Plus there were hoards of people everywhere, conference attendees, large family packs (reunion groups? I don't know. They had matching t-shirts!), and bachelorette parties. Once we got through the check-in process we were fine, and had a small but clean and lovely room on the 12th floor right outside the elevators (it was an accessible room so the bathroom was spacious to me!). I was worried about this, but since we were only there for one night, I didn't want to make a fuss, and it turned out to be a non-issue, the guests were very quiet using the elevator. We were in our room for a total of about 7 hours, 5 of which were spent sleeping, so it really was just a place to crash, we didn't need to use WiFi, eat at the hotel, and we didn't need the concierge or the front desk for anything, but overall, the price was right, the place was clean, and the location was fabulous. We had an easy walk over to a dance club on 46th and 9th and it was a cheap cab ride back. Couldn't ask for more. I can't really comment on how it would be for a long stay, but I definitely would recommend it for a quick weekend getaway, especially if you're seeing a show - it's an easy walk to the Theater district, and there are plenty of places along the way to grab a bite.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel super locarion”
Reviews.Author: Mark K
Reviews.Content: only back yesterday stayed 5 nights 1st march to the 6th. i was really worried as i had read nealy all the reviews on this site of the hotel. Firstly we were we got the subway to grand central and found the hotel fairly easly only 3 block walk. then upon arrival we were downgraded we had the cosy double double booked but we were told there was one left?? and asked if we would take the cosy queen after been travelling for 15 hours at that satge i really didnt care. when we got to the room is was not renovated either ans couldnt get over how small it was.. so first impression were not great but as the week went on my partner and i didnt care the room was left spotless ever day and for some reason we got new towels even when we hung ours up. the bed was super comfy and the tv always had somthin to watch (for the few hours we watched although i was awake from 5/6 evry morning while my partner sleep til 7/8 so i watched a bit) the room was a little warn but i found if u move the latch on the windows u can let in enough air to cool the room and i found it lovely at night as the air con is a little warm. the bathroom was adequate despite what other said on this site the pressure on the shower was very good and was delighted after the long flight. there is so much to do in the city and there is so many places to eat around the hotel we use to eat at the europa cafe for breakfast every morning as when we went to restaurants we found they gave us too much food and it is only brakfast at the end of the day. we went to eamonns nice for lunch or dinner all in all we were very happy with th hotel apart from the early hicups and tink for price and location alone i would saty here again i think some people went to far with there reviews of this hotel if your not happy pay the money and stay in the plaza!!

Reviews.Title: “WAY too many tourists.”
Reviews.Author: MT5211
Reviews.Content: I hit The Roosevelt on Priceline as a 3.5 Star, MidTown East. Overall it was so-so, acceptable and certainly not the best or the worst I've experienced. My primary impression that will remain with me is the hoards of tourist and conference groups coming and going. The lobby, doorways, elevators and some floors were almost always overrun with loud gaggles of shrieking teenagers and middle-aged men wearing "Hi, my name is Bob" nametags. More than once I had to weave my way through piles of luggage and overweight middle school chaperones waiting for their busses back to JFK. That's all fine but if you are looking for someplace relaxing, this isn't it. The crowds made it difficult to get an elevator and there was almost always a loud conversation outside my door. Cleanliness was so-so, the place was far from spotless, and while the towels were clean, fluffy and plentiful the first day they were apparently rationed on subsequent days. As someone mentioned in a previous review the toiletries weren't replaced either. There are no coffee makers or refigerators either and while there was an in-room safe it was inoperable. The location is ok but I'd rather be farther away from TouristTown in Times Square. My limited interaction with the staff was positive, maybe more than positive but I am prepared to tip the concierge and bell guys. Duh, this is New York and it's expected, like it or not. A couple bucks get you a lot further here. I describe my staff interaction as limited because apparently unlike some reviewers I am independent and I can get through the day without a hotel employee holding my hand and participating in every decision. I guess some people just can't get through a day without their therapists... Bottom line is I wasn't overly excited about the place as I prefer something more sedate and elegant so next time I will hold out for a 4 star and try for the Waldorf or the Benjamin.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else if you can!”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroRTW
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've been in years! - Rude receptionists (I had to deal with at least 4 different in 4 differente days and they were all the same). - 15 dollars for a WiFi and/or wired Internet. Per day Per device!!! > This is NY. You have free WiFi in every corner. 15 dollars is just too much. - Small and unclean rooms. > One day they didn't even change/refill the shampoo. The only good thing is the location. But I don't think it worth the $$ and bad times you'll have.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: KeenTraveller1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2011. It's a beautiful hotel. Rooms are nice but very small. This didn't bother us though because we were out all day sightseeing. The hotel is in walking distance to Empire State Building, Times Square, Park Avenue, Central Park, Rockefeller Centre. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded and on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: FunnyMagicGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights; good value and location especially if through a discounter. Rooms are small but seem quite new and spotless. Waiting for elevators was a pain. Beds were comfy but the lumpy cotton filled comforter was a bit odd. I'd stay there again for a similar bargain rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boi_BH
Reviews.Content: I´ve been in Roosevelt on nov. and dec. 2011. It´s a confortable hotel. Beautiful lobby. The rooms were being refurbished and I stayed in an old one. I shoulde be happier in a new room. But the best in the hotel is because it´s near Theater District at Time Square. If you´re a tourist you can round around Manhattan all the day, but your nights always end in Theater District at Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: winechick75
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is in an ideal location and perfect for what we wanted. The décor in the lobby is very grand but when you go into the rooms they are less so. As this is a really old hotel we were expecting older furnishings, which they were, but the electrics scared us the most, we were worried about plugging things in as they seemed to be hanging off the wall in one place. Other than the tired look of the room it was clean, the beds were comfy and we had no major issues. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BAD service but nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Carin S
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the hotel was nice with great beds, which should be most important. Though, the service and attitude of the staff wasn't very nice. At the reception they didn't looked up from their computer screens when you came for help. They were very slow at the check in and didn't seem to care to speed up even though the line ran through the whole lobby and out on the street. When we finally got our room they placed us in a room with a double bed even though we had payed extra for two single beds. When I went back down to try change the room they answered me "We upgraded your standard for free and now you want to change room?" even though they DID NOT upgraded me. I got the same standard as I had payed for, according to my booking and the information folder about the room. The staff taking care of our bags litterally stole our money when we were getting our bags. We only had a 10 dollar bill and told him we wanted to pay him 2 dollar(even though he carried one bag and we took the other two by ourselves), ha said he were going to change it but when he came back he pretended like he didn't knew what we were talking about when we wanted our change back. We also saw a sign were the service desk promoted they could help you with tickets to the 9/11 memorial. When we went there they told us we had to go to a web page and print the tickets, but they couldn't help us with any of it. And I mean, who is bringing a printer? The woman at the desk assured that this was the only way and I asked specifically if there was any place downtown where I could print the tickets, and she said no. I found this strange and went back to my room and googled up that there actually would be a place to print the tickets, close to wall street. We booked the tickets, went to this place which belonged to the memorial, printed the tickets in 2 minutes and went to this amazing place. I mean, it was the simplest thing on earth and if we hadn't been leaving the same day I would go back to confront the woman at the desk. I mean, WHY does she lie/speak of something that she doesn't know something about? Makes no sense. We felt very uncomfortable with the staff. So, terrible service which brought down the whole experience, but still good beds.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: ByScott
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we got a really super rate on Hotwire or I would have lots more to complain about. This hotel is old and tired even with the renovations. Honestly, I could not even determine if my room had been renovated. Old heating /cooling system, chipped bath tub with old fixtures, sloowwww elevators no coffee pot in the room. Rooms were clean and tidy, comfy beds, bad pillows. Nice lobby with plenty of comfy seating. Hotwire rated this as a 4 star hotel which I would disagree with given it's condition and lack of amenities. Give it a try if you can get a really great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Classic NYC Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: rbsolo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Roosevelt through Hotwire at a rate of $104+ tax and we were very pleased with every aspect of our stay. We were two families with young children and we were placed in connecting rooms on the 12th floor. One room was somewhat larger than the other and had windows both overlooking 45th street and Madison Avenue. Since both rooms were supposed to have double beds, and one was a king, they provided 2 rollaways at no additional charge. The rooms were super quiet, and we were barely able to hear the traffic noise below. The rooms were newly remodeled, however the bathrooms were faily standard. With a Sunday arrival, we found street parking, however most spots require you to move your car before 7 AM on Monday, so we moved the cars into a lot for about $16 for 12 hours, much cheaper than the $55/night hotel parking. The further east you go, the cheaper the garages were. We did not eat in the hotel, but brought bagels from Essabagel on 50th street and ate dinner at a German restaurant on 3rd Avenue and had a Chinese lunch near Park Ave. and 35 street. The hotel was well situated, a short walk to the free ice skating at Bryant park (bring your own skates), Times Square, the fashion district, Central Park etc, etc. We walked down to Chelsea and cabbed it back-- quick and easy. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel ..long review and how to get to and from Newark on public transport”
Reviews.Author: leavemeonthebeach
Reviews.Content: Getting there We travelled from Manchester to Newark with Continental Airlines (booked as a package with Expedia.co.uk). We stayed overnight at the Premier Inn Manchester Airport which was a great hotel. Flight was good, in flight entertainment was great - over 50 films in the library of which about 13 were new releases. We had decided to go native and tackle travelling into Manhattan by public transport. I had read previous reviews and thought we’d give it a go. We took the Airtrain from the terminal to Newark Airport train station - that was painless. Just followed the signs for the Airtain. Bought a ticket from the machine which always has helpful staff standing around to help. Costs $12.50 to Manhattan. The train station is at the end of the track and tells you on the tannoy when you have arrived so you don’t need to get off until the end of the line which is only about 5 mins. At the train station the train leaves from track ??? but again , theres helpful staff on the platform who will direct you. We had just missed the train so had to wait for 30mins for the next one. The train from the airport takes you in New York Penn Station as had a couple of stops in between stops at Newark Penn and Seacuaus before it arrives at New York Penn Station. I was a bit overwhelmed when I got to NY Penn as didn’t have a clue what to do then. I knew I had to take the subway but didn;t know which one and there was no staff I could see to help me as it was mobbed. A helpful New Yorker assisted me and once I knew what to do it was very easy. So when you get to NY Peen head for the subway. You need to take the Uptown subway which was No 1 Subway get off after one stop and then head for the S subway ( silver line ) this takes you into Grand Central. If your planning how long all this will take, it was about a 30 mins train ride from Newark and less that 5 mins on the subway. You’ll need to buy a single ride ticket for the subway which was $2.50 each and you can use it for your journey for both stations. Again when getting to Grand Central we didn’t have a clue which exit to take to get to East 45th St so we headed for the nearest exit and came out on E 42nd St and just walked the few minutes to the hotel. Days later we realised we should have taken the Vanderbilt Avenue exit from the main terminal. If I was to do it again, I would have printed of a subway map and NY street map before I arrived, as when we came out on E 42nd St we were like well which way down we go now. The Hotel The hotel was breathtaking when entering, very NY 1920’s so glamourous. This is why I had chosen this hotel, a wedding was taking place and it nearly brought tears to my eyes. The bride looked beautiful and it added even more glamour. Check in was about 20mins and I had to leave a $100 deposit in cash as I hadn’t brought my credit card with me. The room was prefect. The bed was huge - we had a superior king size. Nice plasma TV with lots of channels such as HBO, FX etc. I knew that the rooms didn’t have coffee making facilities, so heading down to the lobby to grab a coffee when I woke up early after my first nights sleep. It was 5am and I could not get a coffee. The concierge advised me I could walk up to 5th Ave to get one. However I walked straight across E 45th a block and a half ( walking to the right towards 5th when and found a 24 hr deli and grabbed a coffee there and brought it back to the hotel lobby. The Cosi Cafe across the street opens at 6.30am and a grande americano costs $2.38 as opposed to $5 in the hotel. This was to be a pain for the rest of my stay as I was always up before the coffee stand / cafes opened and had to head out every morning. Our room was on the 4th floor and outside our window was the generators, you could her them but it didn’t disturb us too much, but I would ask for a higher floor if I stayed again. I paid the $15 each day for wi-fi and noticed later that the $15 dollars was for each appliance not the room , so my daughter had her iphone, ipad and I had my laptop so we had three applicancies. We didn;t realize until check out which I was not happy about. No even free wi-fi in reception. They have a business centre located on the second floor but I used the Web Zone located in the lobby, they have two computers (located next to the Roosevelt Grill) they have two pc’s and a printer , its free to print off your boarding passes, I needed to print off my Broadway tickets and had to use pay as you go, you have to swipe your credit / debit card. I used it for about 4 mins and was charged about $4. We had room service on a few nights very fast delivery within 15 mins, ordered the pizza and a selection of cup cakes was $42 with delivery and service charge and so tasty and plenty for two. Also recommend to Chicken BLT was the best I have ever tasted. Also got take out from Fung Shui in Grand Central - was yummy. Tours We purchased all our tickets before we left the UK using Vaitor.com. I have used this website in the past in Miami and Orlando so knew they were a reputable company. We booked the Hop on Bus on our first day theres 3 loops downtown Downtown Loop , Greenwich Village, Times Square, Empire State Building, Flatiron building, Union Square, Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, Lower East Side, East Village, Rockefeller Center takes about 2hrs and operates daily from 8:30am - 5:00pm. The bus stops at all the tourist attractions so its really easy to get around and they go every 15 minutes so you never have to wait too long. We decided to do the Brooklyn Loop to visit a different borough and see what it was like. Was disappointed that this was not a hop on / off tour had to stay on the bus for 90 mins. We wanted to walk back to Manhattan from Brooklyn on the Brooklyn Bridge , so this wasn’t possible. Natural History Museum pre booked via Viator and just went straight to exchange desk, queues for on the day was very long it was a |Bank Holiday in USA ( presidents day ). Lots of families and children there . We booked the Water Taxi hop on off tour with 911 Memorial tour, the water taxi was excellent. Left from Pier 84 12th and W 44th St easy to find. Great views of both the Manhattan skyline, Brooklyn, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island and New Jersey. You can hop off at Battery Park ( for 911 Memorial ), South Seaport & Brooklyn. The memorial was very moving and the reflecting pools are beautiful. Security is very tight ( similar to going through airport security ). If you have time we didn’t the battleship USS Intrepid is docked next to Pier 84 huge ship which is now a museum. You get a discount if you have booked the water taxi and tickets are only $14 each. We did the Sex and the City Tour which was great fun, our guide Ashley was great she’s a stand up comic and actor also and she was very entertaining. We were picked up at the P|ultizer Fountain in front of the Plaza on 5th Avenue and boarded the bus. She showed us all the sights featured in the show and the films. We stopped at the Pleasure Chest, Magnolia Bakery and Aidan and Steve’s bar. We had free cupcakes and discounted Cosmo’s. We got to see lots of the city such as the West Village. This was a great value tour lasting about 3 hours and again booked with Viator. Central Park We wandered through Central Park starting at Strawberry Fields past the Bow Bridge onto the lake and the Boathouse and followed the road down through the Zoo to the Woolman Rink , we had planned to Ice Skate but we were too tired and weary. I would love to Central Park in the summer with all its greenery. Shopping Macys - huge store loved the old wooden escalators in the older part of the building, head to the 8th floor for the bargains. I bought a Michael Kors winter coat for $90 should have been $285. Century 21 @ Ground Zero far better than Macy’s some greats bargains Raybans $69, Ralph Lauren PJ’s $20, and much more in my basket. We also loved Cart and Barrel which is on Madison Ave just behind the Apple Store and FAO Shwarz on 5th. My daughter had saved some money to buy a necklace at Tiffanys and it felt such a special occasion, its a beautiful store and it was lovely to see the couples getting engaged sitting down drinking champagne whilst the Tiffanys staff helped them choose the perfect ring. Times Square ( 5 mins walk ) is eye opening , you have to see it to believe it, its awesome. 1000’s of people there in the evening. The billboards provide so much light that it feels like day times during the night. A great buzz going on in Times Square. Broadway We saw Phantom of the Opera whilst we were there, I purchased my tickets before I left the UK , I signed up to Broadway Box web site about 2 weeks before my trip to NYC and received emails for offers each day. I managed to get Phantom of the Opera tickets for $40 each. Paid on line and my tickets were emailed to me. We had rear right mezzanine seats and they were great. I knew we would be at the back of the theatre but didn’t hinder the sound or view. The show its self was amazing, the scene changes, actors and performance blew me away. Majestic Theatre was small and beautiful , very easy to find just off Times Square. We had a great evening. Back to Newark On our last day we walked past a bus stop 42nd St that had a sign that said Newark Airport transfers $16 runs every 15 mins. So rather than tackle the subway with our cases, we decided to get the bus. Painless and relaxing . The stop is near the corner of 5th and 42nd St opposite the New York Public Library. Short walk with our cases from the hotel waited for about 15mins hopped on the bus arrived at the terminal 45 mins later. Really wish I knew this for out journey into Manhattan. See photo’s for the sign details. Thats all folks.......

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: jazzzabell
Reviews.Content: All seemed to be going well ................ We'd managed to find our room on our own, been off sight seeing, exhausted ourselves twice over and had a good couple of nights sleep. UNTIL a cockroach scuttled across the carpet in front of me ! My partner swiftly became the newly appointed "roach catcher" and was sent under the bed after the unwanted guest. After crouching on all fours for a few minutes with a glass and a postcard this tittle was quickly stripped from him. I called the front desk to alert them of the situation and was informed someone would be up. However Mr Roach escaped underneath the door and having seen the back of him i hoped it may just be a "one off ". Unfortunately i was wrong ! I decided it would be best to stay away from the floor, for fear of having his twin brother race over my feet and up my leg, which would have cause somewhat of a panic, so i sat on the bed. As i lay back, what crossed my line of sight but a more adventurous roach that had decided to crawl up the wall and was mincing around in the corner above my head ! My partner with his recently stripped tittle suggested that this was his opportunity to regain some of his lost masculinity. "PHAH !" I exclaimed , grabbing the glass and postcard from his hand and balancing on the bed. In one swift swoop i had captured "Rocky the Roach" and chucked him into the ice bucket, at that moment the maintenance man turned up and i proudly presented him with my catch of the day. He told me that the room had only be renovated a couple of weeks previous. It seemed pointless to move rooms for a night, so with our fingers crossed we stuck it out. Apart from this experience the stay was ok, the beds were comfortable, the room clean and the staff friendly enough .

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel worst staff WORST experience”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to New York City with my girlfriend and stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel. Overwhelmed with excitement we entered this hotel with a smile. At the check-in desk we were greeted SO RUDELY. I guess this hotel has so much history that they can treat guests poorly and get away with it. My girlfriend and I had dinner at the hotel. We stood there waiting for 10 minutes watching the waiters just stare at us so we eventually decided to seat ourselves. Another 10 minutes passed and a waiter passed by and said "I don't think you'll be drinking any wine or ordering anything expensive so I'll direct you to the main meals in the menu." Throughout our meal waiters would continuously interrupt us to take away our chairs, take away our table salts and sauces, TOOK OUR NAPKINS, and place them on the tables of businessmen who I guess they thought had more money???? After this beautiful $100 charged meal we went to our hotel room to find we have no bins, one towel, no bins, no toilet paper and a busted television with no reception. It was absolutely terrible. I went straight to the computer to email some documents that needed to be sent, to find we have to pay for Internet? Stupid me I took notice of the hotel's Internet wireless access guarantee, and instead had to pay $110 for 6 days of Internet. With sick family members it was important for me to ring home. Now I can understand hotels charge high for International calls but I was NEVER told I would be charged $18.60 for a phone call even if no one answers!! I called home multiple times with no answer. Altogether only two calls were made from our hotel room, and our grand total was $170.... Fantastic. Icing on the cake had to be the concierge when I went down to ask if he could reconfirm my hotel-airport transfer. Guess what he said? He said "No, you have a phone in your room, go do it yourself".... When it came to leaving the hotel the doorman didn't help us with out bags instead we heard him say to his fellow staff member who saw us struggling "don't bother with them, they're leaving they don't have easy access to their wallet to tip us..." We've travelled around the world and this has been by far the worst hotel experience so far. I beg you never to stay at this hotel. Only stay here iif you wish to be amused at the amazing lack of service and would love to get into arguments with staff on a daily basis!!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt go back”
Reviews.Author: T N
Reviews.Content: I was there for 3 nights. Entrance was lovely but omg it took forever to find my room on the 11th floor. i got so lost and was all hot and flustered carrying 2 suitcases, a back pack and duty free. I finally found the room, literally after 10 mins of going up and down the long hallways and long arms off it and was so dissappointed. It was sooo outdated, brown and orange carpet with matching curtains, a view of a brick wall and peeling wall paper. the bath looked as if it had never been cleaned so although i was looking forward to a bath - I didnt have one. I had one of those rooms that had a door that can be opened if a large family say. Mine was closed off but was scary as two very loud scary soudning men speaking in foreign langueges were next to it and kept pulling on the door trying to open it, at random times like 2am and it would wake me up. it was paper thin i could hear them peeing and number 2'ing even! I was so scared and it happened every night. I felt so depressed staying there I dreaded going back to sleep each night. I would never stay there again. also the reception staff are so rude. I did get room service tho one nite and it was really yummy. It wasnt as close to time sqaure as I had hoped either - it was a good 10 min walk. I paid $185 for a room. where I am from..that gets you a really really fancy room. I felt like i was poor and had paid for the cheapest motel there was.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous stay and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: adqr3421
Reviews.Content: I am astounded that a person could actually say that this place has a “Phenomenal ambience." Worst hotel ever. If I could give it 0 stars I would. Bed bugs, disgusting tiny rooms, horrible rude staff and long waits to check in. The bellman actually stormed into my room (despite my objections), turned on the lights, started to open my suitcase, then tried to demand a trip. This after waiting 25 minutes to check in. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy but Classy”
Reviews.Author: LuckyJoanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel a week before Christmas. Needless to say, the entire city was bustling and full of visitors. However, the staff at the Roosevelt Hotel was very nice, and I didn't feel as if I was being rushed at any point in the check in or check out process. The room itself was very clean, which is my top priority. We had a King Bed that was very comfortable to sleep in, and enough floor space to walk around in. The bathroom was typical New York - super tiny! The bathroom door didn't even open all the way before it hit the toilet. The fixtures could have used some updating, but it wasn't something that bothered me too much. We were lucky to be travelling before Christmas, since the lobby had gorgeous decorations and a lovely Christmas tree. The old grandeur really made me feel like I was visiting a classic New York destination. Even the lobby bar was fun to visit! The location of the hotel is probably its biggest asset. We were a few minutes walking distance away from all the tourist destinations, and of course all the shopping on Madison and 5th avenues. The only negative to the great location was the scarsity of cabs - we had to struggle with flagging one down, and eventually we relied on the subway when we had that option. Overall: Perfect location, clean rooms, and a gorgeous lobby make this hotel worth the price, hence my 5 star rating. It isn't a 5 star hotel on all scales, but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best Expresso Martini in NYC”
Reviews.Author: JTravels23
Reviews.Content: Before you do anything, have Eddie make you an Expresso Martini at the Madison Club Lounge. If you're daring, have two! By far the best expresso martini in NYC. The lobby is classy and elegant. The staff is friendly and always ready to help. Rooms are clean. I always request a corner room and it seems to be more spacious. If you have the opportunity to book your room w/breakfast, I would highly recommend doing so. The breakfast is great! Lots of food, great quality. I've stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel several times and look forward to going back soon! Cheers to future travelers! And cheers to Eddie!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Neighbours”
Reviews.Author: vixandmatt
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a four night stay at The Roosevelt Hotel. The location is excellent but I largely agree with the other comments. When you walk into the lobby for the first time it really is amazing but upon reaching our room - which was on the 9th floor, it was all a bit of a anti climax as the room did not meet the same standards as the lobby below. It was clean and fine for what we needed but could do with a spruce up and the bath was a bit chipped and dated. The walls were paper thin and we had an earful of the couple next door until 4 in the morning two nights in row. It was hit and miss with reception, we asked them to print out a booking confirmation email but were told the hotel didn't have email and were directed to a room with a computer built in the 80's and a cronky old printer, we put our cc details in and the computer promptly crashed. My partner was getting quite irate at this point and went back to reception to demand for the manager who surprise surprise received our email and printed the confirmation straight away. We then overheard them telling another hotel guest they did not have email and directed him to the cronky old printer, needless to stay my partner intervened! I think the bottom line is If you are looking for somewhere to just crash at night and you aren't going to be spending too much time in the room then it's fine but if you want luxury then it doesnt live up to its 4* status.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal ambience & experience”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend a day in the city, visit the museum - enjoy the city for a change instead of rushing back home. Called the Roosevelt Hotel and received a great rate, beautiful room and check-in was absolutely the best ever. Very courteous, friendly and a 10+! The room was just the right size, did not require a lot of space since I wasn't planning on moving in...but to lay my head and relax and unwind after a full day - it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lobby, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: RogerandPeggy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Presidents'Day weekend as part of a USAir packaged trip. My wife and I have stayed here several times before and always found their "cozy room" small but adequate.Perhaps it was because of the package deal, but this room was absolutely tiny. We still enjoyed the rest of the hotel, particularly the bar/lobby area, and you can't beat the location. But be advised if you book a package deal. Also, at check-in they insisted we present a voucher (although we were clearly in their computer). As it turns out, we had a copy of the voucher, but I don't know what would have happened if we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Money...”
Reviews.Author: reneecx
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel for a quick 4-night visit to NYC.
