The first (Supreme King) room we were placed in was VERY small and did not even have a bureau in which to put our clothes. We immediately requested a different room and were moved to a much better option...nothing fancy, but clean and more spacious than many boutique hotels in the city... (must add, front desk "Alfredo" was very quick to move our room and do anything to insure we were very pleased with the second room.) All in all, a good location, beautiful lobby and decent (recently renovated) room. Drawbacks include small and dated bathroom, no in-room internet, tiny and out-of-date business center, and sub par concierge services. We booked this room for about $175 per night and feel that (compared to many NYC hotels) it was a nice hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Marcio1
Reviews.Content: Our last trip to New York we found a good rate (Wifi and Breakfast included) at Roosevelt. The early check in was not possible due a sold out period. The room was 18th and I understood all complaints about the hot temperature and think I found an issue, the air conditioning machine work well, but there's a problem with the curtains just below the air ducts. I just repositioned the curtains and problem solved. The best of this Hotel is the location and the staff that's is wonderful. The Full Breakfast was very good. The only one complain is about the in room safe not wall mounted.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: vs2012
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel back in January. Supposedly the hotel is under renovation. I stayed in a room that wasn't renovated, was quite dated in fact. The smell in the room was musty, the gym was ancient. Overall the hotel does not deserve at 4 star rating. The location, however is excellent. I stay in New York every 2 weeks at 4 star hotels and I can tell you that this one does not compare favorably.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but......”
Reviews.Author: Larkers85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early February 2012. I was dreading arriving at the place, based on some other reviews here. I think I can summerise the place by saying; amazing mid-town location (right next to Grand Central), cheap as chips for New York, but ultimately you can't polish a turd. Sure, the rooms have been refurbished but the place is just not all up together. There's a 1" gap between the bottom of the door and the carpet. That makes the room noisy. The aircon/heater must be 30 years old, and it's noisy. The bathroom was new, but the tub wasn't - it was chipped and cracked and looked tatty. The safe was missing the front panel and the batteries to operate it. I was only there for 1 night so it didn't really matter. If I wanted to see New York with my family "on the cheap" it's probably a good option. As a business traveller I'd spend a few more pennys at one of the nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely building & staff, great location just needs some tweaks...”
Reviews.Author: Derbyclarky
Reviews.Content: My friend, myself & our 2 daughters have just returned from 5 days at this hotel. It is in a great location, 2 minutes from 5th Avenue, 5 mins from Empire State & Grand Central. The hotel itself is beautiful, they are in the middle of renovations so part of the lobby is shut off & it's quite noisy, but as we only noticed walking in & out of the hotel it wasn't a big deal. The hotel put our rooms close together & were perfect, the beds were SO comfy, free safe, nice clean bathroom, the only problem in our room was a large damp patch under the window that had the wallpaper peeling. There is a buffet breakfast that was lovely but at $26 per adult and half price for kids was a tad steep. They have a coffee bar that unfortunately only runs at certain times of the day & is a bar in the evening, we found the (tall) barman to be quite rude when we were waiting to buy as he couldn't drag himself away from the business men at the bar to serve us. The doorman also left us to drag our suitcases through doors we were struggling to open whilst he chatted on his mobile... The concierge recommended at Italian for dinner 2 minutes walk west, Naples 45, which had lovely lasagne & pizza it was very noisy & atmospheric & you could regularly feel the subway rumbling below. We booked to see Chicago & ate at Teds Montana Grill, we also had a bar meal at Trump Towers with the girls drinking virgin cocktails which was very reasonable. If you have daughters take them to Serendipity 3 for frozen hot chocolate! We had a fabulous trip that was over too soon.

Reviews.Title: “New York”
Reviews.Author: Sjr_1972
Reviews.Content: On the plus side the location is fantastic, near Grand Central, Times Square, Rockefellar Centre you can walk everywhere. On the downside the hotel is tired, even with the refurb. The 'first' room we had was on the third floor at the front of the building and very noisy, you hear the traffic outside and the walls are paper thin you could litterally hear a sneeze in the next room as well as everything else - not ideal travelling with Children!!!!!!! The in room safe did not work and when we asked for a move to a room with a safe that worked I was told the hotel was full and I could not move no apology just a typical so what response! I had also been in contact with the hotel in advance and promised free Wifi when I asked at reception they knew nothing about it and again very abrupt and rude as if I was a liar. I returned the next morning with blackberry in hand with the email with the confirmation and the receptionist was disappointed to say the least when proved wrong. I was always very polite and appreciate this is perhaps the New York way but it really was not as outside the hotel everyone we met was friendly and polite and put most of the hotel staff to shame. On our second morning the bathroom roof had a leake and water was pouring thru the ceiling into the light fitting. The staff were much better this time and arranged another room an inconvenience to pack and move but this one was at the back of the building and much quieter - We actually slept which was a bonus! New York was fantastic, I would go back in a heartbeat but Roosevelt would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: AllanWood
Reviews.Content: We booked at the hotel for the 29th December 2011. Upon arriving at the hotel we were impressed by the doorman and the lobby and checking in was easy and uneventful. So what was the problem just beware see below: The conciege service are rude unhelpful and a rip off (when i questioned a price for justification the servive agent replied I don't know what you can get it for but thats my price). The guy who in front of me wanted to borrow a sheet from the book to show his family sitting next to the desk was told get them to come up here. When going out of the hotel leave 10 minutes earlier as that is how long it will take you to get a lift. Baware of the bathroom the water is brown and stinks of extrement, I didn't shower whilst i was there it was horrendous. On a good note the doorman and bell staff could not be more helpful, if you are looking for help ask them they are the best option. We would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms with little/no AC”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice (not by my choice) and each time it is the same problem. There is no AC in the hallways and the rooms do not have control of their AC. Often it is cooler outside than in the room and thus you have to leave the windows open all of the time. The rooms are very small and you can touch opposite walls if you extend your arms. They allow the Pakistanis to smoke despite smoking not being allowed in the hotel. This is most likely because the "Pakistani interests" own a share of the hotel. I would never stay here if I had a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel NYC”
Reviews.Author: wegougo
Reviews.Content: With the many options for midtown Manhattan, I wouldn't pick this hotel again. The rooms are very dated, and the bathrooms tiny. The heat was on all night, way to hot, and you couldn't shut if off. It's a beautiful old building, but needs an update. For the price you can do much better at other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: DWLLakeDistrict
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time my husband and I have stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel, its in a great location, has a wonderful bar/lobby area, however on this occasion our delux room was extremely disappointing. The bathroom was tired and shabby, the shelf to stand your toiletries on was insufficient and unsteady, the air conditioning unit in the room was virtually unuseable, we reported that the heat in the room was overbearing and this was sorted out. However I did ask to be moved to another room but this could not be accommodated due to the hotel being full. I understand that the hotel is in the middle of refurbishment and has to keep running, however should it not be offering some sort of discounted rates for the tired/worn out rooms? I shall not be staying here on our next visit and won't recommend the hotel to anyone else. The barmen as always were very good, especially Homero.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect "US" time!!”
Reviews.Author: MissLisa7168
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to NYC in January '12 for my Christmas present. We stayed at The Roosevelt & it was wonderful! Old time classic! The lobby was beautiful! Our upgraded room was not ready when we arrived but the bellhop staff were wonderful helping us with the luggage. The hotel is so very close to all of the attractions especially to Grand Central. We were able to moe through the city like we lived there! The staff was wonderful!! The front desk, concierge, bell staff, housekeeping, and the bar in the lobby. And what a special treat to have a plate of fruit waiting in our room for us!! We highly recommend and would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good value for money but a little dated. Great for our girly trip.”
Reviews.Author: LadyKeys
Reviews.Content: Some staff were really helpful, others not so much. The hotel is good for the money in a great location bang opposite grand central station so perfect for getting around but most places within walking distance. Rooms need updating, bathroom especially but generally was ok for us as we only slept there. Only gripe really was the noise from outside as window very thin & for a city that never sleeps it kept some of us awake along with the snoring!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New York Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Clemsun
Reviews.Content: LOVE the Roosevelt! It's conveniently located near the city attractions and transportation (times square, broadway, shopping, grand central...). The ambience and the character of the historic building makes all the difference vs staying in a "chain". The staff was helpful, we were able to get a grab and go ny bagel and coffee, or have a seat and take our time before we tore off into the city for shopping and sightseeing. We've stayed here 2x and will continue to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rayan B
Reviews.Content: The location was very central and from where time sqare and central park zoo is very near. But the hotel was extremely congested and the rooms were far too small except a few. The service was ok but the bathroom was very small and the bathtub was not big enough and it had cracks on it. The only thing that was good was the bed which was quite large and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Hot & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Sandy317
Reviews.Content: The room was boiling hot and barely cooled off with the window open; the walls are thin and the couple next door was loud; only the price was good. Wouldn't want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Lynnemul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov,2010 for five nights,loved the location . Hotel was nice and clean,staff very friendly,would go back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location A+++”
Reviews.Author: Denise80UK
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms with ample space 'no tea & coffee facilities which was a mino inconvenience and not allowed to take hot drinks to the room from the bar' But Cafe directly opposite the hotel - So no bother really,,, Most comfortable beds ever --- Would strongly recommend staying here :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: JelyBeanCG
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Roosevelt with some girlfriends. The location was convenient to everywhere we needed to be. The rooms were a good size for NYC. Everything was clean for the most part (a little mildew in the showers). The beds were very comfortable. All of the employees were friendly and helpful. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “New York New York I can understand why they named it twice!”
Reviews.Author: jones_212
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel. Room is very basic but if its only a place to lay your head at the end of a long exciting day this is the place to stay.Very Clean Very Very helpful staff excellent location,beautiful building. Cannot recommend it enough. Will definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled149
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on several occasions and never been disappointed. Great Location. Lovely rooms. Fantastic service.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Packed 5 day's in New York lovely hotel & base.”
Reviews.Author: xoxnicolaxox
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 1.30pm and were checked in streight away, the lady at reception tried telling us that we had to pay 100USD as a deposit on the room for any breakages & internet usage which I refused to pay as our tour operator did'nt tell us about this. She replied with "I'll inform the manager" & then gave us a free upgrade :/ I'm not sure if it was an upgrade or not... We went to our room which I was assuming would be small (most reviews say this) but to my suprise it was a bigger room than what was in the hotel we stayed in at Heathrow! The bed was hugeeeeeeeeeeeee & very comfortable, more than enough room for 2 people. The wardrobe was lacking coat hangers we had about 7 between us. The bathroom was a decent size. There was a shelf which all of our cosmetics fitted on, the shower was very powerful which was great, the bath wasnt very big though! The room's could have done with tea and coffee facilities. TV worked fine & the safe was free which I felt was a nice added extra. Also whenever we were waiting for a lift one always turned up within 2 minuites. All the staff were friendly apart from one of the bell boy's, on the last day I asked if he could get our suitcases for us which were being stored in a cupboard about 2 meters from where we were sitting and he did so but then stood there waiting for a tip for about 5 minuites & then he actually asked me for one! I said I only had a 20 which was true and he muttered something to me. All in all we had a lovely trip to NYC and will definatly return to The Roosevelt, it's in a brilliant location & we could always find our way back to it thanks to a Mc Donalds flag!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scotlowry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while ago but never been back since!! Room was very small for us ( family). We complained about the army of ants twice,crawling across the bedside table and guess what,no response. Also told reception at checkout and they couldn't have cared less!! Fortunately this has not been my experience ever in the U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Snapplegirl68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel on 1/23, having booked the room through Hotwire. When I went to check in, I was told that there was no reservation for me in the system. While they tried to sort the matter out, they gave me a voucher for the hotel bar. By the time I had finished my drink, the problem had been solved and I was able to check in. My room was lovely! I've stayed in many hotels, but I must say this was one of the nicest I've ever been in. It wasn't just the decor, or the fact that the hotel was just renovated; it was also the staff, from Clara at the front desk to Eddie at the hotel bar. Everyone was so friendly and courteous. And believe me, that makes a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location is PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: dizy5150
Reviews.Content: We stayed for ten days arriving New Years Day. We purchased a last minute deal through expedia. We paid around $1200 for 9 days, an incredible price for NYC. The hotel lobby is gorgeous. This is the 12th time we have been to NY in the past 10 years. Our room was one of the updated rooms; however, we too had peeling wallpaper, rusted fixtures. Our radiator also made noises ALL night long. There is no counter space in the bathroom. The electrical sockets are hard to get to. We had to buy an extension cord to accommodate our electrical devices. We placed a bathroom down on the desk to make shift some space for our sundries, etc. Not enough drawer space for two people; however we had a large closet so we left one suitcase open and left our things in there. Overall this room is larger than most hotels in NY but it would be a little tight for 4 people. There were just the two of us and we got two beds so we had additional space to either spread out or sleep. The beds are to die for you just melt in them as far as sleeping, extremely comfortable and cozy. The pillows were very very uncomfortable I awoke with a headache every morning :-( Try the "Chickpea" mini diner next door, you will not be disappointed, very reasonable prices. We also ate at Cosi a few mornings. We saw food deliveries during the night which we would try next time, very convenient. The location was awesome walking distance one block to Grand Central Station which you can take the "S" subway directly to Time Square. If this is your first visit to NYC do not be afraid of taking the subways, they are totally safe and are all part of the experience. Numerous times we walked over to Time Squares, and we are a older couple. Definitely a plus to stay at this hotel, every close to all the posh shopping too. You will not be disappointed. We will definitely be back to the Roosevelt. BTW they serve Starbucks coffee, and pastries in the bar area every morning (for a fee), very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Mid Town Gem, Great Value In Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Shiv L
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to New York for a three day getaway which turned out to be a freezing cold, wintery, windy weekend. Staying at the Roosevelt proved to be just the right thing in this weather. You could zip anywhere in a short walk. We landed at LGA, checked in and were in line at the TKTS booth in times square within one our of our flight landing. The hotel is perfectly situated for people like us, who wanted to wander midtown and shop, be near MoMA, 5th avenue and the UN (where we need to do some work, and were able to do so in walking distance!). At the same time, we wanted it to be easy to meet friends in the West Village and SoHo, and grabbing a cab from here or walking a few blocks to the subway was a breeze. We had a great deal on this booking from priceline and we were shocked with the value of our room. We had a beautiful king size renovated room, that stayed warm and cozy despite the bristling temperatures. Though we were on the 4th floor you couldn't hear a thing from the street. We live in an urban centre and we felt like we were staying in a quiet town! The beauty and history of the hotel are well worth the visit. And yes, there is no coffee in the room and no free wi-fi, but so what? There are a million wonderful cafe's close by from Pret A Manger, to the Cosi cafe right across the street, with delicious breakfast, wifi, and fabulous service. If you want great value and great experience, I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite place!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayAddict2012
Reviews.Content: EVERYTIME I hit NYC... I stay here. It is old glamour. The foyer, the ambience and the staff are truly wonderful. It is a great location, within ten strides to Grand Central. The Midtown area is safe for us girls, and clean, with plenty of great bars. The BEDS? I know that you don't go to NYC to sleep... but they are heaven, heaven, heaven. Some people say that the hotel rooms are slightly scruffy, but they are clean, and well cared for. You may see the odd corner of wallpaper unattached from the wall... But who cares! It is just charming. The breakfasts are yummy, and if you don't want to eat there... Grand Central has all you could want and more! MY only annoyance is that when you get there you have to lug your bags up quite a few steps. I am sure if you were to ask the concierge, they would help. but having stayed here five times this has never happened. It has always been tourists, or friendly silver haired gentlemen that have come to my aide. The Roosevelt... WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denibeck
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Hotwire and got a great deal on the rate. By NYC standards, this place was great. The room was large enough and comfortable enough for four of us. When we first arrived, the room wasn't ready but they checked our baggage for us and called my cell phone as soon as we were able to access the room. It is conveniently located and the overall service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Tazam0827
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a beautiful hotel from the roaring 20s and it retains some of its charm from that era. The lobby if beautifully retained, the staff is friendly, and we got a good rate of $175 for a Saturday night stay. That said, it still needs some work. We had a "Superior" room that was smaller than expected... Given that the room level below "Superior" is called "Cozy", but ten again is in keeping with the 20's feel. The bathroom needed to be updated and there was peeling wallpaper in the hallway. But the worst part was the room radiator that made such a racket that we nearly jumped out of our skin when it turned on every hour and a half throughout the night. Obviously, it needs to be bled. If you do go, don't stay in room 681 :). I'm assuming their other rooms are better

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: Pashworth1
Reviews.Content: Location of Hotel perfect for mid-town and location to Grand Central, reception area of Hotel perfect, felt you were some were that cared. The rooms average but comfortable. Although I understand that the hotel rooms are currently being refurbished, they had not got to the 7th floor by the time of my stay. Would recommend if you are budget conscience!

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC Location”
Reviews.Author: hamil249
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt on our recent NYC visit and were pleased with our stay. You can't beat the location. They were filming a movie while we were staying there which was fun. The hotel is older but has character. Our rooms were very comfortable. The rooftop bar offered great views; however I was disappointed when we ordered a bottle of wine and were provided with plastic cups. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, Grand Hotel, It was just a little tired looking.”
Reviews.Author: justinw1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed in june of 2011. Got reasonable price through priceline. Room was ok, smallish, bed comfortable, everything just seemed a little old and even tatty. It is however a grand hotel with a nice feel to it. Have heard they are spending money tarting it up, so Im sure it will be a nicer stay for those in the future. I would recomend this place to friends, it is what it is... and feels to me like what staying in old school NY... would have been like. Has a great rooftop bar... Mad 46 and starbucks coffee in the very elegant lobby. The lobby bar is ok too!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roblady
Reviews.Content: I and two friends who have never been to N/Y before stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. After some of the bad reviews i was anxious as i had no problems from the previous hotels i had stayed at before. Had a quick check in by a very pleasant and polite gentleman who told me i had been upgraded to a king size room (thankyou) The room was on the 4th floor and appeared to be an refurbished room. The room was facing a road and i heard the trash men every morning, along with traffic. As i,m a light sleeper this disdurbed me every morning, but hey ho, we were in the city that never sleeps! Very clean, quick check at the bed revealed no evidence of bed bugs. Lovely fluffy towels which were replaced daily, air con, perfect, heating perfect, tv, only one channel which was too blurred to watch, but i wasnt in the room long enough to watch it. Only gripe was that the room safe did not work. I went to reception and was told that i had to be in the room for it to be rectified. As i wasnt in the room long enough i didnt bother as i placed my passport, ect, in my friends room safe. We didnt eat in the hotel but saw some of the meals which looked nice. We had a few cocktails in the bar which werent cheap $14, but they were a good size and boy did they have a kick! Watch out for the surcharge which is added, it can really bump the bill up. The hotel is situated in an ideal spot, just a short walk to times square and Grand Central. Yes it does look old fashioned , but its supposed to! I would defo go back to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations for a fun trip to NYC!”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel5485
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent rate of $100 on Hotwire.com for the 3.5* Roosevelt Hotel on January 13-16. I went with 3 of my girlfriends to shop and just have fun. The Roosevelt Hotel exceeded our expectations for a place to crash at night. The rooms were clean and quite large by NYC standards. They rooms were dated, but we didn't care - were only there to sleep. Beds and pillows were comfortable! The Hotel lobby was beautiful. From the minute we arrived, we were taken care of. The bellman took our luggage and met us in the lobby where we checked in. We arrived 2 hours early so they held our luggage for us so that we could go ahead and do touristy things. Our room was on the 5th floor. We did not have much of a view nor did we hear any street noise. There is a Wells Fargo right down the road in case you need to go to an ATM. Also, go out the back door of the hotel and walk 2 blocks toward Times Square - we had breakfast at Food World (convenience store)/Dunkin Donuts every morning. This worked out great as we were on our way to Times Square to catch the Grayline Tour Bus, which I also highly recommend. One night when we returned to the hotel, we had no clean towels. No problem though as there was a maid on our floor who gave us towels. The only complaint that I have is that when I went to check out I was greeted with a $30 breakfast charge, which I did not incur. I disputed the charge and the lady just looked at me. I expected her to push buttons to remove the charge, but she did not. Finally, after standing there and staring at her for a bit, I requested an itemized receipt of charges to my room. She seemed annoyed, but eventually gave me the printout. When we left, we were going to take a cab back to LGA, but the hotel had its own car that was $35 flat rate to LaGuardia. We lucked up with this! All in all, the Roosevelt Hotel exceeded my expectations for this trip! If you can get a good rate on it, I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Montana_Rustler
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in the Roosevelt Hotel in January 2012 as we were booked there using Hotwire (with hotel name hidden). We paid $109 plus tax for a total of $620. For some reason we were given a room with a king size bed, which was great. The bed was very comfortable with a down comforter. The room could use some minor refurbishing, but it was adequate. It did have some peeling paint in the bathroom and the carpet was a little shabby. Had a 32" flat screen TV. The bathroom was also adequate; it had a shelf for our toiletry kits. No coffee maker; but it did have a hair dryer. The room was clean as far as we could tell. We checked for signs of bedbugs and didn't find any (a earlier post on Trip Advisor mentioned bedbugs so we were very leery, but found no sign of them). There was some traffic noise on the 8th floor, but it was not too annoying; our room was not on main street though. It was very cold (low 20's F) & windy for 2 days, and the room heater struggled somewhat to keep that part of the room warm enough. We did not eat at the restaurant in the hotel. The best thing about the Roosevelt is the location and the price. Together these two factors make it a good value. We were able to walk to many places nearby such as Times Square, the Empire State building etc. The hotel is a very short walk from Grand Central Station so the subway lines are about 5 minutes away. We also found a great mix of places to eat within a couple of blocks of the Roosevelt. We didn't pay for the Internet at the Roosevelt, as we went around the block to the Barnes and Noble/Starbucks for a free wireless connection. All-in-all, we will have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Timmy5565
Reviews.Content: Stayed on floor they chose based on being told, ' it's a smoking floor but the rooms are still quite nice.' They ended up comping us $100 and moving us to another one ont he same floor after finding that the uninhabitable hovel they tried to put us in had 1)no knobs on the desk drawers, 2) totally unidentifiable stains on the radiator, 3) something sticky on the carpeted floor, 4) a bathroom door that wouldn't close properly, let alone lock. The second room was much better by comparison but was missing the carpet from the baseboard, strange stains all about and neither room had entirely working cable, including no access to NBC for the entire weekend. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocrity is Your Best Hope”
Reviews.Author: Offseason
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is a HUGE hotel in the middle of Manhattan. Pros: Great location, decent rates compared to other hotels, moderately quiet, somewhat of a known commodity. Cons: The huge hotel is somewhat soulless, it's old and has been under some sort of refurbishment forever, it's more of a big 3 star as opposed to a true 4 star. The bottom line, if you can get a good rate, it serves its purpose. You should be out seeing New York or doing some business instead of staying in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Property needs work on guest rooms”
Reviews.Author: JV101
Reviews.Content: Allegedly the hotel is embarking on a multi-million dollar campaign to upgrade and renovate the guest rooms. I sure hope so because it is surely needed. I stayed at the Roosevelt for business last month for 5 nights and the quality and cleanliness of the room left a lot to be desired. Peeling paint, stains on the carpet, outdated and tiny bathroom, and multiple light fixtures that were not working. All this for about $340 a night. Linens and towels were clean but I didn't even want to sit my suitcase on the floor or in the closet because of the look of the carpet, dust, and stray hair I saw. Hotel staff was generally unresponsive and acted like they could care less about the guest. Front desk agents in particular were curt and unaccomodating. On a positive note-- the workout room on the ground floor was large and spacious--- lots of weight and fitness machines and open 24 hours. The hotel is also just a block from Grand Central Station so catching a train or subway anywhere is quick and easy. This is a 3 star hotel at best. Nowhere near a 4.

Reviews.Title: “"I'll be at the Roosevelt"”
Reviews.Author: BogdanaVoicu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Roosevelt at the end of October, during my birthday trip to New York and I absolutely loved it. I had a corner suite with a view on Madison and 46. I was curious to see how the hotel felt, especially after seeing it featured in "Mad Men", where the main character says, "I'll be at the Roosevelt". Indeed, when you enter in that beautiful lobby, you feel the class of a long-gone era. The position is great... steps away from the Grand Central, for those who like public transportation. For those like me, who prefer the "walking + taxi" combo, it was great. I walked everywhere - to Central Park for jogging, to Rockefeller Centre, to Broadway for my show and only took a cab to go see the 9/11 Memorial. To answer to the few negative comments below... Yes, the bathroom is small, but it's clean. It's not a modern room, but the beds are new and it is really spacious, not only by New York standards. The service was excellent and the front desk staff extremely nice and polite. I have been working in travel business for 10 years and I have no reserve to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights in December”
Reviews.Author: deepc7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideal for a short break in New York City. My wife and I traveled in December, a few days before Christmas. Although we reached the hotel late in the evening, the staff were quite courteous. Check in was smooth and was done in a jiffy, which really helped since we were tired after a long flight. I chose the hotel because of its proximity to Grand Central Station. Grand Central is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, even when you are carrying luggage. The location is great. Most major NYC attractions are not more than 10 mins away from the hotel. Our room was on the 13th floor, and it was comfortable and spacious by NYC standards. The toilets were spacious too with hot water 24 hours. The hotel is always buzzing with activity, especially the bar in the lobby area. Great place to get a drink! Strongly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay In New York”
Reviews.Author: Rfoti
Reviews.Content: My daughter in law and daughter went with me on a short 2 day shopping trip the day after Thanksgiving 2011. We had a great two night stay, the hotel was friendly, room was comfortable, very convenient to everything we wanted to do, which was to shop!! Staff was very nice and helpful, and the breakfast was awesome. The best omlet maker I have ever met, in fact going to breakfast in the hotel was one of the things we enjoyed the most!!! We walked everywhere except took a train down to China Town which was a short ride, and Grand Central was a couple of blocks from the hotel. I would stay there again, it was a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would come again.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1991
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful, the service was fast. The rooms are clean, not to spacious but I dont think many hotel rooms in manhatten are. We stayed here in the summer, and the air con was very good. The hotel is in walking distance to the main attractions. You are right across the street from grand central station, which is fairly easy to use, if you decide to visit the boroughs or surrounding areas. I would certainly stay here again and would recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel - Great Hotel but beware of hidden fees for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: jsabatini
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business meeting/convention. The hotel its self is beautiful and the staff is helpful - however if you are staying for a convention and have material to store with the bell staff or need it taken from your car to the bell staff or delivered from the bell staff to the ballroom be warned - they charge fees for this: $20.00 to have the Doorman unload your car $10.00 to have Doorman store your materials with the hotel $10.00 to have Bell Staff deliver your stored material that you already paid for to be stored to a location other than the lobby All this before a tip is given so its was more like: $30.00 to have the Doorman unload your car $15.00 to have Doorman store your materials with the hotel $15.00 to have Bell Staff deliver your stored material that you already paid for to be stored to a location other than the lobby When asked if I could charge this to my room so I can expense it since it was a business trip- the answer was no. So my question was is this a hotel charge or a staff charge - didn't get a answer. It's a lovely hotel - good food and close to everything just beware of the hidden fees

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value for money”
Reviews.Author: Liam T
Reviews.Content: We only paid £550pp for flights and 5 nights in this fantastic hotel. upon arrival we got a free upgrade to a king room at check-in (which took less than 5 mins), the rooms are amazing they are big enough for 4 people have all the accessories you would expect, are cleaned daily and the beds are comfy. As for location it is almost perfect only a 5min walk from times square and only 10mins from central park but far enough away that there is no noise from the busy streets at night. Cant wait to go back next year and have recommended it to everyone I've met who is thinking of going to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, but near Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: m4rcla
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel "accidentally" through Priceline; I meant to book a different hotel but used the wrong strategy and ended up getting this hotel. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, I made sure to call the hotel to ask if I could request a renovated room. They said they will put the request in, but it's not guaranteed. The hotel location was actually pretty good-- just a couple blocks (albeit long blocks) away from Grand Central station. When we checked in, I re-inquired to make sure that we would get a renovated room, and they said it should be no problem. Check in time was 3 PM, and we did get a renovated room, thankfully, although it still looked pretty old. The bedroom was ok size for New York, but the room felt dry, was very dark, and there was not enough air circulation. The bathroom was really small and basic, and didn't look renovated. Overall I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you have to pay full price - even by getting a cheaper price from Priceline, I still didn't think it was worth it and will definitely choose other hotels when visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: Other reviews had me somewhat concerned - but in the end I was quite satisfied with our stay. We had one of the renovated rooms which had two newer doubles that were comfortable, smaller flat screen tv that was fine too. Room size was slightly bigger than some other Midtown rooms I've been in before. Bathroom was a half-reno, new sink but old tub and tile - but water pressure was good. Did the requisite strip of bed sheets to check mattress, boxspring and headboard for bedbugs and all were clean - no problems for us. Window opens which is nice for air - NY air - but still at least outside air. No coffee maker. No free wi-fi. Paper cups, not glass. Great location walk, everywhere in Midtown. Didn't use room service or restaurants. Parked in a garage one block south on 44th for $45/day. Difficult to approach hotel because of no right turns on pretty much all streets during afternoon - best approach is to turn west onto 45th from 3rd Ave. This will save you many minutes. Staff seemed normal - some cheerier than others - but no complaints. Overall an acceptable hotel for our family excursion to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by their beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: Judy6963
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel on multiple occassions for business since it is one of only 3 approved properties for my compnay. This last trip there however is my last! I paid for a Deluxe room that was anything BUT. The bathroom like in all of their rooms is so small that if you are overweight you woudln't be able to shut the door while using the facilities. The room was supposedly renovated in the last year but all they did was fill in the paint chips on the wall and install a flat screen TV that is too small for the space. There is a desk in the room but power outlets are on the other side of the room so it is useless for work. The heater was broken all 3 nights and the maintenance crew had to be called to my room each night to manually shut it off. The cable was out for one night with no update, no apology and no credit to the account. Finally when it came time to check out I had to wait in line since they don't believe in easy check out with a pre-printed bill. The only nice part of the hotel is their beautiful lobby but that is where the beauty begins and ends!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: mrmfield21
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in New York so I decided splashing out was in order! I was pleasantly surprised by how easy to find the hotel was, on the corner of Madison Avenue and East 45th Street and a stones throw from Grand Central Terminal! Check in was a breeze and very friendly, in Fact when I said it was my first time in New York the Lady on reception gave me some great advice on whee to go for lunch and what time to visit the museums ect before they filled up! My room was spacious and comfortable with a queen sized bed and clean, decent sized bathroom. I didn't take breakfast in the hotel, owing to the fact I like to get out and explore as early as I can. The hotel is a great place to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of dignified old NY glamour in the heart of the Diamond District”
Reviews.Author: MissDebonair
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and were incredibly privileged to be upgraded to a huge double suite, bigger than most people's family lounge rooms. The chandaliers in the lobby are over the top and everything about the property is dignified and glamorous in an old world sort of way. It's huge though, so you can feel wonderfully anonymous here. We loved the fact that you could walk up the street to Grand Central Station and dine in the Oyster Bar, or walk to the Empire State Building, or the NY Public Library, or to the Theatre District to catch a show, or Times Square to wonder at the neon and seething mass of humanity: All things we did and enjoyed immensely. The only downside was that there were no really good foodie places easily found in the area, but with some research ahead of time hat could probably be dealt with. I probably wouldn't stay here again, only because it's a bit too Great (rich) Aunt in style for me, but I was super excited to have that experience, and my husband and I enjoyed our stay immensely. It's the sort of hotel that everyone should treat their Mum to a stay in, if she's a traditionalist and you're seeking something extra special as a gift that she would cherish forever. I really wish I could have sent my Mum to stay in before she died. It is really that special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, grand, comfy bed, nice view”
Reviews.Author: DancingWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: My Fiancé and I stayed in this hotel for 1 week to celebrate his 30th birthday and we had a great time. Some of the hotel staff are not friendly but others are very, just depends who is there, it is a very big hotel with over 1000 rooms. Our room was clean, there were stains on the skirting board around the round and the tap was a bit loose but overall we were happy staying there. We had a nice view of the New York streets as we were on the 11 floor. The only this is you can hear the city bustle a lot. The police and ambulance sirens, cars and taxis but this is the result of being in the heart of the city. We loved our stay and and in February 2012 the hotel is being refurbished so we are looking forward to going back to see the changes. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful looking but very poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Samantha1978GY
Reviews.Content: My partner and i went to the Roosevelt over the Christmas and New Year period we was met by a beautiful looking hotel which went down hill along the way but great location. First they ask for $100 for incidentals which we was warned about and was not happy as the taxi from Newark Airport cost us $140 dollars and we was shafted DO NOT GET IN WITH A GUY CALLED MICHAEL, mixed race tall very short dark hair and will talk you socks off like a sales man it should of cost us $80 dollars but we was stupid and tired please please beware of the scammers, but back to the hotel they are not very friendly people try and save money by saying you don't need any help with the luggage or else you have to tip them as well. The room was medium sized but on the second day we had to move as the TV was crap and was very noisy you can hear car noise its so loud, we went to the 12th floor which was not as noisy but again the door has a large gap at the bottom and you hear all the doors slam and next door the rooms are very dated and worn, the only good thing in the room is the bed. Do not eat there as its very expensive at $26 dollars for a buffet breakfast to which you have to tip on top. New York is very very expensive but has some wonderful sights to see, so not all bad. Sam

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StaceyStandeven
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel over Christmas 23rd Dec- 29th Dec, 2 adults, our 16 year daughter and 13 year old son. Nice location, very close to grand central and a 5 min walk to other major attractions. The staff on reception were in a bad mood (Eduardo) but we bypassed that, lovely xmas decorations and other staff were pleasant, 'Evalynda'..was lovely and kept both our rooms so neat and clean.. I did request a nice view and connecting rooms if not next door to one another (I got neither) bathrooms not the best but they were fine. BUT we had a great time in new york and this was a lovely hotel to relax back to after a hard days pounding the streets of NYC, I would go back happily!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible doorman”
Reviews.Author: DanaF88
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was okay. The location is fantastic, close to everything cant beat it. The room was tiny especially the sink and bathroom. My boyfriend and I are very tall so the shower was difficult to use. The bed and room were clean even though there was hardly any space for our bags. The lobby felt like a sauna and so did our room. We had to put the AC on to sleep and it's January! What I found the most frustrating were the staff. There was a huge line for check out that was unorganized. The worst was waiting in line to have doorman hold our bags. Once we finally got to the front of the line, the bellhop asked us why we didn't tip him! Rude! We were planning on tipping once we got our bags back, but never in my life have I been asked to tip someone! Once we got our bags back hours later they rudely asked us to tip them again! The guy literally asked us why we didnt tip and stopped us as we were leaving. Completely inappropriate. Do not stay here unless you want to deal with rude employees.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: QueenMeerkat
Reviews.Content: The lobby is indeed spectacular, and the location is superb..... but it stops there. My first room smelt of damp, and I then got relocated to another room, which still smelt of damp, but the hotel staff tried to assure me it was because the staff had just cleaned the room?! The en suite bathroom was less than average.... and the staff gave the impression they were above their guests. All round..... I wouldn't bother, too many other hotels to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “Another fiine stay”
Reviews.Author: pjl52
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roosevelt many times. It was another pleasant stay of 3 days January 2-5, 2012. See my previous reviews of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: cassiehk
Reviews.Content: Location was great, only 5 min walk to grand central station, times square and rockefeller centre. But service at desk was sad. For the price you pay I would have expected free wifi in our room. We paid $50 for crappy internet. Lobby was pretty, rooms oldish but they are getting renovated. room location was good and heard no street noise.

Reviews.Title: “We had money stolen and the hotel done NOTHING”
Reviews.Author: jjdarcy20
Reviews.Content: This is just a quick review as I have left one before back in 2010, but I thought I would update people further with what happened to me and my girlfriend when we stayed here in Jan 2010. It was our second day of our holiday as we came for my girlfriends 21st birthday and I also planned on proposing whilst we were in NYC too and the holiday was going brilliantly. We went on a day trip to woodbury common and came back to find that someone had entered our room with a un-named key card and also tampered with our key coded safe and stole the remaining money we had left in there securely along with a mobile phone and the engagement ring for my girlfriend. The thieves took the money but left the mobile phone and the engagement ring inside the safe which to me if this was an ordinary thief I would imagine he would have taken the lot??? Anyway we contacted Security and also the NYPD. The hotel told us that they could not do anything and that they would have to go through insurance but we would 100% get our money back. We had to get money wired over which put us in debt when we got home and we ended up waiting months and constant calls and emails from england to New York continued until we got some answers. Finally the Insurance company emailed us and told us the hotel was not liable for "loss" and we received absolutely nothing. This was truly the worse time for me and my fiancee. This hotel cost us so much money and in no way was it helpful at all. I tried to contact them but they would just ignore my emails, everytime I called no one was there. What should have been a dream holiday and 21st birthday for my girlfriend turned into a nightmare she still gets upset about to this day. It took me to start writing about this incident on there social network sites for them to contact me and there sales and marketing director gave us a little glimpse of hope for about a week and ADMITTED that the hotel had let us down and he would do everything he can only for him to shut us down again and tell us they would not help us any further. My advice to anyone who is going to NYC which is a fantastic city, is to avoid this hotel because it stinks of dishonesty, its staff lack integrity and in a city where dreams are made... this hotel destroyed ours with an insurance scam.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevel Hotel shows its age of 84 years”
Reviews.Author: firedawgs
Reviews.Content: Customer service was helpful in accommodating a double booking of the same room that hotels.com did. They also gave away my sisters room, but after talking to the manager everything was all set. The hotel was built through 1924-1928, and showed some of it age. Although, the art deco of the 20's was fabulous for me to see. Nothing great for my son. The rooms were average in quality, but needs some major updating from rust spots to decor. The regular King or double room is way to small; which my sister rented. I was bumped up to a deluxe double which gives you approximately 5' more which I think should be the minimum. The location is in good spot, being 2 blocks to Grand Central Station, and 4 blocks to Time Square. Waiting 2 days before arriving in NYC was a benefit, due to the lower of the prices to book out rooms. Valet parking is $50 a day, but worth the $10 more of self parking; which you would have to find it yourself. The valet service is a third party service, and upon bringing my vehicle back, I noticed that they scratched my new car in two spots. I fought with them shortly, but wrote a claim from them, and the hotel also wrote up a claim. I am still waiting now 2 weeks for their insurance to at least start the process.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UsaAnon
Reviews.Content: The rooms were somewhat small but stylish and very comfortable, which is a personal priority. The hotel is conveniently located and reasonably-priced for NYC at this time of year. Multitudes crowding the lobby with luggage lent an air of Ellis Island to the place which detracted from an otherwise elegant and festively-decorated space. The elderly and disabled should note that they must navigate a stairway of about 15-20 steps to access the lobby, front desk and elevators, and a doorman may not necessarily be available to assist with luggage. Breakfast was disappointing and not recommended, options included an unremarkable buffet at $28 p/p or ordering off the menu at exorbitant prices.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel, but breakfast policy need to be worked on.”
Reviews.Author: sp27toronto
Reviews.Content: We were a large group and booked 4 rooms at this hotel for its included breakfast and location. Hotel was beautiful, clean and perfectly located. We had renovated rooms on the 16th floor. A/C was loud. The only issue was with the breakfast policy. The hotel should tell you at time of booking that only two people per room are included regardless of age, this should not be in the fine print. We were also told other guests had had issues with this policy. We had one family with a 4 and 10 year old staying in a double room with their parents; which cost $20 more than the king room. The children were not included in the free breakfast, they had to pay an extra $14/child, and this adds up! So each day cost the family with small children an extra $48/night. Every other hotel we looked at, children ate free if they stayed in same room as parent. In the end, the hotel allowed the children to eat free on one day and because not all our family members from the 3 other rooms had breakfast we applied their coupons to the kids meals. If you're booking hotel clarify this prior to booking. It ends up costing quite a bit extra for a young family. Very frustrating and unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel -Should be the Grand Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeJimenez
Reviews.Content: For that old time feeling of grandeur, expensive, quiet and excellent staff to cater to your every need. It was an excellent around the corner from craziness of the midtown crowds. Loved my time there and would suggest it any time.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another place”
Reviews.Author: Chill5001
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Roosevelt 9 years ago and would not have dreamed of returning if they had not "renovated" recently. (That is one of my parameters for choosing a hotel as they all wear out by virtue of their purpose) What they advertise as a renovation is in reality a update in furniture and bedding, if that, at very poor quality. The first room that we were checked into had peeling wallpaper, chipped trim and a moldy bathroom. Apparently they think that if you caulk over mold it gets rid of it. As any homeowner knows the mold simply works its way into the caulk. We were moved to another room whose bath was in better shape but the room was still old and tired. The carpet in the corridors is buckling and worn. On every floor the chairs flanking the chests are thread bear and dirty. This hotel has a great location but I would not stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!! Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: tyffany6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel in NYC with my 11 year old daughter and we really liked it. The rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful. We enjoyed sitting in the lobby for our last few hours and waiting for our train. Very close to the train station for a late night snack and a there is a little deli on the corner for inexpensive quick breakfast food in the morning. Very close to the American Girl Doll Store and Build a Bear if you have small children. Will be staying there again in a month. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: The lobby is grand but the rooms and hallways are terrible. Bathrooms are so small you have to step out of hem to lather up. Paint peeling stains all over carpets in hallways. Very disappointing. Don't let the pictures on their website fool you. I felt dirty after leaving there.

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: waqasgondal
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel and it is with in your price range as its not as much high end or low end . Its a clean hotel . staff is good rooms are fine. its near to times square but you have to walk 15-20 min for that

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful, Historic, Classic Roosevelt Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Neduardo
Reviews.Content: This review is WAY over due! My firts stay at the Roosevelt was in 1986! (On my Seniors class trip in High School) For the past six years I have been traveling to NYC either alone or with the family. I LOVE the Roosevelt. It is a classy, classic, Hotel. The staff is wonderful. The decor is marvelous. It is a hotel with alot of History. The TV show "MadMen" hold an annual event here. Eddie the bartender in the main lobby bar is fantastic and I look forward to seeing him every time I visit. In the better months the Hotel has a RoofTop bar that is open and is wonderful! Enjoy this hotel and its history.

Reviews.Title: “Out dated room”
Reviews.Author: sweetyaya
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby overall looks nice. But the room is kind of old and not too clean. I found roaches and baby roaches in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Old NYC Charm”
Reviews.Author: meridith03
Reviews.Content: Big beautiful lobby with old NYC charm and grandeur. The room was small and modest, but comfortable. Great location--safe, central, convenient, and close to everything. This was the best deal I could find in NYC in a good area with decent reviews and I was pleasantly suprised at what I got for my money.

Reviews.Title: “NEW YORK WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: lazeedaysMidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend trip to New York to celebrate my daughters 21st birthday. It is a very large hotel, however the staff are very friendly and helpful. We had an enormous room with 2 queen size beds on the 10th floor which was very clean and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel for its location - you are not far from anywhere - no breakfast at the hotel but can be bought very cheaply at numerous delis and resturants in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location !ignore the moaners !”
Reviews.Author: kayjayh
Reviews.Content: just back from 5 magical days in NY staying at the roosevelt ,its central to all the big stores and tourist attactions we have been to NY 3 times now and this is the best hotel we ve stayed in !staff are friendly and roons are very nice yes they are maybe a bit tired in places but dont forget this is a very old hotel ,i found absolutly nothing worth moaning about after all theres so much to do in NY you only fall in the door at night and sleep !if there were a couple of things they could do to make the hotel even better i would suggest tea and coffee making facilities in the room and a complementary bottle of water when guests check in as it is much needed after a long trip ,the bar in the lobby has a sun and mon night football special menu which we would highley recommend and is well worth the money ! all in all we would definatly stay here again and cant wait to return !!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Java C
Reviews.Content: My children and I spent Christmas weekend at the Roosevelt. The rooms were spacious and very clean. Check-in was at 3pm but we were able to check in at 1pm. The hotel staff were very friendly. The hotel is centrally located to everything. We were only a few blocks from Radio City Music Hall and the Empire State Building. In the process of booking my room for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: DeanW3
Reviews.Content: We asked for and were given a renovated 5th floor deluxe double double. As you would expect in Manhattan the room was small and required a great deal more renovation ! Tile grouting in bathroom needed replacing and windows outside were very dirty. No free breakfast or free wifi or coffee making in the room with a high price tag for the room leaves a little sour taste. The staff were very pleasant and the hotel lobby was very attractive and the location was perfect. PS if you like Malt Whisky ask for a MaCallan in the bar....they serve at least a treble measure for about $12 which is the best value you will get in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Room Quality”
Reviews.Author: John O
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very classy foyer and reception area but I couldn't say the same about our room, we had room 453 which had one small closet with approx 12 hangers there was no draw space for shirts, sweaters etc and as there were three of us we were not able to unpack our cases, there were holes in the wall where something had been screwed to the wall and a sharp piece of metal sticking out of one the holes which I cut my hand on, the heating didn't work properly and as it was December that was a problem, I asked for something to be done but nothing was but as we only wanted the room to sleep in I gave up, we may have been unlucky with our room but needless to say next time we are in New York we wont be at the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice, but you are paying for the location”
Reviews.Author: Xinmei W
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful and well worth a visit, but the hotel itself is a little outdated. However I don't think it's a problem as you won't be in the hotel for long away seeing as you are in NYC! We didn't get a renovated room but that was fine and our room was clean and even though it was a double it really wasn't that small at all. The beds are really comfortable! The bathroom is also clean with towels replaced every day and we didn't have a problem with it. We were on the 9th floor so had no problems with outside noise although if people were outside our rooms talking we could hear that quite loudly. However you have to watch out that there is no kettle in the room so you need to go out and buy water/hot drinks every day. The breakfast is massively overpriced so I wouldn't recommend eating there as there are loads of cafes around the place to grab something cheaper (and probably nicer too). The staff were very friendly and welcoming apart from the doorman outside who kept counting his tips in front of guests which was a bit rude. The hotel is 15 mins walk away from the Empire State, and 20-30mins from central park, literally 2 mins from Grand Central so an ideal location! But if I were to stay again I'd probably pick somewhere a little further for cheaper and make use of the great subway system in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas stay in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: awampler
Reviews.Content: We headed to New York City for a couple of days near Christmas, and the signs of the season were immediately evident as soon as we wooshed through the revolving doors. The lobby was beautifully decorated, welcoming guests as they climb the few stairs from the font door. We arrived a bit earlier than expected, and the folks at the front desk spent time to look for three rooms not just near each other but that were already made up so that we could drop off our bags. It was wonderful to be able to head out and find some lunch without having to worry about checking bags or coming back to actually check in and get room keys. The doormen waiting outside were pleasant and helpful, as you would expect. We didn't need a cab, though, since so much is located within 10-12 blocks of the Roosevelt, mainly, Rockefeller Center. Grand Central Station is right across the street as well. Basically, it's located right in Midtown with all kinds of shopping, dining, and tourist spots. Our room was rather large, with corner views of the street. There was room for two double beds and plenty of room for movement. We had the rest of our family (six, all together) in our room that evening to have a small tasting of chocolates we picked up during the day. It definitely did not feel crowded. The bathroom was clean and neat, if a bit tight. Of course, we're staying right in the heart of New York City, so we didn't have any expectations of having a ton of room. There was a reasonable closet with an ironing board, iron, and safe that we could use. The television was lacking a remote, but that was fixed after a quick call and short wait. It's a great location, enhanced by a pleasant and very helpful staff and beautiful facilities. There are a ton of shops downstairs and a great bar and lounge area as well. We didn't have time to check them out on this trip but are definitely looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Quite different from what appears to be”
Reviews.Author: ccamancio
Reviews.Content: I lost my hat in the elevator, when asked again the lift was no longer there. I asked the counter staff to help and were little interested in helping me. The hotel has a grand entrance, but the rooms do not match the lobby, are small and smelly, uncomfortable bed, bathroom has no place to leave anything. The wireless Internet is not free. There was a power plug to be used, all were being used by the equipment room. The price paid for the rooms is simple equivalent to the offer.

Reviews.Title: “A fab location to stay and see the sights of New York”
Reviews.Author: Amisons
Reviews.Content: Reception- very grand and welcoming to all, check in very smooth with helpful staff. We stayed in 791 and the bed was very comfy, closet with safe, iron & ironing board, easy to use safe. Bathroom small but functional with hairdryer and shelf for toiletries. Quiet room and did not want view as only slept in room. Just one thing-- no coffee making facility in room so take your own kettle. Location fab for 5th Avenue, Broadway and any other attraction

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lfabregas
Reviews.Content: We spend almost a week in the Roosevelt Hotel, the location is perfect just in front of the biggest metro station I have ever see Grand Station. Walking distance to Broadway and Time Square. The lobby is impresive and the service could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: David110382
Reviews.Content: Good value for money hotel.Brilliant location on Madison Avenue right beside Central Station.We had a very enjoyable stay.We got one of the upgraded rooms which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor response from guest services”
Reviews.Author: Kevin A
Reviews.Content: Room size is nice. Bathroom a little rough and needs upgrade. Wireless Internet has been unavailable all day. Called to get an item in the room replaced or fixed and that request has been ignored.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but need customer service training!”
Reviews.Author: JillRochester_NY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for a one night quick trip to NYC. It was a great location but that is where great ends. The concierge was the most unhelpful one ever - we were trying to visit the 911 memorial and needed to print out passes. He started to help me but then realized we weren't buying the passes for a tour (which he apparently would have gotten commission on) so referred me to the Internet and printer in the business center. So, I went there. I had to pay to get online and then to print- and then the printer jammed. Of course, there was nobody around who knew how to work it so I ended up rebooting the printer to see if I could fix it myself and did. They have a breakfast bar in the lobby but it is pricey. I probably wouldn't stay here again as there are so many great hotels in midtown who appreciate their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great localization, but how about a refurbish?”
Reviews.Author: fseidl
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt has a fantastic localization if you want to stay close the tourist nervous center of Manhattan. You are few blocks from the Times Square, the Grand Central Station and, if you like to walk, not far from the Central Park. But, it is obvious that the hotel already experienced better days. It is too big and it is understandable that it is hard to make a complete refurbishing. But some stained carpets, old wallpapers falling and smoking smelling levels don't match with the Roosevelt's fantastic architecture, placement and beautiful lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: AJR00
Reviews.Content: My room at the Roosevelt was comfortable and clean. It was a little small but that's to be expected in New York. When I walked in I was impressed with the beautiful lobby. The bar in the lobby serves as a breakfast place, where you can get Starbucks coffee and some light breakfast food. It is a little pricey but there is a place next door and one right across the street that has food/coffee for less money. I was happy with the convenient location of the Roosevelt and was able to walk to most of the places that I wanted to visit while in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: broadwaybarb
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel. I've been travelling annually to New York as a budget traveler for the past 25 years. I would have given it a higher rating except the price was high for the value. They are undergoing renos at the moment. I received an un-rennovated room. The size was fairly decent for NY (if you can walk around the bed, its considered spacious in NY). The room itself looked tired. Not all the lamps worked and we had to call the front desk to get one replaced as the room was very dark (very fast response). And if you can figure out the weird phone system -- good for you (I thought I was tech savvy -- apparently not) The bathroom has zero space to put any personal items (no counters, toilet tank lid slopes), making it very inconvenient. The location is fantastic. A 10-15 minute walk westward to the heart of times square and the broadway shows. In addition it is only a one minute walk to Grand Central Station if you want to travel by subway (cut through the Met Life Building 1/2 block east). If you're a wired person-- be aware that they charge $15/day for internet (seriously, in a town where there's a free hot spots all over the place). Go to facebook to find the deal that gives you free internet. My room was quiet (rare in midtown). The housekeeping staff were very friendly. However, the various front desk clerks all looked and acted liked they wished they were elsewhere. They were civil, but attitude was rolling off them in waves. Didn't matter what time of day or night I interacted with them, it was like they were doing you a big favour answering your questions or re-keying your card. That being said, I would stay here again, if I could find a bargain. The location can't be beat, the rooms were clean and quiet and the beds were comfy -- and really that's all you truly want from a hotel in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, well located.”
Reviews.Author: Dempsey_Family08
Reviews.Content: For a midtown hotel it was as good as you could expect; it was clean and well located. The hotel looks old and dated in areas, and there was no coffee making facilities in the room, but these are fairly small drawbacks. Reading other reviews I'd imagine I wouldn't have been so happy at paying $300 a night, but for what we paid, I was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Thordis P
Reviews.Content: Facilities were good, but the hotel was old and tired. Old smell when you walked the corridors. Still the charge was over 300 usd a night! The best thing about the hotel was the fitness centre. Good facilities, and water and fruits offered for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Grand but slightly shabby hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: BinnsyUk
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is ideally situated close to Grand Central station and is very convenient for walking to the main attractions in Manhattan. Empire State, Rockerfeller, Times Square are all within easy reach. There are lots of bars and cafes close by and you instantly get the electric flavour of New York - gloriously buzzing but terribly noisy (which persisted all night) The hotel has a fabulous lobby, currently adorned to the gills with the most enormous Christmas tree and glitzy decorations. It's a busy but beautiful place with much coming and going and the atmosphere is an absolute delight. It's perfect for people watching whil waiting for your room or your taxi. Reception staff and bell boys are very pleasant and helpful. Our room had allegedly been refurbished but we found it slightly shabby, particularly the bathroom which had musty grout in the tiles, also the waste lever in the wash basin was broken. The bed was large and comfortable but the windows were poorly glazed which did not help the noisy traffic situation. I do wonder why they have to blast their car horns all night long! It would be easy during the course of the ongoing "renovations" to address this noise issue. All in all, the location of the hotel was so good that we overlooked the problems as we didnt spend too much time in the hotel anyway. It was not cheap probably because it was the Christmas season. I might stay again if the price was reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Ken T
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are a bit shabby and the bathrooms very small but we found all bar the check in staff to be very helpful. Its got a good bar and traditional New York reception area. Its not too expensive and an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.. whats to moan about?”
Reviews.Author: CallyFaz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at about 1pm, and were advised by the extremely friendly receptionist (Paula, I believe- a sweet woman), that our room was unfortunately not ready but would be at 3pm.This WASNT a problem .. We left out cases with the porter, and went out for a few hours, came back and paid the porter $1 for each cases, and that was that :). We had a room on the smoking floor, not a huge issue as we are smokers anyway (i did get out on the 8th by accident one night, and for all you non smokers, you can smell the difference- even as a smoker!!) , the room had 2 double beds, a dressing table and a plasma screen tv. The beds were SO SO comfortable, and we slept well every night!! YES the bathrooms are a little small, but are you planning on throwing a party in there??? They are clean , hot showers, clean towels, simple and do the job. The location is noisy at times (like any central city hotel i imagine), but in Manhattan location is precious and it is a small price to pay! The lobby is beautiful, vintage, very clean and very 1920s! Infact the hotel is very well kept! The hotel is well located for more or less everything, I mean, Manhattan is a lot of walking anyway if you plan to do it by foot, but the hotel is literally 5 blocks from times square (out of the hotel, turn right and follow 45th! street) and 1 block from Grand Central Station!.. which if by the way you are flying into JFK or Newark you can get a shuttle bus for $15 each way per person. Taxis cost approximately $70 + tips!.. The concierges are very helpful and friendly and can advise you on all of these things! On saying that they are a great way to see the city, and stare out the window as you spend plenty of time in traffic in the midst of Manhattans one way grid system. Its worth noting that unless you are a New Yorker, the subway is a relatively hard thing to work out! Walking is fine, and I would imagine the city would be fine for the immobile and wheelchair users too. :) Buy a New York pass before you go.. i think it was $150 dollars.. but it is entrance to literally all the huge tourist attractions (Liberty Island, Ellis Island, Empire State, Madame Tussauds, Rockerfeller Centre, NYC Water Ferry etc etc!!) I seem to remember the Empire State Building being around $50 alone! Rockerfeller Centre was my favourite view!! The views to the North over Central Park are breathtaking. All in all this hotel is great .. I would recommend it 100% !! :) I will be back Roosevelt! xxxxx

Reviews.Title: “roosevelt hotel new york”
Reviews.Author: SaintMartin56
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Roosevelt. Have to admit to some trepidation after reading the reviews over the last few months. No need to worry, everything is fine for a short vacation to NY. Due to the negative reviews we did request a renovated room from our tour operater (Virgin) we didn't get one but it wasn't a problem the room was just fine with a nice sized comfortable bed. Sure the hotel is a bit 'dated' but it's been there for over 80 years. The staff were all fine polite and helpful when needed. We actually got to the hotel a bit early but within a matter of minutes we were checked in with no problem and up to our room, we were up on the 14th floor and apart from a slightly noisy a/c unit heard very little outside noise. When we return to NY we would stay here again the position of the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading for the price. $14.95 per night for Wifi, horrible bed.”
Reviews.Author: chuck C
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Roosevelt. For a four night stay averaging $300 a room per night I was very dissapointed to find that Wifi is another $14.95 per 24 hours. When we purchased the room I made certain Wifi was available not knowing the ad was misleading with another large fee. The room is extremely small and has not been upgraded in a very long time. The bed is the most uncomfortable bed we have slept on in years. Queen that feels like sleeping on card board. The concierege help was excellent from the older gentleman, the younger staff as usual was unhelpful and obviously hated his job. Simply a product of his generation. The big dude out front was helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Bed was ideal as was location!”
Reviews.Author: Cams32
Reviews.Content: One of the more affordable hotels in New York, we found it one of the best we've stayed in. Staff are friendly, rooms clean and adequate for a stop-over for a few days. Bathroom nice but no bath tub so you may need to request a room with one if you want one! We stayed in November but ironically had to turn the air con on as was too hot in the room - this was really quite noisy but this didn't interrupt sleep. Most importantly: the bed was a comfortable size for 2 large (!) people and just so comfortable to sleep in!! Would highly recommend as a good relatively inexpensive base for a city break as you're right in the best part of NYC for visitors & the best bed we've stayed in in NYC by far!

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: flyguys1
Reviews.Content: Located at 45th and Madison you cannot go wrong as it is within walking distance to 5th Ave. and Times Square. The lobby is gorgeous and the staff is excellant especially Shaila! The room itself had 2 double beds and would be very comfortable for 2 people, we had 3 and it was a little crowded. The bathroom is extremely small. Overall the location makes this hotel very good!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel, Needs a Little TLC”
Reviews.Author: PinguinVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt for one night in November 2011. I was shocked at the size of the room I was given -- a huge suite with a bedroom, two full bathrooms and a very large living room complete with couch, two comfortable chairs and a dining table for four.
