The only drawback to the room was that it was a smoking room -- I'm so used to no-smoking hotels that I didn't think of requesting a non-smoking room. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was very large but the bathroom could use a major renovation. The light fixture looked like it was from 1940 -- and not in a good, vintage way! Location is very good (close to Grand Central and 5th Avenue) and the lobby is beautiful. For the price I paid (via Hotels.com) I was very satisfied, especially considering how much larger the room was compared to most hotel rooms in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: littleclaire23
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I just returned back to england from here last week and all I can say is fab fab fab!!!! The location is excellent and the hotel itself is beautiful. The lobby most definitely has the wow factor and we certainly can't complain about our room either. It was on the 4th floor and we were told it had been refurbished. Having not been to the hotel before I can't comment on what it was like prior to refurbishment but it certainly ticked all boxes for us. It wasn't the biggest hotel room we've stayed in but it wasn't tiny either! It was just a lovely size for us and the bed was very big and may I add, extremely clean and very comfortable. As was the bathroom. Ok so the bath and decor was a bit dated but as long as its spotlessly clean then how can we complain?! The girls on reception when we checked in were very friendly as was the concierge when we asked for some info and so were the men who took care of our cases on our last day. If I was to complain about anything at all the only tiny thing would be the view we had. There wasn't anything to see other than a generator but who goes to NYC anyway to spend time looking out of a hotel window?! We certainly didn't. I give our whole trip including the hotel a 10 out of 10 and wouldn't hesitate for a second about staying here again. Thanks for making our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not what the website would lead you to believe!”
Reviews.Author: MarkM_1982
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night stay at The Roosevelt as I wanted to treat my mum with a trip to new York. Booked a superior double double as the site lead me to believe that the rooms were spacious - not the case. I had emailed the hotel in advance and asked for a room on a renovated floor (had read that they had undergone a multi million dollar refurbishment), away from the elevators and on a high floor. When we checked in, we were allocated a room on the 3rd floor right next to the elevator. The girl on reception had told me that the room was one of the renovated ones. Upon arrival in the room I was disappointed to say the least. Dirty bathroom floor, room that was so small I had to go out into the hallway to change my mind, and wallpaper that was peeling - hardly what I would consider as a refurbished room. I called reception to complain and was advised that every other room was full. I asked about upgrading and was told that it would cost $60 per night but the room wasn't refurbished. Had a look at the other room and it stank of smoke and looked like something out of a time warp - I was scared to open the closet in case I found a body! Complained again and was advised that the only floors that had been refurbished were 3,4 and 16. We were eventually allocated another room on 3rd which was marginally better than the other 2 but still not great. The room we ended up with had a lovely view of a brick wall and noisy air con vent in addition to a bath from which the water didn't drain! All in all a very misleading establishment - website looks great as does the lobby but the rooms are a shambles - pay the extra and stay at the fabulous New York Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: nycfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Roosevelt Nov. 22 - 26 2011. I had a group of 5 families joining my family for our Annual trip to NYC for the parade and to kick off the holiday season. After getting a great rate on the internet I made the reccomendation to the other families.I made an effort to stop by the hotel last year when in town to check out the lobby and from what I saw I felt confident in my decision. Well looks can be decieving. Upon check in @ 11 am was told that we could not have a remodeled room unless we wanted to pay a higher price. We decided to stay in a non-remodeled room and when we got into it were Very dissappointed in it (old and very tired decor and furnishings, and bathroom the same). I called the other families to warn them in advance, and to not be expecting too much. When another family arrived 3 hours later they were given a remodeled room at no additional charge, so upon returning later in the day made a request to be moved to a remodeled room and was accomodated. When we got into the newly remodeled room it was much smaller than the non remodeled room we had just moved from. I called down to the desk to make sure it was a Superior room like I had reserved and was told it was. Later after other families had arrived I compared rooms and I definately did not have the same room as the others did. Theirs were larger rooms. As for the remodel - it looks as though they painted and put up new wallpaper and curtains, along with new carpet. The bathroom was Not remodeled and was maybe painted. Upon check out I had carried my bags to the lobby myself and was putting them into storage for the day because we were leaving later in the afternoon. The bellman Asked for his tip in advanced because he may not be there when I returned later that day. I am never shy at tipping someone when it comes to good service but was offended that he asked me for it - I did not tip him but did tip the other bellman that helped me originally. To say the least I doubt if I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!! Great location - take your bug spray .”
Reviews.Author: gemmawayney
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel-fab location, lovely lobby, I got bit very badly on my legs. Stay at the Wellington or Edison. Same price but no bed bugs . Man in gift shop very very helpful... The fairy on reception Is an utter jobs worth .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: Kanako N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February 2009. The location is excellent - Grand Central Terminal is right outside the door so you can take the Metro North trains or Subway, and you are within easy reach of JFK by bus. That's the only good thing about this hotel. Good, if you just need a place to crash but it is not a cheap place to stay. When you walk into the hotel, the lobby is very impressive, but nobody will help you with your luggage up the stairs to the level where the check-in counter is. Once in your room, the lighting is very depressing. The rooms are in need of refurbishment. It was not filthy, but there was some writing on the wall and something that looked like either lipstick, blood or ketchup. The beds were quite comfortable, but there was a constant noise of what sounded like construction work or garbage truck all night. There is an AC/heater by the window but when you turn it on, it just blows air into the curtains. My room was facing the inside of the building so the view was abysmal. Bathroom was ok but again, it could use some work. Some cracks on the bathtub and stain around the drain. There is no minibar, no fridge. Just a pail and you can get ice from the ice machine on the floor. And they give you paper cups. And these cups were not replaced after the first day. I asked for some new cups and they brought them but after that I could not be bothered asking every single time so I ended up washing and re-using my paper cups for my 8-night stay. Very ecological, I guess! For a hotel of this class and price, I would expect a mini bar and proper glass. So sadly, I won't be staying there again. Great location and lobby, but everything else about it is just not worth my money. Even motels in the countryside have better facilities.

Reviews.Title: “The location is FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Eleni_gak
Reviews.Content: We went with my husband on Christmas 2010, the location of this hotel is fantastic!! In the center, very close to Time square, 5th avenue and exactly opposite of the Crand Central Station. The first room that they gave us was extremely small but after we complained they gave us a big room with view to the street. The room was clean and warm and every afternoon the hotel was offering free hot beverages and cookies at the reception area. Roosevelt hotel is a very good option if you want to visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Carl L
Reviews.Content: Great location, but very disappointed with our last stay. Although the rates had increased, our room was smaller, and very tired. The remote didn't work and the hairdryer shut off very couple of minutes. The temperature control unit was very noisy periodically. Felt like Motel 6 for these reasons. The bed was very comfortable on the other hand and the hotel has a grand old lobby

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: SoCalNative7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend while in town for a wedding. I was a bit concerned with the poor reviews, but it was absolutely fine. The location is great, and while the room was not particularly special, by NY standards (expensive, small, outdated fixtures), it was perfectly acceptable. I was impressed with the front desk staff, who were very friendly and helpful during every interaction.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Shirley611
Reviews.Content: We were 2 friends travelling together and had the deluxe room with 2 double beds which, although a bit dated, was very clean and comfortable (beds were great). The room was a good size for New York at around 300 square feet. The included breakfast was great, a full hot and cold buffet. The location was great, we were able to walk to all of our shows and restaurants, and never took any taxis other than to and from the airport. A very short walk to Grand Central was also a bonus. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again, especially once the room renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: zozika1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many NYC hotels before, this was the lowest point thus far. We were there for a one-day Continuing Medical Education workshop, which I directed for 70 participants, our staff included 5. We stayed 2 nights, one night each before and after our one-day CME program. When I first walked in we received the first dose of "hospitality". The check-in area is behind what seems to be a gate like arrangement with 2 Concierge desks on opposite end of the hallway, narrowing it down some. Since I did not see the check-in, I walked up with my luggage to one of the concierge guys, who obviously had to see me, but kept looking down on some paperwork. I was just standing, hoping at some point, when he finishes looking at whatever paperwork he had to be reviewing right that moment, he will help me. Several awkward minutes went by and I certainly did not feel like it was me who should be addressing me. The other concierge guy on the opposite side saw this and eventually addressed our down-looking chap, after which he looked up and reluctantly advised me that the check-in was right behind him. They gave us a conference room for the CME program right next to another conference room used for Church of Christ activities, which I respect, but they were so loudly singing that it interfered with our program. The hotel rooms are small and provide some old unhealthy moldy atmosphere, but all that I would have easily forgotten as "expected". What caused me to actually write is the incredibly poor service and downright rude way staff handles guests. Trust me, it was not just one bad apple or random experience. We had at least a handful of encounters where hotel staff certainly were not nice, to say the least. Probably the most egregious instance was before checkout. I was asked by a friend (who lives in the area) to unofficially examine his mom. This took a bit longer than expected, just on the morning of our checkout day. So at 11 AM (with a 12PM checkout time coming up) I called down and asked for a "late checkout", which is standard and pretty much all hotels I have been to had it (it may be anywhere between 1/2 hour to 2 hours). When I politely asked "if" we could have late checkout, this b*tch just bluntly announced straightforward that "NO" and that I would be charged $75 if I did not get there by 12. Excuse me?? I explained that I am a doctor and had to examine this patient for why we are running a bit behind. That didn't touch her. She kept addressing me with an emphasis on MISTER (despite the fact I had just mentioned I was a doctor, plus it was "Dr." how my name was registered) and when I asked her to perhaps not keep addressing me Mr. and kindly use Dr. if possible, she snapped out in a highly irritated tone that she would not do that and asked if I was a man and if so she was going to call me Mr. We rushed and managed to make it down by 12.15 PM and (I believe) we were not charged $75... Besides this particular incidence, throughout pretty much our entire stay, every time I called operator from my hotel room, a rather unfriendly (to b*tchy) deep voiced female asked in a tone that made you feel like you should not have called and bothered her. That is unusual. I would say that the standard/usual is that when you call the operator from your hotel room, some kind and warm voice greets you in a grateful tone. Here we had the diametric opposite. The transportation was a nightmare. They won't get you car service or cab when you call the operator, but they advise that you just go to the front door and there will be cabs there. No. There are never cabs there and each time we wanted to get anywhere, it was either a 15 min waiting in front of the hotel waiting for cabs or we went to the nearby Madison Ave and got cabs on our own. The worst was when we were leaving for home and were already waiting for 15 min with no luck (we had a train from Penn to catch), with my GF standing on the corner of 45th & Madison trying to get a cab, while I am waiting for the hotel guy to find one. He waves that there is one, I wave to my GF to come (and she came relenting her post and carrying her luggage back), but then it turned out somebody else took the cab and we were back to square one. Eventually we ourselves got a cab off Madison, after one that stopped refused to take us due to the too short distance. Therefore, it is far to say the hotel provides you zero assistance with cabs. There were several other less noteworthy instances when service was sub par. You could feel that they were so busy due the good location they absolutely did not care that you would just not ever go back there (like us), because they would have plenty of business with or without you. Well, I actually brought quite a bit of business there, which I am happy to take somewhere else next time we have a CME program. The location is great, just as others reported, but with such an attitude, small moldy rooms, and frankly poor service I most definitely recommend you go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “top class,location, location!”
Reviews.Author: aloha40
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughters and I stayed at this hotel in Oct 2009 for a 1 day girlie trip in New York City... Holidaying in the US with friends living in New Jersy. we travelled by train to Penn Station, New York and caught a cab to the hotel which wasnt very far at all.We chose this hotel as my brother had stayed there a few months earlier that year and was raving about the fantastic location etc. We were disappointed at all:) The room, service, facilities, cleanliness, and old world grandeur and charm lifted our spirits as we walked into the lobby. It was so close to Times Square and we loved every minute of our stay which was so much more enjoyable courtesy of Roosevelt Hotel. We felt so safe walking to and from Times Square 1am in the morning... I couldnt believe it.. Wlould never do that in Melbourne on our own. Would love to go back to this hotel simply for its A class all round no fuss stay and cant wait for our next trip back

Reviews.Title: “UNTIL THIS HOTEL IS RENOVATED STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_n_Tracy_0831
Reviews.Content: The first room that I was given the key to, on the 12th floor, was dark, with one small window looking out on the back alley of other buildings, and had only one table lamp on the one nightstand in the room. There wasn't even a lamp on the desk! The second room that I was offered was nicely upgraded on the 16th floor but the only furniture in the room were two double beds and one nightstand between them, with a LAN computer cable sticking up between them... as if sitting on the bed would be an acceptable place to work on a computer... THERE WAS NO DESK AT ALL! The last room, that I finally stayed in, was 1544, and upon my arrival it's door had been propped wide open along with both windows, to air out the thick stench of cigarette smoke that the guest before me had left inconsiderately. That obnoxious smell remained heavy in the room, as it was in the drapes and the bedding for the entire two and a half days of my stay. Renovation or not, I'll never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - 4 star”
Reviews.Author: jbwheat4
Reviews.Content: We booked thru hotels.com for a cozy queen room - at what was the best rate we could find. The lobby was lovely. Somehow we ended up with a room with 2 beds, which was good, (and normally more expensive) as we appreciated the extra space. It was clean, but dated - most importantly, everything worked. For the first time in a while, we stayed somewhere professional, where the employees were trained and we felt like there was real management. The housekeepers were loud, our key card failed, but it still was a real hotel, with real hospitality training. Great location and a really comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary & disappointing”
Reviews.Author: roxcochrane
Reviews.Content: Throughout our honeymoon in the US we were greeted with amazing service and comfortable rooms. The Roosevelt was definitely average and disappointing. We had booked 5 nights at this venue, and upon check in my first impression was to check out and go elsewhere. We had been allocated a room with complimentary mould and musty smell. Especially disappointing as the front desk had 'made special mention' that we were on our honeymoon and we would get a 'nice' room. Location - fantastic! Close to everything in midtown. Only positive. House keeping - friendly and need to be told thank you more often. I'm sorry to say that I would never stay at this hotel again, restoration or not, it's not worth the money. There are plenty more fantastic places in SoHo and TriBeCa.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings on this one”
Reviews.Author: Juanita_PEI
Reviews.Content: I first booked 4 nights through a renovation sale last year and got a superior double for a steal. However, I wanted to increase my stay by one night - I couldn't get the rack rates for November online (waited until early October) so I called and they booked me another night for an exoribant price $425.00 which I thought was normal. I just checked the rates online and the same room is under $300.00 but I figured I got the other nights cheap so it worked out. The room was old as I expected but I did not expect the mold in the curtains. I did not expect that the cleaning staff would not clean the room very well. We had to call everyday for washcloths and clean cups. Air conditioner was very old and loud, we had to run it on high all day to keep the room cool. The location was great, the lobby was WOW! The staff was nice. I would like to hear from folks who got a new room. Are they nice. And to they get well cleaned. If so and the price stayed the same as what is listed on the internet sites then it would be a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: MandSWalker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt for my honeymoon last week and had been upgraded from a double room to a suite for free, which was amazing, the room was huge and beautiful, it was clean and spacious and we loved it. It isn't very modern but its a big grand hotel and I thought it was perfect that way. On the 2nd day there we had a knock at the door, room service with a cheese platter, wine and drinks from all the staff at the roosevelt, congratulating us on our marriage, it was lovely! All of the staff were friendly and welcoming and the food was incredible, we only ate there once as NYC has so many places to go but we ordered a pizza late night and it was delicious, the best we've had. We loved our stay at the hotel and we loved New York, it was a perfect week and I'd highly recommend this hotel, only down side was the wifi, I had been told on twitter it would be included for me but when I checked in I wasnt allowed it and I couldnt access twitter to show the lady at reception I was told I could have it! But it wasnt a huge issue :-) I had read so many bad reviews on this hotel and I can not imagine why people would write things so negative, the hotel was amazing! We never had bed bugs, we never had a dirty room, the staff were great, the food was great and it was totally worth the money and may I add, it isn't that expensive for New York! Myself and my husband actually loved our stay that much, we have said if we ever have a daughter she'll be called Madison, the hotel is on Madison Avenue!! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “it's a classic”
Reviews.Author: sifab
Reviews.Content: Fantastic position just in front at Central, beautiful inside, best place to stay for a tourist for a ragionable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Jackson W
Reviews.Content: New York has been on my wife and I's radar for a while but we were a bit hesitant to travel due to the overwhelming cost. For our 20th we decided it was time. A buddy told me to check out the Roosevelt Hotel because the service was stellar and the staff was known for going out of their way. I found that to be true. Our trip was amazing. My sincere thanks to the concierge help from Todd. Not once but twice he made our trip. September of this year the city was slammed. There weren't tickets or reservations for mostly anything and my wife and I didn't know where to start. Todd went out of his way, found us a great Italian restaurant in Greenwich Village for a romantic dinner. The better part was we found something out of the normal craziness of Midtown and went downtown. Todd gave great directions for the subway. And though we couldn't get tickets to Book of Mormon (like my wife wanted), Todd recommended a couple of options like we wanted and also explained how to do the lottery to try and get tickets for Mormon. I have to say he didn't let us down. A simple walk in Central Park made the perfect end for our Anniversary. This is the service I definitely expect to receive when paying quite a bit for a New York hotel. This guy is doing something right! So hopefully this pays it forward. Thank you Todd for making our experience and helping us have the unique and romantic anniversary we hoped for! Till next time...

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located, Beautiful Lobby”
Reviews.Author: MrAPayne
Reviews.Content: An ideally located Hotel, with clean an friendly staff! Like all hotels within NYC the rooms aren't vastly spacious, but the room was clean and came with a HUGE bed!

Reviews.Title: “Old but charming”
Reviews.Author: jitiwariji
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, ended up taking some nice photos in and around the neighborhood. Yes, the rooms are very small. I had a leaking roof in the first room into which I checked in, after a long flight from Bombay via Paris. Called the front desk and was immediately given an upgrade to another room. I'm not sure of prices of other hotels in that vicinity but for $140 a night it wasn't a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Old lady in dire need of makeover”
Reviews.Author: KMB33
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old and tired, rooms have wallpaper peeling off walls and years of grime. I arrived late at night, hiked upstairs only to discover I had been given a smoking room. Why do these still exist? I dragged everything back downstairs where initially the surly front desk clerk told me there were no other rooms. Well lo and behold upon my insistence there was indeed another room. Understand the hotel is renovating floor by floor; this can't happen soon enough. If we're going to pay through the nose to stay in Manhattan it should at least look like they're trying.

Reviews.Title: “"Cozy Queen was Cozy Double"”
Reviews.Author: err45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is historic and the public areas are beautiful. The lobby is nothing short of grand. The staff (except one) were helpful and friendly. Yes, the rooms are small and dated, but ours was clean. This will be rectified by the renovation. The location is excellent. *** Our major complaint (really major as it impacted our stay) was that our "Cozy Queen" was really a "Cozy Double" which meant we slept very little. The only less-than-friendly person we encountered was the man at the desk who insisted that the bed was a queen. It was not. He also informed us that there were no rooms available. We had no recourse but to remain in the double-bed room. Again, sleep was in short supply. ***See the traveler trip note below*** Would we stay here again. Probably. But only with the absolute certainty that we would have a Queen bed in a Cozy Queen room!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the photos, old and needs love and repair”
Reviews.Author: Melinda&Eric
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the photos and reviews! I expected to stay in an old, well kept hotel. The hotel is in need of Love and Care. The furnishings are worn down, rugs need to be stretched, bathrooms need to be updated. We were booked in room 523, the heating/air conditioning unit made terrible noise, the lamp on the dedk was falling apart, red wall paper felt like I was in a hotel you pay by the hour. They did move us to room 1124, double beds, very small room. The bath tub is peeling and the handles on the sink don't sit right. The toilet over flowed on our first flush. They were up to repair in 15 minutes, but housekeeping never showed up to clean up. Front desk staff has issues, when they moved us to new room the keys didn't work, when I went down to explain the problem I was told we must have rubbed them against our cell phones! Positive, clean as old can be. Great location, comfortable beds and the staff is nice, with the exception of the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable though old”
Reviews.Author: aurrich
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 weeks in New York for business and stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel. While the rooms are small and old, it overall was a pleasant experience. The location is great, near Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue, Theaters and Times Square. The staff was pleasant and courteous. We even got to see them filming a movie in one of the ballrooms. The only drawback was that the hotel did not have a full service restaurant that was open later in the evening and the elevators were not air conditioned. However, the price was very good for the location. I hear they are renovating the rooms which is good thing. I would stay there again as it's 1 block from our office.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a weekend.”
Reviews.Author: shans
Reviews.Content: You couldnt ask for a better placed hotel. just a step away from everything. The lobby looks just like a film set. Ok so the rest is tired but so are many hotels. They did say they were in the middle of redocoration, but we were on the 5th floor and our friends on the 12th and neither of these had been done. The beds were comfy, clean linen every day, room enough for the little time we spent there. We were out by nine in the morning and not back till much the same in the evening, so who cares we couldn't run around the room . All the staff we dealt with were very helpful. We we would go back there any time.

Reviews.Title: “a very tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norman W
Reviews.Content: foyer very grand, thought we had landed on our feet but went all down hill from the the "checking-in". check-in staff very rude and couldn't have cared less about the customer. literally threw our key across the reception. booked bedroom was a "superior" double-double. wall paper peeling off the walls, carpet worn down to the underlay in places and bathroom not touched since the seventies (at best). they offered to change the room, but this was the same...very basic and dated. offered a further two rooms but all the same...very tired, stained and worn carpets and just appeared un-clean. checked out immediately (manageress was understanding) and booked into warwick.

Reviews.Title: “Our second time staying here”
Reviews.Author: mizmof
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying in this wonderful, grand old New York hotel and we loved it! While I will agree with most reviews that the rooms are a bit dated and bathrooms on small side, we were not in NYC to hang out in the room so that did not bother us. The lobby is absolutely gorgeous, the location central, and the service was professional and thoughtful. We were CT residents affected by the end of October weekend nor'easter and were guests there on Halloween. Several Roosevelt Hotel staff members were giving out candy in front of hotel and went out of there way to make sure my children got some. When I thanked them and let them know we would not be having a Halloween in CT due to the storm/lack of power, the staff went above and beyond and made sure my children got even more candy(I'm talking an unopened 3.6 pound bag of candy)! Since then, this is all my kids have been talking about to friends and family! If you are looking for a reasonably priced(we got a good last minute deal), centrally located, NYC landmark hotel, then check out(or check in) The Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate New York Experience”
Reviews.Author: stephenp65
Reviews.Content: They don't call her the "Grand Old dame of Madison Avenue" for nothing. When planning our trip to New York we had a definite vision of what sort of hotel would offer the ultimate New York experience. The moment we saw her grand lobby on the web we knew we had found her and the real thing did not let us down. It was like stepping back in time to the city's magnificent heyday. Ornate wall and ceilings, wide hallways all fitted with a style and granduer rarely seen these days, but what was so delightful was that the old girl had hardly aged at all. The rooms were immaculately decorated in the classic period, but also fitted with modern luxuries. The staff were very efficient, if not particulary friendly, but, hey, this IS New York. We were disappointed that the restuarant that looked so inviting on the website was no longer open for dinner, but the quality of the room service almost made up for it. The location was absolutely perfect for us, my wife, teenage daughter and I loved the fact that we were just a few of blocks from Times Square, yet far enough to get just out of the wonderful mayhem. Grand Central is only across the road so whole city is at your doorstep. The rates were really good for such a beautiful hotel. My only criticism is that after enjoying free internet at five previous hotels in the US, the Roosevelt charged $15 per day, and when you have a teenager travelling with you the thought of not having the internet was simply not an option. This aside, I would recommend The Roosevelt to everyone, and we can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: cdar
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our recent stay. Great location - easy walk to 5th Avenue (Lord & Taylor to the Left, Sak's to the Right), 3 blocks to Broadway where you will find Times Square, Theatres, stores open till 1am, resaturants, and the Hop on Hop Off buses. Deli's, Starbucks, the footcourt in Grand Central are all within 2 blocks or less of the hotel. The superior double room size was similar to what you would find at a Hampton Inn/Holiday Inn across the country. No counter space in bathroom; just a small shelf above the toilet. Room was quiet, clean, with comfotrable beds. There are computers for guest use, charges apply, except for boarding passes which are free. Would definately stay again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has been downgraded!”
Reviews.Author: north40Leeds
Reviews.Content: You might not be aware, therefore you might like to know that this hotel has recently been downgraded from a FOUR STAR to a THREE STAR. This, to my knowledge has not been advertised, it took the holiday comapny that we booked with to inform us via email. On discovering this we contacted the Hotel hoping for some kind of concession - we are still waiting on a response. No suprise, afterall, we booked over three months ago and had to contact them regarding a few points including the confirmation of our booking and to this date they have NEVER acknowledged any of our correspondence!

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: ChamKim
Reviews.Content: Thought this place was outdated. Rooms were small but all hotels are like that in NY. Although the bathrooms were smaller than usual. I could touch from wall to wall while standing up. On a brighter note it is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hallur G
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel needs an update, the location and friendly staff makes up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: DianeMarie1963
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Roosevelt was wonderful. The location is convenient to everything. The rooms were small but very clean. The hotel has a beautiful lobby and a nice bar. Close to Broadway, Time Square and shopping. We were able to walk to all locations around the city. Would stay again and the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: NeilH22
Reviews.Content: Just had a great stay at this hotel. Location is excellent as within 5 mins of 5th Ave and 10 mins to Times Square. Rooms are clean and a good size. Bathrooms are a bit dated but again clean. Staff were friendly and efficient. Breakfast hafa large selection and was available from 6am. Would have been even better if there was a kettle in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enjoysun12
Reviews.Content: I had to book a late business trip to New York and thought I would stay for the weekend. I was meant to take at the Barclay Hotel in Mid town but they had no rooms left. So, having looked at the website, I choose the Roosevelt as my meetings were all very close to the hotel. On arrival, the hotel looks very grand and from a scene out of Mad Men. 1950's decor on a grand level. So, was quite impressed. However, reservation staff were quite rude on check in as they carried on their conversation in Spanish. I had booked a king size room and got a queen twin room. the room was tiny, had damp on the walls, carpet was dirt and everything was so old looking. The bathroom was clean but very dated. i asked to be moved to the another room but was told the hotel was full. This was quite unlikely as the hotel has over 1000 rooms. However, the bar and food was good and was enjoyed. We paid £250 per night and felt ripped off. Not worth it at all. The only thing that was good was the location. Its a ten minute walk to Time Sq and 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Oh when will I go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: gm m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt for over a week in April 2011. So I really got to see the hotel, the staff, the facilities etc. I really really liked it! Before going, I read some reviews on this page and got terrified! Bed bugs, dirty rooms, horrible staff, nightmare-bathrooms... BUT this wasn't my expierence at all, luckily! Maybe it has to do with the rooms you get... The room I stayed in was for 4 people, two king sized beds. It wasn't big, but it wasn't tiny either. It was really ok, considering that I don't need to run up and down in any hotel room! After all, it's New York!! You don't spend so much time in the hotel room, you walk the city! The room was clean and room-service changed sheets, towels and waste-bags every day. There was always toilet paper in the bathroom. Always hot water, had some difficulties with the stationary shower, but after the second shower I just got used to it! And it was fun! NO BED BUGS, at least not in my room, or in any other my 20 friends stayed in. We couldn't open the window, but the A/C was working and was not noisy at all. There was no way to get fresh air in the room, but it didn't smell bad or mouldy. And after all, we were 4 people in there! The great thing was the bed. Honestly, I slept sooooo well, they were so comfortable and huge, I didn't want to get up :) The hotel staff was really ok as well. They did their job just fine, noone was rude to me and noone damanded a tip. When we checked out, we still had a few hours left until departing. The staff demanded 1$ per luggage to store our stuff, which was really ok and not too much. When our bus arrived to take us to the airport, the bus driver refused to put our luggage into the bus, saying he didn't got paid to do that! The hotel staff helped us and carried all our luggage and stored it into the bus, which was really great help because we were a group over 30 people! Thanks about that :) The hotel lobby is huge and impressive. The vending machines all worked perfectly, never had any problems. Would've liked it though if I'd have a fridge in the room to put my own stuff in it, more cosy! The location is terrific! Just everything is closeby, Time Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, Empire State, Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Grand Central Terminal, which is just wonderful. You get the chance to walk the streets and feel like a real New Yorker!! All in all, I had a more than pleasant stay at the Roosevelt. My biggest issue was the cleanliness, and there was nothing to complain about that whatsoever! Sure its old, yes there are no slippers or robes, but hey people...it's not your home! It's a hotel!!! At really reasonable prices and with nice services! There is only one more thing left to say, oh New York I love you! And I would stay at the Roosevelt again, in the very same room :)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: KLC0903
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and thought the room was very dated. We asked to look at a better room and were offered a suite at an extra $200 per night. We looked at this and the suite was just as dated with a greater number of rooms. The room is average but acceptable though the bathroom was in extremely poor condition (not the housekeeping side, just the overall decor). There was a huge crack the the bathtub for instance. This said the hotel is in a great location (5 mins walk to Times Square), reasonably priced and the reception / bar area are nice. The staff were pleasant enough too. The feeling on leaving was that is wasn't a bad hotel but would we stay there again... no.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: litalcrespin
Reviews.Content: i wormly recommend the roosevelt hotel ! the room are not so small as you expect, they are very clean and well maintained, the lobby is very big and impressive, you fell like you are in a museum! the hotel is located 10 min walk from time square and the prices are very reasonable! we paid for 3 nighs in a holiday weekend 830$. enjoy your stay ! Lital

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: srjpJohnsonCity
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the bellman was on his cell phone and completely ignored us. Took us a while to figure where to go. We were booked for a "cozy room" and were upgraded to a junior suite. That was the only good about the stay---a larger room. The lobby is grand, but dark. The halls to the rooms are HOT, no air conditioning! The room we were in needs updating. The sofa had cushions that didn't go with the sofa. In a hotel like this I expect robes, none were provided. I will say the bed was great and the room was quite. It was in the back of hotel. Not sure I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the grand dame of Madison Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Squeak1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for a week in early October for my 40th birthday celebrations. On arrival at the hotel they immediately told us that they were giving us a free room upgrade without us even asking. The hotel lobby has a real wow factor and was everything we could have wished for as our first introduction to New York hotels. It was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful (from the concierge through to the housekeeping staff) and attention to detail is considered. This ranges from practical considerations such a computer area for guests to print return boarding passes through to touches which are more aesthetic (flowers arrangements changed regularly) The lobby itself is not just a place that guests might simply pass through but a sumptious area to actually spend time in. Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed as was the storage space and the bathroom. There is no doubt that this hotel would be hard to beat for location, you simply trip over all the iconic New York sights as soon as leave the hotels doorstep; Chrysler building, Empire State (visible from bedroom window) Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, The Rockafeller Centre and Grand Central Station to name a few! To sum up we popped in to take a look at the Waldorf Astoria whilst there but would not have swapped! Thank you Roosevelt, we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Roosevelt.”
Reviews.Author: pchulo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed three nights at the Roosevelt for an anniversary trip to NYC. I booked the the room via Priceline so I did not know the name of the hotel until after I had already paid. When I saw the some of the reviews on TA, I became concerned that my anniversary trip would not live up to my expectations. I was pleasantly surprised, upon check in I mentioned to the clerk that it was my anniversary and I was upgraded to a superior room with a king size bed. The room was very nice and while not the most spacious it was ample enough especially by NYC standards. I found all the hotel staff to be courteous and very helpfull. I was never felt pressured to give a tip (our european friends should know that tipping is a custom in the US for a good well done and that hotel and restaurant staff are paid a very low hourly wage and that tips make up a large part of their income). We enjoyed the lobby bar, the roof top lounge and the restaurant. Our room was cleaned everyday and while the furnishings were of a more traditional style (fitting the overall decor of the hotel) they were not run down or in disrepair. Upon arrival the AC did not appear to be cooling too well and the maintenance staff responded within minutes and resolved the issue. When I tried to give the maintenance man a gratuity, he refused to accept it saying it was part of his job. The bed was very confortable and NO BED BUGS. Did not find street noise to be a problem. The location was perfect, close to everything and many great places to eat and drink all close by. The subway and Grand Central station within a short walk. The hotel is very busy and there were always lots of people milling around in the lobby, then again the hotel has over 1000 rooms and when you have that many rooms there's going to be a lot a people. I never had to wait more than a few minutes for an elevator or to speak to someone at the front desk. There is a charge for the wifi in the room but there are several workstations available in the lobby area free of charge. I am originally from NYC and travel there at least twice a year. I have stayed at many worse places in the city at twice the price. Overall it was a very pleasant stay and would definately consider the Roosevelt for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Came for a room ended up with a fight.”
Reviews.Author: ArtVanderlay
Reviews.Content: This is quite a place. I booked the room on Priceline but unfortunately, when I went to check in I was informed by the rude desk clerk that there was no record of my reservation. She quickly passed me off to her "Manager" who proceeded to goad me into an argument with her. There are different ways of customer service and it is obvious that the approach here is to berate the customer. Eventually we got the room after we had to pay twice for it, it is old, I understand that, but it was also filthy. There were hairs between the sheets, dust in places were it was obvious it had been there for quite some time. Mildewed bathroom tiles a toilet paper holder that would fall apart when you pulled paper off it, TV not plugged in. A bad experience. Avoid this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location but average hotel - looks better from the outside!”
Reviews.Author: MrDecent D
Reviews.Content: Pro's: * Excellent Location on 45th/46th Street so within easy reach of Times Square and other main attractions. * Front desk always manned - very useful and helpful in arranging a cab to the airport, especially in the early hours of the morning. * Reliable key card. * Helpful doormen/ staff, particularly with directions. * Excellent lobby, looks very grand and has a buzz about it. Great to place to meet a guest/family/friends. Con's: - The rooms and generally the rest of the hotel (apart from the ground floor) is very average, appears worn out and not always cleaned to a high standard (e.g. litter, dirty carpets, food trays in the hallways). - Noisy windows, noisy air-conditioning, old fashioned radiators, no doorbell or knocker on the door. - Too many lamps in the room, not a single overhead light, which useful when reading or doing paperwork. - Loud staff e.g. with their radios late at night, or banging around trolleys, talking loudly etc. - No tooth brush or razor blades in the bathroom, only one shower cap, no slippers (as expected in a 4* establishment), toilet had a very long flush that made noises for 30-40 minutes after use. - Damp smell in the closet, worn out carpets. - The valuables Safe was in a very obvious position. - No 24 Hour breakfast options, overpriced compared to even the most expensive Manhattan restaurants. - Long wait for the elevators and usually a queue, vending machine very hard to find. - Overpriced Wifi for the hotel room, and difficult to connect in other parts of the hotel where it is supposedly free. - Old style shower, with stationary shower head and small bathtub. Bar soaps and no shower gels. No mirrored cabinets for storing shaving kit/personal items. - Dark room, damp smell in the corners and dusty under the bed, red walls looked poor in taste.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bentruong
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. Stay for a week. Forgot my money bag which I left under pillow. Call security and they put it away for me straight away. So very happy or else it would be no money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Mervyn64
Reviews.Content: A grand Dame ok but Air con needs replacing and staff need an attitude check , especially the ones on the roof top bar!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: Nice room, simple, but comfortable. The view was just of all the buildings and lit up windows surrounding the hotel-- that was kind of cool. The old-time feel in the lobby was one of the things that we liked the most about it. The place has an interesting history. More of a business-stay hotel, with a fairly relaxed vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what people are moaning about!”
Reviews.Author: WillowGunn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner last February. Walking in the lobby takes your breath away. We had problems checking in (a problem on the booking side with Expedia, NOT with the hotel). But that was resolved by the friendly front desk staff. The room was lovely. HUGE comfortable bed, rooms cleaned daily. Sure, the bathroom was a little dated but it was clean and the shower was always hot. Location wise, this is FANTASTIC!! For those coming into JFK, get the busses outside the airport to Grand Central and it's litrally a 2 minute walk. You can walk to Times Square from this hotel, and Central Park if you so wish. But with it being so close to Grand Central Station, you are linked to everywhere via Subway. It's seriously the most ideal location. Now, for people moaning about a few things (just addressing a few things from the few reviews I've read)... 1) Yes, the beds are HUGE! This is an american thing I think. Don't go booking the biggest bed you can and then complain about it! 2) the decor... When I went, the decor was what some people would call dated. I call it a beautiful period property. Sure, some things like the bathroom suites needed updating, but it was clean and functioning. 3) the noise... errm, hello? you do realise you booked a trip to New York right? The one place in the world where if the traffic isn't moving people blast their horns? We were only a couple of floors up, and just around the corner from the main street and I slept fine (and I'm a light sleeper). If you have trouble sleeping wit traffic noise, bring earplugs if you're THAT sensitive. Remember, YOU'RE IN NEW YORK!! Overall, any problems we encountered were fault of Expedia, not the Roosevelt. I just wish the price wasn't so high as I would love to go again at the end of this month to see the refurbishment, but I just can't afford it this time around. It's worth the money though.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: travchargia
Reviews.Content: I have been to NYC many times and this is probably the worst place I have stayed. This includes the fact I have stayed with my poor college friends in the past. The lobby is dressed up but the furniture is nasty. RUDE RUDE STAFF. They don't put bottled water in your room or have a minibar. The courtyard marriott at least does that and thats half the price. I would equate the lobby to being in a bus station. THe restroom in central park was cleaner than the lobby restroom. THE ROOM IS STANK. Nasty stained carpet that stinks, mysterious stains on the nasty bed spread, hairs in the tub. The concierge doesn't know anything, suggested a "nice girls breakfast" at Ann Mollies, some sewage smelling bar around the corner. I would spend the extra 50 bucks a night for a nicer room. The only positive...and this is a stretch, is you don't want to be in the room so you busy yourself all day long so you can pass out and not think about what might be in the sheets. Sorry for the negativity but its very true. Yuck

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Houston_traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a good location. I would not recommend the breakfast buffet based on price. My wife and I had the breakfast buffet at a cost of $66. Room and bathroom small but clean. The bed was very comfortable. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Travels to NYC”
Reviews.Author: scott r
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC and Europe on a regular basis. Set your expectations on the reality of having a smaller room. It is not a 4 star hotel, but it is a very good value. Get a high floor, dont expect a sensational view, but you are in an excellent location. The 5 - 10 minute walk to other attractions will set you free. NYC is safer than a national park, and you'll have a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs upgrades”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Flower
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been in business for a long time, that is obvious by the small rooms and extra small bathroom. The location is great because its right down the street from Grand Central station so it makes getting around the city very easy. The lobby is also very nice and makes you feel like you are walking into a very nice hotel. We were only there one nign which was fine, however, had the trip been longer the stay would not have been so pleasant. For starters, the door was hard to open, and not because the key didnt work, the door was simply hard to push open. My first thought was, I hope there's no emergency that requires us to run out of the room, because if there is, it will be a while before we get out. The iron and ironing board did not work either, we had to call housekeeping which is fine but things like that should be checked on a regular basis. The service was just ok, at no point did anybody try to make our stay any better. We arrived at 6am, we know that check-in is normally at 3pm, however there was no attemp to allow us to check in early. We were told the hotel was full yet there was very little activity throughout the day which made me wonder if that was really the case. The bell boys didnt take our suitcase to the room yet they stood by our side waiting for a tip. Over the hotel was clean and fit the need we had for the night, however, i dont think I'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Taking A Bite Outta The Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: lorrcamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April 2007. It was in a great location. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable and considering we were in NY we slept soundly everynight. The amount of traffic that goes through New York City daily is without question enormous and this hotel was well kept and I would certainly go back....

Reviews.Title: “Bring loads of money americans expect a tip for everything”
Reviews.Author: Bigdaddy12345
Reviews.Content: On first appearance looks great then the staff hit you for tips to the point they ask you for it. Had to change room couldn't sleep very noisy load humming noise out side window from large generator managed to change room only for one on smoking floor what a stink that room was just as noisy. Wouldn't stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very OLD hotel with gaudy decor.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: Had to stay in New York for a night and looked for a decent hotel with good reviews. We chose this one because of previous reviews and the fact that they had a GYM inside thier hotel (I work out EVERYDAY and exercise is VERY important to me). Upon check in, the concierge was VERY rude. Check in is normally 3 pm but 99% of hotels will let you check in early, NOT the Roosevelt. They made us wait in the lobby until 3 pm on the button to get our room keys. Got to the room (located DIRECTLY across from elevators - so ALL night you hear the "ding" from the elevator coming and going) we entered the room which smelled like a moldy, wet towel. Not impressed at all. The decor was very GAUDY and old or victorian looking. The bathroom was incredibly SMALL and left quite a bit to be desired. The glass shelf above the toilet was BROKEN and hanging off the wall. No storage space what so ever in this bathroom! I thought being up on the 12th floor would somehow be "good" since it was further from ground level. NOT TRUE. I heard every horn, beep, whistle, truck, etc...sleeping was NOT easy so you may want to invest in a pair of ear plugs! After not sleeping all night and being wide awake at 5 am, I decided I would get my gym routine out of the way earlyThe gym was impressive. 5 treadmills, a few elliptical machines, a couple bikes, some free weights and some univeral gym equipment. I was in HEAVEN! Nice cold water to drink and a basket of fruit to pick from afterwards. Highly impressed with this little slice of the Roosevelt....the hotel itself however, NOT! In closing, I would not stay here again. I don't think it was worth the money paid, it was noisy, the staff was VERY RUDE and the rooms were old and dingy and smelled like mildew. I am used to a more contemporary style hotel so this one was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: MichelleLyons
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Roosevelt for a long weekend in NY. The location is great for midtown sites and shopping. However, from the moment we arrived, the indifferent staff on reception was a clear indicator of the level of service. Our room was a good size for NY with a king size bed. The bathroom was horrendous and stank of mould - there was no extractor fan in the bathroom or it doesn't appear to be working. No amount of air conditioning would get rid of the smell. We asked for the floor lamp to be fixed while we were there but noone came to the room or even tried to call us about it. There are signs of the hotel's earlier grandeur with the beautiful lobby but it's now sadly crying out for a refurb and I'm afraid I wouldn't recommend the hotel. Such a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Ewwww”
Reviews.Author: Mdennis28
Reviews.Content: Just checked in and the lobby is beautiful, but the rooms are small and dingy. All the furniture is scratched and dinged up Had to call maintenance because the room was not cool, (even though the air conditioner is one of the loudest I have ever heard). When maintenance came the filter they took out looked like it had not been changed...EVER. Will never stay here again. The only saving grace is that everyone has been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: denmar186338
Reviews.Content: just back from staying at this hotel 2Nd year running I suppose room was better than last year but cleaners don't do job well didn't tip as poor stayed for 4 days didn't top up soap etc or towels pretty bad but will probably return next year as location is so good for the rate you pay

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cookielady1
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly. Hotel clean but double beds were very, very soft and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Kujati
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights. The rugs in the room looked like they have bee there a long time. Bathtub had some sticky film in it. Glad I only needed to take a shower. Second day, they did not replace the shampoo bottle, a used hand towel was left on the floor in the room. Plastic insert was not replaced in the ice bucket. The worst part: Last morning upon checking out, I asked to door man to hail a cab. I was second in line in back of a ederly couple. Their cab stopped and the door man opend the door. The elderly gentelman handed a tip as he enter the cab. The door man looked at this hand, and droped 3 quarters on the street by the cab and walked back to the sidwalk. I admitt it may not have been much of a tip for NYC standards, but maybe that's all the old man could afford. To me .75 cents is nothing to be thrown away. I grabbed my bag and walked away. Poor, Poor example of a Hotel Door man.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Hiranava C
Reviews.Content: We were at The Roosevelt in April this year. Location wise it's great. Allotment of our room took time.We were told that the room was being readied as the earlier guest/ s had checked out late. After having waited long, the room that we got was pretty sad, it was dark and small. I suspect it was the front desk staff's way of getting back at us as, I had complained about the delay The other staff however were polite and helpful. Would I visit The Roosevelt again? Perhaps, provided they renovate the rooms and checking in is smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: dmarcus163
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended up at this hotel based on a Priceline 3 1/2 star win. The reviews I read on tripadvisor did not accurately describe the hotel. We found it to be in a great location, affordable, hotel has upgraded itself through construction upgrades, and a fine nice hotel. The lobby is very comfortable when entering as well. The room was in good shape. We were on the 4th floor and were told this was one of the floors where remodeling had been done. We won the bid for $190 night from 9/16 until 9/19 and would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: erinleagh
Reviews.Content: Okay, everyone complains about how old the hotel is. That's part of the charm! I do agree that the facade and lobby create this expectation that your room will be just as grand. Not quite the case, but it is very comfortable and the beds are heavenly! The location can't be beat! So cool that they had the forethought of building a tunnel from the hotel to Grand Central. The staff was friendly and helpful with the exception of the concierge, which I really don't get since I'm sure there are plenty of helpful people who would love his job. If you like cocktails you MUST visit Homero in the lobby bar! The rooftop bar is beautiful...nice staff up there as well. The book in your room has fasinating info regarding the history of the hotel. It's been in lots of movies! Hope you enjoy as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy overpriced and unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: backnumber
Reviews.Content: I got to this hotel later than I had hoped, I'd misunderstood the google map directions. I got there, the conceige demanded (no other word for it) my passport and my credit card. Id have walked out there and then had I not prepaid. The foyer and the facade of this hotel are magnificant. My room was not. I was kept awake much of the night by a very noisy airconditioning unit. There were no tea/coffee making facilities, there was no free internet in the room, all the services listed in the hotel directory were very pricey. IT had no pool. Indeed it was worse than a 3rd rate country motel, with only one good feature apart from its external appearance- it is central to most things of interest in New York

Reviews.Title: “Tradition!”
Reviews.Author: ppfiuza
Reviews.Content: I like´d The Roosevelt. Good, Reliable Hotel, Old Fashioned.A New York's classic. Clean, efficient staff, real good location. Large rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: wheelswillroll
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite attractive and had wonderful personal service. As a handicap patron, all of my needs were easily met. The rooms, although small, are quaint and serve the purpose for sleeping or relaxing with the t.v. or Internet. However, Internet services are not free. We slept great. The location is phenomenal! We plan on staying there again our next stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “It was very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Corona22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for eight days in August, 2011. We were booked into a Cozy Queen room, but were upgraded to a King when the room did not have the room safe that was advertised. Good ting as the Cozy Queen is well named! It was small (we had been warned that New York hotel rooms can be small in the older hotels). There is small and there is SMALL! The King room was perfect for our needs. That aside, it was a great hotel. Very conveniently situated one block from Grand Central and about a ten minute walk to Time Square. The hotel staff was very friendly and very professional. When we return to New York we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy! 3 cockroaches in room over three night stay.”
Reviews.Author: goombie
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, aircon unit ancient and clogged with 15 year of human detritus! Gross! Lumpy beds, duvets and pillows all bunched and lumpy due to age. Peeling wallpapers, nasty soaps, shampoos etc DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! Whole place needs gutting and fully refurbishment. VILE VILE VILE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: jsh44320
Reviews.Content: The best thing this hotel has going for it is the location. If you want to walk to Times Square and the theatre district, then this is a good place to stay. While the lobby is beautiful, the elevators are painfully slow, so be prepared for long waits. Rooms are small and dark and bathroom is tiny as well with no room for your personal belongings, making it difficult to brush your teeth, put on make up, etc. COSI across the street was convenient for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite in nyc”
Reviews.Author: ellijayjeff
Reviews.Content: you couldnt ask for a better location, sometimes in manhattan you cant sleep but at this Madison ave location you can...Room is kind of small but the emenities are fantastic. The roosevelt to me is the only place to stay..FANTASTIC service all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “An average business option”
Reviews.Author: Viajantes-75
Reviews.Content: The room was small and dark but comfortable enough. One member of staff on reception was particularly rude and we had to wait in order to have a non-smoking room. The location was central and the overall experience was OK. It's not an attractive option for a romantic trip but is decent enough for business.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place"”
Reviews.Author: crazyirish50
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in NYC. 1 block from grand central station. A few blocks from times square. Walking distance to central park. The hotel is beautiful inside. The rooms are small, but we did not spend much time in the room anyways. Drinks at the bar in the hotel are expensive, but what in NYC isn't. Would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, in spite of Hurricane Irene!”
Reviews.Author: FLAlady50
Reviews.Content: What are the chances of leaving my home in FL, going to New York, only to have Hurricane Irene and Tropical Storm Lee arrive there? In spite of very unusual weather circumstances in a city with NO public transportation for 36 hours, the Roosevelt rose to the occasion. They provided breakfast, lunch and dinner for us, when there were no other restaurants open in the city! Many employees spent the weekend at the hotel so that they could provide continued, excellent service to the guests! How many places have that kind of loyal employees?!?! The rooms aren't fancy and could use a facelift, but they are clean. The staff is what makes this place SO special! From the smiling faces at the front desk to the breakfast staff, particularly Tomas, Juan & the chefs making fresh waffles & any type of eggs requested, you couldn't ask for anything more! Oh, the location is perfect ~ two short blocks to Grand Central, six blocks from Broadway shows ~ you don't need to take a cab! I'll go back at this hotel every time I'm in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bubblesgalore1
Reviews.Content: Staff was very welcoming and professional. Room was nice (small, but we don't spend too much time in the room anyway). Bed/bedding very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hassle”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York multiple times a year on business. I've never stayed at the Roosevelt. For $350/night, my room did not include internet access (additional $15/day) and the bathroom wasn't large enough to even really stand inside without the door open. It was literally probably 8'x4, and that included sink/vanity/shower/toilet. The desk in the room was crooked/lopsided, which explains why their wasn't a writing utensil to speak of - of course if they'd have left a pen or pencil I would have been able to see the desk's lopsidedness because the pen I brought with me rolls right off the side. The desk chair is broken, and the television gets spotty service. On top of that, early check-in is not allowed and once you're in the hotel before 3pm the bell hops insist on taking your bags to your room, requiring an additional tip. Do yourself a favor and avoid staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience, bad service, we'll never come back again”
Reviews.Author: ArfajH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel for three nights; the front desk staff are not friendly, rooms are very small, corridors are narrow and not sufficiently enlightened. With too many rooms in each floor, you feel completely unsafe in case of any emergency. The only good thing, beds are clean and comfortable. Comparing to its rates, it doesn't deserve more than 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of New York with an incredible location and decent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Counse
Reviews.Content: When you stay here, you're paying for 2 things: 1) location, and 2) a bit of history. The Roosevelt has a classical lobby and staff. At $200/night for a 4-person room, the value is quite good. The location is impeccable. What you won't get is complete cleanliness or aesthetics. The rooms are decent - not tiny, not disgusting - but the HVAC system seems to be quite old. Two of us woke up with itchy throats and runny noses. Furthermore, the bed sheets had what appeared to be blood stains everywhere. They were freshly laundered, but it was still quite unprofessional to let something like that slip. The staff were a toss-up. On several occasions, I tried calling guest services and waited more than 10 minutes for somebody to pick up. One concierge didn't know if they had a business center, so they sent us down the block to Staples. (They do have a business center, though it's tiny and Internet usage is expensive.) Overall, I'd recommend the hotel if you're nostalgic and value location over amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Nice room and great location!”
Reviews.Author: J L
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, service and great location. Beautiful lobby area and we happen to be there when there was a wedding and everything looked beautiful! Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: wwrrkd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for a week in August 2011. We were upgraded to a suite that was spacious and clean. The staff knew our names quickly and were very friendly. We also had a lot of family and friends staying at the hotel because we were all going to a wedding there, and everyone only had great things to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Gilaad M
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel in NYC. It is a beautiful place, but a little dated and the rooms are in need of some remodeling. That said, the staff was attentive, the location incredible, the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Midtown East”
Reviews.Author: Macmanmk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights on a business trip to New York. The rooms are small (just about every room in Manhattan is) but comfortable. The bathrooms, while clean, are badly outdated. There was only a microscopic shelf on which to rest toiletries. I had a corner room and heard very little noise except when the door in the adjacent room was opened and closed. The controls for the air conditioning system were spot on accurate and I had no problem keeping the room ice cold, which is how I like it. I didn't eat in any of the hotel restaurants, but I did have a few drinks in the lobby bar, which is excellent...wood paneling everywhere and stuffed chairs compliment the ample bar seating. The lobby has a definite touch of early 20th century elegance...it is a popular spot for television and film production. During my stay there, there was evening and overnight film shooting for The Good Wife. It provided excellent people watching if that is your thing (it isn't mine), but the film crews were not obtrusive. The location is excellent...merely two blocks to Grand Central Terminal, a five minute walk to Rockefeller Center and a ten minute walk to Times Square. Madison Avenue is always bustling at any time of the day or night...safety could hardly be less of an issue here. I picked up a discount code on the hotel's Facebook page and stayed there for $179/night on three weeknights. There may be cheaper options in Midtown East, but I don't think the value would be the same.

Reviews.Title: “will def be back !!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahkennington
Reviews.Content: Was very nervous after reading the reviews of this hotel but it was truly fabulous . The location was excellent and our room was a really good size. Some say the rooms are small but with so much to do in the city why are people in the rooms that long anyway ??? The lobby was gorgeous and we will def be returning. Find it incredible what some people find to complain about on these sites. Food is a little overpriced but its New York - no one forces you to use the restaurant . A lovely hotel with character and charm .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely hotel, I'll be back !”
Reviews.Author: LUIS R
Reviews.Content: I stayed last week at Roosevelt Hotel with my family (6 in two double rooms), The hotel is in a great location, front desk’s ladies are very friendly, Staff attention was excellent while Irene Hurrican event. Lobby is gorgeous and comfortable. Room service is a little bit expensive, rooms are too small; especially if you bring large luggage. TIP: Follow Roosevelt Hotel at Facebook or Twitter: @RooseveltNYC and you will be able to get a complimentary Internet access during your stay and avoid $14 daily charge.

Reviews.Title: “great asian food nearby”
Reviews.Author: Noah B
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, location is OK. Stayed 2 nights and will definitely return on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and charming building!”
Reviews.Author: ajanthony
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for business and then extended for a girls weekend. Yes, the rooms are small. A cozy queen is truly "cozy". This did however give the place a more European feel. Was a little tight for two girls sharing a room and bed with our suitcases and clothes everywhere. Staff was friendly enough. Roof top bar is a must. I went up one evening after meetings by myself. Almost walked out as it didn't have a real welcoming feel for dining/drinking alone but the servers made me feel right at home and took care of getting my food and drinks quickly. An episode of The Good Wife was shot in the lobby while we were staying here. Kind of neat of you're not a native New Yorker and used that. Was fun to hang out by the wall and watch! Also, great fitness center with free apples!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jessicccaa
Reviews.Content: Rooms are too small. I was sharing with my brother (17) and my parents, in a room we were told would be big enough for us all, but it was not. Beds are small. Air conditioning is SO loud, tied in with the hustle and bustle of manhattan at night ( which is only to be expected), this did not make a good nights sleep. On arrival we were told we were being upgraded to a deluxe room (a lie if you ask me) so I can hardly imagine what the standard rooms are like. Generally the place is Outdated and has a musky feel except for the beautiful hotel lobby. The most frustrating thing over all has to be the wi-fi. Yes there is wifi in every room, but at a ridiculous price. It was $15 for 24 hours for one device. However, the location is excellent, especially the proximity to grand central, and we saw sacha baron Cohen there filming his new film, so it wasn't all bad.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Longtravellers
Reviews.Content: When you arrive you are impresed by the lobby, then you get to your small room and dated room, having stayed in New York several times in the Park Central, Wellington and Dylans this came off in last place, lifts were slow and food over priced. There are better places to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Benesis1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel for 3 nights and found it to be quite comfortable. Hotel room was average but very clean. Lobby is gorgeous. We went to the rooftop lounge Mad&46 and found the drinks, at $15.00 + tax each to be outrageously priced and nothing great about the lounge. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most misses a few hits”
Reviews.Author: aquachic
Reviews.Content: Was quite appalled at the lack of fridge, lack of tea and coffee sachets, hot water flask - basic amenities i would expect in a hotel located in Manhattan.... Also our room has a very big aircon that groans noisily throughout the day and had seen better days in the 1970s? Corners of the room was dusty and sneeze-inducing. the bed was far too soft and had bad support. toilet was too small, similar to that of the size one would expect to get at a budget hotel. wardrobe had a musty smell. Lifts were slow and too small. If you decide to stay, dont have too high an expectation... The saving graces are the friendly staff. and a beautiful reception area. The gym is clean and has modern equipment, not to mention a fruit basket with bananas, apples etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleased At All”
Reviews.Author: Brad W
Reviews.Content: Hotel is VERY dated. Room was a little nasty. Two different colors of wallpaper seamed together. Nasty old carpet. Bed was Ok. Telephone wires were hanging out of the wall. Air conditioner was older than I am. Regular TV with regular cable. Not like the hilton where you can rent movies and watch certain things. Its satellite and it was CONSTANTLY cutting out. Bathroom had nasty old tile and grout. Toilet was old everything was just BLEH. Seriously I gave it a solid 1/5

Reviews.Title: “Room was Clean & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: sflanative62
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom stayed at the Roosevelt for 2 days in July and it was great!. After reading some reviews online I was a little worried about bed bugs, but our mattresses looked brand new, the beds were extremely comfortable and the entire room was squeaky clean. The only thing that would have made the room perfect was a coffee maker! There are several places to get coffee next to the hotel, but it would have been nice to have coffee in the room. It was ridiculously expensive to order coffee from room service so we just walked next door to a lovely little cafe that served excellent coffee. I wish I could remember the name. The location of the hotel is very nice because it is in a quiet location, yet you can easily walk a few blocks and you're in Times Square. We got to the hotel early and they had no problem holding on to our luggage until our room was ready. The lobby was a bit crowded and noisy, but it was a busy hotel! Once we got to our room, it was quiet. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely lobby with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: JudifromBoston
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a lovely hotel in what I think is a perfect location. It is close to the theater district and midtown, yet it is quieter than most hotels in the area. A well-equipped fitness center is important to me and the Roosevelt has it- machines, free weights, water and even fresh fruit. The room was small but had everything I needed and in NYC, you don't really spend a lot of time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, old but clean with character. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Quanita42
Reviews.Content: A very decent hotel. Great location near (just a few blocks) Grand Central, front desk service is excellent. Clean room. Would stay here again. Big rooms, comfortable bed. Lobby is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, best possible location”
Reviews.Author: backpacker-couple11
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel over Christmas and really could not have asked for better (maybe a tree in the room for Christmas morning, but you can't have it all!). The foyer was all decked in Christmas lights and trees, very beautiful, and the rooms were lovely and comfortable and clean.
