The location is fantastic, its right on Madison Avenue and right in the middle of Manhattan - only a few blocks from Times Square. One downside is that there is no breakfast included, but Planet Hollywood in Times Square by far do the best breakfasts you could ask for and at really low prices (we were surprised as we assumed everything was going to be really expensive). The only negative thing about the hotel is the attitude of the staff - they don't have that same American-style 'have a nice day' attitude that you find everywhere else on the island. But, from what we have been told this is pretty common in the hotels. Highlight of the trip was the Empire State top of the tower - pay the extra to go to the very top and definitely do it at night, the view is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, unless you love shabby rooms, Attitude! Dirt and bugs.”
Reviews.Author: Dee L
Reviews.Content: Was excited to stay since the location is fantastic. Walking distance to many major NYC attractions, shows, etc. Bell and restaurant staff are friendly BUT Beware the Front Desk employees. The website shows beautifully appointed rooms, But the reality is far from the truth. Antiquiated air conditioners make for stifling rooms. Chipped bathroom tiles, queensized sheets on king sized beds leave you fighting with the bottom sheet all night. The lack of bathroom exhaust fans are like being in an unwanted sauna. The ecologically friendly light bulbs hang below the shades, are too big for the lamps and provide a blinding glare when turned on. The bathrooms have dirt rimmed shower doors and dirty grout. When we asked to change rooms we were rebuffed by one Desk Clerk. Finally after much hassle we did switch rooms. Unfortunately the only difference was a larger space, but this one had an ant colony in the bathrrom.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like your life depends on it”
Reviews.Author: renoopS
Reviews.Content: We just checked into this hotel an hour ago, we're now back on tripadvisor searching for somewhere else in NYC to stay! The staff are discourteous and unprofessional. The bag handler dragged my luggage down a set of stairs, loosening the handle. Room smells like chlorine, loud air conditioning, loose toilet seat, no view (which is fine, but this wasn't the cheapest room on offer). As a kicker, the Wifi is $14 USD / night PER DEVICE, so if you have 2-3 gadgets like we do, you're in for an extra $42/night for this 'service'. Do yourself a favour and find a better managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it! But my travel buddy didn't!”
Reviews.Author: JW75_11
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a lovely throw back to what New York Hotels use to look like. Very Grand. The friend I traveled with hated it and saw nothing but a run down hotel. Yes some of the furniture were cheap and made to look grand but i didn't take anything away from my experience there. Great location. Did the job for us but if you just want modern hotel deco then this is NOT for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: taylorshepard
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Great location. Good staff service. Couldn't have asked to have been treated any better. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, but it was before the actual check-in time and the staff kindly held our luggage and we were out and about for the day. The promptly telephoned the minute the room was ready. No wi-fi though, but not really a major inconvenience since we were there for leisure and not business.

Reviews.Title: “Average accomodations but great location.”
Reviews.Author: ChopSooey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a reserved room block (wedding). Check-in was a breeze despite the large line. I don't know the category of room but we had a basic room with a king bed (15th floor with no real view). The room is on the smaller side and it is dated. The bed was comfortable and the linens were clean. The bathroom doesn't have much counter space and needs updating. Good water pressure in the shower. Location is great with Grand Central station right across the way.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Decadent: a Decently-priced, Unremarkable Base in a Fantastic Area”
Reviews.Author: SNHUK
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel is easily the lobby area: New York smart, fresh and adorned with chandeliers. The charm and elegance of the Roosevelt stops there though. Whilst not dirty, our small room was worn and dated with what appeared to be an ancient air conditioning unit which was clunky and noisy. The air conditioning, moreover, left the sheets slightly damp. The bathroom, whilst perfectly acceptable, also had the trappings of yesteryear and was pokey and worn. The hotel is in a fantastic location though, abutting Midtown and about ten minutes walk from Central Park. If you a looking for a decent value, unremarkable base to crash after a long day's sightseeing, this could be an option. If, however, you're looking for something a bit more, you certainly won't find it at the Roosevelt. A final tip: the only double-room available at the time of check-in was on a smoking floor. Avoid at all costs: what felt like decades of tobacco smoke hung in the air.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to all the attractions and no signs of bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLadybug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt from the 15th to 18th of July for a fun filled girls weekend. We were able to check in early which was much appreciated. We stayed in a deluxe double double. The room was small and was clearly in need of some repair. The furniture is very tired. However the room was clean and there were no signs of bed bugs. All of the hotel staff we dealt with were very friendly and the location can't be beat. Mad 46 was a great way to start an evening. The view is nice, the atmosphere warm but the waitresses are frosty and the drinks expensive. Still worth stopping by. This would not be my choice of hotel for a romantic getaway but it was perfect for a ladies weekend. I wasn't so impressed that I would want to pick this hotel for my next trip to NY but I wouldn't rule it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and elegant hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: MiamiFirefighter
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel has been restored to perfection. The rooms are comfortable, but the best thing about this hotel is its location. Very close to Grand Central, near the park, and the subway so that getting anywhere in the city becomes accessible easily. The room rates are not exorbitant, which is unusual in NYC when the hotel is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Never going back”
Reviews.Author: Francesca L
Reviews.Content: I had to ask to change rooms as the first room I had was damp and smelled awful. They moved me to anther room after two nights, which had the same smell and was damp and mouldy. The whole floor smelt of damp and mustiness. The air conditioning was very old and very noisey and would wake you up. After 5 nights in the hotel and had developed a chesty cough from the poor conditions of the rooms. Please don't stay here, you will be very dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; A Bit Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: binowest
Reviews.Content: Typical to average pricing for Manhattan. Beautiful lobby with a great location. Once you get to your room on the slow elevators (especially around the dinner hour) it is a rather small room. The carpet needed replacing (a bit thread bare) and the bathroom could use a face lift. Hotel service and all employees that I met at the Roosevelt are more than accomodating, making up for the fact that the rooms need a facelift. Room service was perfection, although I was not impressed with food in the restaurants within the hotel. A fun bonus; while there, it appeared that the entire Sunday was spent making a movie outside the front entrance of the hotel. I believe they were shooting the next Borat movie there. Interesting to see the process and the 14 hour day that actors put in, bathed in humidity and 100+ degree temperatures the entire time. Gotta love the craft, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but in need of refresh”
Reviews.Author: gary_hilliard123
Reviews.Content: Myself and family stayed at this hotel from 24th July until 28th July 2011. The hotal is in a superb location and is within walking distance of a number of tourist attractions - Empire state building, grand central station, rockefeller centre, central park etc. The hotel has a very grand entrance and gives the impression of being a good quality hotel. However, our room was in need of some decoration and a refresh. The biggest problem we had with the hotel though was we think the bed had bed bugs. My wife developed several bites on our return to the UK on her arms/legs. Having looked on the internet they appear to be the work of bed bugs. I did email the hotel twice to complain on our return to the UK but have not had any response. I am now dealing with the matter through our travel agent. The air con was really noisy also so had to be switched off at night. Not ideal when outside temperatures were 85 - 90 degrees. The hotel was good value for money and was a good base for all site seeing etc. Although there were one or two issues it did not spoil our time in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masdks
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel a few times and keep coming back. Its in a great location and an easy walk to Times Square, Grand Central, 5th Ave shops and the Rockefeller center. The staff are always friendly and the rooms are comfortable. I love the lobby and the bar is a great place to relax and have a cocktail. During the Christmas holidays the lobby is beautifully decorated with a huge Christmas tree.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice lobby, but after,is this hotal falling in ruin?”
Reviews.Author: Duzum
Reviews.Content: After arrived in the room # 948 we requested a change because carpet was disgusting and stinking. We finally obtained one... with an extra charge only. Is it normal to pay for that? Pricing is dark: if you pay for an internet access, the hotel will charge what is the higher amount seen by me: about 14$ per... device per day (think to that if you use your lappy+Ipad+phone...), + 1$ for each luggage to vallet after check-out, + the anounced price for going to airport at $65 reached to $75 after arrival to airport... Otherwise, well situated hotel, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: hammie1977
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty good hotel, clean and comfortable. As other reviewers have pointed out, the bathroom was kind of small, but hey - it's NYC! The bed was very comfy, the aircon worked and we had no issues with street noise. We also had no hassle with the lifts and never had to wait too long. Can't comment on food as we never ate there. It's biggest bonus is it's location - tons of stuff within easy walking distance and Grand Central just a couple of minutes away. Plus, when we were there they were filming a movie in the hotel (Man on a ledge) so that was kind of cool! if we were lucky enough to return to NYC I'd certainly consider staying here again as the location was pretty hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “It´s a very beautifull hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Carla S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at roosevelt hotel last week and we check out on sunday (11/07). Unfortunately we forgot a pairs of gloves at the room. Could you send me? We stayed at room 540 and my name is Carla Silva from Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: realgc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel July 15-18, 2011. The hotel was nice and clean. we had no issues during the night with noise. The hotel is walking distance to 5th Ave shops, Grand Central, Central Park, Empire State Building, Rockefeller, Time Square, etc. Anytime we were too tired to walk we took a cab and it cost no more than $6.00. A previous review was right in saying that if you don't pull up in a chauffeured car the bell boys pretty much ignore you. If you don't mind carrying your own luggage up to your room this hotel will be just fine. I got a cheaper rate through hotwire.com.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: fivefromboston
Reviews.Content: Our room was great. We booked the double deluxe for a mother/daughter trip for two teenage girls and their moms and it was quite spacious. So go for the deluxe, skip the cozy, no brainer!!!!. After reading the reviews we were nervous about the room being too small and not clean. No need to worry at all. It was fabulous. The lobby is breathtaking. The rooms do need some updating but ours was fine. We even had a large walk in closet to use as a changing room. I have no complaints at all with the bathroom or the beautiful comfortable bed. The staff, especially the concierge origianlly from FallRiver and the doorman Bernard were super helpful!! !We even got a late check out with no issue at all. Location is great, not on top of Times Square or the shows but close, although after walking all day it can seem far! We really got a great deal for this room and it was perfect. Don't believe the bad reviews. We were concerned and I would return tomorrow and recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “We will think about it”
Reviews.Author: papounik
Reviews.Content: + Best location,very gentle staff at the reception and the cleaners. - Not prepared rooms for our reservation, noise at the room because of problem with window. We ask for late out for one of our rooms and we get the answer that the Hotel was sold out. I check this about availability through internet of the hotels official site and i found available rooms!!!!! The worst thing was this: i left on the table at the lobby my coffee,a glass of water and my sunglasses for three minutes because of emergancy reason. When i return to the table i found nothing!!!!! So next time i will think about it.

Reviews.Title: “5 star lobby, 2 star everything else!”
Reviews.Author: reviewerC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights. The plusses were the location, lobby and most of the staff. We were unfortunate to be staying at the same time that a feature film was being recorded. This resulted in the reception areas to be extremly crowded and noisy. Getting an elevator was difficult given all the people involved in the film. We were told on check in that they were 'over booked' and this resulted in us being allocated one of their standard rooms which was small, tired and worn and the bathroom was tiny and grotty. We were extremly disappointed with this given the price we paid. Overall the accommodation aspect of the hotel compares poorly with other hotels we've stayed in (of a lower price and similar location) in Midtown. It badly needs freshining up. We won't be recommending nor returning.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hall, terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: mistok72
Reviews.Content: The hall and the entrance are five stars ones, even too glamorous for the price paid. Since the price is not as high as for a five stars hotel anyway this imples that a lot of tourists are clearly out of scope, in such a luxurious framework. The worst thing in the hotel is by far the rooms condition: absolutely terrible. In the room I booked, a so called "cosy" room for three people, the overall space was enough scarcely for one, and the bathroom was maybe the one when the hotel was built, in the 1930's. The sink was broken and dirty, the tub with the oldest shower I've ever seen was yellow (maybe in the 1930's it was white...). So go to this hotel only if you don't find anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ----- BUT”
Reviews.Author: leafpeeper-supreme
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 3 night stay (03aug 2011 to 06aug 2011) at this hotel.I travelled with my 14 year old grandaughter for a 3 day shopping spree.On arrival I was told we couldn't have a room with two beds despite already having requested it and would need to make do with a rollaway bed in the room ,but that they would definately be able to resolve it the following day.On reaching the lobby the following morning we are then told its not possible we have to stay as we are with the rollaway,after expressing my dissatisfaction we went out to enjoy our day and turned into bed at approx 9.15pm only to be woken at 9.50 pm by the hotel staff actually letting themselves into our room to tell us we were supposed to change rooms.At this stage we declined the move due we were asleep and very tired.the following day we met the manager to advise him of our problems and he did grant us just til 6.00pm on the day we left to check out which amounts to an extra 6 hours.All in all it helped but the intrusion was unforgivable. The good bits were the hotel is in a great location for all you need on a visit to manhattan, the lifts all worked perfectly and no waiting,rooms a little small but this is new york,the room was spotless and I couldn't fault any other aspects.Maybe I was a little unlucky and have to finish saying I would use it again.---------------Bob H

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value but in need of some updates”
Reviews.Author: LoveTaxidia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June 2011 for a few nights during a business trip. Great location next to Grand Central. Great value for NYC but rooms and hallways are in need of major updates. Bathroom is very small and the cleanliness was lost on the fact that the tiles and fixtures were so outdated. Lighting was bad and relied on lots of lamps which was frustrating. Nice gift shop in lobby. Bed was comfortable as were pillows. Did not eat or drink at hotel but lobby bar seemed to be constantly full. Lots of tourists - especially foreign tourists. Would recommend if looking for a centrally located room while visiting the city but would not recommend for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B_villetraveler46
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very smae entry way but the furnishings in your room are very lovely. The shampoo and various other bath products they given you are top notch. The hotel offers advice to any thing you may have a question about in NYC. It is quite a walk from the teather district but can be done if you wear comfortable shoes and are able to walk a good pace. I'd stay here again if the price was comparative to the other hotels in NYC. Anything below $150 is a deal. I have always gotten this hotel when I book it with the airfare attached and then later on find out what hotel I received using Priceline or other search engines.

Reviews.Title: “We hated and won't be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Paolo-of-Gatineau
Reviews.Content: Possible the worst hotel I stayed at... As a frequesnt visoitor to NYC, and around the world, I have stayed in many hotels that were short of normal expectation; however, the Roosevelt tops that list. By far, the most dissapointing aspect was its servuice, especially the Front Desk - which they insist on calling it something else... Almost all of the employees were either ignoreant or rude or both. Any question I had, went unanswered. The staff was completly unaware that they were experienciung a system wide WiFi problem (by the way, I never got my internet access that I desperately needed.) Access to in-house phones were limited or not functioning. When we arrived, our rooms weren't ready, even though it was past 4pm. Once in the room, the brochure picture became a fantasy. The room was sparse and looked very old. The bathroom was very small and had a dirty shower curtain; you know, the one that seems to stick to your skin when showering?? The internet issue was a big issue since reliable access was an important consideration in my selection. There are a lot of lovely hotels in NYC, do not bother with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Tidy, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: NicoleClarke
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel, NY is in a great location (within walking distance of Times Sqaure and Grand Central Station). The hotel itself wan't the cheapest hotel around but for the service and quality you get it is a bargain. The staff were really freindly and helpful. They booked cabs, looked after bags, made phonecalls etc. The room was immaculate, the TV worked, beds were clean and comfortable, there was air con which was great as it was very hot when we went. The hotel itself is very impressive, it has a restaurant, a bar (which is also a Starbucks during the day I think) and the reception is amazing. I would definately recommend The Roosevelt Hotel and stay there again if I were to visit NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: RMH34
Reviews.Content: The location was very good, one block to Grand Central and 5 mins walk to Times Square, everywhere in central Manhattan was easily accessible. (The builders get credit for this, not today's management) Service from the lobby bar staff was very good, they were efficient and extemely polite. Impressive lobby but as a previous review states it appears this is where they focus their efforts as it certainly is not on the bedrooms. What was bad? The attitude of the reception staff, the most rude hotel staff I have come across in all my travels, so rude in fact I'm sure they must have to attend a course to be that rude! The other bad thing was the room, we booked a Deluxe Double Double Luxurious room and I do not know how the hotel have the audacity to give their rooms such grandiose titles for such a mediocre, poor quality room. The ugly? Well the room of course. Paint peeling off the ceiling, an air conditioning unit that sounded like a steam train making it's way up a mountain pass, loose shower head that pulled out of the wall, rusty radiators, dank carpet, dirty windows, tatty mirrors and fixtures, do I need to continue? Also, be aware that you can only use two breakfast vouchers per day even if you are a large family, over two and the rest are charged. It was pointed out that this is explained in the small print on the back of the voucher although as I did not have a magnifying glass on me I was not able to confirm this. The mangement have responded that they are in the process of updating rooms, the reception staff informed us ours had been (paint and carpet) hard to believe given the state of the room but the inside of the closet did smell of fresh paint. The $3000 question (as that is what we paid for 7 nights) would I use the Roosevelt again? If it was just down to having an improved room then maybe so,however, with the brutal rudeness of the reception staff - never again! You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Wife joins husband at the end of her vacation, his work schedule.”
Reviews.Author: 2goodboysmom
Reviews.Content: For some time now, my pilot husband has been staying at the Roosevelt on layovers. I am a nut for NYC and every time he was there and I was stuck at home, he would let me know, "I"m in New York. It's really nice here at the Roosevelt." So at the end of MY week in NYC with my girlfriends, we were able to meet there. The Roosevelt is a lovely, older hotel. The lobby is impressive and the neighborhood, Madison at 45th is wonderful. Our room was small and a little dark, (for pilots who have to sleep during the day, that is a good thing). The two things I liked the most are: the comfortable bed and the lemon soaps in the bathroom. I understand why the airlines contract with this hotel; the rooms are quiet and can be darkened, the location is very good with quick access to the airports. There are many places to shop and eat along Madison. It is a very short walk to St. Patrick's and Rockefella Plaza. If you want to experience what hotels used to be like, the Roosevelt is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location for Times Square, theaters”
Reviews.Author: TripNarrator
Reviews.Content: Our stay was included in a tour, so I can't speak to the price or the reservation/check-in process, though when our tour operator went to the front desk, it was fairly fast getting the room keys for some 40+ people. The room seemed very clean to me and spacious by NYC standards for a basic room. No coffeemaker, which was a bit of a disappointment, but they sell Starbucks right there in the hotel. We had a rotten view, which is normal for us - never any luck in that dept., maybe because we don't scream for one. But we spend little time in our rooms when we travel. Ice machines on every floor which is better than the last NYC hotel we stayed in. Good location - we walked to an off Broadway play, the MOMA Museum (Modern Art) and Times Square easily and there are plenty of restaurants around to choose from. The nearest grocery store seemed to be over on 2nd Avenue. In the summer it is a short walk to the weekend street fairs where they close off the street in one direction and have vendors. The street keeps changing. The bathroom is nice, though there is not much shelf space to store your stuff. The only reason we called the front desk because our luggage hadn't been brought to our room resulted in a quick response. Not much experience with NYC hotels yet, but this was an improvement over the last one, though maybe the price would scare me away if it weren't part of a package.

Reviews.Title: “The class of yesterday with the moderin convinences of today.”
Reviews.Author: parsonhenry1857
Reviews.Content: You can enjoy the history of the Roosevelt and imagen being in the French Connection and where royalty to stars and members of goverment have stayed. I loved it all with even the modern covinces of today. The Roosevelt truely lives up to it's name and is truely New York.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: gilaga
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Good location. Located on Fifth Avenue east of Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Great location; reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: powelltbs
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect spot to stay in NYC - it is close to all major attractions in midtown and steps from Grand Central Station. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and comfortable. You can't go wrong staying here and as an extra bonus you get the sense that this hotel is one of the old historic hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: kwitsil
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in mid-town, and have all the charm of an older hotel..this one is great. Nice staff, larger rooms than normal in NYC...and wonderful location that is walkable to the museums, shops and business locations in Mid-town.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the value”
Reviews.Author: originalcynthia
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here during a conference. When I checked in, I was given an upgraded room as I was traveling with my husband and baby. Despite the upgrade, the room was quite small, but it was large enough to fit the pack & play that was provided for us for our son to sleep in. The bathroom did look a bit dated, but overall, it was clean and comfortable and a better value than any of the other nearby hotels. The lobby and other facilities seemed well maintained. My only big complaint is that the elevators always seemed delayed, despite there being a large number of them, which should've been adequate to accommodate the large number of guests. The location was great -- just a block or so away from Grand Central Station with some cool bars within walking distance. By the way, we took the NYC Airporter to and from JFK and LaGuardia (we flew into and out of different airports), and we were very pleased with the service. The pick-up drop-off location is quite close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay in NYC - if you have a good room...”
Reviews.Author: jeremymmason
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a classic, massive NYC hotel, which seems to cater mostly to large tour groups and airline staff. Everytime I visit, there is a huge queue of pilots and flight attendants, and a large toubus-sized group milling about the lobby. Whenever I have been able to book a larger room () then it has been a pleasant stay. The rooms are all pretty tired, to be honest (nicks on the furniture, some stains on the carpets, some mold residue in the showers, some older drapes, etc), but absolutely no worse than most other older NYC hotels. And the larger rooms are actually pretty large in relation to competitive sets. So do yourself a favor, pay a little extra, and get a better room. The wi-fi can be spotty, based on where your room is (and coverage), but when it works it is pretty fast. The last time I went they had a special with breakfast, which was included in my room rate, and it was a good spread. All in all, for what it is, the hotel is nice for NYC, and I never hesitate staying there.

Reviews.Title: “old fashion charm”
Reviews.Author: weekender023
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a large magnificent lobby with a huge floral arrangement,lovely floor coverings. the bar in the lobby has comfortable furniture. if you get a table near the railing you can literally watch the world go by.the rooms are old fashion but neat and clean. but the cozey queen(bed is small. the hotel is close to grand centeral terminal and the subwa.y also a short walk to times square..

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: SennamanUK
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Roosevelt? Great hotel, Great location 5 minutes walk one way to Grand Central And 5th Avenue, the other way 5 minutes walk to Times Square. Ok so you pay a premium to stay in a great location but everything about trhis hotel was Great. Unbelievable Bar Staff, the 2 Tony's were just Priceless, thats the reception bar then there is a roof bar which is great too. The hotel is pretty plush, the breakfast was excellent, rooms were spacious although a bit Tired in places but that could account for the traffic as I am sure the hotel enjoys full occupancy 7 days a week. All in all Great Hotel and Great location, would recommend to any traveller going to New York

Reviews.Title: “Only had to kill one cockroach!”
Reviews.Author: Ronnewton
Reviews.Content: Room was really small for a suite, thought it would be big enough with kids. Room was pretty clean but the matresses were worn out and sofa pullout was tiny. The lobby makes it look better than it is. Had to kill a huge cockroach in the tub the last night, would have moved of I had seen it on night one.

Reviews.Title: “Really great, well maintained old school hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuntieCol
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a great hotel. The rooms were squeaky clean, the bed was very comfy and the rate was fantastic! Sometimes picking a hotel in NYC in this price range can be stressful... I didn't know what I was getting myself in to when I picked it. We were thrilled! Though it is on the east side, it is a very quick walk to the Theatre district. Great for those going to NYC to see shows. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: SaraNorman
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, old and cozy, yet luxurious! One can feel the 1920's New York is already in the lobby. The bar is super nice and the staff offers quick and easy light meals for a cheap penny. Today's soup with bread and a beer can be recommended. The rooms are not destroyed by the renovation. Baseboards and doors feels like 1920's but the beds are modern and comfortable. A hotel for us who appreciate the genuine, of us who love the real New York. There is no plastics, no 2000's junk, brass, marble, carpet, fresh flowers & staff in hotel uniforms :) Even the mailbox is beautiful. The only thing that is not as nice in appearance is the roof bar. It is a little "plastic" ... but clean and fresh. We would have appreciated if it also had 1920tals feeling like the rest of the hotel. Summary: Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “outdated, over-rated. In poor order”
Reviews.Author: MJDBMW
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel was touted as a 4 star hotel by Amex - this is not the case as confirmed by their Director of Guest services AFTER our trip. The room was severly outdated and grubby and had a terrible musty smell. The bathroom was a particular disgrace, even the toilet was loose! Staff were completely unenthused and were unable to assist us with a room change, we were on a wedding trip therefore on a tight schedule in and out of the hotel. There was a benefit to staying there though should a would be traveller read this - being in such a great location means that there is plenty to do in the vicinity rather than hang around the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: looniewise
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a historical hotel with old world charm, but I was a little disappointed. The hotel lobby was dark; it showed its age, not much grandeur. Our room had the street view and was quiet. Room was small and decor was dated. Bathroom was tiny. We did appreciate the location of the hotel. It was central, close to Time Square, but not as crowded as the hotels there. Grand Central Station was just a few minutes away. We went over to visit our friends staying at Grand Hyatt. Their room was much smaller than ours in Roosevelt. I'd rather stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: RoxPB
Reviews.Content: We planned a fun girls weekend for 4 friends in New York City! Our package included air and 3 nights stay at the Roosevelt Hotel. Based on earlier reviews, we were somewhat apprehensive about what we would find. What we did find was a quiet, cozy, clean and comfortable home-base for our girls weekend. The room was on the small side with a decent sized bathroom, 2 queen size beds and a small closet. We had no problem making it work as 4 close friends. The room, hallways and common areas were very clean and the lobby was absolutely stunning. The location was excellent - close to Grand Central Station and Times Square. Most importantly, our biggest fear of discovering bed bugs was completely unfounded. Overall, the hotel was lovely, central, clean and the room completely met our needs for a fun weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Great lobby and great location. I always enjoy staying here. The hotel has great energy in the lobby. The rooms are small like all hotel rooms in New York, but they are very plush. The beds are high and comfy. The view is great if you get an upper floor room. My company paid for this hotel, but I think it can be kind of spendy.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Roosevelt!!”
Reviews.Author: travelnuts2010
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returend from a vacation to New York City where we stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel. It was such a great location!! Only one block to 5th Avenue and the fabulous shops. Just a few more blocks to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. (Came in very handy when we walked to The Today Show at 4 a.m.) We even walked to Central Park one evening, only about a 30 minute walk that goes very fast with the scenery on 5th Ave. Hotel staff was great, no complaints there. The room wasn't the largest but was certainly clean and updated. For the price and location we most definitely recommend staying at The Roosevelt!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"My favorite spot"”
Reviews.Author: Marlene1953
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, within blocks of Fifth Avenue and 42nd Street, this hotel combines all the things one would want in a hotel -- Service, ambience and close to shopping, theatre district and Grand Central Station and airport bus. Rates are affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we stayed somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: js802002
Reviews.Content: I booked through hotwire thinking we would have a sold 3 to 4 star Manhattan hotel. We were given a room on the 4th floor that was clearly not renovated. Upon arriving into the room there was a strong smell of stale urine and smoke. I called down and asked if it was a smoking room and they said no, and that someone would be 'right up.' No one was right up. The bathroom floor had stains as did the office chair in the room. There was no coffee maker, no iron or nor closet in the room. I had to ask for a coffee maker so I could warm up milk for my baby. It was uncomfortable for my family and I. We wished we stayed somewhere else. Please note I seldom write negative reviews and am usually fairly easygoing.

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: CvilleEater
Reviews.Content: Very pretty lobby. Rooms have clearly not been updated in years. Peeing wallpaper, a little grime here and there, etc. Not dirty, but not terribly nice. Add an extra $15 a night for Internet. My stay was fine, but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good in Parts But Lacking”
Reviews.Author: matthewokane1985
Reviews.Content: When we first got to the hotel it was a beautiful lobby and nice staff. Comfortable bed and good shower and then it started to let itself down with a very very loud ac unit that you cannot turn off. Then their was the toilet that would not stop running which I had 2 ask them more than once to fix. Then after we got the toilet fix the fire alarm decided to have mind of its own and go off time to time and again i had to ask them to fix it more than once, but this did not put us in bad favours with the hotel until we wished to order room service and we were kindly told to go to 5th av and get it Ourselves. Putting this down to bad service that night we continued with our holiday and decided to visit their terrace bar upstairs which was very nice at first then having bar staff refuse to make a simple drink after they previously made one before hand. Overall for the cost of the hotel the service was lacking but the hotel was in a good location for the holiday we wished to have. PS: Not a repeat hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIFIC”
Reviews.Author: Chichibailbonds
Reviews.Content: The website truly doesnt justify the hotel. The rooms are tiny even the SUPER SUPER. We were transfered rooms 3 times due to no availablity, considering I booked reservations 7 monthes prior.. Rooms are old & musky and AC leaks. We took pictures of the bathroom tiles which are barely hanging, the furniture is outdated (1920's)no joke!) & the carpet, lamp shades etc. have all lost there colors. I have traveled much & this is the first time I leave a review. This hotel is truly a 1 star. I was truly disappointed with the hotel & although its in a great location, I will NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: suzukigsxr1000k1
Reviews.Content: On arrival the lobby was very impressive, a good start. Once at the desk staff did not appear interested and quite offhand just asking for a name and cedit card. The room was a reasonable size and very clean. Everyday the sheets and towels looked to have been changed and the room was left very tidy. The location is great for getting around the city, so much within walking distance and Grand Central just around the corner. We stayed for 6 nights and overall had no complaints, the rest of the staff were great and the concierge very helpful with advice about travelling around. The rooms could do with an update, but we were happy with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved and I'll Be back”
Reviews.Author: Robyn084
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked just like the photo's on the internet and I was extrememely pleased with ithe location and the room. Hotel staff were very friendly and housekeeping staff very good at their jobs, every night when I returned to the room it was immaculate and it appeared that they changed the bedlinen every day. The location was a big plus as it was close to everything but away from the crowds of Times Square and downtown. It is an old hotel but beautifully maintained, not like some that post decade old photo's on net and you get the shock of your life when you get there, what you see is what you get. I stayed at this hotel for 17 nights.

Reviews.Title: “No problems here”
Reviews.Author: alwaysthankful15
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews, I was incredibly hesitant of booking this place, but when all was said and done, the hotel was great. The location is AWESOME (which is why we booked it), the staff was very friendly and helpful, and our room was spacious and clean. My only complaint / observation, was that the hallways were muggy and smelled stuffy. Keep in mind, this hotel is not new nor has it been updated; the decor is actually very nice...large chandeliers and lots of ornate details on the ceilings and walls...but, everything is just old. The room was large and clean, the a/c worked perfect, the water pressure and temp was fine, and the hotel was quiet. It's within walking distance to Grand Central Station, Time Square, 5th Ave Shops, St Patricks Cathedral and Radio City Music Hall.

Reviews.Title: “average for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Reginald666
Reviews.Content: The lobby is the best part of the Roosevelt, ornate and beautiful to sit in. Rooms are typical for New York, perhaps a little bigger. Carpets worn, but rooms and linens clean, Old towels. Staff is attentive and competent, but TV has limited channels (no Bloomberg or CNBC). Bathrooms are small, no place to put your stuff. Reasonably good fitness center, open 24 hours Overall, a little less than expected for a business hotel in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Guestess
Reviews.Content: The hotel is steps away from Grand Central and check in was a breeze. After dropping off my bag it was off to see the city. Taking the Times Square Shuttle from Grand Central made navigating the city quite simple. As far as the room is concerned, the Superior was surely not spacious but it was adequate. The furniture is a bit run down but there were real hangers in closet and the shower pressure was great. The bed a bit soft but I tend to prefer sleeping on a slab. The only let down was no coffee-maker in the room. The staff were all very kind and gracious. They even had a dedicated computer for printing off boarding passes. I loved that! All in all, it will be the place to stay for my next trip to Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt. Great Location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: russbarb
Reviews.Content: For 3 ladies on a girls trip, this was a great place to stay. Close to Grand Central, Broadway and Times Square. Plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. I don't have any complaints about this hotel. The double deluxe room fit us in comfortably. Small bathroom, but we managed. Lovely hotel and staff. Would recommend it, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jfield72
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is an older hotel with updated rooms. Our room was comfortable with nice bedding. The bathrooms are small but serviceable. The lobby bar is wonderful with good food and friendly staff. The location is excellent with short walks to Times Square, 5th ave shops and attractions and restaurents.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and value!!”
Reviews.Author: Lostdogs
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Roosevelt for vacation. Contrary to other comments, I found the staff professional and courteous. The location was a few blocks from Times Square, Grand Central and the Rockefeller Center. We had a nice room overlooking Madison Avenue. The decor was fine but dated. I understand they are updating rooms, but probably did not get one because we bought thru Hotels.com. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GoPurple93
Reviews.Content: PIctures looked great, but the guest rooms were disappointing. The furniture was badly bumped and bruised, carpet was worn threadbare, bathtub was chipped, lampshades didn't cover the lighbulbs, and worst of all, the bathroom smelled like mildew covered with bleach. There was no fan or window in the bathroom so it was easy to understand why it would be mildewy. I actually asked if I could see another room, thinking that maybe I had just been put in one of the ones that had not been remodeled. The alternate I was shown was in the same condition as my original room. The front desk person said all the rooms were of the same condiiton. Apparently "remodeled" means a new TV and a couple of new towel bars. I was shocked...that being said, the staff were very nice, and the lobby, bar, and dining room were all charming. The workout room was also very nice. But, it seemed way too expensive given the conditions of the rooms. Also, a friend ordered champagne to be delivered to our room and it never arrived, but my friend was charged for it. It took several weeks to get a credit.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: HuskiesAreCool
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in NYC at the Roosevelt Hotel. We didn't really know what to expect but were pleasantly surprised. All of the staff that we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and well-kept. The location is excellent, right next to Grand Central if you're catching the subway, but also close to many shops and restaurants if you want to walk. The only drawback was no free Wi-Fi access, but then you are not in New York to surf the net.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a decent New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SPTrav
Reviews.Content: Everything was good but not exceptional. A good value. Have stayed on past occasions and would do so again. Close to good shopping on 5th Ave, but not a particularly good location for the better restaurants. Walkable distance to theaters.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Soxfan046
Reviews.Content: They obviously spend what little money they do on upkeep on the lobby. The rooms are HORRIBLE. We paid for a "deluxe" room based on pictures on the website, and it looked nothing like the pictures. No one at the hotel seemed to care about this. Rooms are incredibly small, dirty, are not maintained or housekept well, etc.. I could go on and on, but if it is cheaper than any other hotel in the vicinity that you find - you should ask yourself why that is.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: MissLJH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at Roosevelt NYC. The location is great and you can walk to Times Square and surrounding areas really easily. We booked a superior king room and it was spacious and the bed was realy comfy but... after the first and second night my foot was covered in painful bites - i suspect bed bugs! We complained and were moved rooms at midnight - into a twin as no kings were available, the following morning we had to request to move to another king and had to return to the desk at 3pm. I'd been asked to complete a security form and the hotel management assured me that they would have pest control check the room and give me compensation - I was asked to return to the reception desk the next day - only to be told nobody could speak to me about it until the day after we returned home to England - they told me I would have to call and speak to a different manager! I have no intention of calling America from the UK! Luckily there were no more bites in the room we spent the last 4 nights in. Overall the hotel was nice, good location, rooms were spacious, but hotel staff have no idea about good customer service and expect you to do all the work if there is a problem. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cayman64
Reviews.Content: Returned last night from a 3 night trip to NYC. We stayed at the Roosevelt and loved that we were close to so many attractions. The Grand Central Terminal was just a block away, down Park Ave. Lots of shopping all around the hotel. We saw two plays and both theaters were straight down 45th street. Just a 15 minute walk. Housekeeping staff was very pleasant. The bell hops and the front desk staff were no nonsense. Didn't engage in any more conversation than necessary. Beds were very comfortable. We had a rollaway too. That was comfortable as well. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel but great location!”
Reviews.Author: Fredsson
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel welcomes you with an amazing lobby and cool reception, although the Front desk agents are a bit booring. They do not have the energy that a Hotel like this requires. The room was good and clean but the bathroom was so bad! The pictures from their website are very misleading and they should actually show some real photos from the rooms. The positive thing about this Hotel is the location. It is like a two minute walk from fifth avenue and the same from Grand Central Terminal. If they would hire a couple of service minded Front desk agents and renovate the bathrooms this could become one of the best Hotels in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TXTripper
Reviews.Content: Second time to stay at Roosevelt Hotel. Chose it for its terrific location near Grand Central Station and Times Square and booked rooms at its website for a fairly good rate for 3 nights. Lobby is still beautiful..my family was impressed. Room on 9th floor had not been refurbished yet, but was still clean & comfortable. Bonus -- when we got to room, looked down on 46th St and saw them filming Will Smith in MIB 3. Wow!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Mnmi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for three nights. The lobby is impressive until you look closer. The furniture is old and dirty, but at a glance it looks good. The floor we stayed on (4 th floor) smelled bad the minute we got off the elevator. Smells as if they tried shampooing the carpets and they did not dry out well(very musty). Our room smelled even worse. The minute we opened our door we were hit with the smell of very strong solvent or paint. Not sure what they had done the room did not appear to have been painted anytime recently, it was really bad. The chairs in the room were noticeably dirty and soiled we put a towel over them before we sat on them. The last night in our room the air conditioner quit working in the middle of the night so not only did our room stink but it was hot too We were told the hotel was sold out so no hope of getting a different room so we made the best of it. There were a few nice things at the hotel. The roof top bar was nice. The bouncer at the door was very friendly. The maid that cleaned our room each day was very sweet. When I told her the chairs were so dirty we were using the towels to cover them she gave me and extra sheet. Which worked much better to cover the chairs. The location was very convenient but there are many better options in NYC. In NYC you don't spend a lot of time in your room, but I will not stay here again. When we come back we will go back to the Hilton, the rooms at the Hilton were much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: jmattgardner
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is a very sensible choice for those who are traveling to New York on vacation. It’s located just minutes away from Grand Central Station, which is perfect for travelers who plan on taking the subway. The Hotel staff was very welcoming and the lobby was beautifully decorated. The Hotel rooms are a bit small as well as the bathrooms but they are defiantly worth the moderate price per night. If you are interested in shopping, the hotel has some fine retail shops located on the first floor of the hotel…not to mention you are only minutes away from Fifth Ave. If you plan on going to the hotel bar, it’s best to go early. It gets crowded and will be almost impossible to find a barstool or table. Despite the small rooms and crowded bar area, the Roosevelt Hotel made a good impression with me with its traditional feel and it’s fantastic location. I would certainly stay there again. You can get the best of Mid-Town without paying the Time Square price.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage gem with humorless indifferent staff.”
Reviews.Author: SuburbanHousewife87
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location and had an "old New York" feel to it. Yes, the room was microscopic and out of date, but we knew that going in based on other reviews. We were hoping for one of the renovated rooms, but no luck. My only complaint was the surly staff. The concierge was humorless and seemed annoyed any time we had a question. It got the point that we went to the bell captain for information, which he gladly gave us. We seemed to get the same waiter every time we were in the bar, and he also seemed very put out when we wanted anything. It took an hour to get a toothbrush delivered to the room for one of our group whose luggage was delayed (had to call front desk three times). The amazing location made up for much of these issued, because we were only in the room for showering and sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend and will NOT be back”
Reviews.Author: tikidream
Reviews.Content: Despite the beautiful photos on the web, this hotel is at best a two star one. From check in- my room wasn't ready; to not having towels, a dingy and dirty bathroom, to a LOUD and inefficient air conditioning unit my two night stay was the worst I've ever had! I've stayed at country suites, comfort inns, etc. that were so much better- and several other hotels in NYC that were cheaper and better. Next time I will be at the Marriott Marquis, the Hilton or any of the great boutique hotels in the city. The nicest thing about this place was the fitness center, and I'd only give that an OK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Loctation. Good Hotel. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: DLiss
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was super. Right accross form Grand Central Station and just a few blocks from Times Square. My daughter and I had a mother/daughter trip to NYC for Memrorial Day weekend. We arrived on the Thursday before the weekend and friends joined us that Saturday. I purchaed my travel package with flight and transfer to and from the hotel to the airport through Priceline and I got the hotel at a very good rate. Also got a complimentary upgrade, so our room was huge by New York standards. Bathroom was on the small size, as stated by other reviewers. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again. PS - the bar snacks were addicting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, well located, clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: anacarolHI
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NYC last December right before Christmas and stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel. We LOVED it! The hotel is very nice, beds are super comfortable, room and bathroom is very clean. The room is a bit on the small size, but we had LOTS of luggage (we were visiting family abroad after the stop in NYC) and we could accommodate everything, and we still have space left. We must admit that we got a room deal bidding on Priceline, so we paid way cheaper than the usual rate, but even a more expensive price is worth the cleanness and location of the hotel. Oh, did I mention location? It is a walking distance from Rockefeller center, 5th Ave, Empire State, public library, bryant park, grand central, etc. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying here and would come back”
Reviews.Author: dsrmc
Reviews.Content: I got the hotel through priceline and read the reviews here before coming. Since the hotel got mixed reviews I was a bit concerned about what experience I would have. The hotel is in an excellent location being on 45th and Madison (doesn't get better than this). Also, the hotel itself is an architectural gem with some history. Also, the room appeared to be clean to me. I did not experience some of the problems that other reviewers complained of (hot room, noise from traffic)... room was sufficiently cool and noise from busy traffic outside was not an issue (I was in room 433). My room was classified as a "superior" room with two double beds. The room was a decent size for Manhattan... the reviewers who complained about room size must have gotten the "cozy" room. As far as other services go... I never eat at hotel restaurants so can't speak to that... they did hold my luggage after check out (12:00) so that I could spend a few more hours in NYC before my later flight... but the guys who store your luggage aren't shy about hinting for a tip for this service... but it was a good service. The carpet and wallpaper were a little worn but didn't bother me... it is a classic and classy hotel. I was happy with my stay here and if going back to NYC would look into staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The serives was horrible and the place needs a major renovation”
Reviews.Author: notimpressed02
Reviews.Content: There are so many better hotels in NYC in the same area for the same price don't stay here. The staff was out right rude. Not able to accommodate our request for a superior room although it was books well in advance. The staff asked for tips and if they didn't like what you gave them they told you and asked for more! That happened twice. Also, it's run down. The furniture is very old and needs replacing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: izzle_snizzle
Reviews.Content: Would not stay here again. I realise it is central New York but the lobby was complete chaos and the queue for the checking in desk was massive at all times. After a long flight we arrived at 1pm only to be told by a very unfriendly and miserable member of staff that the room wasnt ready and to come back at 3pm and that we would be in a twin room. As it was our honeymoon we said this was no good and needed a double. We went back at 3pm and were told they couldnt guarantee a time and to come back around 5pm to check if the room was ready. Furious, we walked around town for the next couple of hours, jetlag setting in and needing to freshen up after the flight. We went back at 5pm and was given a room, at last! Oh and what room did we get? A twin! And directly outside the room was the very noisy air conditioning system. We went back and again was faced with more unfriendliness and eventually given a double room! Good location but the hotel was in dire need of updating, was very tired looking and the staff were horrendous. Other than that, New York was a very friendly place outside of the Roosevelt and we had an amazing honeymoon there. Would go back to NYC in a shot but never to the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmzie84
Reviews.Content: We, three people, stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in June this year. The hotel lobby was fantastic but the elevators to the room were very slow. The room was pretty quiet, except air conditioning and sometimes traffic making noise, clean and just the right size but worn. The water pressure in shower was unfortunately unable to be set so it felt like a pressure washer. However, it was easy to adjust water temperature. The large LCD tv was perfect and had many TV channels. We never tried the phone or wifi that was in the room. The beds were great but a bit too soft. The pillows were just right in size and shape. The desk was good to sit on when to send postcards and write letters. The jackets had to hang on your desk chair as a hanger for jackets in the hall was missing. Hotel guests who had ordered room service put out the remains outside the room door. It did not look particularly nice or smelled good for that matter. Perhaps should the hotel be cleaned more often. The hotel location was perfect, close to shops, breakfast restaurants, Grand Central Terminal, Rockfeller Center, Empire State Building, Fifth Avenue, ie, everything a tourist could wish for. It was very easy and convenient to get a taxi outside the hotel. The hotel staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms are being renovated for the moment, but it was not interfering in any way, and will receive new furnishings. Finally, I highly recommend this hotel which is very affordable for being in New York. We never tried the hotel breakfast but if you are looking for a good and inexpensive breakfast, except on Sundays, I can really recommend the restaurant Blake & Todd which is located opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good location but I will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: FredrikOlsson
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 1 1/2 years ago. The location of the hotel was quite good with a close walk to central park and times square. The quality of the hotel however was not so high, the room we got has a view of a brick wall and the bathroom was very small. Do not pay for the internet on the hotel but instead walk 10min to the Applestore at fifth avenue. This hotel did it's work during the week that we was there but that that. We will not stay at this hotel again, for the money spent here I think you can get better value.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite NYC Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luckycharmNyc
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visit NYC a few times a year, and the Roosevelt is our ALL time favorite!! THe classy elegance, the wonderful location and the exceptional service made this the best place to stay in New York...We are already planning our next trip back! Thank you , Mr. Ken Hung, from the Roosevelt for ensuring our stay was the best we ever had.! The California Girls!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfranklin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roosevelt for five days while in NYC for business/pleasure. The location was excellent for business, sightseeing, and shopping. Although the rooms were not the same caliber as, say, a Marriott, they were charming and adequate, and the building is beautiful. The room was a good value, as well, and the bartender in the lobby bar was excellent. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic New York”
Reviews.Author: bargain_hunting
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for a weekend in the city and were very pleased with everything, from the accommodating staff we encountered at the door, to the clean room, to the buffet breakfast... Others have noted that the Roosevelt is not modernized, and that's true, but it is classic New York with lots of charm. Lots of history here! The location is fantastic and the price is reasonable. The rooms aren't that big, but they are on par with other hotels in Manhattan. We will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good service”
Reviews.Author: cros831
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous when we read some of the reviews but were very pleasantly surprised on our stay. Our check in was easy, the room was a good size with a comfortable bed and OK amenities. Yes the bathroom was a bit basic but it was clean with decent towels. A mini bar would have been nice but there are plenty of shops nearby. We were lucky and had a quiet room and the hotel's location is really great. I will be returning in October!

Reviews.Title: “Historic... Or prehistoric?”
Reviews.Author: Roberto_NW_Italy
Reviews.Content: Great location for a hotel that featured in various movies as a classical NY grand hotel... In fact it reminds you of 1920's grandeur as you walk in the lobby.... But it all stops there. My queen room was very narrow and bathroom tiny. Hallways and room smell stuffy as of carpets in need of a deep wash. Minimal toiletries eg. no slippers. Huge and noisy old aircon box. Service is pretentious but unprofessional, far from international standards. On the plus side, I had the best berry covered belgian waffle ever for breakfast... And paid for it dearly. Overall I'll give it a 3 because it's a piece of history, but it's in bad need for a refurbishment. Not good value.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Disgrace!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Madhatta
Reviews.Content: Where do we start? Checking in was simply Abysmal - the very first room we were given had a heavy smell of mould, my wife took two sniffs in the room and then we went back to reception to complain. Fair enough (but suspiciously without quibble or complaint) we were "upgraded" to a room on Madison Avenue. So off we trotted up to the room, and guess what.................. the key card didn't work . So two more trips up and down to the lobby later, we find the twice changed key still doesn't work. Quite helpfully, a member of staff on our floor sees us in distress and comes over to help. He tries at least three times to open the door before it finally works, ( guess we weren't sliding the key car in and out within the requisite 0.006seconds that was required to open up our personal "Fort Knoxx"). By now we are both tired, thoroughly fed up and cheesed off. We rough it for the remaining three days trying our best to enjoy the city whilst avoiding our "hell hole" hotel room. Did I mention mould? Well funnily enough, our new upgraded suite didn't smell like mould............. at first, i guess it was taking its time to mature, but by the time we left, in addition to a loose and shaky tap faucet, our microbial friends had started their own little black mould colony on the bathroom walls. See attached photos. So in conclusion, despite the lovely pictures on their website and the quite impressive lobby, this hotel quite deserve 3 and a half stars. in fact no stars would be appropriate. The front desk staff were neither warm, friendly or appeared particularly interested. In fact so aloof was the receptionist that felt the privilege to stay at this hotel was all mine. And if it all wasn't so bad, The Roosevelt hotel kindly gave us one last parting gift. Having settled our bill in full and in cash, our dear friends in the accounts department not only billed my credit card, but billed me for more money than i owed. Quite helpfully, they billed nearly 1 1/2 times the amount my total bill. This "gift" I didn't get until I attempted to use my credit card on my return home to find that they had not only maxed out my overdraft (without reason) but that a ten day hold on my card prevented me from accessing my account until I, yes i did say I, had to call New York to ask them what the hell they were playing at. So let me just say a very big Thank you to the Roosevelt Hotel, for ruining my honeymoon and spoiling what was otherwise a really good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejames0912
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt in December last year for a last minute trip to NYC. It was my first trip to NYC so had no idea what to expect. I was amazed looking at all the cloud high buildings on our taxi ride in and after a fairly short journey we arrived at the hotel. I have no idea how you New Yorkers drive round this city lol. Its so confusing! Got to the hotel at around 2pm and our room wasnt ready which was a bit poor but didnt bother us too much. The lobby was very tastefully decorated (christmas tree etc) but the staff were a bit abrupt. We had to leave a $100 deposit for the room incase of damage. Did anyone else have to do this?? Room was ready after an hour. A bit on the small side but nothing to grumble about. Beds nice and comfy, clean carpets (my partner is a bit fussy about this). The bathroom was a bit dated but again clean. The whole room, especially the bathroom, was hotter than the core of the sun. Maybe this is a bit of an exaggeration but it was so hot that we had to open the window and put the air con on at night. No joke!! I seemed to forget that the buildings in the city are quite close so when i was walking around naked after getting out of the shower i didnt realise the people in the office over the street may be able to see me lol. The safe in the room was constantly breaking though so we couldnt lock/unlock it but the security guy came up straight away to sort this. Excellent location. We walked more or less everywhere. Nice deli over the road from us for breakfast. Right next door to grand central station. Cant fault the hotel apart from the few points above. Will be returning again and will seriously consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lucia_George
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel for a couple of days (May 13 & 14, 2011) with my hubby and loved it! Mind you, we only used the room for sleeping after exploring the city by foot, so we didn't care much about the amenities or how big or small the room was. Please keep in mind that this hotel is one of the oldest in NY, built in 1924 so don't expect state-of-the art amenities or modern furniture, electronics etc....The room does have a flat screen tv but that's about it. Who cares anyway? You're going to NY to explore the city, not to stay in your room, right? The good thing about it is its location: Madison Avenue and East 45th Street in midtown Manhattan!! Need I say more?!? The room is small but clean, the staff is courteous. The guy at the front reception remembered us when we checked out and he apologized for not being able to check us in before 3pm when we arrived! if that's not good customer service, I don't know what is?!? So what are you waiting for? Book with confidence. You won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Philadelphia_Guest
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from 2 days in NYC. While the hotel was very well located (10 minutes top from Time Square) and our room was spacious and clean, the level of noise from the street prevented us from sleeping. The hotel is older and has not upgraded to newer windows so any noise can be heard from the street. Even with ear plugs and being on the 14th floor we did not manage to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: KPan_11
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little scared about the rooms. The lobby was beautiful, sure, but so were the rooms. Clean, nice size for new york city, a comfortable, blush bed, and we had air and heat....very nice...Six elevators !!!! Great location. 1 1/2 blocks from Grand Central Station, easy access to the subways. I will recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small - great location”
Reviews.Author: Caligirl5007
Reviews.Content: The grand enterance into the hotel is beautiful - The rooms and bathrooms are really small. Beds are not very comfortable. Would of been nice to have one of the updated rooms. The location is great- a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station. Probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: JazzCT55
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel in New York City is an older building that has been beautifully updated to current standards, althouth a few of the older fixtures are still in place and in need of updating, the bathrooms being the most obvious as they are in need of full size vanities with counters instead of a sink and a small shelf, and the shower and tubs also could use a little updating. The overall quality of the room is very good, the bedding is very comfortable. For the money it is a very nice hotel. No it doesn't have all the amenities of a higher price luxury hotel (they could at least put coffee makers in the room), for the lenghth of time you are in the room while in NYC it is quite adequate. A note also on internet, they charge $15 a day, and we couldn't get connected at all, a problem with ATT's modem. The hotel is also very conveniently located, just a block from Grand Central and subways that get you anywhere in NYC. A suggestion if you stay here, for a killer breakfast, Greens Cafe on 44th St is excellent, we had more than we could eat for $15, which is unheard of in NYC, and very tasty and well prepared, and ANYTHING you want!

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Golfguyjoe
Reviews.Content: My son and I both said, "wow" when we entered the hotel's lobby. It looked very expensive and well taken care of and showed no signs of being over 50 years old. The desk staff was very friendly and very willing and able to give directions to different points of interest. The room was smaller than many hotels room I have stayed in, but it is New York. Unless you are willing to spend big bucks for more square feet, then get used to small rooms while in New York. The city is short on space and packed with people. The room had a 27" flat screen TV, a king sized bed, and small desk area with free internet, and a good sized bathroom with tub/shower, but limited counter space. The best part of the hotel was it's location. We were within walking distance to many places including time square and the empire state building, and Broadway shows. It was a 10 minute cab ride to battery park (boat launch to Statue of Liberty), Wall Street and World Trade Center/Trinty Church area. Plenty of great bars and restaurants near the hotel also. We loved Tony's de Napoli which was a family style dinning Italian restaurant. Negatives (minor): The hotel does not have a swimming pool which would have been nice to relax in after a day pounding the pavement exploring the great city! The room's window is old style and do not dampen the noise of constant construction occurring in the city. Ask for a room on the 14th floor or above, the higher you go, the quieter it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Deal, amazing room but staff communication lacking”
Reviews.Author: JKB84
Reviews.Content: We were extremely lucky, our brother had organised a suite at a very reduced price, otherwise we wouldn't have been able to afford staying here. The hotel and our rooms were beautiful, the lobby is very impressive and the room was extremely spacious. The location is about as central as you get, great to be able to pop back mid shopping spree to dump bags and carry on. However, the staff took the shine off the place. We checked in eary at 10am to drop our cases and spent the day out sight seeing. When we returned at 5.30pm our room wasn't ready, despit being told it would be from 3pm onwards. An hour later and our original room still hadn't been cleaned fully. We were eventually given a replacement room of the same standard, but the delay was unacceptable, although they compensated us with a $50 food and drink voucher. There were several other miscommunications with staff during our stay, but other than that we were very happy at the Roosevelt. I would return but only if I was able to get the same rate! And as that was a result of my brother receiving poor service on his stay, don't think they'll win any customer service awards soon!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and decently priced for NYC”
Reviews.Author: LovestoTravel96
Reviews.Content: Hotels in NYC are very expensive; this is not something new. We got a deal through Hotwire.com and stayed here for one night in October. It was marathon weekend and the hotel was very busy; however, the staff were still still friendly, courteous, and helpful. They even upgraded us to a king bed for no extra charge when I asked, as our Hotwire special only gave us a queen. The lobby is outdated maybe, but I liked it and thought it was charming. The room was apparently renovated as it was modern and very clean. There's no glitz and glamour, but it's the rooms are modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Going the way of Hotel Pennsylvania”
Reviews.Author: EdAlabama
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Roosevelt just after its renovation. Now, a few years later, Priceline made us a good deal. First , it takes Yaks and mountain goats to climb the two-tier stairs to lobby. Bellhops nowhere to be found when there is heavy lifting. Check-in took at LEAST 30 minutes. Sure, the lobby and bar look pretty good but the rooms and hallways are very dated. Bathroom is small with NO shelf space at all. We had to call room service for a blanket, the next day for toilet paper (cheapo grade) and finally again for soap. Bar service is brusque. No coffee maker in room...have to go to bar AFTER 6 A.M. and pay for coffee from surly ladies. I would not recommend to anyone...it is almost as bad as a traver-agent booked Hotel Pennsylvania stay 13 years ago...just not quite as much livestock grazing around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Saz032
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to visit New York since I was a teenager. I promised myself that no matter what, I would be in New York City for my 30th birthday. We kept my promise and here are my thoughts. We booked through Virgin Holidays and before our departure they wrote to us and informed the hotel is currently upgrading their rooms. I wasn't at all worried about this as the letter said we would have minimum disruption. The hotel's location is fantastic; Times Square is just under 15 mins walk away, Empire State building under 20mins walk. Grand Central Station is less than 5mins away. 5th avenue and Central Park are within an easy walking distance. On our first day we woke up (After a very good night's sleep) and walked from the hotel to the Staten Island Ferry. Im so glad we didnt take the subway and the weather was perfect - you see so much when you walk; we saw the Flat Iron building, and many scenes from movies. Its like being in a movie!. We did take the subway back as our feet were tired after all the walking. We were on the 18th floor and wow the bed was huge!. The space of the room was great and decent wardrobe space for all my dresses!!. The bathroom was good with a decent shower. The fittings were very characteristic for the hotel (Character was one of the reasons for me that I picked this hotel). The room was very clean throughout our stay which was lovely to return after a full days sightseeing. The minute we arrived there was a few friendly gentlemen by the entrance in the street asking if we needed a hand with the bags wearing top hats and tails. Again for me the wow factor!. You are greeted with marble stairs, beautiful flower arrangements and an incredible reception with comfy sofas. It's beautiful. The staff allways greeted us with smiles (i loved their customer service). The hotel food was great, we both had New York steaks and wow it was incredible. I have to say the gentleman (unfortunately I didnt get his name) who was serving us the cocktails was a brilliant chap!. All in all i fell in love with this hotels character and location, i cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel was elegant with a good atmosphere; beyond our expectations really - we only paid $150 per night for all three of us. We were very lucky and managed to get a large L shaped corner room with 2 big beds and windows along both of the outside walls. Needless to say the flat screen TV wasn't used as we soaked up the street views instead. The Service was impecible too. All the staff were really friendly and suggestions for eateries were spot on. On our last day we treated ourselves to the big buffet breakfast (a bit pricey but a lovely way to end the trip). On top of all that the location could not have been better also - within walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, and Grand Central. It made our first trip to New York a memorable one for all the right reasons. Can't wait to return now (we're well and truly hooked!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RJTraveler_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well situated. The lobby is really amazing. The bedroom that we have stayed was pretty comfortable (king size bed), we have plenty space to put our 4 luggages. The bathroom was clean. I had no complains about the hotel. Only negative fact was the broken icemaker in the floor we have stayed (11th). The A/C was a little bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Pengwern22
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is situated superbly for mid town Manhatton.
