Everywhere is within an easy walking distance, Times Square (10 mins); Central Park (10 mins); Grand Central(2 mins); Theatre Land (5 mins) etc. The hotel is a little dated on the inside and the rooms could do with a freshen up, but that said they were cleaned every day and the bed was very comfortable. It's not the Waldorf Astoria, but you're not paying those prices either. It was very busy during Easter week, and we had to wait for two hours for the room to be ready. The rugby scrum for the lifts was a challenge at times, but that's to be expected at such a busy time. All in all a very functional place to stay in New York, and I would stay there again. As for New York it was my second visit, and I was disappointed by the general lack of manners and effort shown by New Yorkers who I came across. Yellow cab taxi drivers were surly and unfriendly; staff on the subway were even worse, and everyone expected a tip for the favour that they were doing for you. The restaurants were good but very overpriced for what they offered. I was told to go to Little Italy for a reasonablly priced meal but ended paying $140 for basic starters, a main courses and 4 glasses of wine for two people. So if you think New York will be a bargain, think again. Some things are cheaper but you've really got to shop around for them. If you want to experience America and meet genuine Americans people, then New York is probably not the place to go in my opinion. However, New York is a magical place especially on your first visit and I would recommend anyone to go there for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Saficient”
Reviews.Author: Pekocat
Reviews.Content: We got two rooms for great price for the location. We asked for rooms next to each other. One room was nicer/spacious than the other. Staff was always eager to help you. Lobby was pretty. Mad 46, bar/restaurant/rooftop lounge was popular and busy, but we received good service.

Reviews.Title: “Going Downhill FAST”
Reviews.Author: proudrepublican
Reviews.Content: This used to be one of my favorite hotels....but the times, they are a-changing. This hotel still has a very impressive lobby. Big, beautiful floral arrangements, marble, crystal...like the old-time fancy hotels. It all changes when you get to the rooms. Cheap, battered furniture. Bland bathroom with cheap decor. Ripped plastic shower curtain. The beds were flat with the cheapest bedding and pillows...nothing special. The paltry run-down rooms are such a contrast to the luxurious lobby that one may feel it is not the same place. Really, the rooms are exactly like the rooms you get in a cheap hotel chain...just at NYC prices. I hope they spend some money soon on a remodel....

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KJ30
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel seem very mixed but we have just returned from a wonderful stay. The location of The Roosevelt is ideal - close to Grand Central Station and Times Square too. The lobby really is a great welcome and lovely to relax in after returning from a busy day sightseeing. The concierge were very helpful too sorting out baseball tickets for us. Our room was an acceptable standard - the bathroom certainly needs a revamp - but the kingsize bed was soooo comfortable after busy days. A bit disappointing not to have tea making facilities in the room but not sure if this is common for New York. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Midtown Landmark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barden44London_UK
Reviews.Content: A very efficient and comfortable one night stay. Queen sized room was very clean and well presented, maybe a little on the small side but that's a very minor point. Desk, armchair, flat screen TV, tea / coffee machine, iron and ironing board, made for an easy stay. Beautiful lobby, lots of arm chairs and meeting areas with a classic NY bar. All staff were very helpful and polite. Location is perfect; a block from Grand Central Station (there is underground walkway between two just opposite the hotel entrance) and one block off 5th Avenue. Lots of cafès near by if you would prefer to eat out or get breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time staying here and not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jack_presley
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the location for this hotel. 3 minutes from Grand Central Station. Ok, the rooms are a bit small but I was on holidays so only used the room for sleeping and showering so spent very little time in the room so the size didn't bother me and the bed was so comfortable. My biggest gripe the last time was the lack of free wifi even in the lobby and that's still the same. In this day and age this service should really be in every hotel. I didn't eat in the restaurant as the prices looked very expensive but there's a lovely cafe on the corner that does cheap, quick breakfasts. The rooms are a bit old alright but mine was clean and serviced to a good standard every morning and my dealings with the staff were all positive although I did see one of the bellhops having a go at a customer for what he thought was a lousy tip for fetching his bags. Although he was probably in the right ($2 for 9 bags!) I thought it was very unprofessional and he should have bitten his lip. And despite it being NY, I wasn't disturbed too much by outside noise. The air conditioning/heating unit is very noisy but the temperature during my visit was perfect in that I was able to have neither on and be comfortable but I can see how this could be an issue either in colder or warmer times

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sam009
Reviews.Content: This hotel incredibly misrepresents itself on its webpage. We were completely allured by its old world feel and 'old time New York' style. Sadly, our experience couldn't have been worse. The money has obviously been put into the lobby. Upstairs, however, the hotel is very different. We had to be moved to a different room - twice. In one room the tiles in the bathroom were coming off and so was the wall paper in the room. In the other, the bathtub, sink and other bits in the bathroom were full of cracks, the shower head fell on my colleague's head as she was taking a shower, everything behind it was full of rot. The hotel is generally unclean. There were cupboards in the corridors on our floor stuffed with leftovers the cleaners have hidden in there, hoping nobody would see them: Dirty laundry, hangers, empty bottles of cleaning products, used orange juice bottles, etc. We had to take pictures of it to show to the reception staff but nobody really cared, they were obviously too busy and too generally undervalued to care. The members of staff are clearly underpaid and tired from dealing with tourists all day, and they don't have a problem showing it, they are rude or exhausted, many don't speak English and they just don't care. It makes you wonder what underprivileged life they live in a clearly tough and expensive city. Not the type of thought you enjoy entertaining while on holiday, in a supposedly luxurious setting and neighbourhood. The rooms could be cleaner. We had to buy sleepers to walk around as we were disgusted to be walking around with our bare feet. The room service is quite sad too: It's expensive and not very fresh. All is all, I would not recommend this hotel. We were trying to avoid the big 'chains' and were looking for a bit of personality but I would now recommend going for either a family run bijou type of hotel, or a big Hilton type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful. Historical building with moden amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Mtugglet
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Roosevelt. I traveled with my mother (who has mobility issues) and my six year old son. The hotel is literally around the corner from Grand Cental station so navigating the city was very easy. The hotel is a beautiful historic building. It has been moderized with wi-fi and other modern amenities. We didn't spend much time in the room but each evening when we returned we were so glad to be able to relax in such a beautiful setting. We had a room with 2 double beds, it was big for NY but slightly smaller than average for other parts of the country. Overall it was very comfortable even with three people in the room. We were defineately on a budget and would never have afforded someplace so nice if we hadn't gotten a great discount from their Facebook site. I found the quality and cleanliness to be comparable with hotels I've spent $190/ night on in Atlanta. I would stay here again in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be nice but now it's run down”
Reviews.Author: Txjhwk28
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby. That's about it. The rooms are very austere, with worn walls bedding and run down fixtures in the bathroom. In fact our shower head wasn't working the entire time despite service requests. As an example, the chair in our room was one of those cheap conference chairs and the tv was an old tube model with a green picture. The elevators can take 15 minutes to arrive at the proper floor. Great location is about all I can say

Reviews.Title: “Concrete jungle where dreams are made of”
Reviews.Author: FlipFlopHeaven
Reviews.Content: Just back from a city break in New York staying at the Roosevelt Hotel. Despite reading other reviews we were still surprised at how small the hotel room felt, but once we "moved in" we discovered it was more than adequate and the bed oh so comfortable which, after walking, walking and more walking, is the most important aspect of any stop in New York. The amount of time spent in the room was minimal as there are so many other things to see and do. The rooms were spotless and serviced everyday and reception staff more than helpful. We only had breakfast in the hotel one morning and it was buffet style and very good, although a little bit expensive we felt it was worth every penny. The location of the hotel is perfect, just a couple of blocks from Times Square, the shops and well....... just about everywhere. Would definately go back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and adorable!”
Reviews.Author: calinurse
Reviews.Content: Great location!! I love Manhattan, and this hotel, being on Madison Ave, is a block from 5th Ave, a couple short blocks to Grand Central, etc. It's a lively area of businesses and shops, without the over the top commercial business of iconic Times Sq--a fun place to visit but i wouldn't want to emerge into it every day! The lobby of The Roosevelt is magnificent. Enter from t he 45th St side, walk up the carpeted steps to the lobby, look behind and up you to the sky-pained ceiling. They may use cinnamon scent infuser-- it smelled warm and spicy inside. It is the perfect classic, NYC hotel lobby--elegant and far more intimate (IMHO) than even the Waldorf Astoria's , or Barclay's (where i stayed a few days later). Chekcing in with the friendly and courteous front desk people was easy and efficient. The public areas--lobby, elevators, hallways,--were always kept immaculately clean. Rooms: slowly but surely being upgraded. The room i had on the 14th floor was not upgraded yet, but the bed was comfortable, and the flat screen TV worked just fine. The room is Manhattan size--small but adequate, and with all the room i needed to relax. I loved being there after a day in the city. Bathrooom is quite small,, but the shower was hot and strong. You can tell some upgrades are in order: there were some recently repaired areas on the ceiling moulding. Of more importance was that the room and bathroom were always clean. The housekeeping staff were professional and pleasant.Marie from the Dominican Republic, who was in charge of my room's wing, always had a friendly morning greeting. It's hard to describe exactly j what is special about this famous old hotel. I've stayed in much nicer and larger looking rooms, but the feeling in the room is of history and cosiness. And that lobby...!! Wow!!! Upon return home, I was watching an episode of "Mad Men" when his wife has kicked him out, Don Draper tells his secretary, "I'll be at the Roosevelt." So will I , next time in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful bed”
Reviews.Author: Sharvi67
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a lovely old hotel. I've stayed at many hotels in NYC and expected the rooms to be the same usual small closet room. I was surprised. Room was larger, bed was super comfortable (looked like a new mattress) and the location was great. View from my room wasn't the best but I wasn't in the room much. Front desk and coffee bar staff were quite nice. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A superbly located, comfortable and friendly experience!”
Reviews.Author: agbarry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Roosevelt in mid March and had a wonderful stay. The lobby is spectacular and welcoming. A Travelzoo promo put us in touch with the Roosevelt; only steps from Grand Central Station, a couple blocks from Fifth Avenue and really close to Time Square. The front desk staff were great and when our room was not ready provided a complementary glass of wine and appetizer for us while we waited. Our Superior King room was excellent and when the heat malfunctioned we were upgraded to a suite on our second night. Previous reviews about rude front desk personnel are not consistent with our experience. The breakfast buffet and the staff was a pleasant way to start our days - a warm welcome each morning, great coffee, great selection of tastey choices. The rooms were great - beds very, very comfy. We enjoyed our workouts in the fitness centre every day - fresh fruit always available. If we return to New York we will definitely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: trip_architect
Reviews.Content: Once again, travelled to New York for one more educational trip. We got to the hotel from the airport by a bus that picked all of us up from the terminal exit and dropped us off right in front of the hotel. The hotel itself is a quite interesting building with a fabulous lobby. Awesome reception area with a wonderful flower arrangement on a great round table exactly at the hotel's entrance. Unfortunately, though, the travel agent had booked us double rooms for four students, something that was rather unexpected, since when we entered the room we started looking for the rest of it. Fortunately, yet, all the four of us are quite slim, so we didn't have much of a problem staying in the room and sleeping at a double bed. The only problem was the limited space left at the room for four big suitcases, but we managed it then again. Generally the room was nice, and we had a nice view over the street. An other quite disturbing issue was the air-conditioning unit and the refrigerator. When we turned the air-conditioning on it made weird noises and we couldn't adjust it to maintain a stable temperature, so we had to turn it on for a while and then, when we would start to freeze, turn it off. The refrigerator was also funny to use, since when we would put some bottles of milk in for the night, we would have ice-cream ready by the time we woke up in the morning. But, generally, these were petty issues that didn't actually really bother us. The room was generally clean, although old, especially the bathroom. It was quite tricky to manage to get the hot water coming out, but once we managed to find it we left it that way. We haven't booked any breakfast options with the hotel, although I think they didn't actually offer any. Nevertheless, there was a Starbucks right at the lobby, and a small shop right across the street called Cosi, were we could get fresh bagels, coffee, and fresh orange juice for breakfast. There was also an entrance to the Grand Central station next to Cosi, allowing you to easily access the station and find a train to get you almost everywhere around Manhattan or any other New York city district. I would generally recommend it to someone wanting to visit New York, but if I could find a more modern hotel with an equally great location, I would certainly prefer the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flightpro
Reviews.Content: Last March my wife and I stayed a couple of nights at the Roosevelt. After reading the comments about this hotel I was a little bit worried about the quality of the rooms. But after checking in and entering our room everything was fine. A decent bed with lost of pillows, the bathroom was clean and had lots of towels, plus a nice LCD tv. The only complaint we had was the temperature in the room. It really was very hot, so we had to turn on the AC almost the whole day. But considering we booked the hotel through Priceline and enjoyed a good rate we had a great stay close to all the favorite attractions in the centre of Manhattan. If you like a classic NY hotel and don't want to spend the world for your accommodation, please do consider the Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Historic Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mictim2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now on business trips and find this hotel to be wonderful. The lobby is breathtaking. . . for some reason remindes me of the Titantic. . . just stately beauty and georgeous detail. I found the room on the small side, but that's typical in NYC. It was clean and overall very acceptable. The bar area off the lobby is nice for a quick java and muffin in the morning. . and a very nice setting for evening cocktail. For the price I find for this hotel, I am sold and will stay here again. One can easily walk to Time Square and the theater district as we've done several times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Hollykm24
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous lobby area makes you feel like somebody when you walk in to stay there. Reading many of the reviews, I was concerned about staying here, but really enjoyed it. We stayed in a "Superior" King room and it was just fine. Much larger than I thought it would be based on the comments here. Sure, there was a lack of outlet, but the old world charm and perfect location for Times Square, the Theater District, Rockefeller Center, more than made up for any deficiencies. The are launching a big refurbishment, which might please those who left bad reviews, but it makes me think I won't be able to afford this location when they are done. We got a fantastic online deal, so that helped improve my satisfaction with the lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMama458
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day trip to New York City- a mother/daughter trip- stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel while there and had an absolutely wonderful stay!! Was a bit hesitant about booking there due to reviews that I had read, but couldn't have been more pleased with our stay. First- the location was absolutely perfect- we walked to Central Park, Time Square and Macy's, but Grand Central was just a couple short blocks away- so we rode the subway quite a bit-so convenient. The hotel itself had a beautiful lobby- very elegant -and the room was the perfect size for us- we booked a double. Beds were very comfortable!! Bathroom small, but functional. Room was clean and housekeeping was great keeping up with it. The staff was very accomodating and the concierge very helpful. We will be staying there again when we get the chance to make it back to the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: BrownSugar1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt for 3 nights in March and we had a very pleasant experience. I was a little leery after reading some of the reviews here, but I was pleasantly surprised. Check in was easy, the hotel held our luggage until our rooms were ready. We were on the fifth floor and our room was more than adequate. Yes, it is a small room, but you are in New York. I don't expect to spend much time in there anyway. The bed was VERY comfortable and the bathroom was thoroughly clean. The only negative thing I can say was that the walls are pretty thin (you can hear people in the hallway) and the fan/heater was very loud, but I actually like white noise so it wasn't too much of a problem and it actually drowned out the noise from the hallway. Also wifi was not free, however we found that there was a glitch and we could sometimes log on for free for a few minutes each day. You cannot beat the location of this hotel. We were VERY central to everything and that made it easy to drop things off at the hotel midday, or later on find great restaurants to eat at. If you can get a great rate on priceline, this is very good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: amp6306
Reviews.Content: My cousin got married on Saturday at the hotel. My husband and I stayed over and we had a wonderful time. The staff was very nice and the hotel was really very nice. We are from NY and have never been to the Roosevelt, but must say we were very pleased. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The lounge was great where my family gathered before and after the reception. The main thing that I loved most about the hotel was the old historic feeling. And the wedding was very nice. I would definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Hookers Actively Working the Lobby - Need I Say More?”
Reviews.Author: BrianinChinatown
Reviews.Content: There is not too much to say. I checked in for a 3 day stay and left after the first night. When I returned to the hotel the first night, there were two younger prostitutes actively and openly working the lobby. I did not notice when one followed me to the elevator and got one. She accosted me on the elevator offering her services. When I got to my room, I immediately called the front desk. Both security and the "manager" were quite rude for some reason. I wondered if they were getting a cut of the hooker's fees as they both separately seemed irritated that I called to complain. Neither seemed surprised by my call as a normal hotel would be. No apologies, no excuses. Nothing but irritation at me. I made a reservation at the Doubletree Metropolitan (wonderful hotel BTW that I have stayed at several times) that night and left early the next morning. In 20 years of making regular leisure trips to NYC, I had never seen anything like this before. I thought I was past being shocked in my life, but this truly shocked me. I usually stay at the major chains and this confirms why. The room was a bit dumpy and rundown on top of all this.

Reviews.Title: “So Terrible... I Wouldn't Board My Dog There....”
Reviews.Author: MonarchosSeven
Reviews.Content: My dear girlfriend flew into New York to visit some of her friends, take in the sites, and do a bit of shopping. She chose the Roosevelt to be situated close to my residence. When she arrived, I was instructed to please meet her at the hotel. Curiously enough, I have resided in New York City for several years, and yet had never heard of this Hotel. Curiosity satisfied- I now understand why! I entered a lobby that looked almost charming, however, left in desperate state of a much needed renovation. It saddens me to see such structures of once beauty- left to degrade. I had hopes that perhaps her room would be in better shape. When I stepped out of the lift, I was wondering through the Roosevelt's vast, rather creepy hallway, searching for the correct room. A group of kind housekeepers pointed the way. She had tears in her eyes when she opened her door! Long story short- She was freaked out, and did not want to be there. As she imagined her trip to New York quite different! I went into her bathroom to inspect the spotted "shower curtain" that clearly had things only a scientist would know the correct names for, and also had the misfortune of seeing a rusted pipe leaking the "wrong kind" of mineral water under her sink! I went to take a hand towel to clean this puddle up, and to my astonishment- the towel was oddly abrasive... crude and thin! I did not realize that establishments calling themselves "Hotels" use these types of towels! Not to be rude, but towels should not hurt... Nor, stand up on their own! Progress has been made in the world of textiles many years ago! Luckily, she had not yet unpacked. I made a telephone call to the Waldorf Towers. We then went down to the check in desk, to see if she could possibly receive some of her money spent back, since she was leaving and not staying one night. Regretfully not, since it was booked through an online site. Okay. Better than having to stay there! And off to the Towers we went!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful clean hotel with that old new york feel”
Reviews.Author: yevap5
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here and it was absolutely perfect, very clean comfortable beds. It is within a short walking distance to times square and the theatres. David, who helped us with our bags on our last day, went above and beyond to make sure we had a way back to the airport when our shuttle did not show up due to the crazy traffic from the St. Patricks Day parade. He treated us like we were his only priority that day :) I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: winstongreen
Reviews.Content: The room for myself and our 11 year old daughter had 2 double beds which were immaculate. The room was a decent size, the beds were nicely laid out, not in the least bit tired looking, which was the thing I was most worried about and had a very nice bathroom with plenty of towels and the usual bottles of shampoos and the like. A nice big flat screen telly came in handy when we went back to rest. We never had to wait at reception, the ground floor entrance lobby and bar was lovely. Although the breakfast prices in the hotel were quite steep there is plenty of restaurants nearby to get round that. I will be going back there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: DeltaSkyKing
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, the Roosevelt is an old hotel. The lobby is a throwback to yester-year's luxury hotels. The Roosevelt is not a Marriott or a Hyatt. But, it is certainly better than many other hotels I've stayed at in New York City. Let's just say I no longer dread staying downtown anymore. Here's the breakdown: - Small rooms. - Everything works. Plumbing, heating, air conditioning, internet. - Comfortable beds. - It's noisy. No matter where your room is, it's going to be noisy because of the horns and sirens of New York City. - Lot's of great places to eat nearby. - Fantastic location. Grand Central station is next door and the New York Public library is just 3 blocks away. - Good and usually friendly staff. I know, you're shocked right? After all this is New York City. I stay here on business and my company provides the hotel for me. If I was bringing my family on vacation to NYC I'd choose another hotel. Still, for a good reliable place to stay at a great location the Roosevelt deserves a look.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Outdated: Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: lauren_rizzi
Reviews.Content: We had an unpleasant stay for 9 days. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful, but the rooms are tired and old. No mini bar or facilities. We booked a room to share with 3 people and we shoved in a small room with a roll-away bed which was very uncomfortable with little room for our luggage. All beds and pillows were extremely uncomfortable, and our sheets were not changed the entire stay. We didn't get a lot of sleep as the rooms were very noisy and you could hear people in the next room, on top of the loud noises from downtown. The staff were unfriendly and unhelpful, and the concierge was no better. We definitely would not stay again, and it is absolutely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “very nice staff terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: tinanoonan1
Reviews.Content: staff verry nice changed rooms 3times stayed inroom 841 bathroom door did not close properley toilet dlocked on several occasions would not recomend stay somewhere else pity because staff very nice

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: stefanorsi
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is located right behind Grand Central Station, in the heart of NewYorkCity with Fifth Avenue just a block away. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, they seemed to do their best even at the busiest hours. The room was truly "cosy" and clean. I enjoyed my stay there a lot even though the room could have been somewhat more spacious. I would definitely check their availability before my next trip to the Big Apple. Very warmly recommended! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classic Hotel in NYC with Prime Location to Time square!”
Reviews.Author: Xcape2sun
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at The Roosevelt in NYC! Our first trip to NYC & the Roosevelt was Perfect! Ideal location to all the stuff we wanted to do! It only took apx 7 minutes to walk to Time Square! We felt totally safe walking back to our hotel at late night. Close to our Broadway show & Very clean rooms! Not much of a view from our room but we didn't expect to since it stated it in the type of hotel room we choose. We were Very happy with our stay here & would DEFINATELY recommend it and we'd Definately stay here again! The bellhop seemed a bit slow with our bags but all else for service was Great & we were very pleased with the room. Beds were very comfortable & clean! HIGHLY recommended! Walk to Rockerfeller Center, Time Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, New York Library, The MOMA & sooo much more! Thanks for making our first stay in NYC so wonderful! It's DEFINATELY not going to be our last time here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: drstorm
Reviews.Content: Booked several rooms for a birthday party weekend. Large hotel with lots of open common area's to sit and relax. Beautiful lobby,large bar area to chill at the end of the night. $55.00 for 24 hour valet parking.(not bad for a one night trip) Rooms were a tad small but for the price they are of high quality. The bedding was very comfortable and the shade let no sign of light enter in the wee hours of the morning,also noise did not seem to be an issue with any of our rooms. Staff was friendly and professional. Only a short walk over to Carmine's for dinner(2 blocks). All in all we will return to the Roosevelt when we take a trip back into NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good amenities”
Reviews.Author: floonthego
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centrally located so made for relatively short walks to main attractions. Front office staff gladly gave us a room with 2 beds despite us forgetting to ask when booking; Restaurant staff and concierge were not most friendly and helpful. No bugs but bathroom could have been a little cleaner. Cleaning staff very friendly and attentive. Hotel room was noisy at night given we were facing what looked like generators. This was mostly result of having to open the window to let fresh air in, otherwise, the room itself felt like a furnace. The fitness centre was great with good choice of machines, water, fruit, weights. A nice addition for an active family. The foyer of the hotel has a very noticeable smell of either cleaner or years of tobacco smoke. Had to pay $15 for internet access a day. This should be free to guests. Had to get work done so access to business centre was good.

Reviews.Title: “horrible customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: COOKIEBONGO
Reviews.Content: my wife and a co worker stayed at the hotel for 4 nights this month. my wife used her credit card for incidentals to secure the reservation. within the course of 4 nights the hotel erroneously put a hold on 1001.00 dollars on our account. it put our account in the negative, and we ARE still getting daily overdraft charges on our account! its been 4 days, and all i have gotten from management is the complete runaround. it was supposed to be resolved by thurs, then fri, and now its saturday,and i get an ignorant manager that is loving to tell me i have to wait until monday to talk to accounting! and when i tell her thats unacceptable she laughs and hangs up on me!!! DONT GIVE THEM YOUR CREDIT CARD!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but...”
Reviews.Author: Enterprise_J
Reviews.Content: So here's the good first. This 3.5 star hotel is located right in the heart of midtown. It’s only a 10-15 min walk to the ESB, Times Square, Rockefeller center, radio city, etc. You are a few blocks from the nearest subway though. Penn station is a $10 cab ride. Grand central in 2 blocks away. As you walk into the lobby you're greeted by large ceilings, marble table tops, and beautiful chandeliers. There are apples for you to take, a handful of elevators so wait time was minimal and a nice lounge area to chill or grab a cocktail at the bar which is secluded but still accents the lobby so you are not far from the people walking in and out of the hotel. The “help” was very courteous such as the bell hops, concierge and gift store attendant. However, the clerks behind the front desk were not very pleasant. They almost seemed annoyed that you were there. When checking in it took the clerk several minutes to check me in because there was a problem with the rate code that I used to book the room. That was solved and we checked into our room. I stayed one night with my wife and two children ages 12 and 6. We booked a 2 double room. The room itself seemed adequate by New York standards. There was a small desk, a couple of chairs, a dresser with an LCD TV on top. Room was not bad but not spectacular. The pictures on the web look exaggerated. The carpet looked a little old and dirty. It was probably in need of a replacement soon. The bed itself was comfortable and had nice goose down comforters and pillows. The room had the very basics but no coffee maker. The hotel claimed to offer free coffee in the lobby every morning but the only morning I was there I couldn’t find the “free” coffee. I had to buy one from the bar. Albeit, it was Starbucks, which is my fav but also $3 for one small cup of coffee that I thought was free. Possibly it’s because it was a Saturday. Anyway not a biggie but those little annoyances add up quickly. The bathroom was small. The most bothersome part was the vanity. It had virtually no space to put anything. Trust me, there was room to have a large shelf or two for that matter but the only place to keep anything was a small glass shelf about a foot long and 4 inches wide. I was afraid it was going to break with all of our stuff on it. They could’ve done better in the cleaning of the tile as well. The tile in the shower and throughout the bathroom had dirt/mold in the grout. Not a lot but still enough that I was starting to wonder where the 3.5 star hotel rating came from. Plenty of hot water, towels for four people and supplied soaps and shampoo. The other annoying part which was not directly the hotels fault was the traffic on the street. Normally street traffic in NY can be rather soothing but there was construction of some kind and every time a car drove past it would run over this large piece of metal in the road and make a loud “thump-thump”. All night long we heard “thump-thump”. We were on the 9th floor too and heard it as if it was right underneath us. Again, not really the hotels fault but be prepared with earplugs or a sound machine of some kind just in case. Overall this hotel was fine for what I paid ($139 + taxes = $165) and for only staying one night. I’m glad that I didn’t pay the normal price of $230-300 a night here because than I would have been highly upset. I’m not a hotel snob but when if I’m paying $250/night even in NY I expect a very nice 3 star. This was an average 3 star. Definitely not a 3.5 star. If you can book here for around $125-175/night than it’s worth it, anymore than that I would look elsewhere. Email me any questions about this hotel or even NY. I visit often.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not much else”
Reviews.Author: ShannonKristine
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was good, considering it is close to Grand Central Station, Times Square, and more, but the rooms are very small, the staff is unpleasant, and they charged my credit card for more than the receipt that they gave me when i checked out. When we arrived, our room was not ready. They have me a $50 voucher that they stated could be used toward my room cost. When I attempted to use it for that they let me know it was only valid in their restaurants. When we went to go to our room, it had someone else's belongings in it so they had to put us in another room. The hotel has a rich history, and is "the dame of Madison avenue" but I think that the photos on the webiste are very misleading. I know they are doing renovations this year so perhaps that will help. Overall not impressed, and for the money, could have stayed at a fresher hotel with better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite four star”
Reviews.Author: Eloise_8
Reviews.Content: Overall the Roosevelt is a perfectly fine option in New York. The lobby is beautiful - a real joy to walk through every time I went in or out, it's worth staying just for that. Our room was clean and the location is good - close to Grand Central, 5th ave, the park etc. I would have given it three and a half stars if that was an option. A few things that stopped me giving it four stars: The sheets were dreadful. Very worn and thin with balls, and one set actually had holes from being worn through. The Hotel decor, carpet etc did feel tired. Service at the bar wasn't great. $15 a day for wireless access seems excessive, and the room service menu is also overpriced. In short, it's clear this was once a magnificent hotel, and with a little work I think it could be again - I hope this happens. I should caveat this review by saying we had a relatively long stay at the hotel, in a very basic room, so had time to grow annoyed with things that wouldn't have bothered me if we'd only stayed for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Boomaa
Reviews.Content: It is what it is-an old hotel that could use some updating. BUT, our room was spacious, clean, freshly painted, without bed bugs and quiet. The bath was small, but had new tile with no mold or mildew lurking in corners. Staff was friendly, except for the doorman who only attended to people who were likely to give him a big tip. Housekeepers always smiled and said good morning and the front desk lady was very helpful. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, rude staff, cash nicked from my room.”
Reviews.Author: tcnpmr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first and last time. Room very tired, hadn't been cleaned properly (there was a discarded pass for a conference dated from over a month ago on the floor) and bed was not particularly comfortable. Had cash nicked from my room, about which the security staff did not seem remotely interested when I reported it. They promised to check to see if anyone had used a key card to access my room ( all of about six seconds work) and get back to me, neither of which they managed to do. I asked the duty manager the following day if there had been any follow up and was met with Olympic levels of rudeness and indifference. The loss of cash was iritating but the appalling attitude of the manager concerned was the low light and summed up my thoroughly underwhelming experience

Reviews.Title: “Location, its only asset”
Reviews.Author: Ladiesbridge1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are well seasoned British travellers. We take time to choose the right hotel for us and never travel with unrealistic views. On this occasion we felt that this hotel played a major part in the overall feel of our trip even though we were not in it for long periods of time due to the nature of our city break. The plus points as mentioned in other reviews were its location, walkable distance to all key sights and the cleanliness of the rooms and very comfortable beds. These would be the only reason's to recommend this hotel and we believed that the other 'bad points' out weighed the good. Customer service was lacking - did not try to make your stay a memorable one, concierge was bad mannered and the baggage storing situation was a farce. The hotel had dim lighting and much of the hotel and the rooms felt depressing. Guests are not this hotels primary concern they just go through the motions therefore making what should be a trip of a lifetime not so and even leaving you with a bad feeling in your stomach (gosh I guess I have some issues that need dealing with). Whether this was the case of it being a 'city hotel I don't know but what should have been a trip of a lifetime was questioned. New York was great but if you are staying longer than 3 nights or want more than just a place to lay your head then the Roosevelt is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah2evans
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located so many attractions are a few blocks walk away. The rooms were fine, nothing too grand but perfect for us as we were out and about sightseeing all the time. The staff were friendly, again not going 'above and beyond' but certainly not rude as many reviewers have put. It was quiet in our room and housekeeping were very attentive and did a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable!”
Reviews.Author: rodrigormendonca
Reviews.Content: We've spent Christmas time in NY, it's unforgetable! The hotel took part in it. Great location, good services and confotable. I'll never forget the Chistmas carols that was playing all the time... It was so deep and romantic. Kisses to my lovely wife... Best Regards.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for somewhere to crash”
Reviews.Author: julianp-uk
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt in New York is an old lady of a hotel. Palatial lobby, old lifts and rooms that have seen several layers of paint over the years. It's not a crisp modern hotel. We stayed here for four nights but only used it as a place to sleep as we were out for over 14 hours each day. Overall we found it to be fine, clean with big comfy bed. There were a few minor problems, window wouldn't quite shut properly so a little noisy but slept out of exhaustion anyway, and... oh - that was it. Had a drink in the bar one evening which was a little expensive but on a par with similar establishments. Location was perfect, easy walk to many sights or the subway for further afield. New York is a full on city with so much to see and do. I would recommend the Real New York tours for walking tours which are far better than they sound. I also recommend you buy your Empire State Tower tickets online before your visit to jump the very long ticket queues. We ate at the Gubba Shrimp restaurant in Times Square one evening, very nice - lively with great food and service. We found service from restaurants to be great, some shops weren't so good and public establishments such as train stations to be poor - no eye contact from the blaze gum chewing guy in Grand Central. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Ames_6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt in May 2010, the room was clean and fairly big with two very comfortable double beds. The bathroom was very small and needed updating but did the job. The only bad point was that the room was quite dark - being in New York and surrounded by other buildings meant there was little natural light and half the lights in the room didn't work so perhaps needs a bit of TLC. The hotel itself was lovely though with a nice lobby bar downstairs - but very expensive drinks! I was disappointed by the rooftop bar, again very expensive drinks and having seen pictures on the website we expected a better atmosphere. I wouldn't go back to the rooftop bar but I would stay in the hotel again. The location was great, short walk to Times Square and close to Grand Central with (mostly) helpful and polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “situated perfectly for a walking tourist”
Reviews.Author: YEGtogo
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel was perfectly situated for all the activities that we managed to fit into our five day stay. Yes it is an older hotel that has seen brighter shinier days but it is welcoming and has a clean, well cared for homeyness about it. The room size was large enough for my daughter and I, both who have a tendency to sprawl out especially after shopping. I walk and this location allowed me see Central Park, the MET and Guggenheim as well as the surrounding neighborhoods. Times Square with the ticket office for Broadway shows and the hop on off bus was a very very short walk. We walked to our shows in the Theater district in the evening and for dinner as well.... That being said, cabs were quick rides to get us out of the midtown area for dinners and brunch, and shopping in the downtown areas. I think the high volume of airline crews coming and going, staying at the hotel speaks well for the hotel standard. I am a fanatic about bugs and did a check, a proper check for bedbugs in our room which includes dismantling the headboards from the wall, taking out drawers from bedside table as well as the usual mattress check with an LED flashlight. My daughter a frequent nyc visitor, laughed about my bug drill but I rested easy finding no bug poo nor bugs- but they had used a bug dust. There were dust bunnies under the bed and a few left behinds from previous tired tourists. The service was just fine, no one was rude but quite the opposite. I guess you get what you give. The beds were comfortable and when the heat was a bit much we opened the window and it cooled the room perfectly. The only thing that could have improved my stay at The Roosevelt would have been to have a great breakfast place nearby..... otherwise it was absolutely a perfectly fine hotel to use as home base and would return without an hesitation. ***Roosevelt you really should have free WiFi not pay per day***

Reviews.Title: “Go To The Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: PacinoFan
Reviews.Content: No Hotel deserves a good rating where the staff doesn't care about the guest. When we made the reservation on their web site, they have a space for you to make additional comments about any preferences you have while you stay there. We specifically stated that it was our son's 13th birthday and all we wanted was a nice view of the city. We got a roof top. It was laughable. At least a response stating that they didn't have such a room would have been an indication that they cared about you. Staff was also very rude. Don't tell me that it's too difficult to be nice! We knew right away this hotel was not friendly so we canceled our second night and stayed at the 10 times better Hilton! Went down to the bar in the lobby the next morning to grab some quick breakfast and had to remind them 3 times about the hot chocolate I ordered and paid for. I even had to stir the powdered drink myself because they were too interested in the next patron. Couldn't sit down to eat because EVERY table had garbage on it from the last person that sat there. NOBODY cared at all about the cleanliness of the hotel or the service which was almost non existent. Maybe it's because I was an American. All staff were foreigners, and so were most of the guests. Too bad if you don't like that comment, but that's the way it was. Not the first experience with that. Don't support any place that treats you like this place did. They will never change otherwise. Went to the Hilton Times Square and let me tell you, it was magnificent. We all had a good experience there. They couldn't help you enough!! Get with it Roosevelt! With a beautiful Lobby like that, it should represent how you treat your guests!

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry! Read below!”
Reviews.Author: musicteacher16
Reviews.Content: Was terrified after reading terrible reviews-HOWEVER, our stay was wonderful. You cannot beat the location-we walked to everything-never took a taxi-Grand Central Station, Rockerfeller Plaza, Theater District, Garment District...GREAT location! We took the train from upstate NY and stayed 2 nights,3 days. Easy walk from Grand Central to the hotel. VERY clean room-plenty large enough AND very comfortable bed, and I'm fussy! NO bedbugs, not even a sign... and I was TERRIFIED! Bathroom WAS small,but the tub was very large- At times there was a slight mildewy odor, but not like described below. VERY friendly staff- you can store your bags if you get there early and leave them after you check out. This is just an old,HISTORIC hotel,folks! Don't be afraid of the bad reviews! I almost cancelled because of them and I'm so glad I picked The Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “Much bettet than expected”
Reviews.Author: pickacub
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was a bit nervous after I booked the hotel through Hotwire....there were many negative reviews. Not one of them seemed to be a factor for us, though. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean and the room was fine. Yes there is city noise...after all, it is in one of the biggest cities in the world. The only real issue was how long we waited for the elevator down. Other than that, pleasantly surprised overall.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to the renovations”
Reviews.Author: MOMOF2B
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this hotel being a huge mad men fan and a avid facebook fan of the hotel...but...... sadly it is in need of repair. The rooms have holes in carpet and wallpaper, badly in need of paint! The heating was hard to regulate and loud! It was clean, and service was excellent they even gave kids toys. For those reasons and the great location we will try again after the renovations. The lobby was LOVELY!!

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: lilypersian
Reviews.Content: Having read endless reviews on many hotels in New York, we were very pleased with our room at the Roosevelt. The bathroom was a decent size, clean, and good shower. When I did have a bath there was plenty of hot water. Check in was easy, we arrived before time and were told the hotel would hold the bags until check in(you're given a ticket for collection of your bags). After a very busy first day in New York, the huge bed was more than comfortable, it was heaven!!!! My partner used the gym at the hotel which he said was ample for his cardio/weights workout. We didn't use the bar/restaurant at the hotel but asked Bill at the concierge many questions about where to eat etc and he was very helpful!! We will definately be returning to New york and would stay here again. I would recommend this hotel, it's not fancy but more than ample for a stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location; Alfredo at the Front Desk was a terrific greeter”
Reviews.Author: mtf_ta
Reviews.Content: Got a great promotional rate available last summer for this reservation ($119/night). Stayed for Valentine's Day weekend. We normally stay at much smaller hotels, so the lobby, hotel bar, and Roosevelt Grille were all impressive. Room was a nice size (Deluxe King), great views on the 15th floor, bed was comfortable. Room was very quiet, something that you don't often get in NYC. Heater didn't work the first night, but front desk send someone up right away to fix it. Roosevelt Grille for breakfast was a very nice room; servers and hostess were very attentive and friendly. First time staying in the Grand Central district. Very convenient to everything. Had very nice dinners at Naples 45 (get the 5 selection appetizer selection) and Ammos across the street. Service highlight was Alfredo at the Front Desk at check-in and check-out. Extremely friendly, gracious, and helpful. A stellar representative of the Roosevelt Hotel. We'll be back even without the promotional rate.

Reviews.Title: “Big birthday celebrations”
Reviews.Author: DawnCardiff
Reviews.Content: We took a belated birthday celebration trip to NYC. We stayed at this hotel, personally with reservation, but my friend, having stayed there before and loved it. I was cautious because of reviews. Well either we were lucky or others have some mega standards. We had a room with 2 queen beds, and wow what comfort they were too. Maid service was excellent even to the point of changing towels although we had not requested it. My only dislike was the room was too hot and even had to have cold air blowing all night. Lobby is wonderful and we were fortunate enough to watch the superbowl in the bar whilst drinking Manhattans. Location is perfect for seeing all the sights. Will stay here again when I re visit

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: KAYSANT
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to NY and have stayed at other 4/5 stars hotels . This Hotel is 2star , old and tacky rooms, checkin /out desk unfriendly and unhelpful. We asked the conceige that we needed to confirm our booking for flights and he just pointed us to the computer without showing us where it was or any help, where in other hotels in NY they confirm this for you and print your Boarding Passes . We will Never stay in this hotel again as we visit NY once a year.

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur - great location, comfy beds but ....”
Reviews.Author: DebMcQ
Reviews.Content: The photo on on the web site have been well lit - in reality the hotel is darker and more faded grandeur than shown. Wonderful location and comfy beds. But the Concierge did not provide good service - only directed us to other places! Hotel was clean enough - but just enough. We needed the cooling on even though there was snow on the ground outside - and there didn't seem to be proper air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: racerBrazil
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 5 blocks from Manhattan "hot spot" very nice and fancy lobby, kind of old and very very small rooms. 32'LCD TV, bathrooms old and amenities also poor Clean and confortable. I would stay there again because of it's location. This hotel is a part of NY 's history. Internet wifi for US20 per day !!!!! There's a great place to eat right next to the hotel on 46th named FOOD WORLD with grat breakfast and Mongolian food. I reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: LDMcDermott
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay at this hotel from 10 Jan 2011. There were two families in the party - parents with a 5 year old and other family was mother and teenage daughter. We booked on a secret auction and paid GBP70 per room per night for the grade of hotel. When we won and found out the name of the allocated hotel, we read some of the reviews on Tripadvisor and they were VERY mixed. So, we were very apprehensive. However, our stay was great. The lobby is as magnificent as the pictures. The check in was great and they let us check out a few rooms before deciding on which one we wanted. The doormen and bellhop (on arrival) were helpful and we were soon settled in very comfortable rooms. I wouldn't say that they were newly renovated - the bathroom was a bit old and there was a burn on the carpet - but perfectly fine, with nice clean crisp linen and comfortable beds and pillows. And a walk in closet in our room! After a number of trips of New York, we know that we love the East side location - only a 6 block walk to Times Square. A lot of people prefer being in tourist areas like 7th avenue and the area there is geared towards the tourists, but we felt that this was more a business area with more locals on the street, which we prefer. Right across the street is an entrance to the subway/Grand Central, so you can't get much more convenient. THere are plethora of restaurants in all directions - all types and all prices, so something to fit everyone. Given that it was January and it was snowing, it was freezing cold, but the rooms were well heated. The bathrooms had plenty of hot water at all times. The staff in general were very nice and accomodating. We had an altercation with the bell hop checking out though - after throwing our luggage onto the trolley and then us (not him!) rearranging it, we didn't think he deserved a $10 tip, so we halved it and he wasn't impressed. We later saw him slagging us off to the other bell hops - so we spoke to the manager and he immediately sorted him out. Only downside - and probably to be expected from the level of hotel - internet very expensive - $15 a session and the link would drop occassionally and then it wanted to charge you for another session. Also the restaurants etc in the hotel were pricey. So, a great stay and we would definitely stay again - especially at that dirt cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: skippy009
Reviews.Content: Hotel foyer looked great, we were expecting good things from a 4 star New York hotel unfortunately that's where the good things stopped. No help from door staff on arrival, the reception staff were unfriendly and unhelpful, even on asking a simple question felt like we were just an inconvieniance to them. The room was shabby and tired looking, an electric socket was loose and half hanging out the wall, the heating unit was noisy and also coming off the wall. Worst hotel i have stayed at and i have stayed at quite a few all over the world

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - please don't worry about the reviews below!”
Reviews.Author: emailellie
Reviews.Content: I genuinely don't understand why this hotel has had poor reviews. I've stayed in around 8 different hotels in NYC and this is one of the beter ones. The staff were helpful, the location is fantastic and the room size was god fr NYC. In value for money terms, this is probably the best value hotel i've stayed in for the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The place is a complete dump and so dirty!”
Reviews.Author: idoloveholidays
Reviews.Content: Honestly this hotel was a dump, I wouldn't of let me dog stay there to be honest. The hotel was dirty and so tired. Anyone that rates this hotel as good must have very low standards is all I can say. I wouldn't touch this place with a barge pole. The first room they put us in was the size of a shoebox and dirty, I refused to even put my bag down on the floor! The next room wasn't much better just bigger - it would seem this was the best it was going to get in this shocking hotel. Don't get me wrong I know hotel rooms in NY aren't big but they should at least be clean! I went to NY the previous year and didn't experience a hotel that was like this so I wouldn't recommend staying there to anyone If you stay there be warned the place is really dirty, decor completely dated, bar staff are pretty rude and reception staff seemed pretty uninterested when we complained as well. It was that bad that we almost checked into another hotel - we were only there for four nights.

Reviews.Title: “OK.”
Reviews.Author: spoarinoj
Reviews.Content: Adequate. Getting tired and needs refurbishment, but overall pleasant. The problem is internet. They want to bill $15 per DEVICE per day. So if you and your spouse each have a smartphone, ipad/kindle and laptop, thats $120 per day. Crazy. In 2011, internet is an essential utility, and this just pisses off customers. Not smart business. Also really noisy. Poorly soundproofed, and the traffic noise is really LOUD. Needed earplugs to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not Even a "Good" Property; Keep Moving”
Reviews.Author: ElvisPWorldwide
Reviews.Content: Let's be straight from the beginning: the only thing saving this dumper of a hotel is its location which is great for tourists and business travelers. Aside from that, its lucky to pull even two stars. Ive stayed in NYC rooms from one end to the other and this does not even rate a second look. Box like rooms with very old and ineffective climate control. Poorly equipped bathrooms (broken toilet seat) and the telephone did not work (I had to call the hotel from my cell phone to order coffee). ANd if you are arriving late and need a sandwich, forget it. No after hours room service. If you want to visit Manhattan and want a memorable experience, spend the time and research, research, research! Try the Hilton, the Warwick or others---give this one a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: wednesfield
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. You turn right out of the main entrance and continue straight past 3 blocks and you are directly in the heart of Times Square. It took me 10 minutes to walk from the hotel to Times Square. The hotel is approximately 15-20 minutes walk to MACYS and around 5-10 minute walk to Central Park. You are one block from 5th AVENUE and aroud a 5 minute walk from the ROCKFELLER CENTRE. It took me 10 minutes to walk to the Empire state Building along 5th avenue. The hotel rooms are adequate in size. I was a little disappointed that there were no tea or coffee making facilites in the room or a bath only a shower, on the other hand the room was always room and quiet. I had daily room service and there was cable tv. ANOTHER negative was that it didn't have free wifi which cost $15.99 or a charge on your credit card. The hotel servicemen are good, however i was disappointed that i had to tip a man $5 twice for him to carry my bags 10 paces to a holding area until my cab arrived for the airport. I could of carried them myself, and they dont move from you until you tip them which i found was a little rude as its not the law to tip them. However froma view negatives of the hotel, the lobby was stunning, its in a great location, and check in was fast. If you want a no frills city break,with a basic room to sleep in this is an hotel for you. It cost me £800 for 5 nights including flights and transfers for a single traveller which was pretty good. I would give this hotel 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfectly Suitable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mswm80
Reviews.Content: I read reviews ahead of time, so knew this could be a great stay or an awful stay. Fortunately, it was great. Booked the room on Priceline for $99. Selected midtown-East, and since there aren't many hotels (that I saw anyway) in that area, this is what I got. I couldn't have been happier with it. This part of town seems to be mostly business oriented, although it's one block from 5th Ave. and one block from Grand Central Station. It's a quiet part of town, and some retail/restaurant businesses were even closed for the weekend. As most people have mentioned, the lobby is very nice, and I did not find that the upper floors where the rooms are were appreciably different. Our room was large, clean, well maintained, and very comfortable. The controls on the heater didn't seem to work, but the temp. was comfortable so we didn't need to make any adjustments. Staff were friendly and helpful, and no one asked us for a tip. Yes, the restaurant prices were high, but I expected that at a hotel. There are plenty of places nearby to get something to eat or drink if you don't feel like paying hotel prices and are able to go out. We found breakfast at 3 different places within a block of the hotel. We found places for dinner, places to have a drink - everything we needed. It might have been nice to have a coffee maker in the room so I could have had a cup of hot tea in the evening - as it was frigid cold out the weekend we were there. But it wasn't a necessity, just something that would have been nice. I have no complaints about this hotel and would definitely stay there again. In fact, I don't think I'd stay anywhere else, especially at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: lizk59
Reviews.Content: The location is central and we could walk to the park, shopping, and the theatre district easily and never felt unsafe even at night. The room was confortable and clean and the hotel seemed older but well maintained. There are many nearby delis and coffee shops for inexpensive breakfast and lunches. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel choice for NYC visitors who want a great location!”
Reviews.Author: eastbostontraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel for 4 days in March 2010. It was our first time staying at The Roosevelt and we will definitely be returning! The hotel is in one of the best locations I can think of. We were able to walk to multiple tourist attractions. This was the biggest positive for us. It is right around the corner from Grand Central Station. We took the subway everywhere else, which was also VERY convenient to the hotel since there are multiple subway stations walkable to the hotel! The hotel lobby is gorgeous. As soon as you walk in it looks like a 5-star hotel. It also has the distinct feel of a being a historic hotel. If you are looking for sleek and modern this is not the place for you. The Roosevelt is very classic in its elegance. Very clean. The staff was helpful, but not overly so. They did store out luggage for us no problem at early check in and when we checked out and still wanted to travel the city. Our room was clean and the size was decent. We did not eat at the hotel or order room service. To be honest we were never at the hotel, since we were out doing tourist attractions all day. When we were there we had no complaints though! It was FREEZING the days we were there, with the temperature well below 20 degrees. But, the hotel was fine, very warm but not too warm. We were extremely pleased. Hot water and heat with no issues whatsoever. Would recommend to everyone as the pricing is always competitive and we know many others who have stayed here and no one ever has anything bad to say!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Cleo4e
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to NYC for an impromptu american thanksgiving week end from Montreal. I was also 6 months pregnant and just wanted to go out and explore. Upon arrival, we were thoroughly impressed a) with location: walking distance from Times Square and all kinds of centrally located attractions b) the grand lobby: absolutely breathtaking! The doormen were absolutely wonderful and so polite, and truly helped us with great advice! Going up to our room however, my image of the hotel slowly started to change. The hallway carpets were worn and stained, and the hotel room doors, just looked very old and stained. The room itself was adequately sized for two people, and the bed was VERY comfortable! The hotel room carpet however again was worn and stained, and everything was really showing it's age. Especially the very cramped and small old fashioned bathroom. Even though the room was very clean, it didn't 'look' that way just because of how worn everything looked. This didn't bother us too much because we didn't intend on spending much time in the room itself. The service was fantastic and the concierge gave us some great advice on where to go eat (strongly recommend Balthazar in SOHO- make sure you have reservations before you go and take a cab- it only cost us 10$). Overall, we found a great deal, the hotel served it's purpose, the staff was extremely friendly and the location couldn't be more perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great value, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: hawkorange
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Roosevelt was well beyond our expectations! The lobby is fantastic. The front desk let us check in very early and our room was large and clean. We appreciated the free WiFi as well... I highly recommend The Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “Rude reception, no late night food, poor value”
Reviews.Author: neelio45
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 11:30pm and while checking in asked the front desk about restaurant hours and room service. I was abruptly informed that I was out of luck, "the kitchen is closed". When I inquired about nearby places or delivery options, the person said they didn't know and she did not offer to help or consult anyone. The room was quite small for their most deluxe accommodation and the bathroom was dirty and dated. I paid $350 for one lousy night....the following week, I stayed one night at the Omni for $250 and it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor had us worried all for nothing !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: swamgam
Reviews.Content: I did price line and got this hotel . I was leary from the reveiws on here . We were pleasantly surprized ! Central location ( was walking distance to Racheal Ray Show ),average rooms , bellman great , could store luggage before and after check in times , nice breakfast selection in am .Only dislike was incidental charge on credit card had never heard of this.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: JeniU
Reviews.Content: Got a $99 per night deal from priceline to stay at the Roosevelt. For those Mad Men fans out there, this is where Don Draper sometimes stays on Madison Avenue. Beautiful lobby from Manhattan's golden era in the 20's which is worth a look even if you're not staying there. A block from Grand central station. Room was clean with nice bed linens but the bathroom definitely looks a little tired and old, and the drapes were grubby looking. TV channels came in a little fuzzy and HBO didn't work one night at all. Elevators were extremely slow and clearly didn't function properly - it kept losing what floors you'd selected so you had to watch for that. Used the Gym and that was fine for a hotel Gym. All in all for the price it was a very good deal for a great location in midtown Manhattan. But if you're shelling out $250 or $300 a night, it'd feel not so great.

Reviews.Title: “bloody brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: emma3107
Reviews.Content: great hotel!service was great, rooms were clean,had a big screen t.v 2 massive double beds! spacious and was very near to all the main tourists locations, staff were very helpfull! had a great stay and will definatly be coming bk! :)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: aliciark10
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner visited new york from the 5th to 12th of Jan, I actually write this review whilst sitting in the bar of the Roosevelt as we had to be out of our room by 12pm and our flight isn't until late tonight. I'm going to start off by saying that the Roosevelt hotel is in such a great location, 9 mins walk to times square, 16 to central park, 14 mins to the empire state building, 2 mins from Grand central station and minutes away from fifth avenue shopping! Basically this hotel is in the middle of everything. We never had to get a taxi, we got the subway when visiting ground zero and statue of liberty because that's to long to walk. The hotel is.. Just average. The lobby is lovely and grand, but the room we stayed in was deffinately in need of updating. The bed was nice and comfy, but that is about the only good point about the room.. The air conditioning/heating unit made a loud noise all night, for some reason the carpet was incredibly static so I was continuously getting static shocks, the bathroom was OK, when running the bath water it came out a browny colour, not nice. The decor of the room was generally old fashioned, but it was liveable, it wasn't outrageously awful but could have been better. Something that annoyed us was we ordered room service, two burgers at $22 (which is alot for a burger anyway) and when they showed us the bill it was $70 I'm not sure how it added up to that but that is ridiculous money for a dry burnt burger! The man that took our bags asked us for a tip which is quite rude! The Roosevelt is definitely just 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: MsElaineyS
Reviews.Content: After reading some less than favorable reviews on the old Roosevelt Hotel, my expectations were fairly low. Wow, what a pleasant surprise! Fantastic location, beautiful, classic lobby, extremely comfortable bed, free wi-fi and the very best buffet breakfast I have ever experienced - all at a very reasonable rate. Only downsides were the small, older bathroom and the well-worn carpet and furniture. Hey, it's not the Park Plaza, but I had money left over to enjoy fabulous New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swedishstar
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I'm a Travel Agent therefore I am normally very critical................ However, this Hotel could NOT be faulted. Friendly check-in, friendly bar staff, amazing breakfast (although a little overpriced) if you chose to be lazy and not eat in the fab Delis and Cafes around the Block. Stunning Lobby which was very palacial, and also decorated beautifully for the Christmas Period. Could not fault the cleanliness of the Hotel, and the Maids were always first to say a warm hello. Travelled for my 30th birthday and mentioned this in an email to the Hotel before travel. They accomodated me with a free room upgrade which was lovely, so well worth letting the Hotel know if you're staying during a special occasion. New York is one amazing place, possibly one of the best holidays I have had. The whole experience at the Roosevelt added to this. I would definitely return.The only downside to my stay would be the size of the bathroom in the room. It was extremely small,difficult to manoevre around and dated. However the shower was amazingly powerful! I was out of my room by 9am and returned at 9pm so it wasn't such a big deal! Go, enjoy New York and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: youngmomfromTO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location (45th and Madison) - close to 5th Ave for shopping and to times square. The theatre area is really close by as well. It is also right around the corner from Grand Central Station which was wonderful because you can catch a bus to all three of the major NY airports off of 41st. We flew out of Newark so we paid $15 each one way (we did supershuttle on the way into NY and paid $37 total for two people - definitely do the coach bus next time both ways and you can save money! We saw signs for JFK for $15 one way or $20 round trip!) and only took 45 mins and dropped us off at the right terminal. Anyway, I digress, back to the hotel....lovely historical hotel. Room size was very decent and while the bathroom was a little old and not very modern, it was clean and the shower was huge. Only complaint was that the heating in the room - we couldn't get it to the right temperture. It was cold without the heat on (draft was coming from the window) but with the heat on, the room was too hot even on the lowest heat setting. As for the noise, we were located near a very busy street and even on the 8th floor, it wasn't very noisy. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Paris18_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt for a second time, and liked it even more than the first. The lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays, and check-in was quick and very courteous. The location can't be beat, and we were able to walk or take the subway anywhere we wanted. The room was a decent size, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. We also really enjoyed the lobby bar. I had no disappointments in the Roosevelt whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dimitrioskav
Reviews.Content: A good location hotel with big rooms and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel, even better city!”
Reviews.Author: markrae2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic and exactly what we were after when visiting New York, it is clean, the location is really good and each room is well appointed. It is around 2 blocks north of grand central terminal and a block or 2 away from 5th avenue and about 5 blocks away from times square. I'd say it was fairly priced there are cheaper alternatives but trust me when your walking past them you will be glad you didnt stay in them! There are so many things to do in New York its unreal but you can do everything and see everything quite comfortably in 3 full days. We were advised before going to visit Woodberry Common and i'd advise everyone not to bother there isnt that much there its not that much cheaper than the shops in New York and it takes a while to get there and back, plus when you take into account how much the tickets are for the trip it works out no cheaper than New York at all. If you really want to do the best thing possible in New York it has to be the helicopter flight over the city there are loads of different prices and it all comes down to how much time you want in the air, we got 18 minutes and you see eveything it cost around 100 quid each but was well worth it. We also took a late night cruise around Manhatten that was really cheap around 20 quid each and the views you get are stunning you go right up next to the statue of liberty all lit up! You can walk the full length of manhatten in a few hours and to be honest its the best way to see everything, theres also a city tour open bus ride available and i'd recommend this aswell you see tons of sites and you will recognise alot of places from film and television. We were also quite lucky in that when we went it was St.Patricks day and the whole city celebrates, I definetly want to go back to New York and i wouldnt hesitate to stay at the Roosevelt again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, through Christmas and blizzard”
Reviews.Author: GJM3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights including Christmas and the 12/26 NYC blizzard, and the hotel was wonderful throughout. I'm surprised by its middling ranking on TA - I'm giving it my first-ever "5" rating. Lobby was nice and festively decorated; check-in was efficient; room was comfortable and actually not small by NYC standards. Mp3 clock radio alarm was a good amenity. Comfy bed with plenty of pillows & covers; decent bathroom. We really enjoyed the lobby lounge/bar, and we were delighted & surprised to find it open all day and evening, even on Xmas eve & day. Location is excellent, as has been noted in many other reviews. The hotel even responded well to the blizzard - sidewalks were kept clear even while the storm was still in progress, and I witnessed staff being helpful to guests whose travel arrangements had been disrupted (fortunately mine weren't.) My only quibble was that I found the place uncomfortably warm. Even when I turned the heat in the room completely off, it didn't cool off much, because the hallways and common areas were so warm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay.....Definately Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Yiddo2006
Reviews.Content: We were really apprehensive about staying at the hotel after reading so many of the negative reviews........However, I can safely say we found the hotel to be brilliant. Yes it is a little rough around the edges in the sense it could do with a lick of paint but everything else was first class. The hotels location is brilliant. We walked everywhere, you are a 10 minute walk away from all the main attractions of New York and if you want to go further a field then Grand Central Station is literally 2 minutes away. We didnt eat at the hotel but there are plenty of small cafes close by for breakfast and the hotel staff were more than happy to recommend us restaurants and get us tables. The concierge are a little too forward in asking for tips but we found this in most places we went and I can honestly say the service they offered us was top notch. Please do not let other reviews put you off this hotel as it was absolutely brilliant and when we return to New York we will definately be looking at staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it , fantastic”
Reviews.Author: yummymum15
