Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2010 and there were 4 of us my husband and 2 children and we were upgraded as soon as we checked in to a bigger room . The bedroom was lovely and there were Bath and Body works toiletries ( bath and Body works are my fave) and these were restocked everyday. The staff were, lovelty and the man in the gift store was very nice as my son was in there every chance he could get and the sales man even got to know my sons name . I cant fault this hotel and the location was fantastic too. The only downfall if any was that it was incedibly busy but that is the sign of a good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Juliejue78
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant stay Here in oct 2009! It was our first trip to new York and we wanted a hotel that was in the middle of all the different places we wanted to visit, this hotel was in the perfect location! Our room was a corner room so we had plently of natural light and the beds and pillows were really comfy. We did have room service on our first night there. The food was nice, but really expensive! The hotel breakfasts were really good, the scrambled eggs were the best I have ever had! Overall a really excellent trip and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel, don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: 50207Paul
Reviews.Content: Other than the location, there is nothing to like about this hotel or the staff. The rooms are so small you can barely get around the beds. The bathrooms are absolutely tiny. The room was very hot and the heat wasn't on and the air conditioner wouldn't turn on. The staff is arogant and unaccommodating. They act like they are doing you a favor by letting you stay there. They charge $55/night for valet parking and $26 for breakfast. Don't let the beautiful lobby fool you. That's the only thing that is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience, couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Supernurse59
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 nights from 12 Dec to 22 Dec 2010. After reading reviews here for 5 months before leaving, I was terrified, but my husband had paid for this trip for me and I really wanted to stay mid-town and decided that I had to trust my husband's research (which was extensive) ... and go with my gut feeling that everything was going to be okay. Well. I wasn't disappointed. I can only say I really dont understand the negative reviews. I arrived around 7.30pm in the evening after a long flight from Sydney, Australia. I was immediately upgraded to a superior room on the 18th floor (Room 1806) and was thrilled. I had two queen size beds, plenty of space to move around and the bathroom had a bath and was very clean. The room was made up everyday and I never ran out of clean towels, hot water or toiletries. Room service when I ordered was prompt and efficient. I never had to wait more than 2-3 minutes for a lift and that was for the whole time was there, I was always greeted with a smile from all the staff ..... it helps if you are friendly and outgoing, polite and have manners, you get what you put out. The location was fantastic and I planned my days and popped into the Roosevelt several times a day to deposit shoppings bags back in the room, to save me carrying them around. I highly recommend The Roosevelt Hotel, my experience was lovely, I felt safe, the room was warm, the bed ever so cosy, I felt safe at all times, there was never any disruption, noise or problems to keep me awake. Thank you to all the staff at The Roosevelt, you made my holiday ... alone, the most memorable and wonderful time. If I ever come back to New York, you shall have my reservation booking.

Reviews.Title: “Its just the name and the nice lobby”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller1900
Reviews.Content: this hotel has just the name. and the guy infront of the door taking always our shopping bags. and the lobby. the rooms are so old and so dirty. We stayed in a deluxe room. the cold was coming inside from the windows. the floors are so old and dirty. The brewakfast is ok. but not more than ok. if u enter the lobby its nice but as soon as you enter the rooms omg its so crazy. Cold dirty, dusty urgghhhhhh.......for its money it is really nothing its just the name and the location is also very center and clode to central park and rockefeller center. thats it

Reviews.Title: “Our worst hotel experience in NYC”
Reviews.Author: acannada
Reviews.Content: Without going into great detail, I will have to say that we couldn't check out quick enough. I was very happy that I could pull up Tripadvisor.com on my IPhone to find a nearby hotel so that my husband could walk to his meetings at the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CourtaniaLynn
Reviews.Content: Having checked the reviews on this site before leaving, I was worried about what we'd gotten ourselves into. We walked into the lobby and I was blown away. It was a large, elegant spot with gorgeous Christmas decorations and it smelled like apple cider. The bellmen were eager to help store our bags while we explored the city. When we went up to our room (a standard queen-bed), I was just as happy. I didn't find it to be any smaller than other hotels I've stayed at, and one must consider the fact that it's New York City and everything is going to be sized for convenience anyway. The staff was ALWAYS friendly, the valet (Tony!) gave us great directions. The location was great too - blocks away from Grand Central Terminal on one side, blocks from Times Square on the other. I don't know what everyone else was complaining about, I loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stunning lobby, room renovations needed”
Reviews.Author: cabinfever2010
Reviews.Content: The lobby is stunning... especially during the holiday season! Wow was the first impression of my friends when they met me at the hotel... The location is great too - you can walk to a lot of the major sites. Room quite a contrast with the striking lobby. The room was small and dated and needed renovating - the seals are flaking on the sinks for example. It also was only superficially clean - there was dust in the corners and a few hairs from previous guests on the bathroom floor - eugh! That being said staff were super helpful, fast and couldn't have been nicer. The hotel is missing somewhere to get coffee in the evenings. Also the hotel needs to update their restaurant listings as one of the restaurants they recommended was boarded up and closed... That all being said I'd stay here again for the location alone and given I wasn't spending much time in the room it worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, if a little bit rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Naytoo
Reviews.Content: Nowhere near as bad as some reviews suggest - the staff were no more rude or polite than any other hotel staff; our room was a reasonable size, it did not smell musty as per some reviews, if anything it smelt a little of fresh paint and cleaning products; the bed was sumptuously comfortable; the lobby was splendid and they had made a real effort to make it christmassy - it even smelt like christmas! Ok, the bathrooms could probably do with a deep clean or a refurb and the carpets were nothing to write home about (and made me get static shocks off everything when i walked around in my socks!!) but i would definitely stay here again at the right price. i can totally understand what people are saying about the aircon though - we used it for heating and although it warmed the room really quickly, it was very noisy and made the curtains blow around lots, and i can imagine that in summer that would get very annoying! Oh, and the location was really good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend before Christmas and we very happy with our choice. It is located right in the heart of the city and we walked everywhere(shows, shops, dinners). Lots of people on here claim the hotel rooms are dated, I agree slightly but other than that there is nothing wrong with this hotel whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: floricuse
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business. Hotel is apparently geared towards airline employees (lots of pilots and flight attendants rolling in and out) and tourists. Lobby is grand, but the rooms are really worn and outdated. I was greeted in my room by a wet, musty smell and the HVAC unit's vent was covered with dust and mildew. The furniture was outdated and worn, and the bathroom needs a complete overhaul. The cold water handle on the faucet fell off when I went to use it the second day. Also, the bathroom was covered in random hair (some long, some short), so that was exactly pleasant. That being said, the bed was clean and pretty comfortable. Considering I normally pay $400-$600 to stay at one of the chain hotels when I'm in NYC, you could probably do worst than the Roosevelt if you're on a limited budget. However, if you have an expense account and can push a little bit, I suggest you stay clear of this "grand old dame." I am only recommending it for cost-conscious travellers who are looking for a passable hotel at best in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Nicolinna
Reviews.Content: I truly don't agree with half of these reviews. I'm not the pickiest person, and granted it's New York and everything is supposed to be posh - again you're in NEW YORK CITY. Space is limited, and location is everything. I have no real complaints other than the rooms being outdated. Defintely could use a re-vamp to gain its clientele. But realistically, since our goal was to go sightseeing, a football game and a concert. There was no time to spend in the hotel room. The lobby is exquisite. Fresh flowers. I love stepping into the lobby and seeing the beautiful white lilies that carried throughout the main level. With the hotel being directly next to Central Station, it made getting around VERY easy. And even when we thought we should be taking a cab, the doormen suggested a much less expensive way for us to travel - whether it be via train or private driver. I appreciated their honesty. Without a doubt, I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Write Home About”
Reviews.Author: eddienca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Roosevelt in May for a very quick three night trip. I arrived late at the hotel and the first impression of the hotel is a beautiful hotel lobby as you would expect from a grand dame of the roaring 20's. The hotel is in a fabulous location that puts you central to all of the areas you want to go to, but that is where the pros end. When I got into my room it smelled of Urine. So I called the front desk and was told that they were completely booked and could not move me. They sent up an employee who sprayed the room with Fabreeze and left. I was told that I could check back and they could see about moving me. They were able to move me the next night to another room in the hotel, which was much nicer as it was an upgraded room. The rooms are small, and I expect this in major cities. Those that complain about room size have probably not traveled much outside of the US or in major cities as that tends to be the norm. The pictures on the travel sites look nothing like the room you are given. Come to find out the rooms pictured are an upgraded room not the standard house room. My biggest complaint is that they did not have anything to do in the room. There was no internet, they didn't have Lodgenet or OnDemand so you could not watch movies, all you got was whatever was on TV. The bathrooms are small, something else that is typical in historical buildings, but they should consider remodeling to give guests a place to place their vanity items as there is no room to place the items you need to get ready in the morning. Overall the public spaces of the hotel were nice, but the rooms were not a 3 or 4 star because of the amenities offered. You can do better in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nothing like the lobby”
Reviews.Author: Suenk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Airmiles for a very special, surprise trip to New York. I wanted something really special & memorable with a central location. I then contacted the hotel via Email and paid for an upgrade to a "Superior Room" which I was assured was a large room with a King Size bed. We arrived at 2.15am so were very tired. The lobby is just as per the web site, veyr ornate & beautifully refurbished. Our room however was a very different story. It was not particularly large, very gloomy and to be polilte "tired" - a bit like us. I phoned reception and was told that this was actually an upgrade on the Superior Room that had been booked and that although she could find me a bigger room it would not be as nice! I explained that although clean it was disappointing and not what I had expected. We were tired & wanted to sleep so we said not more about it. The room was small & very dark with no central light and a very small window overlooking Madison Avenue. The carpet was badly worn and where it was curved up the wall (instead of skirting) it was coming away from the wall and the cables & plugs were all "stuffed" behind them. The bed was not a King Size and for America really quite small. It was not well made and looked lumpy although was comfortable for sleeping. The heating/cooling unit was so noisy it could not be left on for very long. The TV was widescreen but there were no instructions & limited channels. The Bathroom was clean but the suite was very dates and damaged in places. I have no idea what the "normal" rooms look like but this was not Superior in any way and a real disappointment. I guess it is all about your personal expectations and mine were particularly high on this occaision based on their website & the email from the staff. My expectations were sadly not met. Location is excellent for walking the city of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: AllanBennett
Reviews.Content: The entrance is grand but don't be fooled. The rooms are very small and very (very) old! Service sucks. We arrived one morning at 10am and we're told we couldn't check in before 3pm to our room as no rooms were available and had to sit in the bar. When we spoke to the manager suddenly a room became available. The doormen are only interested in looking at your hands to see how much tip they will get. None of them helped us take our luggage up the stairs. One night all the corridors stunk of smoke. The door to our room stops about 3 inches off the ground so the smell enters the room. There is also no room service between 11pm and 8am. A hotel in NYC with no room service. Absurd. You also have to pay for wireless internet access. You can use it for free at the coffee shop opposite. But the hotel makes you pay to use your laptop. The linen on the bed is also really cheap. So much so that you get static on your clothes and shocks when you turn on the light after being in bed. Cheap and nasty

Reviews.Title: “Dated but great location”
Reviews.Author: moretravelpleez
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through our company travel site (a requirement) as it's one of the approved hotels and I ran out of options. On the way to NYC, I checked Tripadvisor for ratings and were very worried. Needless to say my expectations were low going in. Which probably helped with my ratings a bit. The price for what I got was steep, but NYC hotels are generally expensive. I would've rather stayed at a smaller boutique hotel if I were traveling on my own dime. Regardless, the room and the hotel is very old. My room is small, but not unbearable. The bathroom is relatively clean. It's showing its age and reminds me of the hotel I stayed at in Paris. The location can't be beat. It was close to a lot of shops and Grand Central station. I was there for work so didn't have time to do much, but if you're there for fun, the location is fantastic. It' not a nightmare hotel, just very aged.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, fantastic location, will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: Hillary_bb
Reviews.Content: rooms a great size for NYC, very comfortable...corridors a bit dated and vending rooms very smelly. Hotel staff very helpful and accomodating, hotel bars and restaurants very good tho room service and some meals very overpriced. overall FABULOUS hotel and fantastic city

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mlrein
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice experience despite the bad reviews it got. The location was wonderful just across grand central station and in walking distance from the main NYC attractions. The room was neat and relatively spacious. The price I've paid was relatively low (booked with priceline.com). The stay was worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to be on a cold December night...”
Reviews.Author: fitzpatrickBoston
Reviews.Content: Arrived one very very cold night - room was freezing. Engineer came up and told me i could have it either very hot or very cold - he suggested putting it on very hot and he kindly offered to open a window for me ! Tried to put valuables in the safe - but it did not work. Room eventually heated up - then was cold for the rest of the night - gave up and froze. Next morning - NO hot water for a shower - handle would not go as far as hot..- I am sure the engineer would have come - but who has time for an engineer at 7.00 a.m. on the way to an early meeting ? I took a very cold shower..On the way out i stopped to tell the desk - I got - no eye contact - and no apology. All for $375 a night, and $14.95 for internet access.. Not a good place to be on a cold December night..

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Bolt-Hole, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bluetom
Reviews.Content: I had the hotel recommended to me when I booked my stay earlier in the year. This was our first trip to mainland USA so fully took it as read that we would have to pay big bucks for the honour of a room in Midtown. Of course what added to the price was a low Sterling/Doller exchange rate, coupled with the peak period of the Christmas Holidays. As usual, I scanned the reviews and after contacting one or two reviewers, concluded that the hotel was OK. Upon arrival being ejected from our airport shuttle bus onto the sidewalk the two beefy concierges looked the other way when we struggled to get our luggage into the hotel. At the reception, the lady behind the counter seemed to utter "credit card" then chucked two key cards to us. No assistance forthcoming from bell hops with our luggage, and there was me thinking that staff would be falling over themselves to help (with the expectation of the regulation tip). I can only repeat what people say about the rooms. Quite compact, nice bed which was kept clean and sheets changed each day and a noisy air conditioning unit. The bathroom was musty and recent repairs to the tiling had obviously taken place. I mentioned that this was a first trip, so my surprise at no coffee or tea making facilities has now passed. I now know this is the norm. So for that morning cuppa when you first awake has to come from the coffee bar across the street. The one thing that cannot be denied is that it's location means that within a 20 minute walking radius you could tick off 75% of your "to do" list. Our time there coincided with a few corporate events, with the lobby and bars teeming with delegates of one form or another on expense accounts one would imagine. I think the hotel seemed more geared up for that side rather than tourists. I came away with the feeling that we had paid over the odds just for somewhere to lay our heads and would definitely be looking elsewhere for our intended second visit.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tillytrotterCoDurham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Roosevelt for 4 nights no complaints at all were on the 7th floor lovely room very spacious with 2 queen beds plus a free safe. Great location everything within walking distance for sight seeing or visting bars and restuarants Irish bars down the road on 45th street served lovely meals and drink. My high light of the break was the ice skating it was a scream any one going at this time of year must give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind SERIOUSLY SHABBY chic then you won't mind this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HimandHer_10
Reviews.Content: You can't argue with the hotel's location, it's a 10 minute walk from Times Square and to the Empire State Building, and literally around the corner from Grand Central Station. The stunning lobby of the hotel gives a false impression of the quality of the rooms. I read all the recent reviews before we went and thought that, as they were mixed, the hotel could be better than some of the more recent reviews suggest. The rooms are small(ish) but not tiny. It's the shabbiness of the rooms that really surprised me. Patches of carpet had been replaced where they'd obviously had a leak in the bathroom at some stage, but all the edges of the replaced section were badly frayed, all of the furniture was stained and damaged, the fridge was randomly in the middle of the room, paint was flaking off the ceiling, but the worst thing was the bathroom - in serious need of updating. Shower head was loose from wall, bath was badly chipped and a little mouldy - floor looked really grubby. We asked to look at two other rooms thinking that if we upgraded to a more expensive room, the quality would be better, but actually the Deluxe room and the Suite were of equally poor quality. So we then tried to change hotel but it was Thanksgiving Day and everywhere else was booked up - we were so disappointed because we were on our honeymoon. Plus the air conditioning unit in the room was really noisy to the point where we had to switch it off so that we could get some sleep and had to open window instead - but the city lives up to its reputation of the 'city that never sleeps' and the horns, roadworks etc went on ALL NIGHT. On top of that, the service received in the bar was really bad - a couple of the waiters were nice but the rest were surly and actually damn right rude (they automatically add service to your order so guess they feel that they don't need to deliver a reasonable standard of service). They even kicked two hotel guests out of the bar because they weren't buying drinks and therefore earning them tips. Concierge staff weren't particularly helpful, got the feeling that they were sending people to places that they have a personal link too rather than what might suit the guest. On the bright side, the food was good. I heard from one of the taxi drivers - and I have no idea whether or not this is true - but the hotels above central park in streets numbered 60's and 70's were cheaper, but of far better quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: HAZELGRE
Reviews.Content: Don't know why this hotel has some bad reviews, its a brilliant Hotel in a superb location, its clean the staff are super and the beds are so comfortable (with sheets changed everyday), its the best sleep ever, will definetly go back for sure ITS FANTASTIC

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: millerlit
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous. It is one block from Grand Central where you can catch subway anywhere. I walked to Time Square and to the United Nations. The walk was about 15-20 minutes at a leisurely pace. Checkin and checkout was no problem. No lines and no wait. The staff was friendly. I would see about three maids every morning working on my floor. They all were friendly. My room was clean and spacious. I had a very comfortable king sized bed. I could hear a little outside noise from my room on the 11 floor. Basically the passing police car or fire engine with sirens on. I think I would have heard that staying anywhere though. Overall I had a great stay here the week of Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel - Don't trust all of the reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Lapper21
Reviews.Content: Before I travelled to New York I made the decision to look at some reviews of the hotel!! I booked with Virgin Holidays so I did expect the hotel to be nice, and I was let down by what I was reading!! ... However I arrived at the hotel early and we were able to store our bags free of charge (which is rare for New York) but obviously left a small tip as expected and I was shocked at the fact that as soon as you walk out the hotel everything is only blocks away!! It was fantastic, 5th Avenue is on your doorstep and Times square a few blocks away from that!! When we did eventually arrive in our room (we stayed on the 15th floor) I was so happy that the reviews were wrong. The room was big, more than clean... It was basic but thats what I expected for a 3*... We had a 32" television and a king size bed!! I had no issues with the room, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean and was well stocked with toiletries and towels and over all the room was ABSOLUTLY FINE! The hotel staff were friendly, as said before they allowed us to not only keep our suitcases for free upon arrival, but they also held them for us on departure, again for free!!! (I have a lot of friends who travelled to New York who's hotels refused to hold them AT ALL after they had checked out) Maids greeted you with a smile in the corridors and hotel staff were friendly and helpfull, gave us a map when we arrived so we could get our bearings which was kind of them. I didnt book any excursions through the hotel as we had already pre booked online - and I suggest you do this also if youre thinking of going to New York as it saved us a lot of time and money. But the best thing about this hotel is the AMAZING LOCATION and the stunning entrance hall and the helpfull staff! Grand Central Station is pretty much next door so when we needed to get the subway to downtown it was quick, easy and cheap. I'm not sure if we were just lucky or if it was because we booked in January, so 11 months in advance, through 'Virgin Holidays' (which by the way was a fantastic price for flight, hotel and airport transfers) and I would definatly suggest booking with Virgin Holidays and staying at the Roosevelt... Just for the location if anything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Carol2477
Reviews.Content: Roosevelt is in an excellent location on 45th and 5th and easy to walk to Times Square and the Rockafella Centre. Lobby is very impressive but the rooms unfortunately do not match the first impression. We checked in OK although one of the rooms was not quite ready but we only had to wait about 20 minutes for the second set of keys so was OK. Reception staff on each occassion I had to see them were efficient and helpful. We were on the 5th floor and both rooms were clean and the beds are super comfy but the bathrooms are very tired. A lick of paint and some updated wallpaper will make the world of difference and lift this hotel so much. I know they class themselves with a 3.5 star but this is really a 3* with a great lobby area. Room sizes are OK although one room was smaller than the other but as we were using this just as a base it was more than adequate for the time we were staying. Breakfasts are expensive at the hotel (about $24 per person) , but I took the recommendation from another Trip Advisor review and used the Europa Cafe around the corner on 5th where the breakfasts are freshly made while you wait and come to around $8 pp with coffee. Always a good recommendation when you see the locals also coming in to use the cafe. Apart from the tired decor of the hotel, we were more than happy during our stay at the hotel and would happily stay here again if we come back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Not that pleased”
Reviews.Author: HereOnBiz
Reviews.Content: I keep going back and forth between whether this is an "okay for the money" hotel vs a "they should have given me my money back." Staff was courteous, the room is a nice-size for New York, but things were not as clean as they could have been (the bed ruffle was stained, carpet wasn't necessarily vacuumed), and there were big time issues re: the bathroom. For starters, not all rooms have a tub, so be sure to ask for one when you book. There is no upcharge, though, for them to move you, which is good. Bad news, though, is that my bath water was brown. Evidently, it's because the pipes are older and chemicals build up in them when water is not run often. My question was why they aren't running water between guests to clean the tub. But my tub had a grimy, white substance in the bottom even when I arrived, almost as though the cleaning solution had dried in there and not been wiped out, and I had to wipe it down myself. When I called the front desk to tell them my bathwater was brown, it took a bit longer than it should have for them to send an engineer, who then had go on the roof and do something with a pump before it would run clear again. The engineer acted as though this happened all the time. The next day, after the water was fixed, I took a bath and was already in the tub before I realized that housekeeping had not left any shampoo in the room. I called the front desk & told them I was there with wet hair & needed shampoo. Two more calls and 35 minutes later, they finally brought some. Things were not rough enough here for me to leave, but I do not plan to stay here again. On the bright side, the breakfast buffet staff were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “rooms desperately in need of refurbishment. Once that's done, could be great”
Reviews.Author: ed1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on business. The lobby is beautiful and check in was very quick. I was very disappointed with the room. The carpet was threadbare, the bathroom looked dirty, the furniture was very old, the aircon looked dirty and the view was of a wall. Having said that it was very quiet, which is very unusual for NYC. Breakfast was great and checkout was also very efficient. The public areas of the hotel have a great atmosphere and this hotel could be great if the rooms were brought up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Roosevelt Hotel in New York was fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: foreverred123
Reviews.Content: Great location we managed to see everything we had hoped to see in New York the Hotel is very clean the rooms are a good size. The bed was very comfortable and a great sized bathroom all in working order the room was a little bit over warm and we had to have the air conditioning on which was quite noisy but overall we were very pleased and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and quality!”
Reviews.Author: Woodlandsartgal
Reviews.Content: I purchased a web deal with flight based on pictures and location. The regular amount for a basic room in this hotel was more than $100 avobe what we paid per day, so we actually got a 4 stars hotel for the price of a 2 1/2!. You can't beat the location, steps from 5th Ave, Rockefeller Ctr, St Patrick, Central Park, Brodway. We walked everywhere and felt safe at all times. This is a boutique hotel, beautifully appointed lobby, bar, shops and rooms -but not the Astoria, so no valets running up to you to get the bags or dust your shoes, but who wants that anyway! The desk people were great, and even booked events for us. The room was big for NY standards, good quality, high and puffy queen beds, upgraded crisp linens, extra pillows (I think we had 5 per bed) and chocolates waiting for us every day, on top of the regular hotel stuff like daily paper. Super clean, we don't have one single complaint. New York is a lottery for accomodations, and very expensive, so finding a good place to stay is a gift. I will stay there again next time, if I find a similar deal. Strongly recommend it. BTW, the web pictures reflect exactly what this place is like!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous, save yourself a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Explorer_adventur108
Reviews.Content: My sister and I arrived after pre-booking a month before. They did not have a room for us, we had to wait half an hour four a room to be prepared. When we finally went up to check out the room, it was literally disgusting, in opposition to the front lobby. We were absolutely shocked. Dirt everywhere, foot prints on the bed, stains on the mirrors, dirty stained curtains and worse then anything an air conditioner which was blowing out filthy air. My sister started to get hives. We immediately left the room and went to reception to request to be moved. They refused and only offered to have someone clean the room, which would not change the general state. In the end we found ourselves out on the streets of New York on our first night in the rain, looking for a new hotel to spend our first night. With no alternative we ended up having to spend $300 for a night somewhere else on top of it. They refused to refund us for that night, even though we didn't spend it in the hotel. Staff were rude, the manager extremely stubborn and unhelpful. I truly do not know how people can stay in such poor conditions, the decor is also very old and grotty, do not be fooled by the plush lobby. I will never visit again and would advice everyone I know to stay totally clear!

Reviews.Title: “Old and dingy”
Reviews.Author: livNewYork
Reviews.Content: The lobby was grand. Rooms are ridiculously old. Upholstery on chairs stained and disgusting. Bathroom door in room 963 does not fully close! Mattress is the oldest mattress that I have ever slept on. My husband and I woke up sore. For the location and price of this hotel, they should put money into updating it. I was afraid I would get bedbugs in this dingy place. No where to eat in the hotel except for a cramped, noisy bar. Restaurant only open in the morning and room service would only deliver to the room, not to the sitting area in the lobby. We spent as much time out of the room as possible though. Very, very disappointed. Would never go back and would never recommend. Try the Casablanca. A friend stayed there and it was magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KrissyK47
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a wonderful hotel! I have stayed her twice and was very pleased both times. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the beds were comfortable and the location is great. We take the train in and are able to walk to the hotel from Grand Central there are plenty of subway stations nearby. We also walk from the hotel to 5th Ave and Times Square! Any time I travel to NY I will stay at the Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “living on past glories and borrowed time”
Reviews.Author: erin_smith80
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there before looked forward to going back for our honeymoon, was given a smoking room on arrival and had to move in the morning. New room very dingy but not as bad as our friends who had a room so small they couldnt walk round the bed. Staff very unfriendy and unhelpful. Will not be going back anytime soon, needs millions spent on it to bring it back to a decent hotel. Should be downgraded to a standard hotel not a premier one as it is at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “NO SERVICE, NO HELP, RUDE PEOPLE.”
Reviews.Author: MarieChristine001
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry, my english in not perfect but I have to review this hotel. It is one of the worst hotels where I stayed. When I check-in, I said that I had to make a phone call to my bank in order to make a transfer of money on my credit card. The very rude woman at the front desk didn't listen to anything and she told me: if you don't have money , you cannot stay here. I have money, I just need two minutes to make a transfer from my bank account to my credit card. It was done in 5 minutes. My credit card was accepted and she didn't make any excuse. She act like she was the hotel's owner. The room was clean but the shower was almost broke. There is a lot of noise in the hotel in the morning not from the guest but from the the housekeepers. Those ladies are screaming in the corridor or listening to loud music when they are cleaning the room next door. The day of my departure, i stored my luggage at the hotel until the evening. I Waited 20 minutes before the bell boy took my bag and then he complained to have more tips in a very rude way. There was a problem with the telephone in my room. The line 1 started automatically without any reason while I was not on the phone and the speakers was on without any reason now and then.. I asked an employee in the corridor if it was possible to send somebody to verify the phone and guess what no one ever came to my room to help me with this phone. No service, impolite people and a bell boy running after you for more money when the service is awful. Avoid this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: travelgal111
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights, we liked the location close to Grand Central Station. The maid came everyday, but never did much cleaning, we had stuff on the floor the whole time and never vacumned. Tub backed up and asked to get housekeeping in to clean it and they didn't show up till they next day because we had to phone again. Should redo the bathrooms as they were discusting and old, with the amount we pay to stay there they should update the bathrooms. Bellboy was run off his feet when we wanted to store our luggage waiting for our plane. Front desk check-in was fast but not the friendliest.

Reviews.Title: “Disturbed Sleep”
Reviews.Author: beancounter69
Reviews.Content: The reception area and front lobby is all one could wish for as described in other reviews - the size and decor are impressive. The location is ideal for exploring New York and our room was passable as we only used it for sleeping in, or so we thought. We were on a "package deal" organised by our travel agent as a "Round the World Tour", so individual costs are not known. Our travel agent advised and supplied various vouchers as required - this hotel we were told did not require a voucher and had been pre-paid. When we arrived at reception we were asked for a voucher, we explained the situation and confirmed that the room had been paid for. At 1.40am we were woken up by the alarm on our 'phone going off - it was to advise us that a message was waiting for us at reception. The message turned out to be a request for our hotel voucher! There was no apology for waking us at that time in the morning - no word of "sorry" - just a "our accounting systems require a voucher" despite the room having been paid for! The man on reception got quite beligerent that we had no voucher, until somebody more senior came out of the back office and calmed it down by saying a voucher was not necessary, but still no word of apology. The second night was disturbed again in the early hours of the morning (3am) by the sounds of rubbish collection in the road outside that went on for about half an hour. Thankfully we did not stay for a third night. The other disappointing fact was that the restaurant was closed for our stay so all we could get were some expensive bar snacks, although they were tasty - and the bar staff did smile and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Lobby, Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: holidayfan55
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place is the location. Bang slap in the middle of Manhattan! On first entering the hotel the lobby just has to be seen. Always buzzing and a 1930's feel about it. We found the reception staff friendly and the concierge helpful. (Their commission was a bit high on the airport shuttle they booked for us. May be better to book something like that direct yourself) Also the bar just off the lobby was a nice spot for a relaxing drink after a busy day sightseeing. From there the business centre with internet access is fairly reasonable with the usual free boarding pass printing service. We didn't have time to check out the gym. Our main complaint is the room. The only one they had available for us was a smoking room. (We don't smoke so not ideal) But although the room was of a good size the carpet was absolutely filthy! We were already worried about bed bugs so this was the last thing we wanted to see. Also there were urine stains around the toilet pan and no non slip surface in the bath tub or even a safety grab rail. Very dangerous. However as we were only sleeping and showering in the room we didn't let it spoil New York. Which was fantastic! The only reason I would recommend this hotel is for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Likeable and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: spec1993
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars suits this place. Nice place orig from '24. Room was nice and clean and was pleased w lobby and the service. The usual issues for a high traffic hotel: light switches that were in need of replacement, slow bath drain, some signs of small amounts of missing tile. Aside from that a few blocks from subway, a comfortable bed and good a/c. Can't complain for the price and won't for http://hotwire.com price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: trevorquinn
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous. The hotel personnel were very courteous. While the room was a little small (but not really for NYC rooms), it was clean and met our needs. Check in and check out was easy. I would definitely stay here again and I have stayed in many NYC hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, don't trust the concierge, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mirweer
Reviews.Content: You can't deny the location of this place is fantastic and the price is fantastic. But here is what you should know: - no queen beds, only doubles- we had 4 in the room and the first room we were given wouldn't have had enough room for all of our suitcases to be open at the same time. They upgraded us for free as we thought we had booked queen rooms, and the second room was much nicer. Book the Superior room, not the deluxe. - DON'T TRUST THE CONCIERGE. We should have learned- they told us they could get us Broadway tickets for $190 on face value of $130. Not once did he mention the tkts booth at Times Square which we knew about, and got the same tickets for $65 each. We asked them to call La Esquiana for reservations and the guy wouldn't bother because "they don't answer their phone". My friend had a concierge at another hotel she stays at regularly call for us only to find out they were booked (apparently they do answer their phone sometimes?) Then our concierge sent us to an OK restaurant (Alfredos) for dinner. Finally, we booked an airport limo through them and paid the price of a limo ($135 plus tip and toll) but got a freaking cargo van. This is the New York Concierge you have heard about- the one that wants to rip tourists off. We had 3 different people so it wasn't just a single person that led us wrong. RECOMMEND: Do your research before you go and don't ask the hotel for help. - Agree with the comment about cleanliness - there were always dirty dishes in the hall from room service. However, our room was always cleaned well and the bathroom was pretty good. - We walked everywhere from this hotel and paid for cabs only twice in our 4 days stay. That is most certainly worth something in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mack_7
Reviews.Content: Terrific Midtown location. We stayed 3 nights and had a great time. The hotel is a block from Grand Central, and an easy walk to the theater district, Times Square, the shops on 5th Avenue and Rockefeller Center. Lots of restaurants nearby. The room was small but nice. Staff was friendly and helpful. Very impressive old time lobby with lots going on all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Lord, Don't Make Me Go Back to Hotel Hell”
Reviews.Author: lagniappe34
Reviews.Content: My employer booked this hotel for our entire traveling party via Priceline (I think). We had a crew of about 10 traveling to NYC to cover the Rangers playing the Yankees in the ALDS. The good: The location of the Roosevelt is great. Right in Midtown, near Grand Central (Hello, Joe's coffee!) near an Equinox at which I like to work out, nice little location. Granted, I'd prefer to be on the UES, but I digress. My maid, Bonaventura, was lovely. She cleaned the heck out of my nasty, crusty room and was as sweet as could be. That's about it. I'm a service gal I just like nice people. It's the Texan in me. The staff couldn't even muster basic niceties that a random cabbie in the city offers. Seriously. Front desk attendants wear buttons with the letters "WIT". I asked one what it meant and she replied "Whatever It Takes". That's supposed to refer to their willingness to be helpful and accommodating. Didn't happen. It would have made more sense had they worn buttons with the letters WTF because that's the attitude most of them had. The bellman did not offer to help us when got out of the cab. I don't care, I travel with just one bag but our photographers carry around 5, many of them weighing 50 pounds or more. No offer of help at all. I could go on: front desk people had nothing, upon checkout a woman refused to give me a receipt b/c we paid on Priceline. I just wanted the blank sheet in case my employer needed something for their records (you never know) and she fought me for 5 minutes! The bellman who held my bags for my after I checked out ASKED me to tip him before I even had the chance to get my money out of my purse. The valet asked if I wanted a cab (i usually just grab my own) I said yes, he goes to the street and starts talking to a town car driver about their night out the previous night. After 5 minutes I looked at him and he replies "It's not happening". No, it's not. The rooms apparently haven't been updated since 1947. They are small, have wobbly furniture and crunchy carpets. The bathroom was so small that the door hit me in the knees when I had to use the restroom, eclipsing the postage stamp sized Italian train, I once had to take. It had absolutely no counter space, save for a tiny little glass shelf. I had to put my products on the toilet seat to get ready. I could go on but don't want to relive the experience. The thing is the Roosevelt is always packed with a lot of overseas tourists and price-conscious travelers. It succeeds on price alone. I'm not sure what we paid but no doubt it was cheap. This hotel was at full capacity throughout our stay. Forget botox, it needs a full-on facelift but undoubtedly it will continue to operate with its wrinkly, shriveled miserably facade and terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Location”
Reviews.Author: KDMumbai
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel when on business tour to NY. Due to its location (45th, Madison) we chose the hotel, and should say it was a good choice. But things get worse from here :). Rooms are small, I found clock / alarm in non working condition, and surprised to learn that it is same for many a rooms. As usual for NY hotels, at astonishing (read high) room rates, you don't get any service / amenities. Mind you, this is a really big hotel with 1000+ rooms, so we found a long "q" every day for check-in and check-out. One irritating fact was waiting for 5 minutes each time you want to get an elevator. From second day, we got bored with same breakfast, and really pity that they don't even try to change juice (standard Orange juice everyday) though I was there almost 2 weeks. Only positive thing was that I got some vegetarian choice in B/F and took it regularly. I found location to be good for business purpose, as many of the offices I went, were nearby. Also subway station (Grand Central) was a stone's throw away, which would help a vacation traveler as well. You would find Times Square, Empire state and Rockefeller bld nearby, as well as Macy's and Syms.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: DMC454
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. From the moment we stepped out of our car the staff were friendly and helpful. We requested a cot in our room for our teen-aged son, and the desk clerk provided the cot and then up-graded our room from a 'cozy double' to a larger room at no charge. The room was very clean, the mattresses looked virtually new and the bedding was very nice. We chose this hotel for it's location and period atmosphere, and we were not disappointed. Our room was very quiet. Some minor delays waiting for elevators. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The lobby is wonderful -- don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: marco_polo_1450
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is in a great location and has a wonderful lobby, but don’t stay there. Three nights cost of US$1,046.73 included a $14.95 internet use charge. After spending a night in a room that seemed to be a sauna, it took two phone calls to get some attention to the air conditioner that then never worked properly. Continuing to turn the water faucets on the wash basin shut off the water, then it flowed again. Paint was pealing off the ceiling in the room. I never received a reply in response to a guest comment card. It was only in terms of the size of my room that I was more fortunate than our project director who was assigned a room no larger than an oversized rabbit hutch –after he complained, he was moved to a larger room at an additional charge of $50/night. A colleague who lives in Manhattan recalled that people he knows were complaining about the Roosevelt 30 years ago – the experience staying there has not improved!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, poor cleanliness and amenity : good location, good lobby”
Reviews.Author: TravellerDownUnder53
Reviews.Content: $3,300 for 7 days in a 2-double bed room for 3 adults -- overpriced for disappointment!! Roosevelt is rated 3.5 star but during our 5 weeks in US so far we have stayed in 3 star and B&B that are much better. Disinterested desk staff, rude concierge (you wait when there when you are the only "guest" and there are 2 staff who look down and don't even acknowledge you). Guy that brought our bags to the room was great - but the only good service so far. There is dust sitting along top of bathroom door frame and falling down - have a picture to send to management. Rest of cleaning very average. Doona quilts are lumpy. Outrageously costly AT&T internet only option. $3 minimum time to print in business centre turned into $9 because I had to wait in line at check-in desk (concierge disinterested) for paper because printer was empty!! Air con looks so old we're not game to turn it on so have window up couple of inches so very, very noisy. Laundry came back today - have to send one pair trousers back due to mark on them. They have lost mail that was sent to me from another US State. Bar staff are rude but the lobby is beautiful and classic. Need to spend less on huge beautiful arrangement of lillies in centre of lobby and more on customer service training and cleaning. It's a comedy, but a black one. Here for a few more days unfortunately. Location is the saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: mudd_stuffin
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Roosevelt because 1) we did not want to take a 630am flight into NYC and 2) it was close to where I needed to go to work. We would generally stay at the Intercontintental a block or so away but it was fully booked. Looking back, I would rather wake up at 3am to catch the 630am flight than to fly in a night earlier to sleep at this hotel. The check-in staff was definitely not overly welcoming, to put it mildly. The rooms are old and there are stains between the tiles. The ironing board was basically placed on the floor at one end. The room could definitely have used some restoration. All in all, the sub-$200 rate is decent for the location but it is definitely not a place I would recommend if cleanliness was important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy staff, do not help and always asking a tip”
Reviews.Author: ckotadia
Reviews.Content: Well located, ordinary breakfast and rooms, systems crash all the time so no morning alarm (terrible for busines travellers) i would have missed my flight had i not got a phone call from my office.. staff is snobbish and unhelpful, they promised to call when i room was ready but they didnt, porters asking for tips all the time, the only guy who was helpful without any expectation was the doorman who helped me with the cab..

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie59
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic website and the pictures are very misleading. The reception area is pleasant (not as nice as you would think from looking at the website). However, our room was terrible. We stayed on the 9th floor. The smell on entering the floor was of must and damp. I tried not to inhale from leaving the lift to getting to my room where we kept the window open because of the smell. The room was tiny. Apart from not being able to open our suitcase because there was no floor space, the net curtains were dirty and smelly. The carpet was old and smelled. I never walked on it in my bare feet - I ensured my flip flops were at the ready beside my bed when I got up in the morning. The noise ensured that we got plenty of disturbed sleep. We could hear people talking in the rooms beside us. The bathroom was old and in need of reburbishment. I just cannot say one good thing about this place. Yes, the location is good but the hotel is basic and that is crediting it beyond its' worth. Staff were not helpful with bags etc. Will NEVER be back.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: ktmd
Reviews.Content: Immediately I was disappointed that the guests had to haul their luggage up a flight of stairs without any assistance. During our stay, we witnessed several bell caps hanging out at the "station" but not assisting guests up the stairs. Additionally, we were told the rooftop cafe (Mad46) was closed on Thursday night, when in fact, it wasn't. We only knew this because family members were already up there waiting for us. Furthermore, it was closed on that Friday night "due to inclement weather", however it was a beautiful evening. Then, come to find out, it was "seasonally" closed on Saturday night (Oct 2nd). This rooftop bar was one of the big reasons we chose this hotel. I was hugely disappointed in this, plus the "clandistine" way you accessed the floor (you were supposed to just "stand" at the entrance until someone came to the door to let you in, and escorated you upstairs). All in all, it was NOT worth the money we paid. Yes, it's a historically significant hotel, but it's still old and inefficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn B
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went to NYC on a Friday morning for her appointment at Sloan Kettering. We were looking for a place to stay near the theaters as we had tickets for "La Cage aux Folles" that evening. We wanted a clean hotel that was convenient to the theaters at a fair price! We were thrilled with our find! The Roosevelt was only a couple of blocks away from Grand Central Station which was our gateway to the city. It was only about six blocks away from the theater where "La Cage aux Folles" was playing that evening; we felt safe as we walked through Times Square and the surrounding neighborhood back to the Roosevelt. The Roosevelt is lovely upon entering with a grand lobby. The service was great and we used Express checkout the next day. We also enjoyed a nice breakfast in their ground floor restaurant. We stored our bags with the staff so we could walk to the King Tut Exhibit unencumbered the next day when we met my son and husband. We also ventured to Bubba Gump's shrimp restaurant and Midtown Comics. It was very nice to be able to just drop back in at the hotel and pick up our bag and head for the train at Grand Central Station. We will definitely return to explore the city some more!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - not so great room”
Reviews.Author: Getting2KnowTheWorld
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. The bar is amazing - our bartender Hermando was great =), he suggested a great champagne cocktail. Great location - only a few blocks from Grand Central Station. The room smelt damp/mildew so we changed rooms. Then we ended up next to the garbage compactor or dump which was loud until about 10pm. The bathroom only had two wash clothes, no shower cap, and not a single bath towel. When we called for towels it took over 10 minutes. We have one more night left - lets see how it goes

Reviews.Title: “Expected more . . .”
Reviews.Author: Coloradogirl8888
Reviews.Content: The location was great! Easy walking distance to metro and close to the action (Times Square, etc). We got there late the first night and even though we had a late check in reserved we still got a smoking room in which something had been spilled on the floor and the industrial fan was still on and the floor was still wet when we got there. Also the room was smaller than what we paid for and they wouldn't compensate us at all. They did give us a different room for the rest of the nights but the first night was awful! The staff was ok, but we got better advise from locals and those who had visited in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Lovelly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: derek104
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two friends have just returned from a four night stay at the Rossevelt hotel and we were very happy with the hotel. I had read reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. Our room was more than adequate. The bed was large and comfortable and the sheets were changed daily. The bathroom was of normal size and fresh towels were provided every day. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. There is a handy little gift shop in the hotel lobby which sells the sort of things that you forget to take on holiday. Our friends were able to buy an electric plug converter from there. We used the bar each evening just for drinks and found the prices reasonable. We did not try the restuarant as we ate out each evening due to the vast choice of restaurants in New York. We also ate out for breakfast choosing a different deli each day which all had a huge choice on the menu. The hotel is in a great location. It is in easy walking distance of lots of the sights that New York is famous for. Walking in New York is the best way to see the sights. If you need to be from one place to another quickly use the underground (subway). We bought a one day ticket for $8 and used it all day to go up and down the island. If you visit at the right time of year hire some bikes in Central Park. We hired them for two hours and could have spent all day in there. Well recommended I would definately go back to the Roosevelt Hotel and would recommend it to friends. It is a beatiful looking and comfortable hotel full of old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect hotel to have the Big Apple experience- close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: pldunn62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roosevelt with several families and friends to visit New York and attend the US Open in Flushing. The hotel is rich in history and has been restored into a beautiful landmark. It is a very short waling distance to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, and lots of shopping and great experiences. A quick cab ride will get you to the Empire State Building, Soho, and the Financial District. The hotel rooms were quite big for rooms typically found in the city. All was clean and housekeeping was very pleasant. We could have stayed outside of the city near Flushing but so glad we went to The Roosevelt to complete our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: WVBeth
Reviews.Content: Took a quick trip to NYC with my mother. We picked the Roosevelt Hotel for its location. Let me say this is a perfect location, close to Rock Center, Grand Central, bus tours, Times Square. I read some reviews that were not favorable, but our experience was great. I work in the hospitality industry and may be more critical than most. First, check in was quick and the staff was very friendly. The lobby is beautiful. The rooms were clean, but could use a little updating. The bedding was very comfortable. Could have used a vanity top in the bathroom instead of a pedestal sink as there was not much space to spread out. We had to be organized with our make up, etc. Still not a hugh deal. Yes, the rooms are small, but we didn't pick this hotel for room size and didn't go to NYC to spend all our time in the room. We only got to go to the Mad46 bar on the roof one night as the weather wasn't cooperative. Had a nice time there though. The main lounge was very nice. We had drinks there several nights and dinner once. Abdul our server for two nights was super! He was very nice and took good care of us. One thing we didn't care for was the buffet breakfast. The eggs seemed to be powdered, the hot food was just barely warm, and we thought the price was a little high. We only went there once. Didn't get to try the VanderBar restaurant. Check out was quick. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ellmerfud
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, we found the hotel staff to be very nice and helpful, also the location was great, 5 minute walk your were on 5th Avenue. The hotel itself looks great inside and the hotel rooms are a good size and nicely decorated, although the bathroom could do with updating, all in all i would definately recommend this hotel and go back to it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: B_Oddie
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my girlfriend and had a brilliant time. It was our first visit to NYC and as a base to see all the major sites, the location is perfect. Only 10 mins to times sq, straight on to Madison avenue and just around the corner from grand central. We walked to most places, including battery park for the statue of liberty/ellis island tours, but hopped on the subway a couple of nights which was cheap and right around the corner from the roosevelt. As for the hotel itself, first impressions were excellent. The lobby is very nice, as is the bar area. Drinks are expensive but so is everywhere else! We were having a late drink one night whilst two weddings were being held there, and the atmosphere and people in the bar were brilliant. The rooms were spot on, not huge but big enough. Also had a very comfy bed. After reading some of the comments on here regarding the state of the rooms, we had a good look around when we got to it. Yes, they may be slightly dated and the bathroom was a bit on the small side, but this is really just being picky as the room had everything we needed. Luckily, we had better things to do on our trip then taking pictures of any marks on the curtains, cracked tiles or improperly positioned pillows (we had none of these!) and I think that the people taking issue with such trivial things should probably try and get out more or stay in a more expensive hotel! Overall, this hotel was perfect for what we wanted on our first trip to this fantastic city. It is good value for money and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an ideal place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful older hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: shadow4813
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with friends stayed at the Roosevelt for four nights during our trip to New York. The hotel is located on the corner of Madison Ave and 45th St which is the perfect location. You are 5 blocks from Times Square, one block from Grand Central Terminal and central starting point for Central Park or the Financial District. The hotel itself is very nice. It is an older hotel (built in 1924 I believe) and has signs of being older - plaster has some cracks in it, very small bathrooms and closet etc. That being said, it is beautiful. The beds were incredibly comfortable, the room was a good size, the lobby was beautiful and the staff were very friendly. The bar on the main level sells Starbucks coffee as well as pastries, fruit etc in the morning which was much appreciated! We didn't get to check out the rooftop bar as it was closed due to rain. I would love to stay at this hotel again if I ever went back. It has great character and you couldn't ask for a better location!

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite hotel in New York with a perfect location & first-rate staff!”
Reviews.Author: FLAlady50
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff recognizes us, greets us with friendly big smiles, makes us feel at home. The breakfast staff treats us like royalty; breakfast buffet has fabulous fresh fruit, yummy French toast, custom-made granola, nice variety. Most of all, they treat us like family, or probably much better than many family members get treated! One concern I have is the slippery tub in my room. It is dangerous and an accident waiting to happen. That problem should be addressed promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: wattlegirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel didnt really live up to expectations. Lost luggage from L.A meant we checked in really late and the woman at the desk was rude. The foyer was beautiful as in the pictures, the hotel very busy and the staff ok but no stand outs.Special mention to Junior who was helpful in locating a good meal late at night. The room was ok, nothing special, dont use a rollaway you may never walk again. But the location was fantastic, on Madison Ave and so much in walking distance. Dont forget the leave room tip or your room just wont get cleaned Loved New York recommend everyone go there clean safe and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Comfy bed, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lysaeli
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York City and we stayed for 4 nights. The lobby looks so grand; it was really nice walking in to the hotel and seeing the chandelier and old fashioned decor. The room was small but enough for us and the bed was sooooo comfortable. Even with bands practicing right outside the hotel for the parade, the street noise was not bothersome at all. We walked over to Grand Central Station, Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Museum of Modern Art and Central Park. We took the subway for other locations. Great location! We would stay out late at night and felt very safe walking back to the hotel at 1-2 am. The lobby seemed to be a popular spot on St. Patrick's day. The parade was a block away so that was pretty nice! Patzeria Perfect Pizza delivers to the hotel in case you want seconds after visiting them on Times Square/Broadway!! My only disappointment was that the front desk responsible for luggage was not very helpful when it came to our lost luggage delivery inquiries. They acted like it was an annoyance each time we spoke to them. They kept telling us they would let us know as soon as they received our luggage from the airport. In the evening, we passed by the front desk and saw our luggage behind the desk and it was a few minutes before we could get the bell boy to pay attention to us. We had received no notice our luggage had arrived and we had been waiting in our room for hours since the airport had said it was on its way. But other than those men at the luggage desk, our hotel stay at The Roosevelt was very enjoyable. The ladies checking us in and out and the doorman who hailed our cab to the airport were very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Brilliant Location & UNBELIEVABLE CITY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: natalietaylor538
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at this hotel with my Dad at the end of September 2010. Was VERY dubious about staying here due to all the negative reveiws on this site. Almost changed it! So glad we didn't though, as the hotel was just what the doctor ordered. Very central- Grand Central was just round corner, and Times Square was a 5 min walk away, Empire State & Rock. Centre about 10. The location is a winner with this hotel! As for the hotel itself- we couldn't fault it. All the staff where so helpful- couldn't do enough for you. The hotel is very classic- nice lobby, lobby bar & very clean and well maintained. Didn't eat within the hotel, but from what i saw of the food it all looked good. The main lobby bar serves great cocktails- i recommend French Kiss!! No problem with the rooms, clean towels and sheets every day. Yes, the rooms are old and in need of a refurb, BUT they are clean, and to me, thats all that matters. As for the city itself, what can i say? It's New York! The most amazing city in the world! Did all the major sights- highly recommend the Big Apple helicopter tour run by Liberty Helicopters. A fantastic few days!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: RobinaDorset
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to New York this hotel was in a great location for seeing the city in two and a half days. the staff were all very friendly and our room was always clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Pompougnac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt for 5 nights, and after trying to find a good hotel with a good price ( everything was sold out or VERT expensive due to the United Nations General Assembly) we found the Roosevelt, which was a great surprise. It reminded me a lot of the Waldorf Astoria, with its old New York Charm. The lobby is great, the rooms are nice, the only thing is that the bathroom is VERY small. I also noticed that the room service trays stay outside the room for almost a full day. The location is absolutely remarkable, it is a block away from Grand Central ( try the Oyster Bar there!), 5th avenue and about 5 minute walk to Rockefeller center or Times square. I also recomend a restaurant/bar called The Rabbit in the Moon, on 8th St and 6th Ave. Great place for drinks, a superb Menu and we got to see Janet Jackson and Joaquin Phoenix there while we were having our drinks

Reviews.Title: “Lobby looks great, pity the rooms didn't match”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: Central location, great looking lobby makes you think you are in the 1920's and 1930's and fair price for NYC. Rooms were average and looked like they could use a freshen up. Service was a bit hit-and-miss. For the price we paid (around USD 220 inc tax), it was fair. I would go back knowing what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old world hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlsf415
Reviews.Content: the hotel lobby was big and beautiful and very old work classic. The rooms were a good size. The bed was very comfortable and restful. Location was great for shopping and getting around only 3 blocks from penn state station.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: badley
Reviews.Content: The only thing that's great about this hotel is the location, other than that I suggest biting the bullet and paying the extra dollar for a decent hotel! The staff and service is absolutely atrocious. Not only did we have to wait an extra 2 hours for our room, which we had reservations for, but that same night our credit card was compromised and had only been used at the front desk. We were also told that there were charges to the room, which is impossible since they didn't have any credit card information after we can canceled it. Seriously, it's not worth it even for a night I wouldn't recommend this hotel to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a girl's weekend!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girl's weekend. The free breakfast buffet was AMAZING. Location was great for all of us. Not a long walk to Time Square. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JETHampshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in August with my wife, we had a king room. Very impressed with hotel the service was great, the room was very spacious all worked out well. Hotel is located just off Madison Avenue in 45 East Street, very central and five minutes from central station. The main purpose of our visit was to go to the US Open Tennis and being near to Central Station made this simple as all it needs is to catch line 7 and this takes you out to Flushing Meadows, no problem. The decor of the hotel is very traditional lovely lobby chandiliers etc etc and has been the subject of renovation all done very nicely. The hotel is very busy as you would expect of a New York hotel but the staff deal with all extremely well. We have visited New York before and had done the major tourist things but did visit the Rockefeller centre by night, this is just around the corner off of 5th Avenue. Found some particularly interesting things to do including the High Line in the meatpacking district and a visit to Brooklyn Botanical Garden in the Summer is a must. Would thoroughly recommend the Roosevelt, great hotel, great location

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the Roosevelt btw 9-13 sept. I...”
Reviews.Author: r-hertsxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt btw 9-13 sept. I would have to agree that the best feature of the hotels the Lobby and bar area. But the rooms On the other hand had a damp/urine lingering smell.. Yuk! I also noticed that the room wasn't dusted during our stay. The lifts were constantly slow or out of order. The consierge were as much use as a chocolate fireguard recommending overpriced theatre tickets (40-70% more than tic face value). I don't generally like to moan about hotels but I thought this was just an average hotel with below average rooms with a posh looking lobby. Location was ok 3 blocks from time square and just a block away from grand central station. If in New York make sure you visit the Empire STate building and for some bargains -Woodbury Common. Be aware that almost everyone wants tips and they aren't afraid to demand them (taxi drivers being the worse) and don't be surprised by the grumpy obnoxious attitudes of new york'ans... Rude!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: TXgirl1974
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt with friends the week before Labor Day. There were four women sharing one room and as you can imagine, we had luggage, shoes & shopping bags everywhere! But we still had plenty of room to move around. There were two double beds, an easy chair, a desk & chair, and a TV on a console. There was also a big closet. The bathroom was small, as others have pointed out, and there was hardly any surface area to put our toiletries. But we didn't care since we were hardly in the room anyway. The A/C unit didn't seem to be too loud for us, although it did leave the room a little humid. The location of this hotel is so convenient. It's only a block or two from Madison Ave and Fifth Ave and all that great shopping. It's only about five blocks from Times Square, and Grand Central Terminal is also very close. We only took the subway a few times as so many things were within walking distance. We walked to the Empire State Building in about 15 minutes, it's about 12 blocks south. Central Park is about 10 blocks north. We patronized the lobby bar, the Roosevelt Grill for breakfast, and Mad46, which is the rooftop bar. All had great service, food and drinks. I would definitely recommend the Roosevelt to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: MayGok
Reviews.Content: Planned to stay here for 7 nights, the first room provided was awful - the a/c was not operational and toilet did not flush. There were no lights in the room either! I then asked to be moved to another room and was upgraded however, again the a/c was having issues and the room has a damp smell. Rooms here are very old, dark and not comfy. Worst of all wi-fi here is flaky and hardly ever works - hotel staff are not friendly. Cancelled my stay and moved to another hotel for remaining 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: qtmarcie
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly. Hotel is historic with a beautiful lobby, good quality rooms . Located near great shops, few blocks from broadway, flat out amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest centralized hotel to stay at while in Manhattan New York city.”
Reviews.Author: Brown_Samantha
Reviews.Content: Got 7 nights with this hotel through Priceline bidding, so we were a bit nervous reading some of the negative reviews. It turned out to be the greatest pleasant surprise of the trip. The hotel is across the street from MetLife building, which sits on top of the Grand Central Terminal with easy access to 4,5,6,7 subway lines. It is also right on the Madison bus lines that takes you uptown to the Metropolitan Museum, Central Park. There are several cross town buses to Time Square and 5th Avenue. If you enjoy walking, we often walked back from the Theatre District after shows. Distance is about 15 minutes. Downtown bound buses run on Lexington, which is only a couple of blocks away. The hotel is surrounded by many restaurants, bakery, pubs, taverns. It is also 1 street from 5th Avenue, all the best shopping in the world. Rockafeller Center is just a few blocks away. The concierge is very helpful, made several great restaurant recommendations. We did not purchase any tickets through them, as we prefer to go right to the box offce for the best seats and avoid any type of service fees. The room is old fashion decor. They placed us on the 11th floor, so it is very quiet from the city street noise. We're so glad we did not stay around Time Square area, as the constant noise would have driven us crazy. The only negative thing to say about the room is that the bathroom has no counter space. The air conditioner worked great, which was a blessing in the hot summer week we went, but the unit is old and very loud, sounded like a freight train. Since I was a light sleeper and pack ear plugs where ever we go, I am glad they came in handy. The internet access is also not free, which is uncommon now since so many other hotels offer it for free.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: carolmarion
Reviews.Content: The room looked just as they show on their web site, very clean. Our package was very reasonably priced and included wonderful breakfast buffet. I would definitely recommend when you need to be in a central location in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jh2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the recommendation of our travel agent and then got a bit nervous when we saw some of the other reviews. We needn't have worried, The room we had was more like a junior suite (835) with a large bed, a seating area with sofa, microwave and fridge, 2 TV's. The bathroom was tiny ensuring that it's a bt of a shuffle getting in and out but your not in New York to sit on the toilet are you? The location was great being in the middle of manhattan and close to Grand Central station and the subways system. All in all a good hotel for a 5 day break.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location but be aware....”
Reviews.Author: Freelanderx
Reviews.Content: check the cleanliness of the room as soon as you get the key. Previous occupants had left assorted rubbish under the beds and the cleaners didn't bother to check - it took three times of complaining to get it sorted. Also if you get the concierge to get you tickets for either shows or, more importantly, Yankee games ask what the face value of the tickets are. I was charged almost 100% mark up - once you have paid (which you do before they are delivered) it is too late. on a positive note the location of the hotel is great it really is the best place to work from.
