Not far to walk to get to Central Park, Times Square etc and right on the doorstep of Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and most comfy bed ever”
Reviews.Author: susiegr
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at some of the negative comments here as we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and found it to be perfect - reception staff were friendly and efficient and there was plenty of information available in the hotel. The location is perfect, just two blocks from grand central so easy to use the subway to get around, plus withing easy walking distance of Empire state building and Times square. The room was a cosy double double the decor was a little bit tired but the room was clean and the beds were really comfortable with plenty of great feather pillows. The gym included free fruit which was really good. Air con was a bit noisy but other than that I cannot fault this place for the money a great stay our first time in NY - thank you

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the reviews - they are all true!”
Reviews.Author: MarkLincolnUK
Reviews.Content: Everything that has been said is true! Beautiful reception area, tired and dated rooms. the first one we had was cramped and noisy, but they happily gave us a new room the following day which was much, much better - so make a fuss if you need to! The price was right - special deal trhough travelzoo - and the location is excellent, a passage to Grand Central is just over the road. Empire State, Top of the Rock, Times Square etc all within an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very, Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ilario33
Reviews.Content: After a late flight which had us landing in NY at 12.30am, we arrived at the hotel eager to relax and unwind, only to find that there was no one at the door to take our luggage. The front desk staff were very rude and checked us into a room with two double beds for me and my wife as opposed to the king sized room we had ordered. The explanation, is that it is company Policy, that they guarantee you a room when you book but not the room type!! They basically oversell the rooms and offer no explanation or apology. First come, first serve. Very unprofessional. I suppose that expecting to receive what you pay for is a little too much at this hotel. Bar staff would not make me a hot chocolate for my wife as they did not have it. The rooms are very small, we could not really move in the room when you have two big suitcases. The bathroom is small. The elevators malfunctioned where it took us 30mins to get to our room. As we could not get past the 3rd floor. Also the housekeeping staff are very noisy in the mornings, so if you are jetlagged forget getting a good night sleep. The hotel has a very nice entrance and is in a great location, but for the price, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaLily
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a 1924 grand hotel which is reclaiming its beauty. The lobby is beautiful and bustling with people and fun. Everyone from housekeeping staff to the concierge and guy directing traffic are efficient and helpful. Some rooms may be small, but they are clean and the beds and linens are comfortable. The rooftop bar is really nice with wonderful views. I wish the music had been jazzy rather than hip hop, but the space is lovely with great seating. The Roosevelt is walking distance to Grand Central, MOMA, theater district, great shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Tad Expensive the Roosevelt - But the old 20's decor makes up for it”
Reviews.Author: MarkWButler5705
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Roosevelt for 3 days whilst we were on a short break to New York, the rooms are quite small, but the decor is in the 1920's theme, and I think thats when the hotel was built. We really enjoyed are stay, and it is central for everything in NYC, we even used the room service one night at a cost of about £ 50. Like other people have mentioned it is just around the corner from Central Station. Lots has been already said about this hotel, so I will keep it short. Lots of rooms, Reasonable Service and Staff, Expensive to stay, but it is central, like a comfortable suit its got it all , Nice Mark & Michaela

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sflannery67
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews on this site I was very dubious about staying at the hotel, on arrival the reception staff were very friendly as was the bellman who took our cases to our room, The room was clean and spacious and although the decor is dated this goes with the keeping of the period of the hotel, For me the location of the hotel was great close to times square, empire state building and 5th avenue, if you want to venture futher grand central station is 2 blocks away, I would stay at this hotel again and dont know why this hotel has had such bad reviews but then you cant please everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dealsnphotos
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is old but elegant, with a large open lobby and a nice bar. The staff was alway very helpful and friendly. It is located close enough to walk to anything you would need which was a plus for us. The room itself was small and had no view but was quite and clean. The bathroom was too small with no where to sit anything but had plenty of hot water and good water pressure. We didn't get maid service while we were there, I think we were just over looked, we only stayed two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed professional”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller79_10
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is the prefect location - Best of all is the location for mid town, 3rd ave, 5th Ave shops, Central Park, Times Square etc. which are central and walk distances, nice working gym with various free fruit, venue for conference room is grand, so was the lobby area. But this is were all things good end. I was really looking forward to staying at the hotel since I looked it up before travelling and was extremely disappointed. If you arrive in the early morning, do not expect any help at the door and the staff are equally unhelpful when you get in. The doorman are of no use when you ask them for directions, they half heartedly give you useless assistance. The bell hops were pleasant, the staff in the business area on the 2nd floor (but expect to pay for the services) were helpful and 1 (sandra) out of 5 reception staff made my stay bearable (all others were extremely unhelpful). I had to stay in this hotel for 10 days and the first 2 days, my room wasn't vacummed, then on the 3rd day till my last nite, when I can back after they had cleaned up in the morning, I'm always greeted with a very strong bleach smell. Didn't want to guess if they actually cleaned and changed the sheets and towels or just tidied. Housekeeping during the evening were extremely loud and didn't appreciate people might be sleeping in the next room (lots of doors slamming). The deco was very unexpected in the room. The bed was the only enduring thing in the whole room. The room was decent sized, bathroom rundown, no wardrobe space for hanging cloth after pressed. I am extremely happy that my company paid for this trip, and would not be recommending to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great location & decent sized room.”
Reviews.Author: KSM72
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Roosevelt hotel for 4 nights in August. The lobby area is very impressive and gives a great 1st impression. We arrived around 4pm but our room wasn't ready and we were told it would be about half an hour. We waited in the lobby and went back after 30 mins but the room still wasn't ready - not a good start! When we finally got to our room we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very spacious for Manhattan with good sized twin beds. The bathroom was a lot smaller and was in need of updating but had a nice shower which was needed after a day out in the heat! The hotel is in a good location - 5th Avenue shopping in one way and Times Square in another. New York itself was extremely busy - I've visited in February previously and couldn't believe the difference - Times Square at night was jam packed! Enjoyed the visit and would stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “grand location, beautiful lobby, TERRIBLE service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeeker
Reviews.Content: After a rude check-in which didn't offer a welcome, hello, enjoy your stay or even a smile we went up to our guestroom thinking they really didn't want or need our business. The guestroom was dated and the office chair used to be gold but overtime got worn to this sooty black color that no one had bothered to clean or remove. We went out for a couple of hours and enjoyed the ideal location of the hotel and came back ready to relax for a bit before headed back out for dinner and a night on the town. We called room service at 4:20, got a voicemail and dialed 0 to see if we could order champagne. We were told that room service was not available and why didn't we leave a voicemail because she was the operator and had nothing to do with dining. She then said you should really leave a voicemail they will get back to you "eventually." Well that was about all I could take for one phone call. My husband and I went to the store and bought a bottle of champagne. We got back just before 5 but called the operator despite her having nothing to do with dining and asked if we could have two champagne flutes sent to the room. She had the audacity to ask me where I got the bottle of champagne and when I said I brought it into the hotel she let me know that it was not acceptable! If you like beautiful hotels and don't care about fine service then this could be for you. If you are like me, I would recommend staying at the Waldorf Astoria where it's similar in rate but superior in guest service.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy looking,but in need of changes”
Reviews.Author: Marialena P
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Roosevelt hotel many times last year. I was working for an airline company,so it was the hotel for our one night stays. I stayed there almost 12 times last year. Rooms were clean.Once i found a gum next to my bed,i called the reception and they didn't seem to care.That was a bad impression. Some rooms were comfortable and some not.Beds were great!! Once i was in a room next to the airconditioning facilities and it was really noisy at night. Location was great.next to all i needed.Grand central station is one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Dissoluto
Reviews.Content: 1) Despite I booked a no-smoking room, they did not have available and I had to stay in a stinky (...really stinky) room with kids. They gave us a free breakfast, but if I could choose I would have changed hotel. When we checked in (at 9PM) other people were complaining for some reasons. 2) Concierge service sold us MOMA tickets for kids when they are not needed and refused to reimburse. Had to dispute with front desk to get money back 3) Very newyorker, icluding tip harrassment from service

Reviews.Title: “Might as well book a Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Slfgl
Reviews.Content: I received a discounted room here as a contest reward, and decided to stay due to the location As soon as I walked into the lobby, I was taken aback by its beauty. However, these chandeliers, beautiful furniture, and magnificent lobby were not enough for us to enjoy our stay. Pictures of the rooms are very deceiving! Ours was nothing better than that of a Holiday Inn with a flat screen. For 320 bucks a night, I was expecting so much more! Also, the employees were not very accommodating! One of the concierges was rude and short-tempered and several of the bellhops were lazy and cold. i would NOT recommend staying at this hotel, as me and my two guests were not pleased.

Reviews.Title: “checked in saw the hotel, the corridors, my room and checked out! Awful”
Reviews.Author: honestlyhonest123
Reviews.Content: Trawled trip advisor, fancied the Waldorf but friend suggested Roosevelt ( found out later she had only been to the bar!)so booked Roosevelt for 5 nights, it was just a little cheaper. Was visiting my daughter who was teaching at summer camp. This hotel looks grand, Im sure it was once, but it is so tired and depressing now. After queing for half hour to check in, I exited the lift to a corridor that was so tired and run down. With some dread I opened the door to my room, the same! Furniture old and scratched needed binning. Stains on upholstery, there was nothing pleasant I was so disappointed. I just knew I couldnt possibly stay there. Although tired from long journey, I had to get out. I left suitcase on bed, asked directions to Waldorf and walked ten mins to see did they have a room. What a difference! Booked The Waldorf, not much more money about 20 dollars a night, yet the hotel, room , style and just about everything was in a completly different class. Went back for my case, politely saw manager, paid fee of 75 dollars for leaving early having checked in for 1 hour and made my way back to the Waldorf dragging suitcase as fast as I could! Take no notice of glowing reviews, dont stay here. The Waldorf was just about perfect, had a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location, perfect vacation!”
Reviews.Author: teachergirl01
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 4 nights when we came here during our spring break from school (we are both teachers). We took a red-eye and arrived around 8am in time to freshen up before we set off for a day in the city. The hotel was very hospitable and stowed our baggage away for us until our return later that day. We were greeted by a clean and well-kept, quiet room. Our entire stay the staff was nothing but accommodating. Each day the concierge gave us advice on a local club or cafe to dine in, or helped map out our route to our next location. We had drinks once in the lobby bar, and they were unique and delicious. We wanted to stay in a fun but not too "touristy" location, and this fit the bill perfectly. We were steps away from two great coffee spots, and directly across the street from a subway entrance. We were able to walk to Broadway and Times Square no problem, but didn't have to deal with the hustle and bustle of the overly crowded streets and chaos. It was a perfect location for our getaway, and I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: FUDGE_BROWNIE85
Reviews.Content: We were bit worried about staying at the Roosevelt but our stay was fine. Located corner of Madison Ave (designer shops) Its about a 40 min drive from JFK airport. Roughly $55. We stayed on the 4th floor. Room was small but adequte for two people. Bathroom was large. Only problem with the shower was tha the drain hole was near the door, so water would be all over the bathroom floor. Towels avaliable and changed everyday. Bathroom also has soaps, creams, shower gels. Flat screen tv. Wardrobes and drawers avaliable. Hotel is a few steps from Grand Terminal. Fantastic location with all the major attractions close by. If you want to book theatre tickets you can book them in the reception area. Hotel is clean. There are shops on the ground floor. we had trouble with openning our hotel room door because the key would not work all the time. Safes are avalable free of charge in the room.We booked Mary Poppins on the day of the show from the box office.... i would recconmand to book them before you travel otherwise its gets very expensive. When you go to NY, you must try one the Pink Berry's. Amazing! Loved the stay as we were hardly in the hotel so it was just what we needed. Shopping go to Soho. Best shops and 5th Ave. Food is on 9th ave. We also did the sex and the city tour which was brillant. Yo ucan breakfast from anywhere if your hotel does not provide it. New York is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Teddy would be proud”
Reviews.Author: elvis247
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights from July 18 to the 22, my stay was fantastic. The personell working the front desk on the morning of the 18th were helpfull, friendly and professional. The lobby and my room were elegant and wonderful. Every member of the staff I encountered were great. I love the location being right next to Grand Central station, it made it easy to get to almost any place in the city quickly. I have to single out one member of the staff for his effort on the morning of our checkout on the 22. There was a hotel security member named Al who was working the lobby. Al seemed to be directing all traffic going in and out of the lobby. There was a lot of people going through there at that time of the day and Al seemed to have it all under control. He was greeting people at the elevators and helping them get on with what they needed. He was assiting people who were checking out. He was keeping the crowd at the bellhop station orderly. Al is a real professional and he helped that lobby flow so the rest of the staff could do their job. If you decide to stay at this wonderful Hotel, your stay will be great because the wonderful, professional staff members like "big Al".

Reviews.Title: “Definately on the top 10 list of worst hotels I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Straat60
Reviews.Content: Taps that don't work, plugged drains, a parimetre of dust around the outside edge of the room (cleaners, clearly never take the power nozzel off), drapes where burnt from the heater, air conditioning was noisey, but it drownded out the party people with the crying baby next door, room was small, ice machine didn't work, paint and wallpaper required attention. The thing that really got me was that after paying $300.00 a night for the room, we were required to also pay for the use of the business centre: to gain access to the internet you need to sue a credit card! Whatever you do, don't rely on the concierge or the door men. When we inquired about renting a car, the concierge told us to go several blocks south and eat: "there are tons of car rental places there." Upon our arrival, it was raining. The doormen stayed under cover as my elderly mother and I struggles with our luggage from the back of the airport shuddle over the curb and onto the sidewalk. The only great thing about this hotel is the location and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marumbi
Reviews.Content: we stayed there 4 nights on our first time trip to New York. The hotel has excellent lobby, but really terrible rooms with old bubbling wallpapers, old taps and dirty floors. Especial room landmark is a/c, you can't sleep before you turn it down. The only positive thing is about this hotel is its location, right nesxt-door to NYC Central station.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but overall really nice!”
Reviews.Author: Eams26
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby was very nice, staff was very friendly and it was a nice quiet hotel. Bathroom was small and no counter space (was only an issue b/c we had 4 girls traveling together) but rooms were nice & clean. Our only real complaint besides the bathroom was the lighting. Not a lot of light in the room but overall it was a great hotel. It is a slightly older building so nothing is brand new but most hotels in NYC are similar. Our room was a great size in comparison to some of the hotels we have stayed in in NYC but we booked the Deluxe room because we had been warned that the Cozy was just too small. It was worth the extra money to have the extra room with luggage for 4 females! The block is quiet (for NYC) but close to many great things to see and do. Walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, Times Square and lots of shopping. Definitely an older crowd (lots of business men) who stays there which was nice to keep it quiet. It is not cheap but no hotel in NYC is and for the quality of the hotel and it's location, we thought it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: abelelz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a last minute deal not knowing what to expect from the hotel. I had been to NY before so knew the area I wanted to stay in. This is such an ideal location for everything you would want to do, if you don't mind walking several blocks (5-7 blocks from EVERYTHING!!!). The hotel is a more "established" hotel and it has not been updated for a while but for the price and location, can't be beat. It still had a grand feel to it though. The room was very clean, quiet and the service was excellent. The weather over our long weekend was during a heat wave so it was great going back to a super cold room after a long day. The ac was a tiny bit loud but worth the comfort. Shower preasure was great and the bathroom items were from bath & body works. The bed was comfy and CLEAN... This is a non-negotiable aspect of staying at a hotel for us and they passed. You're a block away from Grand Central Station. Travel times from hotel: walking - most everything is 7-15 min. (ex. Time Square - 12 min). Taxi - most everything is 5-20 min. (ex. Time Square - 5 min, Central Park - 10 min, Statue of Liberty ferry - 15 min).

Reviews.Title: “In the city that never sleeps, you will never sleep”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1396
Reviews.Content: If you want a good night sleep this is NOT the place for you. The room we had was VERY small (even for New York status) and the bed sits right inside the door so you hear EVERYTHING that goes on in the hallway....in the city that never sleeps this is not a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service; excellent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: wickedwise
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Roosevelt could not have been better. Alfredo at the front desk went beyond the call of duty for us; he made us feel most welcome and taken care of. The concierge was also extremely helpful. The hotel's location is fantastic. Our rooms were clean and the beds were amazing.I did not see the need for renovation or dirty carpets as some reviewers noted. Overall I felt that all of the staff were very professional and attentive; the accomodations were good and the location was fantastic. Absolutely no hesitation recommending this hotel-ask for Alfredo to help you..

Reviews.Title: “In no way as bad as some reviews make it sound”
Reviews.Author: auntieIIR
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous about the Roosevelt after reading some reviews. However, we were pleasantly surprised. We only really used the hotel to sleep in and didn't use any of the facilities, so can't comment on them. We were checked in within minutes & in a friendly manner. We were expecting to smell an awful smell coming out of the lifts after reading some reviews, that's not the case. We had a room with 2 double beds, so the room was sizeable to enable all the furniture to fit. There was more than enough room to walk around the furniture & there was plenty of room to put clothes away, we had a cupboard with hanging space and loads of floor space to store luggage. The bathroom was a similar size to mine at home & i manage fine at home! The carpets and decor are fine. We didn't have any stains on the carpet and the wallpaper wasn't peeling. Other reviews have suggested they need a revamp. Our room was fine and the style of the decor complemented the style and age of the hotel. At the end of the day it's a 3 star hotel not 5 star. The only negatives is the air-con is noisey, we didn't have a view from our window which ended up being a positive as we didn't hear any road noise etc.

Reviews.Title: “Quite all right, but not fantastic. Uexpected bills and no wifi”
Reviews.Author: Jacobpries
Reviews.Content: We had quite a nice stay at the Roosevelt, but mostly because of its adress. We were pretty close to all those NY-sites and places we wanted to visit. It truly is a historic place in terms of hotel culture, but it is also a hotel with small rooms (probably a NYC-thing) and paartly in some need of renovation. The offer included free american breakfast. However this was not entirely free. Restaurant gratuity was added. This was 8.79$ a day. Not something that would tip over our budget, but very annoying when you add up the tips we left after every stay. The Restaurant gratuity fee was NOT listed either on our reservation or on the website. The promised HSIA did not work. We complained about this every day, but it wasn't fixed while we were staying at the hotel. The staff seemed friendly and the service level is fine. To sum up: It was quite all right, but not fantastic. I Think I'll go for something les wannabe-posh the next time i Visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and Great location”
Reviews.Author: kendr390
Reviews.Content: Great last minute deal on Expedia. Hotel is really centrally located to Times Square, Rockefella Center and Grand Central Station. The rooftop lounge is great. We stayed in room 422 so its a little noisy at night with the garbage trucks and all. Over all will stay here again. Oh yeah, we went from a 2 double bed for $199 to king $159 on expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, adequate room”
Reviews.Author: angusmurphy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel for five nights. The service was good and staff were very friendly and helpful. However, the room was a little run down as others have mentioned. The beds were comfortable, but the bathroom was small and worst of all smelled mildewy even though it looked clean. I couldn't figure out why it smelled so bad in there. The location of the hotel is good, close to Grand Central and good restaurants. Only problem was not feeling great about coming back to the room - didn't feel welcoming = mostly due to the smell.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Rainy_Dusk
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it simple. We took the airplane early in the morning and got to the hotel around noon. We were nicely told at the front desk that we could only get in the rooms between 2 and 3 pm. We were also told that we could leave our bags at the hotel. After walking around for a few hours, which was fairly pleasant since the hotel is a couple blocks away from Grand Central Station, we finally got to our rooms. The two rooms were clean, apart from minor stains on the carpet and the bottom of the bed spread. On the other hand, the bathroom was filthy. One of the two rooms had only a shower, which was clean, the other room had a tub which was quite unclean. The drain could be removed.. and the bottom of the tub was filled with stains and scrubs. The hotel's location was great, especially if planning on traveling by train or subway, but the cleanliness was quite mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Loud window AC unit”
Reviews.Author: Samoyed79
Reviews.Content: The tiny room, which I expected, had incredibly loud wndow AC unit that did not cool the room. It blew directly onto the bed. Additionally, the cleaning people turned it off during the day, so when I returned, the room was really hot and didn't cool off. I called and asked to change rooms. I was told they would change me tomorrow. This was after they offered to send someone up TOMORROW to look at it. Great. Another night disrupted by an old and rattling window unit.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JayPLondonUK
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a few nights at the Roosevelt last week and we both found it faultless. Every single one of the porters, barmen & concierge services were so helpful and friendly. Our room was really comfortable with soft beds, lots of pillows, a large screen TV, hairdryer & a great view from our window of the Met Life Centre. The foyer, bar, restaurants and rooms are so historic looking, so much better than the soulless modern hotels. The breakfast was glorious (especially the french toast), if somewhat pricey, but then everything in Manhattan is that way. Make sure you have a meal at Naples 45 which is nearby, cheap, serves great food and is also excellent for people watching by Grand Central Station. Hey, and also take a helicopter trip, it's expensive but absolutely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “top location in midtown”
Reviews.Author: allendale66
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt looks great on the website and although a bit gloomy it was great. location was the best feature although the interior architecture was amazing. Would suggest getting all threatre tickets and sightseeing direct from source as it turns out is much cheaper than from the hotel. the service was great and our young daughter enjoyed her stay. Take the water taxi to liberty for photos the other tours are too busy and not worth the money. You get to see other things in taxi as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rockyrodgers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights and had a great stay. I would consider myself to be fussy to the highest degree and was apprehensive with our Priceline win for the Roosevelt, but had no need to be concerned. We arrived in early afternoon, check in was a breeze. The staff were friendly and helpful, we asked for a nice room. We were shown to our room and were very surprised at the quality compared to previous reviews on TA. We had the comfiest bed, a nice clean bathroom with nice toiletries. Loads of space for luggage. I would highly recommend this hotel. The sheets and towels were changed daily. The hotel is very central. Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Typically Good Value for Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Gl0bal_Biz_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is conveniently located next to Grand Central Terminal. If you exit GCT from the backside on 45th you are only about 50 yards to the doors of the Roosevelt. For tourists it is easy to walk or take the shuttle from GCT to Time Square. For business people you are in the heart of mid-town business and GCT can take you down to Wall St. with ease. The rooms are a decent size and the hotel has an old New York feel to it in the lobby. The hallways do show some age, but it isn't bad. The one odd thing that I can't figure out after staying here for years is why they have HD TV's yet they display lousy analog signals. If you are like most people staying at a hotel in NY, you are either out hitting shows at night as a tourist or shmoozing customers at a restaurant for business travelers so the TV isn't on much. Nonetheless, if TV is your thing then this place is going to disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: trefs2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend. They have bed bugs. My friend and I slept in separate beds in the same room, and both woke up with bites all over us. We saw bed bugs when we looked under the sheets at the mattress. I also stayed at the hotel in 2005, and the 3 of us then also got bed bugs. I assumed in 5 years they would have fixed the problem, but they haven't. We asked for a refund, but were told since we booked through priceline, we couldn't have one. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt was great!”
Reviews.Author: LLH58
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Roosevelt and it was great! Checked in with no problems, the front desk clerk was friendly and he told us if anything was wrong in the room to just let him know...We had 2 rooms and both were fine....No mold........we were on the 8th and 16th floors. Take a right outside of hotel and you are in Times Square within minutes...take a left or shortcut across the street and you are at Grand central within minutes.....great location and staff......no worries if you stay here....if you get a room that isnt up to your standards just let them know and I am sure they will switch rooms for you! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Simply awful”
Reviews.Author: thehawkeye
Reviews.Content: We were due to stay at the Roosevelt for two nights before returning home after a great trip to the states. On arrival there was nobody to help with bags which would have been useful as my wife is pregnant. We got our room key and even before getting to the room not only were the lifts dirty but the corridor still had rubbish outside rooms, surprising as we arrived at 9pm and you would have thought housekeeping would have dealt with it. Our room didn't get any better. The a/c unit was rusty and didn't look as if it had ever been cleaned. The net curtains were stained and had holes in, along with the bedside lamps which also had faulty bulbs. The toilet seat was also broken. At this point we left the room and I aired my concerns to the reception team who's attitude was "couldn't care less". Whilst at the reception two other guests were raising complaints, one regarding room cleanliness and the other about personal items been stolen from there room, a worrying situation. An alternative room was offered but by this stage we left returning to The Ritz Carlton, where we had stayed on our outward journey. Having visited The States on many occasions this is quite honestly the worse hotel I have been to and wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The glitz doesn't go beyond the lobby”
Reviews.Author: Suzandcrew
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed and felt slightly mistreated. Upon check-in, our reservation was messed up and they guy tried to make it our fault even though I had documentation to support our reservation. The room was slightly smaller than the picture but the bathroom was in need to a serious update. Cracked tiles, no space to put anything, mold in the shower, etc. The carpet was disgusing, with old gum or something stuck in the carpet in various spots. One bed was very lumpy and the other was fine. EVERYTHING is extra. I spent a lot of time across the cafe across the street because the wireless was about $15 dollars PER DAY at the hotel. We were there for 5 days! The staff was ridiculously snooty ... right down to the crabby people serving Starbucks in the lobby. Yes ... we even had to pay for over-priced coffee in the morning. Our housekeeper was great (however, our great treatment may have come from the fact that I tipped her well each day). NYC is great in spite of the rude people. However, it would be nice to feel a little at home at the hotel after a long day of spending lots of money and putting up with more hostility than we're used to. I've NEVER complained about a hotel before. I feel kind of guilty ... But this kind of stunk. I'd probably even stay in Jersey and take the train in before staying at this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Pay Attention to Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: rundle2883
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 5 nights at the Roosevelt Hotel for our anniversary and had the best time. My husband booked directly with the hotel and was able to get an amazing deal. AT the time of booking he told them it was our anniversary and they said we would try and upgrade us if it was available. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we stored it and went on our day trip. They called us while we were out, and when we checked in they gave us a SUITE!!! We couldn't have asked for better accomidations in NYC! I read reviews before I left and was having doubts about what I was reading...yes the place is little dated, but remember it has been around since the 1920's and the lobby is stunning! Everyone there was amazing and helpful! The location was perfect! Everything was within a 5 minute walk, such as Grand Central Station, Times Square, resturants & pubs......Madison Avenue and 5th Avenue......We have found our diamond in the rough. So Please ignore the reviews and stay there. We stayed from June 10 to June 15, 2010, and we will definately be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Lou058
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here during our first visit to NY. We were impressed with both the hotel and the city! The location of the hotel is perfect, with so many attractions within walking distance. Being so close to Grand Central was particularly useful as we (very easily) hopped all around NY on the subway. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful and the hotel itself has an air of old style grace. Our room was tiny but clean and the bed was soooo comfortable - not your usual rock hard hotel matresses and postage stamp foam pillows. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It's convenient, but not a place I'd return to.”
Reviews.Author: travelinggrrl
Reviews.Content: I was underwhelmed by The Roosevelt. The location is great, I'll grant that. Very central to midtown, etc. But the room felt dingy. Not that it wasn't clean, it was clean enough, but it was really nothing special, and the bathroom felt old. Bathroom was unimpressive--serviceable, but small, with an old shower head (plenty of mirrors--I did like that the mirror on the back of the bathroom wall made it possible to see the back of my head). It's a huge hotel, with a big lobby, etc. There's internet, but you have to pay for it, and finding a plug for my computer took a bit of doing. I suppose it's fine if you get a nice rate, but there are cooler places to stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disaster”
Reviews.Author: peb2
Reviews.Content: Why? I'm a frequent business traveler and have stayed at this hotel before. My last trip showed the Roosevelt lack of class. I had a confirmed room purchased using a pricing service. When I arrived at 7pm, after a long day, the counter informed me that there was no room- they sold out. They gave me cab fare to an inferior hotel outside of the Grand Central area. I took the next 45 minutes to call around and found a nice hotel. Again- Roosevelt showed no class on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: abcdeLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through Expedia travel website and so were able to get a great rate. For its location and overall quality, this hotel offers great value for money. You get the feel of a stunning grand hotel, but without paying the premium as you would at some of the famous NY hotels. The entrance hall is spectacular and the staff are very helpful and friendly, especially the door men and porters. The room was acceptable, it didn't quite match the appearance of the entrance, as it is clear that the Roosevelt would benefit from a refurbishment and an update - but of course this would bring in a heavy price tag. The room was large, and clean, the beds were very comfortable, good large tv, nice clean bathroom with plenty of towels and hairdryer. There were no coffee/tea facilities in the room, and a glance at the room service menu showed that it was a little extortionate, but honestly, who wants to spend time in their hotel room when they are in NY?!? Generally, would recommend this hotel, would be suitable for families, couple and friends of all ages. The location is perfect, right in the heart of Midtown, moments from 5th Ave shops and Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: composthappens
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at this hotel for a conference, and I could not have been more pleased. The staff was courteous and attentive, and my room was fairly large by New York standards. Best of all, it was exceptionally quiet, which was great for me as I am a light sleeper. The room was clean and comfortable, and the in-room safe was large enough to accommodate a laptop. I was pleasantly surprised that I could access the Internet from anywhere in the hotel at no charge because we use AT & T at home. The only place that I had a problem with access was in the large ballroom, and I was not the only one who could not connect there. Other than that, the service was quick and reliable. The hotel is centrally located, with easy access to transportation. Numerous restaurants and shops are in the area. I would definitely consider this hotel again for a future stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, conveniently located, Midtown Manhatten hotel”
Reviews.Author: Likes-to-Travel-52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have traveled extensively but never to New York City together. We found a package deal with The Roosevelt Hotel that couldn't be beat. For $169/night we had a lovely room with king size bed, large screen tv and large bathroom along with the most delicious buffet breakfast (served 6:30am-11:00am). Good thing the breakfast was served until 11am because on Sunday we slept in until 10:15am. The room was so quiet and dark we overslept. Something neither of us has done in a very long time. It was wonderful. The bed was so comfortable! I never heard a sound the entire time we were in our room. And the location was terrific. It has a very convenient location (about 2 blocks from Grand Central Station (where we also took the subway), 5-6 blocks from the United Nations and other nice attractions). We loved this place and are already planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms here vary greatly...beware”
Reviews.Author: BellaDonnainDallas
Reviews.Content: As an avid traveler and someone who has visited NYC multiple times, I booked through priceline. Since it was Valentine's Day weekend, most of the hotels were already full and this was what was still available. I believe I paid $175/night through priceline. The location was excellent. Grand Central Station was literally across the street. The lobby of the hotel was of old charm and was the nicest part about the hotel. The first night, we were put in this room that was about 20 years old, the paint was peeling, marks on the wall, the heater rumbled, and the bathroom was old, it looked like a scene out of movie. I called the front desk and requested a different room. They were full that night but offered to change rooms the following day in which we did. The second room was completely opposite. Typical hotel room but much cleaner and more modern than the first room. I could not believe they would even put someone in that first room. Overall, there are so many hotels in NYC to stay and enjoy that I would not recommend this hotel until they completely renovate it.

Reviews.Title: “`taking custom for granted`”
Reviews.Author: redjimmy
Reviews.Content: this was our 5th time staying in new york.we returned for our 25th wedding anniversary having stayed in the roosevelt before,i sent an e.mail saying it was our anniversary, but to our disappointment not even a complimentary bottle of water how sad,this hotel is living on it`s past glory now,i wanted to look for a shop and used the internet and was charged $20, rip off don`t get caught,our room at the back of hotel had a noisy generator going all the time, the staff do not have the personal touch,i usually tip but no one here got any tips for the lack of service,this was our last time staying at the roosevelt if you go to new york try a different hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE!”
Reviews.Author: Travling-GRITS
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just got back from NY and it was my Hubbies first time back as an adult and he loved it! The rooms were a nice size and the bed was very comfy! We booked our room @ Priceline and were very pleased. The location is great with a cute breakfast spot right across the street! Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again given the choice.”
Reviews.Author: bhug
Reviews.Content: At check-in, the clerk loudly noted that we had booked on a discount website and not paid the full rate. She made it quite clear that as a result of this, we were to be treated as second-class guests and indeed, she did place us in a very second-class room. Room 502 is frankly horrible. The shower is set up for a handicapped person. In theory that is fine but the water floods the entire bathroom since there is no partition between the shower and the rest of the space. There is also a big fold down seat and bars all over the place. We felt that we were showering at a nursing home. The bathroom was generally outdated. I stepped on a toenail that did not belong to me. Also a hair of an unknown woman was plastered on the interior of the bathroom door at our arrival. Gross. The two lamps in the room had compact fluorescent bulbs that were way too big for the shade. The effect was that we were blinded by that portion of the light not covered up. It was also tacky. Please buy the right size light bulb for your lamps. How hard is that? Upon arrival in the room there was one towel although they knew two of us were staying. I called and a second was promptly delivered. When maid service cleaned up the next day, they again left ONE towel! Again, had to get one delivered. The bellhop service was okay at best. There were always lines and only half the bellhops were 'good'. One made thinly veiled demands for cash. One directed us to a floor (for overflow storage) where we waited for no one to show up. Fortunately someone competent came and redirected us to the correct floor when our fellow guests picked up the 'help me' phone (we were directed to the wrong floor initially). The location is great and the common spaces are elegant. Admittedly, we got a deal on the price too but somehow none of this makes up for all of the nonsense described in this review.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, the worst place I´ve ever stayed at NYC - stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ask_Pandora
Reviews.Content: The photos on their website LIES: it is far from that nice and neat (clearly used photo editing program)! The staff was consistently unfriendly, rude and just unhelpful! Just to take a few examples: when I asked for an adapter to convert my European wire to US, the lady in the reception SCREAMED that 1) no, they don´t have one, 2) quote "we are not here to loan you an adapter", "you have to fix that yourself"...EXCUSE ME, but since when does a hotel not cater their foreign guests with electronical adapter. Ended with me having no mobile phone or computer access, which put me in many troubling situations. Also, when me and my friend stored our luggage and I was getting it back, they gave me the wrong luggage! Come on, I had quite valuable stuff in my bag, and what if it would have got to an dishonest person's hand. You kind of trust the hotel when you actually ask them to store it. AGAIN their prompt reply was: well, we can´t guarantee, it's at your risk that you store it here!!! The mini-bar was empty, and we were dying out of thirst, and even not a single bottle of water could be found in the hotel room. The room was not properly cleaned (actually the sheets were not fixed at all) and the view from the hotel room was awful (some kind of groce backyard) and it smelt from old mold. So, do stay away from this expensive hotel - you don´t get value for money!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: neil-amy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June with friends and had a brilliant time. The hotel has a very large and plush lobby. The rooms were a good size for a city centre hotel and more importantly clean. The rooms were cleaned everyday. The location of the hotel is even better as its only a few blocks to Times Square and Grand Central Station. Overall an excellent hotel which is ideal for people looking to explore NYC. One note is that the hotel bar is a little expensive so if you want a beer find a local bar, apart from that we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: audreydoll
Reviews.Content: I booked on Priceline at a great rate but still received a very nice room with a street view. The room was clean and comfortable and the location (near GCT) made this hotel a great starting point for seeing the city. There were lots of stores and restaurants within a few blocks. I'd be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingFoley
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, and I could not have been more pleased. This trip I took my husband and 8 year old daughter. The location is great. We walked every where or took the subway. The hotel staff could not have been any nicer. It was my daughters bithday and they really went out of their way to make sure she had a nice time. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not at all worth half the rack rate”
Reviews.Author: EMG54946
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline, and got what we thought was a great deal. When we arrived we were assigned a room in the back corner of a floor, smaller than any room I have ever stayed in while traveling in the US (even in college). You could barely move around the end of the bed and you couldn't move in the shower without hitting the walls. There was a 1 inch gap under all the doors so it was not quiet Would not EVER recommend this hotel at half of rack rate. Only positives were location (3 blocks east of Times Square) and 1 of 2 concierge staff (put us on to great food, the other basically told us to look up and down the street outside the hotel and pick something). This place needs a lot of updating to stay competitive in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ttwins
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Roosevelt May 29- June 1. I am very particular about hotel rooms so was a little skeptical after reading other reviews. Yes, the room is small and the bathroom is a little outdated, but it is also clean and comfortable. You can't beat the location, close to Grand Central, and I would absolutely stay there again. As an added note, there are several places to eat in Grand Central...great food great prices. Buy the one day metro pass which can be used on the subway and the bus system and you will be set.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable hotel, great rate -- made my stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCanada
Reviews.Content: I got a promotional rate from the Roosevelt's social media promotions. I booked a "Cozy Queen" room, and I would consider my room to be a good size, at least compared to many I have seen in Paris and elsewhere. I loved the elegant lobby. The room and bathroom were fine, and I slept perfectly well. I walked numerous places, or took public transit, which is conveniently available within a minute or two walk. I took a few taxis as well, and prices were reasonable. I felt perfectly safe in the area, day or night. I was very busy in New York, but did spend 2-3 hours a day in my room when I was not sleeping, and I appreciated that the room was comfortable and pleasant enough to enjoy this. I put 4/5 for the room, because I think it was the quality you would expect from a reasonable NY hotel, although I have had much more luxurious rooms in other cities for sure. But to get a luxurious room in NYC, I'm sure you have to pay a lot more than I paid at the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: jack_presley
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay here at the start of the month. I read others' reviews about the staff but from my limited interaction with them they were nice and friendly and generally very helpful. As for the hotel itself, the location is superb. It's worth staying here for that alone. I was traveling alone but was given a room with 2 double beds so there was plenty of room. The bathroom wasn't the biggest but why anyone would complain about not having a massive bathroom is beyond me. What do people be doing in there? There was room to stand at the sink and do my stuff and the bath was a decent size. That complaint from other reviewers confused me. The rooms are a bit dated and look a bit shabby but my one wasn't dirty anyway it was cleaned to a decent standard each morning. My one complaint about the room was the air conditioning unit. It really was loud. Luckily it wasn't the warmest in NY when I was there so I left it on when i wasn't there and turned it of in the evening and it didn't get too warm. I didn't eat in the restaurant or drink in the bar as the prices were very expensive but there's a lovely cafe across the road and down on the corner towards Grand Central Station that I got a lovely breakfast for under $10. The fitness room was very good and not too busy any of the mornings I went and they also have complimentary fruit there so that was a nice way to start the day. MY room didn't have a mini bar but I don't know if that is standard throughout the hotel. I don't generally take stuf out of mini bars but I do like to use it to keep my own bought stuff cool. One other complaint i have is the lack of free wi-fi. Surely a hotel of this size and stature should have free wi-fi in the lobby. i can understand them charging in the rooms but in this day and age, they really should have it in the lobby. I ended up having to go to Barnes & Noble around the corner to check up on emails and read the news from home There are a couple business centres with internet access for a fee but one thing I discovered is that there is the facility in the business centre on the 2nd floor to print out your boarding pass for free which is good. In summary, I'd have no problem staying here again. The location really is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- don't be put off!”
Reviews.Author: jodieb1985
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights and it was just right for us. Yes the rooms are small but who cares, you're only in there when you sleep! Perfectly clean and VERY comfortable- just what you need after a long day walking, sightseeing and shopping. The bed was the most comfy thing I've ever slept on! Staff were quite friendly, but then we weren't interested in hanging about and chinwagging with them during our precious 4 day stay. The lobby was stunning (very 1920s) with lots of lovely furniture to relax on when you're waiting for an airport transfer etc. Great location- just by Grand Central and walking distance to Times Square, Rockerfella Centre etc. We even walked back from Brooklyn one night- and definately worked off our michelin star meal at the River Cafe! Enjoy New York!

Reviews.Title: “would expect more from a hotel of his calibre”
Reviews.Author: pikachiu132
Reviews.Content: For the amoun of money we were paying I really expected more. We did get a discounted rate on priceline for $130 a night and even nee disappointed that people pay more. The rooms were okay. Small but it works. You definately feel that the hotel is old and established. I did like te bath and body works soaps and shampoos. And the hair dryer was workable. The beds were not comfortable and felt like there was no support. Only when I asked for another pillow I got ones of different hardness, otherwise it was flat. The was no coffee maker or free wifi. This made the trip most difficult for us and forced us to eat o buy something from Cosi (small eatery) across the street. Or the amount of money I am paying and a hotel of this calibre I would expect free wifi for hotel guests. I did also like that when I requested another pillow and more towels the guy showed up at the door with linens piled so high I couldn't see his face. He had 4 towels and 4 pillows. One thing o wasn't pleased was the mandatory tipping. I know this is new York culture, but I am a strong believer that tipping is a voluntary token of appreciation of good service that is extra and beyond what is expected. Usually we tip if they have satisfied our needs or more, and only don't tip if we're super unhAppy. We ran into an incident with the bellman where we did not have any small change and planned on not tipping. However we encountered an awkward hinting an silence until weshuffled our pockets for whatever change we had, and we had only 50cents. After a dirty look we learnt our lesson , but my beliefs still stand strong. Overall okay, and great location. Close enough to walk to the subway and attractions an not so close to touristy mayhem of times square. But next time might find something further away from te city for the same amount.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. Good Price. Small Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dancingdaisies
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Roosevelt..I was worried b/c some reviews were very negative. But found that the rooms were very small - we got two double beds. The bathroom was tiny as well. I didn't care that much b/c we were there for the hotel stay as much as sightseeing. The staff was okay, didn't have much interaction though. I think this hotel is a hit or miss. You could either have a great room or an awfeul one. There was construction going on across the street and our window, and there was some very loud banging sounds at like 4 in the morning. That was my only true complaint. It was very centrally located. Close to Times Square - about 15 min walk. Close to Bryant Park - 10 min walk. Not sure how far to Central Park? It was also a 5 min. walk to Grand Central Station - which is where you need to take the Subway to get around. Try to avoid Taxis - the Subway is easy (once you figure it out) and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “A very shabby, worn down, depressing place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: roamingmexico
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel would be a sparkling, Manhattan experience because Priceline rated it as a 3-4 star; but it was more like a 2. The dull, noisy lobby had a lot of torn upholstery and dirty carpets. I was uncomfortable meeting friends there. The small room contained nothing...no frig, no coffee, nothing. New beds were covered in old sheets that did not fit. The toilet rocked and the carpets in the halls were rippled with dirty wrinkles. The ice machine said, 'out of order' and the hotel did not have WiFi. The front desk had long lines due to big clueless international groups clogging up access. Everyone had his hand out for tips, and the way luggage was stored, visitors ended up having to tip twice. What a disappointing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good enough rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stellar424
Reviews.Content: I was terrified after reading some of the reviews on here, but was pleasantly surprised with our room. We were upgraded to a King bed and the room was a good size for New York. Had I not read the prior reviews, I probably would not have noticed the flaws in the room. They were minor cosmetic flaws. The temperature in the room was fine, as was the water pressure and water temperature. My only complaint is that the walls were very thin. We were woken throughout the week by our neighbors. I did get a good deal on Priceline, and I don't think that the full price of the hotel room would be worth it unless location is important. The hotel is within walking distance of many tourist sight-seeing areas and was just a short block away from Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelingjackie
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Roosevelt Hotel through Priceline.com. As I soon found out, many of the people I ran into also booked through Priceline. All except the Delta crew who also stay at the Roosevelt when they are in town. As you may know when you book through Priceline the room you get is the room you get - no special requests. I was happy with my room and also happy I was traveling by myself. The room was very comfortable but small. I am not sure I would have been happy sharing. That being said the location was great. It was an easy walk to the theater district, 5th Avenue, museums and shopping (I like to walk). The lobby was also very nice - the perfect place to people watch while drinking a glass of wine. The drinks were reasonably priced by New York standards and the service was good. There is a CosiCosi across the street so I ate breakfast and one dinner there. It was very good, convenient. and reasonably priced. There are a number of good inexpensive places to eat in the area. My room was clean and quiet. I did not eat at the hotel so I cannot judge that. All in all I feel like I got a good value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the cost and location!”
Reviews.Author: Bug3
Reviews.Content: I, too, reserved my room at the Roosevelt with a promotional deal for $139 per night for a deluxe king room. I thought it was a great deal at that price! My room was on the small side, but very clean and very comfortable. The bed was awesome! The room and hotel were not in top shape and there were some minor issues (slightly peeling wallpaper, stained carpets in the hallways etc.). But, the location was fantastic and my experience was good. I found the staff to be generally helpful and courteous. But, I did receive several pieces of incorrect information from the concierge (concerning transportation options to the airport).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean - recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Swodaem
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a week staying here on a package deal booked through Virgin, it's strange how so many reviews differ! We had a great week staying at the Roosevelt (in early May). Our room was comfortable and very clean. Whenever we needed to speak to the staff for directions or anything, they were helpful and polite to us. We had a drink at the mad46 bar up on the 19th floor, which was a little costly - but offered wonderful views. Well situated and with good facilities, I'd say this place was a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Dont take notice of other reviews”
Reviews.Author: BEVNEWYORK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 7 night stay at The Roosevelt Hotel in New York. I must admit that I was nervous about staying there due to the reviews I had read. I really don't know what people expect from hotels. Our room was small but it was fine, after all you only sleep there. The bedding and towels were changed every day as were any toiletries which needed replenishing. The location was good. When we arrived our room wasn't ready but the friendly receptionist said she would have a room ready within ½ hour. We requested non smoking and away from the elevators. Within the timescale or room was ready. We didn't mind waiting. The doormen and the cleaning ladies were all very friendly and all to happy to help. We had trouble using the safe and asked at reception for further instructions. Within no time at all Al the Security man arrived and explained how it worked also asked if we needed any help with anything else and if the room was ok - which it was. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are so many restaurants to choose from elsewhere. We had taken a travel kettle with us as we had read that there were no coffee facilities in the room. That is the only thing that would have been nice - but we came prepared so all was well. In short don't worry if you have booked to stay here as it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: lmatthes1
Reviews.Content: I considered myself lucky when I discovered a "Facebook" discount on the web and got each room for $99 per night. The hotel is in a great location, just a couple of blocks away from Time Square and all major theater's. The lobby is beautiful, but it stops being good from there on. Our room on situated on the 3rd floor. Our room keys didn't work. It took about 10 try's on each key to get into the room. We got stuck with two double beds, even though I specifically requested a queen bed. The rooms are small, but that didn't matter that much because we would hardly be there. The room was a little bit shabby, some the the wall paper was peeling and there was mold on the ceiling of the bathroom. All of this I could deal with because I was use to motels (even though this was suppose to be a 3 star hotel). My biggest problems was the paper thin walls and the old plumbing. Our last night there I could hear my drunks neighbors talking all night. It felt like they were sitting and talking on the foot of my bed. And the pipes would make clinking noises all night. I didn't hardly sleep any of the nights we were there and didn't sleep the last night. If you stay there, I would recommend bring ear plugs just in case. Also, we had to exchange our room keys three times before we got a set that worked. Now, after saying all this, you have to keep in mind that you get what you pay for. I'm sure they only gave us this room because we used a discount promotional code. And you know what, that's fair. I think the hotel definitely gave me my money's worth. Good location, a room, a bed and a place to take a shower. I actually came back to NYC two weeks later, without my husband, and stayed at the Roosevelt again (I had another promotional code). They were overbooked and I got upgraded to a $1200 per night suite for $139. I had a fantastic experience that night. So if you are planning on staying at this hotel, I would go for the more expensive rooms because I think you would have a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “GROSS!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_a_a_2
Reviews.Content: Do Not Waste Your money!!! (there's a reason why this hotel has good deals!!!) The rooms are filthy (dirty towels, stained comforters, carpet, etc.) The hotel and rooms NEED to be updated (the first room we were assigned had a leg missing to the bed!) Management is not helpful! (We were so grossed out so we decided to cancel our three nights at the Roosevelt and booked a room at a different hotel. The management knew our complaints and agreed, however, they still demanded that we pay for 1 night. We finally agreed to a $50 fee as they said they needed to send a cleaning crew to the room since we were in there. We AGREED that they needed to clean it up because no one would accept that room as is! When my sister returned home from our three day trip in NYC, the Roosevelt charged THREE NIGHTS on her credit card. She called and they said there wasn't a manager on duty who could assist her and she would need to call back later. SERIOUSLY?? DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS HOTEL!!! They need to clean up their act AND their hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl1982
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you that I would never return to this hotel. Yes, its location could not get any better, and as you first enter the hotel, the lobby is breathtaking, but its advantages certainly does not outweigh the disadvantages. Firstly, the room was poorly renovated. And sure, you can live with that, BUT holes in your sheets; a phone that doesn’t work (couldn't make out-going local calls); no exhaust vents in the bathroom; construction noise that seep into the poorly insulated windows; a concierge desk that closes at 8 pm; room cards that do not work and non-smoking floors that smell like smoke; is simply unacceptable! And this was just the beginning. Let me talk about the customer service – there was none! We had to constantly call the front desk over the same issue that they failed to correct the first time, and that probably was because they were trying to deal with multiple guests at the same time while was holding the line. Never did I feel that we were given the undivided attention we deserved for the price per night we were paying. Excuse after excuse is what that gave us. I really am not one for complaining but the straw that broke the camels back was when we smelt smoke as we came off the elevators onto our floor. We were there for only 3 nights so we didn’t make too much of a stink but for the price we paid, again, we definitely should have been treated better (at least with some “please” and “thank-you’s”).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatboyonadiet
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a good price for this hotel via Priceline and saved a nice tidy sum over their published rates. We'd been at the Wellington Hotel a few days early and foudn this to be a very similar type of hotel, dated but lots of charm and generally clean, again I emailed ahead to say it was a special occassion ;) and got an upgrade to a bigger room that was on the corner and overlooked Madison and 45th! Generally the room was very large, clean and light, AC ran well but was a little noisy, bathroom was an OK size. Each floor has ice machines and drink vending machines too. Wifi is available at a cost, we didn't try any of the bars, restaurants or shops but there is a few. Did use the gym which has some good equipment in it and free fruit! Annoyingly the entrance on 46th only lets you out and not in! Very near to Times square and Grand Central Station too.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP, Save Your Money!”
Reviews.Author: moviechic8
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst properties I have ever stayed at. Where to begin? First, it should be noted I got this for cheap (by NYC standards) on Priceline ... but I don't think it was even worth the discounted price. The rooms are beyond tiny and the bathrooms so small you can hardly move. I can deal with size of the place is nice, but rooms are disgusting. Everything is stained, ripping or dirty. I felt so dirty just being in these gross rooms. UGH! On top of that the walls and doors are paper thin. You hear everything, it is so noisy ... I couldn't sleep at all during our 3 nights there. And on top of that the cleaning staff stands in the hallways gossiping and talking (they MUST know how thin these walls are) early in the morning or vacuming!! This hotel is so gross - dish out a few extra bucks and stay the nearby Marriott or Hilton. The ONLY plus is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: StephenRyan
Reviews.Content: A real mixed bag of a hotel. Some really good and nice things and some awful . The lobby is very nce and looks well. Having had to change hotel at short notice as my flight back was cancelled and booked more or less blind on hotels.com it was a relief to walk into the lobby and feel comfortable (good) . Then I walked into the room - it stank (bad) . Apart from a very odd question about what had we done in the room there was no problem switching to a different and even a little nicer room - it seemed a little larger (good) . Although generally speaking the rooms were small and could do with refurb. (not so good) . In the move I left my credit card in the old room and didn't notice until the hotel reception called me during the evening to say they had it and were holding it for me (excellent ) as in the wrong hands it could have gone anywhere. The bell hops and the doormen outside arehustlers pure and simple. I have stayed in four different hotels in NYC over the last few years and the hustling by these guys was off the scale compared to the others. Money for everything. One bellhop told me that as the hotel didn't charge for storing bags so I should pay him. He got a small amount to put the bags in and then some other guy wanted more to take them out. Forget it. The doorman outside asked if I wanted a taxi or a limo parked nearby to take us to JFK. I said taxi but he called up his mate in the limo anyway. We stopped for petrol on the way out whcih was unprecented as it was his local petrol station and we drove ten to fifteen minutes off the highway to get to it. it was an agreed flat fare of $55 inc tax and tip and I wasn't paying a cent over the agreed number. All in all the hustle and the feeling of being incessantky ripped off means I wouldn't go back to this one but I do have to say that the credit card incident reflects really well on the staff involved.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for room theft!”
Reviews.Author: Harmser
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Roosevelt recently and had a problem with theft. There was a problem with the plumbing, so we reported it. We were leaving the hotel to go out on the town but my daughter forgot something & went back to our room. When she returned, she found the plumber with the $20 we left in the room for the maid (nowhere near the bathroom) and he asked if we had left the $$ for him. She said no, we left a tip for him in the bathroom. He then said, "Oh, you can't leave this $$ lying around because the guys coming up to mop the bathroom floor take stuff all the time. The maid was next door, so he took the money to her. We didn't think anything more about this until it was time to pack the following night & discovered that our bag of Museum of Modern Art store items was stolen from our closet. We had it hidden on the top shelf. I didn't sleep well that night knowing that the birthday presents I had bought for family members was gone & this was the one purchase I didn't make with my Amex card. I reported to front desk when I checked out & hope the hotel management is aware of what appears to be an ongoing problem.

Reviews.Title: “Right in Midtown, can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: Qilobaby
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend at the Roosevelt for a friends birthday. Found a godo price for the Roosevelt for the wknd. Right in Midtown so can't beat that...the rooms were roomy, the classic decor for the hotel, but nice and clean and didnt smell old. The lobby was terribly crowded all the time, but that is to be expected for the location. Would stay again! Would go back to check out the Rooftop Bar Mad 46 once the weather gets nicer.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: KMPokc
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was great!! The entrance was beautiful.. However, I do agree that the entrance looks better than the room.. The room was nice and clean. The bathrooms could be updated. I did a plan that included breaf. and it was really good. Bacon, eggs, pancakes, etc. The doormen really sucked!! They were not helpful in helping you get a cab at all. They try to make you take the Limos instead of the Cabs.. It is about a good 15 min walk to Times Sqaure... but, it's really central to everythting.. If you pay 250 or more you might be a little upset.. I paid 169.00 thru Travel Zoo. The maids were not friendly at all.. They will store your luggage for free if you have a later flight. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Please be aware that they have extra charges. They charge up front for room damage and then at the end of your stay you get the money back. Total Rip off!!! I advise paying with a credit card. Don't buy the drinks at the bar... They are very expensive. 2 drinks are about 24.00 dollars.. I advise going the BB Que's in Times Sqaure because the drinks and the wings are great!!! There is no pool !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but service nothing special”
Reviews.Author: faderman
Reviews.Content: This is a great location, one of the entrances to the grand central station is opposite the entrance, its an easy walk to times sq (my wife went there everyday) and other attractions such as the empire state building and chrysler building etc. the bar is expensive and the roof top bar is twice as expensive ! the hotel breakfast is a buffet and keeps you stuffed, but is again expensive so we found a nearby diner THE RED FLAME which was good with the locals as well, service was good and friendly apart from a saturday when a polish girl was on (she was just rude) the bar in the hotel had some nice cocktails,watch the barman though some are a bit rude, rest of new york was friendly so came as a surprise. rooms were ok, we were on the 3rd floor so we used the stairs as there always seemed to be a 'line' for the lifts. as we got stranded here due to the ash from iceland we had to move rooms to the 11th floor where the room was near the lifts, so all night all you could here were the lifts opening and closing and pinging. staff were pleasant but not exactly over helpful. oh and don't book your tickets for a show through the desk as this is very expensive, got to times sq and find the ticket booth we got a good price for mamma mia as opposed to the jersey boys which we bought through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surface Charm but Not Without Faults”
Reviews.Author: DiningDemon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights in the Roosevelt. For the price we paid per night the hotel provided excellent value for money. The hotel has a superb location on Madison Avenue. Grand Central Terminal is just a few minutes walk away. However, these attractions aside, standards within the Roosevelt are not entirely consistent. The most appealing element of the hotel is its its sumption lobby. This conveys a sense of history and on arrival is most attractive. We used the atmospheric bar, located in a raised area to the left of the entrance, most evenings. Despite being attached to a busy entrance hall the bar has a distinctive character. The walls are panelled with dark wood, fire places are positioned at either end and the liveried bar staff are faultlessly polite and efficient. Drinks are routinely brought to your table with a large bowl of mixed nuts. If you like to retire to your hotel's bar following a busy day of sightseeing you will find this a very engaging and relaxing place to spend an hour or so. Beer was priced at $8 a pint which is expensive by UK standards. We didn't sample the bar food. Our room was large, and contained a very comfortable bed. Upgrading to a kingsize room proved a sound decision. The ensuite bathroom was of a reasonable size and everything within worked well. The room appeared clean and towells were changed regularly. However, the room did have a number of shortcomings. Inevitably, given the position of the hotel, adjacent to some very tall buildings, the room was very dark inside. The absense of pictures on the wall, apart from one above the bed, added to the somewhat cheerless atmosphere. A considerable amount of noise from the road below could be heard every night. In addition to the traffic this included quite a lot of bangs and crashes that may have emanated from dust carts and the like. The air conditioning unit, cited beneath the window, was clearly very old. It made a considerable amount intrusive noise particularly when the dial was set to the 'cold' position. I would certainly consider staying in this hotel again, given the location and excellent value for money but in view of some of the shortcomings of our room cannot make an unreserved recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Old glamour...yeah, nice...but old...”
Reviews.Author: StrictView
Reviews.Content: Booking: I won a bid on Priceline. Give this option a try...if you know how to use the "Negotiator" tool, this could save you money. We got a "King Room", away from the elevators, with a street view. Area: Great (Midtown East) location. Right next to Grand Central Terminal...and just a shuttle ride to Times Square. Facilities: The hotel, though elegantly designed...is past its' prime - needs to be revamped a little...perhaps new furniture. Room: The room is small. The bedding is beautiful...and the bed...is nice and cozy. The bathroom is small, a little dated, but is well-maintained and is super clean with nice toiletries. The room is surprisingly equipped with a flat panel television. Good Surprises: Their hotel information binder includes menus from restaurants that deliver to the hotel. Strangely Missing: Rooms have everything except for the most important - TOOTHPASTE! Overall: We only stayed for 1 night...it was okay/good hotel experience overall. Tip: If you want to stay in the "quiet" part of midtown, this hotel is a good option for a fair price. Have fun, be safe, and bring some good wine!

Reviews.Title: “Not enjoyable...actually pretty depressing”
Reviews.Author: talleeeyah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and badly in need of renovation and has poor service. My room was in one of the top floors yet the street noise was unbearable at night and I got no sleep. The bed was reasonably comfortable but I just couldn't sleep with all the street noise where garbage trucks were operating all night. In terms of cleanliness, I think the sheets and towels were washed but the hotel furniture is stained and disgusting. Not a happy place to stay. If you're looking for budget accomodations and don't mind these issues, then it would be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: CB_Aberdeen
