Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel in NYC. I have to disagree with the negative reviewers posted earlier. Our room was spacious and comfortable, yes the bathroom was a bit outdated but all functional, rooms clean and fresh. Lobby was spectacular as mentioned earlier. I agree that it is a shame they don't provide complimentary coffee/breakfast. Many other NY hotels do provide complimentary coffee in the morning which would be beneficial. The location of this hotel is great! 10mins to Empire State Building, 10mins to Times Square. Right next to Grand Central Station/Subway system. Negatives- The prices in the bar are extreme. Nip accross the road to the deli for coffee ($1) rather than paying the crazy prices they demand! Would I go back or recommed this hotel to a friend- Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kat078
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 8 nights with my boyfriend and a couple of friends. It was our first time in New York and we knew that NY is VERY expensive. It was very difficult to find a hotel that had good location for a good price. We chose the Roosevelt and didn´t regret it. The hotel is really nice and the rooms are ok. Nothing fancy, but clean and spacious. Bathroom is a bit outdated but big and we really didn´t care much :-) Minus that is all around for hotels in NY is that breakfast is not included. It cost 30 $ per person + taxes. There is a Starbucks located nearby which we used instead. We liked the hotel and found that location near central station was excellent, as well as it was nearby 5th avenue and Times Square. Would return again

Reviews.Title: “Great Three day weekend!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyMan041610
Reviews.Content: We booked the stay with hotwire.com and the hotel was great. The customer service was outstanding. Everyone and I mean, everyone, was so nice. My family met many people from all around the world. We have already plan to go back to New York in August and hopefully it will be at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...but thats it!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller030
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt hotel for 4 nights and had read alot of bad reviews regarding this hotel, however we thought we would give it a try as the location looked perfect. Indeed the location was perfect! however that is all this hotel had going for itself. Our arrival to the hotel found the reception staff were very rude and slow, something we didnt expect. Once checked in, the bellman assisted in taking our bags upstairs, he was very friendly and assisted us to our room. We also found the concierge at the hotel very rude and unhelpful! We had booked a supershuttle bus to the airport for our departure which was included in our trip, however we needed to book this 24 hours in advance, we asked the concierge if they could book this or assist us with this, however they rudely said this was not a service they promote and would not assist and pointed to the nearest pay phone for us to use. The hotel itself was not clean at all and very old and dated! Yes it looks grand when you first walk in but thats where it stops, beyond the grand entrance is where the problems lie. The bathroom had mould and dirt which looked like it had been there for years! The Air con unit was very noisy and unable to have on during the night as it was too loud. Very Thin walls so you could hear conversations from next door. All your getting with this hotel is a good location, thats it. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone and will certainly not be staying here again on pleasure or Business!

Reviews.Title: “Old but still comfortable & great location”
Reviews.Author: powerswitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 separate nights going to and back from California. It's an old style grand hotel which is showing it's age but some may call it character. It,s a great location and worth it for the ease of walking round mid town, 5th ave & Central Park etc. First room was tired but comfortable, room on return leg was definitely fresher but lower floor meant bit more traffic noise, however overall we were pleased with the cost by NY standards, perfectly good and used by a lot of American flight crews which probably says it's reliable and good value in itself. One thing that did freak us out was sight of a cockroach scuttling under food at lobby bar

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Service! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Braziliantravelers
Reviews.Content: I had been for a week at this hotel about 10 years ago. After reading the reviews and deciding to meet with my cousins for a weekend at this hotel my husband and I were a little concern. The rate was awsome $197 per nite all taxes included.Location is fantastic! Room was clean, check in was perfect. Concierge was very nice.Bellman and door man was very polite. The drinks at the bar and little burgers were delicious. Great hotel. Beautifull flowers. When in NY we'll stay at Roosevelt again.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl1978
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were impressed by the grand lobby, with a huge display of fresh flowers. Service was professional but not overly friendly. The room was small, but clean and well-equipped (no coffee maker though). The decor was good, although a little dated in the bathroom. The view of the Met Life building was amazing! The best view we've had from a hotel window. It was very well located, only 5 mins to Grand Central station and the subway. There were lots of restuarants nearby to choose from. The only negative I can think of was the air conditioner in the room was noisy and clunky. Not a big problem. I would recommend this hotel, without hesitation, to anyone looking for a base to explore the city. I would certainly go back for my next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round”
Reviews.Author: Venkman69
Reviews.Content: So let's be frank, you get what you pay for. So consideing what we paid for a week stay here, we were both pretty impressed with what the hotel had to offer. The hotel is looking a bit tired nowadays, but then it is your typical classic NYC hotel. Staff were helpful, if not sometimes abrupt, but it was very busy, so you can kind of understand it. The bathroom was fine, but the shower was pretty bad (no pressure). The room was great, with lots of space and good facilites. We did find a roach in the room on the last day, but then I would challenge anyone to find an old hotel in NYC that doesn't have one, so it didn't bother me that much. Location was outstanding, so if you just want a place to crash, near the city and not pay an arm and a leg, this is as good as anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “First time in NY - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: StaceyLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Our first time in NY and this was a great hotel for our trip. We were there for a week over St Patricks Day and I would recommend this hotel. Room We were on the higher floors, our room was pretty big, the bed was really comfortable and we had plenty of space for both of us (I do know the rooms tend to be small in NY and other rooms were smaller, but we had no problems with ours). The bathroom was nice and clean, it wasn't tired as some have reviewed but I can only speak for our room. The Aircon was great and really kept the room cool although it could be noisy and took a while to get used to. Downside being there was no tea/coffee making stuff in the room which was missed. Location The location was amazing, as it was our first time we wanted to explore the whole city and we could do that from this hotel, we walked everywhere. The only time we got a taxu was when it was raining and we had a show to go to and when we needed to go to the Financial District we got a subway from Central Station which is just across the road. Staff They were the only negative to the stay, the check in assistant was very rude, stating we didnt have a reservation and causing some panic! But that got sorted in the end, I also asked the concierge a question and he just turned around and started talking to his friend about his tv channels! Not helpful at all, but there were plenty of helpful and polite people outside of the hotel we ended up asking. All in all, a great stay for our first time. I would go back to this hotel in future and we got it for a reasonable price when looking now at booking for a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but outdated ... not a family place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MB-Lorrez
Reviews.Content: We got a cozy cozy double room - great location and great pictures on the website but it does not materialize once you're there ! It is really old fashioned, rooms need updating, bathroom is very small and it's claustrophobic ! The bar however was really nice, the drinks are great and the service was good. While I realie it's expensive to stay in NY, I recommend everyone to add up on the bill and go to a place you will really enjoy !!

Reviews.Title: “(--) on the lower end of a downward slide”
Reviews.Author: Cwheels
Reviews.Content: Cold showers every morning. Enough said? Terrible room service. Shampoo and amenities never replaced in bathroom. Noisy. It's crappy $20 a night motel service for $300+ a night. The cold showers was the killer. Come on. A nightmare. They should be ashamed to call themselves a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Donnamc2
Reviews.Content: Dreadful experience from the beginning. Stayed for six nights did not get one full nights sleep because of noisy guests which the hotel did nothing about or the road works outside which continued throughout the night. The hotel is dirty and tired . The concierge told us to ring around he was busy when we asked about our flight possibly being delayed due to the volcano eruption. The only help he would give us was directing us to a phone.We are stuck in NY because of the volcano in Iceland the roosevelt said we could keep our room for an additonal $329 per night. We have left and gone to the staybridge suites $189 per night absolutely superb friendly staff and lovely and clean. Do not stay at the Roosevelt it is awful

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: girlsonhols
Reviews.Content: having read lots of reviews, was a little apprehensive! Didn't need to be as we had a fantastic weeks stay. The hotel was clean, quite grand, but homely and very comfortable. Halfway through our stay, our toilet blocked up, overflowed and completely flooded and wrecked our 'cosy double' room!! The staff were very helpful and immediately found us a new room - bigger and better for no extra cost, even offering to help us move our belongings (not easy, 4 girls with tons of shopping!) All the staff were helpful and efficient although not friendly - something we were surprised at having come from England where people are much friendlier and chatty. Central location was perfect and we would definately stay here again. A great holiday all in all!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Angelus0704
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the hotel feeling a little apprehensive after reading several negative reviews on TA. However, on arrival I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived at around 3pm and requested a non-smoking room. This wasn't ready, but we were informed we could leave our luggage at the hotel and come back later as we were checked in, we just needed to collect our key. So we went to explore the local area for an hour. As the hotel is right next to Grand Central Station, we went there to explore. On our return our room was ready and we went up and to drop off our luggage. The room was lovely. Very clean. It was on the third floor. The bathroom was somewhat dated. Just a shower, and it was more like a wet room. I think the bathroom was for a disabled visitor due to the chair in the shower. The only annoying thing was the shower area was slightly higher on a slope so everytime you had a shower the water would go all over the rest of the bathroom floor. Not well designed. However, I don't think it is like this in every bathroom. There is also little space to put your toiletries in the bathroom. The hairdryer in the bathroom worked well. Our bedding was clean, and towels were changed every day. I thought the room was kept very clean whilst we stayed there. Our room also had an ironing board and an iron. Our room was directly opposite the elevators. I would suggest that if you are a light sleeper (I am, but did take ear plugs with me) to ask for a room away from them. It seemed to be a general meeting place for groups of people, who did not keep their voices down outside of the rooms even late at night. We did not eat at the hotel, but we did have a drink in Mad46 rooftop bar which was lovely. Drinks were expensive but was what I expected whilst in NYC. This bar seemed very popular with the locals for an after work drink. We also had a few drinks in the main hotel bar, which had a great ambience to it. If you are expecting any messages left for you whilst staying at the hotel, I would ask Reception if people can leave you voicemail. I had arranged to meet up with a friend who lives in NYC, however she was unable to leave any voicemail messages for me and the messages she left with Reception were not passed on. In the end she had to contact my Mother via Facebook to be able to pass a message to me to contact her. The location of the hotel was great. Next to Grand Central Station, 15 mins walk from Times Square, Rockefella Centre etc. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for 3 night city break”
Reviews.Author: Smart_traveller74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt as part of an Expedia package between Christmas and New year - when the lobby was beautifully decorated with a big Christmas tree. Having read some of the earlier reviews here I was quite apprehensive but I needn't have been - we had a lovely time. The rooms were fine - a good size - and my 2 teenage children were allocated a room with 2 beds as requested. Yes, maybe the bathroom was a little dated but it was clean. Service at check-in and check-out was helpful. The concierge (forgotten his name - Spanish/Mexican?) was really helpful - recommended a local Italian restaurant the first night which was excellent and booked out return transport to the airport (stretch limo for the same price as 2 taxis - there were 6 of us) which was hilarious and made a perfect end to a great stay. Location was great. I'd stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, from front desk to luggage, to doorman, to maid service”
Reviews.Author: housemama
Reviews.Content: Just returned from six nights at The Roosevelt. Like others, I was apprehensive based on some negative reviews but our experience was wonderful. We weren't in the room much, but the front desk helped us problem solve an Expedia error, the rooms were always clean, and when my near 80 year old in-laws did not have air conditioning yet and an unexpected heat wave hit, they were moved to another room and accommodated without any hesitation. The complaints of the other reviews seem like petty issues compared to the experience we had. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel more everytime we come back!”
Reviews.Author: Carol711
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, beautiful old hotel, and this time around our check in and check out was serviced by Alfredo -- what a difference customer service makes.

Reviews.Title: “PEACE OF MIND”
Reviews.Author: Myminutemade
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel was a lovely place to stay. the peace and quiet is gone after you get outside. bring your video camera to get all the action. much to see in this area of the hotel. wear some comfortable shoes.The Trump Hotel was nice to see inside. but after a long tiresome day you have a beautiful hotel and room to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but somewhat ageing grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: ben_steph
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over the Easter break and the Roosevelt is definitely well located! Easy access to the subway via Grand Central Station to reach all the key areas of NYC. The lobby is really impressive and proves that this hotel was grand in its glory days... we think it is however ageing and it is a bit of a circus now with so many people staying there. Our room was huge by NYC standards, very comfortable king bed. On the negative side the bathroom was old and in need of refurbishment. The cleaning during our stay could have been better too, we think they basically made the bed and put new towels without really hoovering or cleaning surfaces. The hotel gym is really good and big, coming with decent equipments you could expect from your local gym. As everywhere in the US, beware that all services require tipping... even leaving your suitcases at the left luggage facility (tips expected to drop them in and take them out). You will also realise if you have not tipped enough ;-) There is no free wi-fi but the coffee places next door have.

Reviews.Title: “BAD!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gd2good4u
Reviews.Content: We checked our luggage prior to check in time at 3pm. Upon checking in they informed us that they did not have any non smoking rooms with 2 double beds. We were placed on the 10th floor which was the smoking floor with 2 double beds. When we got to the floor we realized that this would not work for us. We spoke with people down stairs and they said all they could do was put us in a room with a king bed and give us 2 roll away beds which we ended doing because the smoking floor was just to much for us. Needless to say everything about this hotel was just bad. The bathroom ceilings paint was off the floors in the hall had bleach stains. Upon checking out they bellhops brought our luggage down and got stuck in the door and proceeded to rip our suitcases. Then did not take the luggage out for us just looked at us for a tip and walked away. We stayed for 4 nights and this was not my first time staying in Manhattan, but was for my family traveling with me. Location for the hotel was great but that was it. I would NOT recommend staying at this hotel. I did read reviews prior to going to the hotel but went with an open mind and all the bad reviews pretty much lived up to what this hotel is/was awful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..”
Reviews.Author: milehinik
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the hotel. The lobby and entrance are very grand and appealing. The staff were quite friendly. Our rooms were quite small but this is normal for NYC. The Bathroom could've done with upgrading as it was a little tatty. The room service charges are dear but then this is quite common in many hotel's. The food and drink charges in the bar are also expensive but there is quite a nice ambience in the bar area in the evenings. You can't beat the hotel for location, it's perfect, not far to walk to Times Square or Central Park. The towels were changed daily and the room was kept clean. The beds were very big and comfortable and although there was minimal noise in the corridor in the evening we both slept well. Overall it's a great location and lovely hotel as you enter the lobby, rooms aren't bad but I think the bathrooms could do with an overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “A good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Dronningen
Reviews.Content: PLUSES - Excellent beds (saved my back and my stay) - Location (near Grand Central, 5th Avenue and Times Square) -Nice, new televisions -Charming, old lobby MINUSES - It's an old building with loose handles, unclosable windows/doors etc. -No coffee makers/kettle or minibar/fridge -Bar prices HIGH!

Reviews.Title: “Nice setting poor amenities”
Reviews.Author: halepad4
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel looks nice in the lobby area and it is very close to Times Square and the metro lines. But, the negatives are numerous. The bathroom is outdated with no counter space. There are very few outlets in the room. A Coffee pot and coffee is only available upon request. it cost $2 to get a bottle of water if the vending machine works. The rooms ar e not very spacious. It was a good deal with the air flight but much could be improved to make the hotel more accommodating to guests.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY good thing is the location.”
Reviews.Author: KeepingEmHonest
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights there. Here's the deal... location is fantastic, can't beat it. The lobby is beautiful. However, the rooms? Yuck! Old, musty, the hallway smelled of stale smoke (it was a non-smoking floor) and the bathroom was miniscule. Now I expect tiny rooms when I go to NY. The actual room size was okay, but the bathroom was so small I had to enter it sideways. If you're taller than 5'9" your knees will touch the wall when sitting on the toilet. There's no refrigerator in the room, so don't bring leftovers home with you. The pillows were terrible! Why even have a pillow if your head touches the mattress once you lay on it? The heaters made a nice little racket, periodically, throughout the night. Oh and lastly internet access is $14.95 for 24 hours PER computer! So, basically, if you're looking for a step up from a hostel with a good location, this would be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastTravelers30
Reviews.Content: The lobby looks great, the website looks nice, the rooms are disgusting. This place is a dump. I would not stay here again if it were the last room available in NYC. I would opt for Jersey City or other location. Worn carpet, draperies appeared to never have been washed.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rotten Room for Scoundrels”
Reviews.Author: flyingmane
Reviews.Content: Okay - the website makes this hotel look glamourous. Heard it had big rooms. Would be nice if it were true. Had to move twice. the rooms are claustrophobic, dirty, worn and the furniture is broken. Maybe this hotel was used for trysts on the AMC TV series Mad Men - but the nasty room leaves too much to be desired, Oh - and they upgraded me! Memo to self - never, never, never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “All You Need, but no more.”
Reviews.Author: damonandtina
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is the epitome of an average New York Hotel. Semi-friendly, serviceable, able-bodied, adequate,.....and that's about it. A reasonably clean place to lay your head until your next exciting day exploring the Big apple. PLUSES -Good air conditioners that truly cool rooms well. -Nice, new televisions with decent channel selection -Lovely, old lobby that feels like old-time New York luxury. -Beds are comfortable, and location 5-minute walk from Times Square. -AT & T users get FREE INTERNET! MINUSES -Bathroom floors get VERY WET when you use shower. Inadequate flow guards. -Tiny rooms with lots of dings, scratches, loose handles, etc. -No coffee makers. -Not particularly friendly check-in staff. -Bar prices HIGH! All in all, a decent place that is okay for a stay if you get a good rate. Don't expect to hate it or love it, it'll just be a place to sleep. -

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at the Roosevelt again!”
Reviews.Author: njfitz
Reviews.Content: My family & I (husband, two teenagers) spent one week at The Roosevelt in June '09. To me, this hotel is in THE perfect location, only a block from Grand Central Terminal, 2 or 3 blocks (avenues, so longer) from Times Square, about 3 short blocks from Rockefeller Center, easy walk up Madison and 5th avenues. I love the old world feel of The Roosevelt, the lobby is just beautiful, feels very "fancy" when you first walk in, but not snobbish at all. The concierge and front desk people were helpful and not rude in any way, answering our questions gladly. I've read in reviews that the elevators are slow and too busy, but I don 't think there was anything out of the way in that area. We had asked for an upper floor, we were on the 18th, but there wasn't a great view, just some office buildings, oh well. We had a double/double room. It was small, as most NY hotels are, but even with the four of us, it was fine. After all, you don't go to NY to spend all your time in the room, do you? If you put away your suitcases, you can move around just fine. One thing that I didn't like, even though we had a flat screen TV, it apparently wasn't hooked up to a great cable system, it was very "snowy", and my other gripe, no coffee maker for caffeine addicted me! Otherwise, our room was fine, cleaned daily, plenty of towels, a little fridge for sodas. The beds were very comfortable and had very nice snowy white duvets. We didn't use room service (an expensive waste in my mind, no matter where we stay), so I can't comment on that. We also didn't eat in the hotel restaurants, choosing to find less expensive options. We DID get coffee from the Starbucks in the lobby one morning, paying those usual Starbuck's prices, and too much for hot water and a tea bag for my husband. Oh, I didn't mention that we booked this hotel through Hotwire (I had the hotels and their features narrowed down in that neighborhood). We only paid $159/night, which is a great value for a midtown hotel. All in all, we all four agree that we enjoyed our stay at The Roosevelt, and would gladly stay there again, and hopefully will get the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was one of the more pricey we...”
Reviews.Author: Kerzogaga
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the more pricey we looked at but we managed to get it for a REALLY good price through flight centre. it was a lovely hotel, when you walk in, the lobby and reception is like something out of a movie! The room was very clean and we had everything we needed. Sheets and towels were changed every day, and the concierge were more than happy to advise on any tourist things we wanted to do - we even booked the sex and the city tour through them. The location could not have been better. The hotel is located practically next door to grand central station! And from there you can get the subway to almost anywhere! Walking distance to times square, empire state building and central park. Stay in this hotel if you want to have the holiday of a lifetime. Pure class. :) *****

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: theodoreEngland
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at the Roosevelt for 3 nights on a short trip to New York, I can honestly say that having read some of the reviews beforehand I was a little apprehensive as to what I would find. I was pleasantly suprised, the receptionists were polite and very helpful as was the doorman. The room was a good size with 2 double beds (which I may add were very comfy), the bathroom had everything that was needed and the shower was powerful with no problems with the water fluctuating from hot to cold! The decor may be a little tired but hey, you cant have everything when you dont pay really high prices. I cant comment on the restaurant facilities etc, as we didnt eat in the hotel, but we were happy with everything else and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Money stolen from safe... Clear scam going on in hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjdarcy20
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the Roosevelt in Jan 10 and on the third day of our stay while we were out, someone entered our room with no permission (no cleaner or maintenance etc.) and had tampered with our safe and had taken the rest of our money what was in there. Also in our safe was our passports, my mobile phone and an egagement ring which I had for my girlfriend but only the money was taken. When we got in, we reported the incident immediateley to the Hotel security and also to the New York Police Department. Security in the hotel deemed that the safe had been made defective and so did the NYPD were hotel security also had access that an unamed key card had entered our room around 4pm in the afternoon. After a distraught start to the holiday I asked the hotel security when we would get our money back and that we would have no money in the mean time. William Rodriguez, hotel security advised it would take around 1 week possibly that we would have to wait as it is policy that they cannot do anything about this situation but go through the hotels insurance. Once it had all sunk in we were advised to call up relatives to wire money whilst we there so we could still enjoy our holiday and that the hotel would take care of our room service. After asking for the rest of the four days for more information, we were not kept in the loop on the whole situation and that they had no information and as soon as the insurance claim no. came through they would know more. We returned home were we constantly tried to keep in contact with the hotel were Ernie Boyd, the Hotel Security Director continued to tell us that he is waiting on the insurance and to contact the insurance because his "end" of the investigation was complete. I read on this website a similar incident had happened in Dec 09 and that when the insurance came back they said they were not liable for the loss of property. We have just receieved our email from the insurance and they have done exactly the same thing. This is completely unacceptable in my opinion. How can a hotel get away with, on more than one occasion for that matter? We had such high hopes for the Roosevelt Hotel as it is such a beautiful building in such a good location but let me tell everyone who is considering on visiting the hotel is to NOT go. The service is poor, and in such situations as the one we were in, Hotel security is well below average. For someone to steal just cash from inside a safe, fully knowing how to get into the room safe is a clear inside job within the hotel. Why did they not steal my mobile, an expensive egagement ring, passports? If this was just a thief from the streets im sure they would have taken the whole lot. Someone within that hotel knows that their insurance does not cover loss of cash and the Director of Security tells me that his investigation is "complete" without a guilty party being found. Disgusting. Truly, truly disgusting from a hotel. So all in all, The Roosevelt hotel cost us the price for the room, £2,300 in loss of money and also another £1,200 which we now have to pay back to a family member because there scam of insurance tells us it wont pay up, all for a weeks stay. So do I recommend the Roosevelt Hotel? Not a chance I have had some bad times on trips but this is by far the worst simply because of this hotel and its lack of service, helpfulness and definately it's security.

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean”
Reviews.Author: bridget138
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than expected, looking at reviews. Old, but what do you expect, it's been there awhile. Lobby was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “ONCE IN A LIFETIME EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Flora08
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull time at the Roosevelt. We found the staff very friendly. The bar was a bit pricey. The rooms were clean. It is also very central, close to all attractions of NYC. We cant wait to go back and would go back to this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Very good Location”
Reviews.Author: Karoline_91
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RH for 3 nights. Room was very large and comfortable ( for the reputation of NY's hotel rooms). Bathroom was very clean and warm! The location of RH is perfect, one block away from Grand Central Station and metro ( 5 lines). Times Square is only 3 block away (7-10 min) and 5 min from Central Park. Great view of NY skyscrapers. Very reasonably priced, I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Lost our Luggage”
Reviews.Author: serhoney
Reviews.Content: Horrible stay. The room was old and falling apart. The room had a strong smell of cigarette smoke although the hotel claims it is smoke free. The lamp shade was torn, the desk was so wabbly that you couldn't write on it, some of the base boards were missing. Worst of all they lost some of our luggage on the day we checked out. We had an early morning appointment and checked our luggage until we returned later. Upon claiming our luggage in the afternoon one of our pieces was missing. Managers were called and nothing was done. We had to fill out a security report and they said they would review the tapes. To top it off the manager informed us that if we find the luggage when we get home to call them! Horrible, horrible hotel. I've had stay at many great hotels in the city and this place is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: Jer29_11-14
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in New York City in January with our daughter and her family and had the time of our lives! We loved The Roosevelt. It was centrally located and within walking distance of Times Square and Rockefeller Center and was just down the street from Grand Central Station so we had easy access to the subway system as well. The hotel lobby is beautiful, and very inviting. Each night after we returned from seeing the sites, we settled into one of the seating areas to relax, enjoy a beverage, discuss our day and people-watch. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The room we had on the 18th floor was very small but since we weren't in it much, we didn't really care. However, we did have a problem with the in-room safe and the key cards never did work, so they were able to move us to a bigger room on the 7th floor that was very nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone for the convenient location and the cost of the rooms was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: MKBB
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent the night of February 27/28 at the Roosevelt hotel. Despite the frigid exterior temperature and even though the radiator in our room was off, it was stiflingly hot inside. When I tried to open one of the two windows it wouldn't budge and I strained my back in the process. A staff member finally managed to pry it up about six inches. We went out for dinner and when we returned late in the evening it was still so hot we couldn’t sleep. In desperation we turned on the air conditioner in the other window, the noise from which kept us awake for the remainder of the night. Next morning, when we took our showers, the water temperature abruptly fluctuated from scalding hot to ice cold without our ever adjusting the faucet. As I was reporting these conditions to the house-manager (whose only comment was, "I'm sorry, sir, what else can I say?") my wife overheard a lady standing nearby lodge an identical complaint with one of the receptionists. I turned and asked her what floor her room was on. The sixteenth, she replied, the floor below ours. So evidently ours was not an isolated case. Initial impressions can be deceptive. The Roosevelt’s magnificent lobby led us to expect so much more. What a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: bugbyte88
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews had me nervous before I left, but it was great! Roomy, comfortable rooms, fantastic location in Manhattan, very reasonably priced. I had read in previous reviews about the room safes being broken into, so I didn't leave anything in the room of value while I was gone. I'd like to go in the summer, apparently they have a great rooftop restaurant/bar!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mid-Town Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jesse24fire
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is a prefect 3 star hotel in mid-town New York. Grand Central station is right around the corner. It’s a $7.00 cab ride basically uptown or downtown. The rooms are good size and very comfortable. All the room linens and towels are very good quality. It is an older hotel, so keep that in mind. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this is not the place for you. With that being said, this hotel is an outstand value. NYC is a tough place to find a good priced hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, good location”
Reviews.Author: markusl132
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt for 7 nights in February. All in all a good stay at a reasonable price. Room was surprisingly large, given NY's reputation for small rooms (we had a cozy queen) on the 5th floor, and the room was internal (ie not facing the road) which was great, as the surrounding streets are busy 24/7. Room was nice and clean and hotel well located for Grand Central / Metro / Times Square. Only downsides were slightly grumpy check in staff (who offered no greeting or apology for room not being available at check-in, but at check out time were much more cheerful) and no tea / coffee in room (though they served starbucks at reception in the morning). Generally happy with stay and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “potless !!!!”
Reviews.Author: butterflyincolour
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the roosevelt hotel, prior to getting married in the Empire state buildings everything was paid for in the wedding package there was no need for monies to be taken from our card, never would again would i ever stay there and wouldnt recommened it to no one, the reception staff were very rude and unhelpful It completley ruined our stay in New York, thanks to the roosevelt taking a legal transaction of £1000 im now £500 over drawn with my bank and have ran up a mobile phone bill of £200 ringing England to try and sort it out and still have not recieved my money back can the manager pease explain why? i think the hotel should have a customer service upgrade.luckily the wedding went smoothly unlike the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I give it an "A-"”
Reviews.Author: wellermdfan
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel on priceline for a great price and was a little apprehensive. I really didn't need to worry. The hotel was fine, fast checkin/checkout process, comfortable clean beds, plenty of room, great lobby & bar, easy location to get toand from. The bathroom was honestly the cleanest bathroom i have ever experienced at a hotel before. They also had 6 elevators so you never had to wait long for one. We did not eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the restaurant. It's true that the furnishings are a little dated and worn but it wasn't dirty. There was an inroom safe and large closet in the room and plenty of lights. The windows also opened to let in cool air at night. The only service that could have been improved was the bellhop service - we arrived before checkin time and had to store our luggage and waited in a long line for a long time because there were only 1 or 2 bellhops taking luggage. The same experience occurred when we came back on Sunday night to get our luggage before heading home. Overall, this was a minor inconvenience and didn't impact our trip or enjoyment of the hotel. I was very pleasantly surprised and would return in a heartbeat if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely--Definitely in my Top 5 New York Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerNomad
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt has a stunningly gorgeous lobby with old world beauty and charm. The staff matches the charm as they are just wonderfully friendly and accomodating. I had a couple of issues (shower with no cold water, remote battery died) and they were swiftly responsive and cheery throughout. The rooms were on the small side, but very typical for New York. My first room (before the shower made me change) had a bathroom that was so small the door actually hits the toilet and won't open the whole way. Not cute. :-) In the second room, the bathroom door just cleared the toilet by a hair's breath. :-) There was no vanity, which was a bit of a pain, but not the end of the world. I like a very warm room so the very toasty Roosevelt rooms were great for me. However, my friend Curtis, who likes things to be cool, would have been absolutely miserable, such as the extent of the non-adjustable heat. So that's something to keep in mind. But I LOVED it!! The bed was comfortable, The area was very central and I came in and out walking every time, at all hours. When I checked out I had to leave my bags so that I could go to my meeting and then come back to retrieve them before heading home. Both bell captains were cheery, full of humor, and just very nice. So, definitely a great 4 night stay and I would highly recommend the Roosevelt to all. (especially lovers of warmth!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby overshadows a a few issues with room”
Reviews.Author: jburrows500
Reviews.Content: As many have said already, the lobby is right up there with the best of the old grand hotels of the 20's. It's simply beautiful. The room was fine in terms of size and comfort. If it were not for the lobby and the fact that hey, this is a 80 year old property, I might be a little more upset over the water damage that was evident on the ceiling (room 1518). It wasnt anything that occured recently, from the mold and cracking paint, it was pretty clear that it had been left unrepaired for some time. The second issue was the worn spot in the rug about 5 feet into the room. It appeared like a dog chewed the rug. As strange as it sounds, I excused those two flaws because the place otherwise was great. I think when you stay in older properties, you have to take the good with the bad. Overall, the good far outweighed the bad. The concierge was great and the front desk person was helpful during check in and upgraded us to a double bed as I went through Priceline and would have had to go with a bed cart for one of my two children. Parking was steep at $5 a day but not outrageous for NYC. I opted to park the car at a cheaper garage ($23/day) but it was a bit of a walk back to the hotel... but then again, I'm kind of cheap that way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel333333
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice. We got a great deal on Priceline, too. $107 in the middle of Manhattan! Within walking distance of the Theatre District and Times Square. Very clean and the people were very nice,too. Most hotels in NYC have very small rooms. Not this one. Excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Greal Location, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaileP
Reviews.Content: I loved the location, across from the Rockafeller Center. I walked everywhere, Times Square, 5th avenue, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway... The rooms were small, but I didn't spend much time there. Concierge was great, they were able to get me show tickets at a reasonable rate, delivered to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: halliwellrosie
Reviews.Content: Just finishing a weeks stay at the Roosevelt. My friends stayed here last year hence we followed her experience. Overall the hotel is in an excellent location close to all the main attractions. Especially the Rockerfeller centre which is excellent The hotel Lobby is very impressive and I know what people have said on here about the rooms. Yes the bathrooms are l little tired and grubby but the beds and the linen certainly make up for this minor inconvenience. When we arrived I asked as always to see the room first before we lugged our luggage all the way up to the room. Glad we did as the first choice was small and a little grubby.No view went back to reception and explained that it wasn;t up to my standard and for a week stay it was not going to be suitable. So the receptionist duly moved us to a better room at no extra cost. We have stayed here for a week now enjoyed the ambience of the hotel bar in the evenings. We had one breakfast here which cost $22 for adults and $11 for the children each. Great selevtion and typical hotel breakfast very good. We found it difficult finding good reasonably priced restaurants to eat at in the evenings. There is Central Station over the road but to be honest its basically fast food. One evening we went the the Cinema Cafe on 60th this was excellent. Last night we treated ourselves to Jazz at Dizzys this iwas excellent and highly recommend it . The view the food the live music was excellent. Highlight of the trip. Most mornings we ate breakfast at Starbucks although one morning we went to Scottys Diner on Lexington that was good too and very cheap. Typical American DIner.Hope this info helps you,

Reviews.Title: “good for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: kroellig
Reviews.Content: It was very small, small bathroom, we fought over outlets to charge phones, our air conditioner broke day one and they never fixed. ok for the price and we were only there when sleeping anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad the service sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Vbg
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Roosevelt. You can't beat the location, it's close to Times Square.The room was a decent size for NY and the beds were very comfortable. However, the shower was broken: it would give you only scolding or freezing water and they never repaired it. The safe was broken and they wouldn't fix it if we weren't in the room. The wake-up call never came: they had problems with the phones (good thing we didn't have a plane to catch). Although the location is great, the service is inadequate to keep this hotel running smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Location matters”
Reviews.Author: DavidWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: While the lobby makes you think of its more splendid past, the rooms are slightly disappointing and overdue for a more comprehensive overhaul. Still, everything works and the hotel is clean. While not really enjoyable, the gym is doing its job. Meanwhile, the staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is clearly good value for money and the ideal location for the business traveller and for those combining business with leisure.

Reviews.Title: “manager was incredibly rude, bathroom stank of cigarettes.”
Reviews.Author: businesswoman_10
Reviews.Content: a snowstorm caused mass flight cancellations, so I had to request another night's stay. I was told very rudely that there was no space in the hotel. I explained my situation, that my flight had been canceled and I just needed any room for the night. Again he was very rude and stated that that was not the hotel's responsibility. Finally, I was fed up and asked if he would throw me out into the snow, to which he stated, "that is not our responsibility." also, the bathroom stank of cigarettes but that seems incredibly minor after the manager's attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Conflicted- but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: denverroadtrip
Reviews.Content: I had a priceline reservation (which as it turns out is not as cheap as using Kayak for NYC). The hotel was very nice in letting me check in many hours early. The problem is that I needed two beds. They refused. When I told them that I have NEVER had a hotel tell me that I couldn't have two beds (over 1100 rooms), they said that there were absolutely no available rooms with two beds- it would be impossible, even later in the day. Yet, they then said it's no problem if I pay an additional charge. WHAT CRAP! Liars! What a sleazy way to make an extra buck. I checked into my one bed room and it was the SMALLEST I ever had in my life, and the bathroom was too tiny to imagine! The bed was comfortable, good pillows, good flat panel TV, and good toiletries. I would not recommend this hotel or stay here again. It's not a dump by any means, but sleazy front desk policies would easily have me spend my money elsewhere. I move the following morning. I wonder when they took the low road, what type of review they expected. See my review of the Affinia Dumont- same price and fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Money stolen and I'm not the first”
Reviews.Author: jomull
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in Dec 09. One of the main reasons I picked this hotel was because they had safes in the room. On the 2nd day of our stay our money was stolen from this safe. This was a terryifying experiience and completely changed the enjoyment of the holiday. I was told at the time that I would have to claim this back from the hotel's insurance company but I have just been advised by the insurance company that the hotel is not liable for the loss of my money. I have since read another review from a person who had their money stolen as well. I would like to warn other travellers that might be thinking of staying in this hotel that their money is not safe or insured by putting it into the safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel had a brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: northerntart
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying here after reading bad reviews. All the staff we spoke to were really friendly, our room was a lovely size nice and clean the bed was huge. The maid cleaned every day she was very friendly too. We had an excellent week here theres only one thing i would change and thats put a kettle in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.... could do so much better”
Reviews.Author: Bradford_on_Tour
Reviews.Content: Its a great shame this hotel cant improve its standards past the lobby really. We arrived to be told room wasnt ready which was fine, stashed cases and went for a wander round to come back to a massive queue to find out if our room was available 4pm. Reception staff a bit non plus really, not very friendly, not engaging at all. Room we were given was very small on the inside of the building, heating sounding like it was going to explode when switched on, and carpets could have done with a good hoover and clean. Bathroom was passable, but cracked sink and chipped bath not great. Not much room left to walk round the bed when you'd unpacked as there was also nowhere to store cases. No hotel guide, no writing paper, no cups in the room either, by way of amenities in the room actually just the bed, desk, tv and a few toiletries thats it. Was woken at 2am by the most horrendous banging noises outside the window, which carried on relentlessly. Hubby went to reception to see if we could swap rooms and was told we would have to pack, take our bags to reception and then wait again til 3pm next day to see if we could. After asking the rather dismissive receptionist again we were told we could go and have a look at another room which was available - this is at 5am! Anyway was a lot better so we moved. Funnily enough two other couples were doing the same thing at that early hour of the morning as they couldnt sleep either. New room had far more room in it, could fit ourselves and our cases in it at least and there was no heating or banging issues. Hallways were also a bit tired and could do with decorating, they were hoovered as we saw the piles of hoover dust that the hoover couldnt cope with strewn along the hallway! Also no refreshments in room was disappointing. Positives were the breakfast was good and the doorman was polite and obviously the location. We're definately going back to NY but wont be going back to the Roosevelt which is a shame as it does have potential.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: LisaD7
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked grand from the outside and so did the reception area, but when we entered our room we were very disappointed. It was very small and the decor was very old and depressing. Don't get me wrong it was clean and we had a decent TV and a fridge, but the room was very dated. My husband carefully selected this hotel out of many he looked at for my 30th birthday and it wasn't in the cheap range. The promised Manhattan view was out of a very dirty window. The lock on our door was loose and the staff all looked depressed. They didn't crack a smile or ask us if we enjoyed our stay when we checked out. We really expected much more from a so clled 'famous' establishment that has appeared in various movies. There was a world leader conference on that weekend and we think maybe the upper crust were allocated the nicer rooms. We also had a smoking room, which I thought may have played a part also. Never the less - my hubby paid for the room our of his own hard earned cash (unlike the world leaders) and just because I smoke doesn't mean I deserve a depressing room. My husband wanted to complain, but I wouldnt let him - I wish I had let him now when I think back. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location! Really Nice Hotel!! Couldnt have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: emmie_newyork
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights over the Christmas holiday. Lobby is very impressive with a really nice bar, the bar food was also very good and worth the extra few $$. We had a superior king room which was a great size with a massive and very comfortable bed! Bathroom was small but adequate if a little shabby but clean. Lots of space to put clothes and shopping away in. One downside was that the room got very hot at night but it wasnt noisy with the window open. The location is just brilliant, right next to Grand Central where our favourite restaurant was (Micheal Jordan's) and only a few blokes to time square and all major attractions. Overall the decor was a little dated and a bit shabby round the edges but we really enjoyed our stay and would def go back. We got our rate through expedia which was probably cheaper than the rack rate and was worth every penny. Didnt have many dealings with staff as we didnt have to complain about anything, but when we did they were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a first time visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: sarahandrich43
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal for this hotel on Expedia, but had some concerns before we went after reading trip advior reviews. I was pleasantly surprised as the hotel exceeded my expectations. The room was a good size, similar to a standard room in other cities. The room and bathroom were clean, the maid came in daily and always while we were out, we had plenty of towels, cushions, pillows etc. The bed was huge and very comfy. It's a shame there are no tea and coffee making facilities but we knew that beforehand. Our room was on the 4th floor and all the areas we saw were well presented, no worn carpets etc as mentioned by other reviewers. The room and the 4th floor seemed better than the descriptions given by many other reviewers, so maybe the floor you are on makes a big difference? We could hear road noise on the 4th floor but it wasn't enough to keep us awake. The drinks vending machine kept my money but I called reception and they immediately offered to reimburse me at the front desk. Our safe didn't work when we arrived but someone from Security came straight up and fixed it. The staff are polite enough but not particularly friendly, however this didn't matter to us as we rarely needed to contact them. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel in a great location as a base to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: nunomagalhaes
Reviews.Content: Very charmming with and selected atmosphere. Great assistance and in the center of New York heart.

Reviews.Title: “Your paying for the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: sunderland_UKLainey6
Reviews.Content: I searched tripadvisor for a reasonably priced hotel that what central and had decent sized rooms and I opted for the Roosevelt. Mistake - it was crap. Seriously the lobby was fantastic, really looks impressive but thats where it ends. the corridors are dirty and smell, the bedrooms are tiny, my boyfriend is 6ft 2" and it was so tiny you had barely enough room to put one case so you can imagine the arguments!! The bathroom is scruffy and only has a shower. maid service "forgot" to come one day and as the shower leaked we needed towels just to mop the floor. service is nothing to right home about - bar is expensive and they constantly talk about getting money off people. when i asked the bellboys if they could put the cases to one side for a bit they looked at me with disgust as I was interupting their conversation. i dont even rate the location, I have stayed in a doubletree hotel in new york which was cheaper and had bigger rooms. honestly it was my partners 1st time in new york so i spent ages trying to get the right hotel - you are far better off going for the best location with decent size rooms as thats what matters if your thinking about the roosevelt - think again on another note i had a fab time and the realnewtour.com is the best thing to do in New York ENJOY YOUR TRIP!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and decently priced. Don't come here expecting pampering though!”
Reviews.Author: Mantelstone
Reviews.Content: One couldn't really expect more from a USD $210/night hotel in midtown Manhattan. The location is obviously excellent for most intents and purposes, and staff is generally friendly and helpful. Don't come here expecting Peninsula-level service, but Roosevelt is definitely a strong contender for a centrally located hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: RichandMerry
Reviews.Content: We got a fairly good deal on this hotel on priceline. Great location as its centered in midtown yet is far enough away from times square and all the tourist nonsense. It was one of the smallest rooms we ever had in the city. Nice comfortable bed, but hardly room to move around. The rug was worn thru near the bathroom and the dresser was quite banged up. Bathroom was clean. Wonderful old style lobby and every staff member we met was pleasent. All in all not a bad place if you get a good price. As example, if we had paid regular price for this room, i could have had a much better one at the Waldorf instead for only $40 more or Hilton for only $20 more! At only $90 plus tx it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauraqUk
Reviews.Content: I can't understand all the negative comments on here about this hotel. I guess it's that thing where most people who have a good time on holidays don't think to put a review in but those who have a bad time are quick to write a bad review. Anyway, we stayed here for 5 nights over new years eve and we couldn't fault it. Yes, the rooms are small, but then they are smaller than usual in most new york hotels. The fact is they were clean, comfortable and there was hot running water! The bathroom did leave alot to be desired but we didn't spend our whole holiday in the bathroom so it didn't matter!!! I do agree with another review on here that the cleanliness in the corridors were not great. We stayed on the 10th floor (smoking floor) and it seemed that they either didn't have a vacuum or where reluctant to use it! The reception was absolutely beautiful with a gorgeous big xmas tree in the middle. The staff on reception and in the bar were very friendly although in the restaurant were we had breakfast one morning were less than friendly. The location was fantastic as everything was within walking distance. Some really nice little bars and restaurants close by aswell. If you did want a cab to go farther then there was no shortage of them outside, at any time of the day. All in all a very nice hotel and we definitely stay here if we travelled to New York again. Being in New York we didn't spend alot of time in our room anyway. For sleeping and showering - it done what we needed it to do!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gertz666
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in the roosevelt hotel, and both found it excellent. It was my 3rd time to New York, and Roosevelt was far the best hotel i´ve stayed in. The staff was friendly, the room was great, and it was perfectly located in midtown. We´re gonna stay there again next time. No doubt !

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to moaning people”
Reviews.Author: Arnsarmy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights at this hotel rooms are a little on the small side if you want to travel to new York to stay in a hotel room . But the location of this place is amazing you can walk to almost everythink and if not put your hand up and a cab's there . So don't let moaning people put you off rooms are clean towels and bed changed everyday . The bed is massive and very comfy and trust me after all the things you do in the day you need it . We had a great time and would recommend this hotel to freind's and family and would definitly go back .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: Dasindog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for one night and were pleasantly surprised. After reading some of the reviews I was very apprehensive about what we would find once we got there, but our experience was very good. The check-in process went smoothly (we booked through Priceline and received an excellent rate), we were upgraded to a room with a king bed, the room was clean, the staff was knowledgeable and accommodating, the valet parking was efficient, the lobby was beautiful and check-out was quick. In addition, the location is ideal for mid-town access.The only criticism I have is the elevators were packed so we had to walk down eight flights when we checked out. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RIPScarlett
Reviews.Content: I have to say I really can't get my head around all these negative reviews!? I was really worried about the hotel after reading all the bad comments on here but I really don't know what people are moaning about! And then I realised - some people just love to moan! I had absolutely no bad experiences whatsoever at this hotel!!!! We arrived about 5pm and was very impressed by the splendour of the lobby - it was beautiful! And decked out with beautiful Christmas decorations. We checked in easily and got the lift (no queues and the lifts aren't grimey and old as I have previously read on here!) and a bellboy helped us with our cases and showed us to our rooms. The room was an ok size, stayed in bigger but I think hotel rooms in New York tend to be slightly small but it wasn't uncomfortable. The bed was HUGE! We stayed in a "cosy queen" room but you could have fit 3 people in that bed easily! It was very comfortable too with nice big cushions. The bathroom again was small and I'd say the suite was a good few years old but it was clean, everything worked, the shower was great and we got clean towels on a daily basis so I was more than happy! The location of this hotel is perfect. You turn right and head straight for about 5 minutes and your on 5th Avenue! There is a steak restaurant just up the road from the hotel next to an Irish bar and it was the best steak I have ever had! It was quite pricey but I definately recommend it! We also found a great cafe off 5th Avenue next to the cathedral called Prime Burger. It's the best New York experience! Sarah Jessica Parker even goes there! We had some scrumptious breakfasts here! New York is a great place. It was our first time here and we really loved it. It's completely different to any other city I have been to before and would love to return. December is also a great time to go as all the decorations make it very magical! Maybe we got lucky with the hotel and other travellers on here have reason to complain but I thought the hotel was great and we got a really good deal on it too! I wouldn't hesitate at booking another stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest People in Reservations Department”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyBullyGirls
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt last Feb.2009.Wonderful hotel and amazing staff.Must give an extra high five to the special woman in the reservations department.One in particuler stands out (Susan)absolutely a gem and asset to hotel.Just made reservations again for a week this March 2010,happened to get lucky and Talked to Susan again.Was very pleased and felt very lucky to have her make my reservation again.She is pleasant to deal with and no question was a bother for her to answer.I feel she goes out of her way to be friendly and gives a great first impression to anyone booking a room.Another plus is she remembered making reservations for my daughter and me last year,and made us feel special.Will always stay at the Roosevelt and no where else,it says alot when someone as busy as a reservations department staff takes the time to remember prior guests.I just hope the management realize what a outstanding person they have as Susan on their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Digusting!!! damp & mice droppings- wouldn't even give us a refund.”
Reviews.Author: Anita837
Reviews.Content: The hotel was diguisting sheets were dirty, the curtains had mold and mice droppings on the bathroom counter. We arrived at the Roosevelt at 12:30 am as our flight was delayed. When we arrived our room was not ready so we had to wait 30 minutes. All we done was checked in, then look at room for 10 minutes and then checked out. The front desk would not refund our hotel first night hotels fee, as we had booked through priceline. That night we went to Grand Hyatt , but as I'm a students, my sister and I couldnt afford to stay in the Grand Hyatt throughout the whole of our holiday ,as its quite expensive but it's beautiful hotel, So we had to spend the next day finding a another hotel for the remainder of the trip. Its not 3.5 hotel, I will never recommended the roosevelt hotel. Buyers beware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor cleaning- hairs on the mattress pad were um, gross.”
Reviews.Author: Fattycrab
Reviews.Content: I checked in and the front staff is serviceable. I had to have housekeeping come which they did and they agreed that it was a bad situation. Were they gracious? Not really.

Reviews.Title: “Good Priceline hotel”
Reviews.Author: howdog14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business for the first time. Booked the room on Priceline for a great rate ($225 total for 2 nights). Read the reviews here and they ended up being pretty accurate. Great location. Very nice lobby. Dated rooms, other than flat screen TV. Not sure if I was given a "priceline" room, but it wasn't much bigger than a 10x10...room for a queen bed and not much else. Spoke with someone else who did not book through priceline and they had the same comment. Bathroom dated, carpet pulling, etc. But overall, clean room. I would definitely stay here again for the right price, as long as I am traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the negative comments??????”
Reviews.Author: DrStuo
Reviews.Content: I am repeatedly amazed at the negative comments I've read on this site because my experience is ALWAYS a positive one. The Roosevelt is a case in point. My wife and I had a wonderful time staying here for 6 nights: an unbelievably low price $103/night, a room with 2 queen beds and adequate space for an old NYC hotel, everything worked well in the room, great mattress and linens and TONS of pillows, maid service was good, everyone in the hotel was friendly and helpful, the location can't be beat (Midtown east within walking distance to theaters, Times Square, NY Public Library, Pierpoint Morgan Library, Times square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, etc. etc. NO surprizes at checkout: we paid exactly what we were quoted when booking (thru a discount website). We recommend this hotel HIGHLY!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION VERY HELPFUL STAFF WOULD STAY AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ansi192
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt in November over Thanks Giving Weekend. We found the location excellent within walking distance of Grand Central, Empire State, Times Square, Rockerfella, and Fith avenue on the next block. The staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay. The rooms are small but the beds are very comfortable and we found it hard getting out of them in the mornings!!!! I would definately stay at this hotel again....Hopefully this year again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Appears to be dining out on its great location”
Reviews.Author: THFC1978
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt's number one selling point has to be it's great location - right in the centre of town. Withing 10 minutes walk you're in Times Square, 5th Avenue, Grand Central, Rockafeller. Great first impression with its big, impressive foyer. Our room was a good size, although I did see some very small rooms which I thanked my stars we didn't get. Generally the decor in the room was a bit tired, the carpets were warn, tiles in the bathroom were cracked, the shower was dated and strictly average etc. On the plus side, the room had a good bed and a new big flat screen TV as well, and had a great view up Madison Avenue (although this tended to be noisey at night - no real complaints about that though, its not like we expected silence!) The $15 a day Internet wasn't working "in that room at this time" and so went to the coffe shop across the street for free access - not sure how I would have felt if this had been a business trip and I was relying on internet avaliability. We felt the overall service could have been improved a litlle - - Room service plates remained outside our room for 24 hours. When mentioning this in passing to a housekeeping staff member I was told it was not her problem, I'd need to speak to room service. - Upon check out we requested help to carry our bags from the 5th floor to a cab (for which we would have tipped hansomly), after two phone calls and 20 minutes, we struggled down ourselves to find 4 bell boys chatting in reception. 1 bag was carried 5 metres to a cab and the appropriately reduced tipped was met with scorn and disbelief. - The conceirge was a little dismissive and ready to rip me off. I inquired about a ticket for a hockey match and was told it was sold out unless I paid $200. A simple search on the venues website got me a great ticket for $70. He could have done this for me on his computer and I'd have happily paid him for this service. My advice would be if you are staying here, just use it just to sleep. Other services are not good value. Which is a shame, as it basically means that a once grand hotel has basically lost touch with the expectations of a modern traveller. If you're going to charge $30 for breakfast, I honestly don't mind crossing the street and paying $10 for the same plate of pancakes from a coffee shop. The convienence of the Roosevelt's in-house services, in our opinion, did not provide value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel save for internet problem”
Reviews.Author: commodore4444
Reviews.Content: Decent room. Cleaning staff clumsy and also somewhat forgetful during my stay (forgot to leave faceclothes). But speedy service at front desk, great help with luggage, and very impressive bar staff. The internet was a problem. Not only was it not free, but it was prohibitively expensive, which was ridiculous. Definitely the biggest problem I had and that definitely is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a good rate, stay here, location cannot be beat!”
Reviews.Author: brennbug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to NYC in September and thought we wanted to be near Times Square. After arriving I am so glad we choose a mid-town hotel instead. Manhattan hotels are pricey no matter what. We got a king room for $150 per night on Priceline.com (name your own price option), less than half the price I could find anywhere else. Pros: -Good Value -Good Location (mid town, walking distance to Grand Central Station) -Beautiful lobby -Front desk staff was efficient and friendly Cons: -Bell hops were unsatisfactory (long wait, made to carry baggage to be stored and still expected tip, took forever to hail cab even though one was ready) -Rooms are nothing special, small space, nice linens but carpet, walls, and tiling in rooms could use updating.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice for exploring Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: FarandeFant
Reviews.Content: It`s in the middle of and in walking distance to many of the sites you probably want to see. (Empire State, Top of the Rock, TImes Square, Central Park. Chrysler Building , UN building...) and just one block beside 5th ave. all which I mean must be the most important criteria, at least for your first visit to the Big Apple. As a bonus all staff are very service minded and kind, and the bar with bartenders was stunning and professional. OK the room we got was not that spacious and fancy but that was of minor importance. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, annoying lazy bell boys”
Reviews.Author: ragingbeast14
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location in Midtown, right next to grand central station so is located close to all of New York’s main attractions. The hotel lobby looks stunning. It's got a real classy look to it and it's absolutely spotless. Looks like something out a really old movie. In the lobby there is a view shops and a bar which I can't comment on because we never ate or drank there, looked expensive. Check in was easy. We were on the 4th floor. The room was impressive, and big for NYC standards. The bed is massive and very comfy. Almost to comfy. The bathroom is a decent size also. Everything is clean. And the flat screen tv adds a nice finish to the room. The rooms do look old but not dirty. The hotel is right next to 5th avenue so is ideal if you like shopping. Times Square is about a 5 - 10 walk, central park - about 15 - 20. The area is very safe. Infact the whole of NYC is safe. I was there for 6 nights and never got in a taxi once. We walked from midtown all the way to downtown and across the Brooklyn Bridge. The only negative things I can say about this hotel are that the bell boys are rubbish and look for tips at any opportunity. The guy wanted a tip for lifting my bags about 5 yards. I was thinking eh no chance mate, if you told me where my bags were I would get them my self. The guy stood and looked at me in disgust when he realised I wasn't tipping him. I have travelled from Edinburgh with them bags and he wants a tip for carrying them 5 yards. NO CHANCE. I would rather carry my own and my girlfriends bag anyway. Another negative about the hotel was that it charges $15 a day for the internet, which I think is a joke. I didn’t bother with it. Instead i walked directly across the road to the coffee shop and got it for free. Apart from the annoying bell boys and the lack of free internet the Roosevelt is great. I got it for a really good price on Expedia. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “My Roosevelt Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jollys24
Reviews.Content: Lobby Just got back from my stay at The Roosevelt Hotel in New York where I stayed with my boyfriend for 1 week. As you walk up the stairs and into the lobby, it is very grand and impressive. Lovely Christmas decorations, lobby area very clean and cosy. Check in was relatively simple after a minor error on their part was resolved. Room Room very small. Double bed was very inviting and comfortable after a long day roaming the streets of New York, although on our last day as we were packing away our things we noticed that there was dried blood on the mattress itself, not good. Décor was much to be desired, with very large burnt/brown patch on the carpet. Big screen TV which was good when getting ready for bed in the evenings. Not much of a view from our room and ended up having to keep the curtains closed the majority of the time due to an office block directly opposite full of people working, we were concerned they could see in to our room, they were close enough. Room very noisy at night from outside traffic, garbage trucks etc. Bathroom was very small also but functional. Did not have a bath, shower only which was quite pleasant although did take us a while to shower due to ridiculously low water pressure. Hairdryer located in the bathroom but was basically useless as it would cut out power after 2minutes and remained useless for the whole week. Both myself and boyfriend who don’t normally suffer from allergies, woke up at least once during the night and every single morning coughing, sneezing, itchy/red/irritable eyes, which took us at least 30 minutes to 1 hour to ‘get up and get going’ as we felt so weak and lethargic, these symptoms gradually went away once outside but unfortunately did return every night and again in the morning. The only explanation we could think could be the cause could have been was dust mites/ bed bugs/ mould etc ?. Who knows. Second day in we ended up having to buy painkillers and anti-allergy medication to get through the week. Bedding was changed and fresh towels were provided everyday by the maids, in which they would give the room a general tidy up. Only niggle we had with the maids was they would wake you up at silly o’clock every morning (6am so on) for housekeeping and then would persist on waking you up every 20 minutes until you basically got up, if you didn’t respond to them/ hear them they would also call your room. Overall for the price we paid a bigger and more pleasant room would have been welcomed. But was ok for our first trip to New York as was only used as a base. The allergen problem could have been done without and when feeling like that every morning due to the room, the maids continuously waking us up could have been done without also. Busy time of year so upgrades etc were not possible. Staff With the very little contact we required from the staff at The Roosevelt, they were ok. If short answers and no eye contact is ok by you then this is how they work. Concierge was asked a simple question, what time is check out? In which he shouted the answer at us as if we were stupid and didn’t take his eyes away from his news paper the whole time, whilst patronising his more helpful colleague for being more helpful. Location This would be the main reason why The Roosevelt Hotel would be chosen as the place of stay due to the location. Everywhere you would need/ want to do/go is a stones throw away. 10 minutes from Times Square, 15 minutes from Broadway, 1 avenue from 5th av, 15 minutes walk away from Central Park, Grand Central Station round the corner and so on. Overall, if a much better room was available, the allergen problem got taken care of and no other hotels were available, we would probably consider staying here again or recommending to a friend. Not bad for a first trip to New York, but have definitely had better experiences.

Reviews.Title: “5* lobby, 2* hotel”
Reviews.Author: hijinx00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over new year and our stay was very hit and miss, it felt like a risk from the other mixed reviews and after staying there I can say that most of the other reviews are accurate. We picked this hotel because it was the cheapest hotel we can find on the internet that was atleast 3* and on manhatton island. As you walk in you'll notice that the hotel really is in an excellent location, 45 minutes walk from central park, 30 minutes walk from timesquare and 10 minutes walk from grand central station. The lobby is very impressive and had a 25ft christmas tree at the time. You join a short queue for a well staffed desk that quickly found our room, they didnt recall our request for a smoking room and quickly swapped us to one implying that the hotel wasn't full at the time. There are no ash trays in the room, the only thing that lets you know its a smoking floor is the smell that hits you when you leave the lift. Our room was very small, it had one queen sized bed with a dresser, a huge LCD TV with analogue satellite and the premium channels. I'm guessing it was satellite because it kept falling out of synch or crashing for 5-10seconds. The bathroom was dissappointing, it was clean but it was so badly designed. The towel rack was above the toilet so towels fell in it, so was the electric hair dryer! There was plug sockets in the bathroom and it did have an extractor fan that kept the room steam free, no bath. The rest of the room was a bit delapidated, the carpet goes 6 inches up the wall but doesnt stick to it so I spent some time fishing stuff out of the gap between the dresser and the wall carpet, there was a massive burn mark on the carpet.
