The electrical points (plug sockets) were falling off the wall but didn't spark or anything. The room was well lit with 2 lamps, one had 2 halogen bulbs which helps for reading etc. The room was directly accross from a call centre with clear windows so monday to friday we had to keep our curtains closed most of the time. It takes a lot of force to open the window, Im just a normal guy that doesnt work out and it took all my strength to lodge the window an inch, definitely not a room for the elderley! The hotel is located next to a traffic junction on Madison where the road has worn away, the solution was to place giant steel plates over the delapidated parts of the road like loose makeshift bridges. These bridges bang at every hour of the night and I was frequently woken up by a truck hitting the steel, it really is as loud as a bomb. We were definitely allergic to something in the room, we're still not sure if it was a dusty room, duck feather pillows etc. but it left us very drowsy in the mornings. We didn't want to spend all day figuring it out so we stayed in that room. The maid service comes as early as 08:30, one day they came at this time and seemed to come back every hour until 12:30 when they suggested they come back at four. This routine of coming every hour starting between 09:00 and 10:00 happened every day and they would keep coming back, one day they even rang our room after knocking the door for a few hours in a row. I don't think its their fault, someone somewhere needs to lighten up a bit on the importance of maid service. Obviously being a bit ill from the room we have a different experience to other people that would be out by 08:00am every day. The lobby staff didn't blow our mind either. We asked where to leave luggage from am to pm on our last day and a guy said 'Just leave it there' pointing toward a gap between his desk and the disabled toilet entrance without looking us in the eye, from his uniform I'm guessing he was the head porter..... Turned out there was a ticketed luggage room that was pass-coded that sounded a bit more like it. No one told us about any of the hotel facilities, the girl on the desk just told us to read the book in the room. We tried to visit the restaurant once and the guy sent us to the bar for bar snacks, they were nice and reasonably priced mind you. We didn't try any of the other facilities like the computer room, we visited the bar twice and noticed that the prices for our drinks increased by ~20% from friday to saturday (we ordered the same drinks a few times both days). As you walk around the hotel you notice little things that simply suggest that its in need of renovation. The varnish is stratched off the bar, the skirting boards around the mezzanine floor were really yellowed, even the ethernet points (a recent/modern thing?) looked really yellowed. Everything you would see between the front entrance and the desk is immaculate. The toilets were immaculate and the gentleman in the gift shop needs a medal, very nice guy that helped us spend our last few dollars. The hotel has wifi through AT&T, it's very expensive like $15 per day for $70 for five days. I gave up and tried paying for it through my iphone, it wouldn't accept a card outside the USA. There was a feature to bill to my room but they refused to accept my mastercard so I didn't want to rack up stuff on my debit card. When we left the hotel on the final day it was problem free until we went to hail a cab. Now cabs are $45 flat fee to the airport (+tip ofc) so when the doorman of the roosevelt offered us an idle limo for $55 we trusted him. We got to the airport and the limo driver then wanted $70, what are you suppose to do when you're about to get on a plane? If I wasn't dis-satisfied with the hotel so far then that cemented my dis-satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative reviews, it's brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: BungleNorwich
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from new york and the roosevelt hotel. we stayed there from Christmas Day until 30th December. We booked our trip through expedia and cost less than $90 per night. As we arrived check in was very easy, they upgraded our room without asking. Our room had a large bed, desk, chest of drawers with tv on top, built in wardrobe, iron, ironing board etc, reasonable bathroom, bath, shower, toilet, sink. Plenty of room to live in, we didn't feel cramped in at all. If you are expecting or want luxury suites book them in somewhere like the peninsula! We didn't eat in the hotel, expensive! Opposite the hotel is a small coffee shop (Costi) but its ok, if you turn left out of the hotel and walk for 25m, turn right at the junction you will find an outlet of Blake and Todd (outstanding coffee shop for breakfast)) We would definately stay in the hotel again, its has an amazing location 15mins form times square, 3 minutes from grand central station, easy walking to anywhere in midtown. We noticed no problems whilst we were in the hotel, longest we had to wait for a lift was 2 minutes, not bad considering we were on 12th floor! Rooms are all very tidy, well maintained and functional. If you want gold plated taps and toilets then book in at the plaza!! After reading the reviews here I was a little apprehensive on arrival, needless to say I was very relieved as our stay was brilliant and i would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “long weekend”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMI6
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel. Bagels were a 10 minute walk (well worth it) just a few blocks from Times Square - the center of the world :)

Reviews.Title: “1st impression good, then down hill”
Reviews.Author: richards61
Reviews.Content: walked into lobby and it was fabulous then ....they didn't have the interconnecting rooms that we had requested (even though i had emailed them 3 times since the July booking) ended up with connecting room on floor 10 which was the smoking floor (not soo good!) but the rooms were nice beds very comfy....hard to get a space in the bar in the nights in the week, weekend had more room.....not much else to say than it was ok

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: suew50
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great to stay in, the staff were so friendly and the room was clean and the bed was so comfortable, we have no complaints what so ever, we will stay here again if we go back to new york and would highly recommend this hotel. Mr & Mrs Parsons. From the UK

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing find...certainly has the WOW factor”
Reviews.Author: NYC7863
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a 1st class service all round, nothing is too much trouble. We didn't access all services available but those we did, the staff were friendly and very helpful. We stayed at the hotel for 6 days over Christmas, a time we all know to be the busiest of the year, yet staff were always there to help. The lobbly was bright and inviting, the lounge area all festively decorated, was buzzing with activity. Check-in staff greeted us with a smile and porters were on hand to take our bags to our room. The room was spacious and everything we needed was there, even a large flat screen TV. The bed was comfortable (something we all dread about being away from home is sleepness nights) but boy did we sleep well and wake all refreshed. There is pleanty of hot water, soft white towels and lots of complementary soaps, gels and creams. House keeping staff are great, so friendly and polite and they really look after you well. I don't know if all rooms get this, but even our bed was turned down each night along with complimentary chocolates, how special is that! The hotel in right in the center of Mid town Manhattan. Its sits on the corner of E45 St and Maddison Ave, only a stones through from the fantastic Fifth Avenue shops and sights. Its a big beast of a building and takes up a whole block to E46 street. Grand Central Station is only 2 minuites walk away and with an enterance on E45 St, it gives easy access to the subway 4,5 & 6 line. If I had to say something thats sums up the Roosevelt Hotel...it would be to say it offerred us 'the 'Complete package', friendly staff, comfortable, well appointed & affordable rooms, charm and character and if you add in location...you can see why we decided to stay at the Roosevelt New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but nothing soooo special”
Reviews.Author: Amportas
Reviews.Content: I stayed last black-friday-weekend at the Roosevet, and found a nice-looking hotel, mainly because it already had the Christmas ornaments and a tall Christmas tree at the lobby. The room was nice, nothing to complain about the installations. A/C functioning perfectly, safe ok, king size bed with "tens" of pillows, reasonable distance from Times Square. Staff ok, nothing outside the ordinary behavior. My three complaints about the hotel are 1) the hotel charges almost 15 dollars for the wifi connection. That is an absurd compared to the FREE wifi connection of Wellington hotel, which I stayed last July/2009. 2) The subway is a good walk from the hotel, compared to Wellington, which has the subway just under it, literally at the door. 3) I was charged 3 wifi connection day rates, when I asked only 1 day!!!!! An incident that occurred was that on Saturday morning (Nov 28th) I went to the concierge desk and asked for a taxi for the next morning (Nov 29th) at 4AM. Unfortunately the guy delivered the voucher inside an envelope, which, in trust to his good service, I did not check to confirm (neither he showed the voucher to me so we both could confirm it). To my surprise, on Saturday at 4PM the taxi co. employee called me saying the taxi was already waiting for us in front of the hotel. I obviously said my taxi had been asked for the next morning, and the woman said the hotel would charge my for the(ir) mistake. Of course I went in a rage to the concierge desk and said I would not accept them charge me for their mistake, as I had told them the taxi was to 4AM of Sunday, not Saturday. In an excuse he said "but you didn't check your voucher!", and I said "neither you showed it to me so we both could confirm, and you delivered it in a closed envelope, and I didn't look to it in trust to your service!" In the end, the guy said we would not be charged, but I was suspicious until I received my credit card bill. No charge was made beyond the ride I actually made. Also, the exceeding wifi day rates were returned to my credit card bill upon my complaint to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go There”
Reviews.Author: 1lizzym
Reviews.Content: Looks good until you look closely shabby en-suite very small just be glad you did not take your cat, heating broke down for 2 days not ine perrson said sorry it cost a 7 Dollers to get a bowl of soup to warm us up and not even a bread roll Will not stay there again rather pay more for a little more quality and more friendly

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, would go back to stay again”
Reviews.Author: CadburysFlake
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the week before Christmas. It was busy as expected and there were several conferences going on at the same time. The hotel itself was presented well and all the staff were very polite and helpful. The rooms were a decent size considering it was the centre of New York and pretty clean. The beds were reasonably comfortable but a little lumpy. It was nice having a TV and a good warm shower. The rooms were always warm and you could adjust your own heating/air con levels. The hairdryer was useful to have once the burning smell died away! The location of the hotel is fantastic and the major sites and subway is easily accessible. The package we had was room only. We did have breakfast one morning at the hotel, however I would NOT recommend it. It was exceptionally overpriced and the Cosi Cafe over the street did similar for a fraction of the price and the same quality. Also I would recommend getting drinks and snacks away from the hotel shop, that too is very expensive with a bottle of Coke being $4!!!! However I had a great time in NY and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the outside noise”
Reviews.Author: chrssalw
Reviews.Content: When you enter the lobby your taken back to a time of grandure and elligance, and will take you back to days gone by. The staff were friendly and welcoming, and we were seen to straight away. There are six ellivators so we never had to wait long for one, our room had a king bed (very comfy)and the room wasn't a bad size compared to other hotels we have stayed in, in New York. Bathroom was small but serviceable, everything was clean and tidy and the only thing I could say was wrong with the room in what you would expect was no tea/coffee makers. The biggest draw back with the hotel is outside noise, were the hotel is very quite in it's self there is very little sound prooffing to stop the outside noise. Which if anyone has been to New York knows it's can get quite noisey, but on the whole the hotel is well kept and clean. The hotel is very close to Grand central station which makes getting around on the subway very easy, the hotel is also only three short blocks from Time Square and broadway. I had a very good deal on this hotel with Expedia ($100prpn) but I wouldn't want to pay the normal rack rate which would make it over rated. So if I was to sum up this hotel I would say it was a very nice and clean and comfy hotel at the right price, but shame about the outside noise you can hear.

Reviews.Title: “One word to describe this place - Dank.”
Reviews.Author: SaraE917
Reviews.Content: Do not let the lobby fool you - the second you step off of the elevators, the dankness hits you. The rooms are very old and in desperate need of repair. The carpet was moist and sticky, the bed linens were thin and shoddy and the shower was loaded with mold. I did not get a good night's sleep at this hotel and I will definitely not be back.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: DougCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel was well positioned and within walking distance of the places we wanted to visit. We had reservations to see the Lion King on Broadway and it was a short walk to the show. The Hotel was typical NY and we loved it, the service wass great and the room comfortable. We stayed for three nights and did not have a chance to try the restaurants so I cannot comment. I would recommend the Roosevelt the perfect Hotel for those visitors who want to see the sites without spending hours in taxis and traffic, we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Triptaker76
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel is gorgeous, and a drink in the bar is relaxed and enjoyable. I would recommend going to Blake and Todd, a cafe bar across the road serving breakfast, sandwitches etc. at great prices. The location of the hotel is excellent. We were put into a room with 2 double beds, which were quite small (we are not good sleepers at the best of times). We asked to be moved to a room with a kingsize bed, which they offered with no problem. The bed was really comfy, the room basic, but a very good size compared to most hotel rooms in NY. There was a large TV with numerous channels. The staff were very friendly and we had a great holiday. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveleriowa
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Roosevelt Hotel for 4 nights in October 2009. We booked through Priceline for $150.00 per night. We requested an upgrade to a king size bedded room and they honored our request. The lobby is very elegant and the room was a decent size. The bed was very comfortable. We asked for a refrigerator and they brought a small one for no additional charges. The staff were very friendly and helpful and check in and check out was a breeze. I highly recommend this hotel for a stay in New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Go for the location, not the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Indy2299
Reviews.Content: Lobby and downstairs rooms are very nice, good state of repair. However, the bedroom we stayed in was very poor and in real need of redecorating. Carpet was ripped, ceiling / walls were stained from water damage. On the first morning it took 45 minutes to run 3 inches of water in the bath!! This was fixed, however they could not fix the very noisy air conditioning, which we had to switch off as couldnt sleep, then the room became so hot and we went in December!! Beds were comfy and clean linen. Bathroom cleanliness not impressive at all and like the bedroom, very tired and dated. The location was great and compensated for some of the above, although would not stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and not as bad as I thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: lazza999
Reviews.Content: I won this through Priceline for $150 a night from Nov 4-11th, and after winning was a little worried after reading the reviews here. But overall I enjoyed my stay here, and got the room for well under 50% of the rack rate. Checking in was quick and easy, and the staff were helpful in directing me to a few local shops (there is a Duane Reade drug store right around the corner, perfect for all the things you might need) The room was pretty big for a NYC room, with 2 beds, a desk and plenty of room of bags and shopping!! I didn't notice any bedbugs, but did actually watch a news report on the outbreak in the city so overall the rooms were clean. I didn't like the bed covers, they had these horrible gold blankets at the end of the bed, but they were holey and gross, so I pulled them off and dumped them in a corner for my stay. The location was great, close enough to Times Square without the craziness outside your door, and really close to 5th Ave shops (a little too close for my credit card!). I'd recommend this to friend and I'd stay here again as long as I got it at this price, but I think next time I hit NYC I'll stay downtown and investigate another area.

Reviews.Title: “Old rooms, beautiful public space, warm service”
Reviews.Author: ravtrav
Reviews.Content: Had stayed there before many years ago. Rooms plainly furnished though flat screen TV was good. No frills, but "cozy double" was bigger than expected. Great location!!! Easy subways - just cross street to Grand Central. Coffee, etc. across the street at COSI in a.m. Personnel were welcoming and friendly and serviceable (you get back what you send out in NY). We'd stay there again, particularly as it was low priced for December in Manhattan. Pleasantly surprised provided we didn't expect new furniture and decor.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing rooms, maid service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: HopeRocks
Reviews.Content: To begin with let me say that I do a lot of travelling both for business and for pleasure so i've stayed in many levels and types of accomodations from 5 + star to 2 star in small towns so I am comparing this hotel to a wide range. Also I have never written a review before but want to save others a negative experience. My adult daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights. When we arrived we were told the room that we ordered and pre-paid was not available so we were placed in a sub-standard room. It was small, not clean --bathroom floor needed washing, rugs needed at least a shampoo if not replacing, the lamp shades were torn, dried nail polish on the desk, and it did not have a full complement of towels. I called down and had them bring towels up. The room was on the innner court so heard a humming of machinery all night. The next day I asked to be moved and they gave us the room we had ordered -- it was bigger and on the outside also had better lamps etc. Still the carpet needed replacing as it did throughout the hotel. I had to call down each day fro towels as they always left some out -- eitjher face clothes, hand towels ot bath towels. The water pressure was poor and there were no glass cups only paper cups. The maid did not clean the ice bucket out, not remove the wine glasses that we had used (I asked for some to be brought up). All in all it was dissapointing and still not inexpensive. Even the furniture in the lobby was dirty and worn. At one time I suppose this was an opulent littlehotel -- not any more. THe desk clerk told me that it has not been renovated for ten years. That is a long time in New York. Don't stay here. The best thing about it is its location -- close to Grand Central Teminal (which is beautiful by the way) and the little clothing shop in the entrance. Also internet service is $15 a day but I understand that is true in other hotels as well. The bathrooms have a pedistal sink and the first room the sink was cracked.

Reviews.Title: “The price was right”
Reviews.Author: 505badgolfer
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel as a result of blind bidding on Priceline. I paid $155 + taxes per night. The advertised rack rate on the hotel's website is $400 per night. Good midtown east locale. A bargain at $155 per night but not at $400 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Money Stolen”
Reviews.Author: Kellly22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt NewYork hotel from the 19th November till the 23rd of November, we went out the first day and when we came back to our room both of our money was missing $900 in total had been taken from our room. Apart from that the hotel was nice clean and in a brilliant location close to most things.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely organized,efficient and value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: rod4849
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed for four nights from the28th Nov to 2nd Dec and found this an excellent hotel in a superb location that offered us everything we required for a most enjoyable holiday possible The room was superb, the location brilliant, the staff dedicated and amenities wonderful. There was pior mention of slow lifts, so whats the rush we are on holiday

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JIMTDR
Reviews.Content: I woke up with red welts on my back. They moved me to a new room and offered me free breakfast. That it! I have never experienced this before and sincerely hope it never happens to me again.

Reviews.Title: “Family and Fun”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyO3
Reviews.Content: Its a great hotel and its located in a great area with nice views and a nice clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great If you want to stay @ Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Maruji80
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't be better located in NYC: 100 mts from 5 Av and 200 from central Station, you can go walking to Broadway and to the central Park! The service is not great, when we arrived having our room for three already booked and paid they wanted to give us a smoking room or a 1 bed room for three.... after talking some time they gave us what we have paid for! The room was comfortable and clean. If I come back to NYC I won't stay @ midtown but if I had to....I would go back to roosevelt for the price benefit value.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for a reasonably clean hotel experience, this is NOT for you.”
Reviews.Author: RSI1981
Reviews.Content: Although I read some bad reviews about The Roosevelt, I thought I would give it a try considering its location and what I thought was a reasonable deal at the time from Priceline. My room was terrible. The entrance and lobby look decent enough, but my room as small and extremely dirty. The curtains were moldy, no, not the shower curtains, but the drapes in my room! I'm not surprised because the the room was very stuffy and humid. There is no thermostat, just an ancient wall fan with "cool" and "warm" options, which by the way, is very loud. Also, the mirror hanging on my bathroom door was covered in greasy white spots (I still have no idea what it was)... Disgusting! What kind of cleaning staff doesn't wipe down mirrors? The carpet was worn and dirty and the bathroom smelled very dank. The tub was old and had deep scratches across the surface. Worst of all, my bed smelled like urine... I am NOT exaggerating here. To top things off, something in the room aggravated my allergies and I was up sneezing and sniffling all night. Did I mention the view, or lack thereof? The only good thing about this place was the location. I thought I got a good deal on Priceline, but I would not stay there again even if someone paid me. Frankly, I expect more from a 3.5 star hotel. I wouldn't mind the small room and paper thin walls, especially because this is an old hotel, but management should make an effort to make their rooms reasonably clean...

Reviews.Title: “quality vrs price, I would give it a F F F F”
Reviews.Author: jackrabbit1
Reviews.Content: Do not use the concierge for broadway tickets. We were charged double the price. There is no comp of anything. The room is antiquated, analog tv, tiny, tiny bathroom. No coffee in room but may purchase @ restaurant for $4.50 a cup. I will never stay there again. A/C was unsat, hole in carpet. Lobby and location was great. jerryenmon@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Mid-Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: ohiofluffy
Reviews.Content: My sister & I just returned from NYC. We stayed at the Roosevelt--GOOD CHOICE!! Prior to our visit to NYC, we heard about the" bed bug" scare, so we decided to call & inquire about it before our visit. We were assured at that time there was not a problem at the hotel. The gentleman we spoke with was very kind & informative. He also upgraded our rm. to the hospitality suite-at no extra charge. We were not disappointed when we arrived. The rm. was everything that was promised & more { with no bedbugs} The location was the best- we were within walking distance to almost everywhere we wanted to go. Can't wait to go back. Hope to stay in the same rm.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ThelmaZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel for 5 nights and I can honestly not fault it at all. Its in such a great location being 1 block from 5th Avenue and right on Madison Avenue. The room was spotless and quite spacious, contrary to what I have read previously about 'box rooms'! The staff were more than helpful especially as the hotel was extremely busy. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yiannis2002s
Reviews.Content: 3.5/5 +In the heart of NY! +Clean Rooms, comfortable beds -Very small rooms -Expensive -Expensive charges (wifi, roomservice etc)

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel.”
Reviews.Author: timlowe1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 11/15 to 11/17 on business. The hotel is worn, but clean. The rooms were nothing special, but the bed was comfortable. The hotel was very busy, and the bar was busy each evening. For a business trip it was fine, although the internet was slow, and the location was great. I would not stay here for a vacation, though.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST PERFECT!!”
Reviews.Author: caz123456
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the Roosevelt on the 2nd November with my boyfriend. After reading some of the negative comments on here I was quite honestly dreading our stay but from what I experienced the hotel definatly has more pros than cons. When we arrived at the hotel check in was quick and professional. I asked if it would be possible to get an upgrade and was given a suite free of charge which was huge!! The lobby area is beautiful and spotless. The rooms are dated and although the maids came every day to clean there were little things that let them down. Our shower head was loose there was a plug sockett hanging from the wall and there were some blinds in the dressing area that were covered in dust. On the positive side the bed was really comfy we had 2 plasma tvs one in the bed area and one in the living room area and nice comfy sofa. From what we experienced the service at the hotel was 2nd to none every request we had was delt with in a proffsional and friendly manor and quickly too, My boyfriend forgot his razor so the hotel arranged for some complimentry disposables to be brought to the room including shaving foam! The doorman was always on hand to flag down taxis and on our last day the hotel stored our luggage for us without any issue. We only ordered room service once and was delicious!! as with most hotels it was a little pricey but when you compare it with New York prices it's not that different really!! The location of the hotel is FANTASTIC!! we walked everywhere!! It's 2 mins away from Grand Central Station, about 10 mins from times square and The Empire State Building and Rockerfeller Centre are a short distance on foot. It's just on 5th Ave so all the shoppings on your door step and it took about 15 mins to walk to Maceys and 20 mins to Bloomingdales. The only time we took a cab anywhere was to get down to Battery Park for the Ferry to Liberty and Ellis Island. All in all the hotel is definalty worth a visit if you get a bargain. It's classic dated style was fine for us but if you like modern contempery hotels with wow factor rooms it's probably not the place for you. We're quite easy going but I can see for more fussier travllers how the rooms could be a sore point however I can't see how anyone could fault the service.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for the great deal I got on priceline”
Reviews.Author: Noreen28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were determined to find a decent hotel (3*) for under $200 a night for our November 4-7 stay in NYC, and we found it at the Roosevelt. Like the others who've commented here, the lobby is still a gem after all these years. Really, really beautiful. And like the others who've commented on the rooms, we weren't overly impressed. BUT, and this is a big but....the room was clean, functional and the bed was comfortable. At the end of the day, that's really all I care about. Yes, the toilet had to be flushed two, three times. Yes, the room was bare, fairly small, had no coffeemaker or mini fridge, the curtains over the AC unit were dirty and needed washing...but again, the major stuff was fine. Everyone we came into contact with was very pleasant, even went out of their way for us. So keep in mind, the few customer service glitches you are reading here are far outnumbered by the good or excellent service received by the hundreds of people who stay in this hotel and don't leave a review. I would recommend this hotel, unless you want upscale accomodation and are willing to pay for it. P.S. You can get free wi-fi in your room if you have AT&T as your cellphone service provider.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: Rozzz
Reviews.Content: We loved the Roosevelt. Walking distance to Times Sq, U N buildings, and the Empire State building. Our room was clean and quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The foyer was gorgeous and took you back in time to another glamorous era. Lifts were great and quick. Great price. We went from here to stay in Greenwich Village for a few nights. A great combination of places to stay in NY

Reviews.Title: “37 bucks for a club sandwich??? What the...”
Reviews.Author: tummah2
Reviews.Content: There are hundreds, maybe thousands, of hotels in NYC and this one is not the one you should stay at. Rooms are tiny, rooms have absolutely no view (I stayed on the top floor--should have had a view of something), food is 4x more expensive than what it should cost (a club sandwich cost me $37), and the internet should be free (it's $15/day. I could go across the street to the coffee shop and get free internet or I can stay at the Roosevelt, pay $300 to stay the night and still have to pay $15 to use the internet.). The bellhops beg for tips and the waiter who delivered my room service practically stole the tip i gave him because he did not tell me he my room service bill already included an 18% gratuity and a $4.50 "service charge". Do not stay here unless you have some extra cash you just want to throw in the trash.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - don't worry about the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: 4HolerPoler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt for four nights; was slightly concerned at the mixed reviews but am very pleasantly surprised - front-desk staff were great, room is large and in good shape. Good value for money Concierge staff were as good as it gets - Christine helped me with a number of issues and is a credit to the hotel. As long as a I can get a reservation I know where I'll be staying in NYC in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... But Hotel Needs A Complete Renovation”
Reviews.Author: 04bat
Reviews.Content: Having read many mixed reviews on the Roosevelt I was quite unsure what to expect when we arrived at the hotel. We stayed at the Roosevelt for 5 nights and booked a standard double room, but sent an email to the hotel requesting a room with two double beds. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a nice open airy lobby with fresh flowers on the table and smiles at the door from the bell boys, however no one offered to take our luggage for us. When we got to the check in desk, the staff were friendly and helpful but had somehow messed up the booked and stated that we were only booked in for 3 nights, however when she checked the system again she realised she was looking instead at a reservation in 2010 (very strange I know, and I hope they havnt got us booked in for then!) It was rectified quickly and she apologised and we were given a room on the seventh floor with a view of the street on Madison Avenue. The rooms are a very good size, and the beds are quite comfy however they do not know how to make a bed properly and do not have bedding that actually fits the beds! The wallpaper as many have described and the decor of the rooms is somewhat tired and does have the look of nursing home style! There was a nice TV with cable channels and an air conditioning unit however we didn’t touch it! The bathrooms were by far the most tired feature of the rooms, with the shower head not stuck to the wall properly and a bath that would not hold water for any length of time as well as the sink as the plug allowed it to drain. We didn’t experience any of the 'brown water' cases as others suggested and always had hot water. There are 6 lifts in the hotel, but you can be waiting a little time for them. The longest we had to wait for one was 5 mins and this was on our last day. We never eat in the hotel, tried breakfast their once at the Starbucks, would not recommend it, but good if you have no idea where to go on your first day. There is if you are unsure where to eat on your first night, a great Italian restaurant called 'Naples 45,' which is reasonably priced and great food! Overall the hotel did what we needed it to do. We got the hotel at a great price on Expeida, but if I had paid the £1300 the room would have cost if I had booked direct with the hotel, then I would not be happy. We were hardly in the hotel much only to sleep and come back to in the afternoon for a rest, so if that is all your looking for and you get it at a good price, then yes, the Roosevelt would be a fine option.... it was clean, and had all the amenities we needed, however if you are looking for something a bit more, and are bothered about the tired looks and stained carpets in the hall ways etc then I would look to stay somewhere else. If the hotel were to have a complete renovation then this hotel could be amazing! Just a bit of TLC is needed, but I think due to the sheer size of the hotel (1000+ rooms) it is too big for the staff to care for it, or for them to update it. eg. at the bell boys desk there were 7 members of staff all doing the same job when 3 could have done it easily. If you need a hotel that is in a great location with rooms that a comfortable and not bothered about eating there then the Roosevelt would be suitable.

Reviews.Title: “an awful experience”
Reviews.Author: murphysam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Roosevelt hotel.We were on honeymoon and New York was our last stay. We regret booking this hotel. I cannot say one good thing about our time in the hotel/ Our room was like a match box. The sockets on the wall had all burnt marks on them. When I went to iron my clothes the iron fell apart and burnt myself. And it took 12 hours to get another one,even after explaining what happened and asking for one five times thoughout the day. The staff were very rude and very unprofessional.and no ways helpful. I did not expect to be treated like this especially on my honeyroom and I still feel very angry about my experience here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: schnauzerpepper
Reviews.Content: Recently had a 4 night stay, read many reviews on here and was concerend to the point of nearly cancelling. Glad i didnt, hotel was great, good location, friendly staff, nice size rooms and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CataA3
Reviews.Content: We have nothing to complain about. Roomy room decorated in an american taste that is not correspondent with our own but I guess carpets are found in every NY hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you get a great deal on the rate...”
Reviews.Author: Paul99501
Reviews.Content: For a bid of $180 per night, Priceline put me at the Roosevelt for a 6-night business trip. And for that price, it was just fine, but there's no way I would pay the rack rate of $300+ per night to stay here. There was nothing horrible about it, and there was plenty that was good. My room was huge, with 2 queen beds and a huge walk-in closet. It was by far the biggest hotel room I have ever had in Manhattan. The employees were friendly and helpful. The location was good, just a few feet from Grand Central and an easy walk to Times Square, 5th Ave, etc. But the place felt dated and creaky. The elevators were slow. The room air conditioning system made a lot of noise but not much cool air. The toilet flushed reluctantly and the shower drain was also cranky. One morning I took a shower and the water was warm, but would not get hot. And they charge $15 a day for wireless internet which I think is outright gouging. I would stay here again as long as I was paying under $200 a night, but not more than that.

Reviews.Title: “I would never recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: blossom365
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel on a recent trip to NYC. I have stayed at several other 3 1/2 and 4 star hotels in Manhattan and I have never had such a bad experience. Upon check in we went to our room (which was a requested non-smoking room) and the room smelled of smoke. Not just a faint smell but an intense cloud of cigarette smoke. We complained to the front desk and or room was moved. Our new room had a problem with the hot water heater and even after maintenance "fixed" the problem we only got a hot shower one out of the three nights we stayed there. During our second night, my sister discovered a crusty yellow stain on the bed sheets. Overall I would never recommend this hotel to anyone who was visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: parisnoir
Reviews.Content: i held a major black tie gala event at the Roosevelt and was very pleased with the customerservice and attentiveness of the staff. we wanted to have a 3 course meal served to over 300 people within one hour before the speaking part of our program. They executed this flawlessly, with attentiveness and courtesy. We did not feel rushed at all. When there were little issues, not one staff person said it was not their job to handle it. Everyone took responsibility to make sure this flowed. They know how to handle big groups and they do it with style.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy, But Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelgurl2
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal from hotels.com for our trip in August. We had a double queen room - and the rooms were fine. Nothing fancy, but clean and large for NYC. The lobby is impressive and the hotel staff is not overly friendly, but helpful when pressed. The best part of staying here was the location. We didn't spend much time in our rooms, since we traversed the city from dawn to midnight, so for our purposes the Roosevelt was a good choice. Not five-star accomodations, but good nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “While the hotel has made some improvements, I would not stay here”
Reviews.Author: wallingfordtravels
Reviews.Content: Although the entrance and lobby pay tribute to it's historic attributes, don't be fooled. The Roosevelt Hotel does not quite measure up to industry standards. I will recognize the bell staff and bar waiter for their attentive service - but it stops there. One of my colleagues rooms was not ready until 7:30pm in the evening and was told there was 'no place to change clothes' I was originally checked into an accessible room - with no fixed shower head. I asked to move but was told I'd have to wait another day even though there were plenty of rooms ready when I first arrived. I also had to re-pack all my belongings and store with the bell stand yet again - frustrating when you are in town for business. I was not alerted that I even had this room type to begin with. The pillows in the rooms have pointed ends on all fours - I woke up one morning with a large scratch down the side of my face. It was red and cut up enough for my colleagues to notice the next morning. Although food in New York is expensive, $30 for oatmeal and coffee seemed extreme. Maids do not knock before entering a room and they are quick to enter between 8am-8:30am so make sure you have your deadbolt locked. I also had trouble understanding the English from some of the employees- including two bell man. Elevators- it is impossible to get one to not stop at every floor. It seems every time you need to go to your room, they are always busy. Though this is trivial, it became rather annoying being in the 14th floor and having 5 stops or more every time I had to use one. Lastly when I was packing up the day before I left, I noticed a small 'pebble dropping' on the bed comforter. Not sure where that came from, but I'd rather not know. From what I've heard, this hotel had improved quite a bit from where it was last year, but by no means does it even compare to staying at an average Holiday Inn. Rooms were advertised at $299 per night, but I honestly I wouldn't hesitate spending the extra $30-$50 per night to get a much higher level of accommodation and service. You will thank yourself later.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: joshiajay
Reviews.Content: Scored the hotel on priceline for $185 a night. They were very nice. They gave us a room with 2 double beds, a fridge and gave us a crib for our baby without any hassle. Room was reasonable size for NYC. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be fooled by the beautiful lobby, the rooms are awfull and overpriced. Avoid unless desperate.”
Reviews.Author: bambino0
Reviews.Content: We were VERY disappointed with this hotel. After telling friends that we were finishing our 5 week tour of Europe with 3 nights in a Luxury New York hotel we arrived at the Roosevelt to find a hotel that is a shadow of its former self and incredibly overpriced. Our poor experience (after looking forward to our stay) started with our arrival. Not only did the 3 door staff not offer so much as a welcome or a smile, but they failed to even hold the door open for us or even offer to help us with our bags. The lobby was quite beautiful but that is where the class and attention to detail ends. After seeing the aged hallway to our room I instantly knew we had been ripped off. The room itself was old with worn carpets, peeling paint/wallpaper, a musty/moldy smell, ancient air conditioners and a bathroom from the 70's. This place needs a total overhaul. Not only were the rooms on par with budget accommodation, there was no wifi internet (just 2 computers in the lobby that were very expensive), no included breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Charm and location, but expect problems with the room”
Reviews.Author: gwnetapp
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times and I will return. But I've learned to check my expectations in the totally charming lobby. Good: Location, lobby and bar. Totally 'Old New York' Not so good: The air con has been on the heritage list since 1980 and hasn't been serviced since then. You'll complain and a totally charming service guy will make some soothing gestures. But it will continue to noisily blow air at room temperature throughout your stay. The wiring dates from the Roosevelt era. You'll try in vain to plug in your iPhone charger AND your laptop. And the $14.95 internet connection runs at the speed of Clinton era dial-up modems. The bathroom will have at least one of the following issues (and I've seen them all): no hot water, toilet won't flush; toilet runs constantly, tub won't drain. There will be sundry bits of room trim hanging. Do not order food here. Walk a block in any direction instead. But the beds are comfy, the staff are nice and pretend to fix your issues. And I'm a sucker for the 'Old New York' schtick. So I go back.

Reviews.Title: “More cons than pros”
Reviews.Author: my_red_ruby_slippers
Reviews.Content: Walked into impressive lobby and got checked in. Upgraded to a standard double which was an adequate size (cosy queen must be tiny!). Room is dated and in need of refurbishment. Bit smelly, but clean and tidy except for the odd exposed wire connecting the lamp into the wall and the bathroom door not closing properly. The air conditioning unit kept us awake for much of the first night. Tried switching it off and opening the window - but street noise was just as bad. Next morning requested that the air con unit was fixed. Had to complain again when we returned to the hotel later that afternoon as still not repaired. Engineer came up and replaced the unit within the hour. On last day checked out with no problem. Asked a member of staff if the hotel would look after the bags whilst we enjoyed our last day, he then proceeded to make 2 phone calls before passing us onto a colleague - rude. On returning to the hotel to collect the bags the doorman found one, but then I had to go into the room to find the other 2 as they had not been stowed together. All in all the hotel was not worth the money we paid. We have previously stayed at Club Quarters at The Rockafeller Center which put The Roosevelt to shame and was a fraction of the cost. Don't be fooled by the impressive pictures on the website - this needs to be refurbished!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: TamTexas
Reviews.Content: Lobby is very nice, front desk & staff not very friendly, but OK. Room is little small for a cozy double, double, OK bath. Grand central terminal right across the street, Time Square, Rockectfeller, United Nations withing walking distance. If you need breakfast go to "Pizza shop" at 5th Ave, then turn left, pretty good. NY always a nice place to visit this is our 3rd time in the city & we still have a lot of places to go for next trip. On weekend door to Grand central is closed so you need to enter from Park Ave next to Michael Jordan Steak House.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaByron
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the Roosevelt at 45 th and Madison . The location is great . Very close to Grand Central ,and Times Square . The rooms very large for N. Y . We had 2 queen beds. . with lots of room . The bathroom could use some freshing . The wall paper needs fixing The fitness room on the 2nd floor is open 24/7 , and free of charge .The staff were very friendly, and helpful. We took the bus to LGA for only $12.00. each .This sure beats a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - do not go there.”
Reviews.Author: FelliniBermuda
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate experience of staying at this Hotel with a food and wine group. I was supposed to stay for four nights. I left after one! The security lock on the door of the room - when I finally got into it - was broken off, it looked as if it had been forced at some point, and the wood of the door itself was so rotten that it would not hold the screws when maintenance came to replace it. Basic amenities like a shower cap for instance where non existent. The quilt on the bed had been washed and the filling had gone lumpy. When I returned to my room later in the evening after supper there were strange people hanging around the corridors of my floor - obviously not going to or coming from the elevators. Then to top it all off when I awoke the following morning the entire room was without electricity!! The room was never serviced whilst I was there. My friends who were also staying awoke on their final morning to find they had no running HOT WATER. The staff were rude and could not care less - and forget about using the bellhops for luggage or getting cabs they did not want to know.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to offer but location!”
Reviews.Author: CTfoodieCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with a large group in town for a food and wine event. Our room was labeled deluxe and was marginal at best. Small, with a stained and noisy air-conditioner, stained carpeting, questionable bedding, a loose bed frame that almost catapulted my husband to the wall, torn lampshades and a tiny, uncomfortable bathroom with a very hard to work shower control. I talked with two others in our group whose rooms were so bad (roaches in one, and no electricity in the other!) that they changed hotels. Sunday morning was impossible -- 15-20 minute waits for the elevator, with very long lines at the bell desk and front desk. Too bad this hotel has never had a lot of people scheduled to check out at one time before, so they would know how to staff accordingly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Stayed in in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Authentictravel09
Reviews.Content: I took my staff up to NYC for a show as part of a business trip and we booked 3 rooms for 2 nights. When I first visited their website I thought we had made a great selection considering the location and the pictures of the hotel - don't be fooled! The customer service at this hotel was non-existent. My first problem was trying to PAY for a room upgrade. I emailed them a copy of my CC and a CC authorization form - they acknowledged they got it. When I saw the card had not been charged I called to ask about the upgrade I was PAYING for. They snipped that I had simply made a "request." I reiterated that no, I had submitted the authorization form for the charges. They said they didn't get it - despite the fact I have an email from them saying they did receive it. So I sent it again and they finally charged the card - 4 phone calls later. When I arrived at the hotel they tried to charge me AGAIN. One of my staff members woke up to find a cock roach the size of a mosaic tile on the bathroom floor. They called down to the front desk and someone came and "removed" it - but where there's one roach there are more....they moved them to another room. The next night there was a wedding and a big party of some sort going on. There were people in the hallways running up and down and screaming obscenities. People were obviously intoxicated. I understand it's NYC on a Saturday so I didn't pay any mind to it. HOWEVER, when a very rude security officer banged on our door when we were doing nothing but sitting and talking (no tv, no music playing and our group was sober) and told us they had had 2 complaints about us and that if we didn't stop laughing he would "escort us off the property" I was appalled. The staff member who answered the door was in tears. He made no apology for her being upset - he said he was doing his job and he would "do it again." When I stepped into the hallway to go back to my room I could hear all the rooms around us with people talking and laughing. I do not understand why we were singled out. Much less, my other staff complained that the running up and down the hall that people were doing kept them awake all night. Security didn't seem to threaten to escort them off of the property. The next morning, it took us THIRTY minutes to catch an elevator. This hotel has over 1000 rooms and has 6 elevators! During peak times you're wait is atrocious! When we asked a staff member if we could use their elevator just so we could check out (we were on the 16th floor - luggage is not something we could drag down that many steps) they just shook their head and walked away. The rooms are TINY - smallest I've ever seen! Overall, I think this is probably the worst hotel stay I have had in a very long time. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: forkrisf
Reviews.Content: Got a great price for Friday and Saturday night stay recently on Hotwire. This hotel is beautiful. Room was great, nice size, linens and pillows were plush. Water pressure in the shower was unbelievable and hot, that alone makes this a 4 star hotel in my book. Wonderful location, staff was happy and helpful. Bar in lobby had Hendrick's gin what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price. Central to everything.”
Reviews.Author: NOSTRANO
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a trade tasting in Mid-town and chose the hotel for location vs. price without checking on TA first. We arrived early, checked in at the desk as the bellman had to check our bags for no rooms ready at that time. We returned several hours later to find a ling of 15 persons waiting to get checked in and was told that altghough we had 'checked-in' previously, we would have to get back in line and wait our turn to be assigned a key and room number. I found this unexceptible that the bellman had not been given a key for a room and that the bags were not checked into the room accordingly. Most top-notch hotels would have this as a standard mode of handling an early check-in when a room were not available. The upshot of my complaint to the bellman was a key which produced a handicap room which sufficed just fine. The room was clean and large enough if not a bit spartan. For the price and the location it all worked fine for this quick business trip. I'd return for a stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “grand entrance, rooms weel below average”
Reviews.Author: flyfifer11
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in sept. hotel entrance was grand & looked fantastic. Our first room was in a poor state, air conditioning unit was like an old tractor, stains on the carpet & the bathroom was all black & mouldy. we had to stay in that room overnight as no other rooms were available. moved to another room the next day and was a little better. No bath, just a shower but again the shower area grout was all black & mouldy & the toilet pan was cracked. Again no other rooms avail. One Bellhop was only intent on getting a tip even though the cases were still in the same place that i had left them. His atitude was terrible. On the good side the hotel is in a very good location in New york.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice, Great Deal, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSalters
Reviews.Content: Upscale and within a minutes walk of Grand Central Station! Very close to 5th Avenue and within walking distance of Times Square. Very quiet and relaxing this hotel brings a new feel to the hustle and bustle of New York City. The service was excellent and the rooms were cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: rowdyburns22
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to New York on a business trip and stayed at this hotel. My room was kind of small, but it's New York and that's simply how most hotels are. The bed was fine, and I liked the LG flat screen tv. I had some problems with the shower, as the knob would have to be turned barely on and in the cold position to produce hot water. The AC unit worked fine when on high, but was extremely loud when placed on low. There was no fridge or coffee maker in the room. I noticed catching an elevator was consistently a problem, especially after 9am. Be ready to wait 5 minutes just to get an elevator. The location is pretty good which is a bonus. But all in all, there are better places to stay in the same general area. I do not think I'd spend my own money to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Lobby + Front Desk Staff Won Me Over"”
Reviews.Author: danacara
Reviews.Content: I've been a NYC girl for years and I still find the lobby jaw-dropping. It is gorgeous, and the location is second to none for Manhattan - about as perfectly central as you can be. Doris at the Front Desk is spectacular and took great care of me. The bartenders at the lobby bar are charming as heck (they've been at it a while and the jokes don't get old ... ha) The usual cons: The rooms are small (welcome to NY); the elevators are slow (welcome to NY); the heat and AC are from the dark ages (welcome to NY); the only thing they could really legitimately use is regrouting of the showers. But the rest is fine, and priced incredibly reasonably considering that it's sitting on 45th + Mad.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price!”
Reviews.Author: laneycakes
Reviews.Content: Overall for what we paid this hotel was great. We got a special summer deal for a 4 night stay - we paid $139 a night plus tax. That included a voucher for breakfast per day (value of $10 a day). We had a non smoking twin on a high-ish floor (can't remember which one!) that overlooked the street to the front of the hotel. The beds were big and comfy, the room was clean, and the bathroom was good. yes its a bit worn at the edges and the lifts are really slow but lets face it you're in NYC! who wants to spend ages in the room! all you need is a clean comfy room to grab some rest before another great day shopping and sightseeing! The lobby is amazing too - very old grandeur! If i could get the same price again i'd definately stay here. its really close to grand central, a 10 min walk to times square and overall a good stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is infested with bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: misskittens
Reviews.Content: please beware. we stayed at the Roosevelt and brought home a house full of bed bugs! we are infested and have to throw out all of our matresses and spend thousands of dollar to replace them and well as having out whole house treated, it is Horrible. do not stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: dellasaffy
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels I've ever visited. Truly awful. We were first shown our room which was on a "non-smoking" floor, but the entire floor (5th) reeked of smoke. It was also so tiny we could hardly walk around the bed .We requested an upgrade and had to pay $80/ night for the pleasure. The decor of the rooms is what I would call "nursing home style" with what seems to be plastic pink walls, not even wallpaper. The light bulbs have all been replaced with flourescent energy saving ones - which is a nice gesture for their wallets and the environment, but there's a happy medium that they did not strike. These were bottom of the barrel and the lampshades weren't big enough to cover them, so the overall effect was of an interrogation room. There was no cable TV, so we had fuzzy TV reception. There's no coffee maker, so we paid $54 for a medium pot of coffee and two orders of toast in the morning. And as the title suggests, the piece de resistance was the 3-inch cockroach that scuttled across the institution-like bathroom floor and clung to the plastic shower curtain. Luckily my boyfriend was with me because killing cockroaches isn't something I like to do before important business meetings. If you can do anything at all to avoid this hotel, please do. It's horrid.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Old Lady”
Reviews.Author: TravelNYSF
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times for business a few years ago--mostly because of the location and value. Nothing special too close to my office to beat. I stopped because many other hotels midtown NY soon had better rates and more comfortable rooms. I tried again and--while the hotel has a wonderful history and is a beloved friend to many, I'm sorry-- she is a tired old lady. Everything is worn, the front desk staff (at least those I experienced, granted it was an after midnight arrival) cool and dressed in cheap suits, the elevators worn out, hallways depressing and then the room--with its torn lampshades, extension cords and rattling old AC unit--for what? $389 a night? Old bathrooms, just plain defunct and worn out. I hear some rooms were rennovated--my advice is to keep going. I don't see the value or reason to stay in the crowded rusty old relic. If you're coming to NY--don't buy in to the hype of this hotel. Meet someone under the clock--and they go check in somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovation!”
Reviews.Author: TAMemberCt
Reviews.Content: This grand old hotel has been restored beautifully. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “I am sorry Roosevelt staff I seem to have disturbed your day...”
Reviews.Author: yadgiry
Reviews.Content: trip - Business. Location handy and pretty centralNice foyer Overall stay not so great: o Breakfast below average $25 - fruit flies coated fresh fruits, if its not included in the rate then there are lots of great places nearby that are worth the trying instead. Disappointing if you are on business since you need the convienence of the hotel breakfast. o Rooms - clean but very SMALL, and noisey. (not enough room to open suitcase easily) bathroom exceptionally small and a lack lustre shower. If your over 5.6ft forget a comfortable shower, lots of crouching required - and I have a slim build! Noisey - The AC unit was LOUD....hotel unable to do anything about it.....sorry I meant couldn't be bothered o Spoke to reception who said no rooms were available unless I was willing to pay an upgrade! (which means empty rooms existed...just not for someone whose booking and monies thay already had!!!)not what you would expect from this level of hotel found the attitude unhelpful - you could see my problem - they need to prewarn guests about the exact size of their 'cozy' rooms and that they are noisey and those that are not fit for purpose should be made part of a 'special deal' not a standard rate! Stayed a week - so surprised that another room was not available. On the whole - lucky to be on business and not pleasure (since this minimised the time drastically at the hotel) Next trip to NY having having stayed at the belevedre and sofitel will be looking to stay there instead, both similairish in location much better service and after the jet lag, sleepless in need of revival!!!! Its a long time since I have had to give a bad review to a hotel, disappointed to have to have done so today, if the hotel experience if part of your holiday / business experience then I wouldn't recommend this hotel.If you simply want a bed somewhere convienent and happy to tolerate noise, unattentive staff, slow lifts and pay a premium for the pleasure go-ahead. Personally, I felt as if I was a huge unconvience getting in the way of staff who simply were not there for customers. I read some of the favourable reviews and wondered wether there are two roosevelts that look the same ...and I had checked into the wrong one!!! since my experience was not relflected here at all. Also one of my collegues was triple charges on parking....

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MHTruett
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is a beautiful old hotel with a grand lobby. The rooms are small like many New York hotel. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The staff is polite and attentive. Only issue I had was with the slow elevator system. The Roosevelt is in a location – steps from Grand Central Station and just a few blocks from Time Square or the NY Public Library.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent loaction”
Reviews.Author: ladym03
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally located for many of the major attractions, lovely hotel one or two minor issues on the whole what you expect for a very busy New York hotel. Would happily recommend this hotel and even more important would def. stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!! Extremely elegant hotel...”
Reviews.Author: VLGNj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel on Sept. 6th and 7th to celebrate our 25th anniversary. We couldn't have picked a better place! We loved this hotel from the moment we arrived. Everyone from the doorman, bell hops, receptionists to bartenders were extremely polite and helpful. They went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied and always asked if we needed anything when we entered the lobby area...which by the way, is very elegant...just beautiful. The ambiance is that of old world charm of the 20s era. The rooms ample size (our room was upgraded without us even asking and at no extra cost). The bed is extremely comfortable and the rooms kept very clean. The doorman hailed cabs for us when we wanted to go downtown but given the location of the hotel, there is so much to do within walking distance. Very close to Times Square but far enough from the craziness, short blocks to Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedrial and Central Park is not far...location was perfect!! Plenty of shopping and eateries. Great room rates given the elegance of this hotel. Again the staff couldn't have been more accomodating. Visit Ninos a short walk at 39 W. 46th St. for breakfast...Owner Mike is a great guy. I can't type forever, but to sum it up in two words ..."Absolutely Perfect".

Reviews.Title: “Killer Location! Hotel is better than most for the price”
Reviews.Author: TanCalifornian
Reviews.Content: It's Manhattan, so the room is pricey for what you get. The hotel is older. The room is tight and adequate. The bar is nice and the happy hour is convivial. I never ate at the hotel. Stay at this hotel for its proximity to Grand Central and the subway. We did lots of walking and sightseeing from the hotel. The location and its centrality is the reason for staying. Be sure to take advantage of the Grand Central Food Court in the basement of Grand Central. A gazillion choices! Also, take a moment in Grand Central to visit the Grand Central Market. Glorious fresh fish, cheeses, spices, vegetables, ready-to-eat deli food. All pristinely presented and beautifully lit. Bring the camera. I would stay at this hotel again. I loved it's proximity to transportation.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time.”
Reviews.Author: Mattbevhills
Reviews.Content: I was visiting from LA. My room was a bit small but what do you expect from Midtown Manhattan? Met friends for drinks at the bar and the staff was wonderful. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Donal2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights during my business trip. Room was fantastic, staff were superb and ever so helpful and professional. Couldn't ask for more from a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Faded elegance but okay”
Reviews.Author: badcop
Reviews.Content: I booked 6 nights through Hotwire and got a good price, but was dreading the stay due to the negative comments here. However, when I arrived the reception staff were very pleasant and even put me into a larger room because I am a smoker - very unlike the smoking paranoia I have encountered so far in the USA. I declined the services of the bell hops on advice read here - don't be put off by the entrance stairs, as there is a lift on the floor at the bottom, where the shops are. The only service I used was the extravagantly priced wifi, $15 dollars for 24 hours. Otherwise I ate out and brought drinks back with me. As said elsewhere, the whole place needs refurbishment, especially the room doors on my floor, everyone of which had to be slammed in order to close it, so one can imagine the noise. Location is excellent. For the price I paid, $129 a night, not bad for NY, but I wouldn't have been happy had I paid the full rate. Incidentally, I moved on to the Holiday Inn Express just a block over for 2 nights, as I got a ticket for the US Open so extended my stay - for the same price, I got free wifi, extensive cable TV and a free breakfast. Not quite as glamorous but better for me anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - great location.”
Reviews.Author: Margaret89
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from Australia, I was just wanting to relax in a comfortable room and bed. I had read other reviews about the hotel ie small rooms, however I was pleasantly surprised. My room was quite large (it had 2 Queen size beds). I enjoyed relaxing in the bath. I thought the room was beautiful. The front desk staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel is in a great location - close to major tourist attractions. As a solo female traveller I felt safe and at ease. I will definitely stay here again. (I also liked the hotel gym - modern equipment & free fruit to enjoy after a workout).

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better for that occasion!”
Reviews.Author: MarianaFonseca
Reviews.Content: Muito bom! Excelente localização, próximo a Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, charming public areas (bar/lobby), boring and drab rooms”
Reviews.Author: BVakil
Reviews.Content: We booked on expedia and got a room at the end of the floor, far from the elevator. The view was horrible (back alley, roofed courtyard,very industrial). We requested a change of room but they were unable to do it because of a wedding party. The room was larger than we expected and the beds were comfortable. Bathroom was tiny, with about 12in by 5in of counter space. THe tub wasn't dirty but didn't feel clean. The bathroom was old. They tried to make the room look regal but fell short and can be best described as drab. I suppose it is worth it if you're planning to just sleep in the bed. NO frills, no luxury don't expect more. The public areas such as the bar and lobby were lively and charming. The location is good, close to shopping. However the hotel did not ooze hospitality. For a frequent international traveler, I did not feel welcome and secure during my stay here. I was happy to leave this otherwise fun city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: spagirlUk
Reviews.Content: The perfect location!! you are actually two or three block from every where you will like to go! Will always go there when back in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, staff friendly and helpful, however the beds and room not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: zaltyna4
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for my cousin's wedding- Aug 14-17. The wedding reception was in the Grand Ballroom, which was gorgeous. All the food was great. When we checked in about 7:45pm on Friday, Aug 14, our rooms were not ready and we had to wait about 45 minutes. The check-in staff did give us drink vouchers for our party to offset the wait. When we finally got up to our rooms, I was disappointed that the one my folks and stayed in (1235) had uncomfortably small beds (double bed) and the door's deadbolt slider did not look very secure. In fact, you could just about look through the hole through the door and it was not the peephole I was looking in! I did not complain to the front desk, since the hotel was sold out for the weekend and would not have been able to get something else. The bathroom decor, such as wallpaper was peeling off the wall. I still would recommend this hotel, because overall the experience was very positive due to the service we received. We were allowed to store our luggage on Monday for a few hours, which allowed us the opportunity to go to Grand Central Terminal (very close to the hotel), take the subway and hit Chinatown for lunch and shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Nice Hotel, Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Isabella7782
Reviews.Content: Staff was very nice and helpful. Our hotel room was upgrated as soon as we got there. Very nice, clean room, quite spacious for New York City. Hotel offered to store our luggage since we got there before check-in time. Couldn't ask for more. Location was amazing. Beautiful hotel. Beds were really comfortable. We would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: wegofar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and was very clean. The lobby area is beautiful. Our room was well-appointed with a huge king-size bed. The only problem was the very slow elevators. If you're going to a meeting, give yourself extra time or just take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelersfromOH
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Roosevelt hotel on Friday very quickly and went on to tour New York within a short time. The checkout was equally as quick. The room was very nice and the beds very comfortable. The location was across from Grand Central and easy access to the subway system or walk to Time Square. Our rooms were always cleaned by the time we returned. The nicely decorated lobby was comfortable and spacious and staff quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Eh... has it's pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: thenaturebabe
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a wedding, with family. I will list the good parts of the hotel first: -good Manhattan location -beds are very comfortable -hotel lobby is gorgeous! -beautiful place for wedding reception -catered food (at the reception) was delicious - good people watching in the lobby! Now on to the not so great stuff: -No free wifi. It is $15 per 24 hours. There are some eateries down the street that do have it though. -Valet parking. (Ok, some may consider this a "plus", but when you have a car full of people and stuff, and you not only have to pay for parking but tip the driver also... well, it didn't do it for me.) -Food/drinks are very very expensive. If you are on a budget, forget eating there! I think it was $15 for a bowl of oatmeal or something like that. $8 for a beer in the lounge. -Regular rooms are small. (I did have the opportunity to see a suite, and it was amazing!!) But 4 adults in a regular room with 2 beds is very cramped. -One staff member was very rude. -We had booked our room in early May, but they double booked our room, and it took them over an hour to find us a new room. After being in the car for over 6 hours, this was not pleasant. They also said they were upgrading us to a larger room, but that did not happen. We were given the wrong room again. Right after we got settled in, a couple was outside our door, confused, and said the room was theirs. They had to go back down to the front desk and figure that mess out. So I can't say I would personally recommend this hotel, unless you have big $$$ to stay in a suite. However, I would not say it was awful either. The reception was held there and was absolutely beautiful. But, if you expect an exceptional stay here, then expect to pay an exceptional price!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel! Great Location!!! Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: ClassDestroyer
Reviews.Content: We had a girls weekend in NYC last weekend it was amazing! We stay at the Roosevelt and found it to be just what we were looking for. Checking in the lady was confused as to why two girls where sharing a double bed, (there were no rooms with 2 beds when we booked..) and she happily upgraded us to a King Size. Went into our room, you could tell it had been smoked in only if you had allergies, but for a historic hotel what do you expect, at one time you could smoke everywhere and Europe people still smoke everywhere (Gross but deal with it). Our room was clean, the bathroom had some mildew on the tile but it didn’t really bother us to bad, again its an old hotel. The room was a good size for people who travel to do things, we spent a few hours on one of our afternoons and chill and watched tv, was fine. It was close to Grand Central, Time Square and if you wanted to go to Meat Packing District or Little Italy it was a less then $10 cab ride!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price”
Reviews.Author: arara3003
Reviews.Content: Great value but a little out of the way. Rooms were clean and service was good. Only negative was doorman who tried to stear us to a gypsy cab for his benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: Pier313
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well keep. The staff was very helpful during the whole stay. Very convenient location near all that we wanted to see. The rooms were clean and had all the essentials. There was taxi service to and form the hotel at a reasonable cost. We had a great stay in New York in part because of this good Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for NYC”
Reviews.Author: koko2035
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and really enjoyed it. Service was good and location was perfect to get around NYC. Had been to NY a couple of times prior and had stayed at other places in Midtown but would have to rate this one the best from the lot. Our room was on the smaller side but hey in NYC who spends alot of time in their room anyway?? We had friends also staying who had a twin room which was 2 x double beds and their room was very big...all of us in there for some drinks and not crowded! Its worth what you pay for it in comparison to other more expensive hotels in the same area...

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: jlforman7000
Reviews.Content: The room was great! Everyone who worked there was so nice. I am totally planning on staying there again the next time I'm in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Location good and not expensive so not bad”
Reviews.Author: Happy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: In my efforts to cut costs for my employer this year, I am staying at less expensive hotels when possible and chose The Roosevelt this week. I was assigned to Room 953. Check in was fast and polite. Long waits for elevator and it seemed a couple were out of service, but nothing out of hand. Room a bit old and tired looking but clean enough and functional. For the location at US$170 per night, I felt it was a bargain and that is my corporate rate. I did not want to eat at the hotel or in my room (was not appealing to do so) and not using room service saved even more money. I used the ethernet connection for internet at US$14.95 per day which is expensive. I never needed or was offered a bellman or doorman but that is fine - location is great. I see it is popular with tourists over business people. I was fine and happy. For a personal trip, I would stay at The Grand Hyatt which i like better but happy to do my part to cut business travel costs when I can and this was just fine for 4 nights of NY business when I am out of the room from 7 am till 9 or 10 pm everyday anyway.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Location, Exceptionally Poor Service"”
Reviews.Author: abreiz
Reviews.Content: My reservation was pre-booked by my company, I was scheduled to arrive in the early morning around 6 a.m., after a long red eye flight from San Francisco to JFK. Since I know most hotels will honor an early check-in, I made sure to e-mail their reservations department one week before my arrival to ensure that they would be able to grant an early check-in, I NEVER received a reply. I arrived to the property, tired, and sweaty from the long walk from grand central, and was hoping to checkin so I could freshen up before my seminar at another hotel. The Guest Service Agent was not polite as well, and gave me this weird look implying that it was obviously too early to check-in, I showed her the e-mail that I sent to their reservations department telling them about the early check-in, she said that was nothing she could do, and that I would have to come back later. She redirected me to the bellman, whom was VERY helpful, and showed me where the restroom was so I could change before my seminar.
