I arrived later in the afternoon, to check back in, my reservation called for "cozy" queen, I didn't think it was going to be SOOO cozy. My room was directly across the elevator, and I could hear every possible noise you wanted. The reservation was so small, that I had to jump into the bath tub, to close the door, if not, I would be in the way. I went down to the front desk, and asked to move to another room, another gentleman, was not helpful, and said that the entire property was sold out, and wouldn't be able to do anything, I asked, if he could just move me to the other end of the hall, and place someone else in my room, they said "no". Checking out was another experience, as I walked to the elevator, three housekeepers walked by room without acknowledement, or something as simple as a "good morning" Bellstaff was helpful, more helpful than the front desk. I would NEVER stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: tripbunnies
Reviews.Content: Read the mixed reviews and chose to be booked in here as it was one the 'approved' list for my firm. What a mistake! The lobby, bars, and food areas are fine. The room, however, was tired, smelled of smoke, old (bathroom patina had that special aged look that only 40 years of use can give) and very noisy. From an aircon unit that sounded like it was about to explode to paper thin walls where I could hear arguments on BOTH sides, not a good stay. No internet connection in my room, and the front desk claimed it was my computers problem. Not true, as I used both a mac and an itouch and could see the errors in the wireless setup. Avoid. The hotel rooms need a major refit. Oh, fitness centre was OKish - small, but seemed quiet.

Reviews.Title: “don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: wifeof25years
Reviews.Content: UNLESS you get a suite, you'll not have enough room for more than 2 people! The safes didn't work, a bobypin was sticking out of the gross carpet and the room was beyond small! After paying a "small" price to upgrade, we got a 2 bathroom suite that was definately workable! Not luxurious but workable! Talk to the bellman!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Rosy About Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aaa28
Reviews.Content: Check-in was at 3 pm and we arrived at 6pm but our room was not ready and was still being cleaned. We were given complimentary drinks at the bar and served great martinis! But our room was not ready until two and a half hours later! The luggage was never delivered to our room and we had to call to follow-up and at 11:30 pm it was finally delivered!! When we asked the porter what happened, he had no idea because he just came on the night shift. The bathroom and bedroom were small and no better than a budget hotel. The bathroom door was warped and did not close, the cold and hot water in the bathtub must have been switched because it did not work properly, the glass shelf on the mirror was broken, and there was mold along the rim of the tub and sink, and the fan was broken. At times the pressure in the toilet was low and did not flush. The only update in the bedroom was the flat screen tv and the energy saving light bulbs. The dresser drawer was broken, the bedside lamp looked like a cigarette had burned through the lamp shade, the air conditioner unit was very loud, the down comforter had no duvet cover, and there was no painting hung as advertised in the website photo but two screws were exposed. There was nothing "luxurious" about this hotel whatsoever and it was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient but very busy”
Reviews.Author: Maco1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel with wife and 7 year old daughter while in NYC for 5 days on holiday. Have stayed in many hotels in NYC but this was first time at Roosevelt. Arrived a little early and room with two double beds not ready so they gave us a room with a king bed and free roll out for our daughter. Room was on the small side with a small bathroom. We didn't plan on staying in room much so not so concerned about size of room. yes hotel was extremely busy therefore staff also very busy but we were not there to be appreciated by the staff we stayed for location which was extremely convenient to most major attractions. We got a great rate of $160 a night on expedia so at that rate were happy with hotel. Would not pay full rack rate however. Many cheap breakfast and dinner places with good food very close by. relatively good gym free of charge which had no one else in it when i went. Very happy with stay at discount rate

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in: avoid!”
Reviews.Author: PRFluffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon (which we had spent touring New York State) and I cannot begin to express just how appalling it was. The staff couldn't have been less interested in providing a service: we had pre-booked a suite, and ended up in a small room in which you couldn't even walk round the end of the bed, because the staff at the check in desk were "busy" with a wedding elsewhere. And we only got this room because I made a huge stink - I saw three before finally accepting this one as the best of a bad lot - the first smelled of vomit, the second hadn't been made up, and the third stank of stale cigarettes and fried food. It isn't a cheap hotel - but the rude, arrogant and unpleasant staff got them off to a bad start. The room was horribly tatty, the bathroom was a health hazard and all in all, it was a horrible, disgusting way to leave New York - avoid this like the plague. I am only disappointed I cannot leave negative ratings for this monstrosity.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: Nileaksbooks
Reviews.Content: The building and everything about it was georgous. The rooms has thin walls but it's to be expected in older buildings. The service was fantastic. I would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price & location & accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: imisspinky
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Roosevelt for those on a budget that just want a clean basic room and good service. The location is perfect. You are a 2 block wallk to Grand Central. Staying there gives you a real feel of what it is like to live in the heart of the city. We got two rooms for us and our teenagers. They made sure to put our rooms close together. We had a rental car and weren't sure if there would be parking out front, but the bellman was very good at moving the traffic along so guests could park and unload, and then he immediately took our car to the parking garage. That saved a lot of hassle.

Reviews.Title: “SAD DECLINE OF A GRAND OLD LADY”
Reviews.Author: emacayrshire
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Roosevelt with a friend a number of years ago, we had a wonderful experience. It was very reminisce of the 1930's with huge chandeliers and sumptuous seating. The decorations were hung for christmas making the whole atmosphere very festive. It saddens me to read so many negative reviews indicating the sad decline of a once fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our first trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: edih
Reviews.Content: I took my wife on a surprise trip to NYC for our wedding anniversary and I planned most of the trip online. Without knowing NYC, it made it a challenge to find the "right" hotel when swimming through all the online reviews. The location of the Roosevelt Hotel was SO perfect for our trip. We had tickets to see a show at Carnegie Hall and tickets to see a show on Broadway and both were in walking distance. It rained a couple of the nights we were there, so we ended up taking a cab, but during the day we ended up walking past both areas and Times Square without much effort (and we are both *not* walking people :) The hotel is literally across the street from Grand Central station (there's a small door right to enter Grand Central right across from the front door of the hotel). Great food and shops are aplenty within a one block radius of the Roosevelt. Although the room service seemed expensive, there are several outside restaurants in the area that will deliver right to your room. I had a problem with the first room they assigned to us (I'm a large 6'3" and they gave us a queen bed which made my feet hang over the end), but a quick call downstairs and they moved us to a room with a king sized bed with no trouble. The only thing I wish the room had was in room movies which are great for downtime when you're not out and about in the city. There are no pay per view movies or tv based checkout options with this hotel. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone who is staying in NYC for the first time or anyone who is looking for a good hotel that isn't in the super crowded times square area, but it still close enough to everything you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel would definitely comeback if the price was right”
Reviews.Author: gliss_9
Reviews.Content: upon entering the hotel, I felt as though I was being transformed back to the 1930s. Inside it had an elegant if not dated look. After walking up the red carpeted stairs, I fancied myself to be Clark Gable collecting the Oscar. The hotel staff was courteous and businesslike, but not in a customer service friendly way. After exiting the elevator, I took note that the hallway carpeting,though not in poor shape is worn and needs to be replaced. For all I knew, I could have been following in the footsteps(literally) of Jean Harlow. The overall cleanliness of our room was satisfactory. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the bathroom although the room itself was small. No coffee pot or microwave was a negative. Bed was comfortable,although noisy throughout the nights with the garbage trucks picking up and occasional ambulance. Overall no major problems in four nights there,although the heater could have been an issue if we needed it since it didn't respond after hitting the button. Note to management; the baggage area staff appeared disorganized.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chshenrique
Reviews.Content: I recomend this hotel Excelent location and hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, small rooms and bad service”
Reviews.Author: octavi
Reviews.Content: I was 5 nights there. Paying a Superior room, with two beds, they give us one that are small. Some of the days we don't have towels in room and was necessary call front desk some times. At the end, we have a problem with the key and we need call security to go inside the room. In any aspects, is a 2 star hotel or less. Octavio, Barcelona (Spain)

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dontknow00
Reviews.Content: my wife and i and a teen stayed there for a weekend. like all the reviews before , we were blown away by the lobby area. it was very grand. the front desk was helpful even though we got there very late and we thought our reservation might not be honored (bus problems). they gave us 2 double beds. the room was aged but comfortable. the bed was very comfy . it had a good shower head ( no low flow). it had a desk and a flat screen tv but no HD. theres a charge for wi-fi. we wanted to use wi-fi but couldnt get a connection. the toilet did overflow at 6 am but a call to the front desk put that problem away quickly. the location is only about 4 blocks from Times Square and about 3 blks from Grand Central and the subway. we rode the subway and it wasnt bad. the hotel did have a restaurant and bar but we didnt use them. when we went out for breakfast on sunday, we found that a street fair was being set up on Madison right next to the hotel. so we decided to hang there for a while. i think it was about 12-15 blocks long. they said they would hold our luggage after checkout for as long as we wanted. i thought that was very cool. we got a good rate from hotwire so we think it was worth it. we would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: ljh777
Reviews.Content: Hotel was reccomended to us by a friend. I had read all the reviews and was a bit alarmed by some of them, decided to bite the bullet and see for myself. the hotel was fantastic, location was great, staff were very helpful (had read that all the staff were interested in was looking for tips, I thought they were fine besides this is new york everybody is lookng for tips) lobby is very impresive as is the roof top bar (if not a little expensive) great athmosphere in the lobby. the hotel is 90 years old and the corridors are very dated but it is very clean and has great character. the beds are huge and very comfortable (we did upgrade to a king) room was small but i am let to belive all new york rooms are on the small side. 5 - 10 min walk to time square/broadway. hotel expensive for food, have breakfast in the cool deli accross the street (turn left outside 45th street exit and crross the road)

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: pookyandjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in total... (1 night then we checked out to go and do a two night side trip to Niagra Falls, and then back for a further 4 nights) While we were waiting for our room to be ready (we arrived at 4 pm and had to wait for 2 hours!!) I made initial enquiries about having some of our bags stored whilst we went on our 2 night trip to Niagra Falls. I was told the storage rate was $8 per bag per day which i thought was overpriced.. i didn't say anything at the time other than i would discuss it with my husband.. when we were finally checked into our room we got sorted out with repacking what bags we wanted to take with us and which ones we wanted to have stored.. mu husband took down the 3 bags that we wanted stored and he came back saying that he had paid for them in advance $2 per bag per day.. i looked at the receipt and it had noted everything was paid..when we went downstairs i spoke to the guy who i had initially spoke to about the storage charges and he again told me that it was $8 per bag per day... i asked him about the discrepancy in the prices given what my husband had just paid with one of his collegues and he stated that "if i wanted HIM to store my bags that was the price.... what his collegue charged was his business" I was gobsmacked at his attitude but really with one or two exceptions... that "money grabbing" attitude prevailed through the staff... asking for tips ALL the time... one american that we were talking to in the lobby whilst we were waiting for our room to b e ready was telling us it cost him $20 to get his luggage from the cab to the room... and that didn't include any portion of the cab fare or tip... Australian aren't accustomed to tipping but we do it when we are in a country where that custom dictates it... when in Rome and all that... but its really bad when the porters are telling you how much they want you to tip them... About the security.....There was no safe in our room... so i put some valuables in an envelope ( I carry a supply of new ones for exactly this purpose, not every hotel room has a safe ).. i had written an inventory of all the items on a piece of paper, signed it and placed it in the envelope and sealed it... took it down to the front desk and asked them to place it in the safe because there was no safe in the room.. which they did... when i went and collected the package the night before we checked out it had been opened... nothing was missing.. but i wonder if that is because they could see by the list that was there that i would know if there was anything missing... No need whatsoever for them to open guests items given to them for safe keeping about the cleanliness... it doesn't say alot about the cleanliness of a hotel when you see used room service trays sitting in hallways for 3 days without being removed... the only difference is that they start to smell! Now.... the good.... hmmmmmm location is pretty good... the lobby looks nice... but again this is spoilt by the service... there is a fabulous coffee shop/salad bar across the street called Cosi... we had breakfast there each day... great coffee and home made bagels... and wonderful salds which we sometimes had if we were near by at lunch time... plus they have free wifi if you have your computer with you NYC is expensive.... but its such a fabulous place to visit.... dont have your vist marred by staying here.... there are lots of better places to stay that are far more reasonably priced... and with more benefits...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ReggyB
Reviews.Content: First thing first about this hotel. The checkin is and always is, HORRIBLE! We have had three stays here and not once have we got into a room early, that we asked for weeks in advance and which they said they would try to accomodate. But it never happened. We also had to wait twice past the check in time to get our room. Once we were even traveling with another couple, they had got a smaller room and talked to the desk person in front of us and got upgraded to a bigger room like we had orginally booked. Then I step up to the counter, right behind my friends, and they tell us that they have NO rooms ready right now. About 45 minutes later we got a room. This is pathetic!!! Checkin is at 3:00 here and once we did not get in till 4:30. There is also an older gray haired lady with glasses and an accent that works the counter. She has been there everytime we have visited. STAY AWAY from her. She is undoubtly the rudest person that hates her job I have ever come in contact with. Now to the good stuff. The hotel is nice and appears to be somewhat well kept to NY standards. It is very convenient to Grand Central and not a bad walk to Times Square or Rockefeller Center. There is also a nice store to get breakfast, snacks or even a quick meal diaganolly to the left out the main door (45st). Most shopping up and down Madison and other locations are close by too. The rooms are about average size for NY but the bathrooms are tiny and have no storage or shelving to place things. So therefore make sure the toilet lid is down anytime you are in the bathroom and it is not being used or be prepared to just right off personal items! Also the first time we stayed here the room was a bit noisey but the last few times we did not seem to hear as many sirens, horns or vehicle traffic. Everytime we have upgraded to the larger rooms but everytime them seemed to be getting smaller. Some upgrade rooms are obviously larger than others. No use to complain though. There is also a nice bar in the lobby with helpful bartenders and supposedly a roof top bar in the summer months but we never made it up to it. We stopped and looked at the fitness center but we never used it though. It appeared to be set up mostly with treadmills and cardio equipment and somewhat small. Overall we will use this hotel again and I would recommend it to others, minus the obviously angry checkin staff. Remember, angry gray haired glasses lady with an accent = bad check in experience!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & beautiful”
Reviews.Author: berlene
Reviews.Content: The Hotel in general was very clean, elegant and the atmosphere was inviting. The receptionists, concierge, and staff were friendly. The location was spot on, very close to shopping, a walking distance to Times Square, Broadway Theatres, subway, etc. My only disappointment was that the housekeeping staff were loud in the morning (no consideration for visitors who are trying to relax and sleep in late). There was no microwave, not even a coffeemaker in our room, which is a standard in most hotels I've been into.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Odiechau
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking if you get a GREAT rate go ahead and book. On the positive side Great Location; grand old fashion lobby; rooms are clean and roomy for NY standard. On the negative side cold service; rooms are outdated, not much amenities in room (plastic cups, only shampoo no conditioner or shower gel)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: KateLondon_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt with my boyfriend for 5 nights and had a fantastic stay. I had been worried by some of the negative reviews I had seen on TripAdvisor but couldn't find anything wrong with the hotel myself. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable - the bed was really comfortable. The lobby was gorgeous and the Mad46 bar was lovely. The hotel was in a perfect location for most big New York sights. I booked the hotel though Expedia and got a really good deal on a King Size bedroom. I come to New York every year and I will definitely be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated. Not so clean. Rude & unpleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: TraveledWise
Reviews.Content: First let me begin by stating I've been traveling to NYC for business and pleasure for many years. Yes, hotel has good location, but again you are in NYC. The lobby looks grand as their web site presents, and was at one time I'm sure the sparkle and gem that it should be. This hotel is very run down, outdated, and just does not live up to the web site photos. The rooms were VERY dirty. Hair in the bathroom, tub, toilet and on the bedding sheets along w/stains. From the moment of check-in till check out I found the staff to be nothing but unhospitable. I'm not sure why you choose to work in the hospitality industry if you do not enjoy working with the public or visitors/guests? I think you can do A LOT better in NYC in the same price range and three star class that this hotel claims.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Outdated, Fancy Lobby, Room not worth that amount of money”
Reviews.Author: phatt_tony
Reviews.Content: We stayed in SOHO for 2 nights earlier and paid half the price at the Hampton Inn. They had free breakfast, free wifi, and room that was twice as clean and twice the size of the Roosevelt. The room has an old rusty air con, dirty walls, broken shower. room 1581.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JuLondon23
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. The beds are very comfortable, great location, helpful staff. The pipes from neighboring rooms were a little noisy at night, but it wasn't that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely hotel, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: chirpy14
Reviews.Content: It was within perfect walking distance to everything, which was so nice! When we checked in our room was upgraded to a larger one with two king sized beds (originally had a cozy queen which i was going to be sharing with my BFF) but we weren't sure why. The room was so nice, the beds amazing. It was narrow like you'd expect a hotel in NY to be but wasn't small. After a night on the town we got back to the hotel and wanted to try to seasonal rooftop bar that our room book said would be open late, but it was closed. So we headed to the regular bar. Our bartender was super amazing, making us drinks to try on the house. He was so friendly :) The next morning our bus didn't leave till later in the day and we didn't want to lug our bags around so the woman at the desk extented our check out till 1 for no charge. The doormen are also awesome, very informative and helpful, helped us to decide if we had enough time to walk to make our dinner reservations on time or if he should get a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: MsVicky2000
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and very helpful. The location was excellent as it was a short walk to Grand Central Station. The lobby is beautiful, the room was very comfortable, but the bathroom was pretty small. The only complaint would be an odor on all the floors when you step out of the elevator but the room was perfect, no odor. I will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why its rated as high as it is!”
Reviews.Author: joel76
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on combination of price and trip advisor rating. Best thing about it was location, 2nd best was the shower (good water pressure and hot). Room was very tired with peeling wall paper and dirty net curtains. Beds were comfy though. Bathroom was Ok but had damaged mirror and cracked basin. I have stayed in better places in New York for the same price. All a bit faded with European styling that needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, dated hotel!”
Reviews.Author: katekipper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first three nights of our honeymoon. The Roosevelt was easy to find and looked extremely grand as we entered the hotel. We were carrying a lot of luggage which we had to carry up the flight of steps that face you as you walk in to the foyer. This did prove to be a challenge and although there were plenty of staff around were offered no assistance. Having been to NY a few times before I knew not to expect the largest of rooms and was pleasantly surprised at the size of what we got but this hotel is desperate for some TLC. The corridors and lifts needed refurbishment, the rooms were clean but dated. The corridors were strewn with room service items that had been discarded outside by the occupant’s, this included several broken wine glasses, not the safest thing to have lying around we felt!! You could tell that the Roosevelt used to be a fabulous hotel but having not been modernised for a few decades it has lost its lustre. I would recommend this hotel as a cheap stay in a good location but don’t expect anything as glossy as the website suggests!

Reviews.Title: “Loved NYC but Will not be returning to the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: MurielCTPortlandArea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt in May 2009 for three nights. It was my first visit to NYC and although I loved NYC I would not stay at the Roosevelt Hotel. When upon arriving the hotel is impressive due to the decor and grandeur of the lobby, but that's where it ends. We purchased our accommodations online as they were offering rooms at half price - so 150.00 a night, so it was worth it for that but would definitely not pay 300.00 a night to stay there. Ok the pros are it is in a fantastic location, walking distance to Times Square, Central Park. one block away from Central Station, Good Bed and New TV Monitor. The cons: The hallways and rooms look outdated and used, would need a plaster and paint job. The rooms are very small, best suited to wash up and sleep - not to stay in for long periods, use the lobby - more pleasant!!! They do not provide a coffee machine, so if you are like me and look forward to that first sip of coffee in the morning - you'll have to wait 'till you get outside. All the hotel services cost - YOU PAY for EVERYTHING and in my opinion are too expensive. For example, 1) they provide Starbucks Coffee in the lobby at double the price that star buck charges, and by the way there is a Star Bucks coffee shop one block away, 2) They provide wireless internet at 17.00 a day - most places provide this free of charge 3) Be ready to tip always for services you may not want, when we arrived a Hotel Staff grabbed our suitcases and delivered them to our room without asking - so of course we had to tip. Here are some tips that may save you some money, whereas going through the hotel may cost you more. In Central Station, there is a booth with several free guides on restaurant prices and locations, attractions etc. I suggest to check this out, you can then pick restaurants within your price range and there are several good ones to choose from. The Subway is a practical and cheap way to get around. We were quite impressed with it's efficiency and cleanliness. The hotel will try to sell you the idea of taking a cab to the airport. We took a shuttle service for half the cost, and with 24 hour reservations, they will drive you to the Hotel and pick you up from this location - http://www.nyairportservice.com/page.php?id=31. It's worth staying here if you have a very good deal, will be out most of the time visiting the City and do not need Hotel Services - Oh bring your own coffee pot. :)

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, excellent location, superb staff, smaller rooms”
Reviews.Author: frenzee617
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roosevelt probably 10-15 times over the last 4 years as a frequent business traveler to New York and it remains my first choice. I find the lobby to be quiet and inviting. It was built in a golden age of american architecture, and I enjoy the class and elegance the hotel lobby displays. Upon check in , there are always plenty of people to check you in our out no matter the time of day. Once you have your key there are about 5 elevators that unfortunately can be quite slow as they have many floors to cover and they operate a bit slowly. Once you arrive to your room you may find it to be a bit small for your tastes, but this is typical for NYC. The bed is elegant and quite comfortable, even if you end up in one of their smaller "cozy" rooms where the bed takes up most of the room! The bathrooms are always clean with ample supplies. I suppose the only criticism is that the carpeting and decor is a bit outdated and dull. I was upgraded to a suite once which was really nothing more than a regular room, with an additional smaller room that had an ugly green carpet and a gross looking couch in it. Nonetheless, its quiet and comfortable. I have not eaten in the restaurant so I can't comment on that, but I've spent plenty of time having a night cap or an after work drink at the hotel bar. It's quiet and classy, with attentive bartenders. There's also small tables if you prefer to be alone. Excellent assortment of fine liquors (i'm a scotch guy), or just a beer. It's a little pricey to be honest, but the ambience is inviting. It's not rowdy or even noisy even when it's crowded. I've gotten room service many times and the food has always been delicious and on time. Try the Salmon with a half bottle of white wine. The best feature as a business traveler is that they have a car service available almost any time to take you right to LaGuardia or JFK. This beats finding a taxi hands down. I believe its $40 (not including gratuity), which really isnt' that much more than a taxi would cost. I take the shuttles out of LaGuardia and I know if I'm staying at the Roosevelt I can check my bags with the bell desk, go to my meetings during the day, and get right in a town car to the airport quickly. If you want to save a buck, see if anyone else waiting in line wants to split it with you. I've done that a few times and had some good conversations with folks from all sorts of industries and locales on the way. The Roosevelt isn't cheap, but it's not outrageous either. It's in a prime location where you will get every penny you pay for. It's worth it. SIgn up for their email specials and you won't be dissapointed. They had an excellent winter rate last winter that I even came down and stayed over a weekend for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at The Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: ZipsnBucks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roosevelt for three days and the visit was pleasant. We were in New York for business and the hotel was ideal for us. The hotel is located near a lot of what New York has to offer. The rooms are typically small for New York hotels. We arrived early at 9 am and while check was at least six hours away we advised to try back after noon as the room maybe ready. The service was par with the cost of the hotel and everyone we dealt with was friendly and helpful. The costs were a bit extreme, but this is New York and if you don't mind walking out the front door and down a block you can find reasonably priced "New York" meals and drinks. Overall a good visit and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant NYC Stay”
Reviews.Author: greedyflynh
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is very nice overrall. I enjoyed the old school New York City feel - although very modern. The rooms were clean and in good shape for an old hotel. The bed was the best part. Very comfortable. The room had a nice flat panel TV - but no high definition - so the quality of watching any television is low. There is no free Internet. The hotel is a quick walking distance from Times Square - and there are plenty of places to eat and drink right around the hotel. I was attending a conference within the hotel - and the conference setup and food served was very good. Again though - no free Internet - which is tough when attending a conference and having no quick Internet access. I enjoyed my stay and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: andsank
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Roosevelt for 3 days and 2 nights. I was a bit wary after reading some of the Tripadvisor reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. The location is superb, the lobby is as grand as advertised, and while our guest rooms was as many have noted, not large, it was clean, quiet and comfortable. The beds were indeed very comfy as others have commented. The bathroom was also small, but the shower had plenty of pressure and consistent water temp, and the towels were thick and soft. What more do you want from a hotel bathroom! The front desk gave us an umbrella which came in handy during the rains. Just remember to return it or else they will charge you $ 25. Oh and don't forget since this is New York after all, there will another ~ $ 30 for various occupancy taxes, Jacob Javits tax, etc. The high speed internet didn't work at first but someone from IT was up in a jif and got it going quickly. The guys out front seem to do a good job hailing taxis, both the yellow licensed cabs and the "unofficial" dark black unmarked limos. Our only gripe -- the elevators, praised by other reviewers, were always slow and almost always overcrowded. On the morning of our checkout, we were in a hurry and finally gave up and lugged our luggage down 4 flights of interior stairways down to the shop level and then up again a flight to the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: Micwa
Reviews.Content: At US$134 per night plus taxes, the hotel was great value, but I think this is more due to the economic downturn than anything else. Location was good, but don't be fooled - Grand Central is still a couple of blocks walks (plus negotiating through the tunnels) and Times Square is several blocks away. Not impossible distances, but be prepared for a lot of walking. Hotel was good generally, but in our case, the walls were thin (this is such a hit and miss thing with hotels). We could hear people talking in the next rooms. We also had a very bad first night with young drunken fools running and shouting along the hall in the early hours (perhaps the down side of heavily reduced hotel rates ?). As a rule, these older hotels are not well insulated. Noise from roadworks were quite audible. If we stayed there again, we would insist on a quieter room wherever that would be (if one does exist).

Reviews.Title: “Great place, really good for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: Sorayein
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Really close to Grand central terminal and in the middle of Midtown. Just for that reason I would go back forever. The most of the people was really helpful and kind. The room was big enough for three people, and the bed was so comfortable that I just lie down and got asleep. The pillows were PERFECT. But there are two things that I loved the most: 1.- So many elevators!!! Almost nothing of waiting time. And in a city like NYC,where the time is money, UFFF that is so valuable! 2.- The room was made really early. We went out early in the morning and we returned before noon and it was made up. Wonderful! And we got our room at a very good price: 3 people for 163 USD per night. A bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MustangLippy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very pleasant stay at The Roosevelt, a grand dame of NY hotels. The location is perfect. Madison and 45th. Ten minute walk to Rockefeller Center. Twenty minutes to Central Park. One block from Grand Central Station. A couple of blocks from American Girl. Front desk staff were friendly and accomodating. Inititially there wasn't a room ready for us at Noon, when we arrived. However, the clerk double-checked again after processing our reservation and a room had come available. Great service. Concierge, doormen and bellhops all very friendly. Rooms are very small but comfortable and clean. Ladies, if you like to spread your toiletries and make-up out on a counter in the bathroom you will be disappointed. No counter space. But in the scheme of things a minor, minor thing. Nice thick walls. Very quiet hotel. Barely heard any noise from neighbors or elevator traffic. I have stayed in very expensive NY hotels too and frankly for the price I paid at The Roosevelt the others are a complete rip off (my price was $139 a night before tax and fees). Plus, at a couple of these expensive hotels I have waited 5 minutes for an elevator. The Roosevelt has a bank of 6 elevators and we never had to wait. We got offered the "hotel car" too by the doorman on our way back to the airport. I took him up on it even tho I knew it was an unlicensed taxi cab and not a "hotel car". I was traveling in rush hour and I liked the flat rate. Just know what the deal is and you're OK, right?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal in NYC! Walk back into the days of TITANIC!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie A
Reviews.Content: I found that if you find a cheaper rate anywhere on the internet this hotel will match it and give you another 10% off the room per night. The hotel is very elegant and classical inside. The rooms are a little small but the overall room is very nice and more importantly th bed is very comfortable.Not too hard. The hotel had alot of history and fun to read about. Ive stayed in some of the most expensive hotels in the city but for the price and location I cant complain! I found some people were paying 399.00 a night for the samew room we where paying 164.00. I am returning next week and paying 145.00 a night for 5 nights! You may not always be able to get this good a deal but I promise if you surf the internet enough for the best price you will come out ahead compared to what other hotels are charging and not half as nice. I have only one complaint about the hotel. Service. We had to wait in a line for check in but this was a problem each day we walked by at 3pm.I suggest showing up a little later for check in if you can. And when our cab pulled up the bellman didnt offer to help with our bags. I was glad we didnt have too much. It saved us the tip. If you want to spend over 500.00 a night in the city the best place for me is The NY Palace! Hands down. But if you want a nice place but not the price tag then I strongly urge you to try The Roosevelt. The location is close to everything and beautifully decorated. I felt like i had walked back in time. Ive stayed at THE PALACE many times and love it but its just got too expensive in our economic crunch right now. I am happy to return to The Roosevelt again and again as long as I can keep the rate where it is. Im not too concerned with service when i have my husband with me to carry the bags,LOL! Im sure I will be able to get a bellman when I return alone next week.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome mid-town location.”
Reviews.Author: Robocopms
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews - you may be having doubts about the Roosevelt. Don't believe the hype - The Roosevelt is a sure bet for an extended stay in NYC. We stayed for 5 days and throughly enjoyed every moment. The hotel is in the BEST location !! Walking distance to the highlights of NYC. Fifth Av - one block, Grand Central - one block, Chysler building - one block, Times square - two blocks, ESB - a few blocks, etc etc etc !!! It is one of the greatest feelings to walk out the front door of your hotel and be right in the middle of the action. While you are in NYC you don't want to waste time travelling. The rooms are cosy (re - small) but very adequate - let's face facts - who goes to NYC to spend time in their hotel room ? Great TV and a clean functional shower. All you need. Remember - this is New York - space is at a premium. The hotel bar is very plush and a great place to have a drink before heading out on the town. The hotel is quite large so is normally busy at most times but the staff are helpful and professional. There are about 6 elevators so getting in and out usually takes minimal time. All in all a great choice for a stay NYC !

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience... that's all!”
Reviews.Author: Rom14
Reviews.Content: The service is completly horrible! I was surprise how they just don't care about there guests with all the competiton arround New York City... The valet survice: don't use it, they've damaged my care and one other car in the same day! It just doesn't worth paying to stay at the Roosvelt .... R.B

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl700
Reviews.Content: We just got back from three days at the Roosevelt. The hotel lobby is very impressive. The front desk workers were rude. Not very helpful. I Felt we were treated poorly once they knew we booked through expedia. There were 6 elevators...but only one at a time seemed to be working. We were on the 7th floor. Elevators had at least 10 people in them every time we used them. And you could tell by the moans from the people already in the elevator, that it was stopping at every floor. And continued throughout our trip to the lobby. The rooms are small, but nothing out of the ordinary for NYC. The bathrooms were dirty. Mold on the shower tiles and ceiling. No vent for steam. Grout peeling throughout the bathroom tiles. There was no place to put anything in the bathroom. The sink was just a pedistal. Small glass shelve above the toilet that held tissues and soap. We ended up moving those out of the room to gain a little space. The beds were very comfortable and the floor we were on was quiet. Location was good and very close to grand central for subway access. Stayed there only because the deal through expedia couldn't be beat. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, nice price.”
Reviews.Author: Awesomenshvlguy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a deal on Travelzoo and was fortunate to score a price of $159 per night for a double room. The usual price is around 199 per night according to the website. It is located 2 blocks (short blocks) from Grand Central Terminal, which is a great access point to transportation anywhere else you might want to go in Manhattan. It is three blocks (long blocks) to Times Square. It is also within walking distance to Rockefeller Center. The location is very nice and ideal for the NYC tourist. The hotel is known for it's elegant, splendid, old New York-style lobby. It really does feel like you are stepping back into the roaring 1920s. There is a nice bar to the side that is nice to sit back in, have a cocktail and people watch. The gift shop was very small, but contained an adequate supply of needed items, toiletries, drinks, etc. Check in was very quick at the time I checked in, around 7pm. The room was also nicely decorated, very clean, but maybe a tad dated (after all, the hotel is 80+ years old). For NYC, it was a very nice size. I've stayed in double rooms in NYC that were half this size. The bed was quite comfortable, although the pillows were very flat, feather I believe. It had a nice flat screen TV with a lot of channels to surf at night. The bathroom was also nice and adequate. It was definitely clean, but nothing really special. The room did not have a coffee maker, which I believe in these days is a bare necessity for a hotel room, especially one of this caliber. They do offer Starbucks coffee downstairs at the bar in the mornings with snacks for purchase, but who wants to have to get dressed to go get early morning coffee? The hotel has a new rooftop bar called mad46 (after Madison Avenue and 46th Street) which I heard is very, very nice, but was unfortunately closed the night I wanted to go, which was my last night in town. Overall, I definitely enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Roosevelt for 3 nights during my first trip to New York City. Had some reservations about staying there because of the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed or surprised. The location of The Roosevelt is awesome, but the rooms are old and tired. Some reviewers indicated it was dirty. I think it was as clean as an old room can be. Our room was inexpensive compared to other NYC hotels - 1/3 to 1/2 the price of other hotels. I can overlook the tired, old and small room because of the affordable price and great location. It is not a resort top service hotel, but I did not go to NYC to stay in my hotel room. We only stayed in the room to sleep and the bed sheets were clean. The front desk ladies were a little sharp, but we attributed it to the New York attitude. Besides, how much interaction do you really have with the front desk?

Reviews.Title: “nice stay but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: melissabrasil
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation for a non smoking room and got a smoking room, when I complained about I was told that there were not anon smoking room available and I would have to wait until the next day. I had a child with me and for me that was unaccetable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and bathrooms need to be refurbished.”
Reviews.Author: travel1Charlotte
Reviews.Content: This old hotel has a prime location and impressive lobby, however my room and bathroom were in desperate need of updating.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser01793
Reviews.Content: Background: We are British, in our early 60s and retired. We booked this hotel at the recommendation of our travel agent, because it provided one free night in a good location, prior to returning to UK aboard the QM2. We chose to book an additional 3 nights @ £77 pppn room only, enabling us to see something of New York City. Location: Excellently situated in Midtown Manhattan and within 15 minutes walk of Times Square, Empire State Building, Central Park, UN Building, etc. There are lots of restaurants nearby, and its just a block from Grand Central Station. The fixed price Yellow Cab was a good way for two to get in from JFK efficiently and comfortably ($45 + $4.15 QM Tunnel Toll + tip). The hotel is also an easy walk from the stops for the Hop-On – Hop-Off bus tours. Accommodation: The entrance lobby is quite impressive, giving the impression of pre-war grandeur and the reception and hall-porter services were efficient. However, corridors were dingy and our room, apart from the bed and the new flat-screen TV, was in great need of redecoration and refurbishment. The room was a reasonable size and there was a fine king-size bed, although too high for my wife’s little legs! There was only one bed-side light. There was no view from our 15th storey window, but there was a lot of traffic noise all night total 18 storeys). There was no kettle or tea/coffee making facilities. However, a coffee-maker was provided foc once we called for one. (Being Brits, we would have preferred a kettle and teapot!) However, we needed to phone for more coffee and milk sachets each day, as they would not provide more than one day’s supply at a time – just irksome. We certainly did not appreciate all drinking vessels being paper cups – do they not have porcelain and glasswear!? The room safe was broken and unusable. We did not use the restaurant as it was too pricey, compared with the numerous establishments nearby. The bell-boys would give recommendations of where to eat, but they were likely to send you where they would get commission. We actually found that the adverts in the hotel’s information pack in the room were more reliable. When leaving to go to the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal the doorman hailed us a waiting limo, assuring us that this was better than getting a yellow cab or any other option. It was nice to ride in a limo and we avoided the risk of dodgy practice by some cab drivers, but on checking later with other passengers, we found on paying $55 plus tip that we had probably paid nearly double what was necessary. Clearly the doorman had a nice little arrangement operating! Overall, we would not return to the Roosevelt. It does not merit its 4 Star Rating and is overpriced for what it is (even for New York).

Reviews.Title: “Completely turned off by events and front desk staff at The Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctinnewyork
Reviews.Content: I am currently searching for a NYC hotel to accomodate my out of town wedding guests in early 2010 and came across the Roosevelt Hotel. Contacted the events planner Rose Garafolo - who right from the beginning seemed a bit disorganized and frazzled. After several correspondences via email - i had scheduled an appt with Rose to view a room today. When I went to the front desk - I was informed by Alfredo (an extremely rude employee - who seems to get frustrated very easily when asked a question) that there were no rooms. Instead of trying to ease the situation - Alfredo seemed to perpetuate it - given it was Rose's miscommunication. To make a long story short - I left the hotel feeling disrespected and completely turned off by the way the staff treats their guest and potential clients. after reading other reviews on this site - im not the only one thats had a bad experience at this so called hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: rickrtx
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for the NYU graduation. This was a fantastic place to stay. The location was superb one block from Grand Central so you could easily go wherever you wanted. The area is close to many things yet far enough away from the Times square madness! The staff was friendly and it was just a good experience! The hotel has a rich history and was remodeled in the late 90's

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location... shame about the staff.”
Reviews.Author: MickboGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: On our trip covering the USA and Canada, we have stayed at numerous hotels, ranging from very cheap to very pricey. Our daughter found the Roosevelt for us online and they were offering a special deal of 3 nights for the price of 2 and a free continental breakfast each day. We got to the hotel and found it was so very beautiful, but then when we spoke to the staff about the offer my daughter was trying to book for us, they turned very rude. They begrudgingly gave us the 3 nights for 2 and only on the last day did they finally let us have a free breakfast. It was almost as if the staff had to pay for the breakfast out of their own pocket. Our room did not have coffee or tea making facilities and when my husband tried to order a coffee to take to our room he was told it was not possible. The staff seemed to have very little knowledge or just didn't want to be bothered with us. One staff member told us she had no idea where the nearest travel agency was, only for us to then find out there was one on the 19th floor. This was a mission also as none of the staff even seemed to know how to get to the 19th floor. All the people we have met in New York are some of the nicest people we have met in the world, but unfortunately I cannot say the same about the staff at the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Here's more detail - give the Roosevelt a try, more nice than naughty.”
Reviews.Author: Whizzzy
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of reviews, I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel, and now I understand some of the remarks. There are some very, very nice things about this hotel - and some not so great - but don't pass this hotel by - it's a good value in an otherwise very expensive area of mid-town. Here is more detail for those first timers that I had wished I knew prior to my stay... Location, location, location as mentioned, near Grand Central at 45th and Madison - nearby is Times Square, and loads of subway choices, restaurants, shopping, and plentiful taxicabs. As everyone says, the lobby is beautiful, and has a nice seating area if you are waiting for friends. It's fun to people watch and see the bustle. There's a bellhop and concierge service. There's a coffee bar (agree with other posts you can do better elsewhere, but in a rush it's OK). As opposed to some comments, my check-in experience was very good, and my person was quite nice. I had booked open choice two or one bed; I was asked if a King bed was acceptable, and I agreed. I think now a room with two beds might get you a slightly larger room, but for 1 person the room I had was fine. There are a number of elevators in the lobby, but it is hard to figure out if they are going down, or up - and the punch buttons are only on either side of the bank with no button in the middle. It was actually funny to watch newbies (like me) first look in the middle for the button, and then search the bank for the buttons on the side. At busy times there was a bit of a wait. The room I received (a king on the 7th floor) was at the end of two very long corridors. My room took some time to find. This is a big place, with odd numbered rooms on one side, even on the other. Note that the room number signs don't tell you this, I had to figure it out after wandering down various hallways. Something about the older style reminded me of the Overlook Hotel from the Shining - but thankfully without the horror. The hallways were clean, sort of like grandma's house with a little old musty smell and flowery carpeting with a few stains here and there. The musty smell turned out later to be mostly from the soap and shampoo products in the rooms - which have a peculiar smell - they say aloe, but the fragrence is a bit more cloying than that to me. You get two small soaps, shampoo, conditioner and lotion in little bottles. The soap is very drying, so bring your own if that bothers you. My room was at the end of the hall, and was small, but very clean. The hallway was clear, except for some trays here and there, and someone had left a broken wine glass on the hallway floor that took a day to have cleaned up. The room appointments included the king bed, LCD TV, chest, desk and chair with internet connection access, separate comfy chair, and bathroom. The bed seemed new, and was very comfortable (firm, yet not too hard.) Soft white linens, generous number of pillows, and a mini-coverlet in gold were on the bed. Some hotel pictures with the designer "R" bed pillows were not to be found in this room, but no big deal. The room was a bit hot, so I turned on the older style floor model combo A/C and heater. It worked fine, but was a little loud. Turns out that was a good thing, as each of the two nights I stayed, there was heavy machinery noise from the outside inclusive of rings and beeps that I could hear even over the A/C from 12 mid to around 2 in the morning. Not the hotel's fault - but if you are a light sleeper, recommend ear plugs. I also agree with other posts that you can hear everything in the hallway, from conversations, baby cries, to door knocks, opening and closings, and slams. Thankfully, not too much could be heard in the room from neighbors in their rooms, mostly noise from hallway and outside. (Note the window could open to the outside, but I did not use it.) My neighbors were either a group of goats, or a bunch of wild guys coming in at all hours. Not my business, other than a couple of them banging on my door at 3 in the morning thinking it was their room. I ignored this, and the guys stumbled into their room (after banging that door), and the episode was over. There's a new flat screen LCD TV in the room with fairly good reception, but the higher number channels were fuzzy, and as mentioned in other reviews not a lot of choice of channels - but who spends that much time in the room, anyway? Surprising to me for an older hotel was that there was enough adequate lighting that all worked, and enough mirrors. The room, while small, had a fairly large closet right near the entranceway, with an iron and ironing board available. The overall feel of the room was like staying in grandma's attic room - old, small, clean, layers of cream colored paint and wallpaper, a bit mismatched, a little musty, but mostly cozy and workable. I know it sounds odd, but that was the feeling. The bathroom was very clean, but a bit uninspired. You could see where new tiles had been put in the shower area, with a bowed out curtain bar (nice touch giving more shoulder room), new shower curtain (nice, but did not match decor), a pedestal sink (pretty, but does not give counter space), commode (right next to ancient radiator so little room. and the commode seat was crooked), and two small glass shelves without too much space. The tub had two enamel gouges that someone attempted to repair with enamel paint. Large mirror, with an ugly industrial light, which made the room seem a bit sad and garishly lit. Not good for makeup application. There was a hair dryer, medium wattage - the dryer had a little night light on it, a nice touch. Plenty of clean white towels - but first night no washcloths. TP is cheap and harsh, so bring your own if you are sensitive to same. No coffee maker. No mini-bar. Ice bucket and glasses; soda machines down the hall with ice available. Surprisingly, no NY magazines, maps or tourist publications in the room, you had to ask at the desk or concierge. Checkout can be via TV/phone, but I went to the desk. No problems with my bill. Note that there are a number of city taxes that apply in addition to your room rate per night (almost +$30.) We had a breakfast in the Roosevelt restaurant (mezzanine level just up from the lobby.) Pretty ambience, nice buffet and menu, but EXPENSIVE. There are nearby cheaper places. My overall experience was that this place had all the necessities and is in an incredibly good location and gives pretty good value. Was it amazing? No. Was it clean and a very good value? Yes. Would I stay again for biz? Yes. Would I go for a blow out no expense spared trip into the city? No.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value, ? rooms”
Reviews.Author: cycladesfun
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room for 4 people with our two teenage boys. The room was relatively small with two double beds. The boys didn't like to sleep in a double bed and had every night a fight about sharing space, sheets, comforter etc. The location was great just in the centre of Manhattan. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: CJandRJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway. The location of the hotel was great. It was just blocks away from Time Squares, Grand Central Station, and shopping on 5th Ave. The hotel itself for nice. The lobby was beautiful and the staff was very friendly. The room was small, however big enough for just my husband and I. My biggest complaint would be the fact that we were placed in a corner room. Each time someone opened or closed their door we could hear it very loudly. If you stay at this hotel be sure to ask for a room in the hallway. I don't think you hear as much noise in the rooms in the hallway. Overall this is a good hotel. I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, elegant, and good service”
Reviews.Author: Tracywag
Reviews.Content: My daughter (10) and I stayed for three days at the end of April, beginning of May. The tone was set when we first walked up to the desk, and as I checked in, a staff member made friendly suggestions for taking pictures. The lobby is really quite grand. Our room was on the 16th floor, not noisy, and a comfortable temperature on arrival. No heat/cooling issues, we actually had ok water pressure, the beds and bedding were quite comfortable. The towels were quite soft and new. There were no unpleasant odors (even the 'closed up' smell you sometimes get). The decor is a bit old fashioned, but I am fine with that. The room could use more outlets, and the bathroom is starting to show wear. The coffee/breakfast service in the lounge is skippable, better food for the money can be found in less than a block in any direction. We booked a superiour room through a deal from Travelzoo. This meant a large flatscreen TV in a normal NYC room with a closet on the 16th floor. I have not seen any other rooms at this hotel to compare it to. There was limited HD channels for some reason, they left a note about it (but this didn't meatter to us really).

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Location...not the Service...”
Reviews.Author: gti303
Reviews.Content: Like others have mentioned...the hotel is situated about a 2 minute walk away from grand central station so it is a great location for those who want to take the MTA all the time. The hotel itself is very old, and for how old it is...the rooms are actually not too bad. The building itself has been kept quite nice, and overall is quite clean. Room noise is bad, you can always hear people entering and leaving rooms, and street noise is pretty abundant(poor insulation I guess), but that is not a big deal...being inside Manhattan I didn't expect it to be too quiet. But my overall experience in terms of service here was quite horrible. I called ahead of time to confirm my reservation as we will be arriving late that night...everything was supposedly ok. Once we arrived however the story was different. We had 2 rooms, and one of them was supposed to be a double...but nope...it magically turned to a Single King, and apparently there was no other room available anymore. So we accepted that and would try to find another room the next day. My only requests were to be situated on a higher floor and to be away from the elevators (we booked 1 month in advance)...but nope...we got the fourth floor...and one of the rooms was right in front of the elevator. Thats when it all went downhill...our other party split with us, then got stuck in the elevator for 1.5 hours...being stuck in an elevator is acceptable since things do break down once in a while...but for 1.5 hours was pretty ridiculous, and there was very very poor communication from the outside staff letting us know what was going on. Anyways, after this fiasco, we met the only 'nice' person of our hotel stay...the evening manager...he was quite apologetic and overall very professional. Anytime we needed service at the concierge or the front desk, the staff just seemed rude and did not act like we were customers...we stayed a total of 14 days there between our 2 rooms and the only time we felt there was customer service was with the bellhop and the night service manager, everyone else was just rude. We visited the Grill inside the Hotel for breakfast...the staff there were equally unpleasant; Absolutely no service, they would just stand around and talk to each other...when we say thanks, they never would reply with a welcome or any response for that matter... Also the safe's in both rooms were not operational when we initially checked in. The business center charges you around 30cents a minute for internet with a minimum $3 charge, but the computers are so slow, you spend half the time just waiting for things to load. Be it perhaps we are high maintenance, or just demanding too much...but we would definitely not recommend or repeat even though it was a great value, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in NY”
Reviews.Author: benny456
Reviews.Content: The service was amazing, the rooms had good veiws over the city, with many lifts in the hotel, it took no time to get up to the rooms. It had a good posh feel, but not too pricey. Although the cost of the meals in hotel are something to look out for. All round though and enjoyable expirence and would definetly go bakc again

Reviews.Title: “superb roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: kingyEngland
Reviews.Content: have just returned from staying at the roosevelt. we found the rooms were a really good size, the beds were really comfortable,the hotel is really well situated for walking to loads of the city sights including central park, times sq, statue of liberty and many more, the subway is across the road. would i recommend this hotel. yes in a heart beat. i cant say anything bad about it and we stayed for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was great........”
Reviews.Author: MSSCt
Reviews.Content: I took both of my kids to spend a two nights in NYC and we chose the Roosevelt Hotel for hotel and value. I was a bit concerned after I read some of the reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. The room we had (Room 822) was a great size room. Accomodations were good for the price that we paid. The location can not be beat. I valeted my car which I felt was a bit pricey ($55.00 a night) but I was travelling with two kids so I didn't have much of a choice. The staff was courteous other than one person at the front desk. The bell captain was very helpful. Recommended great restaurant in the city. All in all, I think this hotel is worth it. I would highly recommend it to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sarahLancashire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in january for week and had a really great time. The room was a good size with a really comfy bed that was huge!! Great to fall into after so much walking around!! The bathroom was nice and clean too. The location was great, really easy to get everywhere. We didnt try any food at the hotel so cant comment on that but everything else was great. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravSacramento
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two nights at The Roosevelt Hotel with my two young kids and husband. We got a great rate and breakfast included. The hotel was a good find in a great location. Close to subway, walk to most mid-town tourist attractions. The room was a decent size, especially for NYC. The lobby was very lively and a beautiful space. Hard to go wrong with this moderatly priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, problem with reservation, lamps & safe didn't work”
Reviews.Author: betsymiller46
Reviews.Content: Except for the clerk the first night the Roosevelt staff were nice, especially the bellhops and concierges. The lobby is gorgeous and the location is really convenient. If you need wi-fi access go accross the street to Cosi where it is free. The hotel charges $15 per computer per 24-hr period. I had called ahead and notified the Roosevelt that we would be checking in very late (1-2 am) and they guaranteed late check-in. When the 3 of us arrived they did not have a room with 2 beds for us. They gave us a room with 1 king and promised a roll-away (saying they never guarantee the size of the beds). When I asked if they could do anything to make up for the inconvenience the clerk grudgingly wrote out a ticket so that each of us could have 1 pastry and 1 coffee each (my youngest is 12) at the breakfast bar and NOTHING ELSE! (her words). Forty minutes later they brought up a roll-away bed. They had to shove furniture around to squeeze it in. They couldn't fix the room assignment until the next day. As instructed we brought down our luggage to be stored in the morning. They had no safe available except in the rooms, and since we were without a room the girls had to carry their laptops which they had brought to do homework during the NYU tour we were attending (10-12:30). Finally, around 3:00 they were able to get us a room with 2 beds. In the new room, one lamp wouldn't turn off, so they replaced it. Then the safe didn't work, so they sent someone in who replaced the batteries. Then a different lamp stopped working, but at that point we just avoided that lamp. The window also jammed, but we eventually got it working.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt - Very, Very Central”
Reviews.Author: On_the_move_365
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel with my wife and my parents for a week (April 2009). Rooms were not very big (but none are in Manhattan), but they were clean, had comfy bed and good shower. The hotel foyer is quite amazing. It is a very central location in Manhattan, perfect for seeing all the sights. It is right beside Grand Central Station and is 4 blocks (5-10 minute walk) from Times Square. Its about 10-15min walk from Central Park and 2 blocks away from 5th Avenue and Rockefeller Centre. We flew into Newark, got the NJ Transit train ($15) from Airport to Penn Station. Then we used the Subway to get to Grand Central. Line 1 from Penn Station one stop to Times Square, then S Shuttle line to Grand Central) We got a 7 day metro pass ($25), the best move we made as we used it to get all around Manhattan/Bronx/Queens on subway and buses. There is a good fitness centre in the Hotel, but no swimming pool. I used the fitness centre a few times, there were TVs on each machine and water machine as well. We didn’t eat in the Hotel as the breakfast was probably a bit pricy. Have the adventure in NYC is going around all wee Deli bars for breakfast anyway. There are many of them. There are a few good restaurants nearby (Eamon Bar and Grill) – 2min walk and the Perfect Pint (5min walk). They are not fine dining but good quality food. If you are looking for a central location to tour Manhattan, then the Roosevelt is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not ready until 7pm! Smelly smoking rooms, difficult staff.”
Reviews.Author: NYCLizzie
Reviews.Content: I booked two stays here for some friends coming from out of town. When we arrived to check in they were given a smoking room which smelled awful. The rooms have decent furnishings but if you are not a smoker, the smoking rooms are really disgusting. We were told they could not guarantee us a non smoking room upon our return but they would put a request in and it was 'very likely' they coul make it happen. When we returned at 3pm to check in again, the rooms were not ready. The wait for a smoking room was 2 HOURS the wait for a nonsmoking room was FOUR HOURS. We waited 2 and had to settle into another stinky room. The staff made no attempt to compensate us for the inconvenience and were rude when we would check to see if the room was ready. The second room was small and the bathroom wasn't well furnished. It looked tired and old. This hotel has some decent rooms and is in a good location. If the staff would simply make a bit of an effort it would have completely changed my review but under the circumstances I cannot recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayqueenEssex
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel as all the hotels were coming up really expensive and I was very nervous. I booked a petite room so wasn't expecting much! My husband and I were really surprised by the hotel, the entrance is very grand and the room was clean and nice enough, we were on the 17th floor so didn't get any nose. The bed was really comfy and the location was great. The staff on the reception and concierge desk are not very friendly but answer your questions! We had prebooked transfers from Newark airport which my husband swears he would never do again as it took so long but it was nice and easy! We also prebooked our bus tours which was excellent. We really enjoyed ourselves and would definitely stay at this hotel again and believe me I am fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Gipsyguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week last summer. Front desk was fantastic; Sunday brunch was fantastic: room was very good; maid service good; Concierge desk was clueless on how to do their job; front doorman was a crook.

Reviews.Title: “Have a hard time recommending this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjanninnee
Reviews.Content: I'm well aware of NYC prices, so I think the location is good and the service is average; however, I found the rooms to be dingy and a tad on the dirty side. For the price, it's okay, but there are many more hotels with competitive pricing that are better value.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad but...”
Reviews.Author: AmandaTUK
Reviews.Content: ... you should know a few things so that you are not disappointed with your booking: The lobby is amazing.... I don’t think this helps when you see your room. The room is fairly small, smaller than a Travel Lodge room in the UK. It does not have coffee making facilities. Your room may not be as clean as you would like it to be, but it’s really not bad. The windows do not look like they have been cleaned for years and it seems the air con unit filter needed a good clean too. ... the good things were: The location is fab. It is a stone’s throw away from Grand Central so you can get to anywhere you need via the subway and 3½ blocks away from the Comfort Diner, look it up on here, you won't regret a visit. The room had a safe, big enough for a small laptop, camera, camcorder and money etc to be locked away. The bed is very comfy, lovely shower/bath and well needed after a long day walking around NY! We didn’t spend too much time in the room and overall for the price we paid we were happy. We would recommend it to friends and family, once we had mentioned the above!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: lecarlos
Reviews.Content: Booked a room a month in a advance with two double beds. Once we got there they said they only had rooms with king beds left and all they could say was "sorry." What's the point of a reservation?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Victor031
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, friendly staff at front desk, bell hop very nice and accomadating pooring rain, and gentleman at front of hotel hails me a cab sans umbrella

Reviews.Title: “Great first time to New York”
Reviews.Author: scorpiogirl1981
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to New York & after a long flight & slightly dodgy transfer (booked through expedia, pre-paid yet driver tried to charge again-we just refused!) it was nice to arrive here! Hotel is very pretty inside & is in a great location. Very close to everything we needed & wanted to see. Loads of shops & food places literally round the corner. Our room was slightly small, the bed filled most of it, but it really didn't matter, you don't come to New York to stay in your room! Plus I think I had in mind a suite like from pretty woman so I was going to think it was smaller than expected! lol! The bathroom & the room were clean and we found no problems whatsoever! The staff were really helpful and I found this hotel to be perfect for all our needs, would definitely recommend & would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap by price & by service”
Reviews.Author: AussieSlumDog
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 9pm on Friday night to discover that our booking had been lost. After a few phone calls to expedia.com and a confirmation fax being sent to the hotel, they finally agreed that we had a booking. Having said that they said they didn't have a room available!! It was 9pm, why wasn't there a room available?? I guess in the end they compensated us with two free drinks and an entree at their bar. Those drinks and entree were nice. The room was in pretty good shape however the bath was quite dirty. The water tended to clog up in the bath, which wasn't too appealing. The gym was quite good and catered for what I required An issue I had was the cost of internet access. This will set you back an additional $15 or so per day. I found it much cheaper to go to a local Starbucks and use their cheaper internet. That was a bit of a disappointment. Overall the hotel was satisfactory for the money paid. It is about a 5-8 minute walk to times square. The location is pretty good considering. Worth a shot if you want something cheap, but not totally nasty

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain”
Reviews.Author: candkmac
Reviews.Content: I got a deal from travelzoo - a $179/night rate for a King Superior Room including full breakfast for two each day of our visit. The room was clean and the location was superb. It is located one block from Grand Central Terminal, which is convenient for those taking subways. My only complain is that they ran out of breakfast vouchers and we had to go to the front desk each morning to get copies vouchers for breakfast. But the waitstaff in the Roosevelt Grill made up for this as they were very friendly and accommodating. I would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: CD5858
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt on our annual trip to NYC this year. The location is superb. Grand Central is literally across the street so subway access couldn't be more convenient. We arrived at 11:00 and were able to check in immediately before headed to the Village. The room was on the small size but it accommodated us. Bathroom was clean and shower pressure/hot water good. The rooms were not noisy and the bed was unbelievably comfortable. The hotel is located in a prime location making easy walks to Times Square & the Rock however we tend to go off the beaten path for our entertainment. There is no coffee maker in the room but it is available in the lobby. We did not eat at the hotel but had a few drinks in the bar, which was lively both evenings we were there. Unless there is another great deal out there, we'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LucasBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. I hinghly recommend it! It's very clean, the service y really good and has a great fitness area. Great location: steps from Madison Ave. It has an amazing lobby and a nice bar . The room service is really good, and the staff is always ready to help. I do recommend the Roosevelt Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunned”
Reviews.Author: fanofnewyork
Reviews.Content: I have just read a review about the above Hotel and was stunned at the disgust of the writer. Its 18 months since I stayed there, but have visited there twice. First time in April 2001. This hotel was absolutely superb on both occasions. Rooms superb, staff friendly and efficient and food excellent. I hope to go to New York next year and will book at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located for the things we like to do in Manhattan. We had a king room on the 9th floor and were very comfortable. The bathroom was small, but we managed fine. The service was better than average. A few areas for improvement: There was only one nightstand by the bed, which is somewhat inconvenient for two people. Also, the Starbucks coffee and breakfast items in the Madison Lounge were supposed to be available at 6:00, but were usually not ready until 6:15. We really enjoyed this hotel and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Good Hotel, Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: SkinnersDad
Reviews.Content: Like many people, I read as many reviews as possible before deciding on a hotel in New York.....some of the reviews on here just have to be ignored. The Roosevelt is a very, very good choice for a week in New York. Firstly, the location. Perfect spot just off Madison Ave. Lovely short walk to Bloomingdales, Times Square, Macy's, Central Park, Empire State Building, Rockerfella Centre, Chrysler Building. If you walk out the front of the hotel and cross the road, there is a door marked Grand Central Station. Within 2 mins you are in the main concourse. Perfect if you need trains/subway.
