TIP - Turn left out the main entrance on 46th Street and walk 4 blocks (past Met Life Centre on right). The Comfort Diner is a perfect place for breakfast, or lunch, or dinner! Great staff. What us English would descibe as a proper New York diner. I cannot recommend this place highly enough, and really set us up for the day. Second, the hotel and staff. If your the sort of person that gives a hotel rating a 1 star if someone doesn't say hello back to you, then you really need help! Check in was excellent. Arrived 1pm, room not ready. Stored luggage and was told to come back at 3pm. Had a drink in the bar and a local stroll in the snow and got back at 3pm. Room still not ready - BUT, I did not complain, just stayed silent for a few seconds and the lady gave us a free upgrade to a King Room. The room itself wasn't massive, so I would imagine a cozy Queen is very small, BUT it was clean, flatscreen tv, small but fine bathroom with a good shower. No complaints. The bed was excellent. TIP - if you are given a room opposite the lifts, change (as in any hotel). There are no tea/coffee facilities but there is a small coffee shop directly opposite and a Starbucks serving from the hotel bar in the morning. We avoided room service as it looked horrendously over-priced. The lobby is beautiful. It really takes you back to a grand hotel from the 30's. The bar next to the lobby is very busy, but we always found a table. WARNING - Drinks are very expensive. $15 - $20 for a cocktail and just under $10 for a pint. We had a few drinks as it was such a nice location and atmosphere, but I wouldn't advise going on an all day session unless you re-mortgaged the house before you came out. We stayed for seven nights and 2 of the nights had roadworks till past midnight....BUT I'm not going to mark a hotel down for that! Also one night had a big Jewish wedding so there was alot of corridor noise, but again only because we were near the lifts. We had no problem with the staff at all. If you feel someone deserves a tip, give them one. Never at any point did we feel pressured to tip anyone. I would recommend the hotel car back to the airport. That little bit of luxury is a perfect way to round the holiday off, and probably works out the same cost ($55) than the yellow cab ($45 + tip and tolls). The rooms were ok, but like everyone says, the only time you should spend in your room in New York is either getting ready to go out or sleeping. All in all, the hotel and location was the perfect place to spend the week in which I proposed to my girlfriend. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who was staying in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time at the Roosevelt!”
Reviews.Author: kimberleyy
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I stayed at the Roosevelt from February 23 - March 1st and really cannot say anything negative about our experience! Our flight arrived at JFK early in the morning and we arrived at the Roosevelt before 8am. Our room was not ready for us at the time, but our luggage was happily taken care of for us and we were invited to return earlier than the regular check-in time should we choose as the front desk agent was sure our room would be ready by 1pm at the latest. I had originally booked a Cozy Queen room as part of an Expedia package as my mom and I had planned on traveling just the two of us, however when my sister decided to come, we called the hotel ahead of time and asked our room to be changed. As we had an extra person travelling with us, I fully expected to pay for the room upgrade, however we weren't charged anything! We had a great room with 2 double beds, clean bathroom and room, plenty of room for our luggage and a nice view of 46th Street. The beds were very comfortable, there was some noise outside at night from the garbage trucks working overtime to keep the streets clean, however all three of us slept very well. All but one morning we started our day by running down to the lounge in the lobby for bagels, fruit and coffee. Very conveinent, the staff were friendly, courteous, lovely. The hotel lobby was absolutely beautiful. Constantly busy as meeting and conferences were going on almost all the time. I never once felt unsafe in the hotel or the city for that matter! The hotel location is superb. With Grand Central just a block away, it's easy to get anywhere from the hotel! Also, at 47th and Madison is an excellent café, Café Metro. Highly recommend going there for amazing soups and salads. Perfect if you want to grab some food to take back to the hotel. At no time during our entire stay did I ever feel like I had to tip anyone working at the Roosevelt. We left a few dollars everyday in the room for the maid service, and tipped the Bellmen when they retrieved our luggage for us from storage upon our arrival and when we left the hotel. The gentlemen working outside taking care of the taxi's/towncars helped us out, never implying or indicating a sense of entitlement when it came to tips. I highly recommend the Roosevelt to anyone looking for the quintessential New York experience. I cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: cinderella5025
Reviews.Content: Problems with Roosevelt Hotel in New York City: At 2:20 am the front desk calls & says they had a complaint that our Tv was too loud. I told the woman that they were mistaken because our Tv was not on and we had been asleep for hours. as my sis and I are 62 & 64 yrs. old. She then said I am warning you that if this happens again security will be called to knock on your door. I explained again that she was mistaken but she was very rude and continued to threaten me. I went down to the lobby and she was the only one there and I asked for the mananger and a man came to me with a phone in hbis hand. I made a complaint with the night mananger and then again with the day manager the next day. I was told that they would get back to me but no one ever did. We were not able to go back to sleep that night and because we were so tired . We were there for several more days and no one ever contacted us. When we left on 3/01 we both filled out a comment card and explained the incident. We have not heard anything from them at allfrom the Hotel. They woke us us in the middle of the night for something we did not do, then threatened us.We were awake the rest of the night. It was a terrible and costly experiance. that was quite scarry. The room was small but fine. The Tv was good. The view from our window that they claimed had a "view" was the inside of the hotel looking at all the airconditioning units and the other wall of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: CBTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: Grand old hotel. Rooms are partially renovated and larger and cleaner that most NY rooms. Hotel has large lobby with a busy bar and a restaurant. The location is great for meetings - near many of the larger banking and finance companies. For the price, one of the better deals in NY for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: Thecouze
Reviews.Content: After few days staying at the hotel without problem, an incident with Wendy the receptionist and her so-called manager was enough for saying I and my employees would never stay again to the Roosevelt hotel. - Wendy the Receptionist rude and baring call because some of the colleague names were not matching the room number on her computer. All rooms were registered on one name. - She has been rude with people trying to reach room by phone, with her 'gangsta' attitude! - Her "so -manager" telling me he would press charge against the persons staying in the room where the name aren't theirs, saying they were staying illegally in the hotel after 4 nights. Shocked! All filled a form upon arrival! - Received better services in budget hotels around the world including 3rd world country. - Just unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but shabby place”
Reviews.Author: sharkie149
Reviews.Content: This is really well located in central Manhattan but it is in desperate need of a refurb, and in fact simply looks shabby. The room we stayed in was extremely cramped and noisy (although to be fair, you have to expect this in Manhattan!). It wasn't unpleasant and didn't ruin the holiday, I would just expect a lot better for the money

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, superb, clean, fantastic location, ticks all the boxes for me”
Reviews.Author: lawz6179
Reviews.Content: We ( 2 best mates ) stayed here at the end of Jan into Feb and what a lovely hotel. We arrived to see the amazing lobby it is breathtaking and makes it feel that bit more special. The check-in lady was really lovely and as we told her it was our 30th birthdays she upgraded us to a king suite for free ! They do ask for a $100 deposit for breakages but you get it back if no damage is done. The room we were given was on the 14th floor and the view was of some offices but we weren't bothered as we weren't there for that ! The room that greeted us was very clean, tastefully decorated and had two double beds ! One each ! The bed was soooo comfy and there was peace and quiet apart from the humming of traffic and honking of taxi horns- very NYC ! The bathroom had a decent shower/bath and they provide you with complimentary toiletries, fluffy white towels and a hair dryer ! There was cable tv and decent 37' plasma tv to watch it on. The only criticism is that there are no tea/coffee making facilities and you have to fill up a bucket of ice to keep your drinks cold - we used to buy a big carton of orange juice and stick it in the ice and that did us ! There are vending machines for fizzy drinks but I wouldn't waste the money. You can get room service but it is expensive. The Madison Bar in the hotel serves a variety of alcohol, cocktails coffee etc. Be warned it is expensive but if you are splashing out - well worth it ! Cocktails are around $15 each! We would highly recommend this hotel - tip a yellow cab to JFK airport is $45 + tip and tolls - for the same money we got a limo ($55) to the airport from the hotel and it is the ultimate way to spend the last few hours in this glorious city - the position is excellent for times square, empire state, rockerfeller centre, broadway, central park and generally everywhere - I will be staying here again when I visit what I call a home from home

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: AprilMoon
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal, just amazing hotel. Great location!! Service ok, rooms were nice. Not even as small as NYC rooms usually are. Got upgraded for free on our arrival. We stayed for 8 nights. Only negative thing was that the hotel airport transfer is expensive. Beds were so comfy!! Just love the old, real NY feeling!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ed150
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights while attending a conference. Room was small and furnishings a bit worn (but a new flat screen TV), but everything was clean and in good working order. Unlike some others, I was able to manage the climate controls, though it took some time. The staff was efficient, if somewhat diffident. The location is excellent for anything in Midtown. I would definitely stay there again for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NYMAMANewHampshire
Reviews.Content: Wanted to treat myself to one of the "Grand Dames" of NYC Hotels. While the lobbyand restaurant are beautiful, the rest of the hotel was a disappointment. Because I checked in before 3:00, had to leave my bags. That's when everything fell apart. Sent to 3 different places to leave bags. Very disorganized. Long lines. Like being at the airport. Never had to go thru that at any other hotel. Then when I arrived that evening, no one was there to get my bags.Front desk had to call bell hop who insisted that he bring it to my room instead of me waiting for it. Guess why? When he brought it to my tiny, very warm room, he stood there and stared at me until I tipped him (for doing his job...late).

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Diggers1973
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at the Roosevelt hotel in New York city for 5 days over Valentines weekend 2009. When we arrived we were greeted by very friendly staff who are willing to help. When we checked in we were upgraded to a better room free of charge as they were a couple of better rooms spare. All of tehotel staff are very polite and willing to help the porters are very helpful and will give yu any advice you need. The hotel is very modern and the whole appearence is fantastic. Our room was great we had a huge bed and we had everything we needed in the room. The maidskept the rooms clean and tidy on a daily basis and are not in anyway intrusive. Thre is a wide choice of room service options in required. We could not have asked for a better located hotel, The Roosevelt is very well situated for Central park Rockefella centre and anything else you would wish to see/do whilst staying in NYC all with in a short walk/ Taxi ride away with some very good bars and deli's close by. Grand central station is 200yards from the hotel so commuting from the hotel is made very easy indeed. I would highly recommend Gordon Ramsay's "Maze" restauant which is at the London Hotel, And for more less informal dining there is "Eamon's bar and grill " which is 2 mins walk from the hotel. The hotel itself has a very good restaurant ad a shop which is open for much of the day. We were thoroughly impressed with our stay at the Roosevelt hotel and would happily return there if we decide to go back to NYC. I would highly recommend tis hotel to anyone planning on visiting NYC. I think for hotel atmoshpere, staff performance and room service quality this is one of the best hotels i have stay in outside of the UK.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: city of brotherly love and high taxes, PA
Reviews.Title: “good value, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: vinandtonic
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and I's 2nd stay at the Roosevelt. We had previously stayed there for new year's eve 2007-2008 and got upgraded to a king minisuite. This time we weren't so lucky, but the room was nice anyway. We were on the 9th floor and it was a bit of street noise on Friday afternoon but it was quiet in Saturday. It was clean and decently sized for NYC, and the bed was very comfortable. The towels were thick and the water pressure in the shower was great. We got a special deal that included free breakfast vouchers in the dining room. The food was adequate, with a good choice of hot dishes such as eggs, bacon, sausages, waffles, pancakes, and the usual cereal, bagels, toast, and juice or coffee. What we weren't told was that they charge you a $12 gratuity when you use the vouchers...and we had left a cash tip on the table. Oh well. Also, this hotel charges for internet service, which, for the price of the rooms, I think should be free. Regardless, the location is great, the staff is very friendly and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: IshPatrish
Reviews.Content: Yes, the cozy queen is really small but that is true of many hotel rooms in NYC. The room was nicely appointed, comfortable bed, and the bathroom recently remodeled--quite nice. The lobby is great, good bar and we found the staff helpful. The window opened which I feel is very important and this room was oriented to the interior of the block on a high floor so relatively quiet (for NYC). While you may not get an upgrade, it is always reasonable to ask for a quiet room with a window that opens. Tip, don't lug your bags up the stairs upon arrival, walk around to the right and down the hall to the elevators. And I can't say enough about the location--my favorite hotel area in the city because you can get everywhere quickly and easily. We stayed for a week and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Oilersguy
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel in an absolute perfect location (1.5 blocks from Grand Central Station and 5 blocks from Times Square). The staff was friendly and helpful with everything from taking care of our bags to recommending restaurants and making reservations. What the rooms lack in size, they make up for in comfort and cleanliness. I would definitely stay here again and have no problems recommending the Roosevelt to anyone who is thinking of going to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “What a great anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: anne1125
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip on Priceline and paid $115 a night (cozy queen). I called and asked for a king bed and they said they would mark our reservation with the request. When we checked in I told them it was our anniversary and they upgraded us again. We had a big, clean comfortable king room on the 11th floor. The location was perfect and it was nice to have the doorman to get us a cab when we needed one. We were happy to tip but we did not feel obligated or pressured to do so. Wonderful trip. Anne

Reviews.Title: “It was so New York”
Reviews.Author: acorn66
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel if you can afford it now - since 'Maid in Manhattan' (starring J-Lo) was filmed here I understand it has become quite expensive to stay here. However, It is in a fantastic location adjacent Grand Central Station and within easy walking distance of Broadway, Times Square and in the other direction, Central Park. When we travelled the hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas. We never ate in the hotel so can't comment on food but we did use the adjacent deli for breakfast which was very good & great fun - the price is based on weight of your plate full! It is a fabulous hotel; tasteful, elegant and very comfortable. It is old style grandeur without being stuffy and truly contributed to our New York experience.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded!!! For no reason!!!”
Reviews.Author: timwake
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend visited the roosevelt for 3 nights over valentines. We got to the front desk and were upgraded to a king superior room. OUR BED WAS MASSIVE! Nice room and clean with a plasma screen. The bathroom was a little dated and the bath was so shallow and the top drain in the bath was so low, so to have a decent bath you had to have the water running at all times, no both though, at least it was hot. Apart from this the room was so nice and what little time we spent in our room was comfortable. The lobby is amazing, nice classic marble and gold effect with a nice bar, however a beer and lemonade was $11 (a little expensive) but all hotels are. Overall we loved the roosevelt and would definately stay there again. BTW position was fantastic- 5th Ave 1 min walk, grand central 30 secs walk, times square 10 mins walk. Great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sackville
Reviews.Content: hotelbook.com were selling rates at $149.00 (before tax and service) so quite a good rate. I was here for only two nights on business and because of my schedule (and the weather) didn't get to go out too much. That said, the hotel is in a fabulous location with very easy walking up to Saks 5th Avenue, or a stones throw from Grand Central Station. This is a grand old hotel that might have seen it's day but generally has a nice feel to it. Check-in was quick and efficient and the corner room allocated was nice. The bed was well supplied with pillows etc but the same old slanting/tired mattress that you see in so many hotels these days, spoiled the chance of good sleep. The bathroom was OK but shower curtains just get in the way of a decent shower. (Why do hotels still have these unhealthy things?). Room service was good, if a tad pricey (as was the WiFi access) but my fault for not having time to venture out to the many eating places around the hotel. This is a HUGE old style NY hotel that has certainly seen the best of it's days, but has a few more to give having such a fab location. If you want an independent hotel with few airs and graces but a great place in the city - give The Roosevelt a thought.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: newbie44
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled to New York in November 2008 and decided to stay at the Roosevelt Hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. The check-in process was fast and easy, people at the reception desk friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in was in very good conditions, not big, but not small neither. The bed was very good, the bathroom was OK and clean. Location was great, within walking distance of the Central Station, 5th Avenue and Times Square. Only downside: the price of drinks at the bar, and of the food at the restaurant. Better off to eat and drink outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but typical old NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozwitch
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Roosevelt is the location right in midtown. Very convenient to Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, and Times Square etc. The rooms are tiny as you would expect. Our window faced a fire escape. Could hardly put our suitcases in the room without tripping over everything. Bed was good though, very comfy. Bathroom okay, no room to put 2 toilet bags. Lift is terrible. Wait for 10 minutes at least. A lot of people enter via the basement and slow everything down. We were on the 12th floor and honestly it's better to walk down if you are not burdened by cases. Very very busy but then it was July so couldn't expect anything else. Room service is patchy. If you have an issue, don't expect to resolve it over the phone. Save yourself the trouble and go down to the lobby and sort it out there. Lobby overcrowded and nowhere to sit. People were queueing for a place to park themselves while they waited for service or the concierge. Again, it was July I know, but that's when you see a hotel at its worst. Staff seemed inured to the chaos. Concierge was very good on the other hand, knew everything about tickets, restaurants, subway etc. This is also an aircrew hotel so sometimes a couple of crews will be checking in and out in front of you. Can't imagine how frustrating it must be for them to stay here, though. Wouldn't want to stay here more than a couple of nights. If you are staying a week or so, bite the bullet and find an apartment hotel or condo for short stays. If we had to stay in that tiny room for a week my partner and I would have murdered each other probably. Bottom line: standard old NY hotel. Great location for tourists. Reasonably priced for what it is. Just don't expect anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with some faults”
Reviews.Author: mgstiles
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Roosevelt the weekend of Feb.6-8. The trip was a surprise to celebrate her birthday. We were seeing 2 shows and doing alot of shopping so the location was perfect. We were able to take the airtrain and the subway from JFK to the 5th Ave/53rd St. stop and walk the 8 blocks- very easy (50 minutes). It is also only two blocks to catch the subway at Grand Central to go downtown. I had booked the hotel through Expedia and got a rate of 118 (this included the taxes), which is why I chose it! The room I booked was a "cozy queen" but we were upgraded to a king upon arrival. The room was on the 7th floor with a view of the interior (this reduced noise at night, although this is a quiet area of midtown). Our room wasn't big but all we did was sleep there. There was no coffee maker but Blake and Todds across the street had great breakfasts and coffee. The bathroom was small and the tub didn't drain well but we managed just fine. Our room wasn't cleaned on Saturday even though we were gone from 9:30 until 5:00. Since we were only there 2 nights I wasn't too concerned about it, and I didn't feel bad not leaving a tip for the maid. The concierge held our bags on Sunday for us for no charge. I have stayed at the Parc Central, Warwick, Intercontinental, and Wellington and for the price this was perfect. I would much rather have the money in my pocket to spend on other things while in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: c8320
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely brilliant! I was nervous initially as some of the reviews on here are a little negative. Check in was prompt and friendly, although as it was for my 21st birthday i think we were going to be offered an upgrade, until they realised that what booked through expedia. what difference that makes???? i dont know! But the room given was lovely and we were on the 12th floor and far far away from the lifts so it was soooo quiet. However i did take earplugs just incase. The bed linen and bathroom was clean and it was of a really good size too. As it was our first time to New York, location was very important and this hotel was in the perfect place! we walked EVERYWHERE and only got a cab to and from the airport. Obviously you need to be in reasonably good shape to do that but it worked well for us. We didnt seem to have a probem with staff expecting tips, however do make sure that you carry lots of $1 bills, otherwise you may find yourself giving $5 for a guy to carry 2 bags down three stairs like we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Are Basic”
Reviews.Author: damons
Reviews.Content: My wife went for a conference and I came up a couple of days later. The rooms are a nice size but the amenities are few. No Coffee maker in the room. The ironing board was never put away and the beds were just straightened, not changed. The bath room is small. There is no separate vanity and no counter space. It is a pedestal sink. Good for a couple of nights but not for a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: LDS5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel from 2nd Feb till the 7th Feb 2009. We got a taxi from JFK which including tolls came to just under $50. We arrived at the hotel at about 4.30-5pm joined the small queue to check in. Check in was really easy just give your name show some photo ID (passport) and they need a credit card to authorise for any incidentals. I only had my bank card so handed that over but nothing was charged. We were booked into a cozy room but were upgraded at check in to a superior room. Sounds good but the only difference is the room is slightly bigger and has 2 double beds. The beds were really comfy if not slightly small , but we have a big bed at home so could just be us. The bathroom was compact but perfectly fine. The hotel is incredibly warm so we had to have the air on nearly all the time but you get used to it. Our room was on the 16th floor it was cleaned everyday and we had fresh towels everyday. This hotel is ideal if you are going to be out exploring New york everything is within walking distance and grand central station is just across the road. We didn't eat in the hotel although it did look nice we ate out as it was cheaper. When it was time to leave we checked out which just involved us handing over our door key and asked the doorman to order us a car, we got a lincoln town car back to JFK which was $60 including tip.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel practices credit card fraud”
Reviews.Author: old-man-orange
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 12-26-2008 for the Mid-Winter Special for $209 including room and breakfast buffet for two. The checkout bill correctly had the $209 + taxes. Later my credit card had another $56 as a second charge. WELL ... after several phone calls and being hung up on by rude staff (everyone who works there is miserable). They charged me another $56 for breakfast that was already included. After wasting too much time on phone I file a Dispute with AMEX and that takes 2 months to get money and is a hassle. I spoke to a lady Pearl in Accounting Dept ... who does not return phone calls and is basically a liar. Now that I think of it it is 2nd time this has happened here .... I think it is a part of their routine

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: simonsimonsimon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here from the 17th Jan for a week. It was a perfect place to stay! The only drawback was on the last day, they stored our luggage, and when we went to get them to go to the airport, They said "this service is free, however a gratuatary tip is often given" All her did was carry my case down one flight of stairs (3 in total) and then made to feel uncomfortable when we were resting in the lobby afterwards and as we left. Anyway, DONT LET THAT PUT YOU OFF... ...The hotel is in a perfect location for Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Bloomingdales, Macy's and the main sights! Times square was only a 10 minute walk, and that was walking slowly. Walking up 5th Ave to central park was about 20 minutes, or about 5 hours if you stop in the shops. Metlife building is litterally accross the road where you can get to Grand Central, or, if you go out of the main door of the hotel, straight accross the road is a tiny entrance to Grand Central!! You would nt notice it unless you where next to it. The room was clean and a good size. with a nice plasma HD tv, but when in new york do you spend it in the room?? The only time we did was to recharge batteries on the camara and legs. The maids were friendly and always said hello and reception staff were pleasent, so i do not know what other people are on about! Ask for a high floor, then you get better views. We had a view of the rockerfella.

Reviews.Title: “Ask yourself what you want in a NYC hotel and this place ticks every box.”
Reviews.Author: mambogb
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 6 nights and I am so glad I booked it and didn't listen to the negative reviews on here. Ask yourself what you want from a NYC hotel and the Roosevelt ticks all the boxes. 1] Location: you don't need to use the subway. This place is within walking distance of all the major attractions. 2] Safety: It is located within a busy area at the heart of NY so no matter the time you always feel safe. 3] Room size: The rooms are fair for NY where everything is generally small. If you will use it as a crash pad it will suit your needs completely. 4] Staff: Generally pleasant. Others have complained about the cleaning staff but I found them to be outstanding. You also never get pressured to leave the room. If you have a don't disturb sign and leave your room late make sure you put the please clean my room sign when you leave. How else are the staff to know you have gone? 5] Tipping: I never felt pressured into giving tips. Staff asked if you required assistance and obviously you tip if you get help. But if you don't want help simply say no.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JocelynK
Reviews.Content: First the demerits of the hotel : Room cleanup was abit late daily though, once I waited til 3pm and my room wasn't cleaned up yet. Room was pretty small (lacking in space to comfortably open up my luggage) Work table was also too small for anything more than a tiny laptop, I had to use the laptop from the bed most of the time & eating in the room was tedious. Now for the merits (which greatly overwhelms the demerits in my opinion) The hotel was in a great location; I could walk almost everywhere from it - to the Empire State Building, Fifth Ave Shopping, Broadway. Subway was very very near as well (just behind the hotel) when I decided to head to Guggenheim / Tokyo Met museum. there's a korean supermarket/eatery which opens til late very near it if you need any late snacks / pizza (pizza was great), and generally lively area which was safe to walk around alone in the day/night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie99
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is great if you are looking for a decently priced hotel in midtown Manhattan. The best feature about this hotel is obviously it's location on 45th Street @ Madison Ave, which is a stone's throw from Grand Central station making public transport a breeze. The hotel room itself was clean, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the size of the room was decent for NYC. I only have to minor, negative comments. I feel as though the bathroom could use an update as it wasn't in perfect condition and clearly showed the age of the hotel. Also, there didn't seem to be many accessible electrical outlets, which made plugging in multiple devices difficult (particularly with two people staying in the room). Overall the hotel is a decent choice and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: NAAAT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The location of the hotel is perfect. The whole impression was average: the hall, lifts and rooms need refreshment. The room was rather small but clean and cosy. The bed was comfortable (a little bit soft for me). The condition worked not very well (too loudly). Our window looked on hotels ventilation system and that was unpleasant and also noisy even when the window was cloused.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: DMJON
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and would say ignore bad reviews.I am fussy but found hotel 2 be clean and all staff helpful.We did not eat at hotel as prices were steep!Just across the road is a gr8 deli where we had breakfast every day.Would def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: JourneyJen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roosevelt three times. Each time, I found it to be a good, affordable option when visiting New York. The Roosevelt is not a high-end luxury hotel. Nor is it a typical chain hotel. But, the rooms are clean and generally well-kept. For touring Manhattan, the location is great. It is a short walk to a number of sites and is close to Grand Central Station for public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great outside, poor inside”
Reviews.Author: Guybrush79
Reviews.Content: Great position, in the heart of midtown Manhattan, in front of Grand Central Station. Great hall and nice gym. Really really small and old room, bathroom awful. Considering that I payed about 220$ per room per night. Be aware that you will be asked to tip to: 1) take your luggage from the street to the elevator 2) take your luggage from the elevator to the room 3) take your luggage inside the deposit 4) take your luggage outside of the deposit This is way too much for me.

Reviews.Title: “unsatisfactory service”
Reviews.Author: love2travel123_9
Reviews.Content: We were really excited to go to the roosevelt for the night, we only stayed one night, we being me and my boyfriend. Upon arriving there we had to queue for 20 minutes in order to check in. This alone would have been okay but upon finally checking in at around 7pm we were told are room was still not ready. With little choice in the matter we left our bags with the concierge and went for dinner and a walk we came back an hour and a half later. There was only one other couple in the queue in front of us yet we were stood there for 30 minutes this time and slowly the queue built up behind us, meanwhile they have only 2 people on reception only one of whom is dealing with check ins. What made it worse was some people just walked up passed the queue and the staff on reception served them before all the people who had been waiting there. Anyway we finally checked in and found are room and just wanted to have a bath. Loan behold the bath plug was not airtight so after waiting 10 minutes for the water to get hot we ran our bath only to find shortly after all the water to be draining out. Naturally we called reception and were told after our evening of waiting we would have to wait 30-45 minutes for someone to come fix our bath. The man came and went to fix our bath and we proceeded to run one again only to find the man had not fixed the problem anyway we called again and after another 15 minutes we had our bath fixed. Unfortunately at this point we were both too exhausted to enjoy it. Overall it seems the roosevelt needs to be more efficient and reduce waiting time as it is the last thing people want to face after travelling.

Reviews.Title: “The Rooseveldt Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: awjrfam
Reviews.Content: Despite the bad reviews it got recently I and my 17 year old daughter stayed there for a few days just before Xmas 2008. - we quite liked it and I hardly tipped anyone except at the bar etc.- nor was asked to do so! As for it being a bit run-down, after all it is a very old establishment. A few weeks earlier I had stayed with my two sons at the neighbouring Hyatt - newer, more elegant but not not really very different! And the bathtub drain was clogged!~ AWJR

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: bertiecat
Reviews.Content: I have been working in Hotels for the past 4 years, and if I had ever dared to behave such as the Roosevelt Hotel employee, I would have got fired! This should probably say enough of my stay! I addition, I believe the management is poor: in 4 diamond Hotels it cannot take you one hour to check your baggage in. It is ridiculous! The fun part was sharing incredible nasty customer service stories with the other people of the Hotel. DON”T GO THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Get Ready to tip everyone.....who works there”
Reviews.Author: josefb
Reviews.Content: When you arrive get ready for tipping first the porter just for opening the the door for you he looks forward for a tip, then we went to check-inn which was fast but room wasn't ready but we where early, we didn't mind so we gave the luggage to the guy who controls the luggae room- , he asked for money, then again when we picked the luggage, and when we where leaving same routine, even to book a cab from concierge you have to pay a tip, Greedy staff............ The room wasn't that bad (half clean mind you) comftable bed, but when you enter the bathroom you will have a shock, it's a room with an old sink and a curtuian in the middle of the room. The good thing a bout this hotel it''s in a central area of manhattan, it's in a quite area and it's very safe and the lobby is very nice which looks like a 5 star hotel. For the price we paid i think it was overpriced for the standard of the hotel we paid around 350.00 dollars nightly....

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Foodcritic266
Reviews.Content: Hello, We were in New York during the holidays and we stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel. It was definetly not the freshest hotel we stayed at. Everything seemed old, dusty and in desperate need of renevation. The amount of dust whiche we had in our room was shocking. It was almost difficult to breath when we were in out beds. Not mentioning the bathroom whiche can problem remember Franklin Roosevelt. The staff was not very helpful and they were always in a bad mood. The room service was expensive and bad. The food was cold and strange looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SurreyJules
Reviews.Content: Our dealings through the hotels website and over the phone was really good, the staff we dealt with on the phone were polite and helpful, so I was sort of expecting the same when we arrived. We didn't arrive at the hotel until 11pm, it was lashing down with rain and there was no bellman, a guy who was staying at the hotel helped us in with our luggage, and were we glad he did as there was a flight of stairs to climb to the lobby. There were bellmen at their desk and they watched this guy carry our bags up the stairs, offered no help and were very dismissive when he informed them that there was no bellman outside to help us. The reception staff were also dismissive, after I gave my name to check in a registration form was plonked in front of me to sign, we were handed our room key and told "you're on the 16th floor".......in a very bored voice. The room was very shabby and we actually thought they had given us the wrong room. We booked a superior room with 2 double beds, and it certainly didn't match up to the photos or description on their site. We asked at the front desk (a different person than before) to check we were in the right room and was told in the same indifferent, bored voice that "yes, it's a superior" we stated we weren't very happy, there was wallpaper peeling off, the enamel was peeling off the bath, and were told "there's no other rooms available" and then turned away from us. So great service is NOT one of their strong points, especially the reception staff. The bellmen got better while we were there and we ended up quite liking them, they were very helpful. The room was very small and very shabby, as I described earlier, in fact it was so small that you couldn't pull the chair out from under the desk as it hit the foot of the bed. The lobby is fantastic, and when you've seen that and the photos of the hotel rooms on the website it was a real letdown to walk into our room. Although we were there in the middle of December, the room was boiling. Even with the window open and the air con on full blast it was still roasting. Food is very expensive and I wouldn't recommend room service, costs a fortune and it wasn't very good either, but there are so many places nearby to eat that doesn't really matter. Another huge annoyance was no coffee/tea making facilities in the room or mini bar for a cold drink. BUT the huge plus that would make me stay there again (now I know what to expect) is the location. It was perfect - right around the corner from 5th ave, a few blocks from Empire State, right around the corner from Grand Central, a few blocks from Times Square.......we walked EVERYWHERE........the location is what really sells this hotel, so if all you want is a bed for the night with no frills and want to be right in the heart of everything then I would definately use this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Run-Down”
Reviews.Author: travel02906
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in New York often and know it is difficult to find good hotels there for less than $200. We paid about 140 for this via Priceline. For that price, I've stayed at nicer places in the city - difficult to do but possible and worth looking. I would urge everyone to stay clear of this hotel. The rooms are suitable if you have low standards and don't mind ratty furniture and carpets. Any couple looking for a nice or romantic place should be especially weary since there is nothing even remotely romantic about the rooms - we felt like we were staying in the shining. When looking at the pics of the website, be aware the rooms look much better than they actually are - take those room pics and subtract 20 years of wear and tear. Not worth the even bargain price we paid. Btw, rude staff and poor service don’t matter to me, but clean rooms do. As for the staff, they were nice enough although the lobby was very crowded. The whole hotel felt run down and musty. Also, this is my first review ever but the experience was bad enough to urge me to write this review. Would hate to see other people waste their money on this place. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price, Needs a Facelift”
Reviews.Author: youngyaya
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is awesome and the package I got with our airfare made it very affordable. However, I will caution that it badly needs a facelift, sort of what you would have expected in the mid-eighties. We had booked a non-smoking room and it wasn't available. When we got off the elevator, the entire hallway had a haze to it. Surprisingly, our room wasn't too bad for smell and we had been given a corner room which was about three times as large as a normal NYC room. My other caution is with regard to the bell desk. I had made arrangements to get a set fare car to the airport and was told it wouldn't be a problem, to return in an hour and it would be waiting. When we returned, I was told by a different staff member that there were no set fare cars available but that he had a cab ready to take me. I protested and suddenly the town car sitting right in front of the building was mine, as previously arranged. I had earlier seen money surreptitiously changing hands between the cabbies and the bellmen. Now I understand why. We didn't spend much time in our room, so this met our needs. If you plan on seeing a lot and are not concerned about hotel amenities, this is a good location and price for a home base.

Reviews.Title: “Good All Rounder”
Reviews.Author: Benji-x
Reviews.Content: Had read mixed reviews about this hotel but I personally found it fine. It is what it claims to be. A well located hotel with old world charm. Old world charm doesn't come with shiny new appliances as a result the furniture may be a bit battered but everything was clean, rooms were well equipped and service was professional. The hotel has character and a personality. The lobby and liunge area have the wow factor on arrival and it's nice to sit around and soak up the atmosphere. Put on a dress, sip a cocktail (€€€€) sorted!

Reviews.Title: “No No No ...”
Reviews.Author: Nata78
Reviews.Content: I am travelling a lot and seen a lot of countries and hotels, but this one was the worst hotel I have ever been in. There is NOTHING good in this hotel, it's just in the good location. Hotel badly needs renovation, it's so and too old, probably never been renovated since ... Sorry, but if you have used to quality, cleaness and better service find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Jaded. Give it a pass.”
Reviews.Author: Vancouverabc123
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving we were excited about staying in a real New York hotel, like we had seen in the movies. On arriving, several bellhops stood around watching while my wife and I hauled our heavy suitcases up the large set of stairs into the lobby. Only once we finally got to the top did any one of them come forward offering to help. Throughout our stay the staff always seemed to expect a tip, which I expected, but not for doing almost nothing for us. The front desk staff seemed jaded and indifferent. The rooms were small, as we had expected, but also not in good shape. The bathroom shower system was terrible, leaving pools of water all over the floor. There was no coffee maker or any extras in the room whatsoever. And it seemed like it could use a good thorough cleaning, or at least a good renovation. The concierge was helpful in helping us to plan our activities, although again he seems jaded and really didn't offer anything more than the bare limits of his job description. The brunch was tasty, but expensive so it had better be. Overall, this hotel was not a good experience for our first time to New York. I would definitely not go back. We popped in to some other hotels while wandering around New York, and most times we were warmly greeted, unlike the Rosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Ignore the Other Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: PuffpuffSurrey
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked through Travel Zoo where it was a featured offer - superior room with breakfast. My husband and I went to New York for my 'much dreaded' birthday and we mentioned this at check-in. We were delighted to find out we had been upgraded to a suite which I later found out cost $1700 per night! The suite was spotlessly clean and enormous - we had a lounge with a sofa and two armchairs, coffee tables and two 42" wide screen televisions! There was a kitchen area and a dining room area for 4 people to eat! The breakfast was great and well worth having because you didn't need to eat for the rest of the day. Huge choices of cooked food plus omelettes (the omelette cook was pretty miserable but her omelettes were great) and waffles to order. Loads of fresh fruit and freshly cooked bread and pastries. The location is great, 5 mins from Grand Central Station and you could walk to 5th Avenue, the Rockerfeller Centre and most other places. We bought a one day bus pass (the downtown route is the best) and if your time is limited this is the best thing you can do. You simply get on and off as you want. The price for the ticket from the hotel concierge is the same price as at the bus stop and of course you can pay by credit card which you might prefer. I am sorry that other people didn't have such a great time as us, but I really can't fault this hotel in anyway. Special thanks to Paulette for the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal73
Reviews.Content: My mom and I recently took a quick 2-day trip to NYC to enjoy the Christmas decorations. We stayed at the Roosevelt b/c we stayed there back in 1995 and it was ok. It has since been renovated and it is really nice. It's very clean, safe, comfortable, and convenient. The price was great too - less than $150/night which seems to be a deal based on my research for this time of year in Manhattan. The only negative thing I noticed was the room was a bit noisy. But who goes to NYC to sit in a hotel room?? I would definitely stay at the Roosevelt again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not fabulous, not terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Reussite1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here 2 nights on a business trip and have to agree with previous 2 posts. The lobby is very impressive (especially when all decked out in its holiday finery) and the location is really great, both for proximity to tourist sites (Rockefeller Center, Times Square) & the city's commercial center (for my business appointments, at least). The rooms are perfectly serviceable, but not extraordinary. Overall I feel like the place could've done with a good dusting and carpet cleaning. As for room size, I booked a "cozy queen" room (and we all know that "cozy" is just a euphemism for minuscule), so I was expecting the room to be the size of a broom closet, but was pleasantly surprised to find that it was a decent size. I also stayed here years ago, since which time the hotel has been renovated, and it's definitely much better than it used to be. I would most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: thewanderer21
Reviews.Content: ..great location for shopping,, not a child friendly hotel but great for couples and business people. ..lobby is stunning, rooms very basic, holes in bed linen, dust behind and under bed inch thick, curtains look as though they have never been washed, no tea and coffee facilities. ..staff keep themselves to themselves but polite when approached. ..if you love shopping and got lots of money to spend then this is an amazing place, however due to the recent economic problems bargins were very few and far between.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Not so sure about the staff”
Reviews.Author: ProHolidayer
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were staying in New York for sight seeing and Christmas shopping. The Roosevelt had a great location and we were really pleased when we checked in. However we found the staff very pushy and rude where tips were concerned - on our arrival at the hotel we had no change as we'd just travelled from the airport, and the concierge waited until my bf had to scrabble around finding his smallest note. Then as we were leaving we were verbally abused at the front of the hotel by the concierge for only having a one dollar bill. I know americans expect tips, and we have no problem giving a tip when we have had good service - but this guy had just hailed us a cab! That was his job! We were really disappointed by the attitude of the staff. Our room was nice, the bed was very 'squishy' (almost too soft for me) and the air con rattled like nothing i'd ever heard! But otherwise the room was good. It wasn't the greatest room i'd ever stayed in, but i've never stayed elsewhere in NY so perhaps this was excellent for this price range! Overall, the hotel was good and i would probably stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: 1234fla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights and had a great time. The location was literally across the street from Grand Central which provided great transportation access and also lots of food options. The hotel is (if you are in reasonably good shape) walking distance to Empire State Bldg, Rockefellor Center and Times Sqare. Rooms are sizable for NYC and bathroom is not spacious but far better than many other NYC hotels I've stayed at. I will recommed this hotel to anyone going to NYC to sight see.

Reviews.Title: “Giving thanks for the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: cwcharacters
Reviews.Content: I spent Thanksgiving, as I do each year, in New York City. I try a different hotel each time and this trip it was the Roosevelt. The Roosevelt is a "grand old hotel" in a fabulous location on 45th & Madison. I booked a deluxe room and I am glad that I did, as peeking into "superior" rooms, I saw that they are quite small. I called Alan in guest services well in advance of my trip to ask for a spacious, bright, quiet room with a bathtub. He said he'd take care of it and he did! My room was just what I needed, on a corner with plenty of light, and on the top floor (18). The bed was quite comfy and the room well appointed. Flat screen TV and safe, but no in-room coffee maker or robes. The age of the crown moulding was showing and the bathroom small, but over all, this was a very pleasant room. I did meet Alan when he came to make sure that I was taken care of and I showed my appreciation for his attention monitarily. He continued to be at my disposal throughout my stay, even sending up a refrigerator at no charge. The water pressure was weak, to say the least, and it took quite some time to fill the bathtub, although the shower was fine. There is no view to speak of at the hotel. The lobby bar was a nice place to have a drink and watch people move through the holiday-decorated lobby. The food was quite good, especially the enormous crab cake. Prepare for New York prices though. The staff, especially the maids, were extremely pleasant and helpful. All-in-all, I would recommend the Roosevelt. You can't beat the location (2 blks from Grand Central) and the value for what you get. Way to go Alan! Thanks for a great Thanksgiving!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: engineer21
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel, wow really good hotel, well mannerd staff and helpful, looks great espeically in the reception and bar. The room wasnt quite as amazing as we had thought when booking as room only contained king size bed, chest of drawers, desk and desk chair with bedside cabinats and of course en suite, and it was quite small but too be honest your in New York and the hotel location on 5th avenue makes it an awesome hotel great for sightseeing and getting around everythings so close - can walk too Times Square, Rockafeller, Emprie State, Central Park. We stayed 7 nights and it was great I wouldnt recommed breakfast esp not if your on holiday as its so much easier too have bagels etc the choice is endless we had breakfast once it was average. Overall 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Laura Z
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend stay at the Roosevelt. Met some girlfriends there so we had two rooms. One was a nicer corner room with a king. The other a smaller room with two queens. It was definitely on the smaller side (normal for NY, I understand) but it was not a problem for both of us to get ready at once. PROS: great location! Walking distance to Times Square, Theatre district, Grand Central Station. Hardly ever a wait for a taxi. Charming lobby. Comfortable rooms CONS: The room, especially the bathroom, was always sooo warm. It was freezing outside and the room was too warm! I also had a problem with the shower going between hot and cold. (I never had time to complain because we were so busy). Summary: I would say that it was a good bang for the buck. We got a really good deal through Travelzoo.com.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Spainin2008
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast and friendly....got an upgrade when I mentioned this was my "retirement trip". Helpful, prompt staff. Room was great, with extras, also. Iron and ironing board, fantastic bed. I WILL stay there again. An exceptional location.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the ROOSEVELT”
Reviews.Author: wiz1964
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New york, stayed for 5 days at the Roosevelt Hotel on 45th street, after reading very contrasting reports i was a bit unsure about staying there but please be reassured, my daughter and i arrived on the Saturday evening, checked straight in and shown to rooms within minutes( room 1214) it was a twin room with two queen size beds, lovely and clean with everything you should require while staying in the big apple, the hotel is a good example of a traditional hotel, it is not ultra chic, or modern but it does the job, everythin worked and the staff were all very friendly and helpful, the lobby is beautiful with a super xmas tree in the centre, bar prices expensive but everwhere was expensive, Location was excellent only a short walk from to TImes Square, Grand Central Station and the Empire state building, and for cheap breakfast you cant beat THE BROOKLYN BAGEL BAR opposite the empire state building bit scruffy looking but gorgeous coffee only 1 dollar and bagels to die for, a very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Majestic, dream came true”
Reviews.Author: Msshinohara
Reviews.Content: The first time I visited New York. Me and my wife are enchanted. Roosevelt is really above average and the location is the best. Nearby 5th and Times Square. You can walk to Empire State, Rockefeller Center, Broadway. Good Service and nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: lianne26
Reviews.Content: The Bar is extremely over priced ($10 for a small/bad glass of wine) and smells of wet dog, but the rest of the lobby was grand enough. The Christmas tree had just gone up and it looked amazing. The room we stayed in was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. The facilities were clean and modern. The location is what sells this hotel, walking distance to most of the top attractions and right next to Grand Central Station for the rest of them.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MMDNY
Reviews.Content: My husband, two young daughters, and I stayed at the Roosevelt this past weekend. Everyone was very friendly and granted requests cheerfully, and our room was large and clean. We really enjoyed staying at the Roosevelt, and again, the staff were really so pleasant that they made our whole stay even more enjoyable than it already was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: rmartMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel. The hotel is right across the street from Grand Central Terminal. We walked there for breakfast and dinner. There is a Rite Aid located there where we purchased snacks and bottled water. The hotel is a short walk from Times Square, Rockefeller Center and the Empire State Building. We were able to walk to most of the attractions and only had to use the subway one day of our stay. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. There were a few stains on the carpet in the hallway and a few small tears in the carpet in our room, but it didn't affect the quality of our stay. The shower head was loose, but the water ran just fine and we had plenty of hot water. We are a family of four and our room rate included breakfast for two. We were given breakfast vouchers when we checked in. My husband and I ate breakfast in the hotel and then took our two boys to a local Dunkin Donuts. One morning we decided to skip breakfast at the hotel and save the vouchers. We we planning to use four breakfast vouchers our last day at the hotel. We were later advised that we could use no more than two vouchers/day. We ended up going to Grand Central for breakfast and threw away the last four vouchers. I think the hotel could have allowed our family of four to use the remaining vouchers on the same day. We were entitled to free breakfast, but lost out because of the hotel policy of only two vouchers/day. Overall we had a very good stay and I would definitely stay there again. The location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good and friendly”
Reviews.Author: rn4trips124
Reviews.Content: I have found the reviews here to be helpful, so I am just returning the favor. I recently moved to upstate New York and travel to NYC fairly frequently for short stays. I have stayed at the Roosevelt several times. I have stayed with my 2 daughters as older teens /twenties , with my husband, as well as solo. Despite a few problems (which were quickly and cheerfully corrected) I gotta say I really like this hotel. It has a nice "feel". The lobby is wonderful in the "grand old" sense, the location is perfect if you are using Grand Central station for comings and goings, it is safe and friendly even for a woman traveling solo, the bar is welcoming and the bartenders know their stuff. The food is quite good at the hotel, but also good and much cheaper in the little diners, etc. throughout the city. Be aware that prices for drinks are high, as they are everywhere in New York (not just the City). Paying $10 - $12 for a cocktail or glass of wine is no biggie. I generally pay $150 - $225 US to stay here, and if I can't get a room at that price, I look elsewhere. At $150 / night a room here is a steal, even if it is of the not-as-lovely variety . At $225 / night it is still a good deal. I doubt I would pay over $275 NOT because the rooms and hotel aren't worth it, but because I know the city and where to find a better deal. Be aware that, as is the case with many hotels that have some "history", rooms may vary significantly in size, configuration, view, and decor, and the price does not always reflect this difference. I have stayed in a lovely, bright, large corner room with a huge bathroom and have also been assigned a less lovely, somewhat dark room...and paid essentially the same price. have had occasional problems with the rooms- once I was assigned a room with a poorly functioning air conditioner and another time the room was unacceptable due to conditions others have cited, however, I am impressed by the response of the staff in quickly, and without argument, assigning me a different room. In my experience, check-in , check out is always smooth, altho I rarely check in or out at peak times. The hotel will gladly store your bags if you get in early or have to wait after check out for a train, plane, or whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Small, mold, blocked Fox News”
Reviews.Author: WT123
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms. Closet was not even wide enough to hang my suits! Mold on walls around soap dish in extremely small shower. Not room to walk around bed with carry on bag on the floor. TV index shows FoxNews but upon entering that channel could not get. Called front desk and they said that channel was blocked and after asking why and was hung up on. I will not stay here again. However great location, but there are many other hotels in area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prpldy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great - right near Grand Central Station, near the UN, some nice restaurants, etc. The lobby is lovely, but the rooms leave much to be desired. While I expect small in NYC, I don't expect dirty. Terrible to feel that you need a shower after you've taken a shower. We couldn't pull the curtains without using shoes to hold them back because the curtains hung over the air vents which blew all of the dirt and dust from the curtains throughout the room. The vents in the air conditioning/heating unit needed serious cleaning. While I usually don't use in-room movies - no issue here since they didn't provide any. The cable was also limited and no in-room coffee makers. The concierge was a bit behind the times - when I asked if he could check us in on our airlines via the internet p he didn't have a clue - finally we were able to find the business center and for a fee were able to check-in from there. The positives: the beds were comfortable - and there are now comforters that seemed clean, but the dust ruffles could have used some cleaning; and, the hotel did provide umbrellas and luggage storage. For such a grand old hotel it was rather disappointing that they have not been able to keep the rooms up to the same standard as the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and location.”
Reviews.Author: Bkrbtch69
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel this past week and we were very pleased, the staff was really friendly. We were able to check in at 1:00 PM; our room had a crapy view on the third floor between the two towers and we could only see outside our window a flooding terrace, but we can live with that. The beds are really comfy and the pillows too. Everything was working and clean in the bed and the bathroom. Spacious closet. I think the price of the food is a little high but when you it is late, you can't walk anymore and are extremely tired, this is a good option. Food is good and service is great at the Restaurant, they go the extra mile for you. Right across the street there is an entrance to a passage to Grand Central Station and the little cafeteria Cosí is a good place to get a good breakfast. I would stay again there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but a few hiccups”
Reviews.Author: meena482
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt last Christmas, and it was a great experience. That is why I was disappointed with our stay there this weekend. We arrived at 2:45, after at seven hour drive, only to be told that we could not check-in until 3:30, despite the fact that check-in is at 3:00. The man at the front desk was completely unaccommodating and bordered on rude. He started our trip off on the wrong foot, and it was really frustrating. At 3:30 we were able to check-in to room 819. I was disappointed with the room, as it was slightly smaller and rather run down compared to the room we received last year. It really wasn't bad though. It was quite clean, and fairly comfortable. The Roosevelt is the warmest hotel I have ever stayed in! The temperature at night made it difficult for me to sleep. I had the same problem the first time I stayed there, and I am normally a very cold person. We had our AC cranked the entire time we were there and it was still hot! The hotel is very close to Times Square, Grand Central Terminal and shopping, but the area lacks character. It's an easy subway ride to more unique neighbourhoods though. Anyway I guess our stay was fine, but there were a few hiccups.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: mandulka
Reviews.Content: As most reviews were quite positive about this hotel, we decided to stay here on our anniversary!What a mistake!!! Right from the beginning we were having problems. The person who checked us in was VERY arrogant and rude!As he wouldn't give us a nice deluxe room even though it was our anniversary and we came all the way from London, UK we asked for a room with a nice view.Well, our great view(as he described it!) was right in the corner overlooking another guest room!The room itself was very tiny. The bathroom was not better either, the paint was peeling off and the bathtub wasn't cleaned properly. We went back to reception to ask for a room with better standards and were told they are all the same! Shock of a lifetime and they were charging us $400 a night! Eventually we were moved to another room,same standard but at least cleaner.Our door had a huge gap at the bottom so you could clearly hear everything that was going on in the corridors.By this time we kind of accepted the fact that we were conned by the hotel but because it was nearly midnight and we were tired there was not much we could do. AS we were getting ready for bed we realized how cold it was so we called for an engineer to look at the heating system.He arrived within 5 minutes but as he was trying to fix the heater it blew!This meant we had to move room again in the middle of the night with 2 big suitcases and no help at all!At this point I was ready to start world war 3 at reception for all that they put us through.They clearly didn't want to argue so they upgraded us to a suite!Now that was probably worth the $400 as we got 2 bathrooms,a huge bedroom and an even bigger sitting room and dining room! I would not recomment this hotel to anyone!It's a rip off,the rooms are very dated and the staff have serious attitude problems.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, forced to have a smoking room”
Reviews.Author: awilsonTexas
Reviews.Content: The location and the lobby/bar area is great. Aside from that, this place is a dump. Two girls at the front desk were so rude to us. They had given away our Queen Non Smoking room by the time we checked in (10pm), so instead they have us a room with a double bed on a SMOKING floor. The place reeked of stale smoke. We were told that our reservation doesn't guarantee a particular room (??). They couldn't find our reservation in the computer. I made the arrangements online, but they acted like it wasn't legitimate- it was their website!! They don't care if you complain- apparently they don't need or want your business!! They had already charged my credit card and it was late at night, or I would have left. But I'll take my $350/nt somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: OldAgePensioner
Reviews.Content: After trawling through the Manhattan hotel reviews, we picked this one as it seemed to have more positive reviews than others. It is in a good location and easy to get hold of taxis, buses and subways. When we arrived about midday our room wasn't ready, we were told we were 24th in line for a room. There was no problem leaving our cases with the porter while we went out to explore, and our room was ready when we got back; they had told us to come back in a couple of hours and we did. There was no problem, either, looking after our cases when we checked out too because we didn't leave New York until much later in the day. We booked a CozyQueen, but when I told them it was our anniversary (true!) they upgraded us to a room with a king-size bed on the 6th floor. It was a nice good size room with an unspectacular view from the window. The weather was hot (low 70's in October!) and the air-conditioning was noisey. The choice was to have it on and be kept awake or turn it off and be baking hot. You could switch it on Low or High but both settings were noisey. The room was a good size and so was the bathroom. A small complaint about the bathroom was that the basin had a large crack in it, which didn't make it very hygenic. Also there was mold growing on the grouting of a few of the tiles around the bath, and the bath itself seemed to be pockmarked. Nothing very much to complain about, but the room wasn't cheap and I would expect better. We had good water pressure, but I overheard another guest in the lift say that on their floor higher up there was practically no pressure. The hotel did announce they were turning off the hot water for some maintenance during the day so that could have been part of the reason. The hotel has a Business Centre where you can use the Internet, but at a price. It was USD10.00 for 30 minutes or you could use it with a credit card where the minimum charge was USD3.00. Overall, a nice hotel where I would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “World class”
Reviews.Author: NYCNi
Reviews.Content: In short, this hotel is a dream come true. From the 16th to the 23rd of December last year my partner and I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel NYC. Entering the hotel is like entering the set of a romantic movie. As you walk up the staircase into the lobby you are greeted by a beautifully decorated Christmas tree and a host of friendly staff and guests. The whole atmosphere sent butterflies to my stomach. I had looked forward to this trip so much, I was afraid encase I had set my expectations too high and was almost anticipating an anticlimax, but to my delight it was everything I had hoped it would be and more. After an extremely quick check in, (I mean literally 1 min), we made our way to the lift to take us to our new home for the week. Again there was a lovely surprise for us as we waited for the lift, some complimentary egg nog to further intensive the Christmas spirit. As we ascended to our room I could not have felt happier or more excited about the forthcoming week. This was most definitely not going to be any ordinary trip. I can honestly say I’ve never been so far away from home and yet, felt so at home, (if that makes sense). We had booked to stay in the petite room and it was exactly that, however it was more than comfortable and the way in which the cleaning staff made up the rooms each day is to be highly commended. Every single day without fail, we were equipped with new towels and toiletries and the beds were always made to perfection, and that was in addition to the friendliness and politeness of the staff. In this review I must also mention the time and effort that the staff at the front desk put in to making our stay as enjoyable and fun packed as possible. We never felt lost. There was always a smiley face wanting to help, from Broadway tickets to the most time efficient ways of sight seeing, because let’s be honest, it’s NY and there is almost too much to do. By the end of the week we were almost experts of where to go and what to see. MOST IMPORTANT!!!!!!!!!!! DO NOT TAKE THE BLUE SHUTTLE BUS!!!!!!!!!!!! We booked out tickets in advance and the service they provided was adequate from the airport to the hotel; however the more important trip, getting us to the airport in time for our flight home was disastrous!!!!!!! The disastrous part being that they didn’t turn up. We booked our bus an hour earlier than we needed to just encase anything should happen and I’m so glad we did. Our panic was short lived however, as you guessed it, lol, the Roosevelt staff came to the rescue and offered us the hotel car to take us to the airport. It was actually the door staff who sorted this problem for us. Although I don’t know the man’s name he really was a gentleman and did everything in his power to help us. He is a credit to that hotel. We did have to pay for the car but it was only $70 to Newark and when the average taxi is $50 and it meant we didn’t miss our flight I thought this was more than reasonable. The car was most comfortable and it was the perfect end to a most memorable and romantic holiday. Few Additional Points Def do Woodbury Commons Def do Madame Taussauds Def do a couple of Broadway shows Def do The Statue of Liberty Def do Ellis Island Def do The Empire State Building Def SHOP And appreciate your time there because it will fly in, unfortunately. AND DEF DON’T TAKE THE BLUE SHUTTLE BUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel. big rooms. great service”
Reviews.Author: markmyname
Reviews.Content: location is great (45th and madison). 5 min from times sq. big room, nice bath. the hotel is renovated and is "Old style", but very shiqu and clasic. the doormans were very helpful and volontiered themselvs to help. dont take their car to the airport. my driver tried to rip me off after the doorman said i'd have to pay a certien price (55$) he tried to take some more. overall - very good place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gavalex2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt over the weekend and it was great. At first I was hesitate to stay due to the recent dissatisfied reviews that were placed. I'm glad we didn't listen to the reviews because we had a great weekend. This was our second time staying at the Roosevelt and the first was also great. The moment you pull up to the curb you assisted with your bags and the car valet parked. We arrived three hours before check in and expected to just have our bags held and do some shopping until check in, but they had a room already available and checked us in immediately. Armondo at the front desk was terrific and a great help. We had drinks in the lobby and the martini's were excellent. Our room was clean and very roomy for NYC. The mattresses are new pillow top mattresses that are super comfy. We were on the 18th floor and had a view of the chrysler building which was nice. When we checked out on Sunday they held our bags and gifts that we bought in a secure room until we regretablely left for the day. From beginning to end we had a great stay at the Roosevelt and would not hesitate to book again. If your looking for a beautiful, clean hotel with a great location choose the Roosevelt you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTravelqueen
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to NYC and we stayed at The Roosevelt as a final part of our honeymoon trip before heading back to the UK. The hotel staff upgraded us to a 2-room suite which was a lovely touch! The entrance and bar areas are lovely - the rooms are a little dated and not up to the standard of the hotel public areas, but who spends much time in the hotel room when in New York!! We ate in the restaurant on our last evening which was superb - the food service etc... Would definitely stay here again + the hotel is in a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: dpsaz
Reviews.Content: Great location at Grand Central Room smelled of roach spray Inside "view" (See photos) Mold in bathroom During shower tub wouldn't drain. Worst part is the water was brown! (See photo) Good size for NYC but for $379 I want the shower to work (or at least get clear water out of it!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MATraveler08
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I took our teen aged daughters to NYC to see a Broadway show and stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel. It was a great location - short walk from Grand Central, short walk to the theater district as well as shopping, restaurants, etc. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms were basic, but plenty large enough for the two double beds, desk, bureau, etc. The room and bathroom were clean although the bathroom could use some updating. The beds were very comfortable. I have already recommended it to a friend and would stay there again. We did not eat at the hotel as the menu was quite pricey compared to what we wanted to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: joe1514
Reviews.Content: Just come back after staying at the Roosevelt Hotel for a week with 2 other adults and a small child. Hotel was great and staff were very friendly and helpful. Lobby was very grand, rooms not large, but this is what I have been told to expect all over New York. The location was great, just 1 block from Grand Central Station. Had the best time, and would love to stay at the hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame of Madison Avenue”
Reviews.Author: csordila
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel was named from Theodore Roosevelt. the 26th President of the US, in office 1901 – 1909. The hotel opened in 1924. I myself have stayed here several times and everything was all right. The only issue is the elevators. It could take a lot of time to get an elevator that isn’t full of guests and luggage. Right in the heart of midtown. The location is great, a few minutes from Grand Central Station and Times Square. Address: 45 E 45th St, New York, NY 10017 Directions: 45 East 45th Street & Corner of Madison Avenue Website: http://www.theroosevelthotel.com/

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are alike”
Reviews.Author: GailRK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in this hotel (9/25 through 9/28.)
