It was fine for us as we don't spend much time in our room while in New York, but to anyone who does they should remember to refuse Room 381. The view from that room is an eyesore....Dirty pipes, garbage, old bucket which looked like it was at one time filled with tar, a ladder, etc. We kept the drapes closed the entire time so we didn't have to look at it. This is directly on the other side of the window outside this room. Also, the carpet border and the wallpaper was hanging from the wall under the register exposing the bare plaster. Otherwise the room was very clean and everything functioned as it should. Housekeeping was great, check in was great. Location of the hotel is great. I did not make a verbal complaint regarding this as they'd just put someone else in the room, but did make this problem very clear on the comment card I left at the front desk when we left. As I said it was fine for us as we were in the room very little, but I really do feel it should be cleaned up.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: rtw00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a long weekend (Sep 12-14) at the Roosevelt on a trip to see the city for the first time. I chose this hotel because of the positive things I had heard about it as well as it's great location in the city. Neither let us down! Located at the corner of 45th and Madison, the hotel is so close to Times Square, just a couple blocks from Grand Central Station and only about 10 blocks or so from Central Park. We walked nearly every where we went and this location was perfect for it. As for our room, it was fantastic. We ended up getting an upgrade to a suite which had so much room for New York City we didn't know what to do with ourselves. The concierge was very helpful, the valet parking was convenient and the check-in, check-out service at the front desk was very smooth. All in all, if you want to truly get the New York City feel by walking out of your hotel to the heart of the city and you want to do it at a reasonable rate, I can't recommend this hotel enough to you. If a low rate is more important to you, I would suggest just staying outside the city as the public transportation system works very well and would allow for little trouble if you're looking to save money on your stay.

Reviews.Title: “really liked the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: MACON51
Reviews.Content: We recommend this hotel. Almost all NYC hotel prices seem high, compared to other big cities. That being said, the Roosevelt did exceed our expectations, and we will go back. Room was adequate size with very nice amenities. Very clean room and bathroom. Friendly staff. Easy check in and check out. Lovely lobby. Quiet. Super location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby”
Reviews.Author: Mack777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel in August of 2008. The lobby is beautiful and the concierge and hotel staff were extremely helpful. But, our room on the 4th floor was not reflective of the rest of the restoration that was done on this Hotel. Our room was small and the furniture was old. The bathroom was also very small and old (old tiles and wallpaper) with taps that turned almost completely around to shut off. We had an extremely old and noisy air conditioner and our view was old rusted out air ducts directly below our window. Aside from our room, the location of this hotel is great and we had a great time in New York!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Shel2404
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a great hotel. I recently stayed for a long weekend and had a wonderful experience. We could not figure out who the people were leaving bad reviews on here. We arrived early and checked our luggage with the bell captain. We had a cozy queen which was larger than I had anticipated. It was perfect for our needs. Everything was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The air conditioner was a bit noisy, and we were close to the elevator and vending machines so we could hear people talking in the hallway but it really wasn't disruptive. The hotel is in a great location, close to Times Square and Grand Central (subway). We did not eat at the hotel but we did have a drink at the rooftop bar which was lovely. I highly recommend this hotel for the price. I will definitely book at the Roosevelt again!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angel01london
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week stay at the Roosevelt hotel New York. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such kindness and incredible service before. Upon arrival to the hotel we were welcomed by friendly staff eagar to make our stay enjoyable. Also to our suprise we were upgraded to a suite (in celebration of our wedding anniversary, the suite was almost as big as our house!) . The restaurants and bars including the roof top bar were great. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday!

Reviews.Title: “No problems, despite concerns”
Reviews.Author: Abby2007London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for 6 nights from 30 August 2008. I had read hotel reviews of New York hotels til they were driving me mad - basically everywhere has both good and bad reviews. In the end I decided you can't be influenced too much by someone's bad experience, so I decided to book the Roosevelt despite having some concerns about the reviews about theft from the rooms. The reasons for choosing it were general central location, proximity to Grand Central Station, right sort of price range and size, and availability on the nights I wanted. Basically we had a great week there with no problems at all. We arrived too early for check in (1pm) but they did check us in no problem. The room was absolutely fine - two nice big comfortable beds. Air conditioning and safe worked fine, so did toilet and the shower was brilliant. Maybe not much space to hang stuff up or spread out cases but that is minor quibble. I'm pleased to say suffered no thefts or other problems. It was quiet, room cleaning fine, very little contact with other guests or staff so very much a 'hands off' feeling to it, especially when we took to getting the elevator from the lower Arcade level. Elevators were busy but no particularly long waits. The shop was useful for drinks for the night and was open late, also you could get ice from a machine to keep your drinks cool in. We never tried the breakfast in the end but had one evening meal in the restaurant behind the lobby - food was perfectly okay, I had a 'New York Strip' steak and New York cheesecake. Overall I would say our stay was a great success and I enjoyed it, and would definitely recommend it, however seeing other people's gripes about bad service etc I think the conclusion is that there's an element of luck involved in whether you have a good experience or not. I think I would advise not to get too hung up about reviews and don't get too stressed about everything having to be perfect. Oh, and I didn't see a single cockroach anywhere in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: twoseniorcitizens
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel room and the room staff were excellent. Room and bathroom very clean and attended too every morning. However my gripe lies with the male receptionist on my arrival. The conversation went as follows:- Are you checking in? Yes I will need I.D. e.g. Passport and Credit Card? You are staying seven days? Yes Room 1102 I have had a long journey (13 hours) and feeling very tired and not thinking ask the rceptionist how do I find Room 1102. His reply was "on the elevator behind me ". End of conversation . On checking out of the hotel I had problems using the bedroom phone. I was trying to contact the shuttle bus service to confirm my pick-up time ,without success. I contacted Billy the Concierge and explained my difficulties to him. He informed me that my bedroom phone was probably deactivated because I was checking out . However he refused to make a local phone call because they dont do business with that particular Shuttle Bus Company. He referred me to the local payphone(which was out of order). I eventually found a payphone in Grand Central Station,which is two blocks away. Two Senior Citizens

Reviews.Title: “Would go back to the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: CatherineC55
Reviews.Content: Just returned fromNew York where we stayed at The Roosvelt Hotel which was just around the corner from Grand Central Station so was in a great position. The hotel lobby is very grand and can get quite busy. The room we had was very comfortable and clean and was quite as we did not overlook the road. The staff were ok but the bell boys were very friendly. New York is not as cheap as at Christmas time as there are very few sales but if you look hard enough there are some bargains to be had. If we were lucky enough to go back to New York we would stay at the Roosevelt again. One word of warning the roof top bar Mad46 is expensive and full of workers and we were asked (told) to move from our table which did not have a reserved sign on. Not a welcoming place.

Reviews.Title: “will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: cantatraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough upon arrival - old style architecture, grand lobby, etc. However, the staff was rude, I was treated as a 2nd rate customer for booking the room through hotwire. There were a lot of unnecessary references to the 'type of room' I had requested (eg instead of saying 'your room is not ready yet' they said, 'the type of room you requested is not ready yet' - I did not request anything special, just A room...). The kicker is that I had NO HOT WATER in the morning. The bath tub faucet was broken (I could not turn it to the hot water). I went into the shower, waited patiently for about 5 minutes to make sure the hot water was not coming (it never did), and then called the cleaning service (conceirge desk was not available). They transferred me to a manager, who was not terribly apologetic. I felt like I was complaining about my TV screen being fuzzy (which it was btw), not about NOT HAVING HOT WATER, a very basic amnety at any hotel. They oferred to MOVE me to another room which just infuriated me even more because I was standing naked, draped in a towel, dripping wet, with only 30 minutes to get ready before meeting my friends for breakfast. I thought they were joking! Moving rooms?!?! I ended up taking a cold shower, going downstairs and asking for a refund. They said they could not give me one since my room was prepaid. They had the audacity to offer me discount for my future stays - as if I would EVER stay there again. I hope hotwire takes them off their list of hotels. I have booked through hotwire many times before and never had a bad experience. In addition to this 'minor problem' of no hot water, the wall paper was peeling, the a/c was loud (a window unit), the TV was in fact, fuzzy, there were stains on the toilet seat, and the staff was rude. The bell boy coerced a tip out of me, which I found REALLY rude. I would have given him a tip anyways, but he did not even give me a chance. My recommendation is to steer clear of this hotel - there are much better options around NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LaLoba64
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt was perfect for my first visit to NYC! Beautiful hotel, convenient location, helpful staff, overall a wonderful experience. We received the free room upgrade as was mentioned several times on here, found it to be clean and though certainly not huge it was quite large enough for our needs. On our last night there we requested a change of rooms because my children were joining us and we needed two double beds; the staff was incredibly accommodating. The only complaint I have is that there are no coffeemakers in the room, something we're used to in most hotels. There was also not a mini fridge, again something that is rather common, but these were small issues and would certainly not prevent me from staying there again. These items would have been convenient, however, especially when storing leftovers from the fabulous restaurants we dined in! I refused to pay for Starbucks coffee in the hotel lobby, choosing instead to walk to the restaurant across the street and pay $1.00 less per cup! Overall, I was very pleased with the Roosevelt and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: moviebizz
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that this hotel's customer service on the ohone is the worst.. The operatoer NEVER (and I've called many times) tells you that she is transfering uyour call to sales, reservations, etc, etc. The reservation agents all sound as if they rather be somewhere else and they are bothered that you are calling them. Anyway, the experience would be much better is they made you feel welcomed. Not a big task and bvelieve me it goes a long way. What I dont understand is how their managers do not kow this or if they do I guess they just dont care.. because I would call my own hotel as a secret caller and feel the treatment for myself.. if it were my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: International_PH
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving around 1pm we were informed that we couldn't check into the room until 3pm, which was fine. We went through the checkin process and left out bags with the bell boy, grabbed some lunch and returned around 5pm. We went to collect our room key and were told that the room we booked wasn't available (cosy queen) but we could have another room with two twin beds instead. We explained that we wanted the room with the queen bed but the receptionist wouldn't give us a time scale as to when it would be ready. Overall his attitude was quite rude and it seemed like he didn't really care. We decided just to go for the double twin because we were tired from the flight. Not the best first impression of the hotel. The main lobby of the reception is very nice and always busy which adds a vibe to the hotel. But once you get upto the floors which house the room, the decor is very tired. Old furniture, torn wallpaper and just generally out of date. The room is pretty much the same, our carpet was very dirty, beds fortunately were very good and TV a newish LCD panel. The bathroom was again just adequate, very old decor but at least it was clean. If you can get a good deal for the hotel, then it's worth it. But don't expect much from it.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated!”
Reviews.Author: OxfordMoonDaisy
Reviews.Content: What can I say - we stayed for a week and it was awful! Supposed to be a 4/5 star hotel but it was dreadful. When we arrived the bell boys grab your bags climb 3 steps (not even to the recetion) and hands out for a tip! Not a good start! When we got to the reception desk I was told there was a 3hour wait for our room because of a staffing problem, When we explained that I had a migraine there was no interest - not even an offer of a glass of water! Eventually got to our room which was right next to the lift - just what you need with a migraine and the thought of putting up with the noise all week was too much so my husband went to the recetion to request another room. After speaking to 3 different people and argueing politely we were offered another room. On arrival to this one, the toilet was broken, electrics were hanging out of the wall and the air con worked only in a very noisy fashion. So another trip downstairs - by this time I felt absolutely dreadful and so husband went again to reception and got pretty stroppy. The 3rd room we were offered was only adequate - if you could ignore the grubby carpet, bubbling plastic in the bathroom, next to the cleaners cupboard and overlooking the back vents of the hotel kitchens! But it was clean! The website looks amazing - the reception certainly is really impressive but it would seem that once you are pased the hallowed grounds of recetion the rooms have another life! Given that we viewed 3 on our visit, I would guess that we were past just being 'unlucky' in choice of rooms. Most of the staff were unhelpful - to the point of being downright rude but the housekeepers were always pleasant and seemed to do a good surface job. Conseirge were great too and really helpful. Maybe the managers need to look to them for some customer relations training! We left a letter of complaint but got no reply. We emailed a letter of complaint upon our return - and got no reply. Then they sent a customer satisfaction survery (what a laugh) to which we replied very negetivly - but still no reply. We got an email to say that since we had posted negetive feedback they would be in touch - we are still waiting! The best laugh is that they still send me emails inviting us to 'visit again soon'!!! We have stayed in NYC several times but this is one place we will absolutly not be returning to - even if offered for free! Our next stay will be back to 'The Intercontinental - The Barclay' which justifies its 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: junenottingham
Reviews.Content: hotel was very nice but the staff were not helpful or friendly, i found them very rude, you are in a strange country and you want to ask questions they did not want to help or direct you in the right direction, i felt i was bothering them, i found the staff very snobbish. hotel was near shops which was great, the shower was not very good, room was very clean. i did not eat at the hotel, too expensive, i took food back to hotel in the evening, but when my room was cleaned, the cleaning staff left a card on my bed for me to see about room service and the prices, i take it they saw the food wrappers in the bin but it is my choice if i ate at the hotel or not. i would not go back to this hotel again, the view from the room was a tower block, but when i checked in was told i had a nice view over looking the street which was not true, i did leave a customer form saying how rude the staff were i guess they will just bin it, that is there attitude they just did not care. i payed decent money to stay at this hotel and i expected a good service which i did not get.. eat at grand central station food court which was reasonable. take a trip to china town, sample the food which was fantastic and cheap time square was an experience go when it is dark the lights are out of this world. i felt safe walking in the day and night, new york is a must to see designer clothes are cheaper and the trainers. would go back to ny but would stay in a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: _-rachella-_1
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at the Roosevelt for 6 nights in August, and our first impressions were good. The hotel is in a good location (near Grand Central, NY Public library, 5th Avenue - good shops and about a 10 min walk to times square). As we are from England, we were not used to the hot climate, fortunately taxis were relatively cheap to get around. Checking in was quite simple although the receptionist was very unpleasant - he tossed our key across the desk and had a bad attitude. Additionally, the safe in our room was broken, but after calling security this was fixed promptly and the security guy also gave us free breakfast! (We were on a room only basis - breakfast is quite good but I would probably get sick of it everyday - we usually just went to cafes - cafe metro is quite good for breakfast and only about $5.) Additionally the hair dryer was broke in the room and this was never repaired. The cleaning service was quite good and the maids were friendly and actually took notice of the 'do not disturb' sign - this is quite often ignored in other hotels I have stayed in. The hotel rooms were average, we stayed in a 'petite room', 'petite' being true. The room included a large plasma TV with quite a few good channels - movie channels, MTV, BBC etc, and ironing facilities etc. You should also look into the cheapest way of getting to the hotel from the airport, from JFK we got ripped off and ended up paying $90 when the guy had told us it would cost $50. Another man running his private taxi business practically ran away with my suitcase in an attempt to rip us off. Yellowcabs are usually quite cheap for getting around so I'd probably suggest that. Another thing, is EVERYONE expects you to tip them, coming from a country were tipping is not often necessary I found this strange - one guy who gave us a piece of paper with how much luggage we had loitered round for a few minutes until we gave him some dollars, additionally restaurants sometimes add this onto your bill or state that 15-20% is sufficient. Points of interest I would recommend would be to see a Broadway show (we saw Mamma Mia which was excellent and funny), Statue of liberty, Empire state building (good view at night and that is when ques are shorter) top of the rockerfeller centre is good through the day as you get a great view of central park. Central park is a lovely place too and we spent a nice day just walking round, visited strawberry fields and went on the rowing boats near the boathouse. Restaurants I would recommend are Tavern on the Green in central park (outdoor and pretty with lanterns and live music, nice to end the night on a horse and carriage ride which is from $40), Ellen's stardust diner near the theatres in Times Square is quite good for younger people too, this is where all of the waitresses are trying to make it on broadway and serve and sing - the food isn't that good but it's a different experience and a lot of the child customers enjoyed it. Overall I would recommend the Roosevelt and I would definitely return. If you have any questions regarding the Roosevelt you may send me a message and I'd be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmrm
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 9 nights at the Roosevelt this month with my wife and my 8 year old daughter. The room was big, comfy, clean ( although one day i had to leave a note to the housekeeping to clean the dust.). The furniture really needs an update. If you leave a tip the sevice is more well done, i left 2 dollars a day to the housekeeping. A nice surprise was the newspapper everyday (except weekend) at the door. Another good thing were the aminities every day, they even gave mouthwash solution. Although we were in 14 floor we still heard a lot of noise from the street, but its NY the city doesnt reaaly sleeps. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: CentralCATraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked the Roosevelt for its reasonable price. It is convenient to Grand Central and Times Square. Our flight arrived early and they let us check in early, which we appreciated. We were by an elevator, but we weren't bothered by any noise. The staff was helpful. The atmosphere was more classic. A good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “It's fine”
Reviews.Author: GEOFFS3
Reviews.Content: I had a quick stay at the Roosevelt this past weekend and I must say I was a little disapointed. LOCATION- Perfect for Midtown at 45th and Madison. I think it's a great location. There are plenty of restaurants around and all the transportation is close. Bryant Park (my favorite spot in NYC) is just about 5 blocks away. LOBBY- When you arrive you are almost blow away by the stately beauty of the lobby and public areas. Almost stunning. It's been beautifully restored. ROOMS- Mine was tiny indeed. Actually it was so tiny there wasn't even a desk for my laptop. But hey this is NYC. The bedding is comfortable with nice linens and pillows. There was also a great flat-screen television. Okay, so far I have only stated the positives..... Well, this is one of those hotels that LOOKS and SEEMS great at first glance. And really for all practical purposes, it's OK....... However, if they don't start to keep this place up, it's going to be nothing more than a run-down tourist hotel within another 10 or 15 years. Here's my list: -Old slow evelators (need to me modernized) -Almost ever door on my hallway had scuff marks and dirt on them. This shows a real lack of attention to cleaning. -Major scuff mark on the bedskirt in my room. -Many, many spots in the hallway carpet with rips and stains. -HORRIBE bathroom plumbing. The toilet would not flush properly due to insifficient pressure. The shower was one of the worst I have ever had. Did not take one OK shower. Once it was scalding hot, and twice ice cold. No in-between temps - even after I spend 10-15 minutes playing with it. -Staff that wasn't into their jobs at all. As an exmple, once on a packed elevator, a bellhop counted all his money while riding instead of smiling or making eye contact with guests. -Security was a bit lacking. At night, they have the evelator bank was "roped off" however twice no one ever asked to see my room key. If you get a good deal on the place, I say go for it. With the exception of the shower issue, I think only very experienced travelers would find issues. The hotel management just needs to get this hotel on it's P's and Q's and it would be fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beani_p
Reviews.Content: New York accomodation is New York accomodation. Very expensive and very tiny rooms. I have been to NY 16 times now, and unless I have the big budget to stay at Omni Berkshire (which is a beautiful hotel - however now I tend to save the money and put it towards shopping instead!), I am always changing hotels as the prices keep increasing and the last hotel had faults that steer me away. The Roosevelt was a relatively nice hotel for the price and location. Rooms were nicely decorated and they were very clean. The location was perfect for getting around the city and for shopping! My only small crticism was the noise from the street - I have stayed in alot worse in NY, but this wasn't completely sound proof either. Its a nice hotel if you are on a budget, you want something nice, but can't afford to stay in the rooms $400+ a night, based on this, I would recommed the Roosevelt. But its not the 4 star experience you would usually get in another city or country - but hey that's NY for you!

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt was great!”
Reviews.Author: GreeceStars
Reviews.Content: Loved the Roosevelt. Got summer special on room for a "cozy queen", but they upgraded it to king size without me even asking. Room was big (not just by NY standards), bathroom fine, two windows overlooking the city, and quiet. The location was amazing - right next to Grand Central Station and an easy walk to Times square. We'll stay there every time we go to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Tired Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night on July 24th, 2008. This is an older hotel with very slow elevators. Location is not bad for midtown. Breakfast buffet is great, but some may find it expensive ($30). Room rate is quite reasonable and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are good sized, clean, but decor is old fashioned. However, my air conditioning was supurb. Walked into the room on a very hot day and it was refreashingly cool. Problem was that at night, the air conditioner leaked on to the carpet, creating a large wet spot to walk through when getting in and out of bed. Room safe did not work. No honor bar in room and vending machine in hall alcove did not work, so not possible to buy water for room. Hard to believe that housekeeping did not know about the wet spot in front of the air conditioner. Bathroom was small but adequate for one person. this is a huge hotel -- must have 1000 rooms or more and was built a long time ago. It could do with a major remodel, but my guess is that the owners are happy to continue with it as is, since it largely caters to tourists who are looking for an inexpensive, well located hotel. As a business person, I probably would not stay here again, but if you are looking for a well located hotel that is simply OK, then this might be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Smaller Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaurenJane
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been more pleased when arriving at The Roosevelt. It it a smaller hotel, with great staff. Rooms were simple, clean, and large for New York city. The location was perfect- right in the theatre district, and walking district to "restaurant row," tons of great restaurants, all different varieties.

Reviews.Title: “Usually fine but be aware..”
Reviews.Author: tigerfly222
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Roosevelt almost every time I go to NYC for business. This is mostly because we get a special rate through our client and that makes it cheaper than any other hotel I can find. However, cheap rate incentive aside, I would probably choose to stay at the Roosevelt anyway. Having stayed here 10+ times over the last year, I have hardly ever had anything to complain about. One thing to note: the rooms are really a crap shoot. Personally, I like the charm of a hotel where the rooms are not all the same cookie cutter shape and size. But I admit that some of the rooms at the Roosevelt are small and feel cramped. I also know that some of the bathrooms have stall showers with only a small lip separating them from the rest of the bathroom, though I have never had anything but a tub with shower in the bathroom. The one time I have had a problem with my room was when I was given one on the third floor, which should be non-smoking, yet my room reeked of cigarette smoke. I think it might have been because I was on a low floor, some of the odor might have come up from the street. At any rate, I requested a different room on a higher floor and they accommodated me right away. Within the last few months they have added nice flat screen TV's to all the rooms. The carpet could really stand to be replaced in most areas of the hallways and guest rooms, but it's not really bothersome. Room service is usually prompt and professional, and the same goes for the staff in the lounge downstairs. They have also recently opened a rooftop lounge called Mad 46, which I haven't checked out yet but I heard it's nice (when the weather cooperates). Overall I enjoy the Roosevelt regardless of its few small issues.

Reviews.Title: “it's okay”
Reviews.Author: 79Rome
Reviews.Content: Nothing special. I was here mainly for business during the NYC Marathon, which makes things a little bit crazy. Staff wasnt too friendly, big room (you dont get a small room for being America) small bathroom though. it' s okay I guess, it is clean and well located but overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Room Snafu, but wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: gobluegirl
Reviews.Content: I had a love/hate relationship with Roosevelt. Let start off from the beginning, I had booked two doubles as I was taking my nephew on this trip for a graduation present. I had called the hotel in the morning to notify them that I would be checking in late due to a late flight. We got to the hotel around midnight and I was told that there were no double available and that we could have a queen. I explained to them that this was in unacceptable and they said they couldn’t do anything to accommodate us. We asked for a rollaway bed, however that wouldn’t work due to the room being so small. I checked back the following morning and night and they still claimed that there was nothing available. We requested additional bedding and my nephew slept on the floor the first two nights. They finally were able to move us to our two double on our last night there. Both rooms were very tiny, but very clean. I thought that the painting and carpet could be updated, but it really wasn’t that bothersome. Our first room was a handicap room and the shower was awful, we got the entire bathroom wet and water also went out into the room because of the drains not working properly. The bathroom was much better in the second room. I thought the beds were very comfortable and were much needed after walking in the heat all day. The pillows were very stiff and not to comfortable. Each of the rooms had a great flat screen. The noise from the street below could be heard very easily, however that wasn’t too big of deal to me as we were so tired from being on the go all day and I fell asleep in spite of the noise. The staff was very pleasant even when I wasn’t too nice after being upset over our room snafu. The concierge and bell hops were all quick, nice and easy to deal with. We didn’t see our maids, but our room was spotless when we came back each day. I loved the location, this was the best part of the hotel and ALMOST made up for my nephew having to sleep on the floor for two days. You’re away from the chaos that is Times Square, however your close enough to walk if that is something you want to spend a lot of time at. The hotel is super close to Grand Central Station and it made it great for using the subway. 5th avenue is a block away and the Chysler Building is very close. I felt like we had a great Central hub for everything we wanted to do. If the hotel could have straightened our hotel situation room out sooner I would have been happier, I wasn’t looking to be compensated or anything like that. I just wanted the room that I booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast with Tomas, the best ever server!”
Reviews.Author: FLAlady50
Reviews.Content: My friends and I always stay at the Roosevelt Hotel in New York City when we go there for a long weekend to see as many plays as we can squeeze into the weekend. Almost five years ago, we met Tomas, who served us breakfast. With such good service, we went back two to three times per year to the same hotel and feel like family. We've watched as Tomas' son finished high school and gets ready to attend college. Through Tomas, we've met many people in the hotel and have shared the information with many friends, who are now regularly visiting the Roosevelt and Tomas. One man can make a difference in making a stay in a big city feel so special. We feel like we are treated like royalty at the Roosevelt, all because of Tomas! Stop by there and tell him that the Florida ladies sent you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: BEL1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed over at the Roosevelt beginning of May. The Hotel is splendid, huge entrance, very impressive. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room wasn't very big but when you visit NYC you don't stay in your room all day. So for us it was perfect! The bed was a king size with loads of different pillows, the room was cleaned everyday. In other word, we enjoyed staying there and we would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: John_Lewis
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night at this hotel in July 2008 - and had a decent enough experience. The location is good, on the corner of 45th and Madison, it's definitely at the centre of things if that is what you want from your New York Hotel. The bedroom was fairly small, and the bathroom also. The bed was reasonably comfortable. The TV was very modern but the rest of the furnishing were quite old. I wouldn't normally comment on something as trivial as a lift, but for some reason the lifts in this hotel were achingly slow, and very old also. Overall, ok, but I wouldn't be rushing back here in a hurry. One thing to note- the concierge will try and sell you a car to JFK for $73 - don't take it - taxis have a flat rate of $45 + toll + tip (so around $60). And you can get a private car for around the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: lookingforbeaches
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, classic hotel! We found a very reasonable rate on the hotel website ($179 for a cozy queen) and after reading the reviews on tripadvisor, I was really worried. The other reviews are completely wrong! Our room was clean, quite big for NYC and had THE most comfortable bed! The bathroom was small but normal for an older hotel, and there really was plenty of room for toiletries and such. The staff were great...they were all very helpful and accommodating - they made us feel like VIPs everywhere we went. They have a nice lounge/bar right next to the lobby There's also a great new rooftop bar that you must visit, even if you don't stay at the hotel. Not only that, but you are across the street (literally) from Grand Central! It was so easy getting around town, I think we only took a cab twice and those were late at night. I really can't say anything bad about this hotel. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from the Roosevelt Hotel. This was our second visit to this hotel, and I have to say it was just as special the second time around. I would recommend the Roosevelt for its fantastic location (on Madison Ave, Midtown). It seems a higher standard than the price suggests. The staff are extremely helpful, especially the concierge. We were able to leave our bags securely both on arrival (we got there before the check-in time) and departure (ours was a late evening flight home). The room was on the small side (a Queen), however, it was spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom. Although in New York's standards the 18th floor isn't high, the view from rm 1802 was quite magical at night. Our room overlooked Madison Ave, but we weren't disturbed by any noise. The one down side was that our bedding wasn't changed in four days however, it was Independence Day weekend and fully booked! Can't say any more except 'Go stay at the Roosevelt'

Reviews.Title: “Really”
Reviews.Author: OL975
Reviews.Content: We just visited this hotel for three days during a business trip. Although the lobby is very nice, we found our room very small even for New York City standards for the price charged. In addition our bathroom was so small there was little or no room even for a shaving kit. Other concerns were: 1) We were staying on the 6th floor and on several occasions it took so long for the elevator to arrive we decided to take the stairs. 2) While there my wife had a cold and I wanted a cup of hot water to mix her medicine in. When I called room service they said it would cost $5 to bring me a cup plus the charge for the water. I thought they were joking, they were not. I went downstairs to the bar to simply get a cup and the bartender flat refused to give or sell me one saying I had to get it from room service. I next asked at the front desk and they said try a deli down the street. Overall if sked if I would stay here again, I would say no.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, rooms slightly small”
Reviews.Author: raven_apl
Reviews.Content: My Mum decided to treat me to a trip to NYC for my 21st birthday and booked for us to stay at the Roosevelt. The trip was extremely exciting for both of us as we had never been to America and had only ever travelled internationally seperately, so we really wanted our first trip together to be a good one. Upon arrival at The Roosevelt , we were very impressed with the lobby and bar area that you first come across. It has a grand and sophisticated feel, but was comfortable. The bellboys and receptionists were very helpful. We checked in very quickly, without any fuss. Our room was up in the 7th floor, so we had assistance in the lift with our luggage (tipped obviously). The entrance area to the floor was clean and tidy, if not ever so slightly out of date on decor. The room itself was very nice, not particularly huge, but very comfortable. My Mum had ungraded our room to a Superior room, which meant we had a Large double bed each, with various other upgraded amenities. Bathroom was basic, but clean, which is all we could have asked for. We were supplied with a safe in the wardrobe, which could not be moved and set to lock with your own personalised code. We kept our cash in here, as well as passports, as it seemed very secure. Location wise, the Roosevelt is quite central. Grand Central Station is right around the corner and the Empire State is around a 15 minute walk DownTown. In the opposite direction its around a 15 minute walk to Time Square, but taxi's are easy to come by. The Doormen at the front of the hotel are more than happy to flag you one down. On the second night, very tired after a busy day sightseeing, we decided to have dinner in the hotel bar, followed by a few cocktails. The food was fresh and tasty, but a little expensive. Cocktails were large, as my Mum soon realised when she passed out on one of the beds after having just one!! There is a fantastic deli opposite the hotel, which do a great selection of breakfasts, I would strongly suggest anyone visiting the Roosevelt go there. Generally this was a pleasant and well located hotel, with friendly staff. I would most definately go back to the Roosevelt again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “What a trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Allaboutmyhols
Reviews.Content: Can well recommend this hotel. Staff were fantastic and very helpful. JFK airport managed to loose my luggage even before I'd landed, but i was promised that it would be at my Hotel the next day, and it was! Bar staff are excellent, Tony was a legend! Take a trip in one of the yellow taxi's, they are extremely funny to ride in! Times square is beautiful and Toys r Us, WOW!! This is a must, especially for young couples! Stew

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: sandy077
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in New York and for me the hotel makes half of experience. The problem was it ruined it after we noticed things were going missing from our hotel room. The following things were STOLEN: GHD STRAIGHTER SONY CAMERA TOMMY HILFIGER CARDIGAN PHONE CHARGER MAC MAKE-UP PLUS....MY NEW UGG BOOTS WERE SLASHED????? I travel all over the world as part of my job but i've NEVER had anything like this ever happen before. Plus, when we told the hotel these items were all missing they said they were 'investing' it. But they never got back to us and we had to chase them to find out they questioned their staff and they didn't find anything. That's the most ridiciolus thing...no one is going to say 'I STOLE THEM'. It's just upsetting that no one apologized, no compensation was given...basicall the hotel DIDN'T CARE! DON'T STAY HERE - THEY'RE ARE THIEFS WORKING THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tommie69
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 minutes walk from Grand Central. Lots of places nearby to eat breakfast with the locals. Tried the Starbucks in the hotel on the last morning and were really disappointed with the service and standard of drink and food, so we would recommend eating out. If you like to walk this hotel is perfect as you are in easy walking distance of many of the city's attractions - 5th Avenue, Times Square, New York Public Library and Central Park. The standard of our room was good - there were two large queen sized beds. Service ok- very impressive lobby. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitchkitty007
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel to stay in for a quick trip into New York. It is situated very close to Grand Central Station and is moments away from 5th Avenue (superb for shopping) and a few blocks from Times Square. Ok, the rooms are quite small but you won't be spending all day in them. They have ensuite facilities which are adequate. The rooms are clean and tidy and the staff are more than friendly. I really enjoyed my stay there for the week and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very OK”
Reviews.Author: jeffreydung
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Good location, Beautiful Lobby, rooms older, some maintenance needed in bathrooms, halls, carpeting etc., check in quick, First room toilet would not flush properly..called maintenance. After plunging still no luck ...so requested a room change..got it right away to a room where the toilet flushes twice every time. House cleaning know about the plumbing but little is done..its left for you the guest to DISCOVER. Make sure your plumbing works when arriving at room. DO NOT GET ADJOINING ROOMS..the noise from next door will keep you up.. slamming of doors ..and Im not kidding! Be prepared to tip 5-10 dollars for storing and getting your luggage back each time...attendants always pull out a wad of bills just to remind you...these individuals are a real class act! Try the Affinia Manhatten for a better stay...thats why its rated by trip advisor ...and all of you at a much higher level.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: city2country
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 2 children weekend of 6/13/08. Nice hotel, beautiful lobby, and the check in was quick. The hotel is in a great location with 5th avenue about 2 blocks away. Our room was not the room you see on line. It was obviously an older room with some wear and tear and pretty small. The tub had some nice size porcelain chips out of the bottom and the shower curtain rod was rusted. But the beds were comfy and it was definetely a clean room. Rooms were also quite and we could not hear the people on either side of us. Another note is when we got to our room, the room next to us had ordered room service and they set their remaining food out for pick up. It stayed there until the following morning, whenever house cleaning came, because it was there when we left in the morning to head out for the day but gone when we got back around 7pm, but that may be normal, I don't know, I've never come across that before. At one point both of our room keys had stopped working, but a quick run back down to the front desk and that was remedied. Valet parking was also a plus in our book. We would definetely stay here again. It is a nice hotel for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: ysouk
Reviews.Content: Had a hard time finding an affordable hotel in Manhattan. Came across this hotel at hotels.com and decided to book it. The location was excellent and I can take a coach bus from the airport to Grand Central Terminal and walk to the hotel. From the Grand Central Terminal, you can easily reach different part of New York City. The room had a LCD TV and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom is a bit worn out but clean. There is also no fridge in the room. Was given a room facing the air-con generator which can be a bit noisy. Try to ask for a room at a higher floor or one that faces the road. Do consider this hotel if you need one at a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: osutravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Roosevelt in March. The room was quite large by NYC standards. The bed was great, very comfortable. The wallpaper/paint looked a bit old, but somehow, it worked in this historic older hotel - didn't bother me as it might if it was just a modern hotel with old wallpaper/paint. The doormen were just wonderful - posed for pictures with my daughter. There were cars waiting to pull in and my husband was trying to load luggage quickly, my daughter asked for her doll, he began to tell her no there were cars waiting, the bellman said "oh, Dad, get her doll, it will only take a minute". He won our hearts with that. We booked a package that included a breakfast buffet - I highly reccommend it - the buffet was fabulous! The lobby area is beautiful, great for taking photos.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest hotel staff I ever met”
Reviews.Author: stephaniehk
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is absolutely brilliant if you want to explore New York City - but the standard of the staff's competency and friendliness left a lot to be desired. They made a mistake checking me in and rang me at 11.45pm on my second night, demanding I come down to the reception to help them sort it out - the manager's apology alone didn't replace my good night's sleep which I needed for work the next day. My customers were told I had not checked in yet when they rang to speak with me, even though I had already checked in 3 days before, and after I had checked out the staff refused to let me put my suitcase into the storage room - until I offered a generous tip. Even then, the porter just glared at me for inconveniencing him.For breakfast, you have to cough up a whopping 30 bucks, even if you only want a cup of tea! My room card kept getting disconnected, so I kepot having to go up and down in the elevator to have it replaced. On top of it, they "lost" my colleague's reservation, and only a ten dollar tip made it "reappear"! By the way, the rooms were dark and depressing, and if you want to chance it ask for a room on a high level because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience not recommended”
Reviews.Author: freqworld_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on business for 5 nights. I had to move rooms twice the first time because of the traffic noise and the second time because of a problem with the water pipes in the room. The people on the reception desk had terrible customer service and always made it seem like it was my fault that I was having issues. I very rarely complain at hotels but in this case I was unable to sleep for the first 3 nights. I didn't have my towels replaced by the chamber maid as I would have expected for this class of hotel. I also found that the porters would only acknowledge you if you were pulling up to the hotel in a limo it was trying to be an upper class hotel but was miserably failing. If you are considering staying here please look elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allie-Beth
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Roosevelt for 3 nights during May. On checking in we were immediately upgraded to a larger room (thanks!). The hotel staff were very polite and courteous. The lobby was impressive, with a beautiful display of fresh flowers. The hotel bar was right off the lobby so you could chill and people watch after a busy day shopping and sight seeing. The room was clean and comfortable and the bed was HUGE!!! The hotel is right next to Grand Central Terminal so is handy for subway. There are plenty of places to eat near hotel and times square is only a few blocks away. I would definately recommend this hotel, and would love to stay here again real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Cal28
Reviews.Content: Our first port of call on our America trip. We arrived here for a three night stay and they were happy to check us in early, with no additional charge. We were amazed how close it was to everything, Times Square was an easy walk away and Grand Central Station could be seen from the hotel doorstep. We ate in the resteraunt one evening and on the night before we left to continue our travels we had room service. Both meals were fantastic and the service was excellent. I have recommended this to friends and was shocked to see that when I wrote this review it was only #119 in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: EllicottCityPersona
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights for a business trip: Hotel is conveniently located and better refurbished than most.; not a great choice for business travellers though as there was no phone on the desk! Had to call the front desk to get one set up, which they did, but still, the whole thing was annoying. My room was on a lower floor (7th or 8th) and had zero view and very poor light, but that is common in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “One-Nighter”
Reviews.Author: CatIslandCouple
Reviews.Content: While we only stayed a night - it was great! We arrived at the hotel in the morning (10am) and we were planning on storing our luggage with the hotel so we could explore NYC, but the guy at the front desk was able to get us in a room right away. It was very comfy and clean. We had planned on staying at another more budget friendly hotel, but I found a great deal on hotels.com and saved a ton. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: MrsLayman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel for our first trip to NYC. I found a great rate for this hotel for the Memorial Day weekend and I was very pleased with the quality for the amount I paid. We were given an upgrade to a king room instead of the original room I had booked. In the beginning I was a little bummed because our room was on the 3rd floor with only a view of the mechanical equipment of the hotel. However, I think this proved to be very helpful as we were not in our room hardly at all and this definitely kept the street noise out. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was small but still did the job. Plus the Bath & Body Works toiletries were a nice touch. The hotel could use just a little TLC with some of the carpet pulling away from the wall near the air conditioner. We were very happy with the hotel for the price we paid...however, if we had paid much more money I would probably be disappointed. The concierge was very helpful when needed and we never had any problems with housekeeping or the front desk. We loved the Roosevelt and it's location. It was so close to Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, and Times Square. We had a very easy time getting anywhere we needed to be in a small amount of time. As first timers to the city this was definitely a great find for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: DCRE
Reviews.Content: We got a bargain rate of $167 from [--] for a one-night stay over Memorial Day weekend. I was not expecting a lot but was pleasantly surprised and favorably impressed. We were upgraded to a deluxe, corner room which had lots of space but was somewhat under-furnished. We found the service to be better and more responsive than at many other NYC hotels where we've stayed. The bathroom is small and could use updating but this was a very comfortable stay and we would return if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: xsprite
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the midtown, between the rockfeller center, the empire state building and time sqaure. Good looking hall and rooms. The room was quite big and clean. Employees were kind and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: FMRG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week in may, booked a 24 hour sale rate through Expedia, and i have to say that i was very pleased with the stay. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom has been modernized and the room, towels and sheets were always very clean. The conciege and reception desk staff were very helpful and did their job very well. The only negative was the room size, which was small but enough...after all you won’t spend your whole vacation inside the room. The other couple who was travelling with my husband and i actually got a big room with a bathtub (paid the same we did), so i guess not all rooms are as small as ours. Bottom-line: great hotel, with great location (close to Times Square and Grand Central Station). Totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PGRBrussels
Reviews.Content: After alot of research into New York hotels (and particularly Trip Advisor users' comments) I booked the Roosevelt for 7 nights - and was very glad I did * Great great location - next to Grand Central (excellent for public transport both in NYC and to the airports) - not too noisy either. * Very well appointed hotel - impressive lobby, surprisngly comfortable rooms (though I booked a Cozy Queen and got an upgrade to a better room) - although the bathrooms are a little dated but perfectly adequate. Very professional and helpful staff from the check in right thru to the cleaning ladies. No complaints at all and I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “My Tips for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Ski2xs
Reviews.Content: I had been looking to go back to NY for a while but all the deals for 6 nights were really expensive. After looking around, the Roosevelt seemed to come out at a reasonable price. After sleeping on it over night the rate dropped by about £300 and I book it. I paid £980 for 6 nights in a superior room with direct flights. FOR The hotel is in a good location for getting around. I paid for a room upgrade and I was happy with the size of the room. I had no problems with the lifts at al (Some people said they had)l. AGAINST The windows don't keep out much of the road noise and even on the 15th floor I could here the traffic outside. The staff who store your bags before you leave want a tip to leave them and a tip to collect them. I know many people rely on tips, but they were too aggressive with some people! FLIGHT I flew direct from Manchester to Newark with Continental. The plane was comfortable and the entertainment system on the way out was great (You could chose what you want when you want it), it wasn't so good on the way back. TRANSFERS If you read the guides about getting to NYC from Newark it sounds complicated. In reality you buy a ticket for the NJ Transit train at the airport terminal before getting on any trains. You then jump on the airports train (Mono rail) to the airports station, you then connect to Penn Station and you are there! Its $15 single and takes 40 Min's in total. You can then buy a 7 day Metro card that covers the buses and Subway for $21. TIPS The view from the ROCK is the best I have seen anywhere. Take the free tour of Grand Central Station and the New York Public library. They are both very good.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt is in a great area”
Reviews.Author: thedeb
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from 3 nights at the Roosevelt Hotel in NYC. This beautiful old hotel is well-located at the corner of 45th and Madison Avenue. It is steps from Grand Central Station and all of Midtown. We got a room with two double beds. The room was nice, the beds were comfortable. The decor was average for a 3 star hotel, just fine. The bathroom was nice and clean. The size of the room was pretty good for NYC. The lobby of this hotel is beautiful. It is a "grande dame" type of place. There is a very nice bar with leaded glass windows which was lively while we were there. We did not eat in the restaurant but we had room service several times and were pleased with it. They serve Starbucks coffee and it is excellent if you just can't make yourself get dressed and go out to one of the dozens of Starbucks surrounding the neighborhood. All of the staff were very friendly and eager to please. They were helpful in storing bags and getting taxis. The few things I would vote to improve are an update to the decor of the rooms, and they should add a grab bar for the shower (that is just common sense). The concierge we dealt with was new and did not know the basic things anyone should know who has that job (where can we change currency? asked by guests from another country, she did not know to tell them that any bank will do it). This hotel was not cheap. The drinks and the room service were expensive, but we knew that would be true. You are paying for location and convenience here, and the grand lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby - Room are OK - Bathroom is poor”
Reviews.Author: bitrou
Reviews.Content: The lobby is impressing, large & luxury. The guy from reception was very pleasant & efficacious. Effectively a guy from the reservation has been rude on the phone. Astonishing for a hotel at 500 dollars a night... The problem of this hotel is certainly the bathroom which are small and very basic. The bed is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms,great lobby and location,terrible service”
Reviews.Author: susana1
Reviews.Content: The location great,be prepared for small accomodations, lobby is beautiful too bad service is horrible!! everyone expects tips!!Bar in lobby that serves coffee in am costs don't think its on the house!!on top of that the staff is rude!! Room is comfortable so are the beds. Make sure to request a view other than the rear building and the heating/air condition units!! This was nothing to wake up to in the morning!! One other thing is that when we called to request missing items camera,ipod we were so rudely assisted...never did get a call back from the manager that I asked to please call me...make sure you check your items and lock safe at all times!!!!Nice hotel for the price and location but would think twice before going back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Cat43
Reviews.Content: Having read lots of review about hotels in New York, I wanted to book something that was fairly central that didn't cost the earth and was clean with our own bathroom. So we booked the Roosevelt and I was really pleased with the hotel during our stay. It was clean & comfortable, a fantastic location and the temperature was fine (a lot had been written to suggest otherwise!) even though it was hot & sunny outdoors. There is air con in the room so you can control the temperature yourself if its not to your liking anyway. We walked everywhere from here, Times Square, Macy's, the theatre but if you're heading further afield, Grand Central is directly across the road, also the subway to take you downtown. We stayed in a twin room which was exactly as was described on the website, there was plenty room for us and all our shopping! The only gripe would be that there is no extractor fan in the bathroom so it gets a little steamy but other than that, I was delighted with the place. Oh and the concierge was a little unhelful - tried to make us pay above the price for our theatre tickets telling us the performance was sold out. Went directly to the theatre on the day (sat) expecting to be told the same, but we were given a choice of seats and actually got orchestra seats for the price below (about $100 less!) Got a fantastic deal for a good hotel in a great location - what more do you want? Would definately stay again & recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gillmac1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for 5 nights. This was my first trip to New York and found it difficult to choose a hotel as there are so many! However I was not disappointed with my choice. The location of the Hotel is perfect for all the main mid-town attractions and right next to Grand Central if you want to hop on the underground to go further down or up town. The lobby and bar area are beautiful and comfortable with a nice lively buzz about them. I found the staff to be polite and helpful at all times. We booked a superior room - it was pretty basic and quite small but very clean and the bed was really comfortable. The only problem we had was that our room was inter-connecting and our neighbours were really early risers and really loud! So not much privacy if on a romantic getaway! However I would happily stay there again and recommend the Hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Immensely Disappointed in The Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ak7117
Reviews.Content: While The Roosevelt Hotel's website boasts beautiful pictures and gives one the impression of hospitality and comfort, our actual stay at the hotel tells another story. Upon check-in, we discovered dried urine on the toilet seat. We contacted the front desk about this disgusting problem, who in turned blamed housekeeping and did not seem to care to do much to address our concerns. During the next two days, we continuously contacted several managers, who shifted the responsibility of dealing with our concern to other managers. We were promised calls back to address the problem, and were disappointed, but albeit not shocked at this point, that no one returned our calls. Additionally, the bath did not run hot water. After approximately 20-25 minutes of having the water temperature in the tub set on the maximum heat level, we were able to have some lukewarm water. The Roosevelt's solution to this problem? Sending a technician to our room well after our showers were over. If a dirty toilet and cold water in the shower weren't enough, the television only had a handful of channels that showed a clear picture, while the remaining channels were scrambled. In conclusion, don't be fooled by the hotel's website, and opt to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, and Im fussy!”
Reviews.Author: scotthenry
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Roosevelt for five days between 8th Feb - 12th Feb and had an excellent stay. The room was lovely and clean and tidied each day. The weather in New York was so cold and coming back after a long day shopping or sight seeing into a lovelty warm lobby and hotel was a pleasure. The staff were friendly and the hotel had a great ambience about it. It was in a great location as well, two mins walk from grand central station. The gym was also open 24 hrs and was supplied with fresh fruit at all times. I'm normally a very fussy customer, but I can honestly say this hotel was excellent and I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt! Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: joleneelektra625
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt 4/17-4/23. We loved it. I had emailed ahead of time requesting a room with a view since it was our first anniversary. We had booked a cozy queen on hotels.com for a rate of $162 a night. When we arrived we got upgraded to a king room with a view of the street. Lisa at the check in counter was great. Great location. Walking distance to Grand Central Station, Rockefeller center, and Times Square. We even walked to the empire state building which was about 10 blocks away. When we come back as long as we can get a good rate we will stay here again. The bathroom was smaller.. the only downside to this hotel was that they didnt have a whole lot of electrical outlets by mirrors. While my husband was in the shower I was trying to blow dry my hair and flat iron it and it was kind of hard to do without a mirror.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: lowcha
Reviews.Content: We booked the Roosevelt on E45th Street because it was central and looked to have an old world charm. Central it was, charming it most definitely wasn't. On arriving at the hotel after travelling from London we were told our room was double booked and we would be put in a temporary room overnight and reassigned the rome we booked (with an upgrade)the following day. We were then told we should vacate our temporary room before midday the following day, but could not be allocated the 'upgraded' room until after 3pm. When we queried what we should do with our luggage, we were told a bell hop would collect our bags from the temporary room and deliver them to the new room. Whilst this was inconvenient we appeared to have no option. On returning to the hotel after 3pm we had to go through the whole check in process again, with somebody who seemed to find us an annoying interruption to his day, and were allocated the room we had originally paid for (no upgrade). When our bags were redelivered to our room, the bell hop actually argued that our tip was insufficient and tried to intimidate my friend into paying more. When we pointed out that the reason he even had our luggage was because the hotel had messed up, he stated it wasn't his problem. Even knocking on the door after we closed it to query the amount again. Whilst appreciating that tipping is a recognised activity in NY, I have never encountered so many staff who seemed intent on fleecing us for as much money as possible. The front desk staff were nothing short of rude. The only exception were the housekeeping staff who not only ensured the rooms were clean and tidy, but greeted us with a friendly good morning each day. On a practical note, the lifts did not appear to cater for the number of guests. We were two of many who caught the lift going up in order to come down, as it was virtually impossible to get a down lift from the 7th floor. Having visited NY prior to this trip and experienced the friendliness of other hotel staff, I would strongly urge travellers to stay away from the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “loved the roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: lexy191267
Reviews.Content: stayed at the roosevelt for my partners 40th birthday the staff we found were very helpfull and the location was brill all in all a good alrounder rooms are better than avg well cleaned and fresh bedding every day bathroom well stocked downstairs in the lobby theres the bar fairly priced for newyork and bar food not to pricy but cheaper can be found at grand cental they have tons of eaterires to chose from there all types catered for,and only 5 mins away from times square and broadway, would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Midtown.....amazing location!!”
Reviews.Author: DAVIDJORGE
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night but wish it could have been longer. A very impressive hotel with great staff. Arrived in the morning expecting to drop off our luggage and return around 3pm check-in time to get our room. Not only was our room ready early, they upgraded us to a better room. Small, but totally clean and comfortable with all necessary ammenities. Price was great in comparison with other nearby hotels. Close to Grand Central, Bryant Park and 5th Ave shopping. For best rates..book off of the hotel's website directly. Will definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “It is overrated but i still liked it”
Reviews.Author: Smeg21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my partner last year and we got a great rate because of the External building work.. We didn't actually realise how expensive this hotel could get. When we got there we were impressed.. it was in an extremely good location and the overall atmostphere was great! We got dealt with by front desk in about 5 mins and brought to our room on the 8th floor... I didn't find the elevators as bad as ppl say.. there is about 5 of them so only took a minute or two for one to come... The room was a petite queen.. it was big enough for the two of us with all our shopping!! The telly wasn't a flat screen but had good reception. The room was always cleaned and one day when we decided to eat in our room an extremely nice lady called us to ask if we wanted our room cleaned... I didn't realise we should have tipped the cleaning staff which i regret as they were really good! I couldn't believe when i seen the price of the room service... shocking.. def not worth it.. even a litre bottle of Vodka would cost over 100dollars with tax and 'delivery' charge!?! We made about 3 phone calls to ireland no longer than 3 minutes each and the phone bill was $150? Def using payphones the next time!! Also i found the ppl Staying in the hotel (at the time we were there) quite snobbish.. we got in the elevator one day and a women turned to us and said 'our economy is dropping so much that even you guys can stay here now'..... honest to god we were on a 2 week stay in the US from ireland... one flight cost more than the hotel.. its not like we were wearing rags and we had plenty of shopping bags on us... really dont know where she got off saying that.. anyway despite that one run in and the price of food there everything went smoothly and i would prob stay again for atmostphere, cleanliness and location!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanitaOhio
Reviews.Content: My two Aunts and I went to New York on April 8 thru the 10th..Wonderful ! I was nerves about staying after reading all the reviews...Everyone was great ! Very helpful...I loved the Man that ran the gift shop....Rooms were excellent...Lobby was everything I expected it to be...Every one in New York was wonderful to us just two people in our whole stay were rude...My one Aunt is hadicap and everyone never hesitated to help her...Well come again and again to this Hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and good value for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: game_misconduct
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked through Priceline for $149/night for a mid week stay in a room with a queen sized bed. I stayed there with a close friend for a girls getaway trip. Overall, we were happy with the hotel. Location is ideal as it's within four minutes of Grand Central Station and within walking distance of the the Times Square district. The lobby is wonderful... turn of the century class and they've definitely tried to maintain the grandour of the lobby area. Check in was a bit harried, but only because of the volume of people and the activithy around us. We had asked to upgrade our Priceline booking to get two beds or at least a king sized bed but decided it was not worth the additional $60 per night. The room was small but standard Manhattan sized. Overall, the room was cozy with classic furnishings. The bed was a bit cosy for two women sharing so would recommend a king for a male/female couple --especially if one person is larger or taller. The washroom was small but adequate. Restaurant was generally good. I would suggest going off site and paying the same amount for a more complete meal. There are plenty of good eats in other areas that it seems a shame to not leave the restaurant. We arranged a town car to take us from La Guardia. It seemed to be hassle free, compared to what I've been told about the airport shuttles. Transportation in and around New York was fine since we were located by Grand Central. Staff were very friendly and helpful... especially the bell staff. One staff member was on break having a cigarette but stopped to direct me and even walk me in the right direction. Overall, I have no major complaints about the hotel. If I hadn't gotten such a good deal on the hotel and had to pay regular rate, I might have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: WHITLEYCHEAM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel from 20 – 24 March to celebrate his 50th birthday. I emailed in advance and requested a high floor corner room and on our arrival we were upgraded (free of charge) to a corner room on the 15th floor (Room 1544). This room was much bigger than the standard rooms with wonderful views of the Chrysler Tower from our window, very quiet room, no traffic noise, excellent shower and the most comfortable bed we’ve ever slept in which was especially welcoming after a long day walking around New York! We loved everything about the Roosevelt Hotel. The hotel had so much old-fashioned character and charm and you really felt you had arrived in New York, once you entered into the grand reception area. The service was excellent and nothing was too much trouble. The location was excellent, being only a few blocks from Times Square and Fifth Avenue. Lots of great places nearby for breakfast. We both loved New York and can’t wait to return and we would definitely recommend the Roosevelt Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Desk Staff: THE WORST!!!”
Reviews.Author: tipsdeviajero
Reviews.Content: Before my trip to NYC, I read in the Tripadvisor about The Roosevelt Hotel. Lots of people have had a bat experience in that place, but…”It looks very nice”, I thought. Well, I continued to read, and somebody wrote about to get a special rate with a code, in Travelzoo.com. So, I visited the website (Travelzoo), and ¡cool! I found the code TZQ208. 219.00 U.S. with Full American Breakfast. The website processed the reservation, very well. They sent a mail to me, with this information: Room Type: Superior Room, 2 Double Beds: TZQ208 Arriving: Thursday, March 13, 2008 Departing: Tuesday, March 18, 2008 Adults/Children: 2 Adults, 1 Child So, I went to NYC and… Surprise! What horrible people. The woman (Desk) was very rude with me, when I asked about the breakfast, she told me: “What? Do you know…there are people that have paid more than 300.00 U.S. for the same room that you, without breakfast.” I ask for the boss, and she was more rude. I asked her for an e-mail of the hotel, and she gave me a small card with the website of the hotel. I told her than I wanted the e-mail, and she told me “that’s the only thing I have”. Very bat experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable, great location, good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Oatleyr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roosevelt many times on quick trips to visit, shop, see shows, etc. Each time I think I will stay somewhere else, because the Roosevelt is a bit stodgy, but each time I find that it offers far greater value than other NYC hotels. The lobby space is venerable and impressive; there is an adequate though overtaxed concierge; and the rooms are fine, if dated.The location is wonderful, especially for families: You want to be near, but not right in, the theater district, which can be seedy. I always try to skip overpriced hotel breakfasts; there are inexpensive breakfast options near the hotel, including at Grand Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a family friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: acooper0810
Reviews.Content: Where to begin... Hindsight, I should have seen this coming. The first of many issues my family encountered, getting a hold of reservations. Most reputable hotels have reservations available 24/7. Not this one. In fact unless you're non-working individual, you're stuck with an 8am-5pm work day for their reservations counter. After finally getting a hold of them, I signed up for a weekend in February for my family (wife, daughter, and myself). At the time I also signed up for a crib. Two months later and a week before our arrival in NYC, I call to confirm the hotel room. Guess what? No notes confirming a crib. The receptionist was quite nice on the telephone, apologized, and told me directly that she has placed the note on the screen. Alas, our arrival in NYC was here. We checked into the hotel. I must say, the hotel was buzzing. It had a beautiful lobby, excellent doormen, and a good check-in feel. That was about the highlight of our stay (besides checking out). Let me explain to you about this stay -- it's a "historic" hotel. That's a code word for "old." In fact, it's very historic. The elevators are HORRIBLE. In fact, if you go to this hotel, either pick a floor that you can take the stairs, or get a room in the top part of the hotel where you can actually get on an elevator going down. We would wait for 30-45 minutes in order to get an elevator going down. We finally gave up and pressed the up button to up to the top and then grab the elevator down. The view of the room stunk. After all it's NYC, right? Hotels are meant to be vacant because you are "in the city" all day long. Wrong. There are reasons why there are no pictures on the hotel's web site that show the great view -- there is not unless you want to look at brick buildings. About the accommodation: we could barely move around the room (see the pictures). The noise level was horrendous -- thin walls as well as thin windows meaning you will need to use the climate system, which by the way is antiquated and super noisy as the pipes clang constantly. With the sirens coming up from the street as well as the air condition unit right outside of our room, it made for the stereotypical sounds of NYC. If you're looking for sleep in this hotel, forget it. If you're travel with kids, STAY AWAY. Turns out they ran out of cribs. Indeed, I had to call room service three times to ask where was the crib. By the end of the fourth phone call, I received a response in 10 minutes -- a bellman brining me a pack and play apologizing that they ran out of cribs. Guess I should have made my reservations 6 months ago vs. the 2 months I originally set. So let's talk about the bathroom...mold. Mold. And Mold.
