In fact, I contacted room service to have the bathroom cleaned while we went to dinner to recoup our disbelief of this supposedly nice hotel. Even after the cleaning, it still looks moldy (see photo). Then there was the tub. The showerhead pressure was fantastic, if you could close your eyes and pretend the showerhead wasn't plagued with microbes of bacteria. However, even that was overcome by the shower drain being unable to keep up with the water flow. So if you're going to this hotel, be prepared to shower wading in dirty water to your shins. As parents, we got no sleep for 4 days. Our child was miserable. As we left the hotel room and thought to ourselves, thank goodness, even their self-checkout on their new flat screens wasn't working. The sheet says to tune your tv to channel 42. When you do that the screen says the channel doesn't exist. The icing on the cake. As we left the hotel behind, we did encounter one more nice thing, the doorman. If you happen to need directions or someone to hail a cab for you, ask for Bernard, he was great. If you have a family, I would not recommend this hotel. If you're traveling with your significant other, I would caution you to stay only if you're interested in not staying in and merely using it for just a bed. I hope our horrible experience is not lived out by anyone else. That's why I'm taking the time to write this review. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: MauiSunsetsGirl
Reviews.Content: I traveled to NYC this January to visit friends and do some sight-seeing. The hotels in Manhattan were at their lowest prices, and I selected the Roosevelt. The location was great--all the cab drivers know it and your closest subway stop is Grand Central Station (can't beat that!) which is about 1 block or a 5 minute walk away. I really loved going through Grand Central several times. The Roosevelt has a beautiful lobby, but every time I might have wanted to sit and enjoy it, the seating was all occupied. There is a set of 6 elevators, and I never had to wait more than a couple minutes to get an elevator on my floor. The rooms were quite toasty, as I've seen mentioned in other reviews, but I counteracted that with the A/C when I was getting dressed after a shower. My room was 1687, a "cozy queen". The room was quite small but just right for me and my luggage. The bathroom was miniature sized--but again it worked for one traveler. The walls were quite thin--I could hear a neighbor's phone conversation and mild coughing. Also, since the room was so small, the bed is obviously very near the door, so you could hear everything housekeeping was doing. You have to really concentrate to recognize whether they are knocking on your door or someone else's. I had my Do Not Disturb sign out, which they respected. The linens were nice and the bed was quite comfortable. They provided Bath & Body Works toiletries, which were nice. Some of the towels have seen better days, but again since I was alone I could avoid those towels and use the others. I had a non-smoking room which was a true non-smoking room (didn't smell like smoke anyway like many I've experienced at other hotels). I ordered room service one day, and the food and service was good. Otherwise, I didn't eat at the hotel, but would get breakfast at one of many Starbucks all over town on the way to wherever I was going. Overall, I would stay at the Roosevelt again, but I'd bring earplugs next time!

Reviews.Title: “Old World charm in a great location, staff need some help”
Reviews.Author: travelling_smurf
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much from this hotel, but things were mostly good. The Old World lobby was absolutely stunning. Shame the bar prices ($9 for a gin & tonic) seemed rather expensive. The desk staff were friendly enough but the first lady put the 3 of us in what must have been a standard room with a King bed on the 17th floor. We'd requested a twin double room but they didn't have any left apparently. We were told to bring our luggage down the next morning and the desk would find us a twin double room. The King room was small already and with a rollaway bed taking up what was left of the floor space it was very cramped. We also couldn't find any air-conditioning unit and it was too cold to open the window so suffered with no ventilation. This is the room in the photos. The next morning we asked again at the desk and was told that we could have a twin double room, but that there would be no room for a cot. When we protested, the lady was apologetic about her colleague's mistake and offered to show us the twin double room for size if we wanted to. We relented and she gave us another King room on a lower floor. This room though was extremely large and spacious compared to the previous one. The rollaway bed fitted with heaps of extra room. Lesson learnt? Ask for a larger room if they have one available. This one was on the 6th floor. Oh, and this room had an air-conditioning unit located underneath the window. Bathrooms in both rooms were clean and functional. Windows let in a bit of traffic noise but didn't pose any problem for sleeping. Watch the linen as I found a couple of stains on the edges of the sheets but otherwise there were no complaints from the girls. Beds were comfortable enough. Concierge was functional, but not very friendly. When I asked him for a restaurant recommendation he kept looking around at anyone but me when talking to me, and was distracted mid-sentence by something his colleague was doing. Perhaps I didn't look like I was going to give him a big tip (which I wouldn't have minded doing if he actually did his job well). The best thing about the Roosevelt though is the location. It's two blocks from 5th Avenue, and the walk up 5th Avenue to the Apple Store at 5th Av and 58th St is littered with lots of great shopping. It's two blocks from Grand Central Terminal where you can catch trains and subways to all parts of Manhattan. It's about 3 blocks to Times Square and Broadway. It's just around the corner from all the expensive hotels on Park street. Walking to and from the hotel at night was no problem and the girls never felt threatened. I'd advise this hotel for people wanting looking for an affordable hotel for serious shopping or sightseeing in New York with its great location and easy access to trains and the subway. Just remember to ask for a bigger room if they have it, check the linen, and hold out some dollars for the concierge to see when approaching him.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: graceoliver
Reviews.Content: We booked a block at the Roosevelt hotel for our son;'s wedding the weekend of January 19th, 2008 at the Roosevelt Hotel. We also had a welcome reception at the hotel and the Bride's family booked a brunch on Sunday morning after the Saturday wedding. The reception and the rehearsal were held at the different site. The Roosevelt and their staff were just wonderful. There were a few minor gliches here and there with people not getting into their rooms fast enough etc. but all in all they could have not been more accommodating. They offered us a great rate for Manhattan and were just thrillled how the whole weekend turned out. I have no complaints. The location of the Roosevelt is just great in Manhattan, a very safe area, with lots of cute deli's and restautants close by if you don't want to do the hotel breakfast. The hotel's restaurant actually has very good food. Great lobby, and nice bar....everything you could want. It is an old hotel and some of the rooms are smaller, but they have renovated it and all of the beds are new and very comfy. I LOVED THE ROOSEVELT....go for it! Very pleased from Cape Cod

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations”
Reviews.Author: DrRingDing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel on 45th Street for 3 nights in late March. While the room was rather small, it was comfortable for two. The Hotel is in excellent condition, and the service was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Old Hotel, Thin Windows”
Reviews.Author: MyEnzo1
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Roosevelt was a result of high rates at my favorite hotel, Soho Grand. The Roosevelt Hotel is an old, beautiful, quaint hotel in mid-town making the location great. However, we stayed on a street where there was continuous garbage/bottles being processed. The windows were so thin, I felt as if I was sleeping on the street. I could hear everything! The size of the room was good, the bed was nice. But they really need to insulate. If you don't mind not getting sleep, this is a good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Good Room Size!”
Reviews.Author: hunkandsexy
Reviews.Content: My family and myself stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and booked 3 rooms via Expedia. The price we paid was very good considering the excellent hotel decor and service level! The lobby is amazing with the old but classic decor and the rooms where adiquant for my needs, although a tiny bit small, we only sleep in the room on the nights and the rest of the time was dedicated to shopping, broadway shows and discovering new york. The hotel is so central to everything in new york including times sqaure, 5th avenue shopping and broadway. Really amazing! 5*

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable place to stay near Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: QNPoohBear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a convention in April 2005. We had a special convention rate which made it far more affordable. The hotel seems to cater to conventions because we saw many groups there. It is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in and convenient to many major tourist attractions and 5th Ave. shopping. We were met by uniformed doormen able and willing to help us with our bags. My room was not ready yet when I checked in, so I stored my baggage and went off sightseeing. This hotel is a short walk from Grand Central station, the 5th Ave. shops, Rockefeller Center and Times Square. I felt a little intimidated in the lobby, which seemed very fancy. I felt like I should not be wearing jeans. I met with my friends and we spent an hour chatting on the couches in the lobby. My friend arrived late and they didn't give her any problems with late check in. She ordered room service and the food arrived quickly and she declared it very good and the real New York cheesecake the best she ever had. We had a great night's sleep in the comfortable double beds with heavy comforters and fluffy pillows. The room included two double beds and a plush arm chair. The room was quiet and we didn't hear any noise at night. Breakfast was not included in the price of the room, but there seemed to be a coffee cart in the lobby. We chose to go out to eat. We also spent time in the bar area with friends, not drinking, and the bar tender and employees were very friendly. The area was a comfortable, private place to sit and talk. The staff were helpful in giving directions and when it came time to leave, the doormen helped us get cabs and carry our luggage out to the cars. I loved staying here and if I could afford it, I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lobby, but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Greenarm3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on business. The hotel has a great location along with a nice lobby and gym. However, the room was very small and the bed takes up most of it. Also, each night from around 2:30AM - 5:30AM there was a loud metal banging noise outside my window. I couldn't determine the source nor did the hotel do anything about it. Overall, this hotel is alright, but definitely overpriced due to it's location.

Reviews.Title: “good value, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: originalgrin
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful, friendly and seemed happy to greet us. Unlike other visits to NYC when I have encountered indifference and hostility. The location is great and the rooms are clean. I wish I could afford a "5 star hotel" but this was in my budget and I feel that I received a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Characterful, welcoming hotel in the perfect spot.”
Reviews.Author: Pringers
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. The hotel is clean, tidy, characterful and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The location was also fantastic - right next door to Grand Central and only a few blocks from the Rocekfeller Centre etc... The price we got via Expedia was below what we planned to spend so we upgraded to a Superior Room (Kingsize) @ £118 per night. The room was not massive but the bed certainly was. The only down side was the decor in the bathroom was a bit dated and tired. The hotel would also not let my wife in to the hotel without me as the named guest which was a real pain as she had to wait 4 hours before getting in! I would definatly recomend this hote to anyone looking for a base in New York for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel - Great!”
Reviews.Author: sophikita
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a great location very close to 5th Avenue, Madison Avenue and Grand Central Station. We walked all over Manhatten during our stay and the hotel was also conveniently located for the subway. The hotel lobby is beautiful, very grand. We stayed in a cozy queen room and although it was on the small side, we were expecting that from a New York hotel. The room was fine, very clean, comfy bed and enough space. The bathroom was similarly small but clean. Heating could be controlled within the room and turned on or off as required. I really enjoyed our stay at the Roosevelt and would stay again if we could get a good price. We booked through hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, good location, OK”
Reviews.Author: SiouxSue
Reviews.Content: No real complaints about this hotel, and I guess the room was reasonably priced given the location and quality, but I was hoping for more. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows, good shower, window opened to let in fresh air (more on that below), quiet (relatively), and good TV. Based on other reviews, I expected the room to be tiny, and it was. It was well-equipped, as expected. However, * I've had bigger bathrooms on cruise ships! Seriously! The bathroom door bumped on the toilet when it was open so you couldn't open the bathroom door completely. * The room was so hot in January that I had to open the screen-less window (on the 18th floor!) to let in cool air (and city noises) and keep the A/C on HIGH every night, sleeping only with the sheet over me. Yet they wanted me to help them "conserve energy" by re-using the towels and washcloths? Conserve more energy by cutting down on all that heat! Wow! * Limited electrical outlets - one outlet in the bathroom and one on the desk lamp in the bedroom. That was it. So, could not charge the cell phone and charge/use the computer at the same time in the same room. * Internet access through a 3rd party was $15/day (24 hour period) added on to the bill. * Internet access was provided through the typical VERY short ethernet cable. So, to use it, I had to keep my computer on the desk while I sat in the unadjustable desk chair, which was very low, catching up on e-mail and everything else with my elbows above my ears. ARRGH! Not good! Is ethernet really so expensive that they can't afford to put 36 inches of it in each room? Wireless would be even better, of course, and so would FREE!!! * The key card malfunctioned on me the first time I tried to get back into the room. Since my room was on the 18th floor, I tried using the hall phone to get another key sent up. NO luck. The voice answering directed me back down to the lobby where there was a long line. The person who checked me in quickly made me a new card, apologized, and suggested that next time I use the house phone on the floor. Yea, right.... So, keep the card away from your cell phone, your computer, or anything else vaguely electronic. * The safe in the room did not work because the pins that lock the door were too short to connect! Waste of space! * I'm a woman traveling alone, and I'm security conscious. For this hotel, access to the elevators leading to ALL the floors of the hotel were accessible from the lower level of the hotel, where a bunch of street-level stores are located. Plenty of access from the street to the elevator bank - from the stores and also directly from the street. So, anyone walking into the hotel on that level has unfettered access to the elevators and all the hotel rooms. No one watching those elevators at all (perhaps a security camera, but no one stopping foot traffic was visible). Those street doors are locked after 9 p.m. and the stores are closed then, too, but NOT a warm and comfy feeling for me. Last point - The hotel has room service, but I think I figured that a scrambled egg and toast breakfast was going to cost me $50, and the hotel breakfast buffet was excellent but $40/person, too. The bar/coffee shop has good coffee, and some breakfast items, but very pricy. Perhaps normal for NYC, but wow! We aren't all traveling with Euros!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: TDPookie1
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal ($179/night) for the Roosevelt through Travelzoo (but booked on the hotel's website). The location -- half a block of outdoor walking from Grand Central, easy walking distance to Broadway, shopping, and museums) -- looked fabulous. I read the reviews on TripAdvisor before booking so I had realistic expectations. When we arrived at the hotel, they didn't have the room category we reserved available yet, so we got upgraded one level to a Deluxe. It seemed like a spacious room by New York standards. The bedding was new and clean. The bathroom fixtures and carpeting were older, but also clean. We used the internet (for an extra fee), and it worked well. We did not use any of the hotel services, but upon checking out, we asked the bell desk to hold our luggage until the end of that night so we could spend the rest of the day in the City. They were happy to help. I gave four stars instead of five because of the dated bathroom and TV. Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: richy_rich55
Reviews.Content: Similar to a few others on here, when I arrived at the Roosevelt I was really impressed at how grand the lobby was but when I got to my room I was disappointed at how small it was. The rooms are small (the bed was almost the entire width of the room!!) and they really need modernising. Bathroom was very dated. Didn't sample the food or drink at the bar or the hotel's restaurant, the Hotel is however in a great location in the city with plenty of restaurants within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “@ The Roosevelt Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: seagullrob
Reviews.Content: We did a 4 week tour of the USA over December/January 2007, with 3 older children (girl, 22, boy, 19 and boy, 18), going to San Francisco [Omni Hotel], Miami (South Beach) [Beacon Hotel], Orlando (Disneyworld, Pop Century Resort), Chicago [Drake Hotel], New York (for Christmas) [Beacon Hotel – no relation to the one in Miami], Boston [Omni Hotel], New York (again) [Roosevelt Hotel] (including New Year’s Eve at the Renaissance Hotel overlooking Times Square), and a day trip to Niagara Falls. It was sometimes very cosy - sometimes downright stressful - with the kids. Anyway, here are my accommodation reviews. I’ll mention side trips and tours too. Sometimes the accommodation was arranged through a travel agent, but on a couple of occasions I organised it direct. We spent 5 nights at the Roosevelt Hotel in New York, including New Years Eve. This accommodation was arranged through a travel agent (after satisfying ourselves on Trip Advisor), who recommended that we book early in the year, for accommodation goes quickly in the Big Apple on New Years Eve, as it does in any city (ie, people booking hotel rooms just for the night). We had two rooms - a double and a triple, which were unfortunately on separate floors. Ours had a king-sized bed, wardrobe, safe, TV, drawers, desk and chair ($15.00 a day internet access via ethernet cable; slightly cheaper for more than 1 day packages, but the most expensive that I’d seen in the USA) and a reasonably-sized bathroom (shower/bath). The kids’ triple room was much the same, but with 2 double beds. The hotel itself is a wonderful old building with a majestic foyer. It’s big - we seemed to walk for miles just to get to our room, which looked up at the Metlife Building (formerly the Pan Am Building). They served free eggnog in the foyer as part of the Christmas theme. It’s location is quite central to Manhattan - minutes from Grand Central Terminal (and subway), close to such icons as St Patricks Cathedral and the New York Public Library, and easy walking distance to Times Square and 5th Avenue shops. Like most big cities, you will never get a hotel in NY that is convenient to everything. But as mentioned, the subway was nearby, and this is the best way to cheaply get around the longer distances (get a multi-journey ticket - dispatched by vending machines using a credit card on subway stations). As for tours, we got our money’s worth from a City Pass (valid for 9 days to see 6 attractions), and it saved us time when queuing for the Empire State Building. The City Pass included a boat cruise (Hudson River, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, and the East River under the Brooklyn Bridge) which was well worth it. [Hint - trade your travel agent’s voucher for the book of City Pass tickets at a less popular attraction, where the queues are shorter. For instance, at the Empire State Building, there’s a huge queue to get your City Pass, then you’ll have to join the back of the queue for the building itself.] The Gray Line hop-on hop-off loops (open top double-decker buses) were good too (both of these were purchased through the travel agent before we left). We also did an awesome helicopter ride over Manhattan through Liberty Helicopters (the chopper takes 7 passengers plus the pilot) on Christmas Day, but that, as you can imagine, was hellishly expensive. The Empire State Building is a must, but I’d recommend the Top of the Rock too (the viewing decks at the top of the Rockefeller Centre). From there, you get a much better view of Central Park, plus you look south over Manhattan and see the Empire State Building too (which you can’t do when you’re atop it!). The big bonus is that, whilst it took about 2 hours to get to the top of the Empire State Building, there was virtually no wait to get to the Top of the Rock. We went mid-afternoon, and I stayed until the evening to get the sunset and night photos. See my review of the Beacon hotel in New York for photos of these tours. New Years Eve was spent at the Renaissance Hotel’s restaurant overlooking Times Square, and this was simply awesome (and deserving of a separate entry on Trip Advisor). The venue was unsurpassable (but as you can imagine, it came at a cost!). We were very happy with the Roosevelt, and would stay there again depending upon where in Manhattan we wanted to be.

Reviews.Title: “Mother/Daughter weekend”
Reviews.Author: robinleebee
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a weekend at the Roosevelt--first the good: the lobby is wonderful, old-fashioned, huge, with Starbucks-type breakfast in the morning. There are lots of tables, sofas, places to sit and talk, etc. When we were there, at least, the bar was crowded and lively. The rooms are comfortable, but a little tattered--paint was peeling off the ceiling of our bathroom, doorways are chipped, etc. The beds are great, linens are nice. But it's definitely worn. Now the not-so-good: the noise level at night is very high, even on the 14th floor. The amenities are minimal--almost no extras in the bathroom, only shampoo, conditioner, and a hair dryer. Not worth complaining about, but it feels a little stingy. Internet access is $15 per "session", about 3 hours, and there's no wireless in the rooms whatsoever. Not sure I would call this a 3.5 star place--it looks pretty worn around the edges. Now the bad-but-with-a-happy-ending: Our bathroom ceiling leaked the first morning there, and at first the desk was downright cranky about it. After I stayed calm and smiled a lot, we ended up with a voucher for appetizers at the bar and an upgrade to a HUGE suite. Moral here is that if you don't rise (or sink) to the mood of the front desk person, you get much better treatment; they all seem overworked and quick to be negative.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: organisedmichelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on business at the Roosevelt Hotel. The lobby is big and pretty impressive. Lounge offers coffee and breakfast pastries in the morning, which is a good option if you are in a rush, on a budget or not hungry enough for a full cooked breakfast. Check in was fast but not overly friendly. My room must have been a 'Cozy Queen' as it certainly was cozy. The bed took up 80% of the room and the other furniture was sqeezed in. There was a desk but I don't think I could have worked at it in comfort - the chair would have been touching the bed. Bed was comfortable and clean but over all impression of room was that it needed refreshed - needed dusted and smelt musty. The curtains weren't very clean. Bathroom was just a shower room really and you had to go in and close the door before you could get to the toilet. Everything was clean enough but towels were worn and mirror wasn't clean at all. The location was excellent - just one block to Central Station and close to lots of good restaurants. Conciege suggested some good choices. Valet parking also offered - a major plus. I think if you stayed more than one night you might get a larger room so that is why my report differs from other people. A good overall clean would improve things greatly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel...Great Location, Fabulous Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: uptownantiques
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I stayed at The Roosevelt for 6 days from Feb. 2 til Feb 8th 2008. It was a combination of business and pleasure for both of us. We booked our stay through Travelzoo.com and not only received a great rate but also the rate included a full breakfast for two. The hotel is one of those old venerable New York City Hotels with a classic gilded lobby. It was not our first choice but the hotel we wanted could not confirm certain dates and we were forced to book elsewhere. It was the right choice...this hotel worked out great! The location was fabulous. It is a block from Grand Central Station and a few blocks from Times Square if you are a tourist or if you need a west bound metro. You are on the corner of Madison and 45th so shopping is as soon as you walk out the door. Our room was spacious for New York standards with 2 double beds. It was clean and the in room safe worked easily once we figured it out. Our t.v. was small and in the corner on a chest. We are not television watchers but we do flip on CNBC or CNN news in the morning...and it was fine for us. The radiator was noisy the first day and we called the front desk...they sent a service man immediately who took care of the problem. All of the staff was helpful and friendly except one older gentleman concierge who recommended Serendipity for dessert...which had been shuttered recently and had re-opened. Since we had followed the Serendipity story in the news..it was less then appealing! We wanted a light dessert late one evening. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom small as expected. The shower had good water pressure and they provide you with soaps from Bed Bath and Beyond which were very nice. The breakfast was fabulous. It was a full buffet with platters of smoked salmon, cheeses, bowls of berries (blackberries, blueberries, raspberries, strawberries) , fruit platters (melons, pineapple), bacon, meats, eggs, egg whites, turkey sausages, all kinds of baked goods, yogurts, oatmeal with bowls of condiments, and a chef to make omelets, Belgian waffles or whatever you wish. Fresh juices, coffee, tea etc. And the service was superb. It was a great way to start each day. The USA Today newspaper was delivered each morning and they also have a business center at the hotel if you need it. We brought our laptops and there is a $15.00 charge to connect to Wayport each day. Internet is not available in your room but only in the lobby area. We sat on the second floor in the galley overlooking the lobby which was quite pleasant and much quieter to use our laptops. There are Starbucks close by if you use their set up for internet but they close early around 9 pm. If you have suitcases and come in the front door...go to the side of the steps leading up to the lobby to take the elevator. It is an easy way to go to the lobby with luggage. We would highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay there the next time we are in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Always great!”
Reviews.Author: phcva
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here in January 2008. We typically stay at the Roosevelt when we visit NYC. Good location. Close to Grand Central, Times Square, Rockefeller Center. Nice accommodations, friendly staff, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: dougnaie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel for my daughter's 16th birthday and could not have had a better experience! I had some concerns because I booked it online and had read some comments that were less than enthusiastic. Our experience, however, was nothing short of stellar. The location is amazing. Traveling with teenagers, proximity to shopping is paramount. The girls were thrilled that our room looked out on a J. Crew. My sister and I, 53 and 43 respectively, found the hotel to be similar to the St. Francis in San Francisco. Lovely lobby - very "old world" luxury. Nice bar to have a drink at the end of a long day of walking. Rooms were very comfortable and tastefully decorated. Room size was more than adequate. Beds were exceptionally comfortable - the nicest I can remember in a while. Super cozy. Room service was prompt, and the quality of the food was beyond our expectations. Price was about what you would expect for a hotel in a major city. We had coupons for the breakfast buffet in the morning, and it was a nice perk. The food was attractively presented, the help was very attentive, and overall it was a nice way to start the day. They had something that met the taste of everyone in our party. Frankly, we were pretty excited about getting down to breakfast in the morning! Overall, I really cannot think of a bad thing to say about the Roosevelt. Is it an older hotel? Sure. That said, from a harshly critical, highly judgemental Southern Californian, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone I know. We will stay here on any future trips to NYC, and look forward to doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: travelingwitha2z
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at the Roosevelt and can happily report a great stay. I went into the city for a girls' weekend and we choose the Roosevelt because of it's location. Literally around the corner from Grand Central, it made for an easy walk even with luggage. Check in was efficient and our room was ready at noon even though check in was three. The room was average size for NYC with 2 double beds,desk, small chest with conventional t.v., and night stand. The bed linens were updated and the room was very clean. The beds were heavenly, all seven of us commented on the comfort level. The bath was dated but efforts were made to upate with a new pedestal sink. Our view was non existent. We ventured to the lobby bar twice and enjoyed champagne on comfy couches and oversized chairs. Service was timely and pleasant. The doorman was helpful in getting transportation for seven to the Village and recommended a limo instead of two cabs. This was a fun splurge that only cost us $10 each. As for location, it is just a few short blocks to the main shopping area on 5th (Saks, America Girl Place, H&M, etc.) and Rockefeller Center. Time Square was ten minute walk. Check out was as easy as dropping your cardkey in a box. Overall a great stay and am planning on returning in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: Supertiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the last 2 nights of our honeymoon over Christmas. It was in a great location and the decor was very splendid. We had to fight with our luggage to get through a revolving door which we thought was the main entrance, then an elderly employee said he would assist us to the reception, although was more of a hinderence as all we had to do was go up one floor in a lift, he wouldn't go away until we tipped him, then one minute later asked if we were checking out?? We tried to avoid him as I think this is how he makes easy tips and pulls out a roll of dolar bills implying 'It's ok, I've got change' before even touching a bag or assisting in anyway, when the other guys are lugging all the cases around. The room was fine, felt like going back in time which suited the style of the hotel. Room service was very reasonable and you got loads of food, we were too tired to go anywhere. The rest of the staff were indifferent and the barman really let it down, drinks were very costly and the cocktail was mixed in the glass and the Irish coffee came very quick and tasted as if it been sat around for a bit. The hotels taxi guy was good, comfy car out to airport at pretty much the going rate. Overall it was a pleasant place but unfortunately let down by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: britsrusManchesterUk
Reviews.Content: arrived at this hotel on the 31st december,we had read the reviews,everyone has got there own opinon,approached reception which was empty and was greeted by a chap who confirmed our booking and then told us we were upgraded to a double queen room,bellboy took our cases to room and was tipped pleasant chap, the room was perfect, and every member of staff during our week stay was perfect no hassle off anyone,its location is just right nice quiet area at night easy enough to get a coffee locally,try redflame for breakfast 43st between 5th and 6th excellent service with a smile..overall we loved ny,felt safer than back home,,thank you new yorkers for a memorable new year wouldnt have any problems going back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: alfa114
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel in Feb 2007 in the freezing winter months for 4 nights but the check in was warm and welcoming the room although small and seemed to look into a call center was clean and very nice. the staff there more than helpful. a nice coffee snack bar in the lobby. the location was fantastic everything you want within walking distance. would highly recomend eating in grand central station in the food hall its a great experiance and the foods fantastic and cheap.just around the corner from the hotel. it would highly recomend anyone traveling to New York to stay her - we hope to return in Sept 2008

Reviews.Title: “Festive Season Stay”
Reviews.Author: loved1
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt was very nice - although the standard size room is not very large. We stayed here for 3 nights from the 31st Dec 2007 till the 3 Jan 08. In the foyer on New years ever there was free egg nogg. Being from a different country this was great as we were actually able to try it. However on our arrival at the hotel at 5.30pm our room was still not clean. They gave us a free coupon thing for the restaurant which we could get a pizza (any entree) and a cocktail each. This was great as we did not have to go out and get something as it was almost time for us to go to time square for the celebrations. However as we wanted to get into the room to get ready this was a bit of a pain. The room was nice and very clean however again not a large room. However after the first day we were never given clean face towels - which made taking off make up a bit difficult or generally freshing up. Overall a good stay, a lot of money, but a central location. Clean and tidy and I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: PandFB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in early January and had a good stay. The hotel is in a really good location just across from Grand Central and close to the main shopping areas - 5th Avenue etc and the Rockefeller Centre. You can easily walk to Times Square or the Empire State Building or you can get buses going up Madison and down 5th Ave or the Subway at Grand Central. Of the hotel itself - the lobby is very grand and the bar nice. I can't comment on the restaurant as we ate out. We checked in v quickly with a very friendly member of staff. Although we had booked a cozy queen we were given a decent sized room with a large king size bed - very comfortable especially the pillows with nice crisp bedding. Wished we had realised when we arrived that you could avoid climbing the flight of stairs to the lobby by going to the right where there were lifts to all floors - much more convenient with bags. Our room looked inwards so no view but nice and quiet. Bathroom in need up update but shower was v good and we were kept supplied daily with nice clean towels and toiletries (Bath & Body Works). Internet facilities available in the Business Centre - even let us confirm our flights online and print boarding passes for no charge. Don't make international calls from your room though even a v short call was v expensive. Room available to store your bags securely after you check out - worth the tip. All in all really enjoyed our stay at the Roosevelt and would return

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: iwantcomfort
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Roosevelt I was impressed at how beautiful the lobby was. When I got to my room I was a little disappointed that it was barely large enough to hold the bed. I was going to be working 11 hour days and so I wasn't that concerned with the size, up till then I was still ok. Then I ordered room service. BIG mistake. I am accustomed to expensive room service I realize I'm paying for convenience. The food was horrible. Beyond horrible and that is not easy to say about a cheeseburger. So I thought maybe just a bad night and ordered breakfast in the morning. OUCH even worse. So off I was to stand on marble floors for 11 hours. I came back to 5 messages on my phone saying that all of the water would be turned off at 11pm until 5am the next day and then let it run until it is not brown anymore. The message went on to say that there would be complimentary bottled water for the guests. Ok I know at this point anyone reading this will wonder why I ordered room service again, well I don't know the city well and there is nowhere to dine around the hotel. So I ordered again and asked for 5 bottles of water to last through the night. When the food got there I realized they charged me $10 a bottle for water. The man that delivered it was very nice and agreed that this was ridiculous he called the room service manager to the phone. This woman along with the next 3 people I spoke to on the phone that were managers in some capacity told me that EACH GUEST IS ONLY ALLOWED ONE BOTTLE EACH THAT THEY MUST GET THEMSELVES FROM THE FRONT DESK. Needless to say I was furious at this point and finally spoke to a manager named Joe Britt who proceeded to yell at me and say "for the record" before each sentence like "I am not asking you to leave this hotel" the conversation was pretty much one sided with him yelling over me his "For the record" speech. After a half hour of this nonsense he finally agreed to let me have 3 bottles and if I needed anymore I could call him in the middle of the night to bring them. As if this was not bad enough I got bitten all over my chest and woke up with itchy bumps. After running the water clear I was able to shower the next morning but the day after when I got ready to leave for the airport I was in the shower looked down and realized the water was completely brown. I jumped out so fast. What a nightmare..and this was the short version. Traveler BEWARE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LillyAtlanta_Ga
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had a mother-daughter weekend from Jan. 11-13, 2008 and stayed at the Roosevelt. The location was fantastic -- one block from shopping on Fifth Avenue, close by to Rockefeller Center, practically next door to Grand Central Station and not a bad walk from Times Square and Central Park. The lobby was grand and very nice. It also had a great lounge that offered Starbucks coffee in the morning. Rooms were fine -- clean and a decent size for NYC. Also, the beds had crisp, white bedspreads. We had a corner room with two nice-sized windows -- one looked out onto the Empire State Building. It is an older hotel and definitely has a certain charm about it. The one minus was that when we checked in, we were told that the water would be shut off in the hotel between 11pm-5am that night/morning for maintenance. This was definitely not what we wanted to hear after a long day of travel and made us initially skeptical of the hotel, but they provided us with two huge bottles of spring water to use for brushing teeth, etc. if we needed it, and we ended up falling asleep before 11pm anyway, so it all worked out okay. This is a nice hotel for the price (under $180 for a three and a half star hotel in Midtown Manhattan) and at this price, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: HandballYaz
Reviews.Content: The good: 1. Excellent location for shopping, central park, Times square 2. Very friendly and helpful hotel staff (very good concierge) 3. Room generally clean, good size for 2 people, bed comfortable 4. Nice, free, execise room The bad: 1. Walls were paper thin 2. Although we had a non-smoking room, every night cigarette smoke permeated our room. This likely came from people waiting outside the front door as our room was only 4 floors above it. 3. Noisy - the room offfered very little isolation from street noise In sum, I'd stay there again if I could get an inexpensive rate again. If it wasn't reasonably priced, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing NYC find!”
Reviews.Author: WallabyGal
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is terrific! Large rooms, friendly staff, sumptuous breakfast, all in a great location. It was walking distance from Broadway shows, very convenient in midtown. I got a great price from TravelZoo.com. Highly recommend The Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: ml1868
Reviews.Content: I took my mother and teenage daughter to NYC and stayed at this property for five nights. Upon arrival we were told that a non-smoking room was not available for the first night, but that we could be moved the following day. So we packed up our stuff only to be informed that we had to 'check out' and store our luggage until that afternoon. In the process of storing our luggage (a process that took almost an hour) we experienced a bellman that was out of control. He was yelling and screaming at another bellman and another customer. I have never seen anything like it in a place of business. When I spoke with someone about it, we were given a coupon for a free food and drinks at the bar. I was stunned when I saw the same bellman a few days later. The rooms weren't too bad. They could use a little upkeep. The room temperature is hard to control. Room service left a tray of food in the hall for over 24 hours. Elevators are hard to come by. The service was just all around poor. I wrote to the General Manager about all my issues, including my 70 year old mother being stuck in the corner of a hallway while the bellman were going at it, but he apparently is too busy to talk with customers. Three people of various postitions have contacted me, but not the person that I addressed my letter to. The hotel has given me a partial credit on my stay, but I can honestly say that I wouldn't stay there again, even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: steveb872
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 minutes walk to most midtown attractions, hotel lobby superb, staff were friendly and helpful. Room was nice with the exception of the bathroom which was in need of refurb / decorating, but nothing you could not live with. Temperature control in the room was 'fun', either blast furnace hot or north pole cold. That said I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Seedy Place”
Reviews.Author: alaedia
Reviews.Content: My husband had a work-related conference that was based at the hotel, so he booked us at the hotel for a couple of nights. It was a really terrible experience. 1. Firstly, they would not clean our room despite three phone calls (at 2PM, 5PM, and after returning from the day 11PM). When somebody finally came at midnight, he brought a bunch of white sheets, but didn't know how to put them on the bed. They were all untucked and crooked on the bed. He also didn't bother to clean the bathroom, vacuum, or give us any new towels. 2. Secondly, the bathroom was very cramped for any American hotel, even one that is two or three stars. You can barely stand in it with your significant other at the same time. The floor and shower tiles were moldy, and the toilet clogged easily. I've never clogged a hotel toilet before, but this one seemed very delicate. 3. The t.v. was this tiny tube thing you could barely see from the bed. 4. The internet service didn't work for the two days that we were there. We spent over an hour each day troubleshooting with their off-site IT service trying to figure out why it would come on and off. The hotel tried to tell us that our (new) Mac laptop was the problem, but oddly enough we were able to surf the web at any other hotel and other areas with Ethernet cables or free WiFi. In the end, the hotel still charged us for two days of internet service even though it wasn't working for more than about 30 minutes each of those days. 5. There are prostitutes waiting outside the front doors. We saw one of them counting a stack of twenty dollar bills at the elevator on our floor. She also looked as if she had just taken drugs. After the awful time we had there for a day and a half, we couldn't stand sleeping there another night and so left at midnight on the second night to go to the Parker Meridien. Oddly enough, the Parker Meridien charged us only $250 for the night, whereas the Roosevelt Hotel was planning to charge us $358 per night. Such a rip-off, it is a crime. Never ever stay there if you can help it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: reviewEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights beginning the 16th of December. Check in was quick and easy. We stayed in a superior room which was very nice.....the bed and pillows were great! The only downside to the room was that you couldn't get a happy temperature, but apart from that everything was excellent. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, and when I say breakfast I mean a bagel and cream cheese from the starbucks in the lobby of the hotel, which was good and reasonably priced. We looked at the room service menu one night but after all the extra charges they add on for bringing the food up to your room its not really worth it. The hotel location is excellent, and the staff were all friendly and helpful. One nice touch about the hotel was that every afternoon when we got back from shopping there was eggnog or hot apple cider and gingerbread biscuits in the lobby, and we had a newspaper delivered to our room every morning free of charge. Overall this hotel was excellent and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1077
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. The rooms were small, but very clean. Their pillows were the best hotel pillows ever! Personally, this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at! P.S. Breakfast is overpriced there, so that is a negative to the hotel, but that is all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gotrel
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have just returned from spending a week at the Roosevelt Hotel. We found the staff welcoming and polite. The room was standard but left us adequate space for all our shopping and other items. The hotel is ideally located for doing all the touristy things in NY and is within easy walking distance of all places of interest in midtown. Well worth a stay and we'd go back there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: MomTravels
Reviews.Content: I booked a pre-Christmas package for 2 adults and 1 small child using a Travelzoo.com promotion. Package included room and breakfast for two. The location of this hotel is very convenient to Rockefeller Center, Radio City, Grand Central Station, etc. This is our second stay at this hotel. We had nice experiences here both times. The bedroom and bathroom are spacious if a bit generic. The lobby is lovely, especially at Christmas. We enjoyed dinner at the Grill, which was good although there is no real separation between that area and the lobby, so you feel a bit like you are in a fishbowl. My daughter loved the children's menu, which is made of a chocolate puzzle. The breakfast buffet was nice; seating was a bit slow (there were several wedding brunches held later that day, so tables were reserved). During our previous trip (several years ago in the summer), we spent more time in the lounge. This time we did not, as the hotel was packed and service was very slow. All in all I would recommend this hotel, especially for those spending time in this area of the city and if you can secure a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “A real rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: EsteeLauder
Reviews.Content: The only good aspect of this hotel was its location. I can't think of any other positive feature.The room was overlooking a noisy fan from the next door building, the breakfast was very expensive for the prices charged and the worst of all, the porters from the lobby have a cunning scheme with the luggage so that they can make more money out of you. They take your suitcases from you, place them on a trolley and charge a tip before you get in to the lift. Then, they send you to the room (without your luggage) and send a second porter to take the trolley to your room. This means you have to pay a second time for the service. So, by the time you leave the lobby to come to your room you have spent USD 10.00. They stare at you and will not leave unless you pay them. For me, this is a disguised form of begging. There are plenty of better hotels in NY and I will definitely not stay there again and nor would I reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “the bedroom a bit disapointing but very satisfied overall !”
Reviews.Author: suziesouris
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night at The Roosevelt Hotel in december 07. This hotel is charming and gorgeous. It has kept the style of the 20's-30's. The staff and the service were good. The food at the restaurant was excellent. And the hall is just awesome! The Christmas decorations were terrific and charming! (see the pictures). Some points in the room were disapointing though... the lamps don't give enough light and one was broken. The bathroom was fonctionnal and clean but the bathtub was old and not too inviting. Fortunately, we are "shower people"... i would never take a bath there! The bed was clean and quite comfortable. Overall, we were very satisfied with this place and would go again. And the location of this hotel was perfect for us! Suzie & René Fredericton, NB, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in New York”
Reviews.Author: TimTurner
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel from the 15th Dec to the 22nd Dec. WE turned up to the hotel and it was running a full occupancy, I had booked the rooms 6 months beforw the visit over the telephone as I got a better deal then booking online, even though they say best rate guarantee online? Although all three rooms were booked together we were placed all over the hotel, one room was fine the others had back views of air conditioningpipes and noise, one room sunk of smoke thus we asked if we could change this we were told all rooms were taken and no change could be made, however after trying for a second time they were able to locate another room accross the hall from the other. I really think it is who you speak to and if they can be bothered. Service on the front desk was good and housekeeping were very polite, never once missed a good morning from them, rooms were always in a clean state however decoration was tired, i think more to do with the quality of workmanship than wear and tear. The rooms were large and the beds were very good quality, air conditioning units very good in room just had a habit of making a loud noise at times during night. The bar and reception areas were fatastic lovely decorations in the lobby. The staff serving tables in the bar were great but very slow 10 minutes to get a round of drinks but very polite. However what lets the bar down in firstly the size and secondly a guy that works behind the bar, i think the rudest person we met over a full week in New York, he is the tall dark haired guy... steer clear of him!!! Shame really as all other staff in there were great. The hotel was very busy and it took ages some mornings to get a lift to the main floor. The internet is also charged however a cafe across the road its free and very fast. Overall i would stay again, its a very good position for broadway, rockerfeller centre andtimes square and for the shopping on 5th avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: VonTwinzig
Reviews.Content: Just come back from spending Christmas in NYC with my wife and I have to say the hotel was fine. I was a bit disturbed over the weeks leading up to the trip as a number of the reviews at the time were less than complimentary, but I think if you put the effort in to speaking to the hotels reservations team direct, many of the problems could be avoided. We booked a deluxe room and from the hotel website it was clear that there were options, so I picked up the phone. Q "Room size varies from 200 300 square feet. How do I get a 300 foot one?" A "Easy you need a corner room." Q "I want it quiet" A " No problem, above the 14th floor then." Q "What about a view?" A "No problem, quiet view at the side or less so on Madison? A "Quiet view I think " A "No problem - 45th." So when we arrived we had exactly what we asked for, a quiet, corner room on the 15th floor with a side view. Easy. The room was a nice size, bright, with all the normal furniture and two large lounge arm chairs. Just right. The bed was mega comfy. Maid service every day and the bed turned down with little chocolates on the pillow. Nice touch. Okay a few things. The bathroom was small by European standards. Shower, hand basin and loo, no bath or bidet. But it was clean and worked. There were no tea / coffee making facilities in the room, which was a bit of a pain. We made do with water and juice in the end. The room was hot without the heating on so we left it off. The air con worked fine, but wasn't needed. The hotel public areas were warm. Several people felt a little uncomfortable and commented about it. It was fine in shirt sleeves though. The lobby/ main reception was really nice. Very festive. Plenty of helpful staff, a Starbucks concession and a nice lounge and bar area. Quite pricey though. The restaurant was acceptable. We only ate there Christmas day, but the food was fine and not a crazy price. Breakfast, however was a crazy price ($28pp) and try as I might I couldn't get it included in any deal, so we ate out every morning in one of the myriad of little breakfast places there are around the hotel. Easy, clean and cheap. Loads of choice. Not an issue and good fun actually. This is a big hotel and so the lobby area is constantly busy, but it never felt packed. Just don't expect the staff to know your name like you often get in European hotels, it's not going to happen. Going back to JFK we were offered the hotel car, which was a nice relaxed, clean journey and cost $55 (about the same as a taxi, but much nicer.) All in all the hotel was great and added to the experience. It's in a great central Midtown location and with Grand Central on the corner you can get around easily. It's got character so if your looking for something crisp and modern book into a Marriott or Holiday Inn. Couple of tips: Call the hotel and make your booking direct. They have a price match system so you can't lose out and you will stand a good chance of getting your requirements better met. Don't take the bus from the airport. It takes 2 hours; It stops up the road from Grand Central Station where you are meant to be met by a smaller shuttle bus to take you to your hotel, but you can end up walking the last bit instead. We did. Only a couple of minutes, but not fun with a bunch of suitcases. Taxi is $45 plus tolls and tip and goes right to the door. Big queue at the airport though.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, service was terrible”
Reviews.Author: TexasJeff
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, but not exceptional. (BTW - I am not a first time New York visitor, so I do know that all the rooms are small, the prices are outrageous, and the service is usually so-so). The lobby was gorgeous, the beds were ultra comfortable and the "superior room" was about the size of a regular hotel room. The windows opened, which was nice for a smoker. The service in the hotel was very so-so. They kinda took their time and didn't seem like they liked their jobs. The big disappointment was the restaurant. Stay away! Breakfast buffet was about $30 per person, but in a nice hotel in New York, what do you expect. The killer was the service. It was horrible. We couldn't get coffee refilled, they wouldn't come and take our plates, took forever to get the bill. For that kind of price, even in NY, I expect good service. Stay away! In short, this is a good hotel, but there are much better ones. Keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “"Just OK"”
Reviews.Author: TRKC2006
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on its central location and a special they were offering. I have to agree it is in the best location and very easy to get to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Bryant Park and 5th Ave. However, the hotel was very hot and stuffy. When I reached my room I understood why the AC was on cold. If it is not left on cold it is unbearably hot!! Also the beds were lopsided and the bathroom extremely small. The hotel is older and looks dated. The breakfast was a buffett and we found a long black hair in the omelet!! Also the male servers were not attentive and ignored requests for water and juice. The elevators are unbelievably slow! Many aircrew stay here and they all were taking the service elevator in order to make their flights. We waited 20 mins for an elevator going down although there are 7 bays. We were informed this is the way it is .. I could go on and on about the annoyances with this hotel ..with lots of choices in NYC I would advise others to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromPR
Reviews.Content: The whole experience at this hotel was great. First, excellent location 45th and Madison, close to Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue, Radio City and much less crowded and quite than those near Time Square. The staff was very friendly. We ask to change room because the first one assigned was used by someone who smoke and did not respect the hotel rules. They change us immeadiately with no hesitation. The beds are increadebly comfortables and the room was very clean and nice. The lobby was very nice decorated for Christmas and every day they had complimentary eggnog and gingerbread cookies for hotel guests....very nice gesture!! We found this hotel through Orbitz for about less than $200, very good deal, considering it was Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: gena67
Reviews.Content: Won this hotel on priceline @$110 - great deal considering it was Christmas and New York never being cheap. Excellent location - steps from 5th Ave, 5 min walk to Grand Central station/subway. $6 taxi ride to Penn Station. Clean, convenient room. Apparently, some problems with the elevators going down. Our room was on the 3rd floor and it usually was much faster to walk downstairs than to wait for the elevator, it also was too crowded on the 3rd floor. No problems going up though. No coffeemaker in the room, but a number of Starbucks just a few minutes walk or even downstairs in the lobby. Room service - very expensive breakfast, moderately priced lunch/dinner. Surprisingly, very moderately priced local calls. Check in is at 3pm and no rooms are available before that. Maybe because of Christmas, but it looks more like a general policy. Good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wwdc
Reviews.Content: Great location across the street from Grand Central Station. We took the subway and bus and had no difficulty getting to and from hotel. The staff was accommodating,the rooms were decent size for NYC with very clean rooms and comfortable beds.Check different web sites for rates. Excellent breakfast buffet(some off the best oj I've ever drank) I can't say enough good things about this hotel and will definitly stay there again. Oh, also an on premise bar for that final nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Room far too small”
Reviews.Author: yoojayem
Reviews.Content: Expedia described the room as a cozy queen, but it was so small. There was a king sized bed but there was only room for a small suitcase around its entirity. The en suite was equally as small and in need of updating and a decent shower. Despite sub zero temperatures, the room was very hot and unable to cool down without use of the noisy and ineffective cooling fan. It was impossible to sleep with this on. Staff were generally OK, but a little miserable on the whole. The foyer area was beautifully decorated for Xmas and the hotels location is perfect for all the NY sites. Top tip- there is a fabulous diner on West 44th Street called The Red Flame. It's a 5 minute walk and fab for brekkie. Go out of the foyer and turn right onto Madison Ave. Then go next right and walk two blocks. You'll love it. Overall an OK hotel, but the room was a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in NY”
Reviews.Author: keydet46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a long weekend in NY. You couldn't find a better loction or more comfortable hotel. The only complaint we could think of was that there wasn't a coffee pot in the room and we had to go outside for a smoke, we are still evil smokers!

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean budget hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Chris4817
Reviews.Content: A nice clean hotel in a great location. This came out at a budget price when booked but I think that it is an above average hotel with good size rooms for the City. In a great location on Madison and Fifth. The lobby is beautiful and worth a visit even for a look during Thanksgiving/Christmas. The rooms felt a little tired but well decorated and clean. The bathrooms were nice but not all had baths, some only a shower. Nice toiletries finished off the room!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: mars_phoenix
Reviews.Content: The rooms and facilities were small and spartan for what you pay, but I supposed this is to be expected in Manhattan. My in-room safe didn't work, but my stay was only for two nights so it wasn't a major problem. Be aware that there is an additional charge for in-room Internet access. I was disappointed that neither the website nor the reservation confirmation made this clear. The description of the room in the reservation confirmation had a list of amenities such as color TV, telephone, in-room safe, ironing board, etc. and high-speed Internet access was on that list, implying that it came standard with the room. It was not. I don't mind paying for Internet, but this should have been stated explicitly. Otherwise, they might as well claim that food and beverage are also "included" with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: manicsfan
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at The Roosevelt between 1st and 5th December. It's in a great location close to major attractions, in particular The Chrysler Building and Grand Central Terminal. We were a little early for check-in but this wasn't even questioned when we arrived. There was no queue at the desk and we were quickly guided to our comfortable, clean and reasonably sized room on the 7th floor. We had a view onto Madison Ave which was great for watching people and traffic go by - you could hear the traffic but it didn't disturb us in the slightest. Our room service order was taken efficiently and delivered quickly by a very pleasant member of staff. There was a restaurant available but we didn't use it - we've been to NYC before so have our favourite places we go to eat. We did have soom food and drinks in the bar - again, the service was friendly and efficient and the food portions were huge! We can't fault The Roosevelt and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: connorsmum
Reviews.Content: hi we stayed at the roosevelt from 21st nov til 25th nov2007, this hotel is a great location for sightseeing and shopping u can walk almaost anywhere the hotel wal beautifully decorated for christmas very grand approach into the hotel . The staff very polite and helpful the room small but everything you needed the only complaint the heating unpredictable and out dated we ate at resturant the omlettes great tasty would reccomend i would certanly use the roosevelt again and reccomend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: trixie100
Reviews.Content: We loved the Roosevelt. Firstly the location of the hotel is brilliant you couldn't get closer to everything. Fifth Avenue is 2 minutes away. (We spent alot of time there!) When you walk into the reception area and foyer it is spectacular. There was a lovely Christmas tree when we stayed and everything sparkled. We also enjoyed the bar, its not cheap but name me a hotel bar that is. Really great bar with character and huge fireplaces. Got very busy but good for a quick drink before you go out in an evening. The room we had was a superior with a king size bed and I can't tell you how comfortable the bed was. The bathroom looked like it had been refitted, as everything thing was really clean and new. I know some hotels in New York where the bathrooms can be dated as they are old hotels but this was fine, with a powerful shower too! All in all a fantastic stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Architecturally significant”
Reviews.Author: BigPussyBonpensiero
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in the heart of Manhattan, well appointed rooms with a touch of class. Good value for such a plush hotel. A few gripes, long reception queues, everyone has their hand out for a tip, poor reception on many TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: NHResident07
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent Thanksgiving in NYC and selected The Rooselvelt Hotel from reviewing the hotel guests' reviews from the internet sites, "Trip Advisor.com" & "Hotels.com". The hotel was OK, even though the HVAC in our room during our stay never worked properly-it was either too hot or too cold-never consistent. Even though we notified the hotel of this problem, it was never resolved. Overall, the hotel room was small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKDonna
Reviews.Content: Essentially this is a really lovely hotel. Traditional in style and sympathetically renovated. Rooms are very clean. Bathroom basic but everything you need and the hair dryer in the bathroom is very impressive. The hotel is perfectly located for everything you want to do. On our 2nd day there they put the Christmas tree up and decorations and it did look beautiful. There are just a couple of things I would point out. I stayed there with my 21 year old daughter. We checked in on the Friday afternoon and were impressed enough by our room. We set out for the City and arrived back around midnight and tucked ourselves up into bed to get ready for a full day sightseeing. We were rudely woken 3 times in the night by people passing our room and being loud then giggly. On looking through the spyhole I realised that it was teenagers. I rang down to reception on 2 occasions for security to ask them to calm down and remain in their rooms. Unfortunately this did not work and we had to confront them ourselves. In the end I naturally was concerned about any further incidents that I phoned reception and asked to be moved. Sure enough, not a problem, We were transferred from the 3rd to the 14th floor within half an hour (it was 5.30am by then). Our second room was actually slightly nicer than our first, but they were both superior rooms. When I spoke to the receptionist later that morning she explained that they sometimes book in students from schools and do have problems with them from time to time, that they are not responsible for their behaviour, that is down to their teachers. I feel that this is inappropriate for this hotel to accommodate students in this way as it is not a cheap hotel and their behaviour certainly spoilt our first night sleep. The second night we were woken at about 2am by 2 drunken Irishmen in the room next door who had the TV on loud and were shouting above it!! I do recommend the hotel but on booking (1) ask for a room away from the elevator as you can hear the 'ping' every time it arrives on your floor and people don't always lower their voices when stepping out. (2) double check that you have no students on your floor. (3) the walls are a little thin and you can hear the next rooms TV and hear them talking! On the whole it was a lovely hotel. The staff are a bit hot and cold, some are a bit stuffy and find it difficult to smile and some are extremely helpful. Particularly the bellboys. One thing I would ask all travellers is that when you are in a hotel, just to consider who is in the next room, they may not want to hear your TV.

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely stay, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: skitty31
Reviews.Content: Right, just to be clear, we unlike others use hotels for holidays and breaks, we don't travel for business, so based on my experience of hotels and not comparing or judging the star rating as not that experienced. The lobby is beatuiful and as near xmas is very well decorated and we were charmed by the look and warm feel of the hotel. Reception were very polite and upgraded from queen room to king size, we didn't ask, was just done for us which we were very impressed with. Room was a nice size with a king size very comfortable bed, room and bathroom was spotless, if you want to be really picky, the cleaners could use the hose on the vacuum cleaner as the edges of the carpet was a bit dusty, but that would be very picky!!! Shower was great, powerful and very clean, towels and sheets were changed every day and left spotless. Tv had a nice amount of free channels, not a flatscreen but room was for sleeping as we were out 90% of the time. Only gripes really were, the heating was hard to get right, either very hot or under average which was a bit cold, so you either choose sweaty or chilly!!!!! may have been our heater. Other problem was the bar, very arrogant head bar person, lovely bowl of nuts with every visit, but drinks were expensive, $8 for a bottle of beer and food was expensive, my advise would be to eat out cheaper and of same quality. Head barman seemed to swan around like a peacock, not seeming to awknowledge you speaking to him, but returning with your request eventually. Very slow service but to be honest the US is not the place to be if you want a quick drink. Tried to charge us $100 to much at queckout, but reduced it with no fuss when pointed out. Overall we thouroughly enjoyed it at the roosevelt hotel and would recommend it to anyone wanting a romantic or sightseeing holiday/break, perfectly postioned. Loved it and would go back with no hesitation. Thanks to all the staff ( apart from head brman) for a wonderful 4 days. Love new york, but clear up the trash in the roads guys. Steve and Donna ( UK)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: stardust4692
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel for the night before Thanksgiving and found the Roosevelt at a great price. Checked-in around 5 pm with great ease, other than the desk clerk paying more attention to clients with children (which we did not have). Up to the room to drop off our bags and were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and large for NYC. Pefect for the six hours of sleep we planned on getting. After walking around the city until past midnight we returned to the hotel, with the beautiful lobby, and went to the bar for a drink before heading off to bed. Service was somewhat slow, but to be expected on such a busy evening. Up first thing in the morning to catch the parade. Realized on my way that I forgot my hat in the business center. Called the hotel and they retrieved and placed at the front desk - nice not having to be worried about it! Check out via tv and out the door within 10 minutes of returning from the parade. Great trip, great location!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel, GREAT location, GREAT time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisPCream
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! What a great hotel!!! We searched all over trip advisor and were looking around this price range and all the hotels looked a little shady except for the Roosevelt. With the location (45th and Madison) you canNOT go wrong. We used the valet service which was easy and worked out nicely, about $110 plus tip for 2 days (even though we only stayed 35hours) oh well, it was easy. We showed up at the hotel at 9:30 am., check in isn't until 3pm, we were going to drop our stuff off and check in later, but they let us check in then!!! I couldn't believe it!!! We only could book 1 king bed on Expedia but they changed us to 2 fulls because we were traveling with 2 children. I was pleased about this also. The room was smallish but this is New York what can you expect. The room was beautiful, the linen was clean and the bed was comfortable, they even covered all side of the blanket with crisp white sheets so there is no gross reused blanket touching you when you sleep ( a BIG thing for me). The beds were pretty with the throw pillow with the trademark R on them and they had a throw blanket at the bottom of the bed instead of the big ugly comforters most hotels sport. They had Bath and Body works toiletries that smelled fabulous! The room was clean, I can always tell how clean the whole room is by the number of disgusting stray hairs in the bathroom ... here .... ZERO. Thank GOD! There was a little noise from the street but again .. this is NY. The lobby was absolutely BEAUTIFUL, look at pictures on their website ... wow!!! The bar has an area with leather couches and a fire burning (gas) what a nice thing after a chilly afternoon out walking in Manhattan. The staff from the front desk to the housekeepers to the bar and wait staff was VERY nice and helpful!!! GREAT service! We checked out at 10:30 am (check out time is 12) and left our bags with the hotel in a secure location. they gave us a claim tag and when we came back they got our bags fast as can be and we were on our way after a great (although short) stay at the Roosevelt. We will definitely come here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wildly Inconsistent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bostonstory
Reviews.Content: Here's a hotel that could be terrific with some tweaking, but sadly it is not. The good, the bad and the just plain nasty: 1. The location is great: blocks from Grand Central Station, Times Square, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Fab Fifth Avenue shopping (Cartier! Saks! Prada!) and the skating rink at Rockefeller Center. I liked being able to fall out the door, walk a few blocks and see some sights. 2. The room: Way small. a large red stain on the carpet. (yuck) Rips in the sheet. Stained chair. Even a small yellow stain on the little decorative pillow with the "R" on it. Nasty. Although the room itself was clean, and the bathroom was clean. Go NYC maids, who do a commendable job even though management refuses to spring for new linens and won't upgrade the carpet. (Note to management: you have a historic property here. Treat it and your guests with respect and spend the money. It would have a nice feel to it, rather than appearing like a drunk dowager who woke up the next morning wearing a strand of pearls and a smudge of mascara and torn stockings.) 3. The staff is welcoming. The concierge recommended the Hudson Hotel for dinner, and didn't steer us wrong. (cool hotel, the Hudson, although pricier). Thank you! 4. This is a huge hotel, with 1,000 or so rooms, and while it gives the lovely lobby a festive feel (all those people mingling, heading for the bar) you don't get the service you would get in a boutique hotel. 5. Nine dollars for a Corona beer? I tipped the bartender a buck. Okay, I'm from Boston, but that's the first time I spent ten bucks for a mass market beer. (Obviously I don't visit NYC often enough:) 6. The breakfast buffet was nicely presented. I liked the made -to-order omelets and my kids enjoyed making yogurt, berry granola parfaits and toasting their own bagels. Next to the beer, the $85.00 I paid for three of us (one at a child's rate) for the buffet breakfast was practically a steal. 7.The reservation. Completely messed up. We didn't get what we asked for, and when I was checking out, a gentleman at the desk was also complaining about a reservations issue. 8. The lobby area and the bar are quite lovely. In the morning they have starbucks/bagels/fruit served in the bar area, which is convenient. 9. Many Europeans taking advantage of the sad, sad state of the dollar. A number of our friends from over the pond in the elevator heading out for a night on the town. They probably feel it is a bargain, even though the hotel is wildly inconsistent, ranging from a "1" for the state of the linens, to an "8" for the decoration of the lobby, because they getting it at deep discount. 10. Room service. They add on a service charge and a gratuity charge. So a $12.00 plate of tortilla chips and salsa is about $19.00. FYI. I gave the guy $2.00, not realizing they added in the gratuity, so I paid about $21.00 for a pile of chips for the kids. Oops. In summary, I tried to overlook the hotel's shortcomings, and the place oddly grew on me over the three days - sort of like staying at your aged Aunt's house with the ripped sheets and soft beds - because the staff was helpful, the breakfast was excellent and an overpriced brandy can wash down a number of hospitality sins!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Minasld
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days and everything was great! I recommend this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Just What I Needed”
Reviews.Author: Smeagol101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt over the weekend of the 2nd Nov. for 3 nights as I was participating in the New York Marathon.
