I booked a flight and single room hotel package through Expedia 6 months before as I knew that rooms in New York would get booked up and prices would rise. I did a lot of research and Expedia was the cheapest option. After reading all the reviews for 6 months I was wondering if I had done the right thing and kept an open mind as to what the room would be like. Well I have to say that for a single room it was quite large with plenty of room to walk around and the bed was a large double. The bathroom was small but you do not need a large bathroom if only one person is in it. The only problem was the lavatory seat which needed to be held up. The bath had new sealant around it which could have been done better but I guess it was a cheaper option than replacing the whole bath and tiles. The furniture was old but the room was very clean and overall I enjoyed my stay although I only used the room for sleeping. You do not spend time in your hotel room however large it is when in New York . The Starbucks in the bar area was ideal for morning coffee and light breakfast as you did not need to leave the hotel. I would stay there again if I could get the same or similar room at a cheaper rate when there is not a major city event going on. This is only a 3 star hotel after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jubsy007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for five nights in October and have no complaints. Okay, the rooms are not huge, but you are ulikley to spend a lot of time there and our room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is perfectly located in midtown. The staff very really helpful and quick to respond when we had an isseue with our safe and the concierge in the lobby was great too. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Roosevelt and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: forth
Reviews.Content: Excellent hoitel-next to Grand Central(or nearly}. Porters, front of house staff very friendly andhelpful re directions. Rooms very clean-plenty toilertries and hot water. Lounge bar original 1920`s as is the lobby with plenty of atmosphere. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a nip and tuck!”
Reviews.Author: nosuninsyracuse
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at this hotel 10/25-10/28 due to a conference being held there. The hotel is very old and in desperate need of a face lift! The rooms are very small, which is expected in NYC, and the decor is very plain and unattractive. Wall paper is peeling off the walls and our bathroom sink had a serious leak. Every time you ran water, there would be a puddle at your feet. Someone came to fix it, but it continued to leak our entire stay. We ate one meal at the Roosevelt Grill, which was very pricey for just o.k. food. At $400/night I would expect much nicer accommodations. I would not stay here again, unless I had to due to conference location. On a positive note, the beds were extremely comfy and the hotel location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired and very overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: jpuigpey
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Roosevelt in NYC for two nights while in the city for business. At $441/night, the hotel should be ashamed of itself for taking advantage. The lobby is grandiose, but don't let the facade fool you...beyond the surface, the rooms are run down, the bathrooms in need of repair. Firstly, the faucet in the bathroom shower was peeling off. The shower also contained quite a nice quantity of hair that was not mine. The water in the shower ran brown for several minutes, but I was told it was due to the fact that the hotel is 100 years old and this problem is standard in the city. During my stay, after throwing a tissue into the toilet, I had to call maintenance to request a plunger due to the toilet clogging and overflowing. I could not manage to close the window, either. There were strange holes in the walls in the bathroom that made me feel uncomfortable, not knowing what could be crawling between the walls and into my room. I had arranged for a package to be delivered for a meeting during my stay and asked the front desk time and again if it had been delivered--they said no. Needless to say, the package had in fact arrived on time (it was 'lost' in the hotel) and I missed the opportunity to share its contents during my business meeting. I did in fact complain to the manager, who offered me a $30 voucher for a very nice buffet breakfast and $100 off my bill. At over $1000 for two nights, with taxes, it was a very small gesture. If you can reserve a room for under $200, I would call it a fair price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: simsterc
Reviews.Content: The foyer and public areas of the hotel are very grand and impressive. A huge chandellier dominates the reception area. It is tastefully and traditionally decorated. The reception staff could perhaps do with a little training into how to smile, however the resturant and bar staff are very friendly. The bedrroms (ours was a standard) was a little on the crammed side, a huge American bed dominated a room that really could have done with being bigger. There were no mini bar or tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom, and to get a drink we had to go to the vending machine along the corridor. The room was clean and tidy, however the rooms could do with a "Touch Up" and the bathrooms, although clean, could do with a refurb. We reported the safe in our room as faulty, and through lack of communication amognst the staff, this was not rectified during our stay. The hotel is in an excellent location, just a five minute walk from Grand Central Station, and two minute walk from 5th Avenue. A great place to stay, if you are looking for a "base" and do not intend on staying in your room all that much.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night here having paid about $150 on priceline. The lobby is impressive & the staff friendly. But the room we had was quite small & there were no coffee making facilities. The location is good though & not bad value if you can get it on priceline. The gym is free (unlike the Hilton where we stayed the next 5 nights) with free fruit so if you're peckish you can go there & munch. This was fine as a place to crash after sightseeing but it might get a bit claustraphobic if you spent much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: newyorker46
Reviews.Content: Went to New York expecting to stay at the Ameritania on broadway but found it to be terrible so we tracked down the Roosevelt as we had a friend stay there.. What can i say... it was fantastic. Spotless, friendly staff, comfortable rooms, relaxing huge beds, great restaurant i can go on! If you are going to New york head here its fabulous and has a great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, below average rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveler1978
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, being only a block from Grand Central Station. However, that is probably where the plus points for this hotel end. The rooms are adequate but they are quite dreary and in serious need of modernisation. In our room the shower was broken and the sealant was peeling away from the enclosure. For the amount you have to pay I would frankly expect better. The biggest let down though must be the very poor level of service we received. Almost without exception the staff seemed bored and in a few instances rude. For this reason alone I would definitely not recommend this hotel. There are much better ones available for the same price and where the staff are only too willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DezzaB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with our 18 month daughter. the place has about 1000 beds and I think they were all full all the time. The Staff were kept very busy but were very helpful when you could get them. the room was clean, air con was great but the bed was very soft and I got a sore back. the location is fantastic for sight seeing and the place across the road is good for breakfast (like I'm going to pay $35 for the hotel brekky)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KayceeD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Roosevelt Hotel. It was fabulous! The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms were clean, and the location was perfect for the activities we planned. It is very close to Grand Central Station, which meant that getting around NYC on public transportation was very easy. The concierge was always willing to help help us find a certain area of NYC or attraction. It is within walking distance of Times Square, Broadway and the theater district, Fifth Avenue, and St. Patrick's Cathedral. All in all, this hotel helped us have a wonderful experience in NYC and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Suited us just fine!!”
Reviews.Author: Nugenthorne25
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 2.00pm and checked in very quickly, the room was very well presented. We were on the 9th floor which meant the room was a little dark. We had fresh towels everyday as well as the room cleaned. The hotel is very central to everything and to be honest we didn't really spend much time in our room as there is so much to do and see. The breakfast is quite pricey compared with the surrounding restaurants, so i would recommend going our for food, but the starbucks was a nice touch, though they stop serving it at 6.30pm! I would reccomend this hotel if you are just looking for a nice clean, central hotel in New York - for a good price as well!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Adequate”
Reviews.Author: keenakit
Reviews.Content: Convenient and clean but nothing special. No chair (other than desk chair) in room, no in room coffee or mini-bar. Larger than average room. Fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Marianvlc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights from 10 to 18 sept. In general our stay was pleasant. The best thing is that the Hotel is very good located 45th with Madison Av. Short walk to everything in Midtown, and subway in Grand Central though Metlife Bldg on 45th. Personally I don't like big hotels with that many rooms, but that's Manhattan. Rooms are very small, but the bed is big and confortable. Couch not very clean, and furniture old and ugly, scratched... Our safe did not work properly. Our bed was done terribly, and linen was changed only once. Tap (ver old)in shower didn't work well, either water was burning or freezing. We needed patience and time to have our morning shower. And there was a shower curtains from the 80s at least!! Hadn't seen curtains in hotels for years!! Having read that hotel had been fully renewed in the past 3 years, I wonder if our room on 18th floor was included in this renovation!!! That's the negative I have to say. On the positive, I think the hotel was good compared to the average I have read in NY. We had absolutely no problem checking in or out, which we did very quickly. Room temperature was ok, bathroom amenities were very very good. Towels were changed daily, even we didn't discard the towels everyday. As said the matress and pillows were excellent. We didn't meet the staff or required anything, we left very early and arrived late. We had breakfast at the lobby twice, coffee is starbucks' , and there is plenty to choose. However there are lots of places in the area (f.i. Au bon pain), much better. We bought Flight + Stay with EXPEDIA, and everything worked fine. The price we got was excellent, we saved almost 2000 eur.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Overall”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler1204
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel for 3 nights during a business trip. I have to say that I was pretty disappointed. I had problems when booking (as did many of my colleagues). I arrived at the hotel at midnight after a delayed flight. As I entered the front entrance, I saw several steps up to get to the registration desk. I did not see a ramp or elevator and inquired about this with a maintenance member who happened to be near the entrance. He said there wasn't a ramp or elevator and indicated that I would need to walk up the steps. I had heavy luggage and nobody offered to assist. I checked in with a rude staff member who argued that I had multiple reservations and the wrong number of days reserved. After straightening out that mess, I went to my room which was very average. If you're looking for luxury, this is not the place. The lobby was pretty but the rooms are a different story. My room was worn and the carpet was musty. The only good thing was the bed, which was comfortable and the linens were nice enough. The cleaning staff seemed pleasant but the rest of the staff seemed rude. The front desk, concierge, etc. were not very helpful and sometimes rude. I've stayed at many hotels for business and pleasure and would not recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the right price”
Reviews.Author: Rewrite
Reviews.Content: We found a bargain rate advertised on a travel website. We booked through the hotel and our rate was $200 a night with breakfast before taxes. This review is based on that rate. The room was decent size for NYC and was clean. The location of the hotel was excellent, literally caddy-corner from Grand Central Station and within a reasonable walk from the theater district and the early-bird restaurant row near there. The neighbor hood was not glamorous, but we never felt in danger. Hotel security was present and effective without being intrusive or annoying. The best thing about our stay was the included breakfast bar. The breakfast bar included just about every breakfast food imaginable including a great array of fresh fruits with a wide selection of berries. There was also an omelet chef. The worst part of our stay was the breakfast service. The waiters were slow to bring our drinks and even slower to refill them. We were told when we checked in that the breakfast gratuity would be included, but it was not until after we left that I checked the bill to find that gratuity was almost $6 per person per day. The rest of the staff was curteous, plentiful, and helpful. This hotel does seem to run a lot of specials, and if you can find a room around $200 even without the breakfast, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, historical, convenient”
Reviews.Author: iljumittajjeb
Reviews.Content: Picked the Roosevelt hotel on the basis of other reviews here and its location, just a couple of blocks north of Grand Central. Area is touristy, but appears to be quite safe at night. Room was on the 11th floor, might be considered small in the grand scheme of things, but from what I understand from other readers, is quite large for most NY hotel rooms. Adequate storage space, TV, ironing board/iron, usual bathroom stuff. Like most places I've stayed, could do with a few more coat hangers, and I suppose its main omission was the lack of coffee-making gear in the room (though obviously you can order coffee any time of day from downstairs. One tip I would give for foreigners is that you can only change $100 of traveller's cheques at reception per day, per room - though I don't know if this is standard. But there are plenty of banks in the area, and obviously credit cards are accepted everywhere. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: katielou369
Reviews.Content: This was a truly fabulous hotel, rooms were big and the bed is the best I have ever slept in. The hotel was very clean and staff very helpfull and friendly. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wuachuwei
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon in NY last year and had a great time. Stayed 7 nights in a double room which was quite nice, not really big but anyways we didn't spend that much time in the hotel but walking around and as many have already said the location is great!!! Our room was perfectly cleaned everyday and I loved the Bath and Body shampoo etc. Check in and check out was perfect,front desk were nice. We left our luggage in the concierge room downstairs and collected it in the afternoon,bellboys really nice as well. We didn't eat at the hotel so we cannot comment on that. Great stay and planning to go back on February 08 with my in laws.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and Some Useful Tips”
Reviews.Author: EmilyandGill
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thought the Hotel website, which I would recommend doing as you get the best prices. We got the hotel 2 hours before we could cheek in but one of the very friendly front desk staff booked us in as waiting to go into the room and we could leave our bags with the bellman staff, which meant we could go have an explore round the city and not have to wait in the lobby with our bags. We went back to the hotel around 3ish and checked in and our bags were brought to our room. We had asked for a fridge as well which was brought up within half an hour of it being asked for. If staying in the hotel for more than 4 days I would recommend you request a fridge as it saved us a lot of money on breakfast and lunch. On 5th Avenue just left to the hotel there is a Duane Reade drug store, which sells milk, bread, butter, drinks, cereals etc. and it is a lot cheaper than other stores around the area. The room itself was not the biggest of rooms but it is New York. We had plenty of room to move about in it and the bathroom was a perfect size. Two of us were sharing the room with twin beds and had 3 suitcases that still left us enough room to walk around the room easily. It was nicely decorated and cleaned everyday after we had gone out. All the staff we meet up the hotel were friendly and always said good morning or good afternoon. The lobby is stunning and it was a pleasure to enter into it everyday. Like most people have said the hotel is in a great location easy to walk everyway including Times Square, grand central station, empire state building and Rockefeller centre I would defiantly stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it. Useful tips: 1. Duane Reade drug store on 5th avenue to the left of the hotel open to 10pm of weekdays and 8pm on Sundays 2. From Grand Central Station 4 or 5 subway take you to Battery Park to get the ferry for the statue of liberty 3. Go to statue of liberty, Ellis Island and empire state building early, as it gets very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssexJoEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt for a week. I was with a group, but had my own room. Had a king size bed, but would say that further to other reviews here the room size was adequate. The room was clean, but the bathroom could have done with some updating. The bath could really have done with being re-enamalled. It was terribly chipped. Ok for a shower, but would not have dreamt of having a bath. Seems to be a widespread problem in the hotel. The lobby and bar area are very nice to have a drink. There are around 10-15 stairs to climb before you enter the lobby. There is a lift which is not sign-posted, and could do with being. Also, it would be a good idea if the bell-man was actually here to take your bags rather than waiting to I actually got to the reception!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we asked for!”
Reviews.Author: Colocampermom
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for a wedding and this hotel was just what we asked for. The location was fabulous, walking distance to 5th Ave/Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station etc. Our room, 1643 located at the end of the hall, was comfortable (for 2 adults & 1 teenager) with ample space to spread out. Was worried about the bathroom based on other reviews but this one was fine. Not much space to put out toiletries - recommend a toiletry bag which you can remove from the bathroom. The view looked out onto a street and other buildings but was reasonably quite. Air conditioner worked wonderfully which was a requirement for late July! Only downside was the elevators. They were slow or full most of the time day or night. Took the stairs several times (16 floors). Would recommend that the hotel bank the elevators to help eleviate this problem. Front area staff were helpful and pleasant. Spent 4 nights and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: amy86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt for 2 nights in early August for a friend's wedding. We had a lovely stay and found nothing to complain about. The lobby is beautiful, stunning really. Reminds me a bit of the Waldorf. Very old, classy new york. The bar in the lobby is very nice as well, we spent quite a bit of time there after the wedding was over. The room is small, but every hotel room in new york is small. It was perfectly comfortable for the 2 of us. The bed was fantastic! Very comfortable, lots of pillows, I was very pleased. The bathroom could use some updating, but it was fine. We paid $190/night as that was the preferred rate for guests of the wedding (the wedding took place in the hotel) and that was a great price for NYC. We had wonderful service from the staff. Check in was quick and easy, and later on that night when I asked the conierge if there was a shoe shine in the lobby, he let me know that there was not, but ran off and got us a shoe shine kit to use. That was nice. The location is excellent - very centrally located. Overall I would recommend the Roosevelt to anyone - it's a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small Room - through Priceline - Laughable”
Reviews.Author: rico4200
Reviews.Content: For the first time ever I decided to book a room using Priceline. After all Captain Kirk recommends it and I figured I could get a bargain. Well, you get what you pay for no matter what Mr. Shatner says on the commericals. My bid was accepted for the room at $200.00 (not including the taxes, of course). I figured I was getting a 3 star hotel and I only needed 1 Bed for just my husband any myself so I thought all would be just swell. It might be a 3 star hotel, but the room was a 1 star room. It was so small my husband and I just had to laugh. Good thing we were so tired from a long day of helping my daughter move into her college dorm because all one could possibly do in this room is squeeze into bed and go to sleep. It was about half the size of my daughter's college room and believe me college dorm rooms in New York are quite small. Seriously, it was the smallest room I have ever seen in my life anywhere. Really !!! Early in the morning, around 6:00 I am awaken by a steady loud sound of running water. I guess the people in the room next to us were showering and it was as if the shower and water pipes were right in our room. So as you can tell, I wasn't too happy with the room. It was a joke. However, the hotel itself had an absolutely beautiful lobby, just gorgeous and the location was also very good in midtown east side of NY. Walking distance to so many attractions, shops and restaurants. The check in was a major pain. Long lines, like going to an airport. It was not very good at all, but the staff was pleasant. If you stay at the Roosevelt, I would guess that there are many nicer rooms so PLEASE take my advise and do not use PRICELINE to get your room. They must give you the worst room in the entire hotel if you use priceline to name your own price. This truly was a room that I would recommend for maybe your dog, but not 2 humans. That's right, I would say that the room was the size of my dogs accomodations at her kennel except I didn't have a place to run. The room was clean and nice, but way, way, way ---can't stress this enough.... TOO SMALL !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steffie01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from the 23rd of August until the 30th. I was a bit worried about what to expect after reading mixed reviews. Check in time was 3pm but our room was ready at 1.30pm when we arrived. The hotel lobby is stunning. Our room was a petite room but it was actually very big, it was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. Workmen needed to fix a pipe in our bathroom so the Manager gave us a free breakfast which was great. The maid also broke our phone charger by accident but the hotel offerred us free late check out time which suited us great as check out was 12 and we did not leave for the airport until 4pm. The staff were very nice and the maids were lovely. The lifts were a bit busy in the morning but fine any other time. The hotel is very central to everything. The food court around the corner for the hotel is good for breakfast. There are lots of eating places nearby and lots of Irish bars/restraunts. I would highly reccommend drinks in the revoloving lounge in the Mariot at Times Square. China Town is definitely an experience. Overall I would highly reccomment this hotel and would not listen to any of the bad reviews. I would go back to the Roosevelt in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wlomax
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of different reviews of a lot different hotels it seemed like a crap shoot as to which one to pick. I was extremely happy choosing The Roosevelt Hotel in New York. There were so many reviews mentioning hotel rooms that were no bigger than an office cubical, this room had two double beds in it and was the perfect size. It was clean, staff were helpful and friendly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very centrally placed”
Reviews.Author: 1968birchwood
Reviews.Content: We went there on our honeymoon, we found the hotel very comfortable , clean , staff very pleasant.As with most places in U.S.A it was room only, this was not a problenm as plenty places nearby to dine at .Hotel was very busy when we were there but staff were always polite and willing to help us .Hotel got us tickets to go and see a basketball game which worked out expensive, if wanting to do same i would reccomend going to Times Square where tickets for everything availableat a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mlbk888
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 X 2 nites in late July this year. Hotel staff were courteous and helpful. No mention was made of PL but was given upgrade to king-size bed and larger room without question. On our return for the second of two nights, the receptionist immediately recognised us and acknowledged us and promise to give us the same if not better room. Location is very good with buses just round the corner on Madison Ave heading northwards. Fifth Ave just one block across and Grand Central Terminal is an easy walk through MetLife Building which is just opposite the hotel's main entrance. We even walk to Times Square! Lots of restaurants (all price range) within walking distance from the hotel's main entrance. Just steps away are Italian, Japanese, Chinese, Indian restaurants. Grand Cafe just round the corner is excellent for breakfast. Lobby was luxurious and rooms were comfortable with good mattress (not too soft) and plenty of pillows for two persons. Closet provided sufficient space for storage which is important since we travelled 3 weeks and amassed a great deal of shopping deals. Air con worked, water pressure was good and bathrooms were clean albeit a little old. Fresh supplies of towels and toiletries every day. Would stay here again when I next visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: AgentNikky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and for location, this hotel can't be faulted. I found ALL the staff to be pleasant and helpful. Didn't eat in the hotel so can not moan about food prices, there is so much choice in NYC there is something for everyone all within walking distance. The rooms at he Roosevelt are not huge but they are not small either, remember you are in a major city!! Hotel is on Madisson at 45th st, so one block from Grand Central Station and 3 from Times Square. We walked to Central Park and it took about half hour at a slow pace, too many people to allow you to walk fast. Traffic in Manhatten is mental, my advice is to walk as much as you can, it's quicker. We took the Gray Line bus tours which are excellent value and you get to see all the major sights, a great tour if your time is short. All in all a great weekend with great friends at a great hotel. I am a UK travel Agent and will recommend this hotel to my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: doradiegoboots
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. I called a week before to confirm a non-smoking room and request room with double bed as there would be 2 adults but was told that Priceline bookings would receive the standard room (queen bed). Upon check-in there was no reference to priceline, i was informed they were upgrading me to room with king-size bed. I agreed to pay extra $60 fee to change room to one with double bed later in the week as i was expecting a friend from out of town. I thought both of the rooms i stayed in were of good size. The room with the double beds seemed quite large for NYC room with windows along two of the walls. I liked the high ceilings. The bathrooms were small but everything was clean. Shampoo/soaps were from Bath & Body Works. The beds were very comfortable but the air conditioner was very loud so i turned it off before going to sleep. Luckily the temperature in the room did not become too hot. The weather was excellent during our entire stay...sunny but not hot with a slight breeze with some mild rain a couple days The location of this hotel was very convenient to train, subway, Central Park, 5th Ave shopping, restaurants, etc. I encountered helpful, friendly, efficient staff. Elegant lobby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “1st Family trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: tracy07
Reviews.Content: "Remembering all that lost their lives in the 9/11 disaster" We decided to take a trip to New York just before Xmas 2005. After a long tiring flight and transfer to the hotel, we collected our keys for our room. Upon opening the door, we thought we had been given keys to the broom cupboard!!! There were 2 x double beds crammed into the room ( probably the smallest room we have ever stayed in ) The bathroom was a joke, you literally had to back into it, a tiny single shower, toilet, and basin had been somehow plumbed into this room! Clean and dual aspect-wonderful views from window. Tv and dressing table and restricted hanging space. 3 adults (me, oh and teenage daughter ) far too small.......... Didn't let it dampen our spirits though as we had a fabulous break : ) and it snowed!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Ga_Ma_Be
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my grandma for her 80's birthday. Rooms are Ok, but bathroom bit small. Maids were so nice and funny, it was a real pleasure to see them everyday. Breakfast is quite expensive, but it worth it at least once during the stay (they offered the breakfast for the 2 of us on my grandma's birthay). The location is perfect (just in front of Grand Central Station, 10 minutes walk from Time Square and about 15 from Central Park), so you do not even need to take cab to go anywere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: FranStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: Booked The Roosevelt direct through there website, got a good price and confirmation of reservation by return. We stayed for 5 nights and overall it was a good choice of hotel. The hotel was in an ideal position, just off Times Square 45th Madison within easy walking distance of most of the attractions and shopping. We easily walked to the Empire State; Macy's; central park; Broardway;Bloomingdale's and the major shopping areas. The reception area was beautiful and the room we had was well above average size for a city hotel and the bathroom was massive. The only downsides were the noise of the air con, we had to turn it off, but although warm was not unbearable and no tea/coffee making faclities which I really missed. Some people may find the drone of the cars disturbing but I didn't have a problem with it (6th floor). Resturant was the usual city hotel type (expensie) so we never bothered; they serve starbucks breakfast in the reception area but diners are much better. All-in-all it was a very good and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay for NYC”
Reviews.Author: roboron
Reviews.Content: If not for the price we got on Priceline I wouldn't recommend this hotel. We needed two rooms for our stay and so cost was important to us. At $120 per night the Roosevelt was a good deal, but if I had to pay the regular rate there are better choices. We arrived early (11 am) and so our rooms were understandably not ready. Coming back at 3 pm (check-in time) the rooms were still not ready. Throughout the whole time it was hard to understand the woman at the front desk staff because she was chewing gum the whole time and not friendly at all. When we finally were able to get a room (about an hour later), the rooms were on the same floor but on opposite ends. Not a big deal, but since I had requested this more than a week beforehand and had checked in early I would expect it to be accommodated. The rooms themselves are nothing special and if this wasn't NYC I would say "shabby". Furnishings were worn and not very attractive. But, making allowances for the location, I didn't expect much and was in line with my expectations. The bed however was very comfortable and almost as nice as the Heavenly Beds used at the Hyatts. Bathrooms were larger than NYC normal and clean with average to nice fixtures. For some reason both rooms had an initial odd smell from the air conditioning units although we got used to it. Fitness center is small with minimal equipment. The location was very convenient being so close to Grand Central and Midtown. Have to add that although the Front Desk (and Doorman or all people!!) were unfriendly if not downright surly, the bellman were very nice and almost made up for it. If I needed a inexpensive (for NYC) place to stay and got a good rate I would consider the Roosevelt again, but otherwise there is nothing really to recommend about it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel. EVER.”
Reviews.Author: Tulipso
Reviews.Content: Rooms are quite small for the price, faulty doorknobs easily break and outside noise isn't filtered by any means. Also terrible (to be frank horrendous) customer service: if you're pay is overdue because a fault by VISA which is told to them by VISA itself, they will still lock you out your room (and as such disabling you to acces you're possessions which is illegal). As such this "wonderful" hotel spoiled or last day by forcing us to spend a sleepless night (my underage son and me) in their lobby for which we got an "apology": a free meal of mediocre food of their own restaurant. Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, small , somewhat shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: HollyBear75
Reviews.Content: Walking into the Roosevelt was a great experience. The lobby is classic and stunningly beautiful. Check-in was efficient and friendly. In fact, I found all of the staff to be very helpful and friendly - very un-like the "rude new yorker" stereotype. Everyone that I encountered was wonderful and accommodating. The location is great - just across from grand central station, a few blocks from Times Square - and a very safe-feeling area. The only disappointment I had was the sleeping rooms themselves. They were extremely small - which I guess is typical in New York. The bathroom didn't have a countertop or even a proper towel rack. The TV was tiny, and the furnishings seemed, well, old. We did have a couple maintenance issues with our room - which were attended to immediately. But, overall the room was a disappointment. In New York, though - there's so much more to do than hang out in the room, so I still rate The Roosevelt an above-average property, and was pleased that I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing price”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCanadarocks
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel through priceline and recieved an excellent price. As noted in the previous review the priceline room is a noticeably cheaper room but we are paying a cheaper rate so it is to be expected. Our room was clean, it included the wheelchair accessable shower. You can't find a nicer place for the price, staff was great. We will return for the same place. At peak times elevators are slow. Red Flame is great for breakfast, Grand central is a three minute walk-the subways are clean, safe and cheaper then tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: mckval
Reviews.Content: This was our conference hotel, so I did not choose The Roosevelt Hotel directly. But, I will always stay here in the future. It was lovely, and the staff was outstanding. The room was plenty large for my friend and I to have a nice "girl's weekend" after I was done with the conference. There seemed to be a lot of families there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Priceline users watch out though”
Reviews.Author: Midwest167
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8/1-8/4. I would like to say that this is a very nice hotel. The lobby is nice, the rooms are very nice, and the housekeeping in excellent. However, when we checked in we had a problem because we used priceline. The front desk was very rude and indicated even though we did call the hotel directly after we won the bid to request a double/double priceline users only can get the one queen bed room. They offered us the double/double for 90 dollars more a night. We were unaware of the priceline shun and when we questioned the front desk they indicated that several double/double rooms were available but we could not have one without paying for the upgrade. Our party was 2 adults and a 5 year old. Please note that a rollaway bed does not fit in their 1 queen bed rooms so basically one of us would have to sleep on the floor. I would not pay one dollar to sleep on a hotel room floor. I absolutely refused to pay and had the fight of my life until management finally gave us the double/double with no additional charge. This caused alot of unnecessary stress. Is it worth using priceline to get a good deal on a hotel? Maybe. Would I use them again. Probably not. In regards to New York, public transportation was very easy and safe and people in New York are very nice to tourists so our stay was quite enjoyable after this mess.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pivotrm
Reviews.Content: Great location, terrific staff from the checkin to the doorman to the maids – all you could want in a mid town location. We used Priceline.com and had a great rate but regardless of the price this is an excellent hotel in a central location that worked out well for us on a four day sightseeing trip. Our checkin was quick and the upgraded room good size. We asked for extra pillows and they were there quickly. The room was spotless each day and the maids were pleasant and helped with minor requests. The door man advised us to use a car to get to Newark which saved money and time (over a taxi or express bus). We read other reviews and didn’t buy much at the hotel. We asked about show tickets at the concierge and were quoted an outrageous amount so we purchased our own online for a reasonable price (about 1/3 of the concierge's price). We walked to most of our destinations due to the central location – 2 blocks from Grand Central and about 10 from Times Sq and Rockefeller Plaza. Easy to get a taxi on the street except during rush hour and about a $10 fare to Little Italy or Chinatown. Greta place for breakfast on 47th – Blue Flower ($3.50 for a 3 egg omelette). The full service Starbucks in the Roosevelt lobby was a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: madmazCheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel last March. It was my first visit to New York, but definitely won't be my last, as I found it a stunning location and very safe (even for 2 girls walking around late at night!). The hotel's location made it easy to get to everything and we found the concierge extremely helpful and gave us lots of useful tips. When we got to the room, we found the safe wasn't working, so we reported this, got it fixed and got a free breakfast too. Things to do in New York - Top of the Rock - much better views than from the Empire State, Sex and the City Tour - hilarious and very enjoyable if you are a fan of the show, Tony and Tina's wedding - Broadway show where you are part of the cast - just brilliant, and a visit to Tiffanys just to drool over all that gorgeous jewellery.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Antal
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Roosevelt and had a very pleasant stay - though I wish that we had also been offered the opportunity to upgrade our room as mentioned in the previous review, as we found the room quite small - but very clean and comfortable. The location is superb and it was easy to walk to the main tourist and shopping areas. The concierge service is excellent - nothing was too much trouble for the staff and Norva in particular was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with large rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: sufu02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Roosevelt July 13 & 14 and was very pleased. The lobby was very "grand hotel" with a huge chandelier. Check in was very efficient. The room ( a double/double) was very large by NYC standards, very clean and well appointed (Bath & Body Works toiletries!) The bathroom was ample size, tho could use a little work around the edges (wall paper was peeling a little, but I'll never understand why hotels insist on wallpaper in bathrooms anyway, 'cause it's gonna peel!) The beds were VERY comfortable with nice linens and tons of pillows. The room included a safe large enough for a laptop, but the closet was small...but not enough to ruin the overall experience. The Roosevelt is a very large hotel, but we never waited more that a couple of minutes for an elevator. The area is very safe at night, but almost everything around the hotel closes up early, so if you want a night cap or snack after a play, better to do it before leaving the Times Square/Theater District area. I booked the room through Travelzoo for $199/night and the rate included breakfast. The breakfast was GREAT!! Lots of fresh fruits, cereal, bacon, etc. with cooked to order omelets, eggs and waffles. Definitely enough to carry you through until dinner. The staff was friendly and helpful, with the exception of a somewhat surly concierge; he was very helpful to the couple in line before me, but could not have been bothered with my questions and hurried me on my way. Oh, well. Had some very noisy neighbors our first night, but got even by knocking on their door at about 8AM the next morning and running like mad for the elevator. I would definitely stay at the Roosevelt again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!! *****”
Reviews.Author: lowlman2
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in the city and we could not have chosen a better place - very centrally located - we never took a cab - from Central Park to Broadway...you can walk everywhere! I dont have my photos to upload but the pics of the hotel on this website are very much the same as mine. The lobby of the Roosevelt is awesome and our room was terrific. Our beds were very plush with huge down pillows. The rooms are small - but were just what we needed - a comfy place to sleep after long days of shopping. Would (and have) recommended this hotel to anyone - families and business people. There was nothing bad.

Reviews.Title: “great lobby shame about room”
Reviews.Author: natalieb271
Reviews.Content: we arrived at this hotel with an 8 year old girl at 11pm at night to be told we had been given a room with just one king size bed. i told by the extremlley rude hotel reception we had requested 2 double beds and had supplied the age of our child and we were told that requests via expedia didnt have to be honoured this was all she had and we could take it or leave it . we had no choice as we had already paid for our room for 3 nights and she told us like she was doing us a favour that she would give us a fold up bed at no extra charge. the room was extremlley small and the fold up bed that arrived over an hour later after 2 phone calls could barely firt. the price of this hotel and the beautiful lobby makes you expect so much more than a room that could barely contain a king size bed.overall it was good location but i would not stay there again as i think you could find cheaper hotel rooms in the same location that were bigger and had friendlier staff please note that roosevelt hotels in america are operated by differnt companies so this one in new york should not put you off staying at others we stayed at the roosevelt in los angeles after t and it was fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SammyLeeds
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our week long stay at the Roosevelt. The standards were generally high with nice decor and high standards of cleanliness. The staff was very friendly with the exception of a frosty receptionist. Although a problem with a broken hairdryer was sorted in minutes. We went to the hotel restaurant one evening and the filet mignon as recommended by the very nice waiter was amazing. The in house Starbucks in the lovely lobby was a really nice touch. We stayed on a very high floor as requested and had no problems with the elevators as previous reviewers did. The hotels location is great with most things within walking distance and Grand Central Station on your doorstep for the rest. The only let down was that the bathroom, while very clean was falling apart a bit. Also the air con needed to be on constantly which took a bit of getting used to as it was very noisy. Not sure how much we paid for the hotel as we got a deal through Expedia for flights and hotels but I think it worked out around $200 p/n for a superior room with two double beds. All in all a good hotel, well priced and situated!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, but rooms are plain”
Reviews.Author: typome
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful and looks very regal. They use Bath and Body Works for their shampoo, condition, lotion and soap. Pretty much you're paying for location, as it is walking distance to Times Square and a subway station is just 3 blocks away. The concierge can also help you out with making reservations at restaurants. However don't expect anything grand with the bedroom. The rooms are very small and fits only a bed, desk and TV. Bathrooms are just as tiny and don't resemble the rest of the hotel. Also, I experienced slow service where we requested an iron and had to call 3 times before finally going down to the front desk to request it ourselves. Overall a decent stay with great location.

Reviews.Title: “Classy To The T”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLADY045
Reviews.Content: First of all Thank You Tripaadvisor, your the reason our Trip was so great. I took 3 months in planning a trip for my daughter and I. Reading the reviews and looking at the pictures that we a travlers take helped me to see just where I wanted to stay and where I did not want to stay. Went to Priceline and Hit the Jack Pot , got a room at the Roosevelt, for 200 a nite which in June I feel was a great deal,the King and Double bed rooms go for 369 a nite, great deal, got a Double bed room , clean, great location, in the heart of Manhattan, down the street from Grand Centrel Station, walking distance to Time Square, safe area, cleaning staff kept room clean everyday, kept plenty of towels, Bath and Body Works in the Bath Room, in our room Our window looked out to Madison Ave, Staff took good care of us with anything we asked for, young lady at the front desk named Dedra made sure we were well taken care of.Down stairs in the lobby in the morning there is a StarBucks, and so many places to eat near by, we stayed 1 week and it was a great vacation, our flight home was at 6 am so we had to check out at 4:30 am, walked right out side to a Town Car that took us to the airport, can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: sundevil30
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms. Showed up with me and a buddy and they did not have 2 beds for us. We ended up getting a King Bed with a Rollaway bed. We are really not very high maintenance so it was okay. For a lot of you this would have been a big deal and rightfully so!! The location is perfect. Times Square, Grand Central, 5th avenue all right there. Staff was fine. If you can get this hotel for around 175-250 I would say it is a good deal for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: MicheleMemphis
Reviews.Content: We did priceline.com and The Roosevelt Hotel accepted our offer at $135 per night for 2 nights, 2 rooms. When we walked in to the lobby, we were overwhelmed with how beautiful it all was! There was a nice restaurant, several shops, and a lovely bar all a few steps into the hotel. The location was perfect for us to walk around from the theatre district to 5th avenue for shopping. And the rooms... WOW! We could do cartwheels in our 2 bedroom, it was HUGE!!! The beds were wonderful, nice linens, down pillows and comforters. The bathroom was just as enormous, and there was a walk in closet (why??) that you could have put a roll away bed in. I loved this hotel, we usually stay at the Hilton Towers which is WAY more expensive and WAY smaller than The Roosevelt. Oh, and Starbucks served in the lobby.... mmmmm good.

Reviews.Title: “Great 10th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Canuck30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a trip to New York for our 10th Anniversary. We booked the hotel on priceline.com and got it for $175 a night. As many reviewers have stated it is not a new hotel but is a typical New York hotel. The room was not large but then again we did not spend much time in the room. I can be a bit anxious about staying in hotels and I can say that this room was very clean. The room was cleaned each day and I was very grateful. We did not have any trouble with elevators. The location is wondeful, so close to Times Square and also Rockefeller Centre. The Cosi's accross the street is great for a bagel and coffee each morning. The Grey lines tour was a great way to get your bearing and then go back to the sites that you wish to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location, Classic old world hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: MomEmily
Reviews.Content: In looking for a hotel in NYC I was dismayed with my choices and the prices. I got a GREAT price of $200/night on Priceline and was delighted as for our first trip to NYC it was exactly what I wanted - a classic older hotel with a gorgeous lobby and classic architechture. Comparable rates I was getting in NYC in this location were over $300, most over $400/night. BEST: across the street from Grand Central Terminal, or as I like to call it, the human Habitrail. Get your transit FunPass (they are $7 per person per day) and you can get all over the city very quickly. We visited ALL the major places AND came back late on a friday and it was great. Remember this hotel is old and as such, the rooms are small. It reminded me a lot of the 4 seasons in Seattle which is of the same era but has been remodeled a bit more. We had two beds and when we got our suitcases set up (one on the chair) we didnt have tons of room. But from what I hear most hotels in NY have small rooms. For the age of the hotel the furnishings were current and nice and it had a nice sized bathroom. No coffee maker. Across the street is a place called Cosi. Walk there, they open early and get your coffee and their incredible bagels and bagel breakfast and lunch sandwiches. Also I know there are a couple Starbucks and McDonalds within walking distance of the hotel. you are within and easy walk of timesquare or talk the shuttle in the subway. I was there with only my daughter and except for one time, felt safe walking back and forth. Including at 5am to stand in line for Good Morning America. Now the BAD: Staff is very very busy. Concierge is really busy - go really early or really late. They are very nice but did not know where the famous,and visited by the famous, and unmarked Burger Joint is (I'm not telling!!!). When we went to checkout, the bellman never answered and we drug our very large bags down the elevator ourselves. Tipping. I am from California and I still dont get tipping. NO one helped bring out bags down. They checked them and some guy who brought them to the curb wanted a tip as did the guy who got us transportation (due to the airport we were using, he did a lot of work) - tipped him, not the other guy. Tip - the very nice pretty dark haired girl in the gift shop became our personal concierge. She was NEVER busy and when we went in to get a soda she was SO nice and gave us great ideas, that we kept going back to her. Note - if you are NOT from NYC, we found people to be in general RUDE and obnoxious OR overly super duper nice and helpful. Not that much in between. Of course the rudest were the folks that were in line with us at Good Morning America. Dont get me started. would DEFINATELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little shared local knowledge would be very beneficial to their guests”
Reviews.Author: GumboK
Reviews.Content: We chose the Roosevelt Hotel for two simple reasons.: 1. Location - you know where 2. Price - $240 +tax 06/09/07 They were hard to beat on both counts. As others have mentioned the location is a long block from CGT, and access to subways to anywhere. Times Square, et al, are all within easy walking distances. Our room was a Deluxe King corner room on the 15th floor. And although there was no view (other than the rooftop), it was a very good sized, comfortable room. The A/C was cranked down when we opened the door (the way we like it), and we left it pretty cold our entire stay. It functioned quietly and efficiently. As you can see by the photos, there was ample room, and the bed and linen were superb. The bathroom was a little small, and had old style fixtures, and yet was certainly adequate. Good shower with plenty of hot water. We (I) had an small issue with our room safe (totally my fault). Those things and I just don't get along for some reason. It was locked, and we couldn't reopen it. A call to the front desk assured us that a security person would be up soon to help us out. The phone rang about five minutes later and the voice said that the security guard was outside our door. I asked them why didn't he knock, and they replied that the DND sign was on the door. I thought that was very respectful, since I had called them requesting a service, yet they still honored the sign. He fixed it in about sixty seconds and was on his way. Great guest service in this instance. Our only criticism would be the fact that the day we were leaving there was a large parade scheduled to go up 5th Ave, in the AM, which would mean that 5th Ave. would be closed from 44th through 86th streets !!!!!!! We learned that information the day before from a bartender (not at the hotel). My brother had his car in the hotel garage and no one, (front desk nor parking valet) mentioned to him that he would have difficulty getting his car out the next day, and a big headache getting across 5th Ave. since it would be closed. Just a few words or a 'heads up' from someone on the staff, letting us know that this was taking place, and would affect us, would have been something that I would have expected from a competent, dedicated, helpful staff. We glanced in and sat briefly in the bar area, which was very nice, but neither drank there or used the restaurant. Overall, our stay (1 night) was very pleasant. We enjoyed the room's spaciousness, cleanliness, coolness and the extremely comfortable bed, as we lounged Sunday morning with the Times and TV. We would certainly stay there again and recommend the hotel as a solid 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Priceline choice”
Reviews.Author: Crabbus
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the $165 a night I paid through Priceline but I wouldn't have been so happy if I had paid more. I got a great room on the 4th floor, clean, spacious (for New York), and quiet. There are at least eight elevators, so the wait is never long. Despite the throngs of tourists in the lobby there was always room in the bar/lounge. Staff friendly and courteous, Good location (for me), safe and reputable. I would stay here again (if it's well under $200 per night.)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MinnieEngland
Reviews.Content: This is at best no more than a two star hotel. The location is good and that is the only positive statement we can make. We arrived after a long-delayed flight at 5 a.m. to be told by reception that they did not have our booking. We eventually managed to sort this out but the attitude of the receptionist was not particularly helpful or friendly. We were allocated a room on 18th floor only to find that the shower could not be regulated – either scalding hot or freezing cold. We reported this early next morning, as well as requesting a replacement iron (our iron had something scorched on the plate). We returned at 6 p.m looking forward to a shower only to find that nothing had happened and everyone disclaimed any knowledge of our phone call that morning. By 6.30 p.m. (after 2 calls to chase them up) someone came to look at the shower. He reported that nothing could be done quickly to fix the fault and suggested that we were moved to another room. We were therefore offered a room on the 16th floor and began to pack our suitcases. We did receive assistance in moving our suitcases. Unfortunately, the same problem was experienced in the new room. We were subsequently told that any room above the 6th floor experiences these problems. The next morning our toilet overflowed onto the bathroom floor and we put towels down to mop up the water. Someone came out within 10 minutes and unblocked the toilet and we requested that somebody came to clean up the room immediately. This request fell on deaf ears and nothing happened until the next morning when it was dealt with by the normal cleaning staff. The air conditioning was very noisy and had to be switched off at night, which made the room very stuffy. There is a general air of mustiness in the corridors and a feeling that everywhere could do with a good clean. Avoid room service and the hotel restaurant as these are ridiculously over-priced and unbelievably slow. The restaurant (and reception area) are constantly 'blessed' with the music of a dis-embodied, tuneless piano player which does nothing for a visitor's digestive system. The constant expectation to tip, tip, tip really got us down, particularly as the service, at best, was mediocre. More customer-care training of their staff would be a good investment. Needless to say, we shall not be returning to the Roosevelt. This hotel is living on its past reputation and needs to move into the 21st Century – certainly as far as their plumbing is concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: pamplemousserond
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall exceeded my expectations. The room was very clean and I liked that the sketchy top blanket was covered with fresh sheets. The bed was super comfortable and I very much appreciated the Bath and Body Works amenities. The only thing that was disappointing was the room's location. We booked through priceline.com's name your own price system and got a great rate, but they stuck us in the room just opposite the elevators so anytime people got on or off our floor we would hear 'ding ding'. A bit annoying, but we were tired so we could sleep through it. That said, I would definitely stay again but not stay in the rooms like 401, 501, etc. as those are opposite the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Paid $155 a night (via Priceline) for a room at the Roosevelt over the June 22 - 24 weekend. Impressive lobby, clean rooms and helpful staff. Good location, just a 10-minute walk from Times Square. Bad points? Inexcusably, a food tray from Friday evening was still outside our door on Sunday morning. Also, the small gift/supplies store in the hotel was - no surprise here - ridiculously expensive. If you're after water, soda, toothpaste etc., make sure you stock up at a Walgreens or similar. One last thing, the front desk were very accommodating in letting my friend check into the room a day before me even though the reservation was in my name.

Reviews.Title: “Absoutey Brilliant *****”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter200787
Reviews.Content: I must say i was a little nervous after reading so many bad reviews about hotels in New York, especially because i didnt really have a lot of money to spend. But i managed to save up a little extra to avoid staying in a hostal. This hotel was reasonably priced generally for accom in the city, and it was very impressive. The lobby is the most spectacular hotel lobby i have seen in a while, its worth it just for that if you ask me! The room was clean and tidy, not overly spacious, but definatey enough. The staff were frienly and helpful - I had a great overall experience and would only stay there in the future. I even had an experience at the Waldorf 5 years ago and I honestly liked the Roosevelt MORE! The locaton cannot be matched....1 bock from Grand Central! GO FOR IT - ITS AMAZING! (One negative is that breakfast ispossibly he most overpriced breakfast I have ever seen....however there is a lovely place that does breakfast round the corner...."The Red Flame"!)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: SaminDC
Reviews.Content: It is right near Grand Central in the heart of midtown. Near lots of shopping, including some in the building. The workout room is fine. There were some issues keeping the room cool. Fancy soap products.

Reviews.Title: “Big, impressive, touristic”
Reviews.Author: Moramare
Reviews.Content: Fine hotel with great beds. Very, very big though! A plus definitely is tha rooms with connecting doors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: aztraveler83
Reviews.Content: This is a fine mid-priced hotel. The location (literally steps to Grand Central) is amazing. The rooms were small (typical for NYC), but clean. The hotel is older. Don't stay here if you're expecting luxury. Stay here for a nice 3 star hotel in a good location. The staff is courteous and helpful, but they do expect a tip. If you're not leaving your room early (8am) make sure to put out the Do Not Disturb sign, the maids come early. Don't pay full price for this hotel, its not worth more than 300-350 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Chrismar50
Reviews.Content: I treated my 2 daughters and myself to a holiday in New York staying at the Roosevelt Hotel. We had read the reviews so knew the bedrooms were small - and they were!! Having said that, they were spotlessly clean with new bed linen and towels every day. The shower was one of the best I have ever used! The location is very good. We found the consierge very helpful with any queries we had. We had a day out at Woodbury Common (out of town designer shopping outlet). It is an hour out of New York on Grayline buses from the Port Authority Bus Station and costs £20 ($40). It was very good but exhausting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hel_mo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a cosy queen and it sure was cosy! My room, though compact was clean, tidy and very pleasant. I loved everything about this hotel from its fabulous lobby and helpful and very friendly staff to the soft, sumptuous pillows and mattress on my bed! The location couldn’t have been better, everything was within walking distance and cab fares were a mere $5 or $6 when I didn’t feel like walking, very convenient being that it was my first time in New York and I was travelling alone! I think that anyone who has complained about this hotel was expecting more than 3 stars or is accustomed to 5 star luxury but as for me, as my plan was to sight-see and not to stay in my room, I was more than happy and hope to stay at The Roosevelt a few more times before the year is out

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: norfolk1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night break at the Roosevelt. We chose the hotel based on reviews found on Tripadvisor and whilst we were aware that we did get a good price for New York and from the reviews, expected a small room and somewhat unhelpful staff, we were still VERY disappointed with the standard of the hotel. It has a very grand lobby and bar but it is a shame that that is where the charm ends. The elevators are very slow and if you are on one of the higher floors can take a long time, seemingly stopping at every floor on the way. Firstly, the room was for three of us. It had two queen sized beds (bit of a squeeze for two adults) but we found it to be quite roomy and certainly larger than some hotels we have stayed in London. The furnishings were old (not antique as previous reviews) but just well used, marked, stained, lampshades burnt in places. Swivel chair very nice but seat pad badly stained. However the worst thing was that generally it wasn't very clean. The bed linen was OK (however beds never made properly - sheets just laid across beds so I had to tuck them in myself otherwise would have just come off) the towels were clean - but used plastic cutlery from a previous occupant found on floor . I moved the bed against the wall and underneath was full of dust (dust still left there on subsequent days even though room 'cleaned'). Room was very hot and stuffy, air conditioning not the best and VERY noisy. The hotel generally looks very dark and grimy. Some have said it is old fashioned and has character - I would say that it could do with a good thorough clean and lick of paint! However the worst was yet to come! One morning I went to get my sons toothbrush for him only to find a large cockroach sitting on it! I called housekeeping who removed it and assured me that the bathroom would be sanitised that morning as a result. We returned to our room at 5pm to find that the room had not been cleaned or made up at all and they were unsure when it would be able to be done. I was not happy knowing that cockroaches had been wandering around in the bathroom so asked to be moved to another room. The staff were, to their credit, very helpful. The next room was alot cleaner and the fixtures alot newer. The next day, my husband found another cockroach in his jeans which he had taken out of the closet and there was another one on the sheets on the side of the bed. I can put up with alot of things in hotels and realize that they cannot all be perfect, but cleanliness is very important and if you do not have that then it is a bad hotel - especially when you are staying with young children. The hotel is in a very good postion to see all the sights - but so are lots of others. I loved New York and can't wait to go back - but I would not stay at the Roosevelt and would not recommend it to others either.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location... Location !!”
Reviews.Author: MOSH1977
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to New York this year. Me and my GF stayed at the Roosevelt both times and loved the place. I really dont understand when people write bad reviews regarding this Hotel . The Hotel is rated a 3 star therefore people should expect to get a 3 star type of a hotel. People complain about the price of the lobby bar or restaurant . Well as an experienced traveler I have never found a cheap lobby bar or cheap hotel restaurant . People must realise that they are in NYC and if they walk outside for about 5 minutes , there are literally all kinds of restaurants,cafes. I recommend the room with a King Bed which is much larger than the regular room ( though still small compared to rooms in other countries , though decent size for NYC). King Bed is very comfortable. The greatest thing about this Hotel is the location . Everything is about walking distance. 5th avenue, Times Square , Grand Central, Rockefeller Center. If you're not the walking type , everything is about a 5-6$ cab ride. Cons for this Hotel are the bathrooms which are a little retro and the TVS which are old and small. There is also no Free WiFi for the Hotel . I would recommend this Hotel for the experienced traveler who is going to NYC to visit the sites and is looking for a great room for a decent price. I do not recommend this Hotel to anyone looking for a 5 star ALL INCLUSIVE type of experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bully the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: joandphil
Reviews.Content: We fllew into NYC on Saturday and arrived at the hotel in the mid A.M. We were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready and we could take our luggage up, and begin our journey. We were also amazed at the courtesy shown to us and the beauty of the hotel. In reading about the Roosevelt, we expected a small room with an older style bathroom and were not disappointed. However, the bed was incredible and the shower head was so soothing after a day of sightseeing. My wife had requested a coffee maker and one was brought right away. The service was impeccable. I mean, they gave us early check-in and extended our check-out, which allowed us to get a short nap after more sight-seeing and spiff up a little before we had to head back to the airport. We coudn't have asked for a better stay. And the hotel is very clean! The location is incredible as well. The Roosevelt is located a block and a half from Grand Central Station, which made it very convenient to the subway (our major mode of transportation). I think that those who have complained about the Roosevelt must be used to staying in 5-star hotels in locations other than NYC which offer huge rooms. This is our third stay in NYC, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: NDusso17
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Roosevelt for business and from day one had issues. The elevators took forever, when I asked a hotel staff member where the stairs were she said "NO, you take elevator" I told her the wait was too long and she said "You wait". Not very helpful. I was expecting deliveries to the hotel for work, and had problems with that as well. The biggest issue came on day 3 (which turned out to be my last day at the hotel even though I was booked for 5 nights) when I woke up, went to take a shower and found roaches in the shower. I immediately called the front desk--it took forever for someone to show up. When they finally did, the maintance man told me that they were having issues with kids leaving food in the room. I checked out after my meetings that day because I couldn't stand the thought of staying in there a moment longer and the manager of the hotel made me pay for that night. He said there was nothing he could do about it, but wouldn't charge me the fee for checking out early. I WAS DISGUSTED. I travel all over the world for work, and I have never experienced such horrible service or had roaches in my room. My travel agent booked me into a different hotel but I had to pay for two hotel rooms for one night because they clearly don't care about how they come across to their guest. I'd never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: psych0maniac
Reviews.Content: Location is great - 3 blocks from Grand Central Terminal, 15 min walk from Time Square, 7 min from Rockefeller Center. It's an optimal place to stay in Manhattan without having to dish out $500+ a night. The beds were comfortable and I slept easily each night. The staff was friendly but sometimes the lines get long at the front desk and concierge around noon as people are checking in and out. The concierge services were good. They can get you reservations very quickly and recommend places to go. Only warning - sometimes they mark up prices for tickets by as much as $15 a ticket so you may want to compare prices with Ticketmaster for Broadway shows and Yankee tickets. The bad: Be sure to buy drinks or what you may need while at Grand Central or a nearby store. This hotel charges $2 for a can of soda. The staff can be heard vacuuming as early as 8am. Grant it - tourist town and people leave early but some times people sleep in. Walls are pretty thin - my friend and I were watching TV - you can hear it 3 doors down if you were standing in the hallway. Sometimes, the wait for an elevator can be busy during check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, Sorry, Sorry, Sorry, Sorry, Sorry.....”
Reviews.Author: AlbertAlbertanan
Reviews.Content: People, People, People, Listen to what you read - I wished I had and booked at a diff. hotel - We were moved 5 times - yes, 5 times in 7 days, they never offerred any help to pack up, move into storage, then to reclaim belongings from storage and haul them all yet again -god forbid that the get you or give you some help. About the Bus-"Men" --- you are harrassed - yes, harrassed for TIPS!!! Would even continue to follow you until you gave them what THEY wanted! They had our reservations continually - day after day screwed up - one night we were sleeping in lobby with our luggage! Atrocious treatment and you know what, they did not care a bit. It was the first time in New York for all 4 of us and none of us will ever stay there again. The last 2 nights they kept us in the same room - was really too bad it was a lousy urine smelling room - was awful. I can't beleive I had to pay there huge price for rooms - what a bad experience it was!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed - Good Location, Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rikard
Reviews.Content: First a tip: book this hotel with your flights on one of the major travel sites to get excellent discounts on your room rates. On this basis, we were paying equiv to only about $120 per night. Just as well because although it is an excellent location, the rooms are v small and in need of refurb. For those of you paying $300-400 per night, I'm amazed your reviews are so positive. Faded but elegant lobby and bar, pricey food and drink. The rooms, with ancient,rattling a/c units are the big let-down.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid class hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoppyTT
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous find for exploring the city of New York. Its centrally located for shopping, sights and public transport. It was our anniversary and the hotel upgraded us to a deluxe kingsize room. The room was a lot bigger than the standard ones with a walk in closet. The only negtive points were that the bathroom was a bit shabby in comparison to the room but was a good size and the air con system is a bit old and noisey but effective nevertheless. Tip: for breakfast try the Brooklyn Diner off Times Square. Wonderful way to start the day!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: kini30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from May 18-21/07. It was absolutely perfect! We had booked through Expedia and when we checked in we were given an upgrade from the Petite Room with a Queen bed to a King Sized bed with a slightly larger room. The beds were very comfortable, the room was clean. I would agree that the bathrooms are so-so, but really, for a couple of days it did the trick. The bathroom had a hairdryer and bath and body works products. The location was very convenient! The concierge pointed out Grand Central Terminal for us and the subway made things very accessible. We did not think that we would take the subway, but it saved us a ton of money in cab rides. We took the subway to Century 21, SOHO and to Central Park (72nd Street) and we didn't have any problems. The hotel is very close to all of the shops on fifth avenue, bloomingdales, macy's and times square. We had an awesome time and couldn't have asked for more, particularly since the hotel offers a great price. I would avoid the lounge/restaurant, it seemed expensive. We ate at a Mexican restaurant across from Grand Central Terminal, called 'Tequillaville'. It had great mexican and some great beer! My only warning would be that the kitchens and deli's seemed to close early (kitchens around 9pm), so you may have to venture a bit farther for food sometimes. Maybe we just got unlucky!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaToronto
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is a steal! A great hotel at a reasonable price is nearly impossible in NYC. I stayed for the weekend and was very pleased with the accomodations. The hotel is in a great location - a 10 minute walk to Times Square. Although the east side is quiet at night with not much open around, that's good if you're looking for a good night's sleep with little traffic noise. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the lobby is picture-worthy. I would definitely stay at the Roosevelt again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “loved it will come again”
Reviews.Author: janleeh
Reviews.Content: a lovely hotel, wonderful service, wonderful rooms and the lobby, wow one tip, bar and restaurant expensive, but you are in new york and the hotel location is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!! Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: shaq&ani
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days while in New York. The lobby is quite amazing, but unlike some hotels where they dress up the lobby and have shabby rooms, this one didn't disappoint. The rooms are very clean, the bathroom was showing some signs of age, but all in all and nice place to stay. Staff were friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jacquelinecivitarese
Reviews.Content: My travel agent suggested this hotel and at first I was conearned due to the reviews on this page. I went for it anyways as the price was great. This hotel was GREAT! I cannot complain about anything! The staff was great and extremely helpful! We booked our broadway tickets with our hotel and the concierge helped us out with where to go in the evening. He even called ahead for us and got us on the list so we would be guaranteed entrance. The location is also great! My sister and I walked to MACY'S which was about 20 minutes and times square was not even a 10 min walk straight up the street! No turns or nothing.We even walked to one of our Broadway shows which was located super close as well. We ordered room service and although the food was not the greatest it was exceptionally fast and was cleaned up when we called as well! The rooms were small compared to North American rooms but who goes to NYC and stays in their room? The bathroom was also small but we did not care! Everything was clean and pressed and that is what we appreciated! Our luggage was taken care of extremely well and everything I felt was very organized! I COMPLETELY recomend this place to anyone who wants a good location from Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “a little worn, average service, but nice overall”
Reviews.Author: wickedtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend in February of 2006. Overall, the place is a bit worn, and the rooms are small, but not bad at all. The bathroom is nothing fancy, the rooms are not fancy, and you get a basic, clean room with some ornate furnishings.
