Service was fine, and not rude like you can sometimes risk in New York City, and as for location, it is right by Grand Central Station, which is quite handy for getting around. if you go with a decent expectation of good service and clean, comfy but not fancy rooms, you will not be disappointed. It is a good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Coupled with Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: zackary71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as a group and had a great Holiday. The Hotel is well located in the heart of Manhattan within walking distance of Grand Central, Times Square and 5th Avenue. The Hotel has a lot of History reflected in the grandiose lobby but also in the accomodations themselves. The rooms do look a bit dated but I think this just adds to the character of the place. We upgraded to a Superior Room which for $15 odd per night is well worth it. Staff were friendly and helpful and we did not have any grounds for complaint. Our friends though had a minor problem as next door's alarm clock went off at 7am after they'd checked out. This took 40 mins and 3 calls to get sorted but they were compensated with complimentary Breakfasts ! The breakfast buffet is not cheap at $27.95 per person but it is extensive and if you ate what I ate, you won't need to stop for Lunch ! One good tip if you're flying home with BA to UK-use the Hotel internet access 24 hours before your return flight (located in restaurant at end of lobby, round corner to right) For $3, we checked in online and managed to get the front row Economy seats so had a very comfortable sleep o the overnight flight home. As otherrs have said, check out the View Revolving Cocktail bar at the Marriott, Times Square-not cheap but you get a great view of the skyline. Also, the Visitor's Centre at Ground Zero is very moving. Century 21 store nearby is worth visiting too for some great bargains.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DevonJay
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of mixed reviews about New York hotels, the Roosevelt was a pleasant surprise and I'm quite a fussy person, the room wasn't massive but for NYC it was adequate, the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in, the service from everyone in the hotel was impeccable ! The room was kept extremely clean and tidy, the location of the hotel was practically perfect, there was a great diner for breakfast just down the road which had great food at reasonable prices, you're close to 5th Ave and getting around the city is easy peasy. Just getting back to the service thing, I had bought quite alot of stuff and wanted to borrow some tape from the hotel to tape up my box of stuff, within minutes a chap was at my room with his tape, taping up my box for me. The hotel gave me an extra 3 hours to check out of my room because I had a late flight, FOC ! They stored my luggage for me until it was time to leave for the airport. I really can't think of anything negative about this hotel, ah ! 1 thing I think the food is expensive but hey try the many places in the city, buffalo wings in an Irish bar is a good start ! Oh and the bath could have been abit deeper ... now I am being picky for the sake of it eh ... but the shower was great ! I would definitely recommend this hotel and it's location in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: H28
Reviews.Content: First time to New York and it was a fantastic trip. The City of New York is just amazing. The Hotel is all about location, location, location. Set on Madison Avenue and 45th Street, you're only one block away from Fifth Avenue and a easy 10 minutes walk to Times Square. You could even walk to The Empire State Building or Central Park in 15-20 minutes, as long as you don't get distracted by the shops. The rooms could do with a little maintenance work, but don't let this put you off- you really won't be spending much time in the room. The beds are so comfy, made by a company called Serta, so comfy, I'm trying to see if they're available to buy in the UK, and after a hard days shopping, are just what you need. The hotel is clean and all staff are friendly, especially the hotel doormen, who will help you with directions etc. The shopping is great, some good bargains to be had on watches, shoes, jeans and more. I would recommend a trip to Woodbury Common Outlets, a shoppers paradise with designer shops at very low prices. Tickets available from the Port Authority Bus Station. I would also recommend the Harbour Cruise on the Hudson River. A great way to see the city of New York. I can't wait to visit New York again, just need to save up again and I would most definitely stay at the Roosevelt Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: jena16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt this past weekend. I was a bit nervous given some of the reviews on the site, but I have to say that our stay was fantastic. I knew that some of the rooms were on the small side, so during check in I asked for the largest room possible. The incredibly friendly and courteous woman at the reception desk (Wendy) was great, and gave us a large room with a king-sized bed on the 9th floor. We paid $215/night on priceline which is pretty good as far as NYC hotels go. The lobby is beautiful, and I enjoyed sitting in the lounge area during breakfast in the morning (Starbucks and fruit is available in the bar area in the morning). The fitness center was hot the first day, but they got the problem quickly resolved and it was very pleasant the second day. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the housekeeping staff was very responsive. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cafflou
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel during April. Like many of you we had trawled through all the reviews for hours before deciding on the Roosevelt. We are really glad we did. Beautiful hotel with loads of character. Our room was lovely - we had e-mailed the hotel before our arrival to request a high floor, and they honoured our request as we were on the 17th floor. Our room was comfortable and quiet, one small point is that we found the hotel quite hot, but as we were on the 17th floor we could have the window open at night. The hotel is in a great position - within walking distance of most attractions, but my boyfriend mastered the metro which was an excellent way to get around. We found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. We loved NY and the highlight was that we got engaged at the top of the rockefeller centre, so it will always be a special place to us. I would recommend this hotel and would be happy to go back there again

Reviews.Title: “Not pleasant”
Reviews.Author: kidsme
Reviews.Content: Summary: Pros: Cheaper that other hotels. Close to Grand Central Cons: Dishonest in lots of things. Trying to rid you off. Thin walls. Noisy. Not kids friendly. I just stayed in this hotels for 2 nights (Sun & Mon). Price is $350 (Sun) and $250 (Mon). Called to book because none of the online stores sell 2 Double-bed, but calling the hotel directly had no problem getting it. I had 2 kids so I asked "is non-smoking room a guarrantee?"and she said "YES". So I booked. Got there about 9pm (hey I'm experienced booking in this country, so I know I might not have that room). Procceded to the room and it's a smoking room. Ask for an exchange and they said "Sorry we don't have 2-bed room. But we have a king-size non-smoking with a sofa-bed." I said I was told this is a guarrantee room and he said "I don't know who you told to, but I don't have the room right now. (You know this is typical American way of doing business) I repeated what I said before and he said he's going to call me back. Few mins later, he magically made a non-smoking room for me. What a surprise! That room is non-smoking okay but he put us on a floor where there's a huge group of youngers just finished performing in the boardway or something, and the room is super small. That night was horrible because the kids were drunk and talked loud in the lobby just like a party, noisy 'til 2am when a security guy said "open the door or I'm calling the police" The room was super small. We ordered room service (because of the kids). 20% additional charge plus $4.00 delivery. Missed a desert which is $10. Asked for a credit and only $10 is back. Not the 20%. I don't really care for that $2.00 but it really shows how dishonest these people are. And it's going to cost them more once I made this public and people should know about this before staying in this hotel. By the way, valet parking is $48 a night here. Think twice before booking.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect New York hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mustang beau
Reviews.Content: After several recent bad experiences at New York city hotels, I was starting to think there are no good hotels in the city, but thankfully, the Roosevelt proved I was wrong. This hotel is big, but both the rooms and the public areas are well decorated, comfortable and have great beds. The closet was large and there was plenty of storage space. The room and bathroom were immaculately clean. The breakfast buffet, although pricey, was worth every penny because it included thing like fresh berries, smoked salmon, omelets made to order, etc. The service was excellent and the staff universally friendly. The location is also very convenient since it is right in the middle of midtown, near the subway, shopping, the theater district and many attractions. This hotel is worth the money and many of the hotels I have stayed at in NY charge more and provide less value. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovley Hotel In Fantastic Lacation”
Reviews.Author: dawnash20
Reviews.Content: Like other readers i was rather nervous to stay at this hotel but i found the whole experience wonderful. There is nothing i can say negative. Our room was very large with two double beds, extremley comfortable. All the staff were helpful and the location was just the best. Really minute walks from about just everything. Would recommend and difinetely go back again..

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: SCbeachdawg
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms were small but very clean and the bed was better than heavenly. The food was great and the staff was very attentive, especially housekeeping. The location can't be beat and the hotel exudes character. We will definitely return. The Barrons Myrtle Beach, SC

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: relaxbhappy
Reviews.Content: Lovely elegant hotel. Very comfortable beds. Rooms big enough for what you need unless you want to live there! But thats not what you go to New York for is it? Very friendly staff but don't book the theatre tickets there. Its half the price at the box offices. Martinis are great but strong! Barstaff very friendly. Great cafe/deli across the road with food so fresh it makes english cafes look pathetic. Best breakfast - bit of a way away - we found it last time. Park cafe near Carnegie hall and across from the Park Hotel. Hotel car to airport is as cheap as a taxi and much more comfortable. Felt quite spoilt!

Reviews.Title: “great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: happystay88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during spring break. The location is great, room is clean, bed is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A budget style hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DavidMi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in 2007. Paid $150 total per night. Nice lobby. Small room. A bit run down in the halls and rooms. Halls smelled of smoke. No coffee maker in room. No extra blanket in room. Furniture clean enough but old. Carpet torn. Elevators inadequate for size of hotel. For the price we paid and the location it was OK. Would not pay much more that $150 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellet Location, but don't pay full price!!”
Reviews.Author: world_in_my_eyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for 3 nights (Apr 7-10, 2007). The location is excellent, very close to Grand Central Station and buses. You can quickly walk to Times Square, and other mid-town attractions. I agree with the other travelers that the hotel staff was not very friendly. I wouldn't say they were flat-out rude, but no smiles or welcoming attitude. However, service levels in America are rapidly declining across the board in general. The hotel was very busy at all times of the day and night. Elevators were slow and crowded at times. Our non-smoking room on the 8th floor was small, with one queen sized bed. Just enough room for two people. We didn't go to NYC to hang out in the hotel, so it was ok for us. The bed was extremely comfortable, nice pillows. The room and bathroom were very clean, the water was hot, water pressure good. Bath & Body Works brand products, although you better like Coconut Lime Verbana flavor. The one thing that annoyed me the most was the housekeeping staff. On Easter Sunday morning around 8am, they were walking up and down the corridor banging on doors, slamming doors and loudly shouting "housekeeping!" before coming in to a room. Also vacuuming in hallway very early. I have never stayed in a hotel where the housekeepers come that early, esp. on Sunday. Unless you are a VERY early riser, I strongly recommend using the "do not disturb" sign although you will still hear them as they make their way up and down the hall. We elected to not have the room cleaned during our stay. The walls were thin and we could hear our neighbors talking, sneezing, etc. I'm sure they could hear us as well. Also, lots of morning street noise, horns, sirens, etc. The heat worked almost too well, there was no medium - all or nothing. The fan, although noisy, did a good job of drowning out the sound of housekeeping in the mornings. We didn't try the restaurant or room service as there are so many terrific restaurants and coffee shops within a 2 minute walk. NYC is an amazing city. Overall, the hotel was fine for the amount we paid thru Priceline. Looking on other travel websites, a low quality chain hotel was priced at $200+ which is ridiculous to me. There are too many rooms in Manhattan to pay that much for a bad hotel. The Roosevelt is clean, conveniently located, and a good deal if you get it at a discount rate.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!!! Great Location!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Always_Travelling086
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the end of March to the start of April For 6 nights.Having read some of the reviews the hotel got on this website, I was a bit sceptical about staying here. My scepticism was laid to rest as soon as we arrived. At checkin I asked for some directions to get Madison Square Garden as I needed to pick up tickets for the Knicks basketball game that night( the Knicks won), the checkin clerk could not have been more helpful. His direction were so good it was impossible to get lost. The rooms were small but I didn't expect anything else it is New York after all space is at a premium.Some of the reviews are complaining about room size I suggest you pinch yourself and realise where you are. For a hotel of this size the service was excellent our bed sheets were changed every day , new towels were laid out with fresh toiletries. Location is brilliant only a few blocks from Times Square, all the other sites are in close proximity. An Ideal place to stay I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff need customer service training!!”
Reviews.Author: IloveNYCSurrey
Reviews.Content: New York was FANTASTIC. Local people on the streets and in shops, retaurants and bars were friendly and welcoming. The location of the hotel was perfect; 10 mins to Times Square and Broadway ( Mamma Mia! was amazing). However the hotel staff are grumpy and pretty rude most of the time and I can't recall one smiling; except for the room maids, they were lovely. Myself and two friends arrived Monday 2nd April for a 4 night break. As we arrived before 3pm we checked in our bags and went off to explore central park. When we returned our roon was ready. The room was large enough but the two beds were only small doubles, not the expected USA large king beds. Definately not big enough to share, even with very close friends! We requested a rollaway bed, guest services agreed that it would be ok. The bed finally arrived about 3 hours later after 3 phone calls! Problem solved, we thought. However the next day when we returned from sightseeing we discovered they had removed the extra bed leaving no word of explanation! On enquiring at reception we were told that we were not entitled to it so it had been removed! After a lengthy discussion they agreed begrudgingly to return it to us. Room service is very overpriced so we didn't use it. Lots of great eating places for all meals within a couple of blocks. to suit all pockets. Check out was ok except they had run out of the usual storage space for luggage for those guests with evening flights. We were not the only ones affected. The problem was finally sorted, only it took 30 minutes and then we all had to take our own bags to the store room, led by a bell boy who still expected a tip!! I would recommend the hotel for location, but just be prepared for grumpy staff and small double beds in a standard room for 4 people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, top location”
Reviews.Author: AdrianMonk
Reviews.Content: After checking in (reception person was very unfriendly, she didn't even say "welcome" or so) we got to our room which was clean and spacious (for new york). We had a 2 queen bed room. Bathroom was OK but not cleaned very well. The location of the hotel is great. Its a two-minute walk to grand central station, two-minutes to fifth avenue, 5 minutes to rockefeller center, 15 minutes to times square and empire state bldg. I would recommend to stay in this hotel for people who just need a good and safe location to sleep. Don't use hotel drivers service. Not a good value. (55 bucks to JFK!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: SUPERMO
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Roosevelt Hotel (6 nights -March 29- 4 April 2007) and after reading some of the previous reviews I must admit I was slightly concerned. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Although the girl on reception just handed the room key over with no comment whatsoever, not even a welcome or smile,we were delighted with our 18th floor room which was small but very clean and refurbished.We were only in the room to sleep, so the fact it was compact didn't bother us and you could only barely hear the traffic below. One tip though - don't make your bed everyday (like I do always) as one day the housekeeper only emptied the bins and ignore the bed linen. I took the advice of previous posts and never went near anything in the hotel due to prices but ate in Grand Central Terminal, Connellys Bar & Macy's Cellar for lunch which were all good value. There was a slight problem with the elevators as the hotel was busy but being on the 18th floor the only one we had was going down when it obviously has to stop on every floor and many times it was full so these poor people had to continually wait for the next one. The hotel I feel is in a great location as you can walk uptown or downtown and you are close to walk to many of the major attractions. I would recommend the Rockerfeller Centre for views rather than the Empire State Building if you can do only one. I had been previously and only done the latter but the view from the top of the rock is amazing, less busy and there are more viewing areas. Overall a good experience and I would return to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Universal22
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel because there was no availability at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers or The Michelangelo (previously stayed in), I was not too impressed. (Stayed 24th March 2007 for seven nights). Usual fancy lobby but on stepping out of the lifts first impression of the carpet, tired & worn. On entering the room, yes it's small as other reviewers commented on but plenty of space for two. There was a patch of damaged carpet that could easily have been mended, wouldn't have looked too bad if the frayed threads had been removed. The bath seal was mouldy in several areas (how long does it take to put a new seal around the bath), bath enamel damaged and a few tiles on the bathroom floor, towels although replaced daily were passed there best. The room was clean but first impressions count & this was disappointing for us. There was no vanity bar in the bathroom just one small shelf for toiletries. We had noise from the next room whenever they ran water or flushed the toilet; also we could hear the people in the next room and constant noise from the corridor & the banging of doors. After the first night we straightened the bedding as we do not like to leave an untidy room & after housekeeping we found the bed had not been made although the room had been cleaned, so after that left the bed a little untidy to make sure the bed was made up. We were also surprised there were no bath robes provided and only a few coat hangers. Our room overlooked a roof area with no view & a little hum from the machinery, but not a problem we were not in the room long enough to admire the views. Never had a problem with the lifts as other reviewers commented on even though the hotel was very busy all the time. The hotel staff were pleasant and the concierge was very helpful & managed to obtain tickets to a Snow Patrol concert at Madison Square Garden on the day even though they were sold out on-line. Bar ok but cocktails not nice. For the price difference I would prefer to stay at the two hotels I have previously mentioned for a little more money, also we found the location of this hotel a little far away from the main areas.

Reviews.Title: “Overall A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vikki1Staffs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in march for 3 nights.Found the location perfect for everything we wanted to see.The hotel lobby is very grand.It has a nice seating area and bar to relax in after a hard days sightseeing!! Beware bar prices are quite expensive.The rooms were ideal for the time that you spend in them,only downfall was the lighting in them is quite poor.Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel,and would definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Helthemel
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for 3 nights last week. The location is fantastic for 5th Avenue, Times Square, Broadway, Statue of Liberty, Top of the Rock and Central Park was only about 20-25 minutes walk. The lobby has been refurbished and is very lavish - we were really impressed on arrival. The downsides were that they seem to have spent most of the money on the new lobby and although the rooms have been done, they are still a little shabby. We found damage in the room on our arrival : shower head hanging out of the wall about 6 inches, one of the beds was pulled away from the wall exposing a big bunch of about 30 wires ripped out and the phone was missing from the room. As we were on the 18th floor (top) this was a potential health and safety issue. I reported this immediately (by going down to the lobby 18 floors) and nobody came. I thought it would be done the next day but nothing so I reported it again. Nothing done so I reported it a third time and still nobody came. The staff on reception were very solomn, abrupt and did not appear interested. I finally handed my feedback card to the manager as we were checking out and he was equally useless! The final insult was when we checked out, the receptionist commented (in a surprised voice) that we had no room charges - I again pointed out that this may have had something to do with the fact that we had no phone so could not have ordered any room service or made calls! Thank goodness the city made up for it in every which way possible!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: PenistoneJames
Reviews.Content: On arrival i was made to feel a little annoyed by the staff at reception as they made out that we were not booked in (we booked through expedia). At the end of the stay they tried to charge us for the room again although i had paid expedia - Watch out for that one! Another thing to watch is the money grabbing bell boys - but i guess that is just the NYC way. The location was perfect for everything we wanted to do on our holiday (sightseeing/shopping) and felt very safe all hours of the day and night. Avoid the horrendously priced room service and hotel restaurant, instead get into Grand Central Terminal food court and choose from one of the many eateries there. Room was a very good size for us English folk who are not used to gigantic American rooms! It was cleaned to a high standard every day and we also received a complementary paper. The Lobby area is stunning (more impressive than the Waldorf) and the Bar is very cosy (nicer than 'Harry's at the Waldorf). I took a peek in the ballroom and it is amazing (film fans will recognise it from 'Wall Street' starring Michael Douglas and Charlie Sheen!) All in all a great stay and would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “New York what a wonderful town!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver07
Reviews.Content: We flew into New York - JFK - just after the snow fall on March 16th. We arrived on St. Paddy's day - or really in the early morning of March 18th. It was cold - much colder than the West coast of Canada! At 1 am - we walked into the lobby of the Roosevelt Hotel and went 'WOW' . The lobby is spectacular in a traditional , comfortable, old world way. We arrived amid a group of travellers from France and through the hub bub were booked into a room. It was the wrong room - we had booked a superior double to accommodate the three of us and instead found ourselves looking at one king bed. It was so late and we were too tired to try to sort things out - so we managed to get a cot for the night from a very helpful floor manager. The next morning our accommodation was sorted out with the help of the friendly desk staff. Our New York adventure had begun! We found the room spacious, clean, with very comfortable double beds. The ensuite was small but how long does one want to spend in a bathroom!!! The three of us found it large enough to come and go with ease! We even had a walk in closet. Upon our return every evening the beds were made, the pillows plumped and the room a perfect temperature. We read the reviews of others prior to our trip and were a litle apprehensive - but we did not encounter any difficulties - the elevators worked wonderfully - perhaps with some congestion near check out time - but that is too be expected - it is a huge facility!! We had after dinner drinks in the comfortably appointed bar - relaxed in the soft chairs in the lobby and enjoyed the ambience of the grand dame of New York!! It was close to Times Square, to Grand Central Station, the doormen were always ready to lend a helping hand and the concierge had a wealth of New York information. We spent a wonderful 5 nights in the city with great comfort at the end of each day. I would recommend this hotel - and have already done so - to everyone we know. It is a lovely and welcoming hotel a perfect cap to our first New York adventure.

Reviews.Title: “COLD but COMFY”
Reviews.Author: Jacck
Reviews.Content: Just returned fron New York - Very cold but very enjoyable - Hotel perfect location across the street from Grand Central Station and just 4 blocks from Times Square. Very impressive lobby - Staff were quick helpful and curteous - Lift a bit bizzare - Rooms cosy with the comfiest bed you`ll ever sleep on - Room heater a bit strange to control but you got used to it. Perfect for a short stay and I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MaiaB
Reviews.Content: Visited New york in late February 2007. My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt for three nights and got a good deal on the hotel website. Since there were no available king-bed rooms, we were upgraded to a superior room with two double beds for free. When we saw the size of the room we were glad we were upgraded - pretty typical small New York hotel room, but it was big enough for us. The room was very nice and clean with soft, comfy beds. The only downside to our stay was the room service. We like to get room service whenever we go to a nice hotel, but although the service was good, the food itself was mediocre at best. There are many ads for the hotel food in the room and the hotel itself, so we expected much better, especially for the very high prices ! Other than that, the location can't be beat - a few blocks to Grand Central and to Times Square. We would stay there again, but without the room service.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, but not a great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: travel123Boston
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference, and stayed here. It was clean, no doubt about it, but my wife and I decided to stay at the Roosevelt rather than at the Yale Club or one of the other clubs because we were expecting something larger than a shoebox -- which one expects to a certain extent at the clubs. Boy were we wrong. Not only was the room tiny, but the furniture had been arranged in such a way as to minimize the available space. At $250/night, we also expected more than a shower stall. The common/lobby areas were great, the service was fine, and the location worked for our purposes. I just don't think we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: katecarrins
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt hotel was fantastic! The location of this Hotel is exceptional, 10 minutes walk from Times Square and only a few blocks from other major attractions. The Hotel itself was great, the staff were very friendly and all very helpful. The rooms are fairly small but you do not need a big room on a city break....we hardly spent any time in our room at all! The beds are the crowning glory of this hotel, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! I would definately recommend the Roosevelt and we will definately stay here next time we visit New York!

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt - The Best - Nobody Could Really Find Fault!”
Reviews.Author: wanderingirl
Reviews.Content: excellent location - and i am not a walker but its the best ive ever come across. concierge, and bell boys are excellent - you dont have to lift a bag. lobby very relaxing and you are only 5 mins from anywhere. nothing to really complain about for the average traveller - just a note to be wary of bar and room service prices.

Reviews.Title: “if you like walking”
Reviews.Author: DublinSky
Reviews.Content: great location its about a 30 minute walk to times square but you get lost very easy. the rooms are very small and staff arent dat nice on the front desk but the bell boys are lovely and very helpful and dont use the hotel phone for calling home i was down €200 for 20 mins calling ireland beds a lovely 3 people could fit into dem bathroom tiny and safe didnt work so i had to lock my suitcases with my money in them because i wouldnt trust the staff to put it in the safe, if you dont mind walking to get food and cheap shopping den stay here but it is near all major locations cristler building, empire state and its near the bus stops for the tour new york buses if i was to go again i'd stay somewere else.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Manc.girlManchester
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is in a great location, very close to Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, Broadway and very close to Grand Central Station - very handy for the subway. The bedroom was spotlessly clean and the beds were huge and very comfortable. Only downside to the bedroom was a small bathroom (perfectly clean, lovely towels and toiletries) and a tiny closet. The staff were supberb. Look out for Tomas in the dining room at breakfast and Hateem in the restaurant/bar. Both geat people and so friendly. Could not do enough for us. All the staff were polite and very attentive. The breakfast choice is extensive (perhaps a bit pricey) with lots of choice and you could go all day after eating all that is on offer! The bar has a nice cosy feel to it and very welcoming after a long day exploring New York. Bar prices are higher than outside but that is to be expected I suppose. Did not eat in the bar but the menu looked appealing. Had dinner in the restaurant 2 nights. The menu was ok and the food was excellent. Very well presented and well served by friendly staff. We hadn't intended to eat dinner in the hotel but it was so good,we couldn't be bothered to look elsewhere! All in all it was a great few days. We have stayed at this hotel several times and always enjoyed it, but this time was the best!! I never understand why it is not mentioned more often on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality New York hotel”
Reviews.Author: WappingViisitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for 3 nights at the end of February. New York was extremely cold but I have to say that our stay at the Roosevelt was very good indeed. It is very well located for shopping and the sights. As previous reviewers have said the lobby is spectacular. We were given a twin room (with 2 incredibly comfortable 5ft beds) at the front of the hotel on the 3rd floor. The room was a good size for New York and while the bathroom was a little small it suited its purpose (how long do you want to stay in a bathroom anyway!). I can't understand the complaints about the evevators, they worked perfectly well for us. The room was clean but maybe just showing age a little but still very comfortable and warm. The staff were very polite and accommodating and the Starbucks in the lobby in the morning is an excellent innovation. You simply have to try the 20 layer pancake dessert with seasonal berries its spectacularly yummy. This is a good hotel, well up to standard and we would certainly stay there again without any hesitation

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: LondonSh
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 15th February to some of the coldest tempretures I have ever experienced (-20 centigrade with the wind chill)! On arrival at the hotel found the staff to be very helpfull and polite. Had a room allocated on the 18th floor (one of the few smoking ones!). Room was a petite double and while it was small it had all that you would need and was warm even though the heater had two tempretures, cold and hot! However we did expierience a problem with the shower as the tempreture would not adjust from either cold or scalding hot, we did report this but nothing seemed to happen at first. eventually the maitenance manager came to the room to show us how to work the shower! He did agree in the end that there was a problem (and apparently in most rooms on the 18th) with the water tempreture. to this end he got us moved to a double room on the 10th floor with no extra charge, the hotel also gave us a free breakfast for the upheavall of moving. Apparently there are 273 Starbucks in New York and you have one in the hotel bar area, great if you dont want to go out first thing however this is only open from 7-11am , but with a branch 100 yards up the road its not a problem if you want a late night one to take back to the hotel, which they dont mind, well they never chalenged us on it and plenty of people were bringing drinks in. Location of this hotel is great, about a 10 minuite walk to Times Square and again a 2 minuite walk to Grand Central Terminal. 5th ave is just 5 minuites walk away where you will ceratanly shop till you drop! However on the subject of shopping the Woodbury Common shopping outlet is a MUST. You can get a bus from the port authority bus terminal on 8th ave which will take you directly there (journey time is roughly 1 hour). once there you would not belive the prices, Timberland boots $59.99 (current exchange to uk 30.00!) all the big names are there and you will not get stuff as cheap as this in the city, even in the big stores like Bloomingdales and Macy's. The ticket does cost $39.99 each to get there but the savings far out weigh this, people who were in the know (who must have been before) took empty cases with them! The concierge in the hotel will book tickets for this trip for you. We will return to NYC soon, with a spare case (Virgin alow you to check 2 bags for each pasenger up to 23kg each even when flying economy) and for location will probably stop at the roosavelt.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Harrison
Reviews.Content: Even in the so called dead week of early February, even in the coldest temperatures for years, it was a challenge to find a hotel to match our usual requirements in New York for less than a King's Ransom. So, not boutique, not chic, but it turns out that the Roosevelt is a very pleasant establishment in what turns out to be an excellent central location - 2 minutes from 5th Avenue. The room wasn't enormous, the bathroom was a bit of a squeeze and the heater was either noisily melting us or off altogether. Due to a nasty bout of food poisoning picked up in Mexico, we didn't get out much to sample the cuisine of NYC, but did try a number of dishes from room service (safer to be close to a bathroom when you're stuggling to hold your water!). The food was OK, not spectacular and quite expensive, but it didn't make us any worse. Would we stay there again? Maybe, if push came to shove, but it wasn't a 'special' stay like they sometimes can be. Coming from the great service of Mexico to a check in clerk who didn't even grunt at us reminded us instantly that we were in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic -as ever !”
Reviews.Author: SarahAustralia
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at The Roosevelt and, as on previous visits, we were not disappointed. Our room was one of the smaller ones on the 16th floor but was very clean and had a good sized bathroom. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The bar staff, in particular, were unbelieveably lovely and even remembered who we were from our previous visits. We cannot recommend this hotel enough - even though we have stayed four times - each time has been very enjoyable and we would not hesitate to return again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WelshladyChloe
Reviews.Content: Just returned today Saturday February 17th 2007. Excellent location; friendly helpful staff; plenty of lifts - didn't have to wait long at all! Surprised that our room - which was described as petite - was more than adequate for us. Abundance of fresh towels, toiletries and daily change of bed linen. Having travelled extensively to USA during the last 20 years; this hotel is certainly one we will return to without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: cleine
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a 3 night stay in the hotel, I found the reception staff very unhelpfull and not pleasant. I had to ask twice for directions for my hotel room. I requested a low floor, and was given a room on the 15th floor. The carpet in the hall was unkept. Room service outside various rooms (breakfast dishes) greeted me all the corridor to my room, I arrived after 4 in the afternoon. My bedroom was a standard room - it was clean and the bed was very comfortable, but very small, the bathroom had no bath, just a shower which was powerful and plenty of hot water, I was at the front of the hotel and for the 3 nights i was there, an alarm went off for about ten minutes at 3am and 6am, even on the 15th floor - I could hear the busy traffic outside. The room heated up really quickly when you turned it on, it was loud for a couple of minutes and was fine after that. The location was great. Lots of lovely restaurants nearby. We had a few drinks in the loddy area, bad experience!!!!, paid the waiter 50 dollars for two drinks that should have cost 20 dollars - he never returned with our change. Very annoyed, made a complaint.. but as he never gave us a receipt we had no proof.. The customer doesn't seem a priority in the hotel. Had the same frostly reception at check out. No help with luggage at all. Probably wouldn't stay there again but it certainly didn't ruin my new york experience...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC!!!”
Reviews.Author: AdamSAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly, based on reading some reviews, I had a great stay. The hotel has been renovating room by room, so I understand I may have gotten lucky with mine. Ask for room 412. Large room, 2 double beds, bathroom was probably 6 by 4, which is fine. I've stayed at some dumps in NYC, and this was not one of them. The bedding and linens were almost brand new. It defintely felt good to go back to the room and crash. I liked the fact that the bar was always crowded from 5pm - midnight, every night. The bar and lobby are really nice. Lots of marble. Checkin and checkout took about 2 mins each. Great location too on 45th and Madison. overall, it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolAlison
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel great location. stayed for 4 nights room smalleven though we had upgraded to a superior would not like to see the standard room. would stay again

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: kavatee
Reviews.Content: I have to start by saying that I am not a picky traveller. I expect rooms to be safe and clean, and the people to be helpful and friendly to guests. Hotel Roosevelt failed in all of these catagories. I stayed here for the NY gift show. The front desk people were unresponsive and had a bad attitude in general. No box for internet access in the room when I arrived, and so I called down for one. When I told them there was no box in the room the person told me to get on my knees and look under the bed. Took a good hour for someone to come up w/ the box. Not enough electrical outlets in a room that is supposed to cater to business travellers (I have a cell and a laptop) so I called down for a power strip and they bring me an extension cord instead. Had to unplug the clock for my laptop and charge up my phone in the BATHROOM. There was a bulb that was out in the room, I notified the front desk and it was changed the next day. When I came back to the room the lamp was left on and the new bulb was too big for the lamp and was SCORCHING THE LAMPSHADE. I asked the front desk for a trash can for the bathroom for three days in a row, to no avail. The heater was impossible to callibrate and so I had to choose sahara desert heat or an amazing wintery draft from the window. The heater also made a lot of noise. All of this and the most ridiculously slow/broken elevators I have ever experienced. As I was checking out, one guest was so frustrated she took a stack of comment cards and was handing them out to other frustrated guests at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with need of a Few Small Improvements”
Reviews.Author: lalovesny
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked 3 rooms here the last week of January. I was extremely impressed with the beauty of this hotel. The rooms were quite large (we reserved Superior rooms) and the lobby, bar, and floor lobbies were so nice. Bathrooms were a little dated and could use a refresh and the ac/heat unit continually sounded like it had pigeons flying around in them. :) HOWEVER, the entire group continually commented on how incredibly comfortable the beds were. They really were so comfy. If you are looking for a nice hotel with SUPER beds, this is it. The only hotel that beats this one for bed comfort is the Ritz and it is $500 per night! The location is super as well, there is an entrance to Grand Central Station directly across the street. Tony, the Doorman, is an incredible asset to this hotel and does all he can to ensure you have a cab immediately. One of the guests in our party ended up having to see the hotel doctor and briefly had to go to the hospital. They recieved no less than three followup calls from the hotel staff to see how they were doing. Very impressive. The only thing about this hotel that I would recommend you prepare for is the sometimes on/sometimes off service staff in the rooms/front desk and restaurant. On Thursday night the folks across the hall from us had room service and their dirty dishes stayed in the hallway until Friday night when we actually removed the tray ourselves as it was stinking up the hall. The maids also left our dirty glasses in the room all weekend. I don't see how they clean the rooms and just walk past all this stuff. The staff of the restaurant (servers) appeared to be aggravated when we would request water for our table or refills. Also, the hotel charges a "Gratuity Service Fee" that was explained later as a fee to literally sit in the restaurant. It was explained to me as I was having it removed from my bill by the manager. The front desk staff were nice when we arrived, but when we were checking out we were treated horribly by a man at the desk. We requested to be assisted by the manager since this man was obviously not interested in addressing our needs. The doormen, cooks, concierge, barstaff, and bellhops at this hotel were TERRIFIC. I totally recommend this hotel if you can get a special rate as we did (average $155 per night). I do not recommend paying the rack rates for this hotel as things like the poor service cut deeper when you pay over $250 for a hotel. If this hotel can work on its service personnel and revamp the bathrooms it would definitely qualify as a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: christineb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay in the Roosevelt Hotel. We carried our own bags into the lobby and were not hassled by the bellboys. There were 3 receptionists at check-in and we were seen immediately. There was a mix-up with our booking but straight away the receptionist assured us there would not be a problem. Although it took her about 5 minutes to sort everything out, she kept us informed the whole time and even admitted it was the hotel’s fault. This impressed us as all too often people will often try to blame others. We were given the choice of 1 or 2 beds. We took the lifts to the 12th floor and did not have to wait at all. In fact during the whole of our stay we found the lifts to be quick - I don't know why other people have found it such a problem. Considering the hotel has over 1,000 rooms I was amazed we didn’t have to wait longer than a minute or so at any time. Our room was approximately 16ft x 13ft with a 6ft wide bed in the middle. The mattress (Serta) was indeed every bit as comfortable as previous reviewers have stated. Personally I think a clean room and a comfortable bed is more important than a huge room. Other people have mentioned peeling wallpaper but although our room was a little "tired" it was certainly not scruffy. It was extremely cold outside whilst we were there, minus12 degrees centigrade on one of the days, but the room was always very warm. The bathroom was small but not uncomfortably so. There were plenty of towels and toiletries and masses of hot water with a powerful shower. OK, so the bath isn’t huge, but it was nice to soak in after a day’s hard walking. (Would have been even better if the plug had fitted and the water didn’t constantly drain away.) The room was at the back of the hotel and the view was just other hotel rooms, but the window was double-glazed and noise was minimal. The hotel does not provide drinks making facilities but does provide an iron/board and electronic safe which is extremely useful. Our safe mal-functioned one evening and a member of staff appeared within 20 minutes of our telephone call to sort it out. The hotel has internet facilites for a small charge, which we took advantage of to check-in for our return flight. It is also possible to leave your luggage on your last day – don’t forget to tip the bellboy!! We did not eat at the hotel as it was expensive but there are plenty of pubs nearby or Grand Central Station (fantastic building) has plenty of eating options. As nearly every reviewer has stated the location is perfect (unless you want to be on top of Times Square). It doesn’t take long to walk a few blocks and there are plenty of diners etc – although we ate every morning at the Red Flame Diner on 44th Street – address 67W 44th between 5th & 6th Avenue and can highly recommend it for good food and fast service. We thoroughly enjoyed the whole of stay in New York and found everyone we came into contact with, very polite and friendly. The comfort and location of the Roosevelt contributed to making our stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: lizzyOxford
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! After reading mixed reviews my husband and I were slightly apprehensive - especially considering the bargain price we had paid. On entering the Lobby our jaws dropped, it was truly stunning, a real jaw dropper! Very 1920's! Felt like a mini Waldorf! The staff were so welcoming and efficient and very accommodating as to our room preference (on a lower floor). The room was lovely too with the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in. The room was not overly big but spotlessly clean and cosy with all the usual requirements i.e t.v, safe in room (free) and fresh fluffy towels changed daily. The hotel's bar and restaurants were lovely and were always busy. But, the BEST thing about the Roosevelt is the location. We didn't have to get taxis anywhere, turn left and about five blocks and you are in times square, turn right and two blocks and you are at the waldorf, two block further on and you are on 5th avenue leading to central park. We have visited NY many times but this was the best location. We have already re-booked for xmas.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Giovanna7
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Roosevelt for several years now during the Christmas holidays. We love the holiday decorations in the lobby and the old world feel that it projects. However, this year we found the rates to be much higher and the value much less. The location is conveniently located, but the rooms are in dire need of refurbishing. We were informed by the Front Desk Clerk that the hotel mangement does not acknowledge its loyal-return guests with any type of complimentary fruit basket, or flowers, etc. The Roosevelt Hotel attempts to project "old world" accommodations, but its Management Staff is very lax in projecting or recognizing "old world" hospitality and manners. If a guest chooses to return to a hotel property year after year, it should be appreciatively acknowedged by the hosting General Manager.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: walkerWirral
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last week with our 2 girls 13 and 11. We really couldnt fault the hotel, it exceeded our expectations. We were greeted by the staff outside who saw our bags to the room and walking into the hotel we were amazed by the most beautiful foyer we had ever seen. Ok the rooms are not on the huge side but they were clean and the beds fantastic. The hotel is in the heart of Manhanhattan and within walking distance of all the main attractions. Grand Central Station is a 2 min walk. All in all I would definately recommend this hotel for service and location and we would definately return. Oh and it snowed too which made it even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Vichar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location only a short walk over to Times Square and down to Grand Central station. We arrived late afternoon and had the Bell Captain whisk our bags away quicker than you can blink - being Aussies though and a bit nervous with the tipping we only tipped him $2 as we were also trying to check in and my partner noticed him motion to the bell boy who had taken over our bags that we only gave him $2 - I know they "survive" on their tips but no need to be rude if someone doesn't give you enough. Check-in staff were friendly and informative. Lifts at the property were old and very very very slow. For a place with 6 lifts there only seemed to be 2 working and as we stayed on the 5th floor - everytime we tried to go down the lift was always full and we generally had to wair for a 2nd lift before we could squeeze in. The room we were given was small and you could barley swing a cat in there - the bathroom was even smaller and the amenities were basic for a 4 star property - depsite that the rooms were clean and the bed was totally comfortable. We did notice one really disgusting thing - there were quite a few groups and families staying here and someone in a room right near the lift had left their babies dirty nappie rolled up in a ball outside their door - quite foul to see!!! Would probably not stay there again as I'm sure there a re heaps more hotels in NY that could offer just as mediocre rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds!!”
Reviews.Author: ArgyllGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt last weekend and have to say how fabulous the hotel was. The entrance & the lobby are just stunning, a real feeling of old age hospitality when you walk through the door and the staff in general were really helpful. (only exception the female guest relations who when told my friend & i weren't loaded, proceeeded to tell us just to have a walk and we would be able to find somewhere, she only knew the smarter places! - just to indicate, my friend & I had a budget of $50-75 each for dinner, so not exactly looking for a Burger King!) The rooms were great, was sharing with a friend, so had a double double, which was a nice treat compared to the single beds in the UK. But the best thing about the rooms, was single handedly the beds! They were incredible, best hotel beds I have slept in (and talking to other guests in the bar, they were in complete agreement!) Would definitely go back (oh yes, the location is pretty fab too!)

Reviews.Title: “I agree --great deal”
Reviews.Author: pjl52
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt at the end of December. They run a "early bird promotion" (reserving some days in advance) which I took advantage of.$159+ tax for a pleasant room with a fantastic free buffet breakfast. I have stayed at the Waldorf and cannot say it was better, just more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt is getting tired”
Reviews.Author: MAArlington
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is in a great location with a nice lobby and pretty chandeliers but the condition of the sleeping rooms is outdated and shabby. It took too long to check in (one person was on duty which is ridiculous for such a large hotel). I was then sent to a room that was not too clean, lots of paint peeling in the bathtub, a lampshade with a huge burn mark on it, a lock ripped off the door, etc. I called to complain and ask for another room. They gave me a room that was cleaner with a bigger bathroom and no paint peeling but still pretty tired. A bottle of wine, paper plates and half-full wine glasses in the hallway were there when I checked in at 2 in the afternoon and were still there when I checked out the next morning. The hotel isn't awful, and they did agree to move me into a new room, but I would definitely think twice before staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, outstanding location. Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: traveler747
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for the money -- business or vacation; and the convenience to Grand Central Station cannot be overstated. The hotel rooms were clean and big. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room heating is a little overactive, but opening the window solved the problem. The Roosevelt web site has a guarantee that if you can find a better web price for their room, the hotel will match the deal and take off 10%. I found a better deal, and the Roosevelt kept its word adjusting the reservation price. Having stayed in a dozen or so NYC hotels, this is my #1 pick.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt - Great Location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TXHoosier
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a lovely restored historic hotel located in great proximity to almost everything in NYC. Grand Central station (and subway system) was about 1 block. Shopping and restaurants were very accessible. The hotel sits on the corner of 45th and Madison Avenue. We walked almost everywhere. We found the hotel staff extremely accomodating. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant because the prices were quite high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: HaagseBluf
Reviews.Content: Somewhat thrown off by the reviews on Tripadvisor (which we, of course, read after booking) we arrived at the hotel openminded. And we were not disappointed...Granted, the rooms are not immense, the windows are not too big, there are no picturesque city views and everything has that aura of lost splendour (yes, the baths too). But it is still a splendid hotel on an excellent location, courteous staff with New York humor and an impressive lobby. If you know where to look, you can find a good deal and have a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: sweetgracie
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a trip to NYC and a three night stay at the Roosevelt Hotel. It exceeded all of my expectations! The lobby was magnificent, the rooms were perfect, the bedding was divine, and the bathroom was spotless. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking to most everything that we did. Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park were all within easy walking distance. We ate once at the restaurant in the hotel-it was expensive but it was delicious. Honestly, I just can't say enough good about this hotel. You will not be disappointed with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: MightyredEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 3 years ago and i had a good time but since then the reviews have really started going downhill. Was staying the week before christmas so was a bit apprehensive when i got there, thinking how busy the hotel was going to be and would the be able to look after me. However the reception was brilliant and the christmas tree so inviting that the place couldn't be that bad... could it ? The receptionist was nice and i got a room on the 5th floor, smallish bath and a small tv but the bed was huge, and the mattress was so soft yet comfy. Of all the things i wanted to bring back home, the mattress was the thing. For my 5 nights there, the room was freshly cleaned everyday and there were lots of channels on the tv. It was quiet and i was near the stairs but never heard anything, either outside or from my neighbours. I think there most be some poor rooms in the hotel and maybe its just pot luck what you get when you arrive but for me, i enjoyed the Roosevelt and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “wish my experience was like the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: ireland2dublin
Reviews.Content: I wish our experience was like the other reviews on this site but we ended up having a bad experience of the roosevelt. We arrived after an overnight flight to be met by the rudest, most unfriendly staff i have ever experienced. They never said hello or welcomed us to the hotel. They informed us that they only had a smoking room and not the non-smoking room we had requested. We were tired after the flight so accepted it. When we saw the room i was shocked as i didnt think rooms like this existed in 3/4 star hotels. It was the smallest room i have ever seen with a tiny window which was taken up by a loud air conditioning unit. We asked to be changed and were moved to another room which was slightly bigger but was in poor condition ie bath peeling, wallpaper ripped. Overall i feel that although the hotel is in an excellent position for sightseeing, it does need modernisation and if you dont mind sleeping in a box may be a good choice for New York. But there are plenty of better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “No prob with Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: bacfire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt the weekend of 15th-18th Dec. The hotel was excellent, we had a superior room on the 6th floor and it was wonderful. Although we didn't spend much time at the hotel, we tried to see and as much as we could over the weekend, it was good to know that we had a nice place to rest our weary heads. The best place to eat if you are looking for relatively cheap is the dining concourse at Grand Central station. There is a huge selection to choose from and the station itself has some great little bakeries and coffee shops. We ate well, and pretty cheaply. Overall the Roosevelt is a great place to stay, its central to pretty much everything, safe area, and I loved the revolving doors!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if you get a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: silverwatch
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple age 30, not picky and fairly easy to please. We stayed at the Roosevelt weekend of Dec 15-17, 2006. We paid a phenomenal rate of $129/night, found through their website, only available for a limited time. In New York, that price usually gets you a shared bath room in a sketchy hotel. But we could tell that at the Roosevelt we just lucked out price-wise. We got the bottom of the line room, and it was fine! The bed was comfortable, the room and bathroom were clean. Lots of water pressure and hot water. Room was always warm, even a bit too warm. Bath & Bodyworks bathroom products were provided (bar soaps, shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, lotion). We didn't have a view at all, but no biggie. The entrance/lobby are impressive. The location is great. Getting a cab was usually hard to do in this busy part of town. The staff were OK. Nothing outstanding. They have to deal with the same elevator problems as everyone else at checkout time. We had to carry our luggage down the stairs to the lobby at checkout (all elevators were full). Then we had to carry our luggage back up to the 2nd floor to check it for the day. The restaurant is so-so. For dinner, the presentation of the food was much better than the actual taste. Quite expensive for the quality. They have a large breakfast buffet but it runs $28. Eggs, bacon, omelets, fruit, etc. Did have to request my juice 3 times when they were busy. Worth it to us only because it was right downstairs, and we are lazy. All in all, totally a bargain at the $129 rate. However, not really worth the rack rate of $409. At that rate we would have rather stayed at a more modern boutique hotel, or a place with more friendly attentive staff. Couldn't have found a better place for $129 in NYC for the holidays though!

Reviews.Title: “Classy stay at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: flyred
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night stay at the Roosevelt after reading other reviews, have to say from check-in to check-out it was fab. Our room on the tenth floor was spacious, spotlessly clean and the bed was amazing. We never ate breakfast at the hotel as it seemed quite pricy but there is a deli acrosss the road which does great food all day. The bar is very cosy with its leather slouchy chairs and fireplace. The staff were very helpfull and courtious, no problems getting a late checkout, or getting bags looked after until evening after checking out. Looking forward to next trip to NY to stay at The Roosevelt again!

Reviews.Title: “This is the one!”
Reviews.Author: Elgirl
Reviews.Content: This is the one to stay in if you are visiting New York for sight seeing, shopping and just a pleasant break away. The hotel was great and far exceeded my expectations (especially after reading some of the poor reviews beforehand, which is why I feel compelled to write this review). Our room was a superior room and the matresses and bed linen were all new, I have never slept so well. A tip may be to ask for a superior room in a quite location in the hotel but I quickly got used to the noise-it is New York after all! The hotel foyer was gorgeous, as was the bar and great for people watching. The service was great too. Our only issue if we had an issue, is that we had to tip three times to get our luggage from our room to our taxi via the luggage storage on the day we were leaving. The bell boy made it rudely clear he expected more money for this errand, but we did have to tip three times and carried some of the lighter bags ourselves while he had the rest on the trolley! The location of the hotel is perfect, on the corner of Madison avenue and 45th st,a stroll from 5th Avenue and the Rockefeller centre and a comfortable walk to Times Square. Who could ask for more? I would definitely stay here again, very comfortable-looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: simonmiles
Reviews.Content: We arrived late after a long trip, and they had not allocated us our room. No real problems as we were upgraded for the night to a suite, and they were very sorry. We went for a deluxe room which I would definately recommend for space as ours was great. Staff were great, lifts dont take as long as everybody had been reviewing, so dont worry too much and the location is perfect. All in all a very good NY hotel...does everything it says on the tin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WL104AMA10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rooservelt at 1pm on the 18th Nov 2006(6 of us) the rooms were not ready. Told to come back at 2pm still not ready. We were given a voucher to have a drink on them and we did (best glass of wine I've had in a long time). 2.30pm rooms ready one couple are smokers and were given a smoking room on the 18th floor lovely large room two windows (to get rid of the smoke I guess) and great views out of the windows. 2nd Couple had a room on 17th floor this consisted of a sitting room and a bed room 2TV's 2A/C units 2 windows. Only complaint with this room was a little hot and you could hear a little building work outside.otherwise excellent. Our room was on the 7th Floor and was slightly smaller than the other two but again a very comfortable room one window. No complaints at all. The Roosevelt is in an absolutly great spot for most of the sites and if we return to New York we will stay here again. All 6 of us would recommend this Hotel. Our rooms were the next upgrade from their basic room and would recommend you pay that little bit extra. 6Tripadvisers from Cheltenham England. Don't forget to book on line with the Hotel (Airlinenetwork were going to charge us £200 per couple more)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: tippee
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews I was more than a little nervous about our impending stay .........but worried unneccessarily. We arrived at around 7pm on a busy Friday night and were met by a very pleasant doorman who offered to take our bags or gave us the option of the lift to the lobby. We took the lift option and the doors opened out onto the beautiful marble lobby. We got checked in very quickly and went to our room where we met the only glitch!. It was tiny and apparently a superior ( although I believe most NY hotel rooms are like this). Our friends travelling with us had a room with two double beds and considerably larger, we rang down and a few minutes later a bell boy arrived with a new key for a new room, all was well. Large room two double beds, standard bathroom and very clean. The air conditioning unit was a little noisy but wouldn't keep you awake, It was unseasonably mild for November so it was needed. The lift situation is true, you can really wait a good 5+ mins to get one and then it could be full! but it was part of the charm and everybody took it in good humour The bar is expensive but then it is a hotel bar in the middle of Manhatten!! The bar serves coffees, danishes etc for breakfast or alternatively there is a great place just up from the hotel on the corner ( can't remember the name) The location is second to none, directly opposite an entrance to Grand Central, 10 min walk to times square, 5 mins to Rockefeller centre & 5th Avenue. We stayed 4 nights in the Roosevelt and found all the staff friendly and very helpful. It was our first time in New York and we can't wait to go back and will definately stay in The Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, good service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Queen_of_NW2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very pleasant 4-night stay at the Roosevelt, travelling with my four-month old daughter. I had no problems checking in early, and was given a wheelchair-accessible room with a king-sized bed on the 12th floor. The room was large by New York standards, and we had no problem putting the hotel's cot in a corner of the room. I had stayed at the Roosevelt a few years previously, and I know not all the rooms are as large. Since I was attending a conference there, I arranged two days of babysitting via the hotel with the Babysitter's Guild. It wasn't cheap at $25 per hour, but I had no qualms leaving the baby in the nanny's care. Toiletries were adequate, the shower powerful, so no complaints there. Indeed, no complaints at all, and a pleasant surprise was the quality of the room service dinner I had one night. I ordered the classic club sandwich with the soup of the day, which turned out to be a homemade corn chowder rivalling my grandfather's recipe. Buffet lunch at the conference on site was also superior finger food, and the buffet breakfast was copious. My company negotiated a rate of $279 plus tax - don't know if that's competitive, but I certainly felt a fair price paid for what we got. And don't forget the great location, stumbling distance to all sorts of lovely shops on 5th Ave, Grand Central Station, etc. All staff extremely helpful. If travelling with my family to New York, would put hand in my own pocket and go to the Roosevelt again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hmayne
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Roosevelt for the week before Christmas 2005 and loved it! After a long and eventful trip (eg no lugagge on arrival) we were delighted that check in was quick and extremely simple. On arrival to our room on the sixteenth floor we were pleasantly surprised, having only paid £600 ($1050) for the room through Octopus Travel, we weren't expecting lavish, but I think we got more than our moneys worth. Huge and sooo comfortable bed, plenty of room, heater that worked very well, and a clean bathroom. Throughout our stay the room and bathroom were cleaned and tidied brillantly, bed beautifully made and clean towels daily. We were unlucky enough to be in New York during the transit strike, but the hotel kept us well informed and the staff were able to make it to work, did a fantastic job and must have worked from dawn til dusk as the hotel and our room remained spotless. We only ate dinner and breakfast in the hotel once but the food was great. The breakfast buffet had a huge selection and should be more than enough for anybody! The hotel bar also has a lovely atmosphere and is great to chill out in after a heavy days shopping! I think all the photos of the lobby speak for themselves, it really is beautiful, and seeing it at Christmas only accentuated that. Every evening of our stay there was a complimentary warming drink (egg nog, warm apple cider) and biscuits available in the lobby for guests to take to their rooms. I really couldn't fault the hotel on their service; they really look after their guests. Other reviews state that it is noisy and you can hear traffic, but it is New York what do you expect!!? If you want peace and quiet go to a different city never mind a different hotel! We would definitely stay with The Roosevelt again, central to everything and a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Peasant”
Reviews.Author: bklp
Reviews.Content: A stay at such a swank hotel should have been an awesome experience. Maybe it is all of New York (flash the cash) impressing man is not my idea of having fun. "overly priced from room to lounge drinks" Courtesy and Kindness is so much better, I didn't ask hotel to arrange for my transportation to L.G.A so why would they ask to help with my bags when private owned agency came and didn't help either? Sad experience but a whole lot wiser!!

Reviews.Title: “Expect the Older Hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: Armorstud
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is too big to get the personal touch feel. Like most older hotels, the rooms are small along with the bathrooms. They try to make it look good by sprucing up the beds. Rooms were average in the clean area. It is priced fair for the expectations. I was here for a week conference. My history is staying at nice hotels such as the Four Seasons so I know nice hotels. Some foreigners might say good things but if you stayed in Europe, you will understand their taste.

Reviews.Title: “Total enjoyed the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: RubyWoo
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Roosevelt in October and had a great time. The hotel is at a great location. Just around the corner from shopping on 5th Ave and a few blocks from Times Square and yet just the right distance away from all the hoopla at Times Square. The staff was courteous and very helpful. Very helpful! If I need directions anywhere they were in the know. Our waiter at the Roosevelt Grill was so nice and very interesting to speak to. They were great. Rooms were small but we weren't in them very long. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CruiseKing
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel mainly because it has an entrance directly across the street from Grand Central Station and I was going to the US Open Tennis. Note: that entrance is only open during week day, but other entrance is only a couple blocks. Well, I'm so happy that I chose this property. Had a very nice room (Deluxe Queen) which had a seperate sitting area (couch, refrigerator, small desk, TV) from the bedroom area...which also had a TV. Nice sized room. I was supposed to have a King Bed, but upon seeing the room (it was bigger in floor space) I decided to stay with the Deluxe Queen cause of the extra sitting area & extra TV. The Breakfast Buffet they offer is absolutely incredible...the freshest fruit, eggs, omelets made to order, cereals, bagels w/ cream cheese & salmon, pastries, sausage, bacon, and tons of other items..... The Hotel Bar has 2 GREAT bartenders, Sal & Eddie, always friendly & very helpful with local info. Hotel Staff was GREAT...very accommodating....and hotel is a GRAND Hotel of the yesteryear....just lovely! Location is the best....short walks to lots.....only about 5-6 short blocks to Times Square, a couple blocks to 5th Ave shopping, a few blocks to the United Nations, a lovely walk to Rockefeller Center. Would definitely stay here again & again!!

Reviews.Title: “It could have been worse”
Reviews.Author: Clover57
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on the 15th December 2005 during the pouring rain. This was to be an 18th birthday present for our daughters and we had booked a room which would accomodate 4 adults. On arriving at the hotel we were told that the room was not available and would we mind an alternative. We immediately thought that this was going to be a distaster but we could not have been further from the truth. We were then given a suite which had two double beds, tv, table, chair and bathroom in one section and a second room which contained a dining table, chairs, sofas, fridge, 2nd tv, and 2nd bathroom. We were also sent a complimentary meal of fruit, cheese, biscuits and water. It could have been worse as we did check the rooms on our floor which looked small and cramped, but we more than happy with the room, staff, cleanliness and location of this hotel. I would be happy to return there again

Reviews.Title: “Easy and cosy”
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be helpful. Rooms were average but tidy and all my requests were listened. Hotel bar is ok and the lobby busy and nice. The location is suburb! I didn't have the breakfast in the hotel. Overall experience was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Lobby - Shame about the Room”
Reviews.Author: Monica_Innis
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 6 September with a friend for what was to be a 5 day shopping trip as a 21st birthday present for my daughter. Having looked at the Roosevelt on both the BA website and on the Expedia website, I thought it would do nicely as it was centrally located for our shopping needs. The first bad start was they didn't have my friend booked in as she had booked separately and was added on at a later date with British Airways but staying in the same room as myself and my daughter. We were told by British Airways that the rooms had two large double beds and could easily sleep 4 people and still have lots of space, so to cut down on cost - and more money for shopping - we kept the same room originally booked for 2. Eventually, the kind lady on reception booked us all in without any fuss especially as I had my receipt from BA adding an extra person to the booking. We were then taken to our room and what a disappointment. It was very small although it had 2 double beds and an armoire with the TV in, plus a desk in the corner and a table between the beds. Too cramped for 3 people. 2 would have managed but barely. There was no hanging space for clothes so we had to keep our clothes in our suitcases the entire trip. Luckily we didn't need to iron anything. The cupboard where the ironing board and safe was kept smelled damp and musty so we only opened it once and never again! The room was clean enough but the beds had no top covers (which were on order!) The bathroom was only big enough to swing a cat and there was no bath, only a shower cubicle which leaked everytime we took a shower and made the floor completely wet. We wore flip flops in the shower as it didn't look very clean to stand on. There was mould on the ceiling and around the tiled area. If you were a tall person, your legs would touch the door when you sat on the toilet!! Luckily we were not. The staff were very pleasant and friendly, especially Tony who does his best to get you a taxi if you need one. I have no complaints about them whatsoever. We didn't eat at the hotel as we were out mos of the time. We had a drink at the bar on our last day which seemed pricey and ordered room service of hot water to make some herbal teas (total cost of over $5!!) The Roosevelt should either upgrade their rooms or downgrade their star rating. The rooms that appear on the website are NOT the type of rooms that are allocated to you on arrival - where are these rooms and how do you get them? Do they even exist? For info, we were in room 555 (on the fifth floor). The windows could certainly do with a clean. Saying all of the above, we had a fantastic time in New York!! It was my daughter's first trip and she loved it and of course the shopping. I would definitely go again but would only consider the Roosevelt if the rooms were upgraded or you were actually told the type of room you would be staying in. Very misleading pictures on the websites of both Expedia and British Airways.

Reviews.Title: “be careful! .... these people took my money!”
Reviews.Author: Worldtime
Reviews.Content: July 3 2006.
