I ask for a reservation on their webpage with my credit card information NO REPLY July 5 I sent an e-mail asking about my reservation NO REPLY RESERVED IN ANOTHER HOTEL July 26 I receive an e-mail from the manager (Mr. Trovato) with a satisfaction survey??? July 26 I reply this person that I never stayed here that I was worried they would charge me. NO REPLY August They charged me $250, and I never stayed. American Express told me they are working on this situation because they affirm I did stay! These are crooks!

Reviews.Title: “One star would be a gift”
Reviews.Author: flterp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as I was attending some meetings here on Sept. 16, 2006. Checked in around 1:30 a.m. and after getting my key was asked by the bellman whether I wanted him to take my bag to the room. Interesting since it is on wheels and he didn't offer to help me lug it up the stairs from the street 10 minutes earlier. The room was so small that to walk between the bed and the TV I had to turn sideways. Since I was checking out in the morning and it was late I didn't change rooms. Had I been staying more then a night I would have. The bathroom was gross and the door to it didn't close. The air conditioning was good but loud. With the UN in session the place was crawling with security both inside and out. I wouldn't give this hotel consideration at any price. There are absolutely better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “A Shambles”
Reviews.Author: IrishMale
Reviews.Content: I went here with work earlier in the year. The room was an absolute disgrace. It was dirty, stuffy and had very old and noisy air con. The staff were rude, and they overcharged me for room service. I will most certainly not go back, as there are far better options available in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “On business but felt like a dorm room visit”
Reviews.Author: MemphisCPA
Reviews.Content: I was sent to New York for a training session for my job. The company had selected the Roosevelt as the "official hotel". Was someone getting paid off at my employer by the hotel? I would say that it was not worth the $199/night price tag for the following reasons: 1. The lobby was an obsolute sight to see. Grand is the first word that comes to mind. However, other words of a less kind nature describe what come to mind when you talk to the less-the-friendly staff at the bell station. The bell captain (bald, heavier set man) is so professional (?) that he comes off stand-offish and cold. My favorite staff experience was when I had to get my bags out of storage (I had to check out but wasn't leaving NYC until that afternoon). I had lost my house keys and has OBVIOUSLY freaking out. I gave my claim ticket to a bellman and I followed him to the storage room. He returned in a manner of say, 5 steps. As I frantically searched the bags I felt a overwhelming sense that the bellman was WAITING for a tip. Over the whole situation, I gave him $2 (too much as far as I am concerned) to which he left me....not even an offer to take my bags down the very long entry staircase to the street to get a cab, or even get my cab for that manner. Thanks, Bellman. 2. The room - Um, a dorm room might have been sexier. The kind size bed had been shoved into a room that was never designed for one. The armoire holding the TV had to be moved and put diagonally off to the side from it original position; otherwise, one would have to crawl over the bed to go from one side of the room to the other. AND, if it couldn't get better, the marking on the carpet to where the armoire once stood was still there. Um, hi housekeeping, could someone run a sweeper over this? And just to add insult to injury, the wallpaper there had begun to peel. I believe this little (and I repeat) little gem in Room 721.

Reviews.Title: “Watch it 'priceline' users !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: citizenoftheworld1
Reviews.Content: Summary: At the end of the day the experience was OK only because I “prayed for my life” at the reception and the nice lady gave us at the end a reasonable size room. How does it work at Roosevelt when you reserve a room through priceline “name your own price”: What they do to name your own price customers is that they give a very small, dark, shabby, and far from being renovated rooms, usually in a low floor, very noisy etc. These rooms are sold usually as a single room and they have twin size bed. The window will usually face a wall or low floor where you enjoy all the noise coming from the street. Since I arrived with small child I have called the hotel after my offer with priceline was accepted, to make sure that this is a reasonable size room. They say that the room is suitable for 2 (hardly for 2 very small people, after I saw it). But Roosevelt has an attractive offer for Name your own price users. If I want a bigger room (which is actually a standard double room sold on the hotel’s web site, expedia and even priceline’s web site when you pay full price of around $180-190 per night) you can pay extra $60 per night over what pricleine charges your credit card, which brings the total price per night to $185, much above what I would have paid for such an hotel. So I had 2 options – stay with the $125 per night I received from priceline for a twin bed small, dark & ugly room, or pay the $185 for standard room which is not really a good value for money (it cost about the same price on any web site without discounts or favors). Now what would you do??? Luckily enough as we were traveling with our 2 years old child, when I arrived to the Roosevelt at night with her screaming in my arms, the nice shift manager (a lady of course) felt so sorry for us that she upgraded us at no extra cost to a regular size room which was OK & good value for the $125 we have paid. I was lucky, but don’t count on it. Bottom line: 1.Good location. 2.Take it only if you don’t care about room size or look and only want to pay $120 for a hardly 3 stars hotel in mid Manhattan. 3.If you can spare extra $50 per night I would try the ‘name your own price” only for 4 star hotel and up. 4.Apparently 3 stars hotels in Manhattan are very likely to look like 1.5-2 stars anywhere else. 5.Don’t count on luck, most people fail where I was lucky… Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: unique72
Reviews.Content: Maybe we got the priceline room. We were not impressed at all. For the price, I expected much more. Room was small and the bathroom was small and very basic. The tub was in very poor condition. I think the tub was painted over, because white material was peeling away from the tub. I'd rather stay at a 1 or 2 star hotel before I put my money into this hotel again. It really felt like we were staying a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel like the Plague!”
Reviews.Author: JohnWBarry
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at this Hotel for 7 nights at the end of April 2006 and we would never stay there again. We had to struggle up 3 flights of stairs with heavy suitcases to get to the reception desk where the bellhops decend on you once you have done all the hard work The rooms were drab and dingy and the fabrics didnt look like they had been washed in years. The windows were dirty and the nets filthy. There was no decent lighting and the bathroom was very tiny. There was no vainty unit built around the wash basin, just a tiny shelf about 5inches in width that sloped forward so if you put anything on it it would slide off. We ended up putting some of our toiletries on top of the toilet. The bath used to take about 10 minutes to drain away as the drains didnt seem capable of taking the flow. The shower was ok with good presure and temperature. The air conditioning was noisy but as the weather was not too hot we didnt need to run it. But the worse part for me was the noise from the other guests. The walls are paper thin and even with ear plugs in I couldnt sleep till the guests next door had settled down for the night. If you are next to someone that likes to watch TV till late, forget sleep because you are going to be listening to it with them. All this is in contrast to the Exterior and the Lobby which look great as you enter. The room staff are friendly which is in contrast to the desk staff. We had to confirm our passage to the Airport by telephone the day before we were due to leave. The Receptionist picked up the phone to do it for us but as soon as she realised we were not using the hotel transport we were directed to a public phone in the lobby and told to ring ourselves.I cant think of many redeeming features about this place. Its the worse Hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lisagosling
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, Great Location. Problem Arose with Safe, which was dealt with above and beyond what was expected, to our benefit. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very OK”
Reviews.Author: taliza
Reviews.Content: Travel in july 2006 in very good average, specially for NY good size of room, clean even the bathroom very quiet hotel spectacular lobby, nice and efficient staff at the reception very good location: short walk for the main attraction of the city and to eat only one problem: we found, once, during the night ,a cockroach in the bathroom but during summer NYC is not clean so maybe this is not so strange there; we prefer to forget it Definitly return in winter and maybe in summer specially for the price payed: 165 euros for 2 double beds

Reviews.Title: “Cool place”
Reviews.Author: cheekyzippy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week- just got back two days ago! Was very apprehensive after reading some of the reviews here. But was very impressed upon arrival. The reception area is amazing. The staff were very friendly and the check in was quick. We had a superior room and it seemed a good size for two people. The TV had a number of channels - ESPN/CNN/TBS etc. Bathroom was very clean. Room was cool which was welcome in the sweltering New York heat! Daily we had a complimentary copy of USA today delivered to our room. Sheets were changed daily and the room was also cleaned. The hotel is in a wonderful location. For ladies, there is a J Crew and Nine West practically opposite! There are several eating places nearby for dinner and brunch. We did have breakfast and dinner a few times in the hotel. Food is very good, but a little bit on the pricy side. Mains and desserts for two cost around £45 - £50. Okay - maybe not in London, but certainly in NYC. In terms of tourist spots, the Roosevelt is close to the Empire State building by foot. Grand Central station is 5 minutes away. Not only are there great restaurants there, but gives you access to the city if required. Times Square is a 20- 25 minute walk at the most. The Rockerfeller Center is also about a 20 minute walk at the most. Wonderful in the summer and throughly recommend the restaurants there. I really hope you are visiting the Roosevelt you have a great stay like we did!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: Jesse Kumin
Reviews.Content: Priceline works well sometimes for hotels and other times it doesn't. I bid on a three star and Priceline put us into the Roosevelt, it feels more like a two. The public areas have a faded glamour that could pass as three star but our room was plain, modestly sized and without some of the extras I like: internet service, a small fridge and coffee/tea service. Net service is available in the room for another $15/day, but I shouldn't be nicked another $15 on top of what we paid (with a hefty discount off the rack rate) for a mediocre room. The basic room isn't available with a second bed for our son, so we were forced to upgrade to a "Superior" room at an added $60/night, $180 total. The second bed boosted our cost 50%/night. The dimly lit room had a desk and two chairs, a small closet, OK bath and was quiet (16th floor). The beds were comfortable. There's no pool. Everything was clean. The staff were courteous but very business like. It's a large impersonal hotel. The bar charges $10 for a glass of wine or a beer, but there are good, moderately priced restaurants one block away on the other side of Lexington. The location is excellent, less than a five minute walk from Grand Central and within walking distance of a lot of NYC attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a 3-Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru Priceline, and I know you get what you pay for. But qualifing this hotel as 3-Star is false advertising. It is tired, old and dark. One can see that in its day it was a beautiful hotel with classic features and a once- grand lobby. I didn't mind the small room with a view of a filthy, littered rooftop and brick walls, but the furniture was worn, and the room only marginally clean. I would give this hotel 2 stars at best. The staff was innefficient, appathetic and very aggressive about tipping. I am a generous tipper, but I do not like to feel pressured into tipping. When I cheked my bags with the bellman, he asked me when I would be returning. I told him 2 hours and he said-"When you return,SOMEONE ELSE will be here to get your bags, I will be gone. " I didn not tip him, especially since I had waited 15 minutes to hand him my bags. When I was leaving for the airport, another bellman, without asking, took my bags, carried them 2 feet closer to the curb and hailed a cab before I could do so myself. I did not tip him either, as I did not ask for nor need his assistance. As I was getting in to the cab he said sarcastically "Thanks- appreciate it."

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: FizzUk
Reviews.Content: There are good things and disappointing things to mention about this hotel. First the good: this is a beautiful grand hotel with an amazing reception (not sure where the statue of Theordore Rooselent is though, we couldn't spot it). The rooms are a decent size and nice and clean if not a little badly lit and dingey. It's situated in a good position for easy access to major tourist points. Now the downside: No coffee makers in the rooms and the only place you could get coffee/tea was at the bar (you were not allowed to be served coffee in the seated lounge area outside of the bar). For a 3 star hotel the drinks were expensive so we opted to drink elsewhere most of the time. The staff were all very professional and friendly apart from the receptionist in the Business Centre!! We have used this hotel on several occasions and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room at The Roosevelt Hotel for a week. When we arrived, we got our room, a little dark, due to the style of the room, but the room was large (about 18 square meters) cosy, and with two queen sized beds. The room was clean and was cleaned every day, with new towels, bed sheets etc. Only complaint about the room was the noisy aircondition, which could not be turned off. The bathroom had a good size and even with a bath tub. The staff at the hotels was extremely helpsome, with tips about the city and where to go shopping. The lobby was amazing, unfortunately to dark for pictures. We tried the resturant, excelent service, but a bit pricy, two persons, 200 dollars for entrees, desert and a bottle of wine. The food was excelent, except for the desert (why wasn't I warned about root beer and vanilla ice), which was our own fault. The bar was great, with a large selection of single malt whiskey, drinks, beers. The prices were a bit higher than avarage. The location of the hotel is excelent, in walking distance to Grand Central Station, Empire State Building, Central Park and the UN building. It is close to the Metlife building, which we used as a guidence, to find our way to the hotel. When we checked out, the bell boy took care of our luggage (for free, except tips) and when we departed for the airport, we used the hotel car for JFK. (60 dollars) IWe would stay at the roosevelt again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Older Couples and Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: elrondo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt for three nights recently. It was totally fine. I don't have anything bad to say about the place (other than that having first stayed a night at The Hudson, I was totally bored and uninspired by the Roosevelt.) The Roosevelt would be where I would recommend that my grandparents stay when they go to New York. It has an old time classic charm to it. Nice, but nothing special really.

Reviews.Title: “A great central location & accomodations”
Reviews.Author: PaBusymom
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again! Using one of the travel websites, we were able to get a superior double room, with complimentary full breakfast for 2 each day, for under $200 a night. The hotel is located around the block from Grand Central Station and within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Times Square and Rockefeller Center, not to mention all the shopping. The staff was courteous and helpful. Although a little small (typical of most NYC hotel rooms), our room was plenty big for 2 adults and 2 pre-teens. The breakfast buffet was incredible, with an omelet and waffle station. We look forward to returning to NYC soon and staying here once again. Since it is so close to GCS, we will leave the car home and just take the train in this next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lower your expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a two stars hotel and not 3 by any stretch of the imagination. If you don’t mind a tiny little room with an unobstructed view of street dumpsters, a noisy 20 year old window air conditioner that sounds like a bus, a dinky 17” TV, a 20 minute wait time for an elevator, and a 30 minutes wait for your receipt to check out, then this hotel is for you. By the way, the staff attitude usually matches that of this hotel clientele, cheap and without class. Look for more interesting choices in NYC and go here only as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt was a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried and concerned at first after reading some of the negative reviews but decided to book with the Roosevelt anyways since other reputable travel companies were promoting this hotel as part of their packages. The location is perfect. You can't ask for a better location. If you plan on travelling around by the subway, Grand Central Station is only a 2 minute walk away. It's quicker if you head east on 45th and cut through the MetLife Building. Times Square is a short 10 minute walk away as well. The Roosevelt is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan and is the perfect starting point for wherever you plan to visit. We stayed in a room with a King size bed and we did not find the room to be small. The decor is very nice and the washroom was very clean. Considering the hotel was built in 1924 I thought the toilet and bathtub were going to very old but that was not the case. They have been updated and look very modern. The air conditioning worked and was not as loud as some people have complained about. We also checked out the fitness centre just to see what it would be like and it turned out to be quite nice. You can help yourself to the fruits in the fruit basket and a water dispenser is also available. We had no problems with the elevators. We arrived at 7pm and checked in with no problems. Checking out was also as easy with no hidden charges and surprises. The only complaint we have is that the whole place was very dark even on the brightest day when the sun was shining. But I guess that's the way it was back in the 1920's and they wanted to keep the feel from that era. I would recommend the Roosevelt to anyone. In years to come when we think back to our first time in New York, the Roosevelt would definitely be part of those memories.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: coyd
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed 6 nights at this hotel and had a fantastic holiday in New York. I read some very negative reviews after booking and so checked in with trepidation and was pleasantly surprised. Lobby is impressive, hotel is very clean, rooms size were adequate and no smaller than many UK hotel chains. Rooms are decorated to look 1920's and not to my personal taste but in keeping with hotel. This can make them a little dark but certainly not drab as some reviews indicate. Staff were always pleasant, courteous and helpful, particularly the bell hops, lobby guys etc. No probs with heat of water or bathroom cleanliness. Air con a little noisy. No elevator probs and we were there on 4th July!!! No noisy night interruptions - you can hear traffic but probably can from any NY hotel. Hotel well placed for all attractions - we walked to most places with ease! One negative which isn't the hotels fault - they don't cater for a triple room. Our booking agent booked us a triple for our boys - the hotel don't have triples and so put a fold away bed in for the third person - it was fairly substantial but not as comfy as the others. This is something we need to take up with our booker. Great holiday - definately wouldn't have a problem staying at hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Took Advantage of Female Tourists!”
Reviews.Author: BrookefromBrookline
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I went to the Roosevelt for a girls weekend. All was fine with the hotel until we left. (Note: the rooms were somewhat small, but okay for a quick trip.) When we checked out, we decided to take our luggage down to the lobby. It took us over 10 minutes to get an elevator as every single one was full!! When checked out, we decided to put our luggage in the holding as we were going to still tour around the city before we left. My friend told the gentlemen that we would be back later and his superior said, "Michael will be ending his shift soon, so you will want to give him something now!" My friend was a little taken aback and she knew that she was going to tip once we got our luggage back. When Michael gave her the luggage ticket, he said, " I won't be here when I get back, if you know what I mean!" My friend could not believe that he was suggesting that she needed to give him a tip then. She felt so pressured that two employees said that to her, that she gave him the tip. My group of friends were so upset that they would take advantage of us that we spoke to the manager on duty, who did nothing but offer us coffee for our troubles. They did not even apologize for the employees inappropriate behavior, nor did the employee apologize. This whole experience made me wonder how many tourists they take advantage of each day. My advice, go at your own risk, but do not be bullied!!!!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Cardiffborn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only a block or so from Central Station, so you are within easy reach of everything. The lobby is very impressive. The staff were very polite and helpful. The rooms are fine, clean with a TV and bathroom. We didn't eat in the hotel but there are delis within easy walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, with Duane Reade (pharmacy and general store) round the corner and many shops and restaurants nearby. Not TOO far from Times Square. Corridors were musty and dimly lit. The housekeeping carts are parked behind a couple of swing doors which you can see through to the garbage disposal and service area right beside the elevators. The rooms are decently sized, but then there are motel rooms bigger than this. The toilets are tiny and old. The bath is all clogged up and the shower is erratic. No kettle or coffee maker in the room, only 3 lamps in the room. One desk lamp, one to share between 2 beds and one in the corner beside the chair. Not very dark but not sufficiently bright to read in bed either. Internet access costs $12.95 per day excluding taxes. It starts after you have checked in but lasts only until 12 noon the next day (check-out time), regardless of what time you start. I logged on at 1130pm to check my email and since I will be out at 8am tomorrow morning for work, it cost me $12.95 excluding taxes for 15 mins of internet access. Business Center is closed at 8pm. Security is lacking as the floors are all accessible from the shopping arcade in the basement. Anyone can simply avoid the lobby altogether and just come up to your floor. I highly encourage anyone who wants to book this hotel to look for alternatives elsewhere. I only got this through Priceline for $240 per night including taxes. I hope never to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt stay in June 2006 for 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We paid $259 per night which was a good price as compared to others in the same area. However, we had problems with the elevators. There were often long waits and it seemed as if only a few were working. We had two rooms in our group. My room had no problems with the air conditioner but the other one barely worked. The staff were very friendly. The food in the bar (late after a show) was very good. I would stay here again but I would definitely try and get a better rate. From what I have read, it is possible to get a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok but the room was hot.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Roosevelt Hotel... The hotel was fine but our room was very warm and could not get it to cool down. I called about it but nothing was done. It is a great location to stay at though.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Veghead
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early June for 4 nights and had none of the problems related in other emails. Staff was friendly and efficient on check in (I arrived around 2pm on Friday and got a room immediately) and checked out around 10am Tuesday. The room was on the 6th floor right across from the elevator but seemed to be reasonably insulated since I didn't hear much of my neighbors or hall noise. My bathroom was clean and huge--I think it was handicapped accessible, though I didn't request it. The room and hallways were lit fine (I do detailed sewing at night and had no trouble). I had no trouble with the ac and the room smelled fine--no mustiness or smoke. I had to wait occasionally for elevators--I expect that when I'm in a large building... I didn't eat in the hotel since there are so many great places nearby and the hotel is just a couple of blocks from Grand Central. For the $165/night I paid thru Priceline (---), I thought it was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Never again will I stay at the Roosevelt!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of the Roosevelt hotel but it turned out to be one of my worst hotel experiences. Problems include small, dirty, old, and falling apart rooms and only 4 elevators in service to serve over 1,000 rooms (need to wait forever). But the worst part of the hotel is it's people and service. Employees here are simply rude, worse than even the cheapest hotels I've stayed at. But worst of all, I was shocked by how they handled a lost item situation in my room. I was bringing my ill and dying 5 year old nephew's favorite teddy bear from Korea to his hospital in Michigan, but it dissappeared in my hotel room. We had seen it in our room before we left in the morning, but when we returned just after lunch, the room was made up and the bear gone. I immediately called housekeeping and also asked the maid who serviced my room, but they were barely helpful as they told me to simply wait. Because of the sentimental value of the bear, plus a flight the very next day, I even volunteered to find it myself (through it might have been sent to the laundry with the linen) but they would not let me citing liability issues. All throughout the afternoon and night, the staff was outright rude and unhelpful, and almost seemed to be laughing at the situation - most likely since it was not anything expensive and simply a bear - a bear, however, that meant nearly everything to my dying nephew. For the maid to accidentally send a teddy bear with the linen to the laundry seemed ridiculous and irresponsible, but the staff also didn't even think to check her even though she was the only one to enter the room. Overall, they did very little to help my situation and instead was very rude in their responses and could also see them laughing about the situation. Overall, I was disgusted in the poor and rude customer service, especially the manager whom seemed to not want to help at all. In all, it seemed they were more concerned about protecting their laundry and their employees rather than helping me - makes you wonder how a hotel could survive still with so little focus on the customer. By the way, according to the police, apparently theft is common in the rooms of Roosevelt hotel, with most cases ending up going nowhere as the hotel management is focused on protecting their people in order to avoid a bad reputation. Horrible hotel indeed...

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Patwalden
Reviews.Content: 12 Ladies from Cambridge England stayed in this hotel for a total of 4 nights in May-June 2006. The hotel was just fantastic all the staff were helpful & polite. The rooms were more than adequate with shower bath & television. It was in a great location for the buses, subway, & for walking. We all had a great time & cannot wait to return. We would definetly try for rooms at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pdxmark2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt over Memorial Day weekend as part of a contingent of ~900 rugby players who were using it as their headquarters hotel. Stayed for nearly a week. I wouldn't call it the lap of luxury, but the rooms were fine and the public areas were nice. We stayed in a room with a King-size bed on the 6th floor facing Madison Avenue. It wasn't huge, but it was about the same size (if not slightly larger) than a similar room I stayed in at the W. My two main objections to the hotel were the elevator system and general ventilation. There are six elevators in the main lobby, but rarely did all of them seem to be working. If you are staying here at time where there are a lot of people coming and going simultaneously, you will be waiting for the elevator A LOT. You can always use the stairs, but the hotel has a lot of floors. I pity you if you are staying on one of the upper floors and there are elevator issues. Second, general ventilation... our room was clean, but I'd characterize it almost as "dank" -- it always seemed sort of like the air was stale and musty, even with the air conditioner running all the time. Still, you can't beat the location for access to the subway... steps away from an entrance into Grand Central Station. The public areas were nice, lots of seating in the lobby and lobby bar. I'd definitely stay there again if the price was better than some of the other similarly located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing Room and small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Whicker
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed here on business in the past two months. I went for the "De Luxe" King Bedroom. The bathroom certainly did not live up to any kingsize dimensions, there was no bath only a shower cubicle and the bathroom was very narrow. The room was decorated in dreadfully dull colours and certainly did not inspire to spend anytime there. The food I had in the bar (Steak Sandwich) was very poor, all bread and melted cheese with very little meat. On the upside the location is great and you feel very safe. If you get a good deal, then The Roosevelt is certainly worth considering. Especially if you like a noisy, buzzy hotel bars and lobby. But not worth considering at $345 a night + taxes.

Reviews.Title: “If you have nothing good to say...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Why is it that most of the reviews that one reads here are negative for extremely picky reasons? Because most people are too self important and picky themselves. The Roosevelt is a wonderful hotel. The lobby hearkens back to the 40's, the staff is attentive, friendly, and professional. The rooms are tight (as are all rooms in midtown), so I take umbrage when this is a complaint from Joe Hayseed located in some area of the country that GPS doesn't even know about....New York City is expensive, cramped, crowded, noisy but a wonderful place to be. If these things bother some people, don't visit. The rooms are clean, the fixtures all work. The bathrooms are spotless. On our last stay, we attempted to check in early (around 9am), but the room was not ready...no big surprise as this is usually the case at all hotels. Did we get angry...no. We checked our bags and went out, had a wonderful visit to MoMA and a great lunch. Returned to find that the room was ready...end of story. We love this hotel and stay there regularly for all the above reasons and the excellent location. For those out there that tend to dwell on the negative...couple of tips when visiting NYC. Limit your itinerary, don't act as though you are the hotel's only guest, treat people with respect especially staff (which means tipping as well), don't expect perfection in life because it does not exist...these little 'tricks' will help you avoid the overwhelming stress that can accompany a trip to NY and not turn a lamp that does not work into the focal point of an epic saga of your woebegotten sojourn.

Reviews.Title: “fourth time staying here, last time staying here”
Reviews.Author: alaskan_itchy-feet
Reviews.Content: I've stayed on business three times before at the Roosevelt, and so when it showed up as a discounted group rate for this past convention I thought it was my best choice. But I won't make this choice again.After flight delays, I arrived at 1:30 in the morning, tired beyond belief, and had to lug my suitcases up the stairs to the lobby by myself---no doorman, no bellhop. Then in spite of my requests, I was booked into a street-side, low floor-level room. Then had to go back to the front desk to request a change to upper floor, inside room. I used the same one bar of soap the entire visit---until it was a mere sliver. Same with squeezing the last drops from the shampoo and body lotion bottles. There was no replacement of toiletries, which seemed ironic, because based on their little "be earth friendly" hangtag, I should have been able to leave my towels on the shower bar so they wouldn't be replaced---yet everyday they were! Anyway, in general, my stay was not nearly as pleasant as it used to be here. Everything seemed a hassle. I know I can find a better hotel for the price, and next time I will.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel May 18 - 21st to see the Broadway play, the Color Purple. Upon reading some of the reviews, I was very skeptical about the quality of this hotel. Needless to say, I did not need to be. The hotel was fine. It was a great location and the concierge, bellmen, and hotel staff were very accomodating. We arrived well before check-in time and were able to check in early. When doing so, I explained that this was my mother's first trip and that we could really use a nice room. I don't know if my extra request helped or not, but we were able to get a room in the corner that allowed two windows. The space in the room was fine. The tv was small, and the beds are short, but overall its New York and it is what it is. The hotel room was not too shabby or dirty. I feel like I got my money's worth. I booked this hotel online using priceline---. I paid 260.00 a night. I have read on other reviews were some paid cheaper than that AND got free breakfast vouchers. I wish! We did eat breakfast at the restaurant and it was nice. We had their breakast buffet and room service. Food quality was fine. The meals were overpriced, but once again -- you are in New York. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Roosevelt Hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahlou145
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at this hotel. This was our second visit to NY, and we booked this hotel only a week prior to our arrival, so were expecting a not so great room. Check in was really quick, and the staff were all polite, friendly and helpful, check out was equally as efficient. Our room was on the 16th floor and had a fantastic view down Madison avenue. The room was a lot larger than most standard rooms and had two double beds and a good sized bathroom. Each day our room was cleaned and the toiletries in the bathroom replenished. We didnt use room service at all, so cant comment. We did use the bar in the main lobby area, and the service and food/drinks were superb. The main lobby area is magnificent, and you could easily sit there with a drink and watch the world go by. Location wise, this hotel is superb, just a few minutes walk from Grand Central station and within walking distance of Times Square. We enjoyed our stay so much we are going to be staying here again next month (hopefully we will get the same service/room). Watch this space and i will let you know

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: asrosen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on business when I was unable to get a room at the Marriott Time Square Residence Inn. They were very solicitous in helping me get a room at their hotel when it was almost impossible to get a room in any mid-town hotel. Check-in was friendly and I was given an upgrade just as a nice gesture, which was much appreciated! Room was spacious though unremarkable. Bathroom was small. High speed connection available though pricier ($12.95 per day) than I would like. Room heat/ac was from a small unit by the window, which is more typical of lower priced hotels, and didn't do a great job of keeping the room cool (even when the outside temperature was cool).

Reviews.Title: “A great NY experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jamikair
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to the city and this time we were taking our adult son and his wife with us. They are both in grad school and we were going to be footing the hotel rooms for all on a modest budget. The plan was two standard rooms, but a wonderful man in reservations, Alen, up sold us to a King Hospitality Suite. This was a savings to us of over $100 a night and we were thrilled with the decision. I am sure that had I asked for the KHS it wouldn't have been so reasonable. I recommend calling the hotel before you come, as a week before the trip, I did and our reservation had been changed back to single rooms. One call to Alen again and the reservation was corrected. The KHS was huge (about 600 sq ft) and lavish. The king room was so far from the living room where the kids stayed that we couldn't hear them at all. We had two bathrooms, two TVs and a door and hallway between us so it may as well have been separate quarters. They slept on a fold-out that wasn't great, but adequate. The room was situated on the corner of Madison Ave and 45th Street with a great view of the fabulous shopping district. The lobby is grand and impressive. The suite was spotless and amazingly quiet because it is just far enough off of Time Square and the area seemed to close down at a reasonable time. We never used air or heat as the weather was perfect. The bed was a bit hard for my liking but I slept great every night there anyway. This was amazing as I am a light sleeper. The hotel is just a block from Grand Central Station so we made many pit stops during the day to rest or regroup because of the ease of location. Broadway and Time Square is less than a ten minute walk. I found the staff to be attentive and friendly. We only ate one meal (morning brunch buffet) at the hotel and it was excellent. This was the first hotel in NY that both my husband and I agreed to return to on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs shape-up”
Reviews.Author: factfromfiction
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel all in all, although I think the service sector would do well with some better training or monitoring. The entrance is grand, old style, but quite nice. The rooms are just fine at the Roosevelt and location is fantastic. Rooms are clean and normal but this hotel is large so if you're unlucky you may end up with rooms close to the street or on noisy locations. Rooms are not extravagant but above average. Single rooms tend to be real small so if visitors dont like tiny rooms they should opt to book a double room. Many people on this board write that rooms are "cheap" at the Roosevelt. I dont know how $305 plus taxes every night for a regular standard room, the cheapest availble, is considered cheap - but there are many hotels on Manhattan that can beat this for the same quality and probably far better service too. Services are a bit of a mess in this hotel. I ordered roomservice several time and must admit I felt annoyed when I discovered that I had been paying almost tripple on the tip all the time. This hotel includes tip in the bill because all the European tourists are not used to paying tip and neglect paying the required 15% tip (people you are in the USA: you MUST pay tip! If you dont pay tip they have to pay income on the amounts anyways. How do you calculate tip? Just double the tax charge and that's what your tip is). Well, roomservice never told me tip was included in the total when I handed them cash tip each time I ordered something. And one Indian man from roomservice was a total mess; always forgetting something belonging to the order and then he arguing with me when I asking for it! Incredible person. How did he get the job? Finally I asked them not to send this man to my room whenever I had roomservice because it was such a hassel. How am I to wait 15 minutes for utensils when the food by that time is already cold, or have my bread and butter delivered AFTER I am finished, or my coffee brought cold at heavy room charges? He just didnt seem to get it. The other roomservice guys were OK. Roomcleaning was allright, but occasionally they would not vaccum or change anything but towels which meant shampoo, toilette paper and clean drinking glasses were not replaced. This should not be misunderstood; the rooms are still clean at the Roosevelt. Only the quality of the staff is lacking at this hotel and there seem to be no management that monitors staff properly. I was also charged wrong on my bill and to this day have not been credited. I stod in line three times in front of 20 tourists who had no more serious questions than asking where Times Square is to resolve the issue with my excess charges, but finally gave up. After all, I was on a business trip and on time restraint. I dont know if I would recommed this hotel for business travelers. If you have time to search for other hotels I would recommend a traveler to do so, otherwise Roosevelt is an OK medium class hotel to stay at. I feel this hotel should keep the rates at $150-200 a night max, then everything from room quality to messy staff makes sense.

Reviews.Title: “Good location... but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of shops and places to see, but the hotel itself is quite old-fashioned and dingy. The reception and public areas are impressive, but the bedrooms were very dark, meaning we had to have lights on the entire time. Reception staff were pretty ineffective and in some cases, rather rude, which was off-putting. On the postive side, the express checkout is good, as is the baggage service, enabling you to leave your cases at the hotel after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Amanda64
Reviews.Content: We booked this as it was good value for money in a central location. We arrived with some misgivings after reading mixed reviews, but although the rooms were on the smaller side, they were clean with fresh sheets every day and to be honest on a 4 day trip to NY we only spent enough time in the room to sleep, so any more space would have been a waste of money. The room safes were a bonus and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The bar was great and the imposing lobby made for fantastic photos. I think this is a very good hotel, well located and offering good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location/lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wolfwoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid Feb. 2006. Got excellent hotel/flight deal thru Priceline--about $1000 for 4 nites and 2 nonstop plane tickets from Cleveland. We ended up "wasting" the price of our 4th nite, as we chose to leave a day early to get home ahead of the big snowstorm which closed down the airports for the next day or 2, but still felt as if we had gotten a great deal. Very pleasant, clean room. Comfortable bed and bathtub. Location was crucial. We ended up eating at the Grand Central Oyster Bar 3 times (and would have been happy to have gone there more) and it was just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Enjoyed shopping on Madison Ave., and walked to the show "Spamalot"--all easy walking distance, even in the cold. Beautiful lobby to have a nightcap in and to just enjoy watching the people. Would love to stay again, but probably wouldn't if the price is $300+ per night, as it often is.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for price”
Reviews.Author: PradaP
Reviews.Content: We normally stay somewhere more expensive and 'grand' in New York, but we decided to give the Roosevelt a go and for the price weren't at all disappointed. You can't compare the Roosevelt to places like the Waldorf Towers and Ritz-Carlton because it is much less expensive, and similarly you shouldn’t go there expecting similar service and rooms, although I might warn that we had a suite at the Roosevelt which wasn't bad, but it wasn't perfect - so the 'standard' rooms might be less satisfactory; I'd definitely ask for a room which has been refurbished recently, has a bit of a view etc. to avoid their perhaps slightly crumbling standard rooms. The suite decoration was a bit bland, but comfortable and unpretentious. Everything was perfectly clean and the room was cleaned very well each day. Several things went wrong (like things breaking) but the problems were quickly rectified, and compensation in the form of free drinks in the bar or free breakfast was offered (which we gladly accepted!) We had 2 televisions (with a good selection of channels and some games), a hair-dryer, iron and ironing board, empty refrigerator, 3 2-line telephones, safe deposit box, coffee maker and coffee powder and 2 closets, although if you’re getting a different type of room and are bothered about the exact amenities, I would check before booking exactly what is included. There were 2 bathrooms which had lovely large (well by European standards) old semi-sunken tubs, one had a separate shower and the other a shower above the tub, and both had ample towels, face-cloths/flannels and toiletries. The hotel was well maintained, the general decor pleasant and grand in the lobby, and the location hard to beat. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only real problem encountered was the wait for the elevators. The hotel is only served by 6 elevators, and we found ourselves waiting a long time for an elevator which wasn't full during peak times, like trying to get down for breakfast. The breakfast buffet was pretty good, with a large selection of things, both American and Continental and -yes, Krispy Kreme doughnuts! The service at breakfast was good, the plates clean and the atmosphere relaxed. Finally, perhaps it is worth noting that the cooling units were quite noisy and old, so this may be a problem to guests staying in summer especially at night. I would recommend the Roosevelt for people seeking a relatively good value, excellently located New York Hotel, with a friendly relaxed atmosphere and above average accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Murky, grey, not worth it”
Reviews.Author: DCReviewerWashington
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt over three days in mid-March. I was prepared for the rooms to be small (you can't find a large room in Midtown), but I wasn't prepared for how dark and murky the rooms were. While the lobby was beautiful, the rooms were not well lit and not particularly clean. The bedspreads appeared to be extremely old; the room smelled musty, and the walls were extremely thin. The only upside to the hotel was its location--and it is right in the heart of lot of the good attractions in NYC. However, I would not recommend this hotel unless you get a REALLY good deal on the price. There are other, cleaner hotels in midtown. This one was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights. We paid $110/night through price line. We really enjoyed our trip and the location of the hotel helped, but had a few complaints. Things you should note: GOOD - 1. Location, Location, Location. We were close to everything. This place is caddy-corner to Grand Central Station. It's close to Times Square, the Theatre District, and all the local subway stops. 2. With Priceline, we were scheduled to get the smallest room they had, but the hotel upgraded us to a larger room for free. I think that's because we got there before check-in and they had extra rooms. 3. The room was nice and clean. The bed was comfy. BAD - 1. Starbucks adds in the room were misleading. It sounded like they "served" free coffee. That was not the case. In fact, there was no free coffee anywhere in the hotel and no coffee maker in the room. They sold Starbucks at the bar. 2. We couldn't get hot water a few nights when we were getting ready to go out, between 6-7 pm. Just cold water for a long time. 3. They have those $5 bottles of Evian in the room. We bought our own bottled water and it mysteriously disappeared. 4. Also, they charged $25 for a sub-standard breakfast buffet. It was the same eggs and bacon that you would get at McDonalds. 5. When we left for the airport, the head bellhop told us that we could take a hotel car to La Guardia for a "flat-rate" of $35. When we got to the airport, we were charged $40...an extra $5 for the "toll". Shouldn't tolls be included in a "flat-rate"?

Reviews.Title: “A happy memory....”
Reviews.Author: parmesan
Reviews.Content: A longtime girlfriend & I wanted to experience NYC sans husbands.....She had never been before and we both are 50ish and wanted to feel safe and in a clean hotel, centrally located. We really enjoyed the Roosevelt. We were there for 5 nites. Our only complaint was when we initially checked in the beds felt hard....We complained and was given a key to another room as "all of the rooms have the same beds". They were correct. We opted for our original room and actually didn't have a problem sleeping. The water was hot in the shower and lots of pressure. The breakfasts were a treat after having tried others outside of the hotel. The Concierge couldn't have been more helpful as well as the rest of the staff. I would stay here again and highly recommend this hotel, especially for the $159 we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Rude service, cheap sheets and a dirty breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: bouncerville
Reviews.Content: We confirmed our reservation for one room with two double beds with the Roosevelt before we arrived in New York. When we arrived to check in at around 6:00 pm and we were told that a room would not be available for another 3-4 hours despite the fact that we had reservations and a confirmation number. The staff at the check-in desk were extremely unhelpful, rude and offered nothing but a flippant and non-apologetic attitude. We were reluctantly offered a complementary drink in the bar. Once we checked-in at around 10pm, we were given a room with one queen bed, located on the floor just above a ballroom that was being used for a wedding. When we inquired about our reservation for two double beds, the check-in staff told us that there wasn't one available and that the only way we could secure one was to bring our suitcases downstairs in the morning, check-out and then re-check-in after 4pm that day. We did and it was definitely an inconvenience. A few things about the room: the noise from the music and wedding party downstairs was awful and the room and bathroom smelled horribly of mildew. The sheets on the bed consisted of two top sheets (no bottom fitted sheet) which did not even cover the end of the bed (see photo). The sheets didn't fit the bed in our new room that they gave us the following day, either. One word about the buffet breakfast - the service was sorely lacking and everyone of the "clean plates" stacked on the buffet line had large amounts of dried food stuck on them. We had heard that The Roosevelt was a nice hotel at a decent price - is cleanliness, sheets that fit and courteous service too much to ask for?

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely with a very impressive lobby. The rooms were clean and were substantial. The only complaint was it wasn't very modern but that did not bother us and if I was in New York again I would definitely stay at this hotel. The staff were all friendly and on our last day when we checked out they arranged to keep our bags until we were ready for them. Thoroughly recommend anyone who is going to New York to stay at this hotel as the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaia1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Roosevelt Hotel at 45th Street in Midtown Manhattan. It's just a few blocks walk from Grand Central Station. The hotel is a lovely old building that has been kept in fantastic condition. The service was professional and friendly. We spent $169/nt for a dbl-dbl room. That rate included a full breakfast in the beautiful dining both mornings with only a small additional tax fee. The only blemish was the lack of hot water. For some reason the water in the shower was barely hot on both days. The rate for the hotel is normally well over the $200 mark so we got quite a deal. I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Once was enough...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was gorgeous with a great bar and restaurant. Most of the staff members in the lobby were not thrilled to be there and I found them to be unenthused and not welcoming. I am glad we tried it but would only come back for a drink at the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: foggy
Reviews.Content: Our party of four stayed there for four nights in February. Having travelled extensively throughout the world, I have to say that Roosevelt Hotel offers an excellent value. We booked through a travel agent and we got two large rooms with two queen size beds in each one for $160 per room per night. The rooms were at the 10th floor, very clean and very comfortable. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, so I cannot commend on that. We did however have dinner, which I found tasty and reasonably priced ($230 for a 3-course meal and a bottle of wine for four persons). Service was great in every occassion (front desk, concierge, waiters, maids, bellboy and doorman), except for one particular lady at the front desk. Location is great: it is very close to Grand Central station, while you can walk to almost every major attraction. We had to use a cab only once, when we attended a Metropolitan Opera performance at the Lincoln Center. Tip: when you first enter the hotel, you will have to get on a flight of stairs to get to the lobby. It may be difficult to do if you carry a lot of luggage. In this case, use the elevators which are located at the right side of the stairs. They are not visible from the main entrance and you may miss them the first time. I would definetely recommend Roosevelt Hotel to anyone and I will stay there again next time I visit NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel even if your taking young children with you”
Reviews.Author: juliemallett
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter to the roosevelt hotel New York for her 21st Birthday, when we arrived we were greeted by friendly doormen, and a beautiful entrance, the receptionist was very friendly, and made us feel welcome, our room was pleasant and clean, my daughters 3 year old son also came with us, he broke the toilet flush at 5 in the morning, when we reported it at 6 someone was there to mend it there and then.The Roosevelt hotel is in a excellent location. On our departure, we asked for a yellow new york taxi, the head doorman snatched my case out of my hand and put it in a black cab, which i thought was very rude of him, dispite this we would still chose this hotel again, i recomend it even if your taking young children with you. i love new york!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is (nearly) everything”
Reviews.Author: DJMDx2
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the Roosevelt this past Christmas season. We got a deluxe room for an unbelievable $195 a night during peak season via an internet site. We barely missed the transport strike at the time. It wouldn't have made much difference anyway due to the hotel location (see below). The best thing about the hotel is, of course, its location. As has been mentioned before, its proximity to the major New York tourist spots is very convenient. We would walk to Times Square, Toys R Us, Rockefeller Center and the shopping areas never worrying about trying to get a cab. Incidentally, for families with small kids, there is a Build a Bear around 3 blocks away which is supposedly the biggest in the world. That was a hoot with our girls, and was the highlight of their trip. Back to the hotel: the lobby is probably the centerpoint of what otherwise is a somewhat dreary setting. Don't get me wrong, it's not shabby but the hallways are dark and the decor does nothing to lift the spirits. The room was decent and clean enough with a smallish window looking out onto a side street - nothing to write home about. The staff was very friendly and helpful. One of them went out of her way to assist me with a luggage issue (long story). We didn't try the room service so I can't rate that. There's plenty of little sandwich shops and coffee shops and the Grand Central food court nearby, though. I guess my parting shot is: Would I stay there again? Yes, but not for the standard rates posted online.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Berenice
Reviews.Content: THE PROS: Centrally located hotel, near good shopping and sights. The public areas were recently renovated in very traditional, psuedo-luxury style. There is a lively, young crowd gathered at the lobby bar on most nights. THE CONS: We got a special internet rate of $200 per night for a "deluxe" room. The rate seemed a little too good but we decided to take a chance. Our room was dark and dreary (one small window, two lamps), sparsely furnished, cheap materials, hard bed. Not our idea of deluxe. We switched to a mini-suite which was larger but just as ugly, and there were a number of stains and rips, damaged sink. I got a glimpse of a standard room and it was very tiny and old. BOTTOM LINE: There are far worse hotels at the same price, and the Roosevelt is safe and clean. Just keep your expectations low. If you can afford $50-$100 more, there are far better romantic and comfortable options.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall very positive experience and will stay there again. We were pleased with our room and the hotel services that we used. Maid service was fine. Here is some info that I dont see on other reviews. -there is a dedicated smoking-floor, which also permits smoking in the elevator waiting area on that floor.Big deal for smokers who dont want to go stand outside in the freezing cold! -the location of the hotel is optimal. 2 mins walk to Grand Central..which has a huge food court with good food,coffee, drinks etc at very reasonable prices in the basement area...a very nice fresh food market, a drug store, etc. Very convenient if you have kids with you, or dont want to blow budget on room service. -Grand Central is major subway hub, making it very easy to get almost anywhere in city with minimal changing trains.You wont need to take a taxicab! -5 minute walk to NY Public Library, 10 to Times Square, 10 to UN, 10 to Rockefeller Ctr/NBC/Fox/Radio City etc. -there is some street noise in the rooms but no worse than many other NY hotels -there is a quiet Arcade level below main lobby-which allows you to come and go without navigating the busy lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant surprise”
Reviews.Author: mosimpkins
Reviews.Content: Traveling here and there I understand you never know what you're going to get..but WOW..what a lovely place. Yes..is is beautiful, but the service really is wonderful. From the moment we pulled up to the moment we left we were catered to. And the location..amazing. Couldn't recommend The Roosevelt more.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: Trestor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great experience with the Roosevelt hotel. As others have stated, the location is great, the lobby is beautiful, and the staff was very polite and professional. The room was not large, but was clean and comfortable and it looked just like the picture on the webpage. We took a soundmachine and earplugs to block out the street noise, but we never had to use them. I would love to stay at the Roosevelt during our next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: Harri123456
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Roosevelt for five days. Service was very good and quick and the hotel was clean and professional. Even daily newspaper was delivered behind our door every morining without question. We did not encounter any problems nor had anything to complain at all. The location of the hotel is very good. As example, we walked to the Times Square nothing more than in five minutes and all the shops and restaurants are just around the corner. To add more to the location, nearest subway station (Grand Central) is accessible just one block away, so it took like 3 minutes walk to get there from the main entrance. Street noises, what we were expecting to hear on fourth floor were'nt there and overall our stay there was more than good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great lacation, just a few blocks from Grand Central Station and within walking distance of most of the major tourist sites in the city. Very friendly staff and very good meals. We were stranded there during a blizzard and the staff couldn't have been more helpful with extending our stay for one night and getting us transportation to the Newark airport the following morning. Our room was small but clean. The bed was very comfortable but there was no counter in the bathroom and no coffee maker in the room. We did hear from other people that New York City hotel rooms are rather small, so that was ok. We were not there to spent our days in the hotel room. The one negative for the hotel is that the walls are very thin and everything could be heard from the next rooms and hallway. Overall for the price and location, this was a very good choice and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to other people who plan to visit New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Ranger's Mom
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on priceline for a weekend stay in NYC. Although the hotel appears nice and the lobby is beautiful, the rest of the hotel is not very nice. The rooms are ridiculously small. Additionally, my husband and I had a room with a bed not much larger than a twin. When we requested a room with a larger bed, we were told we would have to pay extra. Our travel companions, who also booked through priceline had a room with a king bed without paying any extra. The front desk staff seemed as though they would rather be anywhere but there. The drinks in the lobby bar were overpriced and the wait staff unattentive. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt from 2nd thru 9th Feb for our 10th wedding anniversary and we had booked a family room to give us more space. Room was smaller than expected but very clean and maid service was fine. Hotel staff were friendly & helpful and pleased to assist with any queries. The location is excellent for walking & for subway express train downtown with Grand Central round the corner. If you want a central location with good clean rooms (albeit a little small) and good maid service then you can book the Roosevelt with ease of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We planned a girls weekend trip because one of our friends was turning 30. The front desk was very helpful when they realized they double booked our room. We ended up getting a free upgrade to a larger room. The lobby was beautifully decorated with Christmas decor and the concierge set up reservations for every place we ate. The hotel is very close to all of the tourist attractions and sights. The only complaint I do have is that the heating was very hard to control and the room would go from hot to cold.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay here again. Perfect location, beautiful lobby and lounge. The room was clean, beds comfortable. Heard a little noise from outside but that's what I came to New York for. I think the only complaint is when we wanted a drink from the bar and the bartender told us it was last call but an hour later they were still serving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first time in NYC, this hotel was in a great location, walked for 3 days, adjacent to Grand Central Station, off Madison Ave., Rooms were adequate, not too small like most NYC hotels. The lobby was beautiful. Didn't think the staff was too friendly but who cares......

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Lucie12
Reviews.Content: I was prepared early on to give this hotel a high rating. The lobby is absolutely gorgeous, the hallway leading to our room smelled fresh and fragrant, and our room itself, while small and a bit dark, was quite comfortable, very clean, and more than adequate for our needs. We had a lovely first day and an uneventful night. It wasn't until the next day that we discovered the one huge problem with this hotel--the paper-thin walls! We had no neighbors until the 2nd night of our stay, and when they checked into their room, they might as well have been staying with us, since we could hear every single thing they said, even their normal-voice conversations. It was just annoying at first, but it got worse as they had a young child that awoke at 7 a.m. every day, and therefore we were also awake at 7 a.m. every day. Every time their door closed, it rattled our entire wall and made our door shake very loudly. Needless to say, we got very little sleep after they arrived. I would recommend this hotel due to its great location and affordability, but I would encourage anyone staying here to do yourself a favor and get earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: S_S9901
Reviews.Content: Our $159/night room at the Roosevelt was dark and small, with a small interior window and a very noisy heater. The room was barely bigger than the king size bed. After checking a couple other rooms, we opted to upgrade. The more expensive room was quite nice. Starting with what went well: 1. The buffet breakfast was excellent, with omlettes to order, a large selection of fresh fruit, and attentive service. 2. The doormen and bell staff were very helpful and courteous. 3. The house cleaners made an extra effort, putting our cut flowers in a vase without us asking. Other things were disappointing: 1. An alarm went off in an ajoining room. It took 3 phone calls to the front desk and security and 1 1/2 hours to get this addressed. It turned out to be a smoke alarm. 2. Then, when we left for dinner, we found the hallway filled with furniture, and no hotel employee in sight. We had to pick our way through the furniture. Anyone less agile or with disability would not have been able to get through. It appeared unsafe. 3. The housekeepers re-arranged our personal belongings in our room, making it difficult to find things (good intention, bad result). 4. The heater was noisy and we could not get the room to a comfortable temperature during our three-day stay. 5. After checking out, I realized I had left an item in my room. The people I spoke with on the phone expressed very little interest in helping me recover it, and never followed up as promised. 6. There were unexpected charges on our bill for some sort of "center fee". We will try most of the other hotels in New York before going back to the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: opie18
Reviews.Content: Not recommended. First, my boyfried arranged, through the hotel concierge, for a meet and greet to pick us up at the airport, at the cost of $120. We were met, the driver went and checked his mail, then we walked across the parking ramp to his car. No curb side service. We were further appauled when we asked the doorman to arrange a car back to the airport, and the cost was only $35! This car picked us up and dropped us off at the door! We asked the concierge about the price difference, and were told that the meet and greet picked us up at the door at the airport. We told her he did not. She argued with us. We informed her that we were there, she was not, and well aware that we had to walk to his car. Next, upon check in, my boyfriend asked about the champagne and strawberries he had arranged to be in our room. The lady that checked us in did not offer to verify they would be there, and stated there were 7 other guests with the same name that weekend. Upon arrival in our room, they were not there. We wished to see some museums in the area but were concerned about them being open with the holiday weekend. We asked the concierge, and were told they would all be closed on Sunday and Monday. We asked the next day again, and were told they would all be open. We ate breakfast in the restaurant one morning. $25 per person for a breakfast buffet. This is fine, but apparently it does not include clean juice glassess or ensure coffe in your cup. However, there were several staff members standing around talking rather than making sure the guests have full coffee cups. The icing on the cake is the fact that my boyfriend emailed the hotel when we got back, letting them know of our unsatisfactory experiance. He never heard back from them!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel will come back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The roosevelt is a great hotel. We arrived early in the morning and cound not check in until 2:00 but we were able to drop off our bags and head out into the city. No problems with checking in and the room was great. Great location as well only a few blocks from Time Square, NBC studios, Grand Central station. All staff we interacted with were very nice and helpful offering directions and recommending places to eat. I will stay here again next time I am in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend escape”
Reviews.Author: slamdunk09
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a mother daughter trip with 15 girls, and can't say enough about the Roosevelt. Location is fabulous--walking distance to most major attractions. Rooms were small, but not overly small by NY standards, and very clean and comfortable. Lobby is grand, with nice bar area to relax in front of a fire and have a light snack. Staff was courteous. Nice rooms, perfect location, and terrific buffet breakfast each morning made the trip a huge success. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about the Roosevelt after reading some reviews but I was pleasantly surprised once we arrived. The lobby is beautiful and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Yes, the rooms are small but not nearly as bad as some reviews stated. What do you expect from a hotel room in NYC? There was enough room for my husband and I. The room was always cleaned very well and the noise factor is minimal. The hotel is within good walking distance to everything and there are some really good resturants nearby. We would absolutely stay at the Roosevelt again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day break with my husband at the Roosevelt Hotel and it was a great holiday. The hotel has an excellent location, minutes walking distance from Times Square, 5th Avenue, Grand Central Station etc. It was the perfect base for our holiday. The room was adequate, very large king size bed, clean crisp white linen with a desk, chair and separate bathroom (bath and shower). The wardrobe was incredibly small and also housed the ironing board, so if your only staying for a short trip you can hang up coats etc which is acceptable, but for a longer stay it would have been a bit annoying living out of your suitcase all the time. The bathroom was a fair size with good shower and plenty of towels. We had heard all hotel rooms in NYC were small and this was no exception, but for all the time you actually spend in your room, it was more than adequate. We were on the 8th floor and overlooked the road and you could hear traffic noise, but it is New York after all! Hotel itself is very nice and clean, but we never really spent much time there and it was purely a place to sleep!. Lobby is grand and inviting – however there was no bell boy to help us up the stairs with our bags. I think they were just busy as every other day there was 2/3 waiting to greet guests. I’m sure if we stood at the front door someone would have come to our attention, but our bags were fairly small so it was not a major problem. We ate breakfast there a couple of mornings and the choice of food was very good. However, there are plenty of deli’s nearby where you can sit with a coffee and bagel and watch the world go by. If I have any complaints, they are only minor and personal.. 1) The front desk staff are not the most polite, maybe we caught them on a bad day, but after a long trip you expect to be greeted by someone a bit more pleasant. The ladies manner was quite abrupt and not the usual American charm I’ve had when visiting other States. Saying that, she checked us in in under 5 mins 2) The hotel is full of brass and everywhere I touched I got an electric shock – beware of the lift buttons and stair rails! Overall, the hotel was an excellent base for our first trip to NYC. Can not wait until we can return to the Big Apple again and I would have no hesitation in staying in the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Roosevelt Hotel this past weekend (1/13/06 to 1/15/06)and I can't say enough great things about this property. I am a travel agent in Alabama and we wanted to get away on a quick and fairly inexpensive trip. We purchased the package on our travel agent reservation system under "last minute deals". I have traveled to NYC on numerous occasions and had yet to experience the Roosevelt Hotel. Paying only $400.00 per person (airfare and hotel for 2 nights), we really didn't have high expectations. Well, our expectations were met and exceeded. First of all, the location is exceptional. Located at 45th and Madison, the hotel is prime for east side shopping (Fifth Avenue is one block away). Grand Central Terminal is only two streets south. If you have Broadway shows, you are 4 blocks away (a 15 minute walk). Secondly, the staff was friendly and helpful...from the front desk staff to the bellman. Lastly, my room was clean and well appointed. We checked in early and only a room with a double bed was available at that time. We were worn out from flying so we chose the double bed instead of waiting for a king bed. Our room was standard in size with a writing desk, chair, and a armoire with tv. The bathroom was standard size with a shower only (not sure if rooms with other bedding configurations have a tub or not). The hotel's pillows are down so if you want fiber you will have to ask the maid. I will definitely stay at the Roosevelt again!

Reviews.Title: “Roooosseeevelt !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and staff ! right in the heart of midtown. If I was going to NYC again then this is where I would stay again, clean rooms, good service, great street views..... good.

Reviews.Title: “Had some problems but they reduced rate in the end making it quite fair after al”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms (1 king, 1 with 2 doubles). We had 5 in our party traveling, 2 adults with 3 children. Checked in was massive chaos for every one, their computers were down. We got 2 rooms each with a king bed (does not work for 5 people) at opposite ends of the hotel. Went back downstairs to very rude staff that did not seem willing to help with our situation. I told them our rooms had to be closer since we have children and they needed 2 double beds. They finally found what we needed. Total check-in time was about 2 hours. Hotel condition was great, lobby was absolutely beautiful. Rooms were good and spacious for NY, although ours did not look like the one on the hotel website. There was a lot of street noise even 6 floors up, maybe that is normal for NY though. Had some other minor trouble with check-out and luggage, but the day manager ended up reducing our rate by $70/night/room. Quite fair. Great location for subway, Grand Central was 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Beyand expectations!”
Reviews.Author: MelinaToronto_ON
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in NYC - we stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel located at 45th and Madison and I have to say the hotel, the service and the location exceeded all expectations! We had an amazing experience and would recommend it to anyone and everyone! If you choose to stay at this hotel you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt during mid-December. We were there during the transit strike! We had a very pleasant stay and were so glad we were within easy walking distance to times square, rockafeller center, the broadway shows and 5th ave shopping. The hotel was beautiful. We had a corner room and while small, it was larger than other NYC rooms I have had in the past. The bell and door men were great. We had to get a cab when we left and it was no easy feat given the stike. They were helpful and very friendly. Plenty of places to eat around the hotel. One negative was the hotel bar area.
