In the morning coffee was $2.50 and tea was $1.70. When we came in one afternoon and sat down we not only had a difficult time getting waited on but the prices had gone up - way up! The same tea was $3.50 and the coffee was $4.50. We stayed away in the afternoon from then on! Other than that, the stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: Vargas_Girl360
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute stay at The Roosevelt Hotel for a New Year weekend break and had a lovely experience in this hotel. On arrival, we were greeted by a very helpful receptionist who offered us a complimentary breakfast and drinks in the bar - a nice way to welcome us to the hotel. The lobby was very festive and very inviting. Our room (a standard king) was a good size and was clean and comfortable. The Bath & Body Works toiletries were a nice addition. The bar is very cosy and there was a lot of choice for breakfast. It's in a great location, near Grand Central Station, Times Square and the Rockerfeller Center. We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: craig3558
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Roosevelt for 7 nights including New Year. Found the staff (especially the bar staff) very friendly and helpful. The hotel was well presented, decorated, clean and in the perfect location. The room was small but was more than adequate and very clean. Room service was superb. The food was quick, hot and well presented. We would definately recommend to family and friends, and we will be returning in the future!

Reviews.Title: “It was supposed to be a treat for my daughter.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to New York as a Christmas treat and based on reviews read - I booked the Roosevelt Hotel. But we were so disappointed. The lady at the front desk was rude and disinterested. The hotel was so full that finding room in the lift became a mission. The room , although supposedly superior, was tiny and dismally drab. The overall look of the room was unclean. We had to ask for throw bed pillows to be replaced bacause they were 'crusty' with food and spills. We were awoken at 8am on the morning we were checking out, by housekeeping to clean, yet we had until 12 noon to check out, and by another person 10 minutes later who wanted to check whether we had drunk the $5 bottled water left in the room. We will not return to this hotel and we will not recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt Hotel was great.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I stayed for 3 nights at the Roosevelt just before Christmas and really enjoyed our stay. Our room was nice and quiet and clean. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The eggnog served in the lobby was just great. The decorations were beautiful. A very classy hotel. Would not hesitate to stay there again. Had a luxury ride back to the airport, thanks to the doorman. Everyone was just great!

Reviews.Title: “roosevelt hotel new york”
Reviews.Author: susie39455
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Roosevelt for 4 nights from 16th December. Beautiful hotel, lovely clean rooms, ample size for our shopping trip. Staff all very helpful and friendly. Room service very good, a little expensive for breakfast but dinner average price. DO NOT USE ROOM PHONE TO DIAL DIRECT - VERY EXPENSIVE. For some reason quite a lot of guests were affected by static electricity, especially when you press for the lift you got a nasty shock! On the whole a very enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: JoeyTigs
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and we were very impressed with the accommodation. The staff were extremely helpful and arranged helicopter and theatre trips on our behalf. Our room was lovely and clean although the wardrobe was tiny and, being female, I had taken plenty of shoes!!!.... We walked the entire length of Manhatten during our 5 night trip and decided that out of all the hotels we nearly stayed in, we had definitely picked the best one with the Roosevelt. It was on a safe well-lit corner just off 5th avenue and a 2 minute walk from Times Square and Broadway. The Empire State building and Bloomingdales were also only a 5 minute walk away. We would definitely choose this hotel again for it's location...oh...and the breakfasts were absolutely gorgeous!!...mmmmm!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and two friends of ours stayed for one night at the Roosevelt based on reviews found on this website! The hotel was beautiful and staff was friendly and accomodating. They only provide down pillows in the rooms and one of our guests was allergic so I called housekeeping to request a foam/cotton pillow and extra towels. It took about an hour and 3 phone calls to get these items which seems to be the case at many hotels lately.....what has happened to room service the past couple years? :P Anyway on my third phone call, I was offered a voucher for two free breakfast in the hotel restaurant(worth $55!!!). I thought that was a very nice gesture on their part! :-) the breakfast was yummy and the staff in the restaurant was great! I would definitely stay here again, they have valet and the concierge will hold your luggage upon early check in and check out! Great location and there is a great Irish bar and grill a block away on 45th St. between Madison and 5th. Eammon's Bar and Grill, YUM!!! didn't think the meal would be as good as was but it was awesome!! check it out:-) And let's not the Morton's Steakhouse right next door if you are in the mood for a great steak!

Reviews.Title: “Plesantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: InSedona
Reviews.Content: We also got a room here at the last minute through Priceline, and it was so much better than we expected, given the price we paid and all. We did not share the bad experience that others had regarding the staff. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was very friendly and extremely helpful. They were courteous and treated us like some honored guests. Immediately upon arrival, since it was the holiday season, the bellman offered us eggnog, which was very much appreciated after a long car ride. The room wasn't too big, but considering it is NYC and also we had stayed at another hotel there with much much smaller rooms, this one was more than adequate. I should also mention that we were traveling with a baby, and we even had enough room to set up a portable crib. By the way, the staff actually asked us if we needed one once they found out that we had a baby with us. Anyway, the king size bed offered plenty of room. I also want to mention that the toiletries is from Bath and Body Works, what a treat! Like the other reviewer, we were very impressed with the Christmas decorations at the lobby. It sure did look impressive. The bar at the lobby is expected to be a bit pricy, but since I very much depend on my coffee in the morning, it was certainly delightful for me to find out that they sell Starbucks coffee there. The location is excellent. Every time we visited NYC we always tried to stay at the Times Square area and this is just fine. We agreed that if we can get another deal on Priceline, we will hope that we can get it from the Roosevelt again. I will definitely recommend it to other visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant NY style, great price”
Reviews.Author: chriscity03
Reviews.Content: I ended up with a room at The Roosevelt on Priceline. I was pleasantly surprised looking at the hotel's website, as it looked really ritzy and nice. My boyfriend and I were thrilled to walk through the doors into the expansive, and beautifully decorated lobby. A HUGE Christmas tree took center stage. To the left was a cozy bar, featuring plenty of seating, dark woodwork and two fireplaces where many people were relaxing after work. In fact, it seemed to be quite a hot spot for Happy Hour on a Friday evening. We went up to our room, and despite it being right outside the elvator area, it was not really noisy at all. The rooms were small, and not spectacular, but not shabby by any means. The room consisted of a nicely covered queen bed, nighttable, tv armoire and small desk and that was about it. There was a good-sized closet and a large bathroom with ADA accessible shower with a seat. The room was more than adequate for "crashing" as we planned on spending most of our time out anyway. We didn't sample the food or drink at the bar or the hotel's restaurant, but there were plenty of restaurants within a short walk, as well as a plethora of Starbucks stores for coffee. We felt that $202 for the night was a good deal, since posted rates were $400+ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Lobby! Great Location! Big Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: CockneyBrum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-November 2005 and thought it was amazing value for money (booked through Nectar Points). You are walking distance to Times Square and there are some excellent diners and restaurants right on the doorstep. The hotel lobby is one of the most impressive you'll ever see in New York. The staff were friendly and there were no problems with check-in and out. The room was cleaned every day. The rooms are a great size, not too small at all. The bathroom with a walk-in shower is huge, and suitable for the disabled. Just two points that would make this hotel even better: let's have a tea/coffee machine in the room and better soundproofing for the windows. I know you're in New York, but sometimes it sounds like you have the window open all the time! We would not hesitate to stay here again and highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SusieSeptember
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my third stay at the Roosevelt and at no time have ever had cause to complain about anything. The service was excellent and the room spotless. We did not have a hairdryer in our bathroom and after one phone call, just five minutes later, our hairdryer arrived. The restaurant was excellent. The breakfasts were varied and plentiful and we had the most wonderful evening meal there too. I have nothing but praise for this fine hotel. My only little grumble was that the snack bar ran out of black tea and us English love our early morning cuppa!! I am returning to the Roosevelt in march. I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came in for a Broadway Show weekend. The hotel Lobby looked as if it was part of a broadway show. Very beautiful. We loved sipping our cocktails on the Mezzanine over looking the lobby. The room was very typical New York (on the small side) But very clean. I found the staff to be wonderful and helpful. I cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: robnhol
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel from the minute we walked into the lobby. Dreading going to our room as I heard a lot of the rooms are small in NY. Well I was pleasantly surprised we had a very spacious room with a king size bed that could have fitted my whole family in. The bathroom was clean and well lit - as I have a thing about using bathrooms when I'm on holiday. Great location. Staff very polite and helpful. We stayed at the same time as others who gave bad feed back and we honestly couldn't fault the place. We had trouble with our safe but the security man came up within 5 minutes, as my husband had forgot to put something in the safe he went to it again but it failed to open. Again, the security man came up within 5 minutes to tell us we wouldn't be able to use that safe but could use one at the reception desk and offered a complimentary dinner for us both in the Teddy's Restaurant - we said it was no inconvenience and he insisted we accept the meal, which I must admit we went to town and had a three course meal which was truly delicious. I must remember to do something to the safe if I stay again because it was the best meal we had while in NY. I don't know if it makes any difference who you book with but it does seem that the people who booked with pricerunner had the bad rooms. We paid more for our room about £140 and I booked through Airmiles. Just can't wait to go back, hopefully next year with my sister so I can do more shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel from Oct29-31st and I would NEVER stay here again!!! First off no bellman helped me with my bags when I came through the door and was struggling to drag 3 bags and a purse up the stairway you have to go up to enter the lobby area. I thought that was a true sign of poor service and not a pleasant way to begin an already hectic weekend. To be honest...this hotel is not what it seems to be!!! The lobby pictures that you see in the photos are definitely misleading and as I mentioned before the service is somewhat lacking!!! I booked my room through priceline, paying $130 per night I thought I was getting a really good deal on a deluxe hotel but boy was I wrong!! When making my reservation I requested a smoking room with a king size bed and was told that my request had been confirmed. When I checked into the hotel I was told that I was in a non smoking 2 double beds room. When I told the desk person about my request etc she very rudely walked away without a word and had me standing there for like 20 min while she went into another room. When she came back she said she had a room for me and gave me my keys. When I got up to my room which was on the 10th floor I was VERY disappointed. I was greeted by a HUGE stain on the carpet in the entrance and walked in further only to discover a truly mediocre room that had obviously been poorly maintained!!! There were stains all over the carpet and holes in the wall down by the base moldings that could be easily repaired if attention were paid to them. The bathroom was small but had good lighting and the shower had great water pressure, the only good thing about the room!! The supposedly king sized bed seemed small and was very "short" I am only 5'6 and my feet were touching the bottom of the bed. Not only that but it was like sleeping on bricks, not very comfortable at all. The t.v was in this cabinent that was placed on an odd angle in a corner of the room which made it almost impossible to watch t.v. Aside from the room being awful, I found that the staff were not only rude but had no idea about anything. I asked the concierge about how much a shuttle would be to the airport and was told he didn't know of any shuttles but offered to call a car service which would have cost me $150. Also the hotel is in the middle of a business district so there are almost no places to deliver food to the hotel, but there is a mcdonalds, wendys and sbarro 2 blocks away if you feel like walking and the hotel is only 2 blocks from grand central station which does make it very easy to get on the subway so you can go grab a bite to eat in the village or somewhere else!! Overall I do not recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for good service, convenience and amenities. If you want expensive and not worth the $$ go stay at the Roosevelt!!! Next time I'll try my luck somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly great stay”
Reviews.Author: gwhood
Reviews.Content: Accompanied my daughter on her birthday trip to NYC. Apart from smaller rooms than we are used to, everything about this stay was outstanding: cleanliness, courteous staff, atmosphere, and maybe most importantly: location; we just took off walking to everything! Thanks Teddy.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER stay at the Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very special occassion for my wife and our first vist to America, what a disapointment, a good location for the hotel but let down badly by the dirty rooms. The constant noise (day & night) from the air conditioning units, toilets that failed to flush and then overflowed into the bathroom. After complaining to the disinterested staff at reception we were given another room but first we had to book out from the hotel, re-pack our suitcases and carry them down to reception, then re-book back into the hotel, carry our suitcases to our new room and un-pack. A complete waste of one day of our holiday. The new room that we were given had exactly the same toilet problems, plus a large crack in the wash basin and by this time my wife was in tears and just wanted to go home. After returning home to England on 27th September 2005 I wrote a letter of complaint to the hotel manager a Mr.Andrew Dorough who appeared to be full of appologies but did nothing, except make false promises to us regarding compensation in the form of two free nights accommodation at the Roosevelt Hotel. To date 2nd November 2005 we are still waiting for the promised certificate. Keith Johnson, England

Reviews.Title: “Tipping for breathing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got there late and were told we had the last room. It was poor. The noise from the Air con drove us daft. (Note others have commented upon this) We complained the following morning to be told there were no other rooms. They said that they had sent someone to "fix it" and when we came back we can confirm that a "different" clanking sound. The room was dirty having only been cleaned in the areas in easy reach. The Central Lobby is impressive but whilst I know tipping is part of the game in NY it was aggressive here. An example was the tab I was presented with when we booked to our room the cost of breakfast (It is self service apart from the tea/coffee). The waiter had written on the Bill "suggested 15% and wrote the amount in! I left my bags and said I would be picking them up at 3pm. The Porter said "I shall not be working at 3pm" with his hand out. I told him I hoped that he had a nice day No I will not go back. Good location though.

Reviews.Title: “I strongly advise you not to stay in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kakistoc
Reviews.Content: I would strongly advise you not to stay in this hotel. I was booked to stay there for six days with my wife and five-year old son. Originally I was going to give it a two-star rating, based on a string of minor problems typical of New York hotels - albeit usually of a cheaper level. For example, the water in the bathroom was coffee-coloured (literally) on two occasions and the rooms were small, dark and poorly furnished. The thing that has changed this to a "terrible" rating was their extraordinary response to yet a further problem. On the fourth day our toilet came loose from the floor (seriously!). When I reported this in the morning they: Did nothing until that evening when I reminded them Came in at 6pm, removed the toilet, then said it would take three hours to put it back, so we would have to move to another room. Gave us a room too small for a rollaway bed for my son, so he had nowhere to sleep. Told us that if we left our luggage in the orginal room (which we would be going back to the next day), they would charge us for two rooms. When I complained about this, called security. I was actually quite frightened by the whole experience. We moved into the Hilton for the last two days, which was not much more money and absolutely lovely. I do not know why the staff of the Roosevely behaved the way they did but I don't see why anyone would risk similar treatment. Apart from the lobby, almost any hotel in New York would be better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt is a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: ejpiii
Reviews.Content: Because of work in New York, we stay in the city about a month out of each year. We have stayed in many hotels in midtown as a result. The Roosevelt was a nice find, very close to Grand Central Station and within easy walking distance to the theaters, the mid town business district and Times Square. The lobby is among the best in the city, and the restoration work is near perfect without looking plastic.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what expected”
Reviews.Author: Sussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my family four nights at the Roosevelt Hotel recently. The lobby and entrance was fancy and the hotel had a nice, classical atmosphere. We wanted to have a nice family holliday and tried to ignore certain things but now afterall, it is worth mentioning for others. 1.The room-booking: We had long in advance asked for two twins close to eachother; we were put in totally separated floors. We asked to be moved and that couldn't be done until next day. We agreed to do this because we were garanteed that the rooms would be next to eachother. We packed everything and checked out the next morning and were convinced that the problem would be solved when we arrived on the afternoon from the city tour. Result: the new rooms were on same floor but not even same corridor. As a result, our new rooms were also smaller and gathered round the NOISY air conditioner-system in the yard. (Not a nice view, I can tell you…just pipes and metal cubes). We gave feedback and were offered to change again, but not until next day...it sounded rather ridiculous given that we could not be sure the the same wouldn't happen again so we stayed in our rooms. After all, we reasoned, the hotel is only for sleeping (if you managed from the noise..). It is worth mentioning that the rooms were rather dark and the bathrooms small. 3. The lobby service (tourist info): It seemed like one of the older gentlemen had little clue of what he was advising to guests. On our last day (Columbus day), we had planned to do some last shopping. We asked about the opening hours of a department store near to ground cero as we were not familiar with this holliday. He said that the stores would not open until 11 o'clock due to sunday-schedule. We thought it was a pitty and decided to take it easy with a coffee in the loppy and so on. However, when we left the hotel for a last walk and to look for the parade at 10.00am, we noticed that the stores were open! It was too late to take us to the south due to traffic and we were very disspointed as we realised that the department store had been open since 7:45am according to normal schedule. Not nice for your last day. We also asked simultaneously about the best way to get a taxi for four to the JFK. He said that no normal taxi would take us, so he offered to book a bigger taxi, though it would cost up to 110$! It sounded incredible (we had payed 47$ JFK-Manhattan) and decided to look for another option. Well, it appeared that the black Lincolns outside the entrance only charged 50$ and had no problem with taking us all. The worst thing was that this gentleman had a rather arrogant attitude and probably just didn’t want to admit that he didn’t know so we could have asked elsewere. (luckily we chose to ask the portiere about the taxi...) So, as a summary: small things determine the quality of a hotel and service can well compensate faults in the facilities....In this, Roosevelt hotel fails in filling the expectations. If you still choose to stay at Roosevelt, hope you have better luck! We are looking for another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights - 4 adults in 2 double beds. Great value for money in the middle of Manhattan. Rooms were clean and tidy - a bit small for 4 adults but we were only in the room to sleep! There are so many things to see within easy walking distance from the hotel. Close to Grand Central Terminal. Air conditioner a bit noisy. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not first choice - would stay as a last resort”
Reviews.Author: fundivergirl
Reviews.Content: Mmmm - tough one here. The staff were great and the rooms not as bad as expected, but come on!!! It's 2005 time to not have blankets on beds anymore. The rooms are very small and you may struggle to walk between the TV cabinet and the bed. The walls are very thin as well so it's hard not to hear the conversations going on in the room next to you. Overall - I would probably stay again if it weren't for the blankets as I don't mind a small room as long as it's comfortable. The rooms are very very small though and have a small shower room only. This wouldn't be my first choice at all but it's conveniently located and offers good value for NY.

Reviews.Title: “What are peoples problems”
Reviews.Author: UkRicky
Reviews.Content: Any one thinking of going to New York and staying at this hotel and may have been put off by some of the negative reports FORGET THEM. This is a great hotel in an ideal location. We traveled with our 15 year old son and had more than enough space in our room (9th Floor) even after we had shopped till we dropped????. The only complaint is that the beer is expensive but it is expensive any where else we tried but you are not there to drink and you are only going to be sleeping in your room so why care. So go and enjoy because you will be in for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, would use again”
Reviews.Author: Nicolaglasson
Reviews.Content: We are from London and stayed at this hotel in July, everthing about it was really good. Central location, without being noisy. Theres a great restaurant downstairs for breakfast and there is also a really nice bar in reception after you've been out all day. The rooms aren't massive, but more than enough for a city break and all very clean. I would stay here again if I wen to NYC and would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Slow elevators and small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: caflygrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, Sept 13th and 14th. The street outside the hotel was closed because of the UN so the cab couldn't drop me off right at the door and I couldn't get a cab from the hotel during the stay. I had to walk over to 5th Ave and try to flag one myself or walk. Just inside the entrance is a flight of stairs to the lobby and while there is an elevator, it appears to be for the bellman. So I started to carry all my luggage up the stairs when halfway up, a bellman saw me and came to help me. Check in was quick and the bellman waited for me, carried my luggage up to my room, and set it up for me. The room was small!! I've stayed in many European rooms and this was just as small. It was about 12' x 12' with just enough room for a queen sized bed and two night stands. The bathroom was small with just enough room for the sink (no counter space!), a toilet, and the shower. It was nice and clean though. My biggest gripe was the morning I checked out. I headed out to the elevators around 8:15am with all my luggage. There were already 3 or 4 people waiting there. Well, it's a good thing they put chairs by the elevator because I waited 10 min for an elevator to go down. They have SIX elevators and only one appeared to be going up or down. The first one down that came was packed full (at which point one person waiting headed down the stairs). That same elevator came back up at which point one person got in, rode it up, and then rode it back down. Of course it was packed when it got to our floor again. Waiting for the elevator was making me late so in my heels and suit, I picked up my two pieces of luggage and proceeded to walk down the 7 flights of stairs to the lobby. And I wasn't the only one! There were tons of people in the stairwell dragging their luggage down. Then when I got to the lobby, I had to go down those extra stairs to the entrance. This time no one helped me. I asked the man at the door to flag me a taxi (the hotel is on a corner so I thought he'd at least try to get me a taxi on the street that wasn't closed) and all he did was tell me to go down to 5th Ave and get one there. So I rolled all my luggage over and after unsuccessfully trying to flag a taxi, a policeman saw me and helped me. My meeting that day was at the W Hotel in Union Square and what a difference in service!! People to open the door for you, carry your luggage, flag a taxi... and I wasn't even staying there! Unless you are between the Roosevelt hotel and staying at the Motel 6, I wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and my daughter returned in July, after a 4 night stay at the Roosevelt. I really can't complain about the rate, since I am a Travel Agent, and was given a very low rate, especially for being at a very centrally located New York hotel. However, the room that we were given, was so small for the three of us, especially with the Rollaway bed for my daughter, we had virtually no room to move around. The bathroom was also so very small, only one person could be in there at one time! The air conditioning was horrible, it seems like it put even more humidity in the air than what it normally is like at that time of year! Excellent location, just down the street from Grand Central Station, with lots of food vendors, and one of the best markets I have ever seen! The lobby of the hotel is very spectacular, but kind of fools you into thinking that the rooms will be nice! I would have gladly paid more to be upgraded to a better room, but the staff said there was no availability to upgrade due to a big meeting taking place at that time. Bottom line, pay the extra money to reserve a more deluxe room, or stay at a hotel that has larger rooms like the Wellington

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we were unlucky”
Reviews.Author: smarsh49
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel but were were dogged by problems during our stay (23rd-29th Aug). Having booked with expedia a month earlier we arrived at 19.15 having travelled for about 19 hours to be told that they'd overbooked the day before and that our room was not ready. We were offered complementary drinks and appetisers but with 2 kids we could have done without the hassle. We got into our room about an hour later and then couldn't sleep because a terrible noise started up about 9.00 p.m. At 1.30 a.m. I could take it no longer and got dressed and went outside to find workmen, generators and lights going right below our room. I asked if it was an emergency and was told that it was ongoing roadworks that would happen every night. So I went straight to the front desk and requested a room change for the following day. I was told to pack my bags and leave them in the room while we went out and that they would be moved for us. After breakfast the next day I thought I'd double check and was told that in fact I had to pack my bags, bring them down for storage and then put my name on a waiting list. We did this by 9.00 a.m. and when we got back at 17.15 it was clear that nothing had happened. They gave us an upgraded room and two free breakfasts (not bad as breakfast is $24 each+ tax!) but again, with a family in tow we could have done without the hassle. When I got home I discoved that my credit card had been debited 3 times by the hotel when I'd not charged anything to the room. So I had to phone America and was told that the computer had been taking random nightime debits! Again it was sorted out courteously, and the hotel is nice but all the niggles took the edge off of our holiday. A shame because it is in an excellent location and a film crew was even shooting there one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel for 2 nights. I booked the hotel through Expedia and got great value for money. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York and I would definately visit again. If you prefer the oldy worldy, luxury look of hotels rather than really modern this is for you. Everywhere was spotlessly clean, I couldn't fault it really. The only downside is the expensive charges for phone calls, but then I guess that is the same in most hotels in NY. It's in a fantastic location for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here, I was a bit worried about staying at the Roosevelt, but it was great. The lobby is amazing - just like the pictures if not better. Real wow factor. The rooms are less impressive, but still have the old charm of the lobby. Our room was large and very clean. You did however need the lights on all the time as it was dark, due to being surrounded by other tall buildings. We particularly liked the bar and restaurant, although we only ate there once as it was expensive. The location was also really good for Grand Central Station and Fifth Avenue. In fact we walked to all the major sites we wanted to see apart from the Staten Island Ferry, and we just took the tube from Grand Central so that was easy too. All in all, would recommend if you like traditinal style old hotels with wow factor and want somewhere central to get about.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, But Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel looks like, smells like, and acts like dozens of hotels in New York City. It is a renovated older building with small rooms and impersonal service. However, this hotel tends to be less expensive than most and provides the same accommodations and ambience as more expensive hotels. If you can get a good deal on this hotel, it isn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst hotel we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly disappointed with the Roosevelt, the only plus was the location. The room we were allocated stank of smoke and was really small, dark and dirty. It felt horrible sleeping there for the one night we ended up staying (we were booked in for 3 nights). We checked out the next day as we couldn't bear another night in the hotel. Maybe we were unlucky but I certainly would not have expected this standard from a hotel that was supposed to be a good hotel and had such high ratings on the trip advisor site. A major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “The Rossevelt lovely old fashion charm”
Reviews.Author: sistravelFrederickMD
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel twice this summer and both visits were excellent. The hotel has an old fashion charm similar to the Plaza hotel. Although the rooms are on the small side it is big enough to accommodate a king size bed, desk and chair, 2 side tables a tv/bar cabinet and a extra comfy chair. The bathroom is small, but adequate. The walk in closet allows for extra space. They have some really good rate specials that include a full breakfast in the morning that is excellent. All the freshest foods: fruits, breads, and omelet /waffle chef, breakfast meats and cereals. The location is an easy walk to Times Square or Rockefeller Center. It is considered at business hotel so it is close to Grand Central station and Park Ave. It seemed to be used by many foreign tourist as well as business people. They have a very nice business office. The staff was helpful and the housekeeping staff very friendly. The lobby and bar area is very pleasant, as well as a landmark location. I have stayed in many NYC hotels but this one is defiantly one of my top picks.

Reviews.Title: “great place loved it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel for 5 days then going to las vegas. i thought the hotel was great it was the best hotel i hav been to. i really injoyed my stay at the hotel. we arived at the hotel at 9:00am and the cheaking time was 12:00 they took our bags n we had a look around new york. we went back to our hotel and our room was ready we went to our room and they was great. they was very big and roomey. in the moring i went down to the lobey and got something from the little shop called 'theos' (the O.J was GREAT!!!) i loved my stay and i am goin back again this year and i cant wait

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in NYC. Priceline hotel for $140 a night, and a great value at that. Room was nice, clean. Was on the 9th floor, view was of 45th street. Good location in East Midtown. Very close to Grand Central and Times Sq. Hotel offers parking for $50 a day, but there are cheaper lots close by ($32-40/day). Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good For the Money”
Reviews.Author: ISMA
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel becaue of its cheap rates. This hotel has a very nice lobby and an excellent location on Madison Ave. The staff were also very nice. The rooms were satisfactory and perfectly livable and about what you would expect, although they could use a little work. Our room on the fourth floor had dirty windows, a small bathroom and a damaged/noisy air conditioning unit (no central air). Still, because of the rate it was a good deal, and I would recommend this hotel for short stays and/or weekend trips.

Reviews.Title: “The impossible challenge: Find a better hotel in NYC for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What more can I say! Excellent in every aspect!! Good size room for NY, spotless clean, perfect midtown location, good service, all in all if there is a better hotel in midtown NY for the price then I'll eat my Statue of Liberty hat!! Will not stay anywhere else when in NY its that good!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, no good”
Reviews.Author: mvgeek
Reviews.Content: Fine old hotel, splendid lobby, fine location. Reception & bellhop service very good. Fine & pricey breakfast buffet. Had inexpensive single room, 3rd floor. Dark and stuffy. Uncomfortable hard bed. Too warm even in April because no ventilation to outside: the A/C unit didn't cool or ventilate, and window couldn't open (looked out on a roof, had to be fastened shut.) Called to change rooms, and got helpful response. Packed and left bags w bell captain, left key with Reception, with arrangement to pick up key to new room upon returning in late afternoon. Did day's work, came back, tried to pick up new key. Reception had no idea what I was talking about; eagerly agreed when I asked for the duty manager. With some trouble, after first indicating there were no rooms, they got me a room on 7th floor, slightly larger, where things worked right. This one had a chair to sit in, in which you couldn't read (no light) or watch TV (wrong placement and angle). Someone is unclear on the concept. Oh, and I don't at all like their Wayport Internet service. Worst Internet access I've had in a hotel. The famous Gotham Book Mart is 1/2 block away. Great place. You can buy books there, but the Roosevelt doesn't expect you to read them.

Reviews.Title: “V. Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stumbled onto the Roosevelt when planning an impromptu visit to NYC and would definitely stay there again. The hotel was lovely and is just a quick walk to Times Square, Bryant Park and multiple subway stops. I would recommend the Roosevelt to any of my friends going to the city.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: yummymum
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 2-6th 2005. Service was awesome from the moment we stepped in. Very helpful in finding anything we needed to know about NYC. My husband and I had a deluxe room with 2 double beds. Very spaciuos! Very clean! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean. First time at a hotel in nyc and I was worried about this. Rooms were clean but our first room was very small with a double or queen bed, as is expected in nyc. I requested a different room and we got a much larger room with a king sized bed at no extra cost. We got a great rate with priceline and there were no extra charges at all when we checked out. Service was excellent. Bellman was nice. I left a shoe in my old room and they searched for it and within half an hour gave us a call and brought it up. The only negative is that there are not a lot of little shops and restaurants right around the hotel. There are a few expensive restaurants and large chain stores a block away but I may choose to stay in a different hotel for that reason only. Cab ride to almost anywhere is about 6-8 dollars since it is in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: Ryker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt in June this year. We were worried about what we would get for our money but we were so happy when we got there. The staff were all so friendly and helpful. The room was lovely and most of all clean. The location was absolutely wonderful - right in between ESB and Central Park and no more than a $10 taxi fare around the city. Heaps of inexpensive eateries around the area as well. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Noisy, poor service and complete rip-off on phone calls ($26/min)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Warning: This hotel charges $26 per minute for a direct dial telephone call to the UK and there is no warning that they are going to charge you this complete rip-off pricing! Most guests seem to have an argument with the check-out desk when they first see the bill. The room was noisy (despite saying rooms are "soundproofed") and the staff surly. They were mean at Breakfast in allowing only one small glass of orange juice, despite charging $18 + tip for a simple buffet breakfast. The bed was uncomfortable and the room very small. This hotel was supposedly refurbished relatively recently, but this did not show. In summary, avoid this hotel if you possibly can!

Reviews.Title: “A dodgy place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I never had such a awful experience while travelling!!! after contingencies in having my room ( keys not working, wrong floor comunicated ) I was in extremely unconfortable conditions: shower only cold for nearly two hours after my complaning. the bed was unconfortable and above all so dirty. Notwithstanding my compalnings I had to wait even to have my bed clened up. Never again in this bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at The Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at The Roosevelt Hotel. It was our first visit to New York and wasn't sure what to expect but we had a great time. All of the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. Check-in was easy and our luggage was taken straight up to our room. The Superior room was very welcoming and nicely decorated although on the cosy side but there was enough space for our needs. The bathroom was also on the small side but served its purpose. The only downside was the room was quite dark as the building opposite blocked the sun for most of the day but this is probably to be expected in NY. The hotel was in an excellent location, within walking distance of The Empire State Building. Times Square, Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue and Central Park. After a hard days shopping and sight-seeing the hotel bar was extremely inviting. Again the staff were very friendly, I would recommend the martinis and mini chocolate cake which was delicious! A fantastic stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Teddy would be proud”
Reviews.Author: Louise1072
Reviews.Content: My daughter-in-law booked my husband and me into the Roosevelt because of the bargain price. When we go back, it will be for the friendly, helpful staff, the location (near Grand Central Station), and the sense of history preserved in the beautiful lobby. Our room (standard, not deluxe) was clean; the king-size bed was comfortable. When we noted that there was no coffeemaker, a call to the front desk solved the problem in 10 minutes. Granted, the closet was small and in need of a makeover, the bathroom was typical of the city's older hotels, but we went to NYC to enjoy the city, not camp out in a hotel room. We were very happy with the accommodations and extremely pleased with the Roosevelt's staff. Thanks to the bell captain for storing my luggage after checkout time, so that I could spend a day shopping before I left for the airport; thanks to the "whistling bellman" who performed the most daunting task - getting us a cab in the pre-theater transportation madhouse. I'll look forward to another stay at the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: BlenderBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Expected micro sized rooms and indifferent attitude but was pleasently surprised. Early check in was no problem last Saturday and our room (2 Queens) was at least 275 sq feet. Location was ideal, 2 blocks from Grand Central and the Lexington avenue line. Can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “The service quality varies”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite the great location and comfortable bedding, the service really needs to be improved. It depends on whom you talked to at the counter! We checked in with two bookings: one is for the first three nights and the other the continuing two nights with another group of people. After two days, one of the staff in her night shift asked us to checked out with all our luggages. When we did so the next morning, another lady at the counter wondered why we were asked to leave the rooms that we'd already felt comfortable with and suggested us to re-check in the previous rooms. O.K. Fine. We were like first-visiting-travelers, re-entered the rooms with all packed stuff. Besides, even though our travel agent had informed us that breakfasts were not included, the lady said she would talk to her manager to see if all of us could have breakfasts, not just one of us (weird record in the computer). Later that day, a male staff , with terrible and arrogant attitude, said he hadn't no idea what we were talking about and refusedd to check with his colleagues in any ways. Hello! We were just trying to figure it out. That's all! Also, it took the staff 40 minutes to send up a piece of soap, which was supposed to be there after housekeeping!! That's how the service is with a room charging more than $260 per night! I won't say it is a single instant. Indeed, it carries out many unpleasant experiences. Why should I need to suffer from those time-consuming arguments when I am occupied by tight business schedule and all I ask is a place where I can take a rest?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kim05
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the Roosevelt as it was within easy reach of most major attractions. We would stay there again upon our return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival I had to argue my way into a non smoking room as I had requested one but there were "none available" after much insistance one became "available" out of thin air. I was told that, as I had booked on the internet, the type of room was merely a request and not guaranteed. My colleague had to settle for two singles having requested a King. Staff spend alot of time talking to one another or on the telephone whilst on the Job. The hotel is very old and needs serious updating (which I suppose would cost a fortune as it is enormous), TV's are small, no mini-bar or robes and large noisy airconditioners. Not for people who like the good things in life!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and we did a lot of homework beforehand on where to stay. In truth, everywhere is not far from being central because there's so much packed onto the island, but the Roosevelt didn't disappoint us and we really enjoyed our stay there. It's in a good location - just round the corner from Grand Central Station and within walking distance of almost everywhere - if you stay anywhere in Midtown on the East side you can't really go wrong. The Roosevelt Hotel is 80 years old so it's not flashy and modern with fantastic plumbing, but it has a grand, old opulence that's very welcoming and appealing, particularly when you've been walking your feet off all day! We were told not to bother with room service because it's expensive, but we ate in one night (too tired to do anything else) and the service, and the food, were excellent. We absolutely loved New York - we spent five days there, but will need to go back several more times to enjoy it thoroughly! As well as doing the sights, there's obviously the shopping - Century 21 opposite Ground Zero is amazingly good value for footwear (the rest of the shop is a bit like TK Max) and we found an absolutely brilliant diner that was streets ahead of the rest - Westway Dinner at 614 Ninth Avenue (between 43rd &44th streets). It's a bit out of the way, but we went back more than once because nowhere else was half as good! Have a fantastic trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small old rooms.”
Reviews.Author: LicaC
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over Memorial Day weekend. A fantastic location right near Times Square and 5th Avenue. Friendly staff, grand lobby entrance and busy lounge restaurant so it impresses initially. BUT, it is an old hotel so the rooms reflect that. Small rooms, faulty plumbing (which was remedied right away), basic bathroom appearance, no views from windows, no minibar, thin walls (I heard upstair's night time bed creaking activities). But overall, clean and safe for the price. There is an in-room safe and the concierge will keep your luggage if you check in-out early. It's a nice hotel, but the W and Mandarin Oriental are much much nicer. Just know that you get what you pay for in NYC. Enjoy the city instead of staying in the room. Recommended for the price..(got it for $151/night on Priceline).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price. Good size room!!”
Reviews.Author: MayJune67
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire during Memorial weekend with at $173/night and $407 for 2 nights after tax. We loved the location. Right next to Grand Central station. 5 min. walk to time square, 10 to central park and Empire State building. Can't beat that. The room is not super big but good size for 2 (probably after staying in Cosmopolitan Hotel in Tribeca, we were pretty happy with how big the room "relatively" is). The room is clean and the bed is comfortable. The only thing is the bath tub. not with a comfortable angle to lay in there. And the concierge service was never available. In general, we like it there. And with the great price we've got, we will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just met my aunt, cousins, and other family members in NYC for the Memorial Day weekend. We had a wonderful stay at The Roosevelt. We signed up for e-mail messages and received a wonderful promotion. We stayed for two nights at $200.00 and received the third night free. Also included in the promotion was the breakfast buffet and a sack lunch(which was great). The staff was friendly and easy to work with. They stored our luggage for free when we arrived to early for check-in, as well as when we had a later flight. The room was a little small. We had two small double beds. The bathroom was small as well. My relatives had a king bed which made the room look a little bigger. The food was great. The lounge was very comfortable and cozy. We enjoyed our stay! We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - great location”
Reviews.Author: knightline
Reviews.Content: Here on business - paid $220 for the deluxe room - a corner room overlooking 45th St and Madison Ave. This is the largest non-suite room - don't stay in a smaller room than this!! The regular rooms are just too small. Even a suite should work if you get a good price. The rooms are clean, they offer 24-hour room service, water pressure is good - shower was great. TV was kind of small - and no mini-bar - but for the price and the tremendous location this hotel is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: MoragGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a girls shopping trip and had a great time. We had chosen the hotel after reading the great reviews. The doormen were really cool and extremely helpful. We loved breakfast at The Roosevelt Hotel. We were a bit disapppointed it was not possible to see a cocktail menu in the lounge bar. From 3 golden girls.Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Average, but served it's purpose!”
Reviews.Author: Pegstar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt for 7 nights and found it to be average quality. The room was small with a slightly damp smell on the first day and the bathroom is very dated and in basic condition. The beds are very firm (to put it nicely) and the staff were generally indifferent to us being there at all. With this said the positives are the location, quiet enough area (for NYC) in the cleaner part of town (near 5th Ave) and we never caught a taxi the whole time we were there! as most things are close enough to walk to. So all in all for a place to leave your luggage, have a shower and some sleep the Roosevelt does just fine, you spend minimal time there anyway, but if it's luxury your after this is not the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel for the third time. At the corner of Madison and 45th, the location is wonderful. Just a few blocks to Times Square and just a couple of blocks from Rockefeller Plaza and St. Patrick's Cathedral on Fifth Avenue. We had a wonderful nightly charge of 159.00 (for New York, that is good) and that included a super breakfast buffet. Lobby is beautiful, rooms are average. . . but in New York, who stays in the room? Room Service was prompt. Definitely a great value for New York.

Reviews.Title: “Room for 5”
Reviews.Author: ltgnd
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend at the roosevelt with wife and 3 little ones. Standard room was big enough for all. Room was very clean and kids slept on floor. Could have easily fit a roll away or two. Service was very good. hotel was sold out and when I called for extra blankets and pillows I had them within 5 minutes. Lobby was nice and hotel is in great location. Valet parking is a nice touch. Only negative is trying to get an elevator close to check out time. we were on 5th floor and every elevator(6 of them) was full on the way down.Ending up taking stairs, but not enough of a negative to stop me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful, the location could not have been better. It backs onto Grand Central Station, so food is only a block away. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast which was pricey - but worth it - after a red eye flight. We walked to everything from the Roosevelt which saved us a lot of money in cab fares. The hotel rooms were clean and very comfortable. The hotel has a buisness centre and a gym. The staff was very helpful with directions and setting us up with bus tours. When I go back to NY I will be planning on staying in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ltorres93
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. It was awful. Extremely small room. It reminded me of a room in a cruise ship. No place to even put your luggage. In the bath you could reach your toothbrush while bathing. Service was poor. Checked out by a witch. Not reccmende for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Roosevelt on March 25,2005 to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. Since we arrived prior to check in, our bags were checked for us so we could enjoy our time in the city. When we did check in the room, it was very clean and a comfortable size (superior room). The staff, the location and the decor helped us have a very memorable stay. P.S. Use the subways for transportation to far away locations. You are so close to Grand Central and it is an easy, inexpensive way to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, just don't leave items behind!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Roosevelt Mar 19th - 24th. The location of the hotel is excellent. We could walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Theaters, and shopping. We had 2 rooms that were very nice and clean, 1 room had a small bathroom, no tub, just a shower but was ok for us. The staff was very nice and helpful in every way. However, after returning home, we realized we had left a coat and a make- up palette in each room. When I called the hotel I was given the Lost and Found department. What a joke! I think the only purpose of this department is to tell you tough luck! They kept stating that the rooms had other guests in them and that they were not allowed to bother those guests to see if they had found our things. I asked them to check with Housekeeping, as both items should have been easily discoved when the room was cleaned. The man I spoke with told me that he could not do that, if something is found, the maids would have immediately turned them in. What a joke!!! He pretty much said that he was extremely busy and that he really did not have time at the moment to worry about my stuff. He did take my name and number after I insisted he check with housekeeping, and then he told me if I did not hear from him, that I was out of luck. I have stayed in many hotels and when I have left something behind, it has always been returned. I am greatly disappointed in the way I was treated about the lost items, and now will not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant time at The Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: sjh2005
Reviews.Content: I had an excellant 5 night stay at The Roosevelt in March. It has a very good location, right next to Grand Central Terminal, the Chrysler Building and the Rockefeller Centre. Most of the attrations in Mirtown Manhatten can be reached on foot with Times Square being less than 10 minutes walk away. There is a subway station at Grand Central Terminal from which you can travel all over New York for just $2.00. The hotel lobby is like something from the 1920's. I would agree with other reviews that the rooms in The Roosevelt are on the small side but you don't go to New York to stay in your room. The only problem we had with the room was the safe which on arrival would not work. Once this was reported to the reception someone (a maintenance man in a suit) came to fix it straight away. There is an excellant breakfast in the restaurant (Teddy's Table) with lots of choice and friendly staff such as the Chinese Head Waiter who trys to get you to have the 'healthy waffles'. However, it was sometimes like sitting in a business meeting as this is a favourite hotel for business types and conferences. I did not eat in the hotel restaurant for dinner as there are many restaurants nearby. The service in the bar can be slow unless you where a suit and the choice limited. No cappucino. Overall, I will be coming back to this hotel next time I go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: moonpoppy70
Reviews.Content: After much searching we finally booked this hotel a few weeks before we flew out for Thanksgiving 2003. We chose it for its very central location in Manhattan and for that alone, it was perfect! The rooms were clean, smart and of a fair size 'tho our room was quite gloomy as it was in the "middle" of the hotel; the bathroom was tired-looking but always left very clean. We felt that the porters could be a little more watchful (indeed our porter left my partners hand-luggage outside the room, thank heavens it wasn't stolen before we realised it was missing!) and the concierge wasn't quite as helpful as we expected when it came to finding tickets for Broadway shows. The foyer was stunning - a very grand entrance hall with the most beautifully-decorated Christmas tree taking up a good portion of it! We didn't eat at the restaurants or have a drink in the bar but it certainly looked busy at all times as we passed by. The reception staff were fabulous when I was unexpectedly taken ill on our last night there (thank you!) and the doorman gave us a few handy tips when it came to catching a cab back to the JFK Airport. All in all, a lovely hotel with a few nice shops to browse in - not that you need to when you're actually ON Madison Avenue - and one we are definitely hoping to return to again for this Thanksgiving with family in tow!

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt right on the money !!!”
Reviews.Author: TouristTed
Reviews.Content: Having recently enjoyed a three night stay at The Roosevelt I can only echo the positive comments made on the site. The staff were friendly and the conceirge was always helpful and efficient in dealing with our requests. I must say I was pleasently surprised at how big our room was on the 11th floor - not a penthouse suite, but generous compared to the average room I'd expect in central London for the same price. It was clean, quiet (no sign of the dreaded "paper walls" ...) and it had a safe, which certainly proved useful for passport / iPod storage. It may not be the most impressive looking building on the outside, but it's location could not be much better - pretty quiet but very close to the action. One tip I would pass on is to check the Roosevelt website for special offers - we waited until last minute when a "USA Today" rate was advertised on their site - this was a good $30 cheaper than their standard rate, and included breakfast for two (which was absolutely marvellous but would be expensive if paid for separately ...) Overall though we would definitely go back there when we next head to New York ...

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, shame about the rest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed five nights at The Roosevelt (and picked the hotel based on the reviews here). Certainly has a big lobby that's very 1920s grand. But of course you don't stay in the lobby. Our room was on the 17th floor. The basics were OK - large good quality bed, little street noise, walls solid enough to give you privacy, only one blood stain on the bed linen, etc. The rest was poor. Not enough hanging space for clothes, large and noisy heating units, cracked and flaking paintwork, dirty nets, old heavy brown furniture with plenty of marks and dents, nylon carpet that needed a good clean, big black cheap Phillips television with poor reception, florid decor all mismatched and gone drab. The bathroom was small to middling, the bath very small and getting grubby, the shower good, but with no extractor everything got misted and damp very quickly. A very basic and functional beige tiled bathroom. As with the bedroom, everything was approaching worn out (the hairdryer looked like a museum piece). Room service was adequate. You get through to an answerphone and they call you back a few minutes later. The staff hit you with the same patter every morning (gets tedious) and shamelessly dig for tips regardless of how long they kept you waiting. Service generally followed the same model. Plenty of syrup and mock concern, sure, but delivered with blatant unconcern for anything except the dollars in your wallet (tip low, or not at all, if you want to hear a sincere remark). The restaurant should be avoided. Food comes heavily salted and overcooked, my salad was memorably disgusting, the place anyway looks like Hell's anteroom, and prices are optimistic. For the same money, you'll get a great meal at The Oyster Bar just over the way at Grand Central Station. We wouldn't recommend Eammon's Bar (up the street) unless you just want convenience - the food there was warmed up and ordinary. Final score: Worst hotels exist and service was OK (apart from being mindlessly insincere). Room quality was poor (we were in a group of 12, everyone got a more or less shabby room). Location is good (bear in mind that Manhattan isn't half as big as you'd think, so being in midtown is only a modest bonus). Would we stay at The Roosevelt again? Unlikely. Lobby apart, this was a poor place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ravishing Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: SharonCole1973
Reviews.Content: Loved it! I stayed at the Roosevelt for four nights and couldn't fault it. Really, it's spot on and I'm going back. The lobby is as fantastic as it looks on the website, the location couldn't have been better and the staff were marvellous. We were treated like superstars for the duration of the stay. The concierge, Bill, was a phenomena. He booked us theatre tickets, dinner and our helicopter trip which saved us spending hours in a queue at the heliport. Our room on the 16th floor was warm and comfortable with two double beds and a clean bathroom. It wasn't huge but it was certainly big enough for the time spent in it. We returned to our room at 1am and were out again at 6am. There really is too much to do in NYC. This was supposed to be a once in a lifetime trip for me but everything is so fabulous I'm planning trip no.2 very soon. And I'll be staying at the Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “Unnecessary splendour”
Reviews.Author: Maailmanmatkaaja
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel gives an impression of a five-star hotel, but as soon as you reach your room, you return to reality. The rooms were very small not well cleaned up. (We had a plastic knife and other trash on the floor, requested a clean-up, after which the room was still untidy.) The overall quality of the room didn't correspond to the price, but hey I quess it's just "The Manhattan premium". If you enjoy the common areas in the hotel, this is perfect. But be sure not to spend too much time in the room. However, the service was somewhat good and the location was terrific. There's also a great breakfast cafe right next to the hotel. All in all, the hotel wasn't a big disappointment, but I would consider something else next time I visit N.Y.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain, it's excellent”
Reviews.Author: Nicci_UK
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Roosevelt. There is absolutely nothing i can complain about, everything was top class, considering how cheap we got it for. The lobby looks like a movie scene, and the staff, location, rooms, facilities couldn't be better. I'd recommend it to anyone and will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at The Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We live in Orlando, so my husband and I decided to travel to New York City for a weekend of cold and snow, to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. After reading many reviews, we decided on The Roosevelt. We could not ask for more. We arrived at 10:30 a.m. on a Friday and they let us check in right away. No line, no fuss. The front desk employee was the nicest person and even gave us 2 complimentary breakfasts for the next day. It turned out that each breakfast buffet was $26 each, so right there we saved more than $50. And let me tell you, the breakfast is superb, with made to order omelettes and waffles, fresh bagels, pastry, croissants, etc, all kinds of fruit, pancakes, you name it. While we were doing the check in, the assistant manager emerged from a back room and said "oh, the Rivera's are here!!!". Maybe he just looked at the paperwork and saw our last name, but it certainly made us feel very welcome. The lobby is stunning and the staff, very courteous. The room was indeed small, compared to other hotels and resorts we have stayed in, but for New York, it was fine. The room was clean, with plenty of towels and the heater worked wonders. We hardly spent any time in the room--I guess that's how it's supposed to be when there are so many things to do in a city like NY. The hotel location can't be better, just one block from 5th Avenue, 3 blocks from Times Square and the Theatre District, and 3 blocks from the main subway/train station, where you can go anywhere. Can't beat the location, for the price. The lobby bar is also pretty nice at night. While in NY, our flight was cancelled dut to the blizzard of January 22nd, and they not only gave us a special rate for the additional night, but we also got 2 more complimentary breakfasts, worth $52. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “This grand old hotel of New York did not let us down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from six wonderful nights at the Roosevelt Hotel. We went with open minds having read mostly good (but sometimes bad) tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed though. The lobby was lavish and very grand - quick and efficient reception staff soon had us on our way to our room - all of the staff we came across couldn't have been friendlier. We had an ordinary standard room which was very spacious even with a king size bed, and larger than you would expect for a NYC standard hotel room. The bed was perfect, crisp and spotlessly clean bedlinen and luxurious scatter cushions. Nice lamps and furniture. The bathroom was spacious with very good quality (and far too many!) towels. The toiletries provided were also very good quality. The housekeeping service was first class and the cleanliness of the rooms was a credit to the staff. You hear horror stories about a lot of New York hotels - this certainly does not apply to the Roosevelt and remember, we were only staying in a standard room. We have stayed in some of the best hotels in the USA and I would not hesitate staying at the Roosevelt next time I am in New York. Having read some of the (very few) negative reviews of this hotel I certainly dispute the following: 1) Pushy and lazy staff and rude doormen: quite the opposite, they couldn't do enough for you and were never pushy. 2) brown water in handbasin: never saw this at all. 3) slow elevators: there were six elevators and they were there immediatly. 4) thin walls, able to hear next door guests: complete rubbish, we never heard a thing and we like a quiet hotel - we didn't expect it in NYC but our room (#1164) was exceptionally quiet. We did not use the bar or the restaurant so cannot comment on these. For breakfast we used a wonderful diner five mornings running called Nino's just round the corner on 46th St. whose omelettes I can thoroughly recommend. Try Bubba Gumps on Times Square for a fun dinner. I can find no fault with this hotel at all and look forward to my next stay at the Roosevelt when next in New York. Robin Stevens

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: birdseyeview
Reviews.Content: We had booked a different hotel, but based on some reviews here, we decided to stay at the Roosevelt. I had made reservations several weeks before and got written confirmation for my 'king size bed' room. We were coming from Venice, Italy and checked in vey late and tired only to find out that they didnt have our room, but a tiny twin bed one. I called the front desk and they told me they didnt have a king size bed room available(even though they had confirmed it previously) and so they gave me that one. (She said it was the hotel policy...) Well, after a- l-o-t of complaining, the next day they moved us to the room we had booked. The rooms are small and the walls are paper thin (you can hear your neighbors talking and if their tv is on, u dont need to turn yours...), but the lobby is indeed very beautiful and the location is excellent. I will not stay there again, because I dont like having to fight for my rights, and having to go through all that annoyance when I'm on vacation. There are other places for the same price or less, and even better located. Try the Milford, for instance.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stopped in this hotel with my boyfriend and his family last july and it was the best holiday i ever had. It is within walking distance of all the main shops and there was an excellent service where you could book all your excersions fromt he hotel. They would even ring up a local restaurant and make a reservation for you if you told them what type and price range. The rooms were excellent and we couldnt have asked for any better. It had the most amaxing lobby I have ever seen at a hotel. A must go for anyone intending to visit new york.

Reviews.Title: “solid quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel after deciding last minute to fly up to New York for New Year's Eve. We really expected hotels to be booked up and outrageously priced, but we were pleasantly surprised by The Roosevelt. We did get a great last minute deal with United Airlines that had the cheapest rate for this hotel than any search engine. The hotel lobby was fabulous. the Christmas tree was still up and really is extraordianary. We expected to wait in line for check in for an extended period, as the line was long. Once again, we were pleasantly surprised when we checked in in under fifteen minutes. The concierge was very helpful recommending restaurants and giving us a map of NYC with detailed directions to the stores that had Christmas window displays. The rooms were adequate. They were, of course, very small; however, we had enough room to maneuver around. That is a plus in this city! the room was clean and included a hairdryer (i had forgotten mine). i can't think of anything negative about the room. while it was not luxury, it was solid quality for a good price. the location of the hotel is fabulous. it is very close to madison avenue, park avenue, fifth avenue, and times square. Subway stops are also very close. All in all, i would stay there again and recommend it to friends who want a quality hotel without breaking the vacation budget.

Reviews.Title: “Faboulous Hotel, a must stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a faboulous hotel to stay in. Me and 3 other girls stayed here for five nights and four days. Our stay at the hotel was very pleasant and added to the whole New York experience. Our room was very clean and very comfortable. The bed and especially the pillows will be missed. It is in a great location so its easy to get to most places. When we came on this site to find a hotel and read the reviews, most were good but a few bad. I am a Londoner and we tell it how it is. This hotel was clean, comfortable, in a superb location and i highly reccommend it to anyone wanting to go and visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd visit to New York during Christmas and both times I have gone by the reviews on this website and it has been great so far. We arrived at The Roosevelt on 12/9/04 and everything the staff did was with a smile. This was a great hotel especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “lovley lobby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and daughter for 7 nights in August 2004. Everything was fine no complaints, only wished the standard of the room matched the lobby which we found did not have enough seating. I have stayed in 4 different hotels in NY and the rooms are all of the same standard unless you pay lots of money. although the hotel is undergoing a refurb. The staff were very helpful when my daughter wanted to buy Lucky Charms Cereal! On the plus side we did have a personal safe in our room. The location is good for 5th ave or Grand Central Terminus or Bloomingdales.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Rules!”
Reviews.Author: RJM62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this excellent hotel in early December. The Roosevelt maintains the ambience and decor of what I expect a New York Hotel to be. Rooms are comfortable, clean and well equipped. Staff are friendly and helpful. The bar area is extremely relaxing and the staff welcoming and chatty. I have visited New York a number of times and have never stayed in the same hotel twice by choice through previous experience. Have already re-booked the Roosevelt for June, it is near perfection and in an ideal location for shopping and subway access via Grand Central Station. The buffet breakfast, although usually extra, is first class. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good lobby, good location, bad room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the outside and the grand lobby it looks like a first class hotel. But wait till you check into your room. I had booked the hotel for two nights but checked out after the first. First the heater was so noisy that I had to make a choice between either sleeping in the quiet or in the cold in the middle of January. The walls are so thin I could practically hear the entire conversation next door. The tub didn't drain when I took a shower. The "device" they call a modem to get 'hi-speed' connection had its power cord missing. When I called to get it fixed, I was put on infinite hold three times and eventually someone did come up but didn't know how to fix the problem (how hard can it be to bring and plug in a power cable into one of their own hotel devices!) I am definitely not staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bock
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our 25th Wedding annivesary, and we thought this hotel was brillant, the lobby is just lovely and I loved to sit there and people watch, the bedroom was very comfortable and the bathroom was spotless clean. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. We will be back to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: money4mice
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an overnight at the Roosevelt. I booked directly from their web site. $139 included and very clean room with 2 double beds, and updated clean bathroom and a fantastic full buffet breakfast. Our rate only was supposed to included an american breakfast for 2, but when we got to the dining room the manager took it upon himself to treat the whole family to the entire breakfast. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant. We've stayed in several NY hotels and the Roosevelt is tops for service, cleanliness, comfort and value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for NYC.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Christmas for 7 nights. The lobby was absolutely grand and captured the 1920's feeling. The location was totally central and we found it very inexpensive to cab it around or walk when the weather allowed. Sal at the front door was helpful and recommended what turned out to be one of our favorite places, Eamonn's Grill. Also Dishes and The comfort Dinner are an easy walk for breakfast. Reservations at Rosa Mexicana are a good idea. The food was the best Mexican ever and be sure to have the tableside prepared guacamole. Food at the hotel was very good and the bar at the lobby is a great place for dessert and people watching at the end of the day. This was my first trip to NYC and we had a super time. We would certainly stay here again. The Roosevelt seemed the perfect place to retire to after seeing the historic sites afterall, it's one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, would definitley stay again and reccomend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
