Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst celebrating my 30th Birthday during the middle of December, the lobby was fantastic great Christmas tree!, the reception staff were friendly and helpful along with the concierge being able to provide maps and "whats on" guides, room was set back from the street so was quite quiet, nicely decorated and comfortable, bathroom was good everything you would expect a bathroom to have! We had a very enjoyable stay at the Roosevelt and would definitley stay there again as the location was central to everything we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “A great value at a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Roosevelt for a pre Christmas two night visit to New York through Hotels and got a great deal at $125 per night. We knew the hotel was old but were pleasantly surprized by the size and comfort of the room and bath. We had an inside room which was very quiet. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were goose down and great. The decor was standard hotel but everything was comfortable. We enjoy deluxe hotels but are starting to question how much more you get for a lot more money - why spend $450 or more for a place to sleep when you can get good quality and comfort for far less.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: scubalvr
Reviews.Content: My mother and I checked in December 13 & checked out this a.m. (12/17). The lobby was beautiful and inviting and our room was ample in size. (Thanks to the posters on this board, I had requested a corner room, quiet). The room and linens were spotless, the bathroom remodeled and very neutral & bright with a white pedestal sink & seemingly new fixtures. The shower head and water pressure were fantastic! (I can't stand a shower head that sprays water in prickly needles.) Of note, my mother broke her toe shortly before our trip and when we awoke on on the a.m. of 12/14, she realized that the airport walking had affected her broken toe. Lawrence at the Roosevelt Hotel made the necessary arrangements & had us in a podiatrist's office a few blocks away within 45 minutes. The only reason I didn't give this an "excellent" is because the food in the bar (we only ate there once - didn't try the restaurant) was less than excellent. Otherwise, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff were absolutely wonderful. And the location can't be beat. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “well located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt in November 2004. Unfortunately, the bedroom was not as luxurious as the public rooms and I missed the tea/coffee making facilities. However, the hotel was very well placed and I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. I would stay at the hotel again but would take a portable tea maker!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for NYC”
Reviews.Author: VegasCanuck
Reviews.Content: I booked my company at the Roosevelt for a convention and it was decent. NYC is a tough hotel market when you are on a budget and this suited our needs. Rooms are small (NYC) and the closets were tiny in both rooms. This was a grand hotel built in the 20's with an elaborate lobby. Roos have big safes. The rooms have recently been renovated and they are quite nice. Bathrooms were small but serviceable. The staff that I dealt with seemed very helpful and eager to help. High-speed internet was hit-and miss in the rooms but I was able to connect to someone’s very fast connection (perhaps from a neighboring building). Would I stay here again? Probably yes but I would try to book at one of the nearby Times Square hotels first. The nearby Equinox health club is awesome as is Dishes, a great place for breakfast just down the street on 45th.

Reviews.Title: “utterley lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Roosevelt over St Patricks day last year and found it to be one of the most pleasant hotel stays that i have ever experienced. I am in the travel industry and know what to look for in a good hotel, and the Roosevelt fitted most of the criteria. As you enter your breath is lost at the sight of the majestic lobby with its italian renaissance style. Simply stunning. The location cannot be beaten. Close to everything and the friendly concierge will direct you if unsure. The only down side to this hotel is that the rooms are a little small. But perfectly pleasant and warm. What really made this hotel for me was the staff. They are the friendliest and most helpful in New York. Not to mention utterly hilarious!! I cannot reccomend this hotel enough! New York's best kept secret.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a safe area of New York. The lobby is gorgeous and very nice for sitting with a cup of coffee. The room was standard for a city, which is to say is was well-decorated but on the small side. The bed had extremely comforatable down pillows. The television could offer more channels, but that's really my only complaint. (We booked through a discount site and the boyfriend refuses to tell me how much we paid because it was part of a birthday gift.)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and found the location to be very good, service was courteous and prompt. Bathroom was too small but the room size was fine. Hotel was very clean, overall I thought it was a very good value for the money. In addition, the hotel bar and entertainment were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: KP&TP
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel several times over the past few months, always on business. I must say that the service is lacking most of the time. On two visits I was locked out of my room and had problems obtaining another key that worked. One time, even the security person's master key didn't open my door. Rooms can be small, but the biggest complaint would have to be the showers!!!!! The temperature control is SO sensitive that a hair width will change it to scalding or freezing and sometimes when you finally adjust it and can handle the temperature, it will change while you are showering and you don't dare try to adjust it!! Heater/AC units are extremely loud and the in room fridge froze everything. Also, room smells are an issue. Location is great, but you will have to wait for an elevator and then fight for space to get on or off the elevator. I will not stay at the property again, would prefer to walk a little further and stay at a more comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research into the best places to stay for price, location and amenities. The Roosevelt Hotel was an excellent recommendation. It is very well located, just off Madison Avenue, and you have access to Grand Central Station and some great bus lines. The rooms were clean comfortable and reasonably well appointed. The customer service was excellent, any problems or queries were quickly responded to. The Hotel was noisy due to the road traffic outside, but this is to be expected in you want to stay centrally.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: drlaz
Reviews.Content: The public spaces and the restaurants are excellent, but the room itself was extremely small (likewise the bathroom), and the mattress not especially comfortable. At $269, a poor value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well me and my friends decided to have a long weekend in New York and after looking at the reviews on trip advisor decided to stay at the Roosevelt and we were glad that we did. I’ve seen a few bad reviews of the hotel on this website but noticed that many more were good. Some people have complained about the noise from the street, we were on the 7th floor and had no problems at all. Some others have complained about the size of the rooms I don’t know if we were lucky but we had a massive room with two large beds an on-suit bathroom with bath and separate shower. My other two friends stayed in another room just down the hall it was a little smaller but had the same beds and still enough space to make it comfortable. The lobby of the hotel was beautiful and what’s more important is that the hotel is perfectly situated in the middle of midtown Manhattan which means you can walk just about anywhere you need to go (we certainly did). Also its right by grand central station so you can use the underground if you need to go further afield. Just round the corner is the empire state building and in my opinion its the best attraction in New York we went up there in the evening to see the sun set over Manhattan it was breathtaking. If your going to New York I would defiantly recommend the Roosevelt and will be staying there the next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Had a brilliant time!”
Reviews.Author: Cambergirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at The Roosevelt Hotel and thought it was fantastic. It's a beautiful grand old hotel. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, the maid did a great job and was very accomodating. The concierge was very helpful in recommending shows, shuttle bus to JFK airport etc. The room itself was clean and comfortable, I can't speak for the internet conection as I didn't use it, but the bed was comfortable and the free use of the safe was much appreciated. The bathroom was rather compact but aren't they all?! It's perfectly located, ideal for most of the sights especially the Chrysler Building and Empire State. The breakfast was rather expensive but there are plenty of delis and shops nearby where you can grab breakfast. I usually got a hot breakfast from the deli right next door and took it back to my room and ate in bed! There's also an ATM (cashpoint) in the deli next door. Tip: make use of the subway shuttle route to and from Grand Central to Times Square. Even if you are scared of the subway this only goes from one stop to the other so it is virtually impossible to get lost and it saves your feet from pounding the pavement! Look for the shuttle signs and the grey/liliac colour 'S' symbol.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: rtbabb
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2-night stay at the Roosevelt. I couldn't have been more pleased!!! The staff was very nice, couteous and helpful - I felt well cared for. Upon check-in, I received a free upgrade from a twin to a double. My room was still small (I prefer to say "cozy"), but spotless, freshly painted and well-appointed. The hotel is right in the center of everything. I spent a lot of time downtown and uptown, so its location was perfect for me. Thank you, Trip Advisor, for leading me to the Roosevelt for a terrific weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Overall Fine Room”
Reviews.Author: ViequesBride
Reviews.Content: We booked a nonsmoking room with two double beds. It was spacious, much more so than I would have expected. The bathroom was a decent size but the sink had a bit of a drainage problem with an attendant odor -- nothing too noxious. The Roosevelt had a nice breakfast buffet for a good price. Overall, the Roosevelt is a decent value with a great location and pretty nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “In a perfect position”
Reviews.Author: TwoUKtravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June on our first trip to New York. The location of the hotel was perfect with Times Square, Grand Central Station and many other sights a very easy walk away. The room was fine, small, but well furnished and very clean. Our room had hair dryer, safe and an iron and ironing board. As well as the main restaurant there is a little take away coffee shop in the lobby which opens at breakfast time as well as a bar for later in the day. The lobby area is attractive and vibrant. There were plenty of lifts and we never had to wait long for one either going up or down. The staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room & great service at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: chem_dr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Roosevelt Hotel in October 2004. While traveling around the city, I enjoyed the close proximity of the hotel to Grand Central Station and to the great shops along Madison Ave. All of the front desk and baggage clerks were polite and helpful. The room was small, but clean and well-maintained. It was bit pricey, but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: formerbelle
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay at Roosevelt. Had read other reviews that suggested to ask for a large room and that was a good idea. I was accomodated and the room was fine. The location is very good. walk to Times Square , St. Patrick's, as well as United Nations and the beautiful Grand Central Station etc. I found the hotel enjoyable and would return. Have seen the front and the lobby as a movie location.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrSnarkyPants
Reviews.Content: The first night I was put on a smoking floor instead of non-smoking. There weren't any rooms available that night but they moved me the next day without a hassle. Rooms were larger than I expected, well furnished, and quiet. Service was excellent, the location is convenient, and the hotel is elegant but not pretentious. Plus you can't beat the rates. Business travelers: the high speed internet service was very slow when I was here. You can get about 44.1 using dialup from the room, so skip the $9.95 wayport connection and use dialup for faster e-mail. Overall, I'm impressed and am adding this hotel to the list of places I'll check first when going to the City.

Reviews.Title: “First rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The negative reviews here must be from some time ago or have been written by people who had a one-off bad time. The Roosevelt is a wonderful hotel. The rooms were absolutely spotless, the staff could not have been more helpful. And the lobby is immaculate, giving you that 1920s feeling or opulence. Locationwise I would have to rate it as one of the best hotels around. There is an entrance to Grand Central Station literally across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice 3.5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OilersRule
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay on the Roosevelt Hotel. This is an older hotel that has been well tended to. The rooms are small, as you would expect in New York, but well appointed. The location is very good. Our limited interaction with the staff was all very pleasant, and check in was a breeze. For the right price, I would go back (booked through Hotwire and paid $175 last minute during a very busy week in NYC).

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stopped there for three nights and really enjoyed it the hotel is in an excellent location ,the staff were friendly and the lobby is worth seeing on its own altogether its well worth stopping at.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt is an Elegant Classic”
Reviews.Author: JCM1949
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is one of my favorite hotels. We were originally booked at the Park Central and moved to the Roosevelt. Location is ideal. We had a beautifully decorated room. Didn't have hot water when we arrived, and the repair man had it fixed within 5 minutes of our call to the front desk. Staff is enormously helpful. All common areas are elegant. It's a very classic and historic hotel. My first choice in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister, soon to be sister-in-law and myself recently traveled to New York City and arrived at the Roosevelt hotel on September, 16 2004 and departed on the 19th. When we got to the hotel we were greeted by a friendly doorman who promptly took our bags and lead us into the lobby of the hotel, which is small but beautifully decorated. We arrived at the hotel around noon and check-in time was not until 3 o'clock but we were taken to our room immediately upon check-in. I will admit that the room was much smaller then it was perceived to be in the pictures we saw, but hey we weren't in the room much anyway. I was a little skeptical due to the reviews I had seen about the Roosevelt, but overall I thought it was an excellent bargain. The restaurant in the hotel was lovely and we were right near Madison Avenue and Herald Square (for great shopping). I would recommend the Roosevelt to people traveling to New York because it is very quaint and not so overwhelming. The staff was friendly and even agreed to hold our bags the last day so that we could wander around the city for a few hours before we had to catch our plane. I will definetely be staying at the Roosevelt again on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband's company chose our hotel and I think they should now make all our travel arrangements, because the Roosevelt was perfect. No complaints about the room, the service, or the restaurant. The lavish bar, tended by Eddie, was a fun retreat every evening.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt December last year with a friend and had a great time. The staff at the hotel were friendly, and helpful. The first night we arrived there late, and the lady at the check in desk told us all the non smoking rooms were gone so she gave us a free upgrade smoking room. The room stank of a thousand fat cigars, so the next morning we requested a non-smoking room and were given a pleasant room, although smaller it was still very comfortable. After we just wanted somewhere to shower and sleep. It was situated ideally, and we were close to all the big attractions. Would definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Roosevelt at the last minute and was pleasantly surprised. The Roosevelt is a quaint, boutique hotel. The hotel is conveniently located in Midtown, walking distance from Grand Central Station. The room and the bathroom are a little small but are clean and the price is reasonable. The rooms do not have coffee makers but there are plenty of coffee shops around the city. The staff is helpful and courteous. If you are expecting a five-star hotel, the Roosevelt is not. It is a nice, clean three-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Roosevelt during a recent 4-day weekend. For its location in Midtown Manhattan, this is a solid value. We booked on Expedia. The "standard" room we got was far smaller than expectations. However, the concierge was very accommodating in procuring for us a larger room for a modest additional cost. Our view, however, was less than spectacular: Overlooking Madison Avenue, and directly into the Bear Stearns building across the street. This is an older hotel. Rooms have been renovated, but are not state of the art, nor are they attractively decorated. However, they are clean, comfortable, and functional. If it's space, gadgets, views, and a romantic atmosphere you're after, then consider other hotels. The lobby bar is comfortable and unpretentious, but not gimmicky. A low-key and pleasant way to spend the evening in quiet chat with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Check it out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 29th to August 2nd 2004, booked via Lastminute.com. In comparison to a typical London hotel, the Roosevelt is in a different league altogether. I cannot think of a single thing to fault, despite the fact that we are normally among the staunchest of critics around. Yes, the room itself was on the small side, but not that small. More importantly it was quiet, had a decent bathroom with bath, shower and obligatory selection of soaps, shampoo and even mouthwash. And it was all impeccably clean and well-maintained. The best aspect was how friendly everyone was. The chambermaids politely greeted us in the morning. We troubled the concierge no end of times with questions. And doorman and porters were equally helpful. A couple of dollars here and there was an acceptable thank you, without going too overboard. Location, as others have mentioned, is perfect. Midtown and a block from Grand Central. Times Square is a five minute walk away. From there, it's only another few minutes, ten at most, and you reach Central Park. The Empire State Building, Chrysler and New York Public Library are all also within a stone's throw. We only used the subway to get down to Wall Street, Ground Zero and Battery Park. The number 4 line from Grand Central takes you straight there. $2 a ticket or $7 for a day pass, I think. All in all, a hotel which will seem luxurious, although it really isn't! Great location, and a well run establishment with high level of service. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Happy honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: yandnmy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in every way from the stylish exterior to the polite, helpful staff inside. We spent an enjoyable 3 nights here and were able to get around the city easily as the hotel is only yards from Grand Central and the subway. The rooms are more than ample in size and are kept meticulously clean. We asked the concierge for advice regarding restaurants and bars and he directed us to nearby Second Avenue where we found great places which were not even mentioned in the guidebooks. We would most definitely stay here again and if you are looking for excellent location, good value and courtesy we would recommend the Roosevelt to you.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Location!!!... The staff was very helpful and courteous. The room was comfortable and cleaned promptly every morning. My husband and I were a bit apprehensive about staying there after reading some of the negative reviews of the hotel, but we had a wonderful stay at this grand hotel. The only thing I might have changed was asking for a room facing Madison Avenue...but no big deal. Loved it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is asthetically pleasing with special attention to the renovated lobby area. The Roosevelt is conveniently located at Madison and 45th, for those unfamiliar; a short walk to Grand Central station. Number 4 subway is a direct line to Yankee Stadium 20-25 minutes. We generally chose to walk to Times Square and Central Park but a Taxi fare is only 6 or 7 dolllars. Our Roosevelt room was smallish but clean and our request for a quiet location was met. There was some sort of dance competition held at the "R" during the weekend of our stay so the place was a flurry of activity. We did request that security address unruly teens and the issue was handled quickly. Overall The Roosevelt is a good value for the money and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SuperSi
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1st of May 2004 for 5 days. Great location literally 2 minutes walk from Grand Central Station, 15 minutes from Times Square. Room clean but a bit of a musty smell although my friends said their room was fine. Fabulous bar but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: truckerdave
Reviews.Content: as soon as we walked in to the roosevelt we knew we had made the right choice,a fantastic lobby which takes your breath away.Very friendly staff,relieved us of our cases straight away and led us to our room,nice size room 2 double beds,big enough for 2 adults 1teen.great location,(just off 5th ave)to walk to times sq,broadway,central park etc, nice bar area lovely big resturaunt(bit pricey,breakfast 19dollars per person we stayed for 5 nights) no tea or coffee facility in room(boo hoo).Overall room very clean and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great vacation at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: scohen
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 8 days and 7 nights at the wonderful Roosevelt Hotel. I had gotten an amazingly low rate over their website in conjunction with the hotel's 80th anniversary but I was leary nonetheless after reading so many negative reviews for the Roosevelt (too much noise, backed up toilets, rude staff, etc.) on Trip Advisor. All I can say is, I don't know where those people who had such a bad experience stayed but it certainly wasn't at the same Roosevelt Hotel I stayed at! The hotel is beautiful, very well maintained, huge rooms and extremely friendly and professional staff. The location, too, is just great. You can get anywhere in New York from the hotel by walking or by taking the Metro (do yourself a favor and purchase a metro pass for the duration of your stay...it's the best bargain in town). I wouldn't hesitate for a minute to stay at the Roosevelt again, or to recommend it most highly to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay with two children”
Reviews.Author: ptdooey
Reviews.Content: Exeeded expectations..impressive lobby upon entry...check in fine...room a good size..as expected...ONly disappointment is we arrived early before the room was ready and took bags to conceirge..he had us carry our own bags downstairs to storage to hold them for us..I thought he would have taken them for us!! Maybe no carts available..anyway...a great hotel location and room was clean..

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Stay 2-9 July 2004”
Reviews.Author: titianbear
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to NYC, 4 of us, 1 senior, 1 adult and 2 children. We had a superior room on the 15th floor - quite but not overly well lit, a view of the Metlife building and a corner of the Crysler was nice, through the tiny but 'opening' window. I had requested a mini fridge prior to arriving which had been confirmed by e-mail, but it was not supplied on arrival. Housekeeping was asked for same and I was told there would be a charge to which I agreed - never seen the fridge! Also asked for extra pillows and they never arrived either. Nevertheless these small incedentials did not in anyway take away from our holiday. The room was kept clean and tidy, beds were very comfy and bathroom spotless. I would have liked a kettle for handiness but the deli next door is so close it didnt really matter. We where able to stock up cold drinks on the A/C and never really missed the fridge. There is supposed to be ice machines near the elevators, but I never saw any. All we required was comfort and clean accommodation, easy access to the subway and the Roosevelt was pefect for all. The only thing that really bothered me was the porters - they are a nuisance only looking for tips, but at least I was prepared for them because of these reviews. Mr Bill (concierge) is brilliant, when you can get him! I have stayed in cheaper and better hotels and my only reason for staying was getting accomodation over the '4th July holiday period. Wouldnt be my first choice, but wouldnt turn it down at the right price..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: virtually_perfect
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NYC was met with some apprehension, having never been to the Big Apple, and reading some negative reviews on the Roosevelt Hotel. Let me tell you, they were unfounded. Due to flight delays, we checked into the hotel at 2am, very weary. We were told that all the non-smoking rooms had been taken, and we would have to be placed in a room on a smoking floor, but that we could be moved to a non-smoking room the following day. For our inconvenience, the sympathetic hotel desk clerk offered us complimentary vouchers for the continental breakfast in the hotel dining room. The breakfast was beautifully presented, buffet style, and a very generous selection was offered. The wait staff was attentive and courteous. We were pleasantly surprised with our room on the 10th floor. It was cozy, but very clean and very comfy. There were no lingering smoke odors whatsoever. We were so satisfied with the room, that we never even asked to be moved to a different one. We heard very little noise coming from the streets, nor did we ever hear anyone in rooms on either side of us for our entire stay of 5 nights. We also asked questions every day at the concierge desk, and found them to be informative and very friendly. Because the hotel is located centrally, we walked most everywhere that we needed to go. For the times we needed to venture further than our feet would carry us, we took the subway. Grand central station is a short 5 minute walk from the hotel. Taxi service was also available any time, night or day. We even rode in a bike taxi one night and had a grand visit with the "driver". The barista at the little coffee kiosk, and the clerk in the gift shop also deserve special mention as they were always friendly. The maid staff always greeted us with a friendly smile, and our room got cleaned in a professional manner. When we checked out of the hotel at noon, we were allowed to store our luggage at the hotel, free of charge, until we needed to leave for the airport for our evening flight. I would definitely stay again at the Roosevelt. Its central location and friendly staff are a real asset. The only negative I can even think of regarding the room, is the fact that there was no coffee maker in the room. My daughter says that was a plus, because there is nothing worse than hotel coffee! smiles

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay at the Roosevelt Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mold and mildew in shower, tub did not appear to have been cleaned in quite some time. Room safe needed to be serviced twice during our stay. Very bad stains on carpet. Do not feel room was clean when we arrived nor was it cleaned very well during our stay. Requested coffee maker be brought to room - they did not bring coffee cups nor coffee until we called back and requested. Do not believe this hotel should be rated a three and one-half star hotel as Hotwire represented.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arranged 5 nights in New York staying at this wonderful hotel as a surprise for my Dad from April 24th until 30th April 2004. I read the reviews already written on Trip advisor and they were all good but still I hoped everything would be alright, and it was. This hotel is great, the hotel lobby is fantastic, very grand, it certainly made a good first impression. The rooms were clean and comfortable and better than expected. The bar area was nice - the only thing I would say is that it was very dark. We had breakfast at the Teddy restaurant and went for the buffet, we were not disappointed, the food was lovely with lots of choice to suit all tastes. After we checked in we went to our room and we found the safety deposit box wasn't working, not only was it fixed later that night but we were given 2 free breakfasts and given the use of the hotel safe until the safety box was fixed. I would definitely stay here again, it was within easy reach of Times Square, Grand Central station, New York Public Library and the Empire State Building was just a short walk away. I was very pleased with this hotel and my Dad enjoyed it too. One suggestion I have for you is whether you have been to New York before or not a trip to watch the New York Yankees is a great experience and one not to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Value for money is excellent, for the price you would be hard pushed to find a hotel in Midtown that offers so much. I agree with most people here on the site that the staff on the door really are just fishing for tips, which can be annoying. The rest of the hotel staff were excellent however. I agree with the two previous reviewers who suggested not eating at the Deli next door. Hotel was a little noisy, but its Midtown Manhattan, what do you expect. My toilet also flooded, and yes I am from the States, so I think the reviewer who claimed it was just the Brits being confused is wrong. There was a school party at the hotel, which meant there was often a very long wait for the elevators, however thats not really a gripe as you can never guarentee who will be staying at a hotel the same time as yourself. Aside from the Door staff I really have no complaints, I am returning to New York this fall and am not hesitating to return to the Roosevelt. Excellent service, very attractive hotel, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt lived up to the reviews in our case”
Reviews.Author: monkers13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I didn't know what to expect after first getting the Roosevelt on Hotwire and then reading these reviews. Some reviews were great, some not so, so we laughed and wondered what our experience would be. We arrived at the Roosevelt early on a Sunday morning, June 6, 2004, after taking a red-eye from Denver. Even though check-in time was at 3 pm, we were given a room immediately and the front desk was very courteous. Staff was friendly and helpful, even though we didn't speak with a British accent. Lobby was truly beautiful and had a huge centerpiece of flowers. If atmosphere matters to you at all, you will appreciate the Roosevelt. Our 15th floor room was clean and quiet, tastefully decorated and big enough. I would suggest going for the higher floors if sound is a concern. Minor sound from the street below, but that's part of the NY experience. I am a light sleeper and wasn't bothered. View from our room was of a gray office building and not great, but you can't have it all. We walked easily to St. Patrick's Cathedral, Times Square, Rockefeller Center. It was a bonus to have Grand Central across the street. Next time we come to New York, We will most definitely stay here. I thought it was just great, especially for the price. This was my 4th visit to NY and the city seemed cleaner and the people nicer. Had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited New York for the first time in March. My primary concern was cost and as I didn't pay that much for the trip I wasn't expecting much. I have to say I was more than pleasantly surprised.... The location is excellent, within walking distance of Central Park to the North, just a few blocks from Broadway and Times Square, and a pleasant distance from The Empire State et all. The hotel really is grand, which you will first notice upon arrival in the Lobby. Old school grandoise styling, which really shocked me for the price I paid, I often felt underdressed in such a smart Hotel! The room was large and the bathroom fine. Climate control, large TV, desk, large closet space etc. Housekeeping were excellent, on one occassion I left the room to escort a friend up to my room from downstairs.....upon leaving my room the maid asked if she could make-up the room...... I responded that I would be back up there in under 5 minutes, but she insisted........ and true to her word upon my return the room was immaculate! The maids were really overly keen sometimes to get that room cleaned! I had one problem when the toilet was blocked, which was fixed within 20 minutes of me calling down to reception. The room service was excellent (24 hours), as were the staff in the Business centre. Internet access there was billed by the half hour, but as I only used it for short periods of time they didn't bill me at all. The only problem I had during my entire visit was upon arrival: I arrived with two hefty suitcases and received no offer of help from any of the doormen. I struggled through the doors and up to reception where I collected my room key, and once again received no offer of assistance from the Bell boy, thus lugging my bags to my room on my own. This was the only major negative point really. The alcohol and phone calls are ridiculously over priced, so avoid them at all costs. Also the rooms are not soundproofed as advertised (perhaps this was because I was on the smoking floor, but I could hear everything going on in the hallway, and in the adjacent rooms! If you can put up with doormen who are only interested in large tips, and a few minor faults, you will absolutely LOVE the Roosevelt. For the price it is absolutely outstanding value. I highly recommend it. One final word of advice........ don't be tempted by the Deli that is next door just because of its closeness, take a walk a block or two and you will find much better food on offer :o)

Reviews.Title: “The Good: Location, The Bad: Overpriced Bar, The Ugly: Elevators”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Grand Central is a 5-minute walk away. There is a deli beside the hotel for you to pick up your own beverages and if you care for it, food-by-the-pound dinner (don't be fooled by the thought of possibly saving some money cus the pounds add up the final cost!), and snacks. When we arrived, they were having a system problem so the electronic keys could not be programmed. We waited for 4 hours at the bar for our rooms, while they only gave us a 2-drink ticket. By the time we had racked up 7 martinis and 2 beers, we asked politely that they take care of the bar bill and they did. The staff was polite and helpful. The elevators were our only problems. They were slow and add to that, the fact that there is alot of traffic from the large number of guests, it became an increasingly annoying thing to have to deal with. Beds were made but sheets may have been changed once every 2 days. I was not comfortable with the upholstered cushions and pillows on the bed as you know that they have not been washed for a while because there are no zippers and it is highly unlikely that they dry-clean it after every guest. But no sweat, just move it to the armchair and don't use them!

Reviews.Title: “Let's not get carried away”
Reviews.Author: Nosamnoj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Roosevelt based on all the fantastic reviews on this site. I have to say that I didn't feel the hotel lived up to the hype. It's an OK hotel but nothing more. I found it to be a rather soul less place with staff that didn't seem to care about the guests other than looking for tips. I have been to NY many times and didn't appreciate the doorman trying to con me into taking a hotel car for 15 dollars when we both knew that a cab for the same journey was only 8 dollars. My room was tidy enough but small, and had a very thin inter-joining door with the next door room, this was a problem when my neighbours arrived back a 3am every night and had a party in their room. The Roosevelt also has the noisiest plumbing I've ever experienced, it's hard to sleep throught the whooshing and clanking that begins at around 7am - bring ear plugs. Also everyone says this is a great location, why? Midtown is boring... Surely everyone goes to Greenwich Village and Soho in the evening, this hotel is 11 dollars in cab. Please don't think that I love to complain, I'm quite easily pleased but I felt that the reviews on this site need some balance. It's an OK hotel, but I'm going to try somewhere else on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: fenkazl
Reviews.Content: A group of us traveled to NYC and booked four rooms at this hotel primarily due to price and location. I booked the hotel direct with hotel reservations desk and received a rate of $189 per night for double bedded rooms. We arrived early and the bell captain took our luggage and assisted us with check in. We were advised of our room numbers and told to check back for our rooms after 3 pm. We were in NYC to sight-see and shop so off we went. We returned around 5 and claimed our luggage and went to get our keys only to find out we had been given different rooms now...original ones given to others who were obviously there at 3! Well, the bell captain came to our rescue and we were saved!! He was very helpful and pleasant. Actually, most of the staff were very friendly and willing to help. We all found our rooms to be dark (not enough light) and somewhat on the small side. We all wished there was more space to put things in the bathroom. The small shelf did not serve it's purpose for toiletries and the like. Aside for the lack of lighting in the rooms, they offered a good value for the rate we paid in NYC and we were close to all attractions and shopping. The hotel lobby and appearance is quite stunning and made it seem more like a four-star hotel than the price we paid. I would recommend it and stay here again if the situation arises.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended! Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kbug1914
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a long weekend stay at the Roosevelt with no complaints. You can't beat the price for the hotel! Save your money for shopping! We arrived in the morning and they had no problem holding our bags until check-in time. The staff was always friendly and helpful. I highly recommend the superior room for two people even though the travel websites say that the standard room is fine for two. Actually, the person told me that when I called to reserve the room. The room size was great for being in New York! As for the rooms being sound proof - we heard hallway noice, but it was very minor. The main thing that makes the Roosevelt the best is its location. Yes, you can get anywhere with the subway from Grand Central but it's nice to be so central to everywhere. Another great perk is the all night deli next door. Very convienent for a quick breakfast or late night snack. Use the express check-out service - very quick! We plan on a return trip to New York and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a Wonderful looking hotel especially the grand lobby, although I did feel the staff were not friendly and the odd one (i felt) looked down on us. The room was smaller and darker than expected, but very clean. I did find the noise level irritating, especially at night when trying to sleep. The bar was over priced and the service was lacking. However we did enjoy the Coffee shop that was joined onto the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and terrific hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: CAtraveler47
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel was first-rate. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful - we had arrived very early in the morning and were informed that a non-smoking room would be available within 2 hours (normal check-in time is 3 PM). The room was very nice - we booked through hotels.com for a bargain rate and I was not expecting the lovely room we received. Our room was very quiet; the bath was excellent and the bed was very comfortable. The location is wonderful - just off of Grand Central. We were extremely pleased with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Supratik
Reviews.Content: Just returned from NY after a six day stay at Roosevelt. Booked a superior room through Expedia after a lot of rersearch. Was slightly worried after reading some recent bad reviews but my stay was pleasant. I was offered a room (745) with two twin beds away from the elevators as requested. No problem with bell boys. Seemed to be happy with $3 tips. Room and bathroom were small but clean & comfortable. No problem with hot water pressure as reported in previous posting. Location is excellent. Felt very safe in the neighbourhood. Five minutes from Grand Central. Made full use of my seven day Metrocard. In room safe was working. Not bothered with internet access. Concierge was helpful with my general queries.Check out was smooth. Staff were very friendly towards my four year old daughter. They were happy to look after my bags after check out while wife wanted to do more shopping!! The bad points are: NO COFFEE MAKER !!. No refrigerator in room. AC was effective but slightly noisy. Street noise was slightly annoying initially, but not that bad to wake you up at six O'clock. Extremely overpriced restaurant/bar/room service. Very limited vegeterian choice( the whole of NY!!). The Deli next door is actually not that cheap but very convenient. The decor and the furniture of the room appeared quite old(?intentional?). I've stayed in better hotels in America for less but considering this was Midtown Manhattan I felt it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it....!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, i wish i had taken more notice of the reviews before i booked this hotel - it almost ruined our entire trip. I have to agree that the service is absolutely appalling and the noise is unbearable. We booked through expedia who falsely advertised that these rooms are sound proofed. Well, i can tell you they are not and even though it looks like the windows are double glazed, it is very shabby and lets in as much noise as if the windows were open! There were roadworks going on all through the night and we could hear what sounded like explosions at all hours. On top of that you can hear everything in the next room - every word in fact. When we arrived at the hotel we were not able to check in as they were running so late with the room cleaning. We left our bags and were told the bell staff would take them up - so we gave the guy $10. We came back at around 6.30pm and were given our room number, but the bags were still in the foyer. So another bell boy insists he takes them up - another tip. I had ordered champagne and strawberrries on arrival as a suprise for my partners birthday, but they had been sent to another room. The room we were given was tiny and dark - and this was supposed to be a superior room! We had also called prior to the trip to make sure we got a quiet room (i was dubious of soundproofing) and this room was far from quiet. We asked to change straight away, but were told we could not, we would have to do it the next day at 7pm. We came back the next day at 7pm, still no room. After complaining, the front desk girl checked again with housekeeping and then gave us a key to a room. Upon opening the door to this room, we find that it is already occupied! Can you imagine? So we complain to the manageress who upgrades us to a suite - still very dark and noisy but at least larger. However, whilst i was having a bath i heard the door open and a radio - it was the security guard who had let himself in without even knocking! We complained and were told that we should have informed the front desk we changed rooms. My partner pointed out that the manageress of the front desk had just given us the key and surely she should update her system. They insisted that this was our responsibility. We also tried to order room service which never turned up. And i won't even go into the time i tried to request some milk for coffee. Oh and thats another thing - you don't get tea and coffee facilities in your room - we got a coffee maker when we switched to a suite, but no milk. Now even in a travelodge you get tea and coffee! And finally, to add insult to injury, on the morning we left the maid barged in at 9am (without knocking) demanding to know when we would be vacating the room - check out isn't even until 11am! On a good note, the location is very central so if you can get to sleep in a battlefield - and be rest assured there are no quiet sides to this hotel (we were told this by staff), don't mind crap service, and are very small so you can fit in the tiny rooms, then this is the place for you. For all of us normal folk, don't bother! And i thought US hotels were meant to be better than ours?!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel and could not find fault with the hotel or it's staff. I checked in, 2 hours before 3pm, on the off chance my room was available and it was. I would have been happy to wait, after all, 3pm is 3pm! Very central for all of NY and front desk staff were always helpful and polite. Would recommend to all I know and would gladly stay here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Roosevelt in March. This was our second trip to New York in 2 years and frankly, I was expecting a bit better room and location. The hotel is huge, over 1000 rooms and getting an eleavtor that wasn't jam packed often required letting several go by before you could get down to the lobby. The room was ok, very dark, but nice and clean. The location is good, very close to Grand Central, but quite a hike to Times Square. The 24 hour deli next door was terrific, saved quite a bit buying snadwiches and drinks there instead of in the hotel itself. We explored more of the city on this trip and found delicious italian food in little Italy for $7.95 per meal. Also, the Times Square grill has a great happy hour and the best apple martinis we ever tasted, they also offer price fixed dinners at great prices. Overall, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While our room was fine and the location was great, we experienced the worst service from the moment we arrived. After arriving on a red eye flight at 5am, we thought it may be possible to check in early, after others checked out. We have done this other times in New York. The front desk staff stated that their computers were down, and to come back in an hour. We did so, and still the computers were down, and were told that it didn't matter since their policy was to allow check in at 3pm. The computers came online and they "preregistered" us at 10am. I asked the lady if we could get the first available room in the class we booked, she didn't seem to think it would be a problem. I went back about 1/2 hour later to see if anything was available and the lady now at the front desk said, "It is policy to allow check in at 3pm." I explained that I understood their policy, but would appreciate a room if available. She said, No. Finally, we found a different person at around 1pm to allow us to check in. They must have people every day who arrive early on red eye flights and it would be better "policy" to allow early check in if a room is available, and to train their front desk staff on acceptable customer service. Almost every other hotel allows this. While several of us were trying to get to a wedding rehearsal, the front door man was barely making any effort to get a taxi for us. There is a law in New York that if you get in a Taxi, they cannot refuse to take you somewhere within the city. We did not know this but the doorman should have. He let a young man cut in front of the elderly father of the groom and he told us, no taxi wants to take us to Queens. I found out later we should have gotten in the car and just told them where to take us, b/c they cannot refuse. Then, the doorman told us he could find us a car service for $80. He made every effort to get us a car service that was way more expensive than a taxi would have been b/c those services give him a cut of the $. Rediculous and a total ripoff. Upon checkout, we went to check our baggage. There was a long line at the bell desk. I got near the front when they said we all had to take our luggage down a flight of stairs to another place and wait in line there. I was alone with two bags and they did not offer me any assistance. What was worse, the lady next to me in line was prenant, with a child in tow, and several bags and they expected her to carry her own bags to a room downstair, then expected a tip for her hard work. The bellstaff argued in front of all the guests since they couldn't agree on how to do anything. This isn't rocket science, you take my bag, give me a ticket and then store it in a room. You do not make people take their bags all over the hotel, have them place it in a room, and then expect a tip. I want to know what they wanted a tip for, they did not do anything. Fine facilities, horrendous service. The staff should all be fired, and they should place management in place that knows how to train a staff on customer service. The behavior we witnessed was unacceptable, and I believe that motels provide better services than the Roosevelt hotel. There are other hotel in New York with equal facilities, even better location, and far superior service for the same price range. Stay away from the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful, typlical New York hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights in March 2004 and had the most amazing experience. There were only two of us sharing a room, yet we had a double bed each and a very spacious room (which was surprising for a New York hotel!) The rooms were clean and the bathroom was of ample size. Everything worked OK and the hotel was in an excellent location - especially for shopping!!! The staff were most helpful and they had every amenity you could want. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to this fabulous city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 13th-19th april 2004 which was my first trip to New York. On arrival at the hotel i was very impressed with the location its very central and in walking distance of all the major attractions. I booked a twin superior room through my travel agent. On being shown to the room which was on the fourth floor i was very disappointed it was small and very dark we needed to have the lights on all the time. I told the staff at the check in desk i was unhappy with the room and was told my agent had booked a superior room and if i wanted to upgrade it would cost an extra $40 per night. The female check in clerk was very offhand and i got the impression she really wasnt interested in my complaint. It was a take it or leave it attitude. I dread to think what a standard room is like. Also for 4 of the days we stayed there the beds were not made up properly until the weekend when there was a change of staff. On the positive side the beds were very comfortable and the location couldnt be better and the lobby is very nice. The bell boys are very friendly and helpful which makes up slightly for the rude check in desk staff they were also rude on check out when i asked for a receipt. I dont think i would stay here again having friendly staff makes a big difference to your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: denshires
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for a week in April. The location is perfect - walking distance to Grand Central (for the Subway), 5th Avenue (for the shopping), Times Square (for the theatres) and the Empire State building - amongst other great sights. We had a standard room. Expedia had only reserved one bed, but this was changed to two without our asking on checking in, which was nice. The room was comfortable and clean and quite spacious enough. We found it to be very well sound-proofed against other room users but agree that the noise from the traffic was bad. I would imagine that most mid town hotels are the same really - they do drive on their horns in New York! We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: gracefrn
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for five days over Easter it is a nice enough hotel very clean and all the staff are plesant. With regard to the $3mil renovations that were supposedly carried out in 2003 I think it would be more accurate for the hotel to say "we bought new bed linen". We booked a deluxe king room and what we got was for from deluxe, not that I was expecting anything fancy but it certainly was nothing like the advertised pictures on their web site or those on expedia, having said that we were waiting for almost three hours for a room to be prepared for us upon checkin so we may have been given the wrong room. I was so tired after the flight and the long wait for the room that at that stage I would have taken a closet to sleep in and didn't question them. I probably would stay in this hotel again but I would advise that you dont pay any attention to the room photos on the web pages as they are very misleading, also a little tip if your staying at this hotel, certainly on the 15th floor as we were, you will need to run the hot water tap for at least 10mins before you have a shower as it takes this long for it to heat up, also to say that there is a bath is again a bit of a streach of the imagination it's really more of an oversized shower tray! However in New York there's so much to do all you really need is a comfortable clean bed in which to sleep and the Roosevelt certainly provided that.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My work put me up here while I was in NY on business so I wasn't sure what to expect. I was very pleased overall...the location is good, the staff was pleasant and helpful. The only complaint I have is that the room was a bit small. But I've seen much worse. Also, I was originally put in a smoking room even though non-smoking had been requested. However, the staff was very apologetic and handled the situation very well.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Internet Deals????”
Reviews.Author: redred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for 7 nights from 25th March to the 1st April. Upon arriving at midnight and being told the room we had booked (a cheap deal from expedia) was not available we feared the worst, however we were immediately told that we would be upgraded for the rest of our stay, our room was large, clean, tidy and comfortable, it was on the 12th floor directly opposite the lifts. We experienced no noise problems as reported in previous posts. On one occasion we had to call maintenance, he arrived within 10 minutes and had the problem solved within 5 minutes. He was courteous and efficient as were all the reception, maids and service staff. If I could complain about anything it would be the doorman. He could not be bothered to hail a cab to take us to the airport and rudely grunted answers to any questions, as after 7 days this was our first contact with the stereotypical New Yorker we were quite pleased to have finally met one. The hotel is in a great location and is within walking distance of many attractions, the passage into Grand Central Terminal directly opposite the hotel is convenient as all other areas can be reached via the subway. This was our first visit to Manhattan and after such a great experience we will be returning one day. One tip I would give is not to miss the off Broadway show by the Blue Man Group at The Astor Place Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Forget those lousy boutique hotels!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt was a nice surprise. It's truly a classy hotel in the grand tradition of hotels -- spacious, ornate lobby, fully-uniformed staff. The standard room where I stayed was nicely decorated and very clean (except for the dingy comforter). This problem was handled immediately by housekeeping. I received a brand new comforter. Also, the staff -- from the concierge to the housekeepers -- were very polite and professional. Location was better than I thought. It was about 6-8 blocks from Times Square and close to the designer shops along Madison Avenue .

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel OK but....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel in March 2004. The main foyer was lovely and very grand looking. I was slightly disappointed about the standard of the room (superior double). The first room we received was slightly shabby. However as I paid $125 per night I thought this wasn't a bad deal. Unfortunately later that night when everyone was now in their rooms, the sound proofing was terrible and I could hear people in the next room to us quite clearly. There was also external road works going on at night and the noise became unbearable. We had to then try 4 different rooms and then decided to throw our hands up in defeat and just stay put after the 4th move. On whole the hotel was OK for the price and the staff relatively friendly, great location but don't know if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool!”
Reviews.Author: britguy
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal on resquik Superior Double Room for $109 per night. Excellent room, walk-in closet, spotless bathroom, great maid-service.The Roosevelt is officially a three star but it is more like a four star and the lobby is beautiful and spectacular.Staff friendly - would have preferred a room with one King-Sized bed but I got a room with two doubles but no big deal.I emailed ahead of time asking for a QUIET room cos I had read on this site some of the rooms are noisy. They gave me what I asked for and I slept like a baby!Fast check-in and check-out. For the price it was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -good deals”
Reviews.Author: einsteindreamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a vacation in New York. One of the best deals in New york. It seems far away from everything, but really isn't. It is also right across from Grand Central Station. Room was good. Service was good. They were helpful and nice. My complaint would be the smoke factor. The whole lobby seemed to smell of smoke. There is a bar to the left of the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “New York Baby!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gwoodburn1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 20th birthday, and it was fantastic! I was a little hesitant because of the recent reviews. But take no notice of these. I have stayed in some top hotels in the UK, and this was up to the same standard. The location was A+. The only thing with this hotel is that it has too many exits, so everytime we steppped out, i completly lost my bearings (luckly my partner has a good sense of direction). Ok so the rooms werent that big, but they were clean and comfortable, and thats all that matters. If you want any more info on the hotel, or were eat etc, drop us an email..........

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AmberQu
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week at The Roosevelt. Overall, very nice hotel. Conveniently located right across from GCS. Check-in/out was a breeze. Room was clean and spacious. Bit on the noisy side. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to New York and I cannot believe how lucky I was to stay in this Hotel, everything about it was first class, from the bar staff to the house maids everyone was extreamly helpful and friendly. I would recommend the Roosevelt to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NYUCanadian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt from 1/29/04-2/3/04 in room 1614 (two floors from the top) with a view of Rockefeller Center (in the distance). Lobby was classically elegant, room decor was updated (reminded me of the Millenium Mayfair in London, England), and location simply couldn't be beat on Madison Avenue between 44th & 45th streets. My only problem was with two staff members (one doorman and one of the concierges) who seemed put out when asked for help. The concierge only grudgingly called to confirm a dinner reservation at Tavern on the Green (which you have to do!) and the doorman rather off-handedly told me to "just hail a taxi on Madison Avenue" when he asked if I needed one (laden down with much baggage). Still, if you are a relatively independent & self-reliant traveller who doesn't need coddling 24/7 and is looking for a very clean, truly comfortable, wonderfully centrally-located hotel...this is the place for you. Finally...I got a spectacular deal on a Superior Room with two double beds for only $112USD/night when I stayed which was fantastic (I got this deal by signing up for their online updates on their website).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Roosevelt!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt last week and it was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in! When you first walk into the lobby, you get a grand feeling like you're entering an old-style Victorian hotel. The staff, especially the bellmen are very nice and helpful and make you feel special. The rooms are well-decorated and good-sized, unlike some smaller hotels I've stayed at. The location is prime--across from Grand Central Station and within walking distance to the theatre and shopping and restaurants. I do not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to stay here again when I return to New York. Thumbs up to the Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roosevelt 3 times. It is in a wonderful location, very close to Grand Central Station and tons of other NYC landmarks. I love the Roosevelt. However, the 3rd time I stayed there it was kind of noisy. Something was going on in the room next door and also out in the street. However, I'd go again; its a great bargain and I love their cozy bar. Even when I stay somewhere else I drop by the bar for a little visit. You won't find a better price anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I treated my daughter to a pre wedding holiday in New York in February and booked the Roosevelt Hotel on the internet. What an extremely good choice we made, we were delighted with the whole place. The lobby is very very impressive, the bar is comfortable and welcoming and our room was clean and quiet! (maybe because we were on the 15th floor and away from the lifts. The front staff were helpful and the bar staff were very friendly and entertaining. In fact we found all the staff friendly and professional and would not hesitate to stay at the Roosevelt again.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not only is the Roosevelt an elegant hotel very close to Grand Central Station, but there is a 24-hour market right next door. That may mean nothing to some people, but when you've traveled across the country, it's handy to be able to pick up snacks at odd hours, rather than wandering for blocks in the hugeness of NYC to find cheap food and other necessities. The staff was very helpful during my stay. I was mistakenly shown to a smoking room at first. When I called the front desk, they sent a bellman up within fifteen minutes to take me to a non-smoking room - which was even bigger and nicer. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like to feel your business is appreciated.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We had a gorgeous room with a small fridge, terry cloth robes, nice and quiet. The housekeeping staff was friendly and accomodating, the front desk staff was professional. . .and our waiter in the bar was a joy. Everyone was so classy. Our entire stay there was very sophisticated and gracious - just what I love about New York City. They made these dusty ranchers from New Mexico feel like valued clients.

Reviews.Title: “Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very attractive, in a fabulous location, and the rooms are nicely appointed - but I had some problems. A shower cap was missing from the bathroom and it took an hour and several phone calls to finally get housekeeping to arrive with one (this was at 10:30 at night). In addition, my alarm was left set by the last occupant so that I was awakened at some early hour and could not go back to sleep. And last, and worst, was that my room was not cleaned at all so that I arrived back at midnight from a hard days work to find dirty towels and an unmade bed. This was probably due to the fact that the "Do not distrub" tag was on my door, although I do not remember putting it there but, as explained in the hotel policy, even if you do not respond by telephone they will clean your room even if such a sign is on unless specifically instructed not to. The Hotel management acknowledged my problems and was apologetic and nice enough to offer me a nights free accomodation in a junior suite when I return to New York. I would give the hotel another chance and try again because the price is great for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: max2lucy
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel an average of at least twice a year. They have just renovated the rooms in the past year and that has helped keep things fresh. The lobby is striking and even if you don't stay there, just pop in to visit the lobby scene and be impressed. Hallways are very wide which is a nice change compared to other hotels.Being an old hotel, rooms vary in size, and if you are single or booking over an internet discounter you may get stuck with a very small room, with no desk. There are nicer hotels in the area but they cost more. On a value for money scale, (especially if you can get a room at this hotel for under $ 185 a night), it is hard to beat given the location. Last I heard this hotel was up for sale, and there is some speculation that it could be torn down for an office block, due to its ultra-prime location. This would be sad if it comes true.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: thatsmydawg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for 5 nights 21/01 to 26/01. We were allocated a room with 2 queen beds as a room with one king sized bed was not available. The room was a fine size for 2 of us, but would not be big enough for 4. It's clean, warm and comfortable. And very noisy! We were woken up at 5am on weekdays, and before 8am at weekends. We were on the 5th floor so if you can get higher then try, it might be better. Room service is expensive if all you want is a slice of cheesecake. $8 for the cheesecake, 18% service charge, $3 delivery charge and then tax. For a piece of cheesecake they wanted to charge me over $13 + tax. I politely declined and retracted my order! A good hotel. I would stay here again. Very central.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt hotel from 1/23/04 - 1/25/04. We had a great time in New York. The Hotel, was clean and nice. The concierge service was awful. They were no help at all. Well unless you spoke with a french or english accent. But if you spoke regular english, your on your own!! The front desk was ok, it just depended on who you got. Some were real nice while others just could not be bothered. The cleaning lady on floor 4, was just the nicest she could be!! She was a big help!

Reviews.Title: “New York Tradition”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJoemar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Roosevelt on my last two trips to New York. I like the history and tradition of the Roosevelt. It's where Guy Lombardo used to do his New Years' eve broadcast. Ted Husing and Lindsey Nelson mentioned the Roosevelt in the auto-biographies. It's a Hotel of the Cafe society of the 20's and 30's. The closest hotel to Grand Central Station. Walking distance to the Broadway theatres. Someone mentioned how relaxing the bar is...I agree. For New York, it's an affordable hotel that's also a famous hotel. Big hotel for a big city.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between 26 Dec and 30 Dec 2003 and loved it. The lobby is wonderful and the room was on the smallish side but very comfortable and well appointed. We had a superior room booked via Hotels for around £100 per night. The King size bed was huge and very comfortable. Our ice bucket was missing but this was remedied immediately. Ferrara have a nearby cafe and a branch in the lobby for those early morning espressos! Very centrally located, easy to get a cab and the doorman arranged a very reasonably priced limo for our trip back to the airport. The bar is very relaxing and I recommend the Cosmopolitans! I would unhesitatingly return nex time we visit the US

Reviews.Title: “You're all moaning about nothing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to NYC before and when I arrived at the hotel I was amazed ! The lobby was absolutely beautifull, and the bell boys were very helpfull, although the main man was expecting a tip after only calling the bell boys over and holding the door open for us ??!! A bit demanding I thought, but hay, thats America. Anyway, the room was massive with 2 db beds and a lovely great big tele, we had free shampoo and gel etc (the bathroom was a fair size) and although the air conditioning was slightly noisey (come on, when has it ever been quite in hotels?) it was not a major problem, I liked it there so much I've booked to go there again in April, and I carn't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decided to go to New York for my Birthday (23rd Nov) and booked through Travel Bag (got an excellent deal). We had 2 rooms for 5 friends and myself. Arrived in a limousine and the porters were helpful with our luggage, checking in was not a problem neither. My room was upgraded to a Suite (as it was my birthday !!). The other room was a superior room. The suite was fabulous, I couldn't fault it - the living room was big and spacious and so was the bedroom (it needed to be with 3 females, all our luggage and the shopping we bought!!!) and the bathroom was a nice size. Our room was spotless everyday (when the maid finished with it !!). We had fresh towels, toiletries and sumptious bath robes aswell. The other group of girls who had a superior room were equally satisfied. We found the staff to be very helpful with any requests we had, the front lobby was beautifully decorated with 2 trees as it was the weekend before thanksgiving. We found the hotel to be in an excellent location, and it was never impossible to hail a cab. As our return flight was late afternoon we were able to check out in the morning, the hotel held our luggage so we could go out and do our last minute shopping before leaving for the airport (which the staff arranged transport for that). I would definitely recommend staying at the Roosevelt and personally would stay there again on my next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended! I'll stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel during December 2003 and we will definitely stay at this hotel again when we visit NYC. The hotel is centrally located. You can walk to most tourist locations or walk to Grand Central Station a block from the hotel and hop on the subway. The lobby was very nice and decorated beautifully for Christmas. Our room was very small but the bed was comfortable and our bathroom was nice. I also recommend the deli next door to the hotel for quick breakfast and lunch. The food is good and the price is much cheaper than the hotel. I searched the all over the web before booking at the Roosevelt and I am so happy that I booked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jspade
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in this hotel over Christmas 2003 and I would not hesitate to stay there again. I booked a superior room with a king size bed back in October and paid about $130 US. The room was very clean and most of the amenities were modern, considering the age of the hotel. I do know that the hotel had a soft goods renovation in 2003 and it showed. The bed and linens were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was also very well appointed, the shower pressure was good and towels were nice and thick. An exceptional value for what I paid. The best thing about the Roosevelt is its location at 45th and Madison. This is just central enough to many of the main attractions and the subway is just a couple of blocks away. I also appreciated that the hotel is located just far enough from Times Square to not feel too crowded. There are also lots of places to eat around the hotel, though this true of most of Mahattan. There are a couple of delis on the hotel block, one of which was open 24 hours and they carried just about everything under the sun. The only complaint I have is regarding the noise level in the room were staying in. I can't say that all rooms are noisy, obviously, but the walls in the one we were in were quite thin. The first couple of nights we were there I could hear my neighbours next door every time they spoke. I didn't hear anything after the first two nights, however, so this may just have been how loudly they spoke to each other. I could also hear the water pipes banging every so often. If you've stayed in an older hotel, you've heard this before and it may not bother you. If you're worried about noise, bring earpplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having to leave another Midtown Manhattan hotel due to elevator problems, we ended up at the Roosevelt Hotel at 10 pm. The front desk staff was very accomodating in getting us checked in and comfortable in our room. We got a Superior room with a view of 45th street. This room had two double beds and was extremely nice. I believe all of the negative reviews of this hotel are based on staying in the smaller standard rooms as this room was very large and luxurious. The 24hour room service was very good and the hotel's luxury ambiance was evident in the room, the lobby, and in the quantity and professionalism of the staff. Every time we had a small problem, the staff took care of it immediately. I would very much recommend this hotel, especially if you can book ahead as it appears you can get significant discounts on the rate (which we did not get due to our last minute check in). The location of the hotel is excellent, only blocks from Rockefeller Center, Times Square and the Theater District. You won't regret staying here if you make sure you get the upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Trip to the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: LKnussman27
Reviews.Content: My 2 girlfriends and I stayed at the Roosevelt in November of 2003 overnight so that we could go see a show (we saw Wicked which was awesome too...just a little plug for that!). We got the room through Priceline so we paid just over 100 for the room. When we checked in, the gentleman at the front desk was awesome! He noticed there were 3 of us and that we were staying in "a shoebox sized room" so he tried to get us a room with pull out couch. There were none available...so he got us a suite! It was really great...we wished we were staying for more than one night. We had some great drinks in the beautiful bar downstairs. We later got roomservice (very late I might add) and the fellow that brought up our order was very helpful and accomodating for such a late hour! Everything was great about the trip...the hotel is beautiful and the staff courteous. I've stayed at several NYC hotels and this was pretty much the best. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Best location in the city ,great price for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After looking like crazy in the internet I took a reviewers advise and called the Roosevelt directly.I got a great rate for two beds in a comfortable room .Bathrooms are a bit small and water pressure can be on the weak side.I cant imagine there being a better location right in the middle of everything .Walking distance to all major attractions,5th ave,rockefeller,central park,empire,you get the picture.I'am already planning to go back and stay again at the roosevelt.Dont get fooled with the bigger name hotels,some are way overrated and too crowded.We got everything we wanted out of the Hotel.I think you will agree.

HotelInfo.Name: The Roosevelt Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 45 East 45th Street at Madison Avenue, New York City, NY 10017
